Start.text: Start

Next.text: Next

DlgAccompagny.desc: This character will temporarily join your troop.

DlgRecruitAnnounce.desc: Publish a Vacancy Notice to hire a recruit.

Dig.desc: The pendulum swings when close to special items. The shorter the oscillations, the closer the item is.

CampFireEatArrow.desc: Feed your troop by allocating the necessary amount of food.

ConverterToolActionArrow.desc: Place an ingredient to start production.

StakeToolArrow.desc: Impale a body on the stake

Relationship.desc:
Your Companions can form relationships ranging from love to hate.
Their relationships can evolve through combat interactions as well as their closeness in the camp, affecting the troop's overall happiness.

RelationshipBestFriend.desc: When best friends are in close proximity, they are stronger in battle and happier at camp.

RelationshipHate.desc: When Companions who hate each other are in close proximity at camp, they reduce the troop's happiness.

PrisonerTrust.desc: This prisoner can be wary of the troop or trust them.

RuinsLight.desc:
You will need torches to light your way as you explore Tombs.
If your Light dies out, your troop will panic and flee the Tomb.

NoiseForsakenVillage.desc: Your expedition troop's actions can make noise that might attract Plague-ridden.

NoiseCrimeCave.desc: Your troop's actions can make noise that might attract the owners.

ActionPointBonus.desc: Temporary Valour Points must be used before the battle ends or they will be lost.

Suspicion.desc: A high Suspicion level will cause you to be sought by the Guard, and you will have to pay for your crimes.

SeaLordsReputation.desc: Increasing your Reputation will improve your position on the Lords of the Seas leaderboard and allow you to challenge rivals.

PathMenu.desc: Paths combine the feats you've achieved and show your progress in the various possible routes.

ShowPathTitles.desc: Show the titles available for this path

PathMight.desc:
The path of Power and Glory is fraught with dangers and fearsome enemies, but great rewards await those who prevail.
Forge the best armour, recruit the bravest Companions and fight together so your names echo beyond the farthest reaches of the Five Kingdoms.

PathTrade.desc:
The path of Trade and Craftsmanship offers abundant riches to the humblest individuals, provided they are cunning and ambitious.
Complete the most lucrative missions, trade in every city, track down the rarest and most luxurious items, and your troop will become the most affluent in the Five Kingdoms.

PathCrime.desc:
Loathed by the gentry and cursed by the Guard, the path of Crime and Chaos will take you on a treacherous journey.
But through raids, thefts, caravan attacks and murder, you could well become the defenders of the common folk of the Five Kingdoms... or their persecutors.

PathMystery.desc:
Only the most curious of adventurers dare tread the path of Mysteries and Wisdom.
Follow this winding road and explore uncharted lands, search the mysterious Tombs of the Ancients, uncover the best-kept secrets, and become the most knowledgeable scholars in the Five Kingdoms.

MoraleGalvanized.desc: Your units become galvanised, significantly boosting the damage they deal.

MoraleWin.desc: You win the battle: your opponents are overwhelmed and try to flee.

MoraleMotivation.desc: Your units become motivated, boosting the damage they deal.

Retreat.desc:
Flee the battle!
Your Companions' armour will take damage, and they risk being injured themselves.
You will also lose <happy>::value::</happy>.

BackToMainUnit.desc: Another Companion has started their turn. Return to the active Companion.

SportTackle.desc: Indicates that the unit will try to make their opponent fall.

SportDodge.desc: Indicates that the unit will try and evade their opponent's tackle.

UnitReinforcements.desc:
Reinforcements will soon join the opposing team.
Remaining reinforcement rounds: ::value::

GiveUp.desc:
Flee the battle!
Your Companions' armour will not take damage, and they do not risk being injured themselves.

Arena_GroupToDefeat.desc: Defeat this team to move on to the next battle.

Arena_ChampionToDefeat.desc: Defeat the Champion to win in the arena.

Pit_Rules.desc: Take out all the initial enemies before your Mercenaries fall victim to the pit's traps.

Camp.desc: The Camp is a place for your Companions to rest, have a meal, and go about various activities.

Inventory.desc: All your items are stored in your Inventory. Be sure to always have enough Carrying Capacity.

MiniMap.desc: Use the world map to keep track of the places you have explored and the ones still unknown to you.

Grimoire.desc: The Compendium is a collection of all the blueprints, patterns and recipes your troop can learn.

Boat.desc: Manage your ship and delegate roles to your crew.

OutlawsCancel.desc: Use your Krowns and influence to convince this group to let you go.

WolfCancel.desc: Throw the meat on the ground to create a diversion and run away.

BoarCancel.desc: These ravenous boars will eat anything.

WeightOverLimit.text: You are carrying too much weight in your inventory!

CraftUnique.text: You can only have this item once.

CraftNotEnoughMaterials.text: Not enough resources to craft this amount

AttributeUpgrade.desc: You can spend Influence to add 1 to an Aptitude when levelling up.

UnitStatusAfraid.text: This unit fled the troop during combat.

AptitudePoint.desc: Aptitude Points can be used to improve your Companion's attributes.

AdjustedEquipment.desc:
These pieces of equipment are matching.
Their stats are increased by ::value::%.

PlaceForsakenVillage.desc: Form a group of scouts who are determined and stealthy enough to explore the abandoned village discreetly.

GamemodeTavern.desc: The Tavern can generate profits during each Rest. The troop manages its menu, staff, layout and progress.

TavernSilver.desc: Can be exchanged for Krowns. The exchange rate increases with the frequency of transfers.

TavernPrestige.desc: A measure of the Tavern's success, this allows you to order better equipment. Based on the number, variety, and satisfaction of patrons.

TavernComfort.desc: A measure of the Tavern's appeal. Impacts the number of patrons and the sale odds.

TavernStars.desc: These stars, awarded by the Tavern Keepers' Guild, represent how your Tavern measures up against your competitors.

TavernSecurity.desc: Impacts satisfaction and the odds of negative events. The more patrons there are, the more Bouncers you need to enforce security measures.

TavernCapacity.desc: Max number of patrons you can accommodate for each Shift.

TavernCustomers.desc: A measure of the Tavern's style. An upscale clientele will tolerate higher prices, while a working-class patronage will tolerate low security.

TavernStatsGeneral.desc: Used to view all details about the Tavern and manage its funds.

TavernGraph.desc: Shows the Tavern's progress over the last 7 Shifts.

FoodRecipe.desc: A Scullion can no longer steal recipes from this Tavern. An infiltration mission can only earn them a profession trait.

TavernSpy.desc: Depending on their profession, an infiltrator employee can steal prestige or a secret recipe from a rival Tavern.

DrinkRecipe.desc: Brewers can no longer steal recipes in this Tavern. An infiltration mission will only reward them with a profession trait.

TavernMenu.desc: Used to determine the dishes and beverages served, manage their production and set their prices.

TavernCommand.desc: Used to move or upgrade Tavern equipment or order new equipment.

TavernStaff.desc: Used to transfer Companions between the troop and the Tavern, as well as recruit civilians.

TavernStats.desc: Manage the Tavern's funds and view its statistics, progress and how often it is visited by each faction.

TavernRanking.desc: Presents rival Taverns and lets you send infiltrators there.

TavernUnitInTransfert.desc: This Companion will reach the Tavern by the next Shift.

TavernUnitInCustomMission.desc: This employee will return to the Tavern once their infiltration mission is over.

TavernUnitInSpying.desc: This employee will return to the Tavern once their infiltration mission is over.

BarrelProgress.desc:
The green part of the meter will be full after the next Shift. Ignores potential sales.
The speed of production depends on the Brewer's level, the type of alcohol and the degree of ageing.

BrewerLevelRequire.text: This Brewer doesn't meet the level requirement to craft this alcohol.

BrewerProducingArrow.text: If a Brewer is assigned to an empty barrel, they will produce alcohol during each Rest. If the barrel is filled and put in reserve, the Brewer will age its contents. The speed of production depends on the Brewer's level, the type of alcohol and the degree of ageing.

ForSale.desc: The barrel's contents are for sale. If a Brewer is assigned to it, they will focus on production.

InCellar.desc: The barrel's contents cannot be sold. Once the barrel is filled, if a Brewer is assigned to it, they will improve its ageing.

TavernCivilian.desc: Civilians cannot learn a new profession or be transferred to the troop.

TavernInjured.desc: An injured employee continues to receive wages, but can no longer work. If the Tavern Keeper is injured, their traits no longer apply but the Tavern continues to operate.

TavernPrisoner.desc: A prisoner working in the Tavern receives lower wages, but costs prestige.

TavernCantProduce.text: Some of the selected recipes cannot be made.

TavernSeasoning.desc: The Scullions use seasoning to improve dishes and sell them at higher prices.

TavernNewService.desc: Starts a new Shift without needing to rest at the camp.

GamemodeFief.desc: The Fief produces resources, some of which can be sent to the Troop at each Rest. The Troop will have to meet residents' needs, erect new buildings and manage the Fief. As the Fief develops, it will offer new services and benefits.

FiefCanUpIcon.desc: You increase your Fief's level every time its population increases. When you reach the required threshold, build a new district to move up to the next level.

FiefMaxPopIcon.desc:
The number of dwellings increases for each district and each building you build. An upgraded building will provide more dwellings.
Population growth drops to zero whenever your population equals or exceeds the number of dwellings.

WinHArena.desc:
Rules
1. A team consists of four fighters. After registering, the team cannot be modified for the rest of the competition.
2. Fight three battles in a row to take on the Arena Champion and try to obtain their medal.
3. When a fighter has no more Health, they do not die but are instantly taken out of combat.

WinHArenaHard.desc:
Rules
1. A team consists of four fighters. After registering, the team cannot be modified for the rest of the competition.
2. Fight three battles in a row to take on the Arena Champion and try to obtain their medal.
3. When a fighter has no more Health, they do not die but are instantly taken out of combat.
4. Each time you fail to meet a requirement, a fighter is taken out of combat.

WinHArenaLegend.desc:
Rules
1. Fight three champions in a row during a long and challenging arena battle.
2. Upon joining the fight, each champion adds a new rule to the previous ones and a new round starts.
3. When a fighter has no more Health, they do not die but are instantly taken out of combat.
4. Every time you fulfil a requirement, your fighters recover some Health.

WinHArenaLegendHard.desc:
Rules
1. Fight three champions in a row during a long and challenging arena battle.
2. Upon joining the fight, each champion adds a new rule to the previous ones and a new round starts.
3. When a fighter has no more Health, they do not die but are instantly taken out of combat.
4. Every time you fulfil a requirement, your fighters recover some Health.
5. Each time you fail to meet a requirement, a fighter is taken out of combat.

WinHSport.desc:
Rules
1. A team is made up of 6 players. Each player has a specific role depending on their Strength or Dexterity.
2. There are 2 balls that both teams fight to control. A player taking a ball to the opponent's end zone scores 2 points for their team, plus 1 additional point if their team also has the other ball.
3. A match is played over 8 rounds. The team with the highest score at the end of the last round wins the game!

Gosenberg2RegionQuestAccuse.desc:
Find the guilty person in the region.
Do you want to accuse this person?

Gosenberg2RegionQuestAccuseTuto.desc:
Search for the culprit throughout the region.
Do you want to accuse this person?

WinHCrimePath.text:
The treasure is in a chest bearing the Gosenberg Wheel.
The keys are in the other chests.
Only chests with symbols are booby-trapped. Only wooden chests contain information.

WinHE2Stealth.desc:
Free as many prisoners as you can without being detected by the Skelmar. To win, you must eliminate all the Skelmar and save the most prisoners.
You can choose up to ::COUNT:: units for this fight.

CookSpecialty.desc: When a speciality is prepared at the Tavern, a serving is set aside for the troop at each Rest. A Tavern's speciality is its trademark, and only one kind can be served at a time.

ForgePit.text: The Pit & Arena Armour and Weapons

ForgeBeast.text: The Beast Hunt & Trackers Armour and Weapons

HuntBonus.desc: Will be active during combat against the animal group that is being hunted. Will be lost if the group is defeated or if the hunt is abandoned.

ApparitionZone.desc: The unit that left the battlefield will reappear in one of these areas.

Backstab.desc: Triggered when this unit attacks an engaged enemy from behind.

DeadlyBlow.desc: Triggered if this ability kills the target.

CapaCritical.desc: Triggered if this ability lands a critical hit.

Duel.desc: Can only be used if this unit is engaged in combat.

Vigilance.desc: Cannot be used if this unit is engaged in combat.

NeedReload.desc: Can only be used if this unit has [Loaded].

Patience.desc: Triggered if the target has already played their turn this round.

Initiative.desc: Triggered if the target has not yet played their turn this round.

ConsecutiveShot.desc: Triggered if a precision skill has already been used by this unit during this round.

line0.desc: The metal plates are heating up. Press [LMB] when a plate turns red to forge your item.

line1.desc: Press [LMB] when the metal plate gives off sparks to forge an item of superior quality!

line2.desc: Hit all the plates at the right time for a chance to forge an item of exceptional quality!

line0.desc: Rotate the pick and press [LMB] to insert it into the lock.

line1.desc: The closer the pick is to an opening, the more it lifts up. But if it jiggles too much, it might break.

line0.desc: Use a hook to cast your line in the water with [LMB].

line1.desc: Once the fish is hooked, hold [LMB] to keep the line tension in the central zone. Don't let the fish escape!

line0.desc: Place your cursor on the mining circle.

line1.desc: Press [LMB] when the green circle overlaps the grey one to gather a maximum of ore!

line0.desc: If you think you are fighting a losing battle, you can leave combat by hitting the Retreat button. You Companions will suffer damage but they will survive!
When a unit flees in Terror, they disappear from combat but do not leave your troop. They will reappears once the battle has ended.
When a unit falls overboard, they disappear from combat but do not leave your troop. They will reappear once the battle has ended.
TKill the Matriarch to end the fight.

line1.desc: At the end of each Round, the Matriarch calls in numerous rats to help her.

line2.desc: Try to destroy as many Plague-infested outgrowths as possible before killing the Matriarch to earn more rewards!

line0.desc: Elites are unique enemies who can act more than once during a Round. Pay close attention to the turn order to prepare your strategy.
Some characters are important. If they die, the battle will end.Important allied characters must be protected, and important enemies captured.
A Lair is a place teeming with enemies. The more active skulls there are, the more dangerous the lair is.

line1.desc: To reduce the number of enemies in a Lair, look for groups with a skull in the region. Eliminate them first to make your final assault easier.

line0.desc: You group is overtired. Your Companions might die of exhaustion if you keep walking! You really should rest.
You can Rest at a Campfire in your camp. Feed your troop and pay their wages to avoid unrest!

line1.desc: Resting refills your Fatigue metre, restores Valour Points and speeds up time.

line0.desc: When your turn comes, play any unit you havent used yet in the Round.

line1.desc: You can find out which enemy will then come into play. Prepare your strategy!

line0.desc: When you perform a melee attack on a free enemy, you engage them.

line1.desc: An engaged unit can only attack their engaged opponent and has a higher chance of taking critical damage. Take advantage of this with your other units!

line2.desc: An engaged unit is exposing their back. Attack them from behind to get a bonus.

line0.desc: Surround an engaged enemy unit with two allies to get a bonus!
Surround an engaged enemy unit with two allies to get a bonus!
A dying unit can only move. If you heal them before they take damage, they will be able to fight again. If not, they will be permanently lost.
Some actions grant [ActionPointBonus] that must be used before the battle ends or they will be lost.
You will need torches to light your way as you explore Tombs.

line1.desc: If your Light dies out, your troop will panic and flee the Tomb.

line0.desc: When an enemy has less than half of their Health left, use Chains or Rope to capture them!

line1.desc: Place one of your units next to an engaged enemy to try and capture them.

line0.desc: At this level, the enemies develop more complex and specialised battle strategies!
In Escape Mode, you must reach the escape area and flee with all of your characters, but you can no longer Retreat!

line1.desc: Once in the target area, use the Flee skill.

line0.desc: Form a group of scouts to explore a village as quietly as possible to avoid attracting the Plague-ridden.
Block the entrances to prevent the Plague-ridden from entering the building and swarming you!

line1.desc: Use the Find a way out skill to change the gauge and escape the building!

TutoLute.title: Learn how to play the lute!

line0.desc: Press [LMB] in time with the notes on each string to play the sheet music.

line1.desc: Your reward will depend on the quality of your performance!

line0.desc: Place the cursor on the wood-cutting circle.

line1.desc: Press [LMB] when the green circle overlaps the grey one to gather more wood!

line0.desc:
You can steal items using [RMB].
Each theft increases the Guard's suspicion level.

Grab the ball and bring it to the opponent's end zone to score.
The game is divided into 8 Rounds. All units on the ground will stand up again at the beginning of each new Round.
Any unit already played who gets the ball can play again.

An enemy captain's words announce their next action. Interpret their words correctly and choose the appropriate response:
- If you Attack when your opponent Taunts, you will hit them.
- If you Parry when they Attack, you'll avoid the hit.
- If you Taunt when they Parry, you will gain the Upper Hand.

line1.desc:
The Upper Hand allows you to hit your enemy:
- If you Attack at the same time as them.
- If you Parry successfully.
You cannot use the same action twice in a row.

line0.desc: An enemy captain's words announce their next action. Interpret their words correctly and choose the appropriate response.
The enemy captain has no [Armor] left. You can challenge them to a duel with a melee unit.

line1.desc: Duels are optional. They are a more honourable way to defeat an enemy captain.

line0.desc: The ship moves automatically when the sails are up.

line1.desc: Its speed depends on the wind direction, which is shown on the compass and the nautical map. To accelerate, you can put out the oars, but this will tire your troop.

line2.desc: Your ship's condition will deteriorate if it suffers collisions, is fired upon or encounters rough weather. You can repair or upgrade it at any Dock.

line0.desc:
*Falls*:
- A unit pushed overboard is left hanging and can no longer use their skills.
- They can only be rescued by an ally or killed by an enemy in melee range.

line1.desc:
*Boarding*:
- Ropes can be used to board the enemy ship.
- The unit using them disappears into the rigging and drops back down at a distance on the next round, damaging and knocking back nearby units.

line0.desc:
Controls:
- Continue steering your ship normally.
- Aim the ballista with [KEY_BallistaLeft] and [KEY_BallistaRight].
- Fire with [KEY_BallistaFire].
- Change projectiles with [KEY_BallistaProjectileChange].

line1.desc: Hitting an enemy ship will slow it down and weaken its crew. A projectile's effect can only be applied once to an enemy ship.

line0.desc:
The Ballista injures and pushes back all units in its line of fire.
It must be reloaded before it can be used. A unit cannot reload and operate the Ballista in the same turn.
When a Companion reaches level 12, they can choose a Bravery, a skill that unlocks new strategies in battle.

line1.desc: Make the most of these skills, as their usage is limited. Your troop can perform only one Bravery per round. Each Companion can use their Bravery only once per battle.

line0.desc: We have revised the difficulty level of Wartales in the latest update!

line1.desc: Having taken your feedback into consideration, the difficulty has been increased to make sure the game remains challenging past level 5. Thanks to new units and skills, enemy troops will definitely give you a run for your money. You might have to enter into battles more carefully and even rework the composition of your team. Your tactics and strategies will have an even more decisive impact.

line2.desc: You can now change the difficulty level at any time in the Options menu. If you're having a hard time, feel free to retreat and decrease the difficulty until you get the hang of things.

line3.desc: For more details, check out the latest patch notes listing all the difficulty-related changes.

line0.desc: As long as the Guard is after you, they will remember what you stole. Stolen items that are consumed, sold, discarded or used for crafting will still count towards your total fine until you are no longer wanted.

line1.desc: Fencing an item is the only other way to reduce your fine.

line0.desc: The Tavern is an establishment managed by the troop, which can generate revenue during each Shift. To operate successfully, a Tavern requires staff, equipment and an extensive menu.

line1.desc: The Tavern's reputation is measured by Prestige . Using Prestige, you can unlock equipment and expand the Tavern. The more numerous, varied and satisfied your patrons are, the more Prestige you will earn.

line2.desc: The main ways to attract patrons and encourage them to spend money are Comfort , Security and Satisfaction , which are calculated after each Shift.

line0.desc: Each barrel with a Brewer assigned to it can produce alcohol. Production is calculated during each Shift, and costs resources. Production depends on the Brewer's level, the type of alcohol and the degree of ageing .

line1.desc: When a barrel is put in reserve and a Brewer is assigned to it, its degree of ageing will gradually increase, thereby increasing its value. Ageing alcohol does not cost resources.

line2.desc: To acquire new recipes, you can explore the Compendium or, if your Prestige is high enough, steal secret recipes from rival Taverns.

line0.desc: Food production depends on the Scullion's capacity, but also on demand. If demand is low, the Scullion will produce less. To increase your sale odds, set reasonable prices and select dishes that your patrons will like.

line1.desc: To acquire new recipes, you can explore the Compendium, buy recipes from Taverns in different regions or, if your Prestige is high enough, steal their secret recipes.

line0.desc: Use this window to move, buy or sell Tavern equipment. Increase the Tavern's Prestige to unlock new types of equipment.

line1.desc: When the upgraded version of a piece of equipment is available, you can buy it directly or upgrade equipment you already own.

line0.desc: A Tavern must fill various roles in order to operate. These roles can be filled by your Companions, or by civilians recruited specifically for the Tavern.

line1.desc: When the troop is away from the Tavern, transferring a Companion does not take effect until after the next Shift. Civilians are available immediately, but cannot learn a new profession or be transferred to the troop. When a civilian is fired, they receive a small bonus.

line2.desc: Employee wages depend on their role, the Tavern's Prestige and their Profession level. Working in the Tavern grants Profession experience.

line0.desc: Taverns use a special currency: Copper Coins . They can be exchanged for Krowns , but the exchange rate will decline with each additional withdrawal. The rate rises slightly after each Shift.

line1.desc: Krowns can only be used to replenish the Tavern's funds when its balance is negative. The exchange rate is then set at 1 for 1 .

line0.desc: The more visits your Tavern receives from different factions, the more its Prestige will increase. But each faction has its own requirement, and if it's not met, that faction wont come.

line1.desc: Each faction also has certain preferences in terms of food, drink, music and ambiance. If these requirements are met, the faction will be more likely to arrive in numbers.

line2.desc: The more your menu reflects your patrons' tastes, the more likely your items will sell.

line0.desc: Taverns are ranked according to their Prestige . Exceeding the Prestige of other popular Taverns will grant you stars . Besides attracting customers, these stars also come with special rewards.

line1.desc: You can send employees to infiltrate rival Taverns. The effects of an infiltration mission depend on the infiltrators profession, and its odds of success depend on their Profession level, the Prestige of the targeted Tavern, and how many days the mission lasts.

line0.desc: You are not yet ready for a fight to liberate this bastion. Until that changes, you will suffer injuries if you come too close to this bastion.
An allied unit has been assigned to the battering ram. You must also assign one of your units in order to take control of the battering ram.
You must retake the bastion. It is protected by structures that you can destroy.

line1.desc: To retake the bastion, you must get inside the fortress by destroying the gate. Battering rams are much more effective than units at destroying these structures.

line0.desc: You have successfully entered the bastion. You can now redeploy your units.

line1.desc: To fully retake the bastion, you will have to defeat the enemy leader, raise the flag and protect it for multiple rounds.

line0.desc: Once certain places have been rebuilt, the occupants will want to take part in the war effort to help liberate the region. You can choose what kind of help they will provide directly from the strategic map, even if you are not near the location in question.
You have unlocked the Conquest Skill for this subregion: Volley. Each of these skills can be used once per encounter by any of your units, and costs a certain amount of [E2Manpower].
You have intercepted a prisoner convoy. During this encounter, you earn [E2Manpower] for each prisoner you free. Free the prisoners quickly, before your enemies kill them.

Part of your troop will show up to provide reinforcements during this encounter. You can manage or view your reinforcements by clicking on the Reinforcements Icon or an empty deployment slot. Reinforcements can only be managed during the Deployment Phase.
To withdraw a unit, click on it after selecting it. To deploy a unit, click on it in the Reinforcement Management window. You can change the slot where the unit will be deployed by clicking on an empty deployment slot.
Your Huntsman can examine traces left by animals in the world to start a hunt.

line1.desc: A path indicates the animals' direction.

line2.desc: By examining your surroundings, you may find an additional trace that will give you a bonus against the animal group you are hunting.

line0.desc: Examining the traces left by the Beast increases your Knowledge of the Beast .

line1.desc: You can also gain Knowledge of the Beast by examining the Trail tool at camp, or by encountering the Beast.

line2.desc: Spend Knowledge of the Beast on the Hunt Map to get a hint about the location of other traces, or to obtain unique bonuses.

line0.desc: Animals with the Under the Influence status will transform after 5 applications. They become hostile and leave the troop at the end of the fight.

line1.desc: An influenced animal can opt to resist the influence instead of any other action on its turn.

line2.desc: An animal keeps its applications of this status after the fight is over. An influenced animal gains 1 application of the status after each Rest.

line0.desc: An animal under the Beast's influence gains an additional application of the status after each Rest.

line1.desc: After 5 applications, the animal will transform. You will have to choose between abandoning it and helping it to resist at your own risk.

TutoIR2Intro.title: Help the Master Trackers to flee

line0.desc: The Master Trackers cannot flee while they are engaged in combat.

line1.desc: When disengaged, they are petrified with fear.

line2.desc: Use the conditional skill Create a diversion to help them flee the battle.

line0.desc: Use the District Slot icon to build your [FiefPlace_Throne]. This will be the main building in your first district: the Dungeon District.

line1.desc: Each district contains multiple slots in which you can add buildings.

line0.desc: Erect a new building using the Building Slot icon.

line1.desc: Open the Management Interface for a building by clicking on its icon. Some buildings produce items, while others grant special effects or can contain certain characters or services.

line2.desc: Upgrade a building to produce more items or receive better effects. A building's level cannot exceed the level of the district in which it was built.

line0.desc: Each item produced by your buildings helps to satisfy your populations needs: [Fief_Needs_Food], [Fief_Needs_Defense], [Fief_Needs_Hobbies] and [Fief_Needs_Education].

line1.desc: Each need increases along with the [Fief_Val_Pop] and is modified by its composition.

line2.desc: At each Rest, a satisfied need increases your [Fief_Val_Happy], while an unsatisfied need will decrease it.

line0.desc: In the Fief Management menu, you can specify the amount of taxes that will be collected from each district.

line1.desc: All of the buildings in a district will suffer a production penalty equal to the tax rate, resulting in a negative impact to [Fief_Val_Happy] in exchange for tax revenue.

line2.desc: The revenue generated at each Rest depends on the amount of production taxed.

line0.desc: Send Mercenaries to carry out contracts with the Missions List.

line1.desc: For each mission, different weapon types are recommended for the composition of the Troop assigned to it.

line2.desc: Each Companion who uses one of the recommended weapons will increase the reward you receive.

line0.desc: At each Rest, your [Fief_Val_Pop] will increase if the Fief's [Fief_Val_Happy] is positive, or decrease if it is negative.

line1.desc: The more your [Fief_Val_Pop] grows, the more its needs will increase.

line2.desc: The population types that make up your Fiefs people will increase or reduce their needs.

line0.desc: Your Fief levels up when your [Fief_Val_Pop] reaches a certain threshold.

line1.desc: You can then build an additional district.

line2.desc: Each Fief level gives you access to new buildings, new characters and services, or new features.

line0.desc: Assignments grant certain effects when started, or at each Rest while they are ongoing.

line0.desc: Lightning bolts strike the field and take any unit they hit out of combat for the remainder of the match.
A special ball is added to the match. It cannot be used to score.

line1.desc: The team holding it at the end of each round earns an extra point.

line0.desc: When a point is scored, the match continues: the ball and players maintain their positions.

line1.desc: The team that just scored plays first, and the goal areas are reversed.

line2.desc: One of the balls is replaced with a sea urchin. It can only be used to knock out enemies, not to shoot or score a point.

line0.desc: Players need to circumvent the obstacles littering the field in order to score.
Units carrying a ball cannot use a specific skill. The banned skill changes with each skill used by a unit carrying a ball.
One ball is made of metal and is too heavy to kick.

line1.desc: The other one is on fire. The carrier must get rid of it to end their turn.

RatInvasion.name: Rat Infestation
RatInvasion.descs.defender: Your feet sink into some repulsive muck. The ground shudders...

A1Champion1.props.bountyDesc: It appears that smuggler Kristoff Kruppe was found in Drombach. Several kingdoms would gladly pay to see him gone.

A1DesignedMission2.props.name: The Avengers
A1DesignedMission2.props.bountyDesc: Brotherhood Mercenaries seem to be looking for a company that took part in the kidnapping of a woman named Corene Winfel. Their investigation methods are scaring the locals.

A1DesignedMission2Alt.props.name: The Avengers
A1DesignedMission2Alt.props.bountyDesc: Brotherhood Mercenaries seem to be looking for a company that killed Brunhilde Adr Alazar. While their goal is noble, their interrogation methods are endangering the locals.

A1DesignedMission1.props.name: Charlatans
A1DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: Charlatans are peddling a fake cure for the plague. They must be stopped before their deceit leads to unfortunate consequences.

A1SlavesGuardsArmy.props.desc: Tasked with protecting the property of the good people of Drombach, these soldiers will not let slaves escape.

A1SlavesTrackersArmy.props.desc: These warriors travelled across four kingdoms to free their enslaved brothers and sisters.

A1MoutainAlazarSoldierGroup.props.desc: Lieutenant Damen was appointed to protect the Celestial Mountain Gate and the secret it hides.

A1MountainInquisitionGroup.props.desc: Inquisitor Emeria will stop at nothing to find out what unleashed the Eye's Reckoning.

A1TavernInquisition.props.desc: Clelia and her Inquisitors seem unwilling to share information with you. A few solid whacks should loosen their tongues.

A1LaboratoryPlagueRidden.props.desc: Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory was overrun by these Plague-Ridden, which are now killing Scholars and students inside.

A1DestroyedStablesInquisitors.props.desc: Inquisitors saw the Reckoning strike the Iron Hoof Stables and will not leave until theyve seen the culprits burn.

Worldmap_edoranRefugees.props.name: Amateur Hunters
Worldmap_edoranRefugees.props.bountyDesc: Unaware of the danger they face, a handful of Edoranians have gone hunting in Sikha's Forest. Someone must warn them lest they get eaten!

DesignedMission1Group.props.name: Desperate Refugees
DesignedMission1Group.props.bountyDesc: Bandits have been attacking caravans and travellers along the roads. This must end now or merchants will refuse to travel through Tiltren.

DesignedMission2Group.props.name: Drunkards
DesignedMission2Group.props.bountyDesc: A group of drunkards have decided to square off with the Refugees. They must be stopped before things get out of control.

Matthias.props.bountyDesc: Wanted for a string of murders, ::roaming:: is a dangerous individual.

B1Champion1.props.bountyDesc: Ever since he discovered Alazarian powder, Captain Eokeld has been a different man. They say he even slaughtered his own crew.

B1DesignedMission2Legion.props.name: The Emissary
B1DesignedMission2Legion.props.bountyDesc: An Edoranian diplomatic mission was expected in Per-Bast, but never arrived. Find the crew, or whatever is left of it.

B1DesignedMission1.props.name: Heretic Hunters
B1DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: A group of Inquisitors has taken upon themselves to burn the Ihrians' pagan idols. Stop them before someone gets hurt.

B1SeaLord01.props.name: Sinan
B1SeaLord01.props.bountyDesc: This pirate is known for kidnapping fishermen and holding them for ransom.

B1SeaLord02.props.name: Adelwis
B1SeaLord02.props.bountyDesc: If there's one thing this Mercenary hates more than pirates, it's competition.

B1SeaLord03.props.name: Drest
B1SeaLord03.props.bountyDesc: Drest was a pirate long before the Ihrians came along. He knows the archipelago like the back of his hand and proves very elusive.

B1SeaLord04.props.name: Hana & Meryem
B1SeaLord04.props.bountyDesc: Their sworn mission is to free the Belerion Archipelago of all forms of authority. To destabilise the dihyas, Meryem and Hana sow terror and panic throughout the region.

B1SeaLord06.props.name: Loderans
B1SeaLord06.props.bountyDesc: Rumour has it that Loderans was a Merchant before he was captured by pirates. But he adapted so well to life with his kidnappers that he eventually became their captain.

B1SeaLord07.props.name: Danzir
B1SeaLord07.props.bountyDesc: Protecting widows and orphans is an afterthought at best for Danzir, who only joined the Guard for the glory he hoped to earn there. He cannot stand it when other people steal his thunder.

B1SeaLord08.props.name: Isha
B1SeaLord08.props.bountyDesc: This former dihya was forced from power by her own people. Her resentment has turned her into a cruel pirate who does everything she can to undermine her former sisters.

B1SeaLord09.props.name: Rodolbert
B1SeaLord09.props.bountyDesc: Condemned to death in Alazar for assassinating a local governor, Rodolbert has found refuge in the archipelago. Now convinced that every sailor he encounters is a Guard attempting to capture him, he indiscriminately attacks anything that floats his way.

B1SeaLord10.props.name: Ganne
B1SeaLord10.props.bountyDesc: Ambushes are Ganne's speciality. Her mentor Drest taught her all there is to know about the archipelago, and she has become an expert at setting nearly unavoidable traps for the region's Merchants.

B1SeaLord11Fake.props.name: Kjerti
B1SeaLord11Fake.props.bountyDesc: Rumour has it that Kjerti has grown so powerful that the Guard have given up on trying to arrest him. Besides having a loyal crew, the pirate is also one of Belerion's greatest fighters.

B1SeaLord11.props.name: Kjerti
B1SeaLord11.props.bountyDesc: Rumour has it that Kjerti has grown so powerful that the Guard have given up on trying to arrest him. Besides having a loyal crew, the pirate is also one of Belerion's greatest fighters.

E1ChampionBoar.props.bountyDesc: It seems a monster has moved into the mountains in the south of the County. The farmers are offering a reward to anyone who can slay it.

E1KnowledgePath1Group1.props.desc: The Inquisition is moving an artefact from one Province to another.

ChampinonKaghal.props.bountyDesc: Brutal and unexplained deaths attributed to the ghost of Harag have been reported in Arthes. This individual must be stopped now.

E1DesignedMission4Group.props.bountyDesc: Some peasants have taken advantage of the chaos of war to steal an extremely valuable pony. The Guard wants to make an example of them.

E1DesignedMission3Group.props.name: Corpse Looters
E1DesignedMission3Group.props.bountyDesc: Some people were spotted looting corpses on a battlefield. This must not be allowed to continue!

E1DesignedMission2Group.props.name: Ghost Hunters
E1DesignedMission2Group.props.bountyDesc: Soldiers from Lord Laheart's army have decided to slay the Ghost of Harag. Reason with these fools before they freeze to death in the mountains!

E1DesignedMission1Group.props.name: The Lost Expedition
E1DesignedMission1Group.props.bountyDesc: An expedition has given no news for days. Alazar's ambassador is promising a large sum of Krowns to whoever will find them.

AnimalFarmWolves.props.desc: The wolves are trying to enter the building!

LaheartCaravan.props.desc: This group is taking a large amount of food to Laheart's castle.

Worldmap_HamletLaheartTest.props.desc: This group seems surprised to see you.

E2DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: Oredel and his men traitorously abandoned their duty. The Legion wants these deserters punished.

E2DesignedMission1Bis.props.bountyDesc: Oredel and his men traitorously abandoned their duty. The Legion wants these deserters punished.

E2DesignedMission1Clone.props.bountyDesc: Oredel and his men traitorously abandoned their duty. The Legion wants these deserters punished.

G1PrisonSawmillBandits.props.desc: Fugitives do not tend to return where they came from!

G1ChampionAlexaGroup.props.bountyDesc: Rumour has it that the old ::roaming:: might be somewhere in this Province. The Legion is willing to pay a handsome reward for her head.

G1DesignedMission1Group.props.name: The New Recruits
G1DesignedMission1Group.props.bountyDesc: The Brotherhood is concerned for a group of young recruits who haven't returned from their training.

G1DesignedMission2Group.props.name: Brothers on a Mission
G1DesignedMission2Group.props.bountyDesc: Protect someone called Sanka Bael by fighting off the Brotherhood, who have come to collect her debt.

G1DesignedMission3Group2.props.name: The Old Pig Keeper
G1DesignedMission3Group2.props.bountyDesc: A farmer is looking for his father-in-law who went missing while gathering wood in the mountain.

G1PoisonersGroups.props.desc: These men's knees are covered in mud.

G1ApothecaryKillersGroup.props.desc: This unknown gang was hiding behind a bush, waiting for you.

G2BoatRookArmy.props.desc: Efficient and remorseless, the Rooks are fearsome assassins who guard their secrets closely.

G2ChampionFenrisDredd.props.bountyDesc: Having escaped captivity, the former slave ::roaming:: swore to have his revenge on Gosenberg. The Broker Council is keen to get to him first, and is demanding his head.

G2DesignedMission3.props.name: Burglars
G2DesignedMission3.props.bountyDesc: A group of greedy burglars are operating in Gosenberg's more affluent districts. The wealthy residents have had enough and are willing to pay to be rid of them.

G2DesignedMission2.props.name: Amateur Teuls
G2DesignedMission2.props.bountyDesc: Giant crop circles have appeared in the fields; terrified farmers believe them to be the work of the Teuls. Search the area for whoever is responsible.

G2DesignedMission1.props.name: Annoying Jugglers
G2DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: The Broker Council is determined to silence the poet Jan and his troupe who publish satires and pamphlets undermining its power.

G2AmbassadorAttackerArmy.props.desc: Gosenberg residents have decided to take justice into their own hands, and execute the person they believe murdered Broker Hoevendorp.

G2CaveWolf.props.desc: Wolves have made their den in the Great Growler Cave. Ferocious and aggressive, they attack all merchant caravans passing nearby.

H1ChampionGroup.props.bountyDesc: An unusually powerful Plague-ridden is prowling the lands of Ludern. The Guard fears that he will spread the Plague across the entire region.

H1DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: Men wanted by the Legion are rumoured to be in Ludern. To avoid conflict with Edoran, the clans have put a bounty on their heads.

H1DesignedMission2.props.bountyDesc: The family of a Gosenberg merchant, who has been in Ludern for many months, is pleading for their father's return.

H1DesignedMission3.props.name: Wolf-eaters
H1DesignedMission3.props.bountyDesc: Trackers said they found wolf carcasses bearing what they believe are human bite marks. The Plague-ridden responsible must be found before they start attacking people!

IR1BorderPostBandit.props.desc: This group of Bandits guards the frontier between Ludern and Tiltren.

IR2DesignedMission3Army.props.bountyDesc: Following a clash with a herald of the Beast, Tracker Nella and her bear have been separated from their clan. The clan wants to know what happened to them.

IR2DesignedMission2BrighidArmy.props.bountyDesc: Some Guards from Ludern are willing to pay handsomely for any information about the murder of Master Tracker Brighid.

IR2DesignedMission2ScholarsArmy.props.bountyDesc: Scouts have noticed a small group of soldiers wearing no coat of arms and sniffing around Redane. The clans want to make sure they're not a threat.

IR2DesignMission1Army.props.bountyDesc: Limbre's clan complains that a Tracker named Issa harassing them. They're offering a bounty to anyone who can get her off their backs.

IR2Champion2.props.bountyDesc: A man named Llyr and his clan disappeared during the last Hunt of the Beast. However the scouts swear that they spotted the man wandering around south of Brigga.

Fugitive01Army.props.name: Rojen's Coterie
Fugitive01Army.props.bountyDesc: Using the Brotherhood's banner, Rojen robs and kills the merchants who call on him for protection.

Fugitive02Army.props.name: Sylla's Inquisitors
Fugitive02Army.props.bountyDesc: After three victims were burned at the stake in less than a week with complete disregard for due process, Broker Ald Marheim has ordered the arrest of Sylla and her Inquisitors.

Fugitive03Army.props.name: Meliance's Troop
Fugitive03Army.props.bountyDesc: Former members of Lord Laheart's Army have been sowing havoc and death in the Arthes countryside. Cortia is offering a hefty sum for the head of their leader Meliance.

Fugitive04Army.props.name: Gacius's Cohort
Fugitive04Army.props.bountyDesc: For an unknown reason, Lieutenant Gacius and his cohort of Legionnaires are trying to infiltrate Ludern. The Edoranian General is ready to pay to avoid a diplomatic incident.

Fugitive05Army.props.name: The Old Crone's Crew
Fugitive05Army.props.bountyDesc: The Old Crone and her lackeys are wanted in all of Ludern for a series of crimes, including murder, arson, battery and pony theft.

Fugitive06Army.props.name: Finna's Pack
Fugitive06Army.props.bountyDesc: The Gosenberg Minstrel Guild has raised a large sum of money to be rid of Finna's Pack.

Fugitive07Army.props.name: Bartes Gang
Fugitive07Army.props.bountyDesc: Despite many stretches behind bars, Bartes remains as rowdy as ever and burned down the Cortia Tavern to celebrate his release. But this time, the Guard has put a price on his head.

Fugitive08Army.props.name: Eitlingardes Followers
Fugitive08Army.props.bountyDesc: Found guilty of sedition in Alazar, Eitlingarde and her Followers are hiding in Arthes until things die down.

Fugitive09Army.props.name: The Ogre's Troop
Fugitive09Army.props.bountyDesc: Children have started disappearing again... This can only mean one thing: the infamous Ogre is back.

Fugitive10Army.props.name: Selestius' Inquisitors
Fugitive10Army.props.bountyDesc: The Inquisition has had enough of Brother Selestius' antics and are calling for the arrest of the fanatical monk before he hurts someone.

Fugitive11Army.props.name: Eligann's Troop
Fugitive11Army.props.bountyDesc: Tired of the ways of the Guard, Eligann and her Troop advocate a more expeditious method.

Fugitive12Army.props.name: Eleora's Cohort
Fugitive12Army.props.bountyDesc: Merchants report seeing a small contingent of Legion troops out and about in Grinmeer. The Broker Council demands that these intruders are driven out.

Fugitive15Army.props.name: Otton's Followers
Fugitive15Army.props.bountyDesc: Otton and his slave traders have apparently already crossed the border into Ludern, with a host of captive peasants.

Fugitive19Army.props.name: Claressia's Cohort
Fugitive19Army.props.bountyDesc: Having murdered their captain, Claressia and her accomplices fled the Edoranian capital to lay low somewhere in Arthes.

Fugitive14Army.props.name: Thenevon's Pack
Fugitive14Army.props.bountyDesc: Vertrusian traders are worried: Thenevon's Pack is wreaking havoc in the region, attacking slave convoys, freeing captives and killing Guards.

Fugitive13Army.props.name: Diewer's Gang
Fugitive13Army.props.bountyDesc: Enraged by their defeat at the Rouste Tournament, Diewer and his gang stole the winner's prize and fled.

Fugitive17Army.props.name: Kothelyn's Band
Fugitive17Army.props.bountyDesc: Passing off a disgusting Edoranian swill as the finest Gosenberg vintage, the bootleggers have accrued considerable wealth at the expense of local Vintners, who are now calling for revenge.

Fugitive18Army.props.name: Maudeg's troops
Fugitive18Army.props.bountyDesc: Not only did Maudeg and his accomplices desert the Ludern Guard, but they also made off with their employers' funds. The Clans want to make an example of them with severe retribution.

Fugitive16Army.props.name: Vesunna's Pack
Fugitive16Army.props.bountyDesc: Claiming they are protecting their gods from raiders, Vesunna and her trackers slaughter anyone who dares enter the Tiltren Tomb.

Alazar_Aneding.name: Tiltren County
Alazar_Aneding.setting.title: The Fate of Tiltren
Alazar_Aneding.setting.desc: After the war broke out, Refugees fled the neighbouring kingdom of Edoran. Their arrival in Tiltren has stirred up tensions.

Edoran_1.name: County of Arthes
Edoran_1.setting.title: The Fate of Arthes
Edoran_1.setting.desc: The war opposing Count Laheart and his former subject Vernalis is laying waste to the entire region.

Gosenberg_1.name: Vertruse Province
Gosenberg_1.setting.title: The Fate of Vertruse
Gosenberg_1.setting.desc: A strange illness is destroying the Vertrusian vineyards.

Harag_1.name: Ludern Region
Harag_1.setting.title: The Fate of Ludern
Harag_1.setting.desc: Despite the prohibitions affecting them, the Alazarian scholars seem to have found a way into Ludern. Who knows what they're planning...

Gosenberg_2.name: Grinmeer Province
Gosenberg_2.setting.title: The Fate of Grinmeer
Gosenberg_2.setting.desc: In the wake of <narrator>Broker Hoevendorp</narrator>'s death, the merchant city descends into panic as her murderer remains at large.

Alazar_1.name: Drombach County
Alazar_1.setting.title: The Fate of Drombach
Alazar_1.setting.desc: As the Eye's Reckoning tears through the lands of Drombach, the Inquisition investigates to discover which heresy gave rise to the divine wrath.

Belerion_1.name: Belerion Archipelago
Belerion_1.setting.title: The Fate of the Archipelago
Belerion_1.setting.desc: Many ships have disappeared in the Belerion Archipelago. All signs point to pirates.

Edoran_2.name: Ormance County
Edoran_2.setting.title: The Fate of Ormance
Edoran_2.setting.desc: The Skelmar invasion has plunged Ormance County into chaos.

InterRegion_2.name: Wild Lands of Brigga
InterRegion_2.setting.title: The Beast Hunt
InterRegion_2.setting.desc: The Beast is on the prowl in the desolate lands of Brigga. The Trackers of Harag can't pass up this opportunity to hunt the creature down.

Start.text: My oh my... You seem to struggle to <narrator>solverise</narrator> this puzzle, my dear Mercenaries!

Next1.text:
Luckily for you, <narrator>I, Solvius, the Greatest Solveriser in the World</narrator> am willing to help.
For a paltry sum, I will solverise this puzzle, which has you so flummoxed!

line0.props.tipText: Pay Solvius to solverise the puzzle.

line1.props.tipText: Persuade Solvius to solverise the puzzle without paying him.

Accept1.text: Let's see... Ah yes... one tile to the left, one tile upwards...

Accept2.text: Tada! The puzzle have been solverised!

Convinced1.text:
You are right, my good fellows! A great solveriser does not solverise anything for a few measly Krowns, but for the love of solverising!
Please allow me to work my magic!

Convinced2.text: Tada! The puzzle have been solverised!

End.text: Tada! The puzzle have been solverised!

Refuse.text:
Ah! I am ever so proud of you, Mercenaries! The art of Solverising requires a good measure of purposefulness.
Please allow me to observe you.

Start.text:
Might you be looking for work?
Our role as emissaries is to ensure that all service requests are fulfilled. We regularly update our job offers.
You have much to do, my Lords. As ambassador, my role is to spare you any superfluous tasks. In short, I shall relieve you of all those insufferable banquets and endless toadying.

Next1.text: I can accept presents from your ally for you, and give them to your residents on your behalf. Of course, I can let my foreign counterpart know if the gifts they send you are of little interest to you, and request others instead.

Ambassador.text: Are you satisfied with the gifts sent by your ally, or shall I subtly let them know that they're on the wrong track?

NoAlly.text: I regret to inform you that your diplomatic relations are not the most cordial. Might I suggest that you try trading with your neighbours?

line0.props.disableReason: You have no allied kingdoms.

Start.text: It's an honour to serve you, my Lords.

line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Heal.text: Is there anything else I can do?

Start.text:
Don't worry, my Lords.
Your residents don't suspect a thing.
Business is booming. Your Fief's in the perfect location.

Next1.text: Half the loot is yours, as agreed. Just tell us what we should set aside for you.

Start.text: That noble must be hiding a lot of Krowns. No one tortures people without a good reason...
It's an honour to welcome you to the Barracks, my Lords!
I finally get to meet you, Mercenaries! Or should I say, my Lords! You've grown into quite the legends around here.

Next1.text:
All the rogues in the Five Kingdoms are following your adventures at Mount Altis with rapt attention.
You didn't settle for a simple fortress, oh no! You've built an entire Fief!

Next2.text: The Brotherhood is always happy to lend up-and-coming companies a hand, so please allow me to sell you our finest techniques.

Respec.text: One last piece of advice Train thoroughly with this new class to become familiar with it before jumping into any serious fights.

Start.text: No disrespect, my Lords, but if you merely wish to mend your dented helmets or buy a sack of coal, you can go to any ordinary blacksmith. My art is in another class entirely!

Next1.text: Show me a model for the breastplate or shield of your choice, and I'll reproduce it in no time. You won't be able to tell the difference between the copy and the original.

line0.props.tipText: Reproduce a weapon, armour, or helmet.
line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Start.text: Oh! My Lords! I am most pleased to meet you! Your people have told me so very many wonderful things about you.

Next1.text: As your new Master-at-Arms, I promise to personally take part in your Companions' training. I will be relentlessly strict with them. With me, they will always know who's boss!

line0.props.tipText: Grant the Troop's level to a Companion in the garrison.

line1.props.tipText: Generate a recruit in the garrison based on a Companion's class and stats.

Start.text: Residents, probably here to complain about the noise.
Your militia's training is attracting attention.

Entrust the souls of your residents and Companions to me.
I swear I will do everything in my power to guide them according to the precepts of the Light.

line0.props.tipText: Remove a negative trait from a Companion.
line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Start.text: There's no better justification for power than divine right...
Well the Tules are not usually worshipped indoors, but I suppose that converting so many new believers requires a few concessions.

Next1.text: You can trust me, I'll teach your residents everything I know about the Tules and the Ancients.

line0.props.tipText: Remove a negative trait from a Companion.
line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Start.text: So much noise! City life is too much for me.
This place is perfect for reflection and study. I'm pleased that you have finally decided to build a university.

Next1.text:
How can the Scholars be of use to you, my Lords?
Does one of your Companions wish to join in our studies?

line0.props.tipText: Learn a positive trait from a Companion.
line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Start.text:
I'm fascinated by anything to do with the Ancients!
I suppose you could say it's in my blood! Has the Professor mentioned that my grandfather was part of the royal expedition that unearthed the ruin of Tiltren?

Next1.text: Entrust me with all your codices! I am confident I can identify the location of any sepulchre!

line0.props.tipText: Ask the Explorer to find the location of a sepulchre from the relevant codices.
line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

line1.props.tipText: Decipher a codex, even if not all of the runes have been discovered.
line1.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Sepulcre2.text:
Hmm... That was a tricky one, but I reckon I've discovered the place the Chronicler was referring to!
I've marked it on your map!

Codex2.text:
Interesting... yes...
I believe my translation is correct. You can now consult it whenever you like.

Start.text: The Brokers had no interest in my work whatsoever! They considered the plain ones too ugly to adorn their homes, and too bland to eat. Those knaves! I left them behind with no regrets!

Next1.text:
The plants I grow here can both heal and kill! ...
Which kind are you after?

Start.text: The Scholars maintain a positively sepulchral silence.
Caught up in an animated discussion, these residents haven't noticed your presence.
Whatever the subject is, it seems to be a heated debate.
I've raised dozens of pigs and no less than six children in my life! When it comes to excrement and ingratitude, I've seen it all, believe me.

Next1.text: Whatever your residents want to eat, I can produce it!

Start.text:
Ask me anything.
This forge is yours as much as it is mine!

line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Repair.text: I hope you'll be satisfied with my work, my Lords.

Start.text: You won't be mad at me, will you, if I take your other customers for all they've got?
The thing about me is, I never ask questions. No one will know what you came here for.
These people don't seem the type to only bet what they can afford to lose...
The Scholars don't need to know where we found this Wheel of the Ancients. So why bother them? Just come and try your luck instead!

Next1.text: Don't be shy, my lords! Spin the Wheel of the Ancients!

line0.props.tipText: Play Wheel of the Ancients.

Start.text: This Smuggler doesn't need you.

When I'm not teaching algebra to my students, I keep track of your Fief's accounts.
It's as good a pastime as any.
Being elected by your citizens to assist you is surely the greatest honour I've ever received. Even so, I must admit that the work is more tiring than I expected.

Next1.text: Your people have submitted several laws that they'd like to see implemented. Do you wish to consult them?

Start.text: I keep this building in good condition. In case we ever need it one day...

line0.props.disableReason: You must have a democratic government to access Town Hall activities.

Start.text:
Mercenaries are pouring in from the Five Kingdoms to join you.
They're drawn to your Fief like flies to a carcass!

line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

line1.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Rest.text: Did you sleep well, my Lords?

Start.text: The subject of this play appeals to you somehow.

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance.
Watch the performance.

Next1.text:
Far from it, accursed rogue!
For lo, we have seized it from you in pitched combat! These walls now belong to us!

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance.

Next2.text: But what will you do with this place, bold Mercenaries?

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance.

Next3.text:
It shall form the foundations of a city fine and proud, and we shall be its valiant lords!
Here, the people will no longer live in fear of Bandits like you!
Death to Alvrick the Vile!

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance.

Next4.text: Nooooooo!

Start.text:
Oh! My Lords! I'm thrilled to meet you in person!
I've just been chosen by your Merchants to serve as their representative.

Next1.text:
I know every trade, every guild, as if I'd been personally trained there!
With a man like me by your side, your Fief and your company are sure to prosper.

line0.props.tipText: Train a Companion in a profession.
line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Start.text:
Need something, my Lords?
I've saved the best for you!
I'd never dream of selling junk to your residents! Everything in this stall is fresh and locally grown!
When I heard your Fief was in need of a barber, I left my wife and kids behind to seize my chance!

Next1.text: Believe me, I may not be the most reliable husband, but I'm the best barber for leagues around!

Start.text: The Militia always has an eye out for charlatans and thieves.
Better to keep your distance from your residents' gossip.
In our family, being a prison guard is a vocation that's passed down from father to son. You'll be getting generations' worth of reliable know-how if you hire me.

Next1.text: Have you captured some Bandits? I'm just itching to have a few prisoners to watch over.

line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Deliver.text: Wonderful! I know exactly which chains I'll lock him up in!

NoSlotAvailable.text:
What a sight, my Lords!
All these outlaws locked up nice and tight here in my prison!
Bringing in any more would disrupt the harmony we've established here, don't you agree?

line0.props.disableReason: No prisoner slots available.

Start.text: Let me take care of your prisoners. I know how to cure them of their taste for crime.

line0.props.tipText: After slipping through the executioner's fingers, the prisoner will become a respectable Companion in the Mercenaries' Inn.

Start.text: Trading with the Five Kingdoms could earn you a lot of money, my Lords. But I must warn you: not all caravans that set out will return.

Next1.text: The roads are filled with peril these days. I humbly suggest that you always have your Merchants accompanied by a few Militiamen.

Start.text:
Just because I don't know how to lead a caravan doesn't mean I can't organise your trips!
I have served two Lords Mayor, after all!

Next1.text: Please, my Lords, tell me which of your Travel Posts you wish to travel to, and I'll handle all the preparations. Then all you'll have to do is let the driver guide you.

line0.props.disableReason: Build Travel Posts in other villages to get there quickly. Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Start.text: My parents had a whole pony breeding farm in Tiltren. I loved watching them run through the fields, their manes blowing in the wind.

Next1.text:
Would you like to entrust one of your animals to me?
Don't worry a bit though I do have a preference for ponies, I'll take good care of all your beasts. No matter how exotic.

line0.props.tipText: Leave an animal at the stable.

line1.props.tipText: Grant the Troop's level to an animal in the stable.
line1.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

line2.props.tipText: Add an animal of a species you already own to the Troop
line2.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Deliver.text: What a magnificent animal! I promise I'll take excellent care of it.

NoSlotAvailable.text:
I'm sorry, all the stalls at our stables are occupied.
I can't watch over any more animals.

line0.props.disableReason: No stalls available.

Start.text: This home is quite the comfortable hideout. Who would ever suspect that a Black Market was hidden beneath such an elegant villa?

Next1.text:
I'm in direct contact with the other Black Markets and the Baron.
Whatever you want, I can get it for you.

Start.text:
I'm most eager to be of use to you, my Lords.
Do you have any questions for me?

line0.props.tipText: Start the tutorial missions for the Fief.

TutorialRequest.text: But of course! I've already thought quite a bit about potential improvements to the Fief.

ConstructionMission1.text: What an impressive success, Mercenaries! With this Throne Room alone, you've already made more progress in renovating this ruin than Alvrick and his gang ever did.

ConstructionMission2.text: Since you already have a room to administer your Fief, I'd suggest you next build something to keep its first residents busy. Maybe something lucrative?

ConstructionMission3.text: The first thing to do is to construct a production building: a Forge, an Apothecary's office or a Farm would do the trick. Then you'll just need to decide what you want to make or grow there.

TaxMission1.text: All those scoundrels toiling away for your prosperity, leaving you free to focus on your own affairs! Isn't that what power is all about?

TaxMission2.text: If your Fief's buildings produce food, items, and goods of all sorts, your districts also produce money. Provided that you tax them, of course! None of your residents will give you anything of their own volition.

TaxMission3.text:
Collecting your people's hard-won riches may seem cruel, but you need this revenue to construct and upgrade buildings.
Heed my advice: you must tax your residents.

PopulationMission1.text:
Those taxes will do your Fief a world of good!
I can't wait to see what you do with them!

PopulationMission2.text: Now that you have a stable revenue stream, you should think about growing your population. The more subjects you have, the more you'll be able to build and produce.

NewDistrictMission1.text: Congratulations, my Lords! So many people are flocking to your Fief, simply for the pleasure of working for you!

NewDistrictMission2.text: Your realm now has enough residents to develop further: you can build a new district! You can house more residents there, but more importantly, it will provide new locations for your production buildings!

MandateMission1.text:
What a glorious sight! All those banners waving over the towers of your Fief!
I wonder how many there are now...

MandateMission2.text: Managing such a large domain is no easy task. All of your residents must abide by the same rules, no matter how far they are from your Throne Room.

MandateMission3.text: Establishing a government should help with this. Besides helping to guide your Fief's policies, it will also allow you to issue assignments to tweak your economy as needed.

OutroMission1.text: With a government like that, you're bound to lead this Fief to glory.

OutroMission2.text:
Allow me to congratulate you one last time, my Lords. You have accomplished great things here. From simple mercenaries, you've become proper lords.
Every time I look at you, I'm glad I encouraged you to kill Alvrick.

End.text:
You know everything there is to know about managing a Fief.
From now on, my role will be limited to making the complainants wait patiently while you're away.

Start.text: The militia sees to it that your audiences run smoothly.
It's an honour to serve as your messenger. I swear I will not disappoint you!

Next1.text: Whichever items you need sent, I shall deliver them to your Troop without fail! Even if I must run all night!

line0.props.tipText: Send items produced by the Fief to the Troop.
line0.props.disableReason: Your Troop must be physically present in the Fief to access this.

Start.text: General Lavender never misses a single audience.
Your residents have assembled to attend the audiences.
No one slacks off here. I make sure of that!

Next1.text: If you're not satisfied with what we produce, or if you want us to make something else, just say the word. You're the one paying.

Start.text: This man looks like he doesn't want to be disturbed.

Do you know Gosenberg City?
I used to be one of the best fighters in Bernnas Arena.

Next1.text: Impressive, eh?

Start.text:
I'll have you know we don't trade with just anybody.
Only Arena champions can buy my wares.

Alt.text: Oh! Our new champions? What can I do for you?

Start.text:
In these troubled times, the people need entertainment more than ever!
Challenge our champion and some of our best fighters to give them an unforgettable show!

NoBeginArena.text: Our audience will be awfully disappointed.

OnLeaveArena.text: Youre doing great, dont stop now!

Completed.text:
What a show! What an amazing victory!
Have you ever considered entering the Gosenberg Arena Clash?
Ah! But I digress. Here's Lisbeth's throwing axe, it's yours now!

ArenaLost.text: Go train for a while and come back stronger. The good people of Drombach can wait.

ArenaDiff.text:
Want to go again?
Sign up, our audience is eager to see you in action!

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text: You are without a doubt the best gladiators in all of Drombach. Our spectators really got their money's worth!

CompletedDiff2.text: Take your reward, and feel free to come back for the love of the fight!

CompletedDiff3.text: I said for the love of the fight because you won't get paid. Not that you don't deserve money, but you've won all the rewards!

ArenaAgain.text: I knew you'd be back! Fighters like you don't care about rewards, right?

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedAgain.text: I wish you'd come every day, Mercenaries! Watching you fight lifts everyone's spirits.

Start.text: I'm going back to Drombach to look for Plague remedies. Tiltrens stock is dwindling.
I heard that the <narrator>Eyes Reckoning</narrator> did some damage in New-Asthel. I hope my family is all right.
Do you know how much I have to pay for each slave crossing the border? This is preposterous!

Next1.text: They won't let honest citizens work! This kingdom is going to hell in a handcart!

Start.text: Do you really want to enter Alazar? Despite the Eyes Reckoning?

Give.text:
All right, suit yourselves...
Send my regards to the <narrator>Inquisition</narrator>.

End.text:
What do you want?
Youve already paid, you can cross the border.

line0.title: To Alazar
line0.props.helpTip: Pay the toll (200 or a Border Pass).

Start.text:
Prince Aerald asked us to rebuild this bridge, but someone messed up the order of materials.
When the cart got here, it was short several sandstone blocks.

Next1.text: Now we need to send word to the castle, then wait for quarry owners to set their prices, for slaves to carve out the blocks, and for caravans to deliver them... Its going to take weeks!

Next2.text: Were willing to buy any sandstone you have. We wont get paid until the bridge is fixed.

Give1.text:
Its a deal.
We can get back to work now.

Given2.text: Come back in a couple of days and the repairs should be done.

line0.text: Give 20 Sandstone to the workers rebuilding the Pitta Bridge.

Start.text:
Some damage, eh?
Heard bandits were crossing the bridge when they were struck by the Eyes Reckoning.

Next1.text: Wish theyd walked faster, then the bridge would still be standing!

line0.text: Defeat the cannibals.

line1.text: Comfort Clowilda Ald Alazar to get your bounty back.

Start.text:
Today's our lucky day, lads.
Our meal has come to us.

Alt.text: You shouldn't have followed us here!

Start.text: Mercenaries, youre here! You must help me! Bandits fell upon my husband and...

Next1.text: Youve killed them? What about my husband? Where is he?

Start.text:
...
What the...
No! No! <narrator>Noooo</narrator>!

line0.props.tipText: Comfort Clowilda.

line1.props.tipText: Calm Clowilda down.

Next1.text: Thank you... I really needed that.

Next2.text: I knew those barbarians werent mere bandits... Thank you for putting an end to this horror.

Next3.text: I can give you this as a token of my gratitude. I hope its enough.

Next4.text: My husband was a close cousin of Prince Aerald. I trust the castle will send someone to retrieve his body.

Start.text:
This pillar was carved by the Ancients.
The Scholars milling about are oblivious to your presence.

Alt.text:
This pillar was carved by the Ancients.
Alazar built whats around it.

MissionDescPrince.text: Talk to Prince Aerald Adr Alazar to get your reward.

line0.text: Defeat Prince Aerald Adr Alazar.

line1.text: Talk to High Inquisitor Dexera.

line0.text: Defeat High Inquisitor Dexera.

line1.text: Talk to Prince Aerald Adr Alazar.

Start.text: What...

Next1.text: What is this thing?

Start.text: So you've finally discovered the <narrator>Celestium</narrator>.

Next1.text: I figured a locked door would pique your curiosity. Perhaps I should have kept it open...

Start.text:
What...
What is this thing?

Next1.text: What is this place, Prince Aerald? Answer me!

Next2.text: As I told you, it is the <narrator>Celestium</narrator>. A one-of-a-kind place of learning, where the most advanced Alazarian technology meets that of the Ancients. A treasure trove of knowledge.

Next3.text: I could elaborate, but I doubt you would understand. All youre good for is burning peasants.

Next4.text:
Do not play games with me, Prince.
One needs not be a great Alazarian Scholar to understand that the Eyes Reckoning was unleashed because of this unholy aberration.

Next4bis.text: You unearthed it from the mountain where the Ancients left it, without knowing what it was or how to control it! And you had the gall to use it!

Next5.text: Youre not entirely wrong, High Inquisitor. However, let me assure you that our understanding of this artefact is growing by the hour. We will find a way to stop it soon enough.

Next6.text: Oh! But I know just what to do. This thing is begging to be reduced to rubble!

Next7.text: Mercenaries! It is time to put an end to this sinful endeavour and destroy this insult to the Great Eye!

Start.text:
You fought bravely, Mercenaries. By destroying this relic, you saved a county from the madness of its prince.
Maybe even the Five Kingdoms.

Next1.text:
What happened in Drombach was a warning sent by the God of Light.
One must stay away from the relics of a civilisation that left only Tombs behind.

Next2.text: As for your reward, I realise it is far from what you deserve, but no matter how many Krowns we could shower you with, it would never come close to rewarding you properly.

Next3.text: We will make an example of Prince Aeralds heresy. He will be taken to the Holy City at the heart of Edoran, where he will face judgement.

Start.text:
We were so close! So close to controlling the Eye!
We could have become gods!

This pillar... Did I understand correctly?
Could it really control the Eye?

Those Scholars tried to use an Ancient artefact to bring about, and then stop the Eyes Reckoning?
But why?

Look whos paying us a visit!
Our ungodly Mercenaries!

Next1.text: I would have been most disappointed not to run into you heretics.

MissionDesc.text: Defeat High Inquisitor Dexera.

Start.text: Thus died High Inquisitor Dexera.

By the Beast's fangs, we did it!
We saved the pillar, averted the Eye's Reckoning, defeated the Inquisition... I could not have wished for a better outcome!

Next2.text:
Things would have ended very differently without your help.
I thought you were nothing more than vultures in armour, but I must admit I was wrong, Mercenaries.

Next3.text: Please accept this reward and my most humble apologies. I trust you will find this present worthy of your service.

End1.text: You can count on us to continue studying this Ancient pillar.

End2.text: Should Alazar one day harness the power of the God of Light, the kingdom will become invincible thanks to you.

Notif.text: The Eye's Reckoning has left Drombach.

EndSetting.text: You have finished the Drombach scenario. It is time to explore other regions.

Start.text: Help!

And you, Prince Aerald!
I appreciate not having to hunt you down. You came willingly to confess your heresy!
Dont worry. As soon as we destroy this thing, youre next.

Next1.text: You have no idea what youre doing! This relic is our only chance to stop the Eyes Reckoning!

Next2.text: Your only chance? You are such a shameless liar, Prince Aerald! Is that what you told the Mercenaries? I had time to question your Scholars. They admitted that it is this thing that brought about the wrath of the God of Light!

Next3.text:
And it can put an end to it just the same.
Given a little more time, the Scholars you didn't slaughter will find a way. They are making great strides, my people are about to...

Next4.text:
They are about to die. Just like you.
As for this thing, we will destroy it to please the God of Light!

Next5.text: Tsk! Might as well try to reason with a crocswine!

Next6.text:
Mercenaries! You handle the fanatics.
I will direct the Scholars. <narrator>Buy time until they disable the pillar.</narrator>

Start.text: Were still hard at work trying to uncover the secrets of the Ancients. But as were no longer pressed for time, we can afford to take breaks.
Someday, we will harness the power of the God of Light. We will become gods ourselves!
The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.

MissionDesc1.text: Greet the army with Professor Berthild.

MissionDesc2.text: Fight the Alazarian soldiers or the Inquisitors.

line0.text: Take on Professor Berthild's mission.

line1.text: Clear the rubble to find survivors.

line2.text: Meet the Guard by the stables.

line3.text: Resolve the conflict between the Scholars and the Inquisitors.

Start.text: Sorry, no time to chat. These stables wont rebuild themselves!

Oh! I know you! You're the Mercenaries who saved us!
I'm so glad to see you after all this time!

Next1.text:
As you can see, we reopened the stables after the Inquisition left.
Theres still work to do, but repairs are going well.

Start.text: We were on our way to the border crossing when we saw the <narrator>Eyes Reckoning</narrator> strike these stables.

Next1.text: I sent one of our companions to New-Asthel for help, but time is of the essence. Any survivors still under the rubble might suffocate if we wait.

Next2.text: You seem equipped for the task, Mercenaries. Would you mind clearing the debris? I can offer fair payment for your efforts.

Next3.text: Best get to it immediately.

Next4.text: I hear soldiers! Come, Mercenaries. Lets go greet them.

MissionDesc.text: Clear the rubble to save the stables occupants.

Start.text: This woman's injuries may be superficial, but her mind is deeply troubled.
The Eye... I saw it...
What have I done? What have I done to offend the God of Light?
Im not a heretic, I swear! Don't hurt me!
<narrator>This fresco is so ancient that it has faded over time. </narrator>
There is nothing but an old blue dress in this chest.
A dusty axe.

line0.text: Find the real Isold among the pretenders.

Start.text: Maybe she wasn't the real Isold after all...
Youre not as stupid as you look, Mercenaries!

Next1.text: But you wouldve been better served to get it wrong. Then we wouldn't have to slaughter you.

Next2.text: The sheepfold is ours! Get back!

Start.text:
Father!
Dont you recognise me?

Next1.text: I'm Isold! Father! Tell them!

Next2.text: By Saint Eleor! Please, Father! Its me, your daughter!
