Next3.text: I don't know! I can't think straight!

Next4.text:
I dont know what to do!
These three women claim to be my daughter Isold... And I can't tell which one is telling the truth!

Next5.text:
Oh! Good folks! I'm so ashamed that I can't even recognise my own daughter!
I beg you, take pity on me! Im but a blind beggar whose beloved child left him long ago.

Next6.text: If only... If only you could help me find my Isold!

line0.props.tipText: Identify the dark-haired Isold as the shepherds daughter.

line1.props.tipText: Identify the blond Isold as the shepherds daughter.

line2.props.tipText: Identify the red-haired Isold as the shepherds daughter.

End1.text:
You saved me!
Isold saved me!
Thank you! Thank you!

EndWrong.text: I'm so happy to have my dear Isold back!

Start.text: These wenches are only after what little he has left!

Next1.text: Please, Mercenaries! You must convince my father that I'm the real Isold. I'll give you what's most precious to me if you make these women leave.

End1.text: Thank you, Mercenaries! Thank you!

End2.text:
Look at those tramps run, as they should!
I will have my revenge.

End3.text: But first, let me give you this reward. Its the least I can do.

Wait.text: I have so many things to tell my father, so much catching up to do...

Start.text: I risked my life to provide for my father!

Next1.text: I spent ten years in a gang of bandits to put food on the old man's table, and he doesn't even recognise me? I'm willing to give you my weapon to make him come to his senses.

End1.text:
By Saint Jerus beard, I thought you were going to pick one of those tramps instead of me.
That would have been too much to bear!

End2.text: My father may not be able to tell me apart from a stranger, but hes still my father.

End3.text: Take this reward. Thanks to you, he can enjoy whatever time he has left with his daughter.

Wait.text: Ah, its good to be back home.

Start.text: Ten years fighting for the Brotherhood! Ten years sending him my wages! And for what? So that this old coot doesn't even recognise me when I come back?

Next1.text: Convince him that I'm the real Isold, Mercenaries, and Ill give you my old armour.

Alt1.text: I didn't think these hussies would start a fight. Had I known, I would have struck the first blow.

Alt2.text: I met them in an inn on my way home. I guess I told them a bit too much about my life. They then decided to impersonate me and try to trick my father.

Alt3.text: Good thing you came this way. Let me give you your reward before I have a chat with my father.

Wait.text: Lets just say that I still resent him a bit.

line0.text: Find a way to free the slaves.

line1.text: Free the slaves from the fishery at night.

line2.text: Fight the Harag warriors or the Alazarian army.

Start.text:
The Inquisition is lying!
Having slaves is no heresy, its a traditional way of life!

Next1.text: The thief must serve the honest man, the loser must serve the winner! Such is the Alazarian way. Always has been.

Next2.text: Now that weve cleared things up, get out of here. The work needs to be done before <narrator>sunset.</narrator>

Slaves.text: Stop talking to the slaves, youre slowing them down.

EndHarag.text:
I heard that savages came all the way from Harag to steal my slaves!
Good thing the Alazarian army is keeping watch!

Start.text: Someone stole my slaves!
You could free us... But then, what would we do? <narrator>How could I return to Harag?</narrator>

Next1.text:
Praise the Ancients!
Untie me, quick!

Next2.text:
Leave me alone.
I'd rather spend the rest of my life working here than see your faces a moment longer.

Start.text: Heard that some <narrator>Harag warriors</narrator> are freeing slaves to honour their gods. If you happen to cross their path, let them know were ready for them.

Next1.text:
What? Harag is coming to rescue us?
Quickly! Quickly! The army could be here any minute!

Next2.text: Curse you.

Start.text: I ran away twice, and all I got out of it is this cage.

Next1.text:
My brethren are coming to free us?
Praise the Tules!
Open this damn door, don't leave me behind!

Next2.text: I hope the Beast stomps you to death. Thats all a slaver like you deserves.

Start.text:
Are you here to hunt the Ghost Pack?
Youve got the wrong camp, Mercenaries. The Trackers set up theirs in the centre of Drombach.

Next1.text: We too come from Harag, but with a different purpose.

Next2.text:
Despite the many treaties and peace accords between our kingdoms, Alazar keeps buying slaves from the bandits roaming our lands.
We were sent by our clan to free our brothers and sisters who were captured by those miscreants.

Next3.text:
Should you wish to support our cause, we can afford to reward you.
Enter the Icy Bay Fishery after nightfall, free the poor souls theyre holding captive, and bring them to us. We'll make sure that no soldier interrupts you.

End.text: We must tend to our wounds before setting off for Harag. It will be a long and dangerous journey.

line0.text: Go to the <narrator>Icy Bay Fishery</narrator> at night and free the slaves.

line1.text: Free the slaves.

Start.text: In Gosenberg and Alazar, everyone claims that their slaves are all former criminals...

Next1.text:
Its a lie!
In all of the kingdoms, bandits kidnap peasants and sell them to those barbarians from the North! Curse them all!

Start.text: My own brother was abducted when he was just a boy. He must be a grown man now, I don't even know if I'd recognise him.

Thank you, Mercenaries.
I didn't think I'd ever be free again.
I wonder what Harag is like.
I can't help but worry. I feel like a patrol could show up at any time.

This shelter is the last stop before Mount Ernst and the mountain range that separates us from Edoran.
Be careful if thats where youre headed. Travellers often lose their way around here.
I will not to go further south. Id sooner face the God of Lights judgement than that of the mountain.
I went on a mission on Mount Ernst before. I lost three toes and two Companions.

line0.text: Take on Inquisitor Emerias mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line0.text: Take on the High Inquisitors mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Don't let them burn me! Please!

StartCrawler.text: The creature seems to know what is coming.

Start.text: Walk in the Light, Mercenaries, and you will never have to fear the pyre.

Next1.text: Are you here to save your Companion from the Light's judgement? Your offering had better measure up to their crimes against the Eye.

line0.props.tipText: Pay the fine to free ::A1InquisitionCampSlot1::.

line1.props.tipText: Feed ::A1InquisitionCampSlot1::'s pyre.

line2.props.tipText: ::A1InquisitionCampSlot1:: has an enemy in the troop.

Pay1.text: Good enough, your Companion is free. But remember that the All-Seeing Eye watches your every move.

Give1.text: That's... that's very nice of you! This quality wood will burn bright!

Watch1.text: Come sit with us. Watching the cleansing of a soul is always very moving.

Deliver.text: We will cleanse this heretic's soul as soon as possible.

NoSlotAvailable.text: It wouldn't be proper to burn several heretics at the same time. Come back in ::until_vars.days:: days.

NotCageAvailable.text: We can't take any more heretics at the moment. Come back in ::until_vars.days:: days.

Start.text: Inquisitors say that fire doesnt hurt true believers. Im doing my best to pray properly before my time comes.

The Eyes Reckoning is divine retribution, an answer to the worst heresies. It is the Inquisitions duty to catch anyone who would dare escape it.
No matter where it happens, the Edoranian Church is watching.

Tavern1.text:
Who is that you are bringing, Mercenaries?
This man, could he be...?

line0.props.tipText: Hand over the New-Asthel innkeeper.

Give1.text:
The New-Asthel innkeeper! Weve been trying to find him for quite some time.
But tell me, Mercenaries, he seems quite calm for someone who is about to be burnt at the stake. Did you drug him?

Give2.text: He surrendered of his own volition? Praised be Saint Jeru. Perhaps this county isn't completely hopeless after all.

Give3.text:
He can rejoice in the knowledge that our pyre will cleanse his soul, and that he will pass into the Light as surely as any good believer would.
Please accept this reward. You have done us all a great service.

SettingLog.text: You handed the New-Asthel innkeeper over to the Inquisition.

Wait.text: We will prepare a special pyre for the innkeeper.

End1.text:
I am pleased that you answered my call, Mercenaries.
Every blade, every shield is needed in this battle that will see the forces of Light triumph over the darkness of heresy.

End2.text: Because were going to war! A war in the name of the God of Light. A war against Drombach, against Prince Aerald Adr Alazar, against the sacrilege that hes trying to hide from us!

End3.text:
Let us destroy the Celestial Mountain Gate! We will go through this unholy portal and cleanse all heresy from Drombach!
Are you with us?

AcceptEnd.text:
Get ready to give your lives to the God of Light.
We will meet you by the mountain.

MissionDesc1.text: Meet the Inquisitors at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

line0.text: Take the innkeeper to the High Inquisitor.

Start.text: The pyres flames help me focus. I have much to reflect upon.

Next1.text: You may wonder why I, an Inquisitor, would call upon unbelievers like you.

Next2.text: Well, the reason is that the mission I wish to give you goes against our precepts. I was even forbidden from enlisting the help of other Inquisitors...

Next3.text: I dont think the Inquisitions usual methods will appease the God of Light. The Eyes Reckoning is different in Drombach. More frequent, more powerful... And I want to find out why! Are you ready to follow me?

Alt1.text:
Im glad that your company answered my call.
I need people I can trust, not mere Mercenaries who might misunderstand my faith...

Alt2.text: The Eyes Reckoning is very odd in this county. It destroys taverns and stables, kills dozens of people... Elsewhere, the God of Light manifests Himself once or twice a year at most, and only for a handful of heathens.

Alt3.text:
I doubt that merely killing those who survived the Reckoning will be enough to appease the God of Light. We must find what sparked His wrath: the original heresy.
Are you with me?

Accept.text:
Very well.
Our first order of business is to study the victims of the Eyes Reckoning. Discovering what they have in common could give us insight into the heresy were looking for. Protect me on the way and I will examine the bodies.

Start.text:
The people of Drombach should be grateful!
We came from Edoran to save their souls!
<narrator>When the Plague first appeared, we knew nothing about it. It was a distant scourge affecting the Legion and Harag Trackers, little more than a wartime disease or so we thought.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Alas, we started receiving increasingly alarming reports from the front. Entire regiments were contaminated. The disease, that was merely souring tempers at the beginning, was now forcing them to devour each other.</narrator>

Next3.text:
<narrator>Despite the many remedies used and the Scholars ingenuity, the Plague seemed unstoppable. The Legion was wiped out.
The army that had conquered Alazar and destroyed the Northern Kingdom was laid low by nature, at the gates of the capital of Harag.</narrator>

Start.text: <narrator>Critical years followed the end of the war. The Plague crossed Harags borders with the retreating Legion.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Scholars tried to find a cure, in vain. We just could not understand where this affliction originated from. Veterans tales were muddled, fragmented, full of superstition. Out of desperation, I left Drombach for Ludern...</narrator>

Next3.text: Several pages have been ripped out.

Start.text: It is here, between these walls, that the illustrious Sophy Adr Alazar bested the Plague. Since then, weve been striving to walk in her footsteps and improve her original cure.

Next1.text: Thanks to Prince Aerald Adr Alazars unconditional support, we are now ready to take another step on the path of Knowledge. Only one thing is still holding us back: the Inquisition.

Next2.text: We cannot take proper initiatives as long as theyre in Drombach! Even our army is under watch! If any of our requests are even slightly out of the ordinary, no one can fulfil them...

Next3.text: But perhaps Mercenaries like you would be discreet enough to break a few religious precepts, as inconspicuously as possible... What say you? I can offer you a princely reward...

Next4.text: Is it a thirst for knowledge I see sparkling in your eyes? We need 3 live Plague-ridden. You will find plenty of them in the cursed village of Asthel, a few miles north of here.

Wait.text:
Did you find our test subjects?
We need them alive, all three of them!

line0.props.tipText: Hand over the <narrator>3 Plague-ridden</narrator>.
line0.props.disableReason: Hand over <narrator>3 Plague-ridden</narrator>.

Give1.text:
This is...
Blessed be the Eye, you did it!
Take your reward, with the gratitude of everyone at the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.

Give2.text: You can leave without fear. As seasoned Scholars, we have the situation well in hand.

MissionDesc.text: Catch 3 Plague-ridden in the cursed village of Asthel.

MissionDesc2.text: Bring the Plague-ridden subjects to Professor Grind.

MissionDesc3.text: Go to Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.

SettingLog.text: You provided Professor Grind with Plague-ridden subjects.

End1.text: My students sacrifice wont be in vain. As soon as the Inquisition has their back turned, I will resume my research.

End2.text:
Just imagine, Mercenaries!
Imagine a world where we could avert the Plague. The Alazarian army would have a sizeable advantage over the other kingdoms. We could turn this curse into a weapon!

Start.text: I wonder if were not making a mistake, studying so many live Plague-ridden subjects...

Next1.text: Don't torment yourself. This experiment was approved by the Prince himself. He knows what hes doing.

Start.text: The Inquisition claims that studying live specimens is heresy.

Next1.text: That's preposterous! How are we supposed to test the new formula without Plague-ridden subjects who will react to it?

MissionDesc.text: Meet Lieutenant Damen at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

MissionDesc2.text: Climb the Celestial Mountain steps.

line0.text: Meet Lieutenant Damen by the mountain.

line1.text: Talk to Lieutenant Damen at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

line2.text: Talk to Inquisitor Emeria at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

Start.text:
By the Beast's fangs! I just can't catch a break!
The mine collapsed and...

Next1.text: WHAT? The Inquisition is coming?

Next2.text: Curses, if they manage to get inside the mountain, a war could break out!

Next3.text: We must stop them from reaching the <narrator>gate</narrator> at all costs. Follow me!

Wait1.text: Who let you in? Go away, Mercenaries.

Start.text: Mercenaries! We've found it!

Next1.text: Beyond this gate lies the heresy were looking for, I'm sure of it. A sacrilege so great it unleashed the Eyes Reckoning upon a whole county.

Next2.text:
This discovery would not have been possible without you and your unfailing dedication!
Please accept this reward as a token of my gratitude.

Wait.text: Count on us to open this door! We will call you as soon as its done.

SettingLog.text: You let the Inquisition reach the Celestial Mountain Gate.

Start.text: The High Inquisitor always says that every closed door hides a heresy. Just imagine whats going on behind this one!
Its an honour to take up arms in the name of the Eye, even more so when were fighting heretics.
I have never set foot beyond this gate, and truth be told, I have no way of opening it myself.

Next1.text: Only some Scholars know the code.

End1.text: You saved us, Mercenaries. Thank you for coming to our rescue.

Start.text: My sister is a great Scholar. She's allowed to pass through the gate, but she can't tell me what she's doing there. I probably wouldn't understand anyway.
Now that those goody-two-shoes know that an entire garrison is hiding here, you can bet they'll be back.

Next1.text: The Inquisition believes that every closed door hides a heresy. Just imagine what theyll think when they see the size of this one! Good thing you drove them back!

Next2.text: We may require your services again in the future, so don't stray too far from Drombach. For everyones sake.

Wait.text: Don't bother asking me whats behind this gate, Im just standing guard here. I've never been to the other side, and from what I gather, itll never happen.

SettingLog.text: You stopped the Inquisition from reaching the Celestial Mountain Gate.

Start.text: There we go, the gate is open.

Next1.text: It was no mean feat, but nothing can stand in the way of the Inquisitions determination.

Next2.text: After you, Mercenaries! Let us find out what the heretics are hiding and carry out the will of the God of Light!

Start.text:
Remember what you saw in the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.
This countys Scholars know no bounds. What theyre doing up there is probably worse than you can imagine.
Opening this gate was difficult, but I did it, as promised.
Do you think they wanted to take the artefact from the Tomb atop the mountain?
It is highly possible that the victims of the Eye's Reckoning in Drombach deserved their fate.
What...?

Next1.text: The gate is open! The Inquisition got in!

Next2.text: Quickly! We have to stop them before they put an end to our research!

MissionDesc.text: Climb the stairs at the Celestial Mountain Gate and stop the Inquisition.

Start.text: I can't take their quarrelling any more. Now I even have to sleep next to them so that they won't kill each other!

EndOne.text:
Good riddance! I was this close to blowing up and banging their heads together.
I owe you a beer for your troubles.

EndTwo.text:
You took both of them? By Jeru, youre brave...
Or you have no idea what youre getting into.

Wait.text: Good luck, you're going to need it.

line0.text: Hire Heleth or Gunbald to take a load off the jails wardens.

Start.text: I can't believe I wasted five years of my life with you!

Next1.text: Wasted? Wasted? Some life that was! We didn't even have a roof over our heads.

Next2.text: But at least we weren't stuck behind bars!

Next3.text: Oh! Sorry I had too much ambition for you.

Next4.text: Shut up, dammit! Those fifteen lashes werent enough?

Start.text: All I want is to never see Gunbald again! Doesnt matter where youre going.

Gunbald.text: I really want to get out of here, but dont count on me to make up with this degenerate.

Start.text: Ill follow anyone, as long as Heleth isn't coming.

Heleth.text:
Heleth is with you?
All right, but I cant promise I wont strangle her in her sleep.

Start.text:
Sorry, but were not taking anyone else in. Inquisition orders.
They say all criminals need to be burnt to appease the Eye.

Next1.text: Heleth and Gunbald are the only ones left. Even the Inquisition didn't want them.

Recruited.text:
Sorry, but were not taking anyone else in. Inquisition orders.
They say all criminals need to be burnt to appease the Eye.

Start.text: We're taking in <inf>outlaws</inf> again! Knock yourselves out, I have a jail to fill!

Deliver.text: It won't be hard for your scoundrel to find a new master. The demand for slaves is higher than ever since the Inquisition left.

NoSlotAvailable.text: You've done so well, the Jail is now full!

Start.text: I'm so proud of what we've accomplished.

Next1.text: You've left your mark on Drombach.

Start.text:
So many buildings need to be rebuilt!
I deserve a little break now and again.
We haven't seen our foreman nor our owner in a while.

Next1.text: I'm not going to work if I don't have to.

Start.text:
I was a Bandit before becoming a slave,
got caught stealing horses.

Next1.text: At least I'm glad it happened before the Inquisition arrived. Criminals are burned at the stake nowadays.

Start.text: Our master freed us. All of a sudden, he let us go just like that.

Next1.text: The others left, but I decided to stay on the condition that I get paid. The mines protect us from the cold and the Eye's Reckoning.

Start.text: Mine to your heart's content, I won't stop you.

Next1.text: This place belongs to our owner, not to us. Do whatever you want with his rocks.

line0.text: Fight the creature behind the sealed door.

line1.text: Decide between the Scholar and the Inquisitor.

Start.text: You feel a draught coming from this wall.
The statues head is covered with a thick layer of dust.
The writing beneath the statue was defaced with a chisel.
Something tried to bite you in the dark!
This fresco was vandalised.
Stone gives way to emptiness, and darkness swallows the light of your torches. The path seems to stop here.

A stone bridge appeared, but its too short to lead anywhere.
There must be a way to extend it.
The way is blocked on the other side.
These creatures were devoured by something much bigger.
Remnants of old tools lay next to the skeleton, including a hammer and a chisel.
This part of the wall can rotate. Someone strong enough should be able to move it.

line0.props.tipText: Have a strong Companion rotate the wall.

line1.props.tipText: Slip through the gap.
line1.props.disableReason: There are one or more large animals in your group that cannot make it through.

Sneak.text: Your Companions slip through the gap one by one.

Start.text: Are you sure you want to open this door?
Viviane was consumed by darkness! Consumed!
Do not open this door! Do not let it out!
This Inquisitor sacrificed himself so that I could reach the <narrator>lever</narrator> and shut the door. Without him, none of us would have survived.

Next1.text: I gave him a remedy, but he needs time to recover.

End.text: The others have already left. We will join them as soon as the Inquisitor is stable.

Start.text: In the name of Jeru and the God of Light, you will answer my question, Scholar!

Next1.text: What was that abomination protecting?

Next2.text: You wouldn't understand even if I told you, you zealot!

Start.text: Did the Prince send you? Youve shown up at a good time, Mercenaries. Perhaps you can get us out of this mess.

Next1.text: Our objective is on the other side of this door, but these foolish Inquisitors attracted a monster. Its a miracle we managed to escape with our lives!

Next2.text: Its a miracle we followed you! Without my mens sacrifice, you would all be dead!

Next3.text: If you hadn't been snooping around, you wouldn't have set off the trap! And the relic would be in our hands!

Next4.text: So it is a relic youre looking for! What for? Answer me!

Alt0.text: Youve shown up at a good time, Mercenaries. Perhaps you can get us out of this mess.

Alt1.text: Our objective is on the other side of this door, but these foolish Inquisitors attracted a monster. Its a miracle we managed to escape with our lives!

Alt2.text: Its a miracle we followed you! Without my mens sacrifice, you would all be dead!

Alt3.text: If you hadn't been snooping around, you wouldn't have set off the trap! And the relic would be in our hands!

Alt4.text: So it is a relic youre looking for! What for? Answer me!

MissionDesc.text: Use the lever and defeat the monster.

Start.text: The door is blocked by some sort of mechanism.
You can hear a huge creature roaming in the dark.
By Saint Jeru! You fight like a soldier, Scholar!

Next1.text:
You handle yourself just as well, Inquisitor.
I thought I was watching Saint Eleor herself.

Next2.text: The Inquisitor and the Scholar are busy congratulating each other.

MissionDesc.text: Choose whom to give the relic of the Drombach Tomb to.

Start.text: I really hope this relic is a useless trinket and that you didn't just doom the whole county.

Oh no, the <narrator>relic</narrator>!...
Is it still in one piece?

Next1.text:
What a strange object...
It looks like...

Next2.text: The Eye, indeed. We believe this is how the Ancients depicted the God of Light.

Next3.text: Based on writings that we managed to decipher, they already knew about the Eyes Reckoning. This relic could help us stop it.

Next4.text:
Wait.
What did you just say?

Next4bis.text: If this relic can be used to communicate with God, then its a sacred artefact! Meaning it rightfully belongs to the Edoranian Church. Give it to me!

Next5.text:
Mercenaries! No!
It may be our only chance to stop the Eyes Reckoning!

Next6.text:
They can't be trusted!
Leaving such an artefact in the hands of heathens would only worsen the wrath of the God of Light.

line0.props.tipText: Give the relic to the Professor.

line1.props.tipText: Give the relic to the Inquisitor.

Inquisition1.text:
By Saint Septimus, you had me worried!
For a moment there, I thought you were going to give the relic to this miscreant!

Inquisition2.text: Trust me, you made the right choice. Tonight, the relic will depart for the Holy City where it will be stored in a safe place, away from heretics.

Inquisition3.text: Now lets go. Were done here.

SettingLogInquisition.text: You handed the relic over to the Inquisition.

Scholars1.text: Thank you, Mercenaries. Your decision probably saved Drombach.

Scholars2.text: I promise to dedicate my life to understanding this artefact, no matter how long it takes.

Scholars3.text:
Lets go.
I will store the relic in a safe place, as far as possible from the Inquisition.

SettingLogScholars.text: You handed the relic over to the Scholar.

EndScholar.text: I don't have enough men left to fight you, but trust that the Inquisition will know about your sacrilege. You can count on it.

Start.text: One of your Companion trips over a soft heap lying on the ground.
The door is locked.
Light the brazier?

Accept.text: Some of the statues in this clay battalion are different from others...

Start.text: The inscription reads General Mehyt.
Suddenly, your torches light up a monstrous face.

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Drombach Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Professor Hadwige.

Start.text: I purchased all of these fine goods in the heart of Ludern. They are most efficient, trust me!
Ludern Mercenaries! Perfect timing, I have something to show you!

Next1.text:
I've been studying the relics we collected, and I discovered that the Ancients knew about the Beast and its Pack.
They left enough instructions for me to create this!

Next2.text: It's just a prototype, but the first tests were quite promising!

Start.text:
Well, well, if it isn't our dear camp hands from Harag.
Your group has made good progress since we last met.

Next1.text: I am pleased to inform you that the same can be said of our research. Thanks to you and the relics found in the Ludern Tomb, our knowledge of the Beast and the Ghost Pack has made great strides.

Next2.text:
The Kingdom of Alazar no longer needs the Trackers, we can now hunt the Ghost Pack on our own.
That being said, you can still join us, for old time's sake.

Accept.text: You'll see that our methods are similar to what those savages were doing. We simply rationalised the process. You should talk to dear Winfrith, he's very proud of his work.

Wait.text: Exterminating the Ghost Pack is one thing, but doing it quickly while avoiding casualties is another challenge entirely.

End1.text: You see? Our information is as reliable as the Trackers'. We even managed to replicate their so-called ancestral techniques and to create armour layers.

End2.text: I hope youll like it. Winfrith put his heart into it.

Final.text: Feel free to visit us any time. Its always a pleasure to see you.

TrackIP1.text:
Well, well, if it isn't our dear camp hands from Harag.
Your group has made good progress since we last met.

TrackIP2.text: I am pleased to inform you that the same can be said of our research. Thanks to you and the relics found in the Ludern Tomb, our knowledge of the Beast and the Ghost Pack has made great strides.

TrackIP3.text:
The Kingdom of Alazar no longer needs the Trackers, we can now hunt the Ghost Pack on our own.
That being said, you can still join us, for old time's sake.

TrackDone1.text:
Well, well, if it isn't our dear camphands from Harag.
Your group has made good progress since we last met.

TrackDone2.text: I am pleased to inform you that the same can be said of our research. Thanks to you and the relics found in the Ludern Tomb, our knowledge of the Beast and the Ghost Pack has made great strides.

TrackDone3.text:
The Kingdom of Alazar no longer needs the Trackers, we can now hunt the Ghost Pack on our own.
But since you went ahead and did it anyway, please accept a reward as a token of our gratitude.

TrackFinished1.text:
Well, well, if it isn't our dear camphands from Harag.
Your group has made good progress since we last met.

TrackFinished2.text: I am pleased to inform you that the same can be said of our research. Thanks to you and the relics found in the Ludern Tomb, our knowledge of the Beast and the Ghost Pack has made great strides.

TrackFinished3.text: The Kingdom of Alazar no longer needs the Trackers, we can now hunt the Ghost Pack on our own.

Start.text: Set on fire?
There is something behind this boulder.
There is something written on the gravestone.

line0.props.tipText: Scholar Companion required.
line0.props.disableReason: Scholar Companion required.

Next1.text: The inscription reads: Dose who drunk saloot you. Though puzzled, your Companion spots a small object in the dirt.

Start.text: All Rouste matches are cancelled until further notice.

Next1.text: We found ancient relics on the pitch, and we won't let a bunch of yokels step on them.

Antiquity1.text: You found an artefact! By the Beast's fangs, you must analyse it right away! It could be the key to this mystery!

End1.text:
So, Mercenaries? What did you find out about the artefact?
Is it a sword? A key? A trinket, perhaps?

End2.text: By the Beast's fangs! The little fiends!

End3.text: Call off the search! This bloody corkscrew is proof that the whole thing was a prank. Probably from the Laboratory alumni... It's the third time this year!

End4.text: Well, since we're here, we might as well make use of the place. If you want to play Rouste against our team, let me know.

Rouste1.text: But be warned, the players of the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory's team are highly skilled.

Rouste3.text:
Your approach of the game is so innovative that I had to take notes.
Here's your reward, with the compliments of the best minds in Drombach.

Rouste4.text: If you agree to a rematch, I believe we'll show you that we've learned from our defeat.

RousteDiff1.text: Our Scholars still need to blow off steam after being humiliated by our students.

line0.props.tipText: Play Drombach's team in Hard mode.

RousteDiff3.text:
You're merciless, Mercenaries!
The reward is yours. I hope you'll enjoy it, it's the last one we have.

RousteEnd1.text: If you wish to challenge our Scholars again, don't expect a reward, you've already won them all.

line0.props.tipText: Play Drombach's team in Hard mode.

RousteEnd3.text: I hope our players will learn from your techniques!

line0.text: Inspect the gravestone found on the Rouste Pitch in Drombach.

line1.text: Inspect the Treasure of the Ancients found near the Rouste Pitch gravestone.

line2.text: Talk to Professor Marah.

line0.text: Win a Rouste match in Drombach.

Start.text: I can't make sense of this gravestone. Something's not right.

Next1.text: I fell for it hook, line and sinker.

Start.text:
We'd been digging here for days.
I need to play Rouste to vent my frustration.
How about a match against our team?

Next1.text: I'm in no hurry to return to the Laboratory. When the others learn we were fooled by our students...

Start.text: I was travelling through the region when I heard about the Rouste Pitch reopening! I couldn't miss it!
Heavy rains revealed this site in the fall. To think we were playing Rouste over a secret Tomb!
I can't believe we're about to uncover an unknown site...

line0.text: Find the bandits lurking on the road to the <narrator>Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory</narrator>.

Start.text: Its hard to focus with a Princess sobbing in your ears.

Next1.text: She claims that she was attacked by bandits <narrator>on the road to the Laboratory</narrator>. But if you ask me, I bet her escort was struck by the Eyes Reckoning.

Next2.text: Shes lying because shes scared the Inquisition will come after her.

End.text:
You killed cannibals? Sends a shiver down my spine, it does.
No wonder the Eyes Reckoning is upon us.

Start.text: Youve got to help me! Please!

Next1.text: Wish I could, m'lady. But I'm just a farmer, not a warrior. Best I can do is take you to the village or the castle.

Next2.text:
Then it will be too late!
Those men took my husband. By the time we reach Hulburg, he will be dead.

Next3.text: Dont worry, Princess. Your husband is a nobleman, theyll demand a ransom, for sure...

Next4.text:
They were not ordinary bandits! They slaughtered our escort!
If theyre still lurking <narrator>around the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory</narrator>, its only a matter of time before they prey upon other travellers!

MissionDesc.text: Save the innkeeper.

MissionDescInquisition.text: Take the innkeeper to the High Inquisitor.

MissionDescPrince.text: Take the innkeeper back to Lady Mayoress Gerslind.

line0.text: Rescue the innkeeper from the bears.

line1.text: Decide the innkeepers fate.

Start.text: Why? Why did you save me?

Next1.text: The Eye sent those bears to kill me! I deserve to die after I dared survive His Reckoning!

Next2.text:
I'm a heretic! I have slaves! I made a fortune on my neighbours backs! I didn't go to church...
Everything thats happening to me is my own fault!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the innkeeper to go back to <narrator>New-Asthel</narrator>.

line1.props.tipText: Offer to take the innkeeper to the <narrator>Inquisition</narrator> to be executed.

Convinced1.text:
If... If the townsfolk think I'm a true believer, then it must be true, right?
Maybe the Eyes Reckoning was targeting someone else? My slacker of a slave, for instance...

Convinced2.text:
Yes! Its his fault, not mine!
I won't sacrifice myself for that heretic. <narrator>Take me back to the Lady Mayoress of New-Asthel!</narrator>

Suggest1.text: You... You think it could save my soul? Oh! Mercenaries! I can't be doomed to wander for all eternity!

Suggest2.text: If there is the slightest chance for me to join the Light, I'll do anything, even meet with the High Inquisitor.

Start.text: If this man really is the innkeeper, he's in a tight spot.

line0.text: Take the redeemed bandit to Saint Serene Church.

Start.text:
Kill me if you want. I wont try to stop you.
Now that my outlaw days are behind me, I refuse to fight.

Next1.text: My former colleagues were struck down by the <narrator>Eyes Reckoning</narrator> while crossing the Pitta Bridge. That was a wake-up call for me.

Next2.text: If you want to help, take me to <narrator>Saint Serene Church</narrator> in <narrator>New-Asthel</narrator>. I wish to confess my sins to the priestess and take the cloth myself.

line0.props.tipText: Take the bandit to Saint Serene Church in New-Asthel.

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Drombach Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Belecos.

line3.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Brighid.

line4.text: Report your victory to Professor Hadwige.

Start.text: War paints have a meaning that foreign eyes cannot perceive.

Next1.text: Only those who have been to the Tules' Glade in Ludern and followed the teachings of a druid can wear them.

Tatoo1.text:
I see that you are worthy of wearing our war paints. Have a seat.
Who among your Companions wants one?

Tatoo2.text: Does anyone else among your Companions want an ornament?

Start.text: The people of Drombach have their hands full dealing with the Eye's Reckoning, so we're handling the Ghost Pack to try and ease their burden.

Next1.text: Youre welcome to give us a hand if you so wish. Some of my Trackers were devoured, others struck by lightning during our latest hunt.

Accept.text: I hope this information will be of use to you. Be careful.

Wait.text: This pack is vicious, I hope you know what youre doing.

End1.text:
Ah, Mercenaries!
It appears your valiant efforts made quite an impression. Some merchants stopped by the camp to tell us of your deeds.

End2.text: Congratulations, this armour layer is yours.

Final.text: As soon as I learn anything new about the Ghost Pack, you'll be the first to know.

Start.text:
The people of Drombach have been trading with us since the Eyes Reckoning first appeared.
They must be afraid of travelling to New-Asthel.

You?
Mercenaries! Do you remember us? You helped us take down the Scholars in the <narrator>Ludern Tomb</narrator>!
I didnt think we'd meet again! Deep in enemy territory, of all places.

Next1.text: I wish I could say weve been living happily since you left, but... The Scholars intrusion has enraged the clans. We were sent here to retrieve relics stolen by Alazar over the years.

Next2.text: Officially, were hunting the Ghost Pack, but our real mission takes up all of our time. Maybe you could help us keep up that pretence.

Accept.text: The Eye's Reckoning will probably make things harder for you. Talk to Lerina, she's got something to give you.

Wait.text: How's your gear? Talk to Lerina, if you haven't already.

End1.text:
I knew it. You defeated the Ghost Pack!
Nothing unexpected from those who faced the Beast and lived to tell the tale!

End2.text: I hope this enhancement will demonstrate just how grateful we are for your help. Thanks to you, we can focus on our real mission.

TrackIP1.text:
You?
Mercenaries! Do you remember us? You helped us take down the Scholars in the <narrator>Ludern Tomb</narrator>!
I didnt think we'd meet again! Deep in enemy territory, of all places.

TrackIP2.text: I wish I could say weve been living happily since you left, but... The Scholars intrusion has enraged the clans. We were sent here to retrieve relics stolen by Alazar over the years.

TrackIP3.text:
Officially, we're hunting the Ghost Pack, but our real mission takes up all of our time.
Good thing you're taking care of the monsters yourself, helps us keep up the pretence. Talk to Lerina, she'll help you.

TrackDone1.text:
You?
Mercenaries! Do you remember us? You helped us take down the Scholars in the <narrator>Ludern Tomb</narrator>!

TrackDone1bis.text: You didnt waste any time! I heard you killed the Ghost Pack in Drombach?

TrackDone2.text: You have no idea how relieved we are. But first, let me give you the enhancement you deserve.

TrackDone3.text: I wish I could say weve been living happily since you left Ludern, but... The Scholars intrusion has enraged the clans. We were sent here to retrieve relics stolen by Alazar over the years.

TrackDone4.text: Officially, were hunting the Ghost Pack, but our real mission takes up all of our time. Good thing you got rid of the monsters for us, or our subterfuge would have been uncovered.

TrackFinished1.text:
You?
Mercenaries! Do you remember us? You helped us take down the Scholars in the <narrator>Ludern Tomb</narrator>!
I didnt think we'd meet again! Deep in enemy territory, of all places.

TrackFinished2.text: I wish I could say weve been living happily since you left, but... The Scholars intrusion has enraged the clans. We were sent here to retrieve relics stolen by Alazar over the years.

TrackFinished3.text:
Officially, were hunting the Ghost Pack, but our real mission takes up all of our time.
Good thing you got rid of the monsters for us, or our subterfuge would have been uncovered.

Start.text: Alazar angered the gods because of all the Ancient Tombs they plundered. Even their own! They definitely deserved the Reckoning!

Next1.text: The consequences of their actions extend far beyond what they imagine. Our druids were able to gain a better understanding of the Beast after it was drawn to Ludern. They gave us an advantage that will come back to bite them.

Next2.text: Take this axe, it was made to kill Pack monsters more efficiently than any other weapon. Instead of destroying us, the Scholars made us stronger.

Reward.text: Harag is much less vulnerable to the Ghost Pack than before, all thanks to Alazar. Ironic, isn't it?

Start.text: I would cut off my own arm if it could take me back to Ludern.
Its good to see familiar faces in this hostile land.
Senuna wasn't eager to follow Brighid here, but I think shes adapting quite well.

Sister.text: I thought I told you not to show your faces here again!

Start.text: I said no! I'm not taking on any mission until I get my risk bonus.

Next1.text: I became a mercenary to fight bandits and serve lords. Being struck down by a god wasnt part of the plan!

Start.text: Its hard to focus on training when you know that the God of Light is lurking nearby...

Next1.text: I keep jumping at shadows, dont you?

Start.text:
This region is extremely dangerous. I hope your group is well-trained.
If not, I can help.

Respec.text: I'm pretty sure youll find this useful.

Start.text: Waltraud was under too much pressure when she was the arena champion.

Next1.text: We decided to start a new life elsewhere, but I think we didn't move far enough.

Start.text:
How far must I go to find peace? Leave my mountain, now!
If I still wanted to sign my fans' shields, I would've stayed in the valley!

Next1.text:
Oh? That's not why you're here?
Well then... erm...

Next2.text: Sorry for snapping at you, Mercenaries. I thought you were fans. Some of them are willing to brave the blizzard and the Eye's Reckoning to try and convince me to go back...

Next2Bis.text:
But it's because of them that I left!
You can't imagine the pressure I was under. I had to win all of my fights and always be entertaining so that the audience would get their money's worth, and if I happened to lose... It was...

Next3.text:
Help me escape from them! Entertain them for me and earn glory in the arena so that they'll remember your names instead of mine.
Help me live in peace, and I'll teach you everything I know.

End1.text:
Did you beat Lisbeth in the arena?
Did the audience cheer for you? Enough to forget about me?

End2.text: Oh! Blessed be the Eye! I'll finally be rid of my fans! As a token of my gratitude, let me teach you everything I learned during my years as champion.

End3.text: Now that we're done, please leave me alone.

line0.text: Return to the former champion after completing Lisbeth's Arena.

Start.text: <narrator>This dragon skeleton is not how you imagined.</narrator>

line0.text: Take on Professor Grind's mission.

line1.text: Catch 3 live Plague-ridden subjects and take them to Professor Grind.

line0.text: Meet Professor Grind at the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.

line1.text: Contain the Plague-ridden until the reinforcements arrive.

line2.text: Report to the Inquisitor.

Start.text: I trust you know that it is considered heresy to experiment on live Plague-ridden subjects...

Next1.text: I do not like what youre implying, Inquisitor! This laboratory is as conscientious as can be. Our experiments dutifully follow the precepts of the Light.

Next2.text: Am I supposed to believe that Plague-ridden spawned out of thin air inside your library?

Next3.text: They attacked from the outside! They probably fled the cursed village because of the Eyes Reckoning and...

Next4.text: Sure they did.

Next5.text:
Mercenaries.
I want the truth. What did you see?

line0.props.tipText: Tell the truth.

line1.props.tipText: Hide the truth.

Truth2.text: You and your subordinates are under arrest, Professor. Your profane experiments will be destroyed or seized by the Edoranian Church.

Truth3.text: As for you, Mercenaries, it is my pleasure to give you this reward. The Inquisition owes you a great debt...

AcceptTruth1.text: Weve been wanting to inspect this place for years. Not only to appease the God of Light, but also to find out how far along the Plague cure is...

AcceptTruth2.text: Edoran fears that they were conducting research zealously in an effort to make the Alazarian army impervious to the Plague.

SettingLog.text: You reported Professor Grinds experiments.

EndTruth.text: I had the Professor and his surviving colleagues sent to the Inquisition camp. Thanks to you, they will be burned at the stake as they should be. Congratulations.

Lie1.text: Really? So they really did attack from the outside.

Lie2.text: I have to admit that Im quite surprised by your confirmation. The scene around us seems to indicate otherwise.

Lie3.text: So be it... I have no choice but to trust you. But if the Eyes Reckoning strikes this laboratory, I will know you lied to me.

EndLie.text: It will come as no surprise that I dont find your story very convincing.

Start.text:
Mercenaries, youre amazing!
You've saved all of Sophy Adr Alazars legacy.

Next1.text: Take this. We usually give it only to the best Scholars, but you deserve it.

Next3.text:
Count on me to continue my research.
Everyone in Alazar will soon be immune to the Plague. We will then have a major advantage over our enemies. We will turn this scourge into a blessing for our kingdom!

SettingLog.text: You covered Professor Grinds experiments.

Start.text:
It was a massacre.
They didn't stand a chance against the Plague-ridden.
Heretics dont deserve prayers, so I'm trying to be discreet.
Prince Aerald asked me to translate an Ancient text, but it's by far the most complicated I've had to study in my entire career.

Next1.text: It seems to be some kind of instruction manual filled with technical terms. And... I think some words are missing. I wonder where he found it.

Start.text: Apologies, but Professor Grinds laboratory is sealed off.
You look well-travelled.

Next1.text: I have here a most important letter that must be delivered in person to my counterpart in Gosenberg.

Next2.text:
This letter details my latest research, discoveries that could change the way we see our world!
Do you feel capable of carrying something so precious?

Accept.text:
Excellent.
You will find my colleague in Gosenberg City, in Grinmeer Province.
She will have your payment.

End1.text: So? Did you deliver my letter?

End2.text: What did she say? Let me guess! Was she amazed?

Wait.text: My name will still be remembered in a hundred years.

line0.text: Take on the astronomers mission.

line1.text: Deliver the Drombach astronomers letter to his counterpart in Grinmeer.

Start.text: The dean refuses to fund my expeditions. "You might as well hunt groattles, Professor Maurith," she says.

Next1.text:
But I'm not hunting groattles! <narrator>Dragons</narrator> did exist!
If she'd just let me explore those blasted caves, I'd finally get her proof!

Next3.text:
What if you went for me?
Ill give you whatever profits your discoveries yield as payment. All I want is to prove that old crone wrong!

Next4.text:
We will do great things together!
I've already listed the locations you need to inspect, three caves where you stand the best chance of finding dragon bones!

Accept.text: Explore the <narrator>Great Growler Grotto</narrator> in Arthes, the <narrator>Great Growler Cave</narrator> in Grinmeer and the <narrator>Fatclaw Cave</narrator> in Ludern.

Bones2.text: I can't believe you found them!

Bones3.text: I knew there was something in that cave!

End1.text: Excellent! Mercenaries, thanks to your efforts, I am well on my way to becoming the greatest expert of pre-Jeru fauna.

End2.text: Stay here. I'm going to arrange the bones into a complete dragon skeleton.

End3.text: Lets see... That one goes here, this one there...

End4.text: Oh dear... What is this thing?

Final1.text:
Are you waiting for your reward?
Ahem! What you brought me isnt a dragon, so I'm not sure you deserve anything.

Final2.text: Oh, fine! Here's your reward. And now, go away. I don't need an audience when the dean comes and laughs in my face.

Wait.text: By Jeru, what is this supposed to be?

MissionArthesCave.text: Find the dragon bones buried in the cave.

MissionGrinmeerCave.text: Find the dragon bones buried in the cave.

MissionLudernCave.text: Find the dragon bones buried in the cave.

line0.text: Dig in the <narrator>Great Growler Grotto</narrator> in Arthes, the <narrator>Great Growler Cave</narrator> in Grinmeer and <narrator>Fatclaw Cave</narrator> in Ludern, then bring your findings to Professor Maurith.

Start.text: I can't focus on my research.

Next1.text: I heard that a Broker was murdered in Gosenberg. I hope my mother is all right...

Start.text: I volunteered to take part in Professor Grinds experiments, but my application was rejected.

Next1.text: Now Im doomed to study medicine like a mere village apothecary.

A1UniversityBookshelf.npc.name: The History of Tiltren, by Jaffrey of Stromkapp

Start.text: <narrator>The sole purpose of this book is to return our beautiful County of Tiltren to its rightful place among the Five Kingdoms.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>I mean to make copies of my writings, and promptly send them to the universities and laboratories of Alazar, Edoran and Gosenberg, whose so-called Scholars have not deigned to add even the slightest mention of our lands in their chronicles!</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>Yet it is the invasion of Tiltren by General Edor's army that led to all of the others, and even though it lasted only a few days, our county was occupied by a foreign kingdom for over fifty years... </narrator>

Start.text: So youre looking for the New-Asthel innkeeper?

Next1.text: How do I know youre not working for the Inquisition? And that you won't burn the man the minute you get your hands on him?

line0.props.tipText: Threaten to fetch the Inquisition immediately.

line1.props.tipText: Use force to make him talk.

Threat1.text: Zealots like you make me sick.

Threat2.text: The poor sod must be dead by now, anyway. Have fun burning his dead body.

Threat3.text: We saw him head toward the peak in the middle of a snow storm, without fire or any gear. The cold probably did him in.

Attack1.text:
All right! I surrender!
Blasted zealots!

Attack2.text: The innkeeper headed towards the mountain peak. He didnt want to stay here despite the blizzard.

Attack3.text: I bet hes already dead. And considering what the Inquisition has in store for him, its probably best.

Wait.text: Youre here to check out the border? Beyond the mountains is Edoran. The road is pretty much impassable in winter, but invaders have tried to cross over when the weather warms up.

MissionDesc.text: Track down the innkeeper in this area.

line0.text: Question the Valiant Tower soldiers.

Start.text:
The New-Asthel innkeeper?
What do you want from him? Did the Inquisition send you?

Next2.text: Hmpf! I see...

Next4.text:
If you really want to know, our sentries saw your innkeeper. He was running as if the Beast was after him, straight towards the peak.
With no gear or supplies, hes probably dead by now.

Wait.text: Youre here to check out the border? Edoran is just over the mountain. The road is long and treacherous, but that didn't deter invasion attempts.

MissionDesc.text: Track down the innkeeper in this area.

Start.text: Have we met before?

Next1.text: Wait! Captain, I remember!

Next2.text:
Theyre the Mercenaries who <narrator>helped Lady Brunhilde escape from Vertruse</narrator>.
They can be trusted.

End.text:
Lady Brunhilde Adr Alazar went back to the capital to mull over her failure.
But dont worry about her, that old crone is nothing if not resourceful.

Start.text: Why bother guarding the Edoran border when the Inquisition is already walking our lands?

The Eye's Reckoning seems to strike less frequently here, doesn't it?
Probably because there are fewer people, therefore less heresy.

line0.text: Sleep in the haunted castle.

line1.text: Defeat the Harag spirits.

line2.text: Investigate the escaped spirit.

Start.text: Those Harag spirits look vicious.
Leave while you still can, Mercenaries. Maybe the evil spirits of this place havent spotted you yet!

Next1.text: This castle has been haunted since my ancestor left to wage war in the faraway land of Harag only to bring back this curse with him.

Next2.text:
Monsters appear when night falls.
As soon as I dare fall asleep, they swarm the castle to wreak havoc and try to kill me. Others came to help me, but none of them survived...

Start.text: What happened?

I'll tell you the truth.
I'm not a Harag spirit. It was just a disguise...

Next1.text: I made up the whole story to be able to destroy my ancestors castle. After enough people had died and gone missing, the Prince would have accepted my request.

Next2.text: Drombach forbids the destruction of buildings dating back to the time when Alazar was still called the Northern Kingdom. But with the old pile still standing, how can I mine the rimesteel deposits that lie below?

Next3.text: Here, take this as thanks for not killing me when you had the chance. I would have deserved to die.

Accept.text: Your Companion is right here, you can take them back.

End.text: I hope we can all put this adventure behind us soon.

Start.text: Fear! Fear the wrath of Harag!

line0.props.tipText: Threaten the Harag spirit.

line1.props.tipText: Convince the Harag spirit to tell the truth.

Wanted.text: You unleashed the wrath of Harag.

Start.text: Choose a Companion who will sleep in the bed.

What are you doing? No!
You promised to take me to the Inquisition!
We're on high alert: the Inquisition is becoming increasingly resolute.

EndInquisition.text: Do you really think the Inquisition will burn the Prince at the stake? I mean... He's a Prince!

EndPrince.text:
The Inquisition is gone! Gone!
Its such a relief to see their empty camp, I never tire of it.

Start.text: I feel like I cant take a single step without being questioned by an Inquisitor.

EndInquisition.text: It feels strange to guard an empty throne... Gives me the creeps.

EndCorene.text: Turns out its a Gosenberg lady whos leading Drombach... I thought it was supposed to be the other way around.

EndPrince.text:
Can you believe it?
Soon the Prince will control the God of Light!
Its such an honour to serve a man like him!

Start.text: The Prince stopped paying attention to the women I introduce to him! This Divine Reckoning and Inquisition business is distracting him from his main duty.

Next1.text: He may be young, but given the infant mortality rate in our kingdom, he must start producing descendants as soon as possible.

EndInquisition.text: We have to wait for the King to appoint a new governor... I hope he won't take too long.

Start.text: Well I'll be!

Next1.text: You have some nerve to show your face here after what you did!

Next2.text: Do not talk to me again or I will have my new husband quarter you on the spot!

End.text: Do you have a death wish?

Start.text: Drombach is mine to rule since my husband's arrest.

Next1.text: Fate is a strange and unpredictable thing...

Start.text: Well, well... Look whos here.

Next1.text: I had a feeling the woes befalling our region would attract your ilk.

Next2.text: If I could afford to, I'd send you back where you came from, but it so happens that I need people like you: discreet and daring.

Next3.text: The most brilliant minds of this county are headed toward the Tomb of the Ancients. I want you to join them there and protect them from the creatures roaming the ruins.

Next4.text:
One more thing, Mercenaries.
If I'm entrusting you with this mission, its not because I like hiring sellswords. I expect you to be more discreet than my soldiers. Under no circumstance should you draw the Inquisitions attention.

MissionInquisition.text: My Scholars told me what you did in the Tomb. You gave the Inquisition an invaluable relic. That was a terrible mistake.

MissionPrince.text: My Scholars are already working on the Tombs relic and making good progress. Its just a shame the Inquisition heard about it...

Final1.text: Were about to leave the castle. You almost missed us, Mercenaries.

Final2.text: We need to go to the <narrator>Celestial Mountain Gate</narrator> without delay. According to our spies, the Inquisition is sending most of their troops there. I guess they got tired of asking me permission to get in...

Final3.text: I need you, Mercenaries. I need all men and women who believe that only Knowledge can save us from the Eyes Reckoning. If the Inquisition passes the Celestial Mountain Gate, Drombach is doomed.

FinalAccept.text:
Lets go!
Go on ahead, Ill meet you there with my soldiers.

EndPrince.text: Research is progressing apace, Mercenaries. I hope to see results before I die.

MissionDesc1.text: Look for the Scholars in the Drombach Tomb.

MissionDescEnd.text: Join Prince Aerald Adr Alazar at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

line0.text: Take on the Princes mission.

line1.text: Explore the Drombach Tomb and find the Scholars.

line0.text: Take on Prince Aerald Ald Alazar's mission at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
The closer you are to the Prince, the more suspicious the Inquisition gets.
You have no idea how many patrols come to check on me each day.

Repair.text: It wont protect you from the Eyes Reckoning, but it should do.

End.text: You think things will get better? Really?

Start.text: We'll go over the cliffs to cross the border. You should do the same, Mercenaries!

Next1.text:
<narrator>The Inquisition reigns supreme here.</narrator>
If you thought the Guard was ruthless, you're not ready for what the Inquisition has in store for you!

Next2.text: <narrator>Forget about jail. Here, thieves and murderers are burned at the stake!</narrator> Run before they spot you!

line0.props.tipText: Capture the Bandits to hand them over to the Inquisition.

line1.props.tipText: Let the Bandits go.

Start.text: Youre a bit skinny, but you'll do...
Turn back, Mercenaries. For your own safety. This mine is about to collapse.
Why is this man not tied up? Where are you taking him?

Next1.text:
To Saint Serene Church?
Are you out of your mind? This bandit must pay for his crimes!

line1.props.tipText: Hand over the bandit.

End.text:
I guess youre not completely crazy, after all.
From now on, dont believe outlaws and their false promises.

Start.text: Halt!

Next1.text:
This man with you dared survive the Eyes Reckoning. He must suffer the same fate as his accomplices.
Hand him over immediately!

line1.props.tipText: Hand over the bandit.

End.text: What you just did makes you cowards, but also true believers.

Start.text:
I dont sell my relics to just anyone.
I mean, just look at you, Mercenaries! All of your equipment combined isnt worth even one of my artefacts.

Next1.text:
Oh! Youre here to arrest me?
Youre welcome to try! I bet you won't manage to lay a hand on me.

Start.text: So, Mercenaries! Hiding in Alazar?

Next1.text:
Did you think the <narrator>Winfels</narrator> wouldn't look for you here?
Well, you thought wrong!

Next2.text:
Their terms are crystal clear: were to bring back either their dear <narrator>Corene</narrator>, or her captors' heads.
So? Where is she?

line0.props.tipText: Tell the Brotherhood that Corene married Prince Aerald Adr Alazar.

Corene1.text:
She married...
Wait a minute! What did you say?

Corene2.text:
Corene married an Alazarian Prince?
Now thats an unexpected development...

Corene3.text:
Well then... I suppose we should let the Winfel family know before continuing our mission.
Here, take this for your troubles.

Start.text: Murdering Brunhilde Adr Alazar wasn't enough for you? You had to come all the way here and prance about her kingdom?

Next1.text: Know that her father, the King, is furious. He offered us a hefty sum to find you.

Next2.text: Dont bother trying to run. We were in Vertruse when you killed her. We've seen your faces.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Brotherhood that you are not involved in the murder.

Brunehilde1.text:
Yeah... On second thought, we could be wrong.
As you say, there were a lot of Mercenaries in Gosenberg at the time.

Brunehilde2.text:
I guess well have to extend our search to regions surrounding Vertruse. Thanks for the tip.
Take this, as an apology for wrongfully accusing you.
No hard feelings, right?

Start.text: One of your Companions is turning into a wild beast, but their life isnt worth your Krowns?

Next1.text:
We have the solution!
Drawing upon ancient tradition and years of relentless research, my Companions and I have the means to solve all of your problems!

Next2.text: Behold, Mercenaries! Our revolutionary cure for the Plague: the Homeopill!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the charlatans to leave the kingdom before Mercenaries go after them.

Convinced1.text:
The Scholars put a bounty on our heads?
Are you sure?

Convinced2.text: I knew they valued medicine highly, but to send Mercenaries after us...!

Convinced3.text: You can keep the Homeopills, I don't want the border guards to catch us with the stuff.

Start.text:
Those slaves are convicted criminals! They must serve their sentence!
I order you to hand them over!

Next1.text: You dare claim that among the slaves your people buy, none are farmers kidnapped by Bandits?

Next2.text: It's up to the King of Alazar to prevent that! Not to a bunch of savages still caked in swamp mud.

Next3.text:
You there! Mercenaries!
Help us drive away those wretches. We'll pay you well.

Next5.text:
Don't believe anything they say, Mercenaries!
They can't admit that they're abducting farmers in other kingdoms!

Start.text:
I'm sorry.
We were supposed to watch your backs, but there were too many soldiers. Without your help, we would have all died.

Next1.text: This patrol was running towards the fishery. We had no choice but to attack them, or they would have caught you in the act and taken the slaves.

Next2.text:
Even though it didn't exactly go as planned, what matters is the result.
Please accept this reward, as well as our gratitude.

Accept.text: We're going back to the camp, but as soon as the weather allows, we'll run straight to Harag.

Start.text: How stupid do you have to be to come all the way from Harag on mere rumours!

Next1.text: The King of Alazar makes sure that slaves from other kingdoms bear proof of their conviction. Claiming otherwise is absurd!

Next2.text: Now that the problem is solved, we can return these slaves to their owners. Thank you for your cooperation, Mercenaries.

Start.text: I wonder how you found out they were coming this way...

Next1.text: But since you saved us, we'll call it a miracle! Come with me to the Celestial Mountain Gate, I have a reward for you.

Start.text: In the name of the Eye! Let us through, soldier!

Next1.text: This mountain is off limits, by order of Prince Aerald.

Next2.text: Do not oppose the will of the God of Light! Your Prince is just a man and...

Next3.text: And youre just an Inquisitor.

Next4.text: Is this funny to you?

Next5.text:
Mercenaries! These soldiers are heathens!
Theyre trying to hide the heresy taking place in this mountain. Fight by our side!

Next6.text:
Stop!
Mercenaries! Whats in this mountain is beyond their understanding. The Inquisitors must not pass.

Start.text: Good thing I brought reinforcements, right?

Next1.text: Now lets see what theyre hiding.

Peasants1.text: Its not a pretty sight. The pony pulling the cart seems to have exploded.

Peasants2.text: I wonder what these <narrator>farmers</narrator> did to deserve to die like this. Maybe they robbed a shrine on the way or insulted a priest.

Wolves1.text:
Are those... <narrator>wolves</narrator>?
Why would the Eye punish wolves?

Wolves2.text: It doesn't make any sense. Jerus precepts clearly state that animals cannot commit heresy.

Soldiers1.text:
<narrator>Alazarian soldiers</narrator>, no surprise here.
These men probably blasphemed or committed some kind of crime against the Eye.

Merchants1.text: Theres nothing left of these <narrator>merchants</narrator> wares. They could have been slavers or fur traders for all we know...

Merchants2.text: That said, slavery goes against the Eyes teachings, so it could be the reason for their death.

Next1.text: Lets not tarry.

Next2.text:
But I don't understand. These bodies are nothing like those we saw earlier...
We should keep going.

Next3.text: Could there be a connection with the other Reckonings? We studied three different occurrences, and they didn't seem to have anything in common. Its as if... as if... the Eye was striking at random.

Next4.text: No! Thats impossible. The God of Light does not punish without cause! There must be another explanation. We will get to the bottom of this!

End1.text: Maybe were not approaching the problem the right way. Lets consider these bodies as a whole.

End2.text: The number of victims and impacts left by the Eyes Reckoning seems to increase as we move toward the Celestial Mountain...

End3.text: There must be something there... Something especially heretical. I'll meet you there with reinforcements.

Start.text:
The innkeeper?
What do you want with him, Mercenaries?
Did those New-Asthel bumpkins ask you to find him?

Next1.text:
Infidels! I knew it!
Theyre hiding from us, trying to escape our scrutiny, but the Eye is already onto them. Their Reckoning draws near! Its coming!

Next2.text: Leave this cursed county, Mercenaries. Dont worry about the innkeeper, the Inquisition will deal with him and all of the other heathens in Drombach!

line0.props.tipText: Make up a pious reason.

line1.props.tipText: Use force to make her talk.

Convinced1.text:
Ah! If you want him to be executed, thats another story!
True believers have to stick together. I'll help you find him.

Convinced2.text: The night the Reckoning struck his tavern, we set off after him. But the wretch knew the area better than us! He gave us the slip and disappeared near <narrator>Valiant Tower</narrator>.

Start.text: All right! Calm down! We'll talk.

Next1.text: The innkeeper made for the mountain, straight to <narrator>Valiant Tower</narrator>. With no furs or cloak, he probably died on the way there.

Next2.text: May you share his fate, heathens!

Start.text: Sorry to make you come all the way here, Mercenaries. One can never be too careful with the Inquisition.

Next1.text: Ever since the <narrator>Eyes Reckoning</narrator> befell Drombach, these zealots have been watching our every move. Woe betide whoever they find suspicious.

Next2.text:
Our innkeeper ran away because of them: he had the misfortune to survive when his tavern was struck by the Eye.
He's a good man and we want to help him, so <narrator>we're willing to pay you to find him</narrator>.

Accept1.text: The night he disappeared, Inquisitor Clelia and her goons were watching the village. She might know something.

Refuse1.text: If you change your mind, I'll be on the market square.

MissionDesc.text: Question Inquisitor Clelia about the New-Asthel innkeeper.

End1.text: Oh, I can't wait to see him. Where is he?

End2.text:
Silric! I'm so happy! Mercenaries, you brought him back as promised!
Please accept this reward.

EndAccept.text: Dont worry about the village. We know how to hide our innkeeper from the Inquisition.

SettingLog.text: You handed the New-Asthel innkeeper over to Lady Mayoress Gerslind.

Start.text: Its a disaster!

Next1.text:
The Plague-ridden subjects broke out! They attacked my students, my colleagues, the professors...
The newly infected joined their ranks and things got out of hand.

Next2.text: I beg of you! You must help us until reinforcements arrive. If the Plague-ridden subjects get out, the whole county will be overrun!

line0.props.tipText: Fight the Plague-ridden.

Start.text: By Saint Jeru, that was a hard-won fight.

Next1.text:
Take a moment to catch your breath, you fought well.
We'll search the laboratory to make sure there are no Plague-ridden left.

Next2.text: Join us as soon as you can. I want you to tell me what happened.

Start.text: Please! Tell the Inquisitors that the Plague-ridden came from outside. They must not know that were studying live subjects. I beg of you, do it for the sake of Knowledge and all the people our cure could save.
I see the army didnt come alone. You couldn't help but follow!

Next1.text: The <narrator>Eyes Reckoning</narrator> struck these stables. We are duty-bound to inspect the place and make sure that no heretics survived.

Next2.text: Move along, everyones dead.

Next3.text:
Dead? Nonsense!
You wouldnt call the Alazarian army to bury dead bodies.

Next4.text: These men came to rescue injured people. Heretics! You know full well that the God of Light does not punish without cause. If you let them live, the Eyes Reckoning will strike again!

Next5.text:
Theyre not heretics!
Mercenaries! You saw them, didn't you? Did those poor folks look like heathens?

Next6.text:
What they look like is irrelevant. The Eyes Reckoning does not smite innocents.
Mercenaries! All believers have a duty to carry out the will of the God of Light.

Start.text:
Thank you, Mercenaries.
Im grateful you didnt listen to those zealots lies.

Next1.text: For weeks, theyve been burning and torturing those who dare survive the <narrator>Eyes Reckoning</narrator>, but nothing has changed.

Next2.text: I dont know what angered the God of Light, but I doubt those poor sods have anything to do with it.

SettingLog.text: You let the Scholars save the stables owners.

Start.text: Praised be Jeru for sending you our way, Mercenaries.

Next1.text: Thanks to you, the heretics who lived here will be burnt at the stake to appease the God of Light. This reward is yours.

Next2.text: Don't ever be fooled by the Scholars lies again. The clemency they show heretics is the reason Drombach is beset by the Eyes Reckoning.

SettingLog.text: You let the Inquisition burn the stables occupants.

MissionDescInvestigation1.text: Talk to Inquisitor Emeria in the Inquisition Camp.

MissionDescRuins.text: Prince Aerald Adr Alazar has summoned you to his castle.

MissionDescInquisition.text: Enter the mountain and talk to Inquisitor Emeria.

MissionDescSoldier.text: Enter the Celestial Mountain and talk to Soldier Damen.

MissionDescInquisitionEnd.text: Meet with the High Inquisitor and listen to what she has to say.

MissionDescPrinceEnd.text: Meet with Prince Aerald and listen to what he has to say.

Start.text: We cannot let the Eye's Reckoning get in the way of our fight against the Plague.
Whatever killed this Scholar is long gone. Heavy paw prints lead away from the scene in the snow.
Looting altars of this kind is a grave offence to the God of Light.
In the absence of a church nearby, locals use this altar for rituals and prayer.
This altar is frequently used and well maintained by travellers.
A caravan has been struck down by the Eye's Reckoning!
This patrol was not spared by the Eye's Reckoning. There is almost nothing left of them.
There is a lot of blood, but no body.

line0.props.tipText: Follow the trail of blood.

Start.text: This large chest is covered with debris. Only a dexterous Companion would be able to clear it out quietly.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Win.text: Your troop has found a way out, and the village slowly regains its peacefulness. You can resume your exploration undetected.

Start.text: Plague-ridden bodies are lying across the basement floor. Only someone agile enough could safely step over them to reach the large wooden chest.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text: The key is out of reach. To get it, you need a Companion strong enough to carry another one.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion

Start.text:
You didn't see the wolf until you were inside the building.
Cornered and trapped, the animal becomes agitated, but a determined Companion could calm it down.

line2.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Feeded.text: The wolf seems intrigued by your group.

Start.text: I'm trying to improve the <narrator>cure</narrator>, but with the Inquisition sniffing around, I'm afraid theyll accuse me of something. If there were at least 5 wounded among you, I could test my new formula without raising suspicion...

line1.props.tipText: Present 5 wounded Companions.

Injuries1.text:
So? Do you feel better?
No nausea, dizziness, oozing rashes on the chest?

Injuries2.text:
Perfect! My new cure didn't kill you. What a relief!
Thank you! I'm nearing my goal.

Alt1.text:
Thanks to you, my remedy is almost ready.
Do you need anything else?

Done.text: Take care of yourselves.

line0.title: Behind the Inquisitions Back
line0.props.helpTip: Bring at least 5 wounded Companions to Apothecary Salki.

Start.text: The lock is adorned with an Eye.
Dont get me wrong, Mercenaries. Im glad to see so many faithful in my humble church.

Next1.text:
The only problem is that they won't leave.
Theyre convinced that the Eyes Reckoning was targeting them.

Next2.text: If no one can talk sense into them, I'm afraid they will end up dying from thirst and hunger in here rather than setting foot outside.

Give1.text: Your generosity knows no bounds, Mercenaries. I pray to the Eye that these supplies will last until His wrath subsides, and that you will find this reward worthy of your efforts.

End.text: I will make sure your donation is shared fairly.

EndAlt1.text: My church seems so empty all of a sudden. Whatever did you tell them, Mercenaries?

EndAlt2.text:
Ah, no matter.
Now I can get back to my prayers without worrying that those devotees will starve to death.
Please take as my thanks.

BanditEnd.text: By Saint Jeru! What did you bring me, Mercenaries?

line0.text: Prevent the faithful from starving to death.

Start.text: We must do penance, Mercenaries.

Next1.text: This past Festival of Light, we sold our sheep for more than they were worth. Taking advantage of gullible people is a terrible sin!

line0.props.tipText: Suggest the farmers make amends.

Convinced.text:
You're right. Donating a sheep as penance should be enough.
Lets go, son. Without us, Drombach will starve to death.

Start.text:
Oh God of Light!
Oh heavenly Eye!
Hear our prayers and forgive us for straying from the righteous path.
Turn your wrath away from those who repent.

Next1.text:
If you spare us,
we will free our slaves from their chains.
We will shore up our mines securely.
We will pay our workers an honest wage.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the mine owners to make good on their promises right away.

Convinced.text:
Well... so be it!
We'll prove to the God of Light how strong our faith is. With intentions so pure, we should be safe from His wrath.

Start.text: The God of Light is after us! I feel like His gaze is constantly upon us since we performed The Green Night of the Tules!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the jugglers to dedicate their art to the God of Light.

Convinced.text:
Really? You think the God of Light would forgive us if we performed holy plays?
I guess it could work... Yes. It has to work!

Start.text:
Oh joy!
Oh happiness!
We did it! I can feel the Eyes forgiveness blessing my soul.

Next1.text:
Thank you, Mercenaries! Heres something my former comrades and I obtained through nefarious means.
I dont want it anymore!

End.text: I'll talk to the priestess! I bet shell be happy to see me!

Note.text: <narrator>For increased efficiency, place four traps in a tight square.</narrator>
<narrator>The upper row must have two keys.</narrator>
<narrator>Warning: Do not place any note around the treasure.</narrator>
<narrator>An Eye key must be placed next to the treasure.</narrator>
<narrator>Fill a whole row with traps to greatly increase the chance that would-be thieves will be injured.</narrator>
<narrator>Place a first booby-trapped sword chest over an Eye key and a second one over another Eye key.</narrator>

<narrator>Do not write instructions yourselves.
These notes were successfully tested on the best thieves of Grinmeer's jail and can be used to find your treasure while resisting looters.
</narrator>
<narrator>Place 2 booby-trapped sword chests around the treasure's key.</narrator>

Start.text:
You would steal Saint Serene's treasure?
Have you no honour, Mercenaries?

Bribe1.text: That's a lot of Krowns you're offering, Mercenaries. It's worth considering...

Bribe2.text:
Fine! We're taking the gold.
Now get lost!

Start.text: Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

Start.text: The result is quite satisfying, dont you think, Mercenaries?

Next1.text:
Everything is ready for your convenience: a chest to store unneeded items, and stools for Companions who are... also unneeded.
As for me, I will arrange journeys from one Travel Post to another.

Next2.text: Is there somewhere you would like to go?

line0.props.disableReason: Build Travel Posts in other villages to get there quickly.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: A small ramshackle house stood here before it fell to the Eyes Reckoning.

Next1.text:
It would be a shame to leave this land unused. Would you like to invest, Mercenaries?
Wouldnt it be great to have a Travel Post to journey quickly from one place to another?

line0.props.tipText: Build the Drombach Travel Post.

Build.text: Stay here, I'll let the craftsmen know!

Start.text:
Make sure to close the door behind you.
Those nosy Inquisitors are everywhere.

Alt.text: The Inquisitors may be gone, but that doesn't mean you can leave the blasted door wide open!

Repair.text: Your equipment should still last a while.

Start.text:
Youre Mercenaries?
Then follow me, I need to talk to you away from prying ears.

End1.text: So? Any news about our innkeeper?

End2.text: By Saint Eleor, not here! Meet me outside, quickly.

InquisitionEnd.text: I regret asking Mercenaries for help.

MissionDesc.text: Investigate Valiant Tower to find the New-Asthel innkeeper.

line0.text: Take on Lady Mayoress Gerslinds mission.

line1.text: Find out what happened to the New-Asthel innkeeper.

Start.text: My customers are so scared of being questioned by the Inquisition that they fled the market!

Next1.text:
Thieves have came back since the Inquisitors left.
By the Eye, we just can't catch a break!

Start.text: I was drinking in the tavern when the Eyes Reckoning struck. Sobered me up real quick.

Next1.text:
The God of Light is gone?
This calls for a celebration at the tavern!

Start.text: I'll head south as soon as I sell my wares, away from those heretics and this cursed county!
Were tasked with finding the heathens who angered the God of Light and drew His Reckoning onto the county.

Next1.text: While were at it, were also checking this markets morality.

Start.text: Drombach County is in turmoil because of the Eyes Reckoning. There are plenty of missions to be found, if you know who to ask.

Done.text: I would have made the same choice.

line0.props.tipText: The Iron Hoof Stables were destroyed by the Eyes Reckoning. There might still be survivors inside.
