line1.props.tipText: Apparently, the Lady Mayoress of New-Asthel approached several mercenary groups discreetly.

line2.props.tipText: The Scholars at the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory want to further their research, but it appears that they would rather avoid the Inquisitions scrutiny.

line3.props.tipText: Prince Aerald Adr Alazar is doing his utmost to avoid drawing the Inquisitions attention to the castle. Something is afoot.

Stables.text: The Iron Hoof Stables were destroyed by the Eyes Reckoning. There might still be survivors inside.

Taverner.text: Apparently, the Lady Mayoress of New-Asthel approached several mercenary groups discreetly.

Laboratory.text: The Scholars at the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory want to further their research, but it appears that they would rather avoid the Inquisitions scrutiny.

Prince.text: Prince Aerald Adr Alazar is doing his utmost to avoid drawing the Inquisitions attention to the castle. Something is afoot.

DeliverMission1.text:
<narrator>The informant doesn't look happy.</narrator>
I thought it would take longer. Thanks anyway.

End.text: Apologies, but I have nothing for you.

PathCrime1.text: Seeing how easily you dealt with a certain security system, the Informants deemed it inefficient. Still, it appears to have piqued the Scholars' interest in spite of its flaws.

PathCrime2.text: A group of savants decided to buy the system from its inventor in order to perfect it using their Knowledge. I hope you are up to the challenge.

PathCrime3.text: There are precious few Scholars who are competent enough to tackle such a complex matter. You should have no trouble finding them.

PathCrimeEnd1.text:
The shamed inventor left for Belerion. As for the Scholars, they were expelled from their University for losing the dean's treasure.
The mission was a success, Mercenaries.

PathCrimeEnd2.text:
The Informants have always held you in high regard, but I have to say that you really went above and beyond.
On behalf of my colleagues, I thank you.

line0.text: Buy the Scholar's Key from the Informant.

line1.text: Find and thwart the security system matching the Scholar's Key.

Start.text: Honestly, I liked it better when my master was hiding in the mountain.

I dont know if I'm allowed to rent rooms or sell my masters recipe.
I'm just watching the Terns Nest while hes away.

I got my freedom back after my former master was branded a heretic by the Inquisition.
Lucky break for me...
People are giving me dirty looks, the Lady Mayoress piled a bunch of new instructions on me... I wonder whats going on.

Next1.text: I'm the new owner of this tavern! Lady Mayoress Gerslind told me so herself!

Start.text: Its good to see things return to normal.
I can heal any injury, but frostbite is my speciality!

Done.text: Dont forget to make regular stops on your trip. Frostbite is always a risk when it gets this cold.

Start.text: I'm warning you: if youre with the Inquisition, I won't even repair your boots.

Repair.text: Sorry for the cold welcome. I'm nervous with those zealots around.

Alt.text: They say the Inquisition is gone... Is it true?

Start.text: My pony froze to death last week. Ill leave with the next caravan travelling through the village.
No one can make me serve Inquisitors. Not even the Prince.

Alt.text: We havent seen the Inquisition around here for a while. Do you know why?

Start.text: We sell all our surplus to help with the cost of rebuilding this ruin.

EndBandit.text: May the Eye grant us victory!

Start.text: I asked Berthram to bring me everything I need to sew warmer clothing. When do you think he will be back?

End.text: Do you... do you think Fergas stands a chance?

Start.text: I know that Fergas and the others are doing their best, but let's face it: we won't survive the winter months if we stay here.

End.text: Fergas is going to get us killed.

Start.text: Any last words, ruffian?

Bandit.text: Why? Why won't you leave us in peace?

Bourgomaster.text: In peace? Why would we do such a thing? You've destroyed our farms, ransacked our villages, stolen our grain and brought Edoranian soldiers in your wake! You've done nothing but cause problems!

Bandit2.text: We had no other choice! You refused to open your doors and take us in! And just as we were starting to rebuild the Haven, you laid waste to the place!

Bourgomaster2.text: What, this ruin? That's enough! You wouldn't survive the winter months if you stayed here. For your insolence and the trouble you've caused, I hereby condemn you to the gallows! As for these Refugees, they must leave Tiltren or suffer the same fate!

Next.text: Ah, Mercenaries! Words cannot express how grateful I am for your help! Thanks to you, the locals will rest easy tonight.

Next2.text: Come back to visit the real Stromkapp when you get a chance. We will welcome our saviours with open arms. Please accept these gifts from our craftsmen and merchants in consideration for your invaluable help!

Start.text: I wasn't expecting to see so many familiar faces here!

We are trying to rebuild a village from scratch. We've got more than enough farmers, but we are in dire need of skilled craftspeople. If you find a blacksmith amongst the Refugees, please bring them to us. We are in such a bind that we are willing to pay for your help.

line0.props.tipText: Offer Claes services.

End.text: I know this man! He was a blacksmith back in Cortia! The Eye smiles upon us! Claes is a very gifted artisan. Here is your reward. You have been more than helpful.

Alt.text: Please, if you meet other Refugees, do what you can to help them.

SettingLog.text: The Deserter blacksmith now works in the Haven.

line0.title: Blacksmith Blackout
line0.props.helpTip: Find a blacksmith among the refugees and take him to the Haven.

Start.text: Ah, mercenaries! Just in the nick of time! Welcome to the Haven. My name is Fergas, I am the former Lord Mayor of Cortia, and I now lead the Refugees.

Next.text: As you have discovered, the locals haven't exactly welcomed us with open arms... I have therefore decided to move our people to this cold and isolated wasteland. But it seems that it is still not far enough for the Lady Mayoress of Stromkapp.

Next2.text: Take our woodcutter camp, for example. We need wood to fortify our new home and survive the winter months, but the local farmers have been harassing us ceaselessly. I fear the worst. We haven't heard from our woodcutters in several days.

Next4.text: Hence the reason for your presence here. This situation could be far too dangerous for the humble farmers we are. I need Mercenaries to find out what happened to our men.

AgainstBandit1.text: My name is Fergas, I am the former Lord Mayor of Cortia, and I now lead the Refugees. It was I who requested your presence.

AgainstBandit2.text: It seems you have chosen to support the citizens of Tiltren rather than our cause. I wish I could change your mind... Perhaps offering you a mission that will be worth your while will do more than a thousand words.

AgainstBandit3.text: We have set up a woodcutter camp to the north. This remote camp was only meant to provide us with the timber necessary for firewood and rebuilding the Haven. But still the Tiltren farmers continue harassing our men. I fear the situation might escalate. We haven't heard back from our woodcutters in several days.

AgainstBandit4.text: I would therefore ask you and your Mercenaries to find out what happened.

Next5.text: Thank you. The woodcutters are just north of here.

EndLumberjack2.text: Thank you for helping our woodcutters. I do not know if their work will be enough to see us through until spring, but at least, you have given us hope.

EndLumberjack3.text: Rumour has it that you would rather defend fairy-tale creatures than help the Refugees. It seems I was wrong about you...

NotInvited.text: Who are you? What are you doing here?

Alt.text: I've been waiting for you. As a matter of fact, we all have... After seeing everything you've done for us Refugees, we have taken an important decision.

Alt2.text: This ruin will not be our Haven! You have shown us that more than a roof over our heads, we need our dignity back!

Alt3.text: We will leave this forsaken place and demand that Stromkapp treat us like the human beings we are! We will not back down! Please, come and support us in this as you have in our previous endeavours!

MissionDesc.text: Go and see what happened to the woodcutters.

line0.text: Take on Refugee Leader Fergas' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line0.text: Take on Refugee Leader Fergas' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
By the All-seeing Eye! Have you lost your mind?
You can't take me back to Arthes! I'm wanted there!
I am Professor Hermann. It is my honour to represent the great Universities of Edoran, Alazar and Gosenberg. According to our information, we share a common interest in discovery and knowledge.

Next1.text: Our learned Deans have therefore selected you for a mission of crucial importance: recovering an artefact. This item is currently in the hands of the Church, but the clergy refuses to send it to us for research, despite our many requests.

Next2.text: I am sure you will agree this is unacceptable. We have therefore sought to determine the exact whereabouts of this mysterious relic. And we now know where it is!

Next3.text: The artefact is kept in the crypt of Saint Eleor Abbey. You will need to enter the church, take the relic and bring it back to us.

Accept1.text: Here, take this marble piece. Our source assured us that you will need it.

Wait.text: The scholars and academics in all the kingdoms are counting on you!

End1.text: I beg your forgiveness! We unknowingly sent you into a trap...

End2.text: Our leaders will know of your misfortune, and I will investigate the matter further. In the meantime, please accept this reward. We cannot hold this failure against you.

End3.text: We may require your services again in the future. Should you decide not to blame us for this unfortunate incident, we would be thrilled to hire you again.

line0.text: Take on Professor Hermann's mission

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Use the Inquisitor Rendezvous Point item to find where they will be meeting.

line3.text: Follow the trail to find the Inquisitors.

Start.text: We are to let the farmers seek refuge in Tiltren - general's orders.
I'm waiting for other caravans. When passing through a warring county, it's best to do so in a large group. It discourages bandits and you can all pitch in to pay mercenaries.
People are fleeing Arthes, and you're going there?

Give.text:
Very well, at your own risk.
The border is open to you in both directions, you know. Should you regret your boldness, you can return to Tiltren without paying.

FromEdoran.text: You can go through, Mercenaries. But not without paying first.

End.text: No need to check in with me. You've paid the toll, so the border is open to you.

line0.title: To Edoran
line0.props.helpTip: Pay the toll (200 or a Border Pass).

Start.text: How could they? We didn't even put up a fight, and they still killed our precious Lucilla.

NextStart.text: Mad with grief, her father chased after them toward the mill. I hope he caught up with them. These thieves don't deserve to live!

Give2.text: You can't begin to understand how much this means to me. I can't thank you enough. You deserve much more than this, but it's all I have.

Done.text: My sweet little Lucilla... May the All-seeing Eye watch over you, dear angel...

Start.text: Go away! I'm starving. I'm beginning to lose control. I might kill you!

Kill.text: I heard what my wife told you. She's right, you know. I will eventually turn against her. Do what you must. I'd rather die than hurt her.

Start.text: A plague rat bit my husband while he was out chopping wood, and Stromkapp has cast us out. Ever since, I've had a very hard time finding enough food for him.

Next.text: I've nothing to offer in return, but could you... take care of him?

Done.text: May the All-seeing Eye give me the strength to go on living without him...

line0.title: The Plague-ridden Husband
line0.props.helpTip: Help Kary get rid of her husband.

Start.text: I don't think I thanked you.

Next1.text: It is high time I do so, before we go our separate ways.

Next2.text: I will always remember with great fondness the day we butchered these guards hand in hand. Thanks to you, no one in Tiltren will ever forget my name again. Thank you.

Start.text:
Hey! You! Over here!
Act as if I were an ordinary merchant. Whatever you do, dont attract the guard's attention.

Next1.text: I have a mission for you from the Baron. If you succeed, hell take you under his wing and show you the ropes.

Next2.text: You are to go to Tiltren Jail, recruit a woman named Septelle, just as you would any ordinary mercenary, and bring her back here to collect your reward. Easy enough, right?

Next3.text: But know that this young woman is very special to the Baron. Take good care of her. And don't take too long. I'll be waiting for you.

MissionDesc.text: Recruit Septelle at the Tiltren Jail.

End1.text: Finally! I was wondering what was keeping you, until I heard patrols were being slaughtered everywhere.

End2.text: I hope Septelle had fun.

End3.text: Here is your reward. As promised, the Baron will be in touch. Farewell.

line0.text: Take on the bandit's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: We are not a charity, you know... You need an official pass to enter Gosenberg... unless you are willing to pay. Up to you.

Next.text: Everything is in order. Welcome to Gosenberg.

line0.title: To Gosenberg
line0.props.helpTip: Pay the toll (200 or a Border Pass).

Start.text: I don't have enough money to cross the border. I don't know where to go from here...
I may not look wealthy, but if you pay for my passage, you won't regret it, trust me!

Next.text: My cousin runs a tavern in the city of Gosenberg. If you can lend me the money, I promise he will pay you back threefold. I'm not lying! He truly does exist, you have to believe me!

End.text: Oh, thank you! I'd given up hope. Come and see us in Gosenberg. My cousin will compensate you adequately.

Start.text: I can't believe Rovand is dead, and we are free!

Next.text: We really owe you one! Here, take this! You deserve it. I'll be sure to tell Fergas and the other Refugees in the Haven what you did.

SettingLog.text: The Refugees no longer have to fear Captain Rovand.

Start.text: I will never help the Refugees after what happened! They are all just like Berthram... Lawless scoundrels, the lot of them!
Nothing is beneath him! Berthram stole two cows and a calf from my brother-in-law. In one night, his family lost everything.

To think that we have to camp out here because of some pig-headed bandit! That Berthram will stop at nothing to terrorise the yokels, but when it comes to facing the Guard, that's a whole other matter. You see that cave, to the north? He's holed up in there...

Next.text: It's been three days and still he won't surrender! Berthram knows he's done for... Yet he continues defending his lair with such doggedness that we have no choice but to starve him to death.

Next2.text: That's why I need Mercenaries! He doesn't know you... He might even let you in if he thinks he can convince you to help him. And once you've gained his trust, you can finish him off for us... We'll make it worth your while, I promise.

Alt.text: Berthram hired you to kill us? No, wait, you don't understand! This man is not some poor Refugee! He's been terrorising the local farmers and stealing their crops. He must die. I will pay you to kill him!

line0.props.tipText: Kill Captain Rovand for Berthram.

MissionDesc.text: Kill Berthram for Captain Rovand.

MissionDesc2.text: Talk to Captain Rovand.

line0.text: Take on Captain Rovand's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: So Berthram is dead... My men and the good citizens of Tiltren will be glad to hear it.

Next.text: I must commend you for your courage and your devotion to our cause. Here is the reward the Lady Mayoress promised me. You deserve it. Goodbye.

SettingLog.text: The villagers no longer have to fear Berthram.

Start.text: I hate having to strong-arm the farmers. But we have no other choice! The citizens of Tiltren refuse to hire us or share their resources with us.
To think that four years ago, Berthram and I spent our days driving oxen! Seems like a lifetime ago...
Ah! Mercenaries! Did Fergas send you to help us?

Next.text: He didn't? Dammit! ... Wait! Would you be willing to help us if we make it worth your while?

Third.text: You probably saw a campsite on your way here. That's Captain Rovand and his men. If you kill him, you will do much more than save our lives!

Fourth.text: Without Captain Rovand to defend them, the good people of Tiltren would surely share their resources with us Refugees. We wouldn't have to steal or threaten them any more. Kill him for us.

line0.props.tipText: Agree to kill Captain Rovand.

Alt.text: Ah! Mercenaries! Did Fergas send you to help us?

Next2.text: ! Rovand hired you to kill me? I beg of you, don't do this! We do not enjoy bullying the farmers, you know! We have no choice if we want to survive!

Next3.text: Rovand is the one who must die! I will match his offer! In fact, I can pay you more! And you would be doing a good deed.

Next4.text: Once he is gone, the farmers of Tiltren will have no one to protect them. We won't have to force them to share their resources with us. Kill the captain. It's the only solution.

line0.props.tipText: Kill Berthram the Bandit for Captain Rovand.

line1.props.tipText: Agree to kill Captain Rovand for Berthram.

MissionDesc.text: Kill Captain Rovand.

MissionDesc2.text: Talk to Berthram.

line0.text: Take on Berthram's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Thank you, Mercenaries. I promise I will never steal again. Isabeth told us about the *Haven*, a refuge where pariahs like us can come together and help each other out. That's where we're heading.
Thank you for your help. Recruiting Refugees seemed like a good idea at the time, but being desperate does not make them good thieves.

Next.text: Without your help, my mistake could have cost this poor soul dearly. Please accept this on behalf of our people. It's not much, but I hope the Mercenaries you are will not be too disappointed.

Reward.text: And now, to take these good people to the *Haven*.

Alt.text: Thank you for your help. Recruiting Refugees seemed like a good idea at the time, but being desperate does not make them good thieves.

SettingLog.text: You helped the Bandits save a Refugee.

MissionReport.text: Join Isabeth in the Wealthy Farm.

Start.text: Do not take pity on this scoundrel. He fled his home country to come and steal our crops.

Next.text: This Edoranian leech will be strung up for his crime, and soon we'll all sleep easy.

End.text: Your ill-advised intervention almost cost us our lives. But since you killed the Bandits for us, I am willing to forgive you.

End2.text: Here is a little something for your trouble. Now skedaddle, and leave the good townsfolk in peace!

End3.text: Goodbye.

SettingLog.text: You help the Villagers restore order.

MissionReport.text: Join Oddi at the Wealthy Farm.

Start.text: I am terribly sorry, I shouldn't have agreed to this, but... we'd run out of food, and we were starving!

Help.text: I hear shouting! Could you go and see what that is all about?

Start.text: Are you... Are you Mercenaries? Oh, blessed be the All-seeing Eye! You are our last hope! I swear I will find a way to pay you.

Next.text: You must warn my husband's "friends". They need to come and help him! Yes! Ask them to come. If only they could speak in his favour, reason with the people who want to kill him for a handful of grain...

Accept.text: My husband only told me that his friends live north of the lake, not far from here. Please come back quickly!

Help.text: Oh, by the All-seeing Eye, what is going on out there? You brought his "friends"?

EndBandit.text: Oh, thank you, thank you so much! Had I known that his friends were bandits and that he turned to a life of crime, I would have done everything in my power to stop him!

EndVillager.text: You let them hang my husband! May the Beast take you!

line0.text: Agree to help the convicted man's wife.

line1.text: Warn the convicted man's friends north of the nearby lake.

line2.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Our boss is open to recruiting anyone, including Refugees. The Villagers are blaming us for taking advantage of the situation, but at least, we're not letting these people starve to death...
One of our new recruits hasn't returned from his first assignment... I'm starting to worry. Stealing grain should be quick and easy. Something must have gone terribly wrong.

Next3.text: He probably just got delayed. He seemed capable enough... for a Refugee.

line0.props.tipText: One of your "friends" is to be hung from the gallows.

Next.text: Ah! Caught red-handed on his first try? I never should have recruited a simple farmer... He just doesnt have it in him.

Next2.text: He cannot hang by my fault! Pack it up, lads, we are leaving! As for you, come and meet me at the farm. We could do with your help!

Bis.text: Oh, you're back? You will always be welcome here. Come back as often as you'd like.

MissionDesc.text: Meet up with Isabeth and the Bandits.

line0.title: Worrisome Delay
line0.props.helpTip: Investigate the missing rookie thief.

Start.text: How I manage to get all this? Ah, hard work, that's the secret! Ha! Ha!
Only Edoranians are daft enough not to believe in the Tules! Had these people been from Belerion, they would never have come here to chop wood!
Mercenaries, you are as much our heroes as those of the Tules. I can only imagine the wrath of these creatures had the refugees continued to fell but one tree.

Next.text: Take this as a token of our gratitude.

Wait.text: Helping the Tules is good luck, believe me.

SettingLog.text: The villagers have preserved the Mount Altis forest.

Start.text: Even in this place lost in the forest, the people of Tiltren still find a way to inconvenience us! No way to chop wood in peace in this Eye-forsaken county!

Bis.text: Huh? The chief is worried about us? And so he should be! The locals are getting more vindictive by the minute. They harass us, and we haven't enough men to send a message and... Wha...?

Bis2.text: ... WATCH OUT! The farmers are back!

Bis3.text: You there! Mercenaries! Since the chief sent you, hurry up and join our lads outside the camp, and stop these fools from getting in!

Waiting.text: Well? What are you waiting for?

End.text: All this talk of Tules was driving me mad. It was high time someone talked some sense into them. Here is your reward - we'll be sure to let the chief know we're safe now you've cleared the way.

MissionDesc.text: Go and check what is happening outside the Woodcutters' Camp.

MissionDesc2.text: Meet your allies at the Woodcutters' Camp.

SettingLog.text: The Refugees can make use of Tiltren wood.

line0.title: A Legendary Presence
line0.props.helpTip: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: My only job is to fend off the Tiltren farmers who come and interfere with the woodcutters' work. Believe me, there's as many of them as there are trees around here.

Bis.text: Tules! That is the most ridiculous excuse I've ever heard! These farmers cannot be serious - they're just trying to scare us away.

Start.text: He... He killed everyone... A real madman... I'm injured... Help me...

Help.text: Thank you. I still can't believe that Ricky used us as bait! He was the one to blame, not us!

Help3.text: If he hadn't killed that little girl to steal her necklace, her father wouldn't have fought back and my friends would still be alive!

Help4.text: Take me with you. I have a score to settle with that traitor!

line0.title: Injured Thief
line0.props.helpTip: Decide what to do with Hakert.

Start.text: Stop right there! This salt mine belongs to Her Ladyship Gontrande. I can't just let you walk in.

Intro.text: As you wish. We can't mine the salt because of these two iron veins, anyway. I really don't understand why you were so keen to go in there!

Wanted.text: You threatened the Lady Mayoress' foreman.

Done.text: You cleared out the iron deposits? Well done! We can get back to work!

End.text: You cleared out the iron deposits? Well done! We can get back to work!

line0.title: Mining Misfortunes
line0.props.helpTip: Destroy the iron veins so that mining can resume.

Start.text: There is a corpse in the campsite. Hakert immediately recognises Ricky, his former accomplice who had betrayed him.

Alone.text: A dead body is lying in the snow. Something seems to be hanging from his belt.

Start.text: The Black Market is at your service. I take any kind of merchandise, no matter where it comes from.
What do you want?

MissionDesc.text: Take Septelle back to the Gosenberg border crossing.

CampDialogGuard0.text: What are you waiting for? I'm not going to make a name for myself by standing here!

CampDialogGuard1.text: That was fun, wasn't it? But was this fight memorable enough? No, I think not. We need to persevere.

CampDialogGuard2.text: I wasn't quite sure youd be up to the task. But you weren't so bad in the end!

CampDialogGuard4.text: Tiltren will never forget my name! And I hope you won't either.

Start.text: The Lady Mayoress has offered a reward for any <inf>outlaw</inf> captured in the region. You should give bounty hunting a try.

Deliver.text: Thanks for contributing to law and order!

NoSlotAvailable.text: All the dungeons are full. Come back later.

line0.title: Hand over a prisoner
line0.props.helpTip: Catch an outlaw and take him back to jail.

Start.text: The match's prize is going to get eaten!

S1PathMight1MercenaryLeader1.npc.name: Ogger, of the Searing Fists gang

Start.text: Dont trust Seggognia, of the Harag's Bane gang. I've heard about them, and their methods are terrifying.

Next1.text: That was impressive! You defeated all these Bandits with such dexterity!

Next2.text: You truly are the best Mercenaries in the land! You deserve this reward. My men and I cant pretend this mission's success was our doing. Our honour forbids it.

Next3.text: Maybe our paths will cross again.

Start.text: So you were summoned, too? And the emissary hasn't told you anything either?

Next1.text: It's very strange. We thought we were the only ones hired for this mission, but it seems 3 different Mercenary troops have been asked to dispatch this measly Bandit camp...

Next2.text: But perhaps there is a reason for that... If the Brotherhood is looking for new allies, they will want to assess their capacity for collaboration.

Next3.text: And with *5* groups of Bandits defending this lair, there will be plenty of targets for us all, right?

Next4.text: Let's do this! Well meet here once weve defeated our enemies. Good luck, everyone!

Next5.text: Yeah, right... Good luck.

S1PathMight1MercenaryLeader2.npc.name: Seggognia, of the Harag's Bane gang

Start.text: What do you want? Don't you have enough brigands to keep you busy?
No need to glare at us! We didn't kill Ogger and the Searing Fists gang for the fun of it.

Next1.text:
It just so happens that the Brotherhood has hired 3 different Mercenary troops, but there is only one reward for this mission... Talk about underhand tactics...
In any case, we will do anything to get our hands on it.

Next2.text: You must be disappointed, after all the hard work you put in.

Start.text: We surrender! Please! Don't kill us!

Next1.text: We don't want to end up like them... We're no match for you...

Next2.text: You can tell the Guard we'll surrender peacefully. Take anything you want in the camp. It's all yours.

Start.text: Who... who told you we were here? That cowardly merchant who wont face us himself? That traitor...

Next1.text: That's right! A traitor! That's what he is! His family has been selling our fabric and pots for years, and all of a sudden, he prefers dealing with Gosenberg?

Next2.text: He doesn't care about the consequences of his action. And neither do you! Oh, that Aldeberth! We won't be intimidated by a bunch of Mercenaries! We're going to teach you all a lesson!

Start.text: Lieutenant Perault! Dont you remember me?

Next1.text: ... Youre the woman I arrested a few days ago! You attacked a merchant caravan.

Next2.text: Ah, your memory isnt as bad as I thought. To be honest, Im quite offended.

Next3.text: What are you talking about? I don't understand.

Next4.text: Oh but you should! Because it's all your fault.

Next5.text: Because of you, my new friends and I had to kill all these guards.

Next6.text: So you were behind all this?

Next7.text: Yes! We went out of our way so that no one in this Eye-forsaken province will ever forget the name of Septelle!

Next9.text: Now, you remember? Yes! I am the Baron's daughter! Not only do I not appreciate being thrown Jail, but I also resent being mistaken for a common Bandit!

Next10.text: You and your men must die, So that the next ones who come for me will not make the same mistake!

Start.text:
Just a second, Mercenaries!
Before I come with you, I have a score to settle in Tiltren, and youre going to help me. Let's just say this service is included in your contract...

Next1.text: Lieutenant Perault threw me in jail like some two-bit crook.... That idiot didn't even recognise the Baron's daughter!

Next2.text: He couldve blackmailed the most powerful outlaw in the Five Kingdoms, but no! He put me in a seedy cell with nothing but stale bread and water... I will not suffer this humiliation a second longer! This pigsty of a province will know who I am! I wont leave Tiltren until they quake in fear at the mere sight of me!

Next3.text: First, we'll attack a few Guard patrols. 2 should do the trick. Then, the good lieutenant himself will come after me, and that's when we'll get him! Got it? Then let's go!

Guard1.text: Well done! Well done! An excellent start! 1 more, and the lieutenant will have to come after me!

Guard3.text: Ah, had my previous henchmen been this good, the lieutenant never wouldve mistaken me for someone else!

Guard3Bis.text: Speaking of which, I am sure hell be here soon. You should get ready.

End.text: All this fighting has been exhausting. I'm glad its over... I've had quite enough of this.

End1.text: Take me to the Gosenberg border crossing, and youll get your reward. After all you've done for me, I hope its worth it!

Start.text: We came to hunt for food for our families, but the animals here... Their calls are enough to make your hair stand on end!

Next2.text: I'm beginning to wonder if we did the right thing coming here. But now that we're here, we can't go back empty-handed!

line0.props.tipText: Spare the men from hunting by sharing your supplies.

line1.props.tipText: Explain that this mountain is extremely dangerous for inexperienced hunters.

Give2.text: All this? That's incredibly generous of you. With no more need to hunt, we'll be able to return home. Take this - we won't be needing it.

Convinced.text: I see. Thank you for warning us. We were venturing into unknown territory.

Convinced2.text: Thanks to you, we'll get back to our families safe and sound.

Start.text: Please! Have mercy, good sirs! Have mercy on us.

Next.text: We didn't attack you to hurt you, believe me! We only wanted... to scare you so that you would hand over your Krowns...

Next2.text: Please don't hurt me! It was wrong, and we knew it. But Gosenberg requires so much gold to cross the border that we had no other choice! We have no other choice but to rob travellers.

Give.text: You... You offer us passage? I can't believe it. Thank you ever so much! Please, take this, we no longer need it.

Start.text: Where's 'em Refugees? We'll toss 'em out ourselves! We'll toss 'em all out!

Next.text: Yeah, I been drinkin'! We all have! How'd you know? You seers or summat?

Next2.text: Pff! Ne'er mind. Leave us be, we've got refugees to clear outta Tiltren!

line1.props.tipText: Alcohol should distract them.

Give.text: Oh, that's awful kind of ya! We were startin' to get thirsty!

Give2.text: Think we'll take a little nap, and we'll decide what to do later...

Start.text: What do you want now? Don't you have anything better to do than harass Refugees?

Next.text: Even if you were Edor himself, you couldn't cut down those trees!

Next2.text: What do you mean? What's it to you if we cut those trees instead of any others?

Next3.text: The Mount Altis forest is sacred - it has belonged to the Tules since the dawn of time. If you upset the little folk, they will attack all the surrounding settlements. Including ours and your Haven.

Next4.text: Don't be absurd! The Tules aren't even real! They're just fairy tales! We won't freeze to death over some imaginary pixies.

Next5.text: How dare you? For the Eye's sake...

Next6.text: Go and tell your hallucinations to move out. There's no lack of trees in this county.

Next7.text: Mercenaries! Did you hear that? Name your price and give those blasphemers the punishment they deserve! The Tules will be most grateful.

Start.text: We won't let you near the only refuge we have! Turn back, mercenaries!
Finally! The lads were starting to think you wouldn't come. But I knew you would keep your word. Let's go and get rid of those intruders.
Any last words?

Bourgomaster.text: You've no right to be here! Stromkapp is a free village that only belongs to its people! You're nothing but parasites, too cowardly to fight for your own land!

Bandit.text: We're here because our land was burned down! Because our craftsmen were drafted! Because our families were starving! All we wanted was for you to welcome us in.

Bourgomaster2.text: So what are you going to do now? Kill all the villagers of Stromkapp, don their clothes and seize their goods, sleep in their beds and replace our people with your own?

Bandit2.text: No, we only want the villagers to share. Had you done so in the first place, the situation would never have escalated. I will be the new mayor, whilst you and your supporters will be hanged.

Bandit3.text: As for you, Mercenaries, thank you for helping us in restoring the peace. As long as Edoran is torn by conflict, the new council of Stromkapp will welcome refugees with open arms.

Bandit4.text: Claim your reward and know that you will always be welcome here.

Start.text: The Lady Mayoress, she didn't want to hear it, but we won't give up! We're prepared to fight. Are you with us?

line0.props.tipText: You are ready to start fighting.

MidSettingMission.text: The refugee leader awaits you in the *Haven*.

VillagersEnd.text: The Lady Mayoress of Stromkapp awaits you in the *Townhall*.

VillagersEnd2.text: Join the Lady Mayoress in the assault on the *Haven*.

BanditEnd.text: The refugee leader awaits you in the *Haven*.

BanditEnd2.text: Join the refugee leader in the assault on Stromkapp.

StromkappTutorial.text: Escort the Merchant to the Stromkapp Market.

Start.text: Halt! You have a Deserter amongst you. In the name of Edoran, the All-seeing Eye and Count Laheart, hand over the blacksmith!

line0.props.tipText: Hand over the blacksmith without protest.

Accept.text: Whether it was cowardice or reason that led you to that decision, you should know it was the right one. Farewell.

SettingLog.text: You handed the blacksmith over to Count Laheart's men.

Start.text: Are you this traitor's accomplices? Hand over the blacksmith or we won't show any mercy!

line0.props.tipText: Hand over the blacksmith without protest.

Accept.text: Whether it was cowardice or reason which led you to that decision, you should know it was the right one. Farewell.

SettingLog.text: You handed the blacksmith over to Count Laheart's men.

Start.text: Mercenaries, this man belongs to Count Laheart. Hand him over without resisting.

line0.props.tipText: Hand over the blacksmith without protest.

Accept.text: Whether it was cowardice or reason which led you to that decision, you should know it was the right one. Farewell.

SettingLog.text: You handed the blacksmith over to Count Laheart's men.

Start.text: Merely travelling with that Deserter makes you enemies of Count Laheart. Hand over that man and we'll forget we ever saw you.

line0.props.tipText: Hand over the blacksmith without protest.

Accept.text: Whether it was cowardice or reason which led you to that decision, you should know it was the right one. Farewell.

SettingLog.text: You handed the blacksmith over to Count Laheart's men.

Start.text: Release the refugee immediately!

Villager1.text: But... You! You brought bandits! Mercenaries, are you willing to let them slaughter us to save a thief?

Bandit2.text: He's just a desperate farmer. Let him go, and no harm will come to you.

Villager2.text: Who's to say you won't be back in a few days to plunder our supplies? No, we won't let any of you leave.

Villager3.text: Mercenaries! Whatever those thieves promised you, I can pay you much more to defend us! We'll even forget you were ever involved in this!

Start.text: I can polish your armour for...

Next.text: You! How did you find me?!

Start.text: Sadly for you, ransacking a slaver's basement tends to be a bad idea.

Negociate.text: If you want to talk, you will have to prove your good faith. You did poke around my place, after all!

Pay.text: How kind of you... You wish to deal with me? I suppose you could bring in new "employees", and I'd give you wood in exchange.

Pay2.text: Very well, let's give it a go. Capture a refugee and bring them to me.

Pay3.text: Let me be clear: I have a heart and Tiltren is my home. I don't want some honest farmer, only an Edoranian refugee.

Accept.text: You have two days. After that, I'll assume you lot were taking the piss, and I will find you.

Accept2.text: Oh! And don't even think about telling the Guard. I pay them handsomely to look the other way. You would hang in an instant.

Hunting.text: I patiently waited for my slaves but soon realised they would never come. You'll wish you never lied to me. Farewell.

Start.text: We were sent from Alazar to rid the northern forest of its plague rat infestation.

Next.text: However, we're also looking for an infected man. Apparently, Stromkapp cast him out.

line0.props.tipText: We killed the infected man.

Nextbis.text: However, we're also looking for an infected man. Apparently, Stromkapp cast him out.

Nextbis2.text: But... There, amongst your men... That's him! The one with the Plague! Hand him over!

Accept.text: Wonderful! It's been some time since we last had a live subject. Now where did I put my kit?

End2.text: Let's press on and deal with those rats. May the Eye guide you on your path.

Refuse.text: We've been commissioned by the kingdom of Alazar. If you don't change your tune, we're entitled to slay you where you stand. Don't be foolish - hand over the infected man.

Pestkilled.text: Is this really his blood? It is crucial that it be his blood! I would have preferred to study him alive...

End.text: Let's press on and deal with those rats. May the Eye guide you on your path.

NextTer.text: We were also looking for a Plague-ridden man, but I see that you've cured him already...

NextTer2.text: Such a shame... It would've been an excellent opportunity to try and improve the cure.

Start.text: Lucilla... I'll kill them all!

<narrator>As they approach the old well, your Companions hear a voice:</narrator>
What's the password?

line0.props.tipText: Say the password.

NoDlc.text:
<narrator>As they approach the old well, your Companions hear a voice:</narrator>
What's the password?

Start.text: Parts of the corpse are horribly mangled. Only an animal could tear off such large chunks of flesh.

line0.text: Get the Tiltren Black Market reward.

Start.text: If you want to send your lads into the pit, you'll have to talk to me!

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

FightLost1.text:
Nothing to be ashamed of! We're not all cut out to be warriors!
I'd give up if I were you.

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

FightWin1.text:
That was an impressive fight, Mercenaries!
The kind that deserves a reward!

FightWin2.text:
Best to strike while the iron's hot!
What fight shall I sign you up for?

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

Renounce.text: What? Don't want to fight any more?

FightRedo.text:
?
I haven't got a reward for you, Mercenaries.
We want to see new stuff, not the same fight over and over!

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

WholePitWin1.text: You've won all five fights! We don't see warriors of your calibre every day, I'll tell you that.

WholePitWin2.text: Tiltren's special reward is all yours, so wear it proudly!

WholePitWinAgain1.text:
The first time you showed up here, I wouldn't have bet a single copper coin on you!
But look at you now you've won all the fights in our pit!

WholePitWinAgain2.text: It's a shame I've got nothing left to offer you I would have liked to cheer you on one last time!

PitNoGain.text: You're sure you want to fight for free? All right, it's up to you!

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

Start.text:
Rats and Plague-ridden escape from the pit on a regular basis.
It seems they infected a farmer recently.
Poor old fellow.

This arena puts all of Tiltren in danger!
If those Bandits didn't pay so well, I would have turned them in ages ago!
My companion is an accomplished artist! My victims love his little tricks.
My job is to distract spectators while my accomplice picks their pockets.
Dont turn your noses up at the merchandise. Your presence here means your hands are as dirty as mine.
The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.
There is something written on the bookcase.

Next1.text: It is a prayer asking for the Artist's work to survive the Destruction.

Next2.text: It is a prayer asking for the Artist's work to survive the Destruction.

Start.text: Stones of all sizes are strewn across this corridor. They seemed to have fallen from a ceiling obscured by darkness.

NotifRun.text: A stone the size of an apple crashes down onto ::name::'s head : <status>::injury::</status>

NotifMove.text: Slowly but surely, you reach the other side.

Start.text: The statue depicts a man called Dagan. Something about his posture makes you want to sing.

SingSuccess.text: Your performance seems to have triggered something.

SingFailed.text: Your performance wasn't up to scratch.

End.text: Dagan's statue stands completely still.

Start.text: Your Companions could just about slip through a small opening in the rubble blocking the way.
The door is locked.
You feel a warm breath behind your shoulder.
The atmosphere in the halls is strained. Your Companions can sense eyes watching them. A pot breaks. Creatures lunge out of the darkness!
Pretending to be scholars exploring the Tomb, are we, Mercenaries? Steel yourselves... People often go missing in there.

The tracks lead away from the pitch.
Do you want to follow them?
This pony makes for a beautiful reward.
We did have a reward for the winner, but it escaped.

Next1.text: All that's left of our pony are tracks running away through the plain.

Next2.text: Our team won't play if there's no decent reward to be won.

line0.props.tipText: Give a pony
line0.props.disableReason: Hand over the runaway pony.

Pony1.text:
Meadowsweet!
This pony is getting on in years, but she can plough a field like no other! Farmers will fight tooth and nail to get their hands on her.

Pony2.text: If you want to challenge them, come see me and I'll sign you up.

Rouste1.text:
Are you ready to fight? The mud is perfect today!
The winners of this match will earn the beautiful pony you gave us, or its worth in vegetables. Their choice.

Rouste2.text:
Those wretches didn't stand a chance!
So, what will it be? Your pony back or its worth in vegetables?

RewardPony.text:
All right, here's your pony.
Come back whenever you want, our team is going to train hard!

RewardVegetables.text:
Vegetables it is, then.
Come back whenever you want, our team is going to train hard!

RousteDiff1.text:
Our players may be farmers, but they want to win as fiercely as you do.
How about a rematch?

line0.props.tipText: Play Tiltren's team in Hard mode.

RousteDiff2.text: Once again, you've crushed your opponent. It's an honour to give you this prize.

RousteDiff3.text: That was the last prize we had. Next time, all you can expect is a friendly match.

RousteEnd1.text: How about a friendly match? Let me remind you that you will be playing for sport only, since you've already earned all of the rewards.

line0.props.tipText: Play Tiltren's team in Hard mode.

line0.text: Find the pony that escaped from the <narrator>Rouste Pitch</narrator> and bring it back to the <narrator>referee</narrator>.
Win a Rouste match on the Tiltren Pitch.

Start.text: Given the refugee crisis, I doubt Stromkapp can afford another pony to replace the one that ran away.

Next1.text: For a free pony, I'd punch anyone!

Start.text: I ain't playing for nothing!

Next1.text: I was promised a pony, so I want a pony!

Next2.text: Are we playing or what?

Start.text: In Tiltren, Rouste players are all amateurs: farmers, craftsmen... even Bandits, sometimes.

Next1.text: Rewards serve a very important purpose: they are a compensation for the risks taken on the pitch. Without them, it's not worth playing.

Start.text: There may not be much to eat in Tiltren, but you can still drink your fill!
If one of your Companions doesn't carry their weight, don't be afraid to teach them new skills. We can help you with that. For a price.

Respec.text: Done. Now that was some intensive training, am I right?

Start.text:
Look what the sea coughed up: an Ihrian ship.
With all that damage, I'm amazed it didn't sink.

Next1.text: I buried the corpses I found on board. If you ask me, these Guards were hit by a pirate attack it seems <narrator>the Belerion Archipelago</narrator> is positively teeming with them.

Next2.text: Listen, I've been looking for work ever since I left Edoran. If you bring me some materials and a bit of gold for my trouble, I can bang this tub back together for you. That way, you could sail around wherever you like.

Wood1.text:
Hmmm...
I've seen better-quality wood, but I'll do my best.

Gold1.text: By Saint Jeru! I haven't seen this much gold in one place in ages. What a beautiful sight!

Done1.text: Don't move, I'll have this ship ready for you in no time.

Done2.text: Tada! All done! You can climb aboard and sail to the Belerion Archipelago.

Done3.text: Don't worry about me. With all these Krowns, I can start my own business and get a new lease on life.

Next1_DLC.text: I think I can bang it back together for you, but you'll need to learn to sail if you want to reach the <narrator>Belerion Archipelago</narrator>.

line0.text: Agree to help the carpenter.

line1.text: Bring 10 Wood and 200 Krowns to the carpenter to rebuild the ship.

Start.text: I am terribly sorry, Mercenaries, but here is nothing of interest for you here.

Next.text: This is but a simple sawmill, and I am its humble owner.

Negociatetimer.text: Tick-tock, tick-tock... Time's running out and still no Refugee in sight...

Deliver.text: I think this is the beginning of the very profitable partnership.

Deliver2.text: Come along, you lovely people, into the basement!

line0.title: Sleazy Slavers
line0.props.helpTip: Capture slaves and take them back to the sawmill within the time limit.

Start.text: This woman promised us honest labour! And look what we got! We're treated worse than slaves!

Next.text: And the Guard turns a blind eye! But then again, why would anyone help Edoranian Refugees?

Start.text: D-don't hurt me! If they flog me one more time...
I will not go anywhere until this old fool comes to his senses! I refuse to send my parents out on the roads again. I just can't do it.

Next.text: You agreed to help me, so please, convince him to let us stay, and you will get your reward.

End.text: Has he accepted? ... Oh, blessed be the All-seeing Eye! You cannot imagine what this new home means for the three of us. Please, accept this as a token of our gratitude.

End2.text: I have to go. I must tell my parents the wonderful news. They will be thrilled!

SettingLog.text: Thanks to you, the Refugees can stay in the Sheepfold.

Start.text: Are you here to catch some fish? Well, I hope you know what you are doing.

Next.text: What's it to you if I use that Sheepfold or not? That has nothing to do with it! That pile of rubble is mine! That woman has no right to stay there and is making a fuss. I'll pay you handsomely if you make her leave!

Threat.text: Come now, no need to get so upset! They can keep that old pile of rubble!

Bribe.text: Ha! But if you want to buy the Sheepfold, that's a whole other story... That pile of rubble is all your... or theirs, for all I care.

End.text: What now?

End2.text: Ha! Fine work you've done there! That' a relief! Here's a little something for your efforts.

End3.text: I don't know what I'm going to do with that Sheepfold yet, but it was a matter of principle!

SettingLog.text: You chased the Refugees from the Sheepfold.

Wanted.text: You have threatened an elderly man.

Start.text: ... Why refuse? We are sheep farmers. If you would just let us stay in the sheepfold, we could...

Next.text: Absolutely not! I inherited this barn from my sister. I will not let anyone take it from me!

Next2.text: But you are not even using it! You are a fisherman. What use would you have for a sheepfold?

Next3.text: That is none of your business! I will do as I please with my property! And I will do what I must to protect it from raiders.

MissionDesc.text: Decide what will become of the Sheepfold.

Start.text: This type of trunk is usually given as a dowry for a wedding. This one look fairly old.
My parents were sheep farmers back in Edoran. When I brought them to this abandoned Sheepfold, their tired faces lit up, and I saw hope in their eyes for the first time since we left.

Next.text: Unfortunately, we've just learned that this building belongs to a man called Wilburt. I would like to meet him and convince him to let us stay here.

Next2.text: But I would feel safer if Mercenaries such as you could escort me. The good people of Tiltren do not look kindly upon us Refugees. I fear this Wilburt person might become violent or refuse to even listen to me. I am willing to give you all I have for my parents' safety.

Next3.text: Oh, thank you! I will meet you there.

End.text: Thanks to you, we now have a roof over our heads. This is more than we hoped for when we fled Edoran.

MissionDesc.text: Convince Old Wilburt to give his Sheepfold to the Refugees.

line0.text: Take on Danae Pavii's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Ah! When Lord Laheart burned down my stables, my whole livelihood went up in flames. But Danae found us this place, a true blessing from the Eye!

End.text: We need to leave? But... where is my daughter?

Start.text: My daughter is very proud to have secured this Sheepfold, but we lack the necessary materials to rebuild it. Would you be willing to trade some for a little food and a very useful recipe?

Thanks.text: Oh, you are ever so generous! I haven't been this happy since the beginning of the war.

AcceptEnd.text: Oh, you are ever so generous! I haven't been this happy since the beginning of the war.

Bis.text: My daughter told me everything. I know what you did for us, and I will never forget it.

Alt.text: My daughter told me everything. I know what you did for us, and I will never forget it.

Give.text: I am terribly sorry to have to ask after all you've done for us, but we still need materials.

End.text: Have you come to see all the harm you've done? I won't give you the pleasure. Goodbye.

line0.title: Starting Over
line0.props.helpTip: Give the refugees 10 Wood to rebuild their house.

Start.text: When I think of how many people don't shoe their ponies, it makes me want to pull out the little hair I have left!

Next.text: Tell you what. Buy a horse from us and I'll throw in the horseshoes for free!

Horse2.text: But, for the Eye's sake, use them on your new steed.

End.text: Need a new Companion?

line0.title: If the Horseshoe Fits...
line0.props.helpTip: Buy a pony to be eligible for the special offer.

Start.text: Although the war in Edoran has been a boon for my business, I cannot help but feel for my poor ponies...

Next.text: I can tell you aren't soldiers. Take them with you if you can. Otherwise, they would most likely end up dead on the battlefield through no fault of their own...

line0.text: Take on Claes' mission.

line1.text: Find someone willing to hire Claes.

Start.text: Please, untie me! Laheart's goons could be here any minute. They want to take me back to Edoran.

Next.text: I am no danger to anyone. They are after me because I deserted! You can't imagine what they do to artisans like me in Arthes. Count Laheart treats us worse than slaves!

Release2.text: I'll work for anyone except Count Laheart. I'm an excellent craftsman, you know. I can do wonders!

Release3.text: Take me with you, and lead me to my future boss. I may not have the gold to pay you, but times like these, I imagine he'll pay handsomely for a man of my talent.

line0.title: The Man in Chains
line0.props.helpTip: Pick the lock to free the blacksmith.

Start.text: Name's Brennan, Master Tracker. Our brotherhood is tasked with the culling of all the wild beasts on the continent. We reward hunters for their kills and protect the common folk from these vicious animals.

Next.text: If you want to join us and learn from us, you'll need to prove your worth and take part in your first Hunt.

Next2.text: Come back victorious or do not come back at all.

Alphadead.text: Interesting... Very interesting... A hunt worthy of a Tracker! To think you've accomplished this feat with such flimsy armour!

Alphadead2.text: To survive our hunts, you will need to upgrade your armour using layers.

Alphadead3.text: Besides protecting the wearer, the layers and patches worn by Trackers mark their feats. Making these requires some skill, and the right to wear them must be earned.

Alphadead4.text: Here, take this Armour Layer Pattern. The world will know of the fierce battle you waged against Sikha.

Alphadead5.text: The Brotherhood operates throughout the land, but be warned: our quarries can be far from ordinary...

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Tiltren Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Brennan.

Start.text: Don't even bother trying to sell me your filth. I am in need of fangs to accomplish our ancient rituals.
Envious of our war paints, are you? Haha! You're not the first!

Next1.text: Sorry, Mercenaries! Only those who have been initiated in our ways may sport these.

Next2.text: To become part of the lucky few, you must travel to Ludern and ask the druid in the Tules' Glade. But be warned: the way there is fraught with danger.

Tatoo1.text:
You went to the Tules' Glade?
Why, colour me impressed! You truly deserve your war paints. Who wants to go first?

Tatoo2.text: Does anyone else among your Companions want an ornament?

Start.text: My concoctions can heal the most grievous injuries. Be sure to hold on to the vials after using them!!

Done.text: There... I hope you will be more careful next time.

Start.text: I hope the result is to your liking.

Next1.text: In this camp, you will find a chest to store unneeded items, as well as stools where you can leave Companions who are slowing you down. I can also arrange trips between travel posts you built in other villages.

Next2.text: Where would you like to go?

line0.props.disableReason: Build travel posts in other villages to travel there quickly.

Start.text:
It's an honour to meet you, Mercenaries!
I come to you today on behalf of the <narrator>Pedlars Guild</narrator>, who have been following your adventures ever since you started renovating Travel Posts.

Next1.text:
We knew your efforts would soon bear wonderful fruit, and we were right!
You've made such a reputation for yourselves that several local leaders are willing to let you build a <narrator>Trade Route</narrator>.

Next2.text: <narrator>Trade Routes</narrator> replace roads connecting towns, and since they're paved, they allow for faster travelling. Thanks to this technological advancement, our guild could transport exotic wares between different regions. Sounds great, doesn't it?

TradeRoute1Next1.text:
Brilliant!
Then let's build the first route of your future trade network!
As your reputation grows, villagers will beg you to build more.

TradeRoute1Next2.text: Now you just have to pay! Choose a road connecting two towns with a Travel Post, and we will start supervising the construction right away.

TradeRoute1Next3.text: The Pedlars Guild is honoured to have your trust, and hopes this gift will encourage you to continue doing business with us.

TradeRouteWait1.text: I trust that you will find our Trade Routes to be satisfactory.

line0.props.disableReason: Your troop must reach Tier 9 of the <narrator>Trade and Crafting</narrator> Path.

line1.props.disableReason: Your troop must reach Tier 10 of the <narrator>Trade and Crafting</narrator> Path.

line2.props.disableReason: Your troop must reach Tier 11 of the <narrator>Trade and Crafting</narrator> Path.

line3.props.disableReason: Your troop must reach Tier 12 of the <narrator>Trade and Crafting</narrator> Path.

TradeRoute2Next1.text:
Mercenaries! I have great news for you!
The latest road you built and your growing reputation convinced more villages to get their own Trade Routes.

TradeRouteReward5.text:
The guild is thoroughly satisfied with your work. I hope this collaboration has been as beneficial for you as it has been for us, Mercenaries.
If you ever need to build another Trade Route in the future, you know where to find us.

NoConstructibleTradeRoutes.text:
I hope you're well, Mercenaries.
The guild is very satisfied with the routes you've built.

ConstructibleTradeRoutes1.text: Would our know-how be of use to you in establishing a Trade Route? If you've got the funds, our Guild would be more than happy to help you. Just be aware that since this request doesn't come from the Guild, you won't be getting a reward.

ConstructibleTradeRoutes2.text: I hope you'll be fully satisfied with this new route.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

Start.text: This travel post was one of Tiltren's jewels, but it's been abandoned for years.

Next1.text: With appropriate funding, I could help you rebuild the place. You could then use it to travel quickly from one village to another.

line0.props.tipText: Build the Tiltren Travel Post.

Build.text: You won't have to wait long, craftsmen are ready to get to work.

Start.text: You can use my anvil. I can also repair your armour.

Bis.text: You can use my anvil. I can also repair your armour. Oh, and I'm looking to hire a skilled blacksmith, if you happen to know one...

line1.props.tipText: Suggest Claes as new blacksmith.

Repair.text: A few dents here and there, nothing more. There, good as new!

Blacksmith.text: I asked you for a blacksmith and you bring me a Refugee on the run from an Edoranian count?! Oh, very well, then. But he'll have to work out back. And don't you go telling anyone he's here!

Accept.text: Now, take this, and keep your mouths shut!

SettingLog.text: The Refugee blacksmith now works for the Stromkapp Villagers.

line0.title: Hammer for Hire
line0.props.helpTip: Find a blacksmith and bring him here.

Start.text: The residents of Tiltren haven't exactly welcomed the Refugees with open arms, but never matter... They can just obey their new Mayor, for all I care.
Are you Mercenaries? I'll have you know that we do not take kindly to Refugees in these parts.

Next.text: Why, you ask? Because they have overrun our streets and are now taking to the roads! Edoran is sending our way anything with legs and a mouth that cannot wield a sword.

Next2.text: You have your work cut out for you... There is no lack of honest folk in need of help to fend off the Refugee menace!

Alt.text: I commend you for your service, Mercenaries. The locals hail you as the new Jeru.

Alt2.text: Better yet, you have come to our aid, and shown us that we must fight back! The good people of Tiltren are now determined to drive away the Refugee menace!

Alt3.text: Join me at the *Haven*. We will rid our land of this filth!

End1.text: Ah! I am very happy to see you! Finally, we can show you the true Stromkapp, a thriving, peaceful, honest community.

End1Next.text: We have rid our streets of these wretched Refugees. The Edoranians now know not to come here.

line0.text: Take on Lady Mayoress Gontrande's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Thank you for bringing me back to Stromkapp in one piece! I'll just wait for another caravan. And I must thank you properly!

Next1.text: I'll always keep you in my prayers to the All-Seeing Eye.

Start.text: Don't you recognise me? I was begging in the streets not so long ago!

Next.text: Don't you recognise me? You gave me some bread when I was starving. I will now return the favour and offer you a discount.

Start.text: You touch it, you buy it!
Those Refugees... I understand there's a war in Edoran, but that doesn't mean they can just help themselves!

Next.text: Anything tickle your fancy?

Start.text: Come, come! Take a look at my wares!

line0.props.tipText: Talk about Broker Aldeberth's offer with the merchant.

PathTrade1.text: You mean that Gosenberger, Aldeberth? Yes, he did approach me, but I only sell the wares of producers I know. I have no reason to trade with a foreigner.

line0.props.tipText: Scare him into dealing with Aldeberth.

Threaten1.text: I... I... Theres no need for that! After all, who wouldn't want to deal with such a respectable businessman?

Threaten2.text: I agree to buy his wares and to sell them here in his name. However, I require proof that he can hold up his end of the bargain. I believe the exquisite Marheim commodity everyone's talking about will do the trick.

Convinced1.text: Youre right. He needs to offer goods, meats and spices that we dont have access to in Tiltren. That could make me famous!

Convinced2.text: I agree to buy his wares and to sell them here in his name. However, I require proof that he can hold up his end of the bargain. I believe the exquisite Marheim commodity everyone's talking about will do the trick.

Accepted1.text: What an amazing smell! I can already see the clients rushing to my stall to find out what smells so wonderful and buy it at any cost! My colleagues will be green with envy! Aha!

Accepted2.text: I agree to deal with this merchant of yours. But my previous providers are far from pleased. I have received a number of threats since your last visit.

Accepted3.text: You have to deal with them or my stall will be in ruins next time you stop by. One of my clients told me she saw them giving me the eye, just outside Stromkapp.

MissionDesc1.text: Bring the required goods to the merchant.

MissionDesc2.text: Protect the Tiltren Merchant.

End1.text: Ah! Finally, the All-seeing Eye looks kindly upon us!

End2.text: Go and tell that merchant of yours that he can count me in! He should receive an order in the coming days.

Start.text: Please, can you spare some food...?

Feed.text: Thank you so much. I will pray for you.

End.text: Thank you so much. I will pray for you.

Start.text: For a few Krowns, I can polish your armour. Please... I'm so hungry...

Accept.text: Here we go... A little spit and polish here and there... Done! So shiny I could go blind just looking at it!

Done.text: Thank you for all the money. It will be well spent!

Start.text: As the Merchant in charge of selling this little marvel, it's my pleasure to welcome you, Mercenaries!

Next1.text:
Take your time, have a look around this fine building, and just soak in the atmosphere!
Let me draw your attention to the low-maintenance dirt floor, and the roof that's never once failed in its hundred years of existence.

Next2.text:
But the best part, Mercenaries? The price!
For a tiny, almost inconsequential investment, you can finally become the proud Tavern keepers you've always dreamed of being!

line0.props.tipText: Buy the Tavern for a nominal price.

line1.props.tipText: Buy the Tavern.

End.text: Excellent decision, Mercenaries. You won't regret it.

End3.text: I'll leave you to your clean-up you won't be needing me anymore.

Alt1.text: Apologies, Mercenaries, but the owners of this architectural wonder will only sell to fellow Tavern Keepers.

Alt2.text: If you know of any, please be sure to tell them. This building is a great opportunity for anyone who wants to set up shop!

Start.text: My name is Aldeberth. I am the eldest son of a family seeking to join the Broker Council. But for a merchant to obtain the coveted Broker title, they must prove their supply lines are efficient and their business partners reliable.

Next1.text: Unfortunately, I am lacking the latter. I believe Mercenaries such as you , who know the value of both shiny Krowns and sharp swords, can be of help.

Next2.text: I need you to convince Tiltren and Marheim shopkeepers to become my local resellers. You will speak with them, possibly negotiate or even bribe them, so that they agree to sell the wares I will provide.

Accept.text: Excellent. Meet me here once youve finished.

Wait.text: You speak in my name when dealing with the merchants. Try to be on your best behaviour.

End1.text: Have you succeeded? Are they willing to be part of my trade network?

End2.text: Ah! Wonderful! Im going to be rich! I will be a Broker in no time! Rest assured I will not forget your help.

End3.text: Here is your reward. Its a Broker speciality, and can prove very useful for those in your field of work.

line0.text: Take on Aldeberth's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
Pst! You! Yeah, you!
You looking for work? I can give you tips and point you toward the best missions, The kind that pays much better than the measly rewards the Mercenary Guild has to offer...

Next.text: Of course, you'll then have to meet the client and meddle in other people's affairs... But at the end of the day, it's the number of Krowns in your purse that counts, right?

Done.text: I thought you might be interested. Anything else I can do for you?

line0.props.tipText: The wife of a man condemned to the gallows is desperately seeking help.

line1.props.tipText: Someone needs help in the Abandoned Tower. At least, that's what he's screaming out the window...

line2.props.tipText: A Refugee is looking for Mercenaries who can fight as well as they can negotiate.

line3.props.tipText: The captain of the Guard is looking for Mercenaries to help him bring a criminal to justice.

HangStory.text: The wife of a man condemned to the gallows is desperately seeking help.

BlacksmithTower.text: Someone needs help in the Abandoned Tower. At least, that's what he's screaming out the window...

Fisherman.text: A Refugee is looking for Mercenaries who can fight as well as they can negotiate.

Rovand.text: The captain of the Guard is looking for Mercenaries to help him bring a criminal to justice.

DeliverMessage1.text: After checking the letter's seal, the Informant tucked it away inside his clothes. Your discretion would be appreciated, as this is confidential information.

End.text: I have no further information for you. You already know everything there is to know.

PathCrime1.text: When I got my hands on this item, I immediately thought of you, Mercenaries.

PathCrime2.text: This key provides access to a security system we would like to put to the test. It is said to be tamper-proof in these <narrator>instructions</narrator> written by its Gosenberger inventor, a claim that we Informants wish to ascertain.

PathCrime3.text: It just so happens that a number of people and factions are already using this system. All you have to do is find whom this key belongs to, gain access to the invention and then best it. Should you get your hands on any treasure in the process, the Informants would see no objection to letting you keep it.

PathCrime4.text: Did you take a good look at the key? It's likely to hold a clue about its true owner.

PathCrimeEnd1.text: No need to report to me, Mercenaries. I have already been informed of your success.

line0.text: Buy the Noble's Key from the Informant.

line1.text: Find and thwart the security system matching the Noble's Key.

Start.text: Oh, it's so nice and warm here. So different from the Haven!
Say, it's not often you see new faces around here. Well, apart from the Edoranian war Refugees, that is...

Next.text: Feel free to come back often! There's always folks looking for work around here. Especially since all the fighting started across the border.

End.text: So, want to find out what's new in Tiltren?

Start.text: Oris was born in Akhed, just like my parents. I'm proud to fight alongside him.
I always come to watch the arena fights when I'm passing through the archipelago.
When they first arrived here, the Ihrians thought arena fights were barbaric. Nowadays, our stands are always full of spectators.

Next1.text: Anyone can challenge our champion as long as they have at least one fighter armed with a katar, claw or cestus.

Completed.text: You're amazing, Mercenaries! I've seen many warriors fight here, but none of them could hold a candle to you!

Completed1.text:
Oris's weapon is yours, as custom dictates.
Come back and challenge our fighters whenever you like.

ArenaLost.text: Don't let a defeat get you down! Train up and come back to challenge our fighters!

ArenaDiff.text: Still hungry for a fight? Face off against our champion again he and his lads have been training hard since your victory.

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text: Another victory amazing! You must have some secret...

CompletedDiff2.text: But don't worry, I won't ask. Got to maintain that air of mystery for your fans, right?

CompletedDiff3.text: This is the last reward we can offer you. Still, you can always come back and fight for the fun of it!

ArenaAgain.text: I can see that hunger for combat in your eyes! Don't say another word I'll tell our fighters to get ready!

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedAgain.text:
I think I saw pirates in the crowd.
You are making quite a name for yourselves in the archipelago!

Start.text: Sorry, but the rules say I can only sell my wares to the winners from the arena.

Alt.text: I saw you in the arena before. That was one hell of a show!

Start.text: You find a diary tucked between the corpse's layers of plate and mail.
<narrator>On the counsel of the scholar Octius, I made my way to the Tomb of the Belerion Archipelago.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>There I found the weapon the Ancients used to battle the Sea Serpent, and took it for myself. Armed with this strange spear, I should be able to rid the kingdom of that monster.</narrator>

MissionDesc1.text: Talk to Hector Halios.

MissionDesc2.text: Bring Hector Halios back home.

line0.text: Exterminate the sea creatures.

line1.text: Search the area for some trace of Belerion Halios.

Start.text: Look, Mercenaries! It's the wreck of the Empress! My ancestor's ship! I'd recognise my family's coat of arms even at the bottom of the sea.

Next1.text: We need to get closer! I have to know what happened.

MissionDesc1.text: Defeat the sea creatures.

MissionDesc2.text: Investigate the area.

Start.text: A battle worthy of Belerion Halios himself! If his spirit still haunts the archipelago as they say, I'm sure he was watching with a smile!

Next0.text: Now that we've got the place to ourselves, let's have a look around.

Next1.text: Surely those sirens must have kept the ship's treasures. If we find them, we'll learn what glorious death Belerion met, and then all of Edoran will be fighting to hear my story...

Weapon1.text: What a strange weapon! Let me have a look!

Weapon2.text:
By Saint Jeru, is this the sort of weapon they used 300 years ago? It looks a bit like a spear, or one of those Ihrian ballista bolts.
Let's keep looking and see if we can find anything more interesting!

Weapon3.text: So that's the weapon of the Ancients Belerion Halios wielded... Show it to me, would you?

Weapon4.text: A short spear? It looks like one of those bolts that the Ihrians use for their ballistas. Belerion really was brave to face a monster with such a weapon!

End1.text: What have you found? My ancestor's diary? Let me see!

End2.text: Unbelievable it says here that Prince Belerion Halios fought a Sea Serpent with a weapon of the Ancients!

End3.text: We must find this weapon! It might still be here!

End4.text: That man was a truly extraordinary hero! I can't wait to exhibit these treasures in my manor. Too bad you had to destroy that fang, it was the only proof of the monster's existence...

End5.text: Well, Mercenaries, I think we've found what we came for. Let's go back to my place to celebrate. My wife will be thrilled to see you!

MissionDesc1.text: Investigate the area.

MissionDesc2.text: Bring Hector Halios back home.

Start.text: The sirens look pretty well settled in.
Hands off, Mercenaries!

Next2.text: That's smuggled contraband. Returning it to its owners could prove very lucrative.

MissionDesc.text: Return the Plague Remedies to the leader of the Smugglers.

line0.text: Eliminate the sea creatures preventing you from approaching the shipwreck.

line1.text: Inspect the shipwreck.

line2.text: Eliminate the pirates preventing you from approaching the shipwreck.

line3.text: Inspect the shipwreck.

Start.text: The body of a Smuggler, half-eaten by saurians.
This man was dead long before washing up here.
This is our wreck! We were here first!

Next0.text: Just because you killed the saurians doesn't give you any claim to it! Shipwrecks belong to whoever finds them!

Next1.text: We've been waiting for hours for those beasts to finish eating the drowned crew. So there's no way we're letting you touch even one plank of that bloody ship!

Start.text: The saurians are preventing you from getting any closer.
May Jeru... ... the captain has abandoned us... stole the lifeboat... find my body... don't open... The rest of the note is unreadable.
There's a key around this skeleton's neck.

line0.text: Find out what's happening on the ghost ship.

line1.text: Eliminate the Plague-ridden.

Start.text: <narrator>You couldn't ask for better sailing conditions. It seems the God of Light has blessed our return voyage. Not a cloud in the sky, but a brisk wind bringing us ever closer to our beloved Edoran.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Morale on board is high. The men are thrilled to be returning to their families. None of these lads will miss the Harag swamps.</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>Even so, I must stay vigilant. A few fights broke out this morning when the cook handed out the last of the meat rations. With any luck, rationing the alcohol will calm the men down.</narrator>

Start.text: The hold is infested with Plague-ridden!
A Dihya, starved to death.

line0.text: Bring 5 fat to the travellers.

line1.text: Talk with the three travellers.

line2.text: Decide what to do with the runaways.

Start.text: Hey! Hold on! What do you mean, you're Mercenaries? Why didn't you say so in the first place?

Next1.text: Please, I'm begging you! Don't take us back to our parents! We don't want to spend our lives on some remote island like Tebessa! We want to explore the world, meet people from other lands... We want to live!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the runaways to return home.

line1.props.tipText: Teach the runaways a lesson.

line2.props.tipText: Agree to look the other way for a small fee.

Convinced1.text:
I suppose you're right.
If we explain it to them that way, our parents will probably let us choose our own path.

Convinced2.text:
All right, we'll go back to Tebessa.
I guess we should give you a little something for your help. That's how Mercenaries do things, right?

Negociate1.text: Yes! No problem! As soon as we reach the <narrator>Smugglers' Bastion</narrator>, we'll send you our first week's wages. Promise!

Start.text: We've been walking all day I can't take another step. If only we could get a fire going...

Next1.text: I ran away from home to become a Smuggler. It wasn't exactly my dream job, but at least it'll get me far away from here.

Next2.text:
What about you? You seem to know a thing or two about travelling. I can tell by your equipment...
What do you do for a living, then?

Start.text: How are we supposed to sleep with all that howling?

Next1.text: This is the first time I've been away from my parents for this long. I guess I miss them a bit...

Next2.text: You're Merchants, right? If you ever make port at <narrator>Tebessa</narrator>, could you tell them their son is all right?

Start.text: Dammit! Who would have thought starting a fire would be so hard? Why won't it light? What am I doing wrong?

Next3.text:
I'm begging you, we haven't had a hot meal in days.
Whoever you are, please help us. We're at the end of our rope!

Give2.text:
I would have never thought to use fat like that.
Let me make the food, it's the least I can do to thank you.

Give4.text:
Go on, help yourselves! There's plenty left in the pot.
And while you're eating, we'd love to hear any advice you may have. You look like you've travelled a lot.

Talk1.text: It's lucky we ran into you! I don't know what we would've done without your help.

Talk2.text:
We were actually this close to turning ourselves in!
Imagine the looks on our parents' faces if they hadn't even had to hire Mercenaries to bring us back.

Start.text: We surrender! Please, we get it!

Next1.text: You're right, we're not ready for the adventuring life. I promise that if you let us go, we'll head straight home to our parents. We'll never leave Tebessa again.

Next2.text:
Here, take this. That's, uh... That's your bounty.
So we're even, right? Please don't hurt us!

Start.text: Belerion Halios, setting out to fight the scourge of the archipelago.
Saint Jeru guiding men toward the Light.
The emblem of the Empire of Jeru before it became the Kingdom of Edoran.

MissionDesc1.text: Upgrade your boat.

MissionDesc2.text: Bring Hector Halios to Ferath.

MissionDesc3.text: Break through the rocks blocking entry into Farath.

line0.text: Take on Hector Halios's mission.

line1.text: Upgrade your ship and talk to Hector Halios.

line2.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.
