line0.text: Fight Laheart's Caravan by the destroyed bridge.

line1.text: Talk to Abbot Theocene.

MissionDesc.text: Escort Abbot Theocene to Saint Eleor Abbey.

Start.text: The abbot eyes you suspiciously.
Rebuilding this bridge is crucial to Merchant caravans! If there is only one road we can travel, bandits will know where to ambush us...

Next1.text: We can afford to hire workers, but were short on materials. Would you be willing to trade us what we need?

Give1.text:
Perfect. Please accept this small accessory in exchange for your stones.
Not only is it useful, but it will also fetch a good price if you sell it.

Give2.text: Come back in a couple of days, and this bridge will be as "Unstable" as it was before!

line0.text: Give 20 Sandstone to the Merchants rebuilding the unstable bridge.

Start.text:
They destroyed a bridge? By Saint Eleor!
Those so-called lords dont respect anything!

Well done, Mercenaries!
Go and stand in front of the bridge. They will be here any minute now.

Wait.text: Are you keen to fight? So am I! I can feel the Eye's gaze upon us.

End1.text: Praised be Saint Eleor! Praised be our Guide Jeru! Praised be the Great Eye. We've done it! Mercenaries, this is wonderful - it is a blessed day, indeed.

End2.text: Laheart won't dare venture into these parts any more. I'll spread rumours that the caravan was struck by the Eye's Reckoning... Yes! All their soldiers will quaver in fear. I'll do so upon my return.

End3.text: Also, I do not wish to unduly profit from your piety, but would you be so kind as to escort me to Saint Eleor Abbey? I will give you a well-deserved reward as soon as we arrive.

line0.props.tipText: Escort the abbot to Saint Eleor Abbey.

line1.props.tipText: Attack the abbot and keep the food for yourself.

Accept2.text: One last effort, my friends. There may be more soldiers nearby.

Attack.text: No! No! I meant it in all seriousness. I was really going to give you a reward!

StealAttack.text: How dare you steal the people's tax money? You're nothing but miscreants!

MissionDesc.text: Wait for nightfall and the arrival of Laheart's caravan.

MissionDesc2.text: Escort Reverend Theocene to Saint Eleor Abbey.

SettingLog.text: Abbot Theocene died by your hand.

line0.text: Destroy the bridge supports.
Fight Lahearts Caravan by the destroyed bridge.

line1.text: Talk to Abbot Theocene.

Start.text: After Claes fled, the Counts henchmen needed a new blacksmith to replace him. I havent seen my family in weeks.

Repair.text: Your armour is in a much better state now.

Note.text:
<narrator>Sergeant Odrin!
Tell your men not to place any chest to the right of the treasure. It mustn't be destroyed by an explosion.</narrator>

<narrator>Sergeant Odrin,
Do not place any key in this row. I don't have enough for all of these blasted chests.</narrator>

<narrator>If you don't want to lose your hands, keep them off the chest below this one!
Captain Hostes has already booby-trapped it.</narrator>

<narrator>Do not take this Eye-forsaken key with you! I bought this system for a reason!
Keep it in the chest to the right of this one.</narrator>

<narrator>There is a reason the Gosenberger said that two keys must be placed on this diagonal!
Do you think you know better?</narrator>

<narrator>Sergeant!
Stop skimping on Alazarian powder. A servant accidentally triggered the chest to the right of this one, and the explosion barely singed his nose hair.</narrator>
<narrator>The Countess is most displeased with this new investment. Do not mention it in her presence.</narrator>

<narrator>Sergeant Odrin,
I'm still waiting for you to move this chest.There shouldn't be anything above the key to the treasure.</narrator>
<narrator>Sergeant, I trust that you stored the instructions safely and didn't leave them lying around.</narrator>

Start.text:
The robbers are here!
Grab them!

Bribe1.text: Ahem, this is... a tidy sum...

Bribe2.text:
Fine, we didn't see anything.
Now get out before we change our minds.

Start.text: The lock bears Laheart's crest.

MissionDesc.text: Find and attack a black caravan.

line0.text: Take on Captain Hostes' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Follow the Black Caravans to locate the concealed camp.

Start.text: The enemy's castle?! Laheart hates our abbey, he could have me hung! Let's get out of here!

Our spies have spotted strange black caravans around Vernalis' castle. According to our sources, they seem to be ferrying large amounts of gold. This could mean our opponent is getting help from someone outside the region.

Next2.text: These caravans must be stopped if we want Vernalis' finances to dwindle. That is where you come in.

Repeat.text: You are going to accompany me: hidden amongst you, I will look like a mere Mercenary, and we will infiltrate the enemy territory. We will then attack one of these black caravans and get to the bottom of this. Do you accept this mission?

Accept.text: Good. One more thing: it would be best if I did not fight. We cannot run the risk of Vernalis' soldiers recognising me and raising the alarm.

Start.text: Count Laheart is willing to pay handsomely whoever recruits able-bodied men to fight in our ranks.

Next.text: Renegades from both Vernalis' army and ours have gone into hiding in the region. They are capable soldiers, but... they have lost the will to fight.

Next2.text: If you can convince at least two of these groups to join our cause, the others will follow. And the bounty will be yours.

Accept.text: Very well, then! I will show you where you might find them.

Wait.text: We are counting on you, Mercenaries!

Reward.text: Ah! There you are! Have you come to collect your reward? Please also accept Count Laheart's personal thanks.

End.text: Count Laheart's cause is the only worthy one!

EndAlt.text: It's been a while since anyone has seen Deserters in these parts. I wonder where they all went.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

SettingLog.text: You have rallied Deserters to Laheart's cause.

line0.text: Take on Sergeant Odrin's mission.

line1.text: Bribe 2 of the Deserter groups marked on the map into joining Count Laheart's army.

line2.text: Report to Sergeant Odrin.

Start.text: Have you heard all these louts complaining about my so-called cruelty? How dare they? Am I supposed to forego my birthright just because Vernalis had a dream?

End1.text: Ah, my heroes! My most precious allies! My devoted Mercenaries!

End2.text: My officers speak very highly of you. They have been tremendously impressed with the missions you have accomplished on our behalf. I have therefore decided to entrust you with a very special task. As a thanks.

End3.text: Would you lay siege to Vernalis with me?

MissionDesc.text: Lay siege to Vernalis' castle.

line0.text: Take on Count Laheart's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Do not think for an instant that this war has changed anything to life in this castle.
Do not mourn Count Laheart and his people. They died because they opposed Jeru's will.

Next.text: You, however, have shown your devotion. The Church will be just as grateful and delighted as I am. Please accept this. I shall pray for all your endeavours.

Wait.text: I shall thank Jeru every day for this victory.

Start.text: Now that we have prevailed, I have become a countess, have I not?
If only I could meet my end as swiftly as my husband met his.
Lady Vernalis hasn't yet decided what will become of the countess. I feel sorry for her.
It is a privilege to prepare remedies for Lord Vernalis: I feel closer to the All-Seeing Eye than ever.

Next.text: May the All-Seeing Eye set its gaze upon you.

Start.text: What are you doing? Do you want to get me killed? Let's get out of here!
I only sell my wares to Lord Vernalis' allies: you'll have to prove your worth first!
I am sorry I doubted you. How can I help you?
Ah! It is a pleasure to see such a display. I haven't felt this good in years.

End.text: Here is your reward, my friends, an adequate compensation for your achievements, I dare say. The Legion is grateful they didn't have to step in. The Colonels and the General shall not forget your names!

End2.text: You will always be welcome in Arthes.

Start.text: My son... no...
My son is a Chosen One, just like Saint Jeru. Only a heretic would deny him the county. And that drunkard Laheart is exactly that, a heretic!
I must win this war, the All-seeing Eye wills it so. Jeru has revealed unto me that Count Laheart is a heretic. He must be ousted.

Next.text: Do you wish to assist me on my holiest of quests? You have my thanks. All true believers are welcome in my army.

End1.text: Blessed be Jeru, our paths cross once again. Thanks to you, we now have an advantage in this war. Soon, Arthes will rejoice in the one true Faith.

End2.text: Today, you must become the punishing arm of the Eye. Join my ranks one last time, and together we will drive Laheart, the heretic, from these lands.

MissionDesc.text: Attack Laheart's Castle and defeat him for Jeru.

line0.text: Take on Lord Vernalis' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Don't go anywhere near the wells. Don't try to drink their water. They have been poisoned. Only the one in the farmyard is not contaminated.

Next.text: I don't know how the saboteurs did it, but I am sure they were sent by Laheart, the Lord of Cowards! Who else would resort to such underhand tactics against an envoy of the Eye?

Next2.text: These ruffians will come back to finish the job. If you stop them, I promise you a reward worthy of your efforts.

Accept.text:
Glad to hear it!
Be vigilant, their hideout can't be very far!
I will also patrol the area, we need all hands on deck.

End.text: I am happy to see you, Mercenaries. I pray for your continued support.

MissionDesc.text: Find and arrest the saboteurs

line0.text: Take on Lieutenant Asercia's mission.

line1.text: Find and kill the saboteurs around Lord Vernalis' castle.

line2.text: Join Lieutenant Asercia.

Start.text: All able-bodied fighters have already been drafted. We can only recruit among the rabble now.

Next.text:
And that is where you come in...
No! No, I don't mean to include you in the rabble!

Next2.text: Ahem... We need someone to track down the soldiers who have deserted our army and Laheart's in order to convince them to rejoin our ranks.

Next3.text: Simple enough, isn't it?

Accept.text: Here are the last locations where the Deserters were spotted. Bring back at least two groups. The others will follow.

Wait.text: May the gaze of the All-seeing Eye be upon you. We have faith in you.

Reward.text: By Saint Eleor's grace, you have succeeded! We never doubted you. Here is your reward.

End.text: We will call upon you if we have a mission for you.

EndAlt.text: No Deserters have been spotted in these parts for quite some time. I wonder where they all went.

SettingLog.text: You have convinced the Deserters to join Vernalis' ranks.

line0.text: Take on Sergeant Preast's mission.

line1.text: Bribe 2 of the Deserter groups marked on the map into joining Lord Vernalis' army.

line2.text: Report to Sergeant Preast.

line0.text: Remove all obstacles to clear the passage between Edoran and Gosenberg.

Start.text: The passage to Vertruse Province is now open. Do you want to fast travel?
You have entered the wolf's den!
An extremely old altar built to commemorate a deadly rockslide.
Help! Help! Mercenaries!

Next1.text: Those wretched things ambushed us while we were sleeping! I'm begging you... You've got to help us!

Start.text:
By the Beast's fangs!
It's a lucky thing you came along! Those filthy monsters were about to eat us alive!

Next1.text: I don't know how to thank you... Take whatever you like from our camp. Help yourselves!

Next2.text: To think we came here to get away from the Guard!

Start.text:
I... I'm alive...
Praised be Saint Eleor.
The rats had a hearty meal.
This wolf has been nibbled on.

line0.text: Remove all obstacles to clear the passage between Edoran and Gosenberg.

Start.text: The passage to Arthes County is now open. Do you want to fast travel?
You've stirred up the mole-rats!
Saint Eleor herself guided you to us!

Next.text: We thought that we were done for, that everyone would be too busy with the war to ever bother with us. But our Holy Matron guided you! We're alive! Praised be Saint Eleor.

End.text: Praised be Saint Eleor.

line0.title: Buried Alive
line0.props.helpTip: Clear the debris.

Start.text: The light from those blasted torches is burning my eyes. We spent three days in total darkness.
You can hear muffled voices through the debris.
You know, this arena is usually only open to smugglers...

Next1.text: But since you came all this way, it wouldn't be fair to turn you away! Sign up if you want to fight. The rules are the same as in legal arenas.

NoBeginArena.text: Don't make a fuss, Mercenaries! I just told you we're happy for you to fight!

OnLeaveArena.text: Don't get spotted when you leave.

Completed.text: If I'd known you were that good, I would've bet on you, Mercenaries. Too bad!

Completed2.text: Take your reward. If you want another one, come back and face our best fighters.

ArenaLost.text: Don't be disappointed! I bet against you, and your defeat earned me quite a few Krowns.

ArenaDiff.text: You ready to face our fighters once again? I hope you know what you're doing. Kriss, our champion, has improved since last time.

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text:
Well fought, Mercenaries!
I bet on you this time, and you didn't let me down!

CompletedDiff2.text: Here's your reward. I hope you like it, because it's the last one we can give you.

ArenaAgain.text:
You're willing to fight for nothing?
No smuggler would do that, believe me!

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedAgain.text: Another victory for you! At this rate, you'll be the talk of the land all the way to Belerion!

Start.text:
Are you seriously expecting me to sell you anything?
You're not even smugglers.

Alt.text: Don't be so coy. Now that you beat our champion, you're part of the family.

Start.text: A hideout like this is important for morale.
Why settle for a shack when you can have a whole arena?
You dare come to our arena?

Next1.text: Our champion will take you down a peg or two!

line0.text: Get the Arthes Black Market reward.

Start.text: <narrator> The henchman doesn't appreciate your ignoring the Baron.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator> The henchman won't let you get any closer this stall is only for victorious pit fighters.</narrator>

line0.props.tipText: Get the reward corresponding to your level of Fame.
line0.props.disableReason: Win at least one fight in the pit.

Next2.text: The stall is filled with special rewards for the best pit fighters. The henchman watches carefully to make sure you take only your own reward.

line0.props.tipText: Get the reward corresponding to your level of Fame.

Start.text:
We rarely see the Baron down here he's a very busy man!
It's a great honour to be welcomed by him in person. Not all crooks are lucky enough to have the privilege.

Fighting in the pit is a great way to supplement my wages!
Just don't mention this to my captain, all right?
It's always a pleasure to trade with kindred spirits.
Welcome to my humble Black Market! I've taken the liberty of inviting you to our pit fights I hope that's not a problem.

Next1.text:
These performances may have a bad reputation, but they can be a real boon for the participants' careers. The most famous Mercenaries out there today got their start here.
The bets are just a pleasant side effect.

Next2.text:
If you're interested, my referee can tell you more.
She's been instructed to welcome you as members of our big, happy family.

Reward1.text:
That was some victory, Mercenaries!
You've treated our humble organisation to one of the most memorable shows we've ever seen!

Reward2.text: It'd be a shame to stop when you're doing so well! And with so many rewards still waiting to be won...

Reward3.text:
Let me teach you the passwords to my branch offices!
The other Black Markets are just dying to meet you!

Wait.text: Newcomers drive the bets up. I can't wait to see you at work!

Start.text:
The Baron wants to speak with you.
You won't want to keep him waiting.

Next1.text: I don't suppose you know how a pit works, do you?

Next2.text: There are multiple unique fights available there tell me your names and I'll sign you up. Each victory increases your Reputation, which gives you access to the pit shop.

Next3.text: There's no need to take on all the fights one after the other, but if you want Arthes' special reward, you'll have to win each one at least once. So, still interested?

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

FightLost1.text:
That was a real massacre.
Want to stop there, or do you want to get some revenge?

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

FightWin1.text:
That fight was more interesting than I expected. You really know how to excite the crowd, Mercenaries.
This reward is all yours.

FightWin2.text: Shall I sign you up for the next fight straight away, or would you prefer to rest a bit?

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

FightRedo.text:
You fought well, but no self-respecting crook will pay twice for the same fight!
If you want a reward, your fight needs to be worth our while.

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

Renounce.text:
Stop wasting my time!
Come back when you're sure you want to participate.

PitComeBack.text: Which of your Companions would like to take part?

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

WholePitWin1.text: You've won five fights! We don't see that every day around here. Even the Baron looked impressed! You've earned Arthes' special reward.

WholePitWin2.text:
If you ever feel like fighting in the pit again, let me know!
Your combat techniques are most entertaining!

PitAgain.text: Want to sign up for more fights? Please, be my guest! The crowd will be thrilled to see you.

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

WholePitWinAgain1.text:
Too bad the Baron missed that, it was quite the memorable fight!
You've certainly earned your reward.

WholePitWinAgain2.text:
I'd invite you to fight in the pit again, but we don't have any rewards left to offer you.
I'm sure no self-respecting criminal would agree to that.

PitNoGain.text:
You'll fight without getting anything in exchange?
That's the most surprising thing I've heard all day!

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

Start.text: This place reminds me of home. Did you see all those Gosenberg crests?
We offer wares of exceptional quality, and I know you will recognise their value.
I thought this travel post had been burned and ransacked!

Next1.text: I'm glad to see a young one take over.

Start.text: No one knows who burned this place to the ground Lord Laheart or Lord Vernalis. Regardless, its destruction caused a substantial loss of profits for Gosenberg merchants.

Next1.text: But every cloud has a silver lining: after rebuilding this travel post with my own hands, I am now its proud owner.

Next2.text:
Would you like to trade, Mercenaries? You seem quite business-savvy yourselves!
Here, take this as a welcome gift.

Reward.text: Feel free to come by any time. We offer unique wares brought in from all of the Five Kingdoms through the harbour.

Start.text: The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.
The chest is sealed by a puzzle. One of the pieces is missing.

MissionDesc.text: Use the Inquisition's map to find their rendezvous point.

Start.text: This chest is inaccessible.

line0.text: Find a way to open the heretic's chest.

Start.text: This is my house... or what's left of it.

Next1.text: My ingredients must still be in there amongst the rubble. Go ahead and take what you like it belongs to the troop now.

Next2.text: If I remember correctly, my apothecary's trunk was against the back wall.

Key1.text: I'm afraid I threw away the key in the mountains...

Key2.text: The Inquisitors showed up so fast! I wasn't about to let them get their hands on my most prized possessions.

End.text: Let us leave this place, Companions. This is all in the past now.

Start.text: The tunnel continues into darkness.

Wait, you think I'm wasting my time?
Legionaries promised me a large audience, but... they still haven't started playing!

Next1.text: The Legion's coin will flow!

Start.text: I can't believe we bothered rebuilding this place for nothing!

Next1.text: The Colonel let us fix it up, only to then proclaim that Rouste is unworthy of the Legion!

Next2.text: We have to change Rhoveres' mind! Our soldiers' morale depends on it!

Nego1.text: Find two officers willing to support us. They will have to send a sworn statement to the capital.

Nego2.text: For a <narrator>Corporal</narrator>, Form 6.B is enough, but a <narrator>Lieutenant</narrator> should at least sign Affidavit 5.7.90.G...

End1.text: Excellent work, Mercenaries! You have a knack for negotiation! Now we just need to rally a Corporal to our cause!

End2.text: Excellent work, Mercenaries! Now we just need to pray to the God of Light while we wait for an answer from the Quartermaster.

Rouste1.text: Finally! Mercenaries! We've got the authorisations we need! Colonel Rhoveres can't stop us now!

Rouste2.text:
So? How about a match?
After all this time, our players can't wait to get back on the pitch!

Rouste4.text: Of all the opponents we could've faced, you're certainly the only ones we're happy to lose to. It's a pleasure to offer you this fine reward.

Rouste5.text:
So, what did you think? Not bad, eh?
Come back whenever you want, we're not about to abandon this pitch.

RousteDiff1.text: Can't get enough of the pitch, eh? No surprise there, we feel the same way! So much so that our lads have been constantly training!

line0.props.tipText: Play Arthes' team in Hard mode.

RousteDiff3.text: After this defeat, I'm beginning to wonder whether Colonel Rhoveres was right...

RousteDiff4.text: Take this reward and make good use of it. It's the last one we have, meaning the next matches will be strictly friendly.

line0.props.tipText: Play Arthes' team in Hard mode.

RousteEnd3.text: I'm going to need time to recover from this...

line0.text: Talk to Colonel Rhoveres in the <narrator>Legion Camp</narrator>.

line1.text: Seek out Legion officers and ask for their signatures.

line2.text: Go back to the referee on the <narrator>Rouste Pitch</narrator>.

line0.text: Win a Rouste Match in Arthes.

Start.text: I hope the Colonel will let us play. We worked hard to restore this pitch.

Next1.text: An official request to the Empire? Look, Mercenaries, this could seriously jeopardise my career... I really want to play, but...

Bribe.text: This would make up nicely for any loss I sustain.

Convinced.text:
Yes, you're right.
Worst case scenario, the Quartermaster refuses, right?

Choice.text: Which form do I need to send again?

Wrong1.text:
This is... a requisition form for a new spear?
My career is at stake, but you have no idea what you're doing, do you?

Wrong2.text:
A report for stolen horses?
My career is at stake, but you have no idea what you're doing, do you?

Right.text: Very well, it will be done as soon as possible.

Allowed.text: I can't wait to face you on the pitch!

Start.text: I put my heart and soul into rebuilding this pitch! You wouldn't believe what it looked like when we found it!

The Colonel tricked us!
He never intended to let us play! He was just hoping to keep us busy until the end of the war.
Even at the height of the war, the Trackers cannot abandon their hunt.
You wish to join the Hunt? You are free to do so, but I must warn you, we hunt the Ghost Pack, and this quarry is nothing like ordinary game.

Next.text: These monsters only appear under the cover of darkness and wreak havoc wherever they go. It's a harrowing fight, which has taken many an excellent Tracker.

Next2.text: If you're still determined to partake in the Hunt, I can give you this map. It shows you where the tracks begin.

Accept.text: It will take all that you have to get through it.

Wait.text: Make sure that you are well prepared. I've seen the Pack take Trackers who were much more experienced than you.

End.text: You have my full respect and admiration, mercenaries. It's an honour to give you the blueprints for this upgrade.

AcceptWait.text: You have my full respect and admiration, mercenaries. It's an honour to give you the blueprints for this upgrade.

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Arthesian Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Broneith.

Start.text: If this is your first time hunting the Ghost Pack, I suggest you make sure you are fully prepared.
It is my honour to enhance the Trackers' features when they chase after the Ghost Pack.

Next1.text: To sport our war paints, you must first be initiated in our ways by a druid, at the heart of the Tules' Glade in Ludern.

Tatoo1.text:
News reached me that a group of Mercenaries was initiated in Ludern. I see it must be you!
Which of your Companions would like war paints?

Tatoo2.text: Does anyone else among your Companions want an ornament?

Start.text: Wouldn't surprise me if Count Laheart or Lord Vernalis ended up hiring us. Not that I would like it, but it's part of the job.

Alt.text: Glad this war is over. They say we have you to thank for that.

Start.text: Those guys over there are rubbish, completely hopeless. Don't make the same mistake: learn new skills if you dont want to end up like them.

Respec.text: Take your time to get used to your new specialisation before taking on tough opponents.

MissionDesc.text: Arrest Laheart's men in Boethius.

line0.text: Take on Abbot Theocene's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Aaaaaah... It hurts...
No! We can't go in there. The abbot supports Vernalis, he'd report me. Let's go!
I don't want to die... not so soon.

Don't tell the abbot I said this, but Lord Vernalis' sudden vision of Jeru is a bit strange, don't you think? I have been praying daily for over twenty years and the Guide has never once spoken to me.

AbbeyDead.text: Why are you coming back alone? Is the abbot all right? Shouldn't he be here by now?

Start.text: Lord Vernalis sent me to tend to the injured, but without providing me with the resources to do so.

Next.text: I would be very grateful if you could supply me with some flowers, specifically Snow Irises.

Reward.text: Thanks to you, I can finally get to work. Thank you very much. Take this, I hope it will prove useful.

Inactive.text: I'd like to prepare some remedies for you, but the injured are my priority.

AbbeyDead.text: You've come back without the abbot? He is all right, isn't he?

line0.title: First Aid
line0.props.helpTip: Give the apothecary 10 Snow Irises.

Start.text:
Have you come to pray for the soldiers' recovery and the victory of Lord Vernalis?
You really should, you know. Lord Vernalis is a devout man. Jeru came to him in a dream and identified him as the one true ruler of the land.

Next.text: It is my holy duty as an abbot to help him: that is why I am tending to his injured soldiers. But I so wish I could do more. Perhaps, if I paid you to take on a number of specific tasks...

Next2.text: How would you feel about stopping that usurper Laheart from levying his taxes? This would lessen the burden on the farmers, and I could feed the injured properly.

Accept.text: Blessed be Saint Eleor! Laheart's tax collectors never miss a chance to ransack Boethius. I will take you to the hamlet so you don't get lost.

End.text: How exciting that was! I almost felt like I was leading an army! Please accept this well-deserved reward and my blessing.

Reward.text: Enlisting the help of Companions such as you has been the miracle this Abbey needed. I will immediately send word of your invaluable help to Lord Vernalis!

Inactive.text: Thanks again. May the All-seeing Eye bless you.

SettingLog.text: You helped Abbot Theocene feed Vernalis' soldiers.

Start.text: When my sister was at sea, I used to stay here and weave wool. But with this horse causing all sorts of mayhem, I am too scared to go out and get my loom. This is all I could take with me.
Woe betides anyone mounting the Black Steed! The beast will take them into the night, never to be seen again.

Next.text: Never mind the mercenaries and the ruffians who lurk here! I'd rather die from a human hand than be taken away by a demon!

Start.text: We fled to the South when we saw it.

Next.text: The Black Steed! It was there! Just outside our fishery door.

Next2.text: If you want to live, avoid the river bank at all cost, and do not go anywhere near the fishery.

line0.title: The Black Steed
line0.props.helpTip: Find the Fishery haunted by the Black Steed.

Start.text: This pony seems to have escaped from a battlefield. It looks like it wants to follow you.
The trough is empty.

Throw.text: There are a few handfuls of wheat in the trough.

line0.title: The Empty Trough
line0.props.helpTip: Fill the trough with Wheat.

MissionDesc.text: Speak to Commander Hostes

Start.text: Commander Hostes reaches for his weapon as you approach the chests.

Treasure.text: The glinting gold almost makes you forget Hostes is watching your every move.

Start.text: Commander Hostes reaches for his weapon as you approach the chests.

Treasure.text: The glinting gold almost makes you forget Hostes is watching your every move.

Start.text: You can almost feel Hostes' gaze on you.

Treasure.text: The gold in the chest almost makes you forget Hostes is watching your every move.

Start.text: The woman we fought was a fearsome inquisitor called Octavia. I did not think I would ever see her again, but her presence here confirms one thing: the Inquisition is funding Vernalis.

Next.text: Or they used to, anyway. Now that we know who Vernalis' allies are, we can increase our presence at the border and keep a close eye on the churches and monasteries.

Next2.text: As for the *300*Krowns the inquisitors were kind enough to leave us, I will take them to Count Laheart. This seems fair compensation for all the suffering our army has had to endure.

Next3.text: Here is your share. No mercenary has ever proved more worthy of their stipend.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the reward.

line1.props.tipText: Attack Commander Hostes and take the chests.

Reward.text: I commend you on your bravery and your devotion. It was an honour to fight by your side, Mercenaries.

SettingLogHelp.text: You cut off the funding for Lord Vernalis' army.

SettingLogTraitor.text: Commander Hostes died at your hand.

Steal.text: How dare you steal this gold in front of me? You have no honour.

Start.text: Where is your carriage? Are you here by chance? You should take your leave and be quick about it.

Next.text: Who...? Captain Hostes?

Next2.text: Silly me! Of course, Captain Hostes! Only you could hide amongst a group of Mercenaries, you old weasel!

Next3.text: But your little charade ends here: your grubby Companions are no match for a professional army! Prepare to die!

Start.text: I'm serving under Colonel Rhoveres orders for the first time. Its an honour, everyone in the Legion knows his name.

Rouste1.text: Rouste? Absolutely not, Mercenaries! I refuse to do anything that would go against the Colonel's orders!

Bribe.text:
I admit I wouldn't turn down a few coins...
Well, then, tell me what I need to sign.

Convinced.text:
You think that would make me a leader in the eyes of the General?
All right! Tell me where to sign.

Wrong1.text: Is this right? It says here Report of stolen pony... The Rouste Field referee knows all about paperwork, maybe you should ask him.

Wrong2.text:
This... this is a requisition form for new sleeping bags...
The Rouste Field referee knows all about paperwork, maybe you should ask him.

Right.text: Done. This letter will leave with the next messenger.

Start.text: Apart from the Legion's steeds, all Arthesian horses have been requisitioned for Lords Laheart and Vernalis.

Next.text: These animals could make invaluable companions, but to be honest, they are too old to be of any use on the battlefield. They're yours if you want to buy them. Otherwise, I'm sure they will make a very tasty soup.

Repeat.text: So, new companion or pony soup?

End.text: Shame for the pony soup...

Start.text: The Church has asked the General to let the war decide of the land's fate, but the conflict is dragging on.

Next.text: Because of this so-called Chosen One, the situation has become extremely volatile. And Laheart is a drunkard who will never be able to defeat him. If the situation deteriorates any further, we will have to step in.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Colonel to let Legionaries play Rouste.

End1.text: Not a moment too soon! You drag your feet to come to me, yet you dash off to sow chaos throughout the land.

End2.text: What? Did you really think the Legion was unaware of your dealings? But worry not. You have unknowingly given us the perfect excuse to take over the region. Laheart and Vernalis have proved to the General that they were incapable of keeping a simple group of Mercenaries at bay.

End3.text: Would you care to finish what you started? The Legion will pay for your service. Quite the prestigious mission for a bunch of scoundrels.

Accept.text: Good. Join us in Cortia. We will take Laheart and Vernalis head on.

MissionDesc.text: Join the Legion and fight Laheart and Vernalis.

EndChaos.text: I'm planning on overseeing the region from this camp. I couldn't care less about what happens to those lords old castles.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Colonel to let Legionaries play Rouste.

EndNeutral1.text: My scouts told me that you played an important part in resolving this conflict.

EndNeutral2.text: Know that the General and I are truly grateful.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Colonel to let Legionaries play Rouste.

Rouste1.text: Mercenaries, I will not let my men roll around in the mud when they're meant to represent the Kingdom. End of discussion. You are dismissed.

line0.text: Take on Colonel Rhoveres' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: The General does not want us to be directly involved in the conflict, but we must make sure this war does not spread to the other counties of Edoran.

Next.text: There have been more and more sightings of Deserters gathering throughout Arthes. This could become a nuisance for the entire realm.

Next2.text: We are not supposed to attack Deserters as long as they stay put... However, there is nothing to prevent us from hiring Mercenaries to deal with them. Would you be interested?

Accept.text: Very well then. I will add their last known locations to your map. Slay at least two of these groups. That should be enough to deter the others from stirring up trouble.

Wait.text: The Legion expects great things from you.

Reward.text: In the name of the General and the Legion, here is your bounty. You have completed this mission impeccably.

End.text: I have no work for you.

EndAlt.text: What have you done? Oh well. Never mind. At least, the problem is solved. But don't expect a reward.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

SettingLog.text: You have eliminated the Deserters for the Legion.

line0.text: Take on the Legion Sergeant's mission.

line1.text: Defeat 2 of the Deserter groups marked on the map.

line2.text: Report to the Legion Sergeant.

Start.text:
Would you like to buy this map?
It is all I have left from my old life, but my children need food more than they need weapons.

Buy.text: Oh... Did you really just buy it? Thank you, thank you so much.

End.text: My children will not go hungry this week. This is such a relief.

line0.title: Past Career
line0.props.helpTip: Buy the former mercenary's map.

Start.text: It is written Danae Pavii, Edor Military School.
The crate contains a large number of books, some of which are much too technical for you.

line0.title: Buried Memories
line0.props.helpTip: Find a way to open the trapdoor.

Start.text: Oh no you don't! We got here first! This is our loot!

line1.props.tipText: Force the raiders to give up part of their loot.

Threat.text: Fine! Fine! We'll share, no need for insults!

End.text: Take this, it is half of what we got. Here's hoping we never meet again...

line0.title: Nothing goes to Waste
line0.props.helpTip: Get rid of the raiders.

line0.title: The Starved Neighbours
line0.props.helpTip: Go back and find out what happened while you were gone.

Start.text: We are so *hungry*...
It's my cellar, and I'll do whatever I want with it! If I want to pack it full of Plague-ridden wretches, that is my business.

Next.text: Dammit! They are my neighbours, my friends! You think they weren't here for me during the war? You think I am going to stand idly by while my wife is killing them?

Next2.text: If you really want to make my selfish wife happy, give me some food so they don't go mad. Or timber, so that we can reinforce the cellar door.

line2.props.tipText: Convince the man to let you kill the Plague-ridden people.

Give.text: This should bring back some semblance of peace in my marriage! Here's a little something to compensate you for your efforts.

Convinced.text: Fine, take this key and go slaughter my friends. My wife will be ever so pleased.

RepeartConvinced.text: Fine, take this key and go slaughter my friends. My wife will be ever so pleased.

Give2.text: Everything is fine now. You can leave, we are safe!

End.text: You should be ashamed of yourselves! My poor neighbours...

line0.title: Troublesome Neighbours
line0.props.helpTip: Decide what to do with the Plague-ridden that the man was hiding.

Start.text: I can't live like this any longer!

Next.text: I keep jumping in fear at all hours, thinking that these monsters have escaped from the cellar. You have to reason with my husband. He just will not listen to me!

Reward.text: I am so relieved you killed these monsters. Thank you. Let me pour you a drink: I was saving this for a special occasion!

End.text: With everyone so focused on the war, the Plague-ridden have been left unchecked. Thank the Eye you were here!

End2.text: Are you sure that will do the trick?

line0.text: Dig up the dragon bones.

Start.text: Don't... Don't tell anyone I'm here. Please.

Next.text: I beg you, you must keep this to yourselves. The citizens of Praino are out to kill me. They say I've been contaminated by the Plague, but it's not true.

Next2.text: My parents were already dead... There was nothing left to eat, I had no choice.

line0.props.tipText: Kill the young cannibal.

line1.props.tipText: Tell him that the villagers are planning to come and kill him.

line2.props.tipText: Leave the poor man alone.

Warn.text: Really? I... I must go! Thanks for letting me know.

Spare.text: Th... Thanks. I... I am going to leave Arthes. You'll never hear from me again.

line0.title: Family Meal
line0.props.helpTip: Decide what to do with the cannibal.

Start.text: This man is old. Part of the flesh in his thighs has been carved out.
She was an elderly woman. Her shoulder has been carefully carved out, but from the looks of it, she starved to death.
This wretched lout tried to hide his condition! We never noticed. He could have been contaminated weeks ago! To think of all those who were put at risk...

End.text: These poor souls suffered the worst possible fate, and we can't even provide them with a decent offering.

Reward.text: This will help them on their way to the All-seeing Eye. I thank you on their behalf.

RewardRepeat.text: This will help them on their way to the All-seeing Eye. I thank you on their behalf.

Start.text: Be careful, Mercenaries. A Plague-ridden man is at large in the area. Look at what he has done to his own parents!

Next.text: I am gathering volunteers as we speak to track him down and finish him off.

Next2.text: If you find him before we do, don't spare him. The villagers will be most grateful for your help.

End.text: Thanks for helping us kill this monster. We no longer have to worry about him coming back to haunt us, and his parents can now rest in peace.

End2.text: We have buried their remains according to the rites of the All-seeing Eye. I pray for them to go forth into the Light.

line0.title: Uncanny Cannibalism
line0.props.helpTip: Find and kill the Plague-ridden somewhere in Arthes.

Start.text: What am I to do? Laheart's soldiers will be here soon, and I can't pay the levy.

Next.text: Laheart's soldiers took quite a beating... They chose the wrong person to pick a fight with, right? Take this. I am just happy they didn't get their filthy hands on it.

End.text: You are not Mercenaries! You are heroes!

line0.title: The People's Father
line0.props.helpTip: Find Abbot Theocene and apprise him of the situation.

Start.text: We can't afford to pay... Laheart will burn our houses to the ground and have us flogged if we don't give him anything. Please, inform the abbot of Saint Eleor. He is the only one who cares about us!

Next.text: You defeated a whole patrol! You truly are amazing!

Start.text:
Oh, so that caravan was yours?...
You didn't seem that wealthy at first glance.

Next2.text: Thing is, now that I know you're rich, I can't let you leave without robbing you...

Start.text: This monster is by far the biggest boar you've ever seen!
So? What did the Colonel say?

Next1.text:
By the Beast's fangs! He's as stubborn as a crocswine!
We don't have a choice: we must bypass the Colonel and send our request directly to the Legion's Quartermaster.

Next2.text: Find two officers willing to support us. They will have to send a sworn statement to the capital.

Next3.text: For a <narrator>Corporal</narrator>, Form 6.B is enough, but a <narrator>Lieutenant</narrator> should at least sign Affidavit 5.7.90.G...

End1.text: Perfect, Mercenaries! Everything is in place. Our friend the Corporal was very cooperative. Next up, the Lieutenant...

End2.text: Perfect, Mercenaries! Everything is in place. Our friend the Corporal was very cooperative. Now we just have to wait patiently for the Quartermaster's answer.

NotifRouste.text: A message arrived in Arthes from the Legion's Quartermaster: legionaries are now allowed to play Rouste.

Start.text: There you are!

Next1.text: What? You thought we didnt know you were coming? That we just inadvertently forgot our map in that chest?

Next2.text: I cant believe such a crude trick actually worked! The Scholars clearly expected too much of you.

Next3.text: Therefore I have no qualms about terminating your contract with them. Your bodies will remind the Scholars to stay out of our business!

Start.text: Rat nest infestations are always more common in times of conflict. Watch your step out there.
A ghost? I am no ghost! I am Kaghal! The best hunter in Harag!

Next1.text: As for you... How dare you track me down, dogs of Edor! I will kill you!

Next2.text: Death to the General! Harag will live!

Start.text: This dated hunter's outfit looks very similar to those represented in the tapestries of the Edoranian War.

End2.text: How many decades has this man lived here alone?

Start.text: I must admit, I didn't expect Laheart and Vernalis to come to an agreement at the eleventh hour. Who knows, maybe they could have found common ground.

Next1.text: But I digress... As County Governor and Legion Officer, I, Colonel Rhoveres, thank you for your invaluable help.

Next2.text: You have more than earned your reward. The General will know of the role you played here

Start.text:
Under the General's order, the Legion is taking control of Arthes.
His Lordship will spare your lives if you turn yourself in without a fight.

Next1.text: How dare you, Colonel? I swore allegiance to the General. The Legion is supposed to support me!

Next2.text: This is heresy! The Legion cannot go against Jeru's will. I am his Chosen One, I am the one to rule us all!

Next3.text: I would rather throw my lot in with this mystic fool than give up my birthright to the General!

Next4.text: Shame you took so long to come to this conclusion...

Next5.text: On guard!

Start.text: Long have I prayed to see Count Laheart's soul rejoin the Light.

Next.text: Let us fight for the glory of the All-seeing Eye, Mercenaries!

Start.text: Look at them! Look how weak they have become! This is all your doing, Mercenaries! It is now up to you to finish them off.

Let us go! Please!
How could we have known this pony was so valuable?

Next1.text:
Just take it! Surely it's a fair trade for our freedom!
We stole it straight out of Laheart's stables! You won't find a better one!

Next2.text: Oh please, Mercenaries, I beg you! You don't need to kill us! We'll just leave! Your client will never hear from us again!

Accept.text:
The pony is yours! See, he likes you!
You won't regret it!

Wanted.text: You're travelling with a stolen pony.

Start.text:
Hello, dear colleagues! ...
What am I doing, you ask? Why, I am looting dead bodies, of course!

Next.text: No need to look so appalled! I am sure you have done the same to many of your own victims.

Next2.text: See, I was not mistaken, you really are my *colleagues*.

line0.props.tipText: You have nothing in common with these vultures!

line1.props.tipText: Hire your colleague.

Start.text: There they are! That's the Ghost of Harag! Kill them all!

line1.props.tipText: Try to convince the soldiers that you are actually alive.

Convinced.text: Sorry for the misunderstanding. We are a bit on edge, you see. We are looking for a ghost, but the snow makes it difficult to be sure of anything.

Convinced2.text: Lord Laheart was right. We will never kill a wraith at this rate. We should go back. Take this, maybe you will fare better than we have.

Attacked.text: Ouch... We took a serious beating. And you are not even dead. This is really embarrassing...

Attacked2.text: Lord Laheart was right. We will never kill a wraith at this rate. We should go back. Take this, maybe you will fare better than we have.

Start.text: Exploring the ruins was supposed to be child's play, but... we got lost before we even got there. We've been waiting to be rescued for days!

Next.text: We are exhausted. We do not have enough food to turn back nor any pitons to make it home the short way.

Next2.text: We beg you, please don't leave. Without you, we're all dead.

Give.text: Oh, blessed be the Eye! We are eternally grateful. Take this, it's always useful in the ruins.

AcceptGive.text: Oh! Blessed be the All-seeing Eye. We are eternally grateful. Take this, it's always useful in the ruins.

Start.text: Thanks for saving me. You are good people.

Next.text: You know, I don't regret eating my parents. No. It is their death that keeps me up at night.

Start.text: Phew! I am so relieved. The Plague-ridden should always be culled. Here's a small bounty for your efforts. Goodbye, Mercenaries.
Look! He was trying to escape! Kill him!

Villagers1.text: Please, no! I am not sick, let me go!

PlagueMan1.text: Don't listen to him. He ate his own parents. If we don't kill him now, he will hurt someone else!

Villagers2.text: I didn't kill anyone! My parents had already starved to death. I would have met the same end had I not...

PlagueMan2.text: Mercenaries! The village is offering *10* Krowns for you to slaughter him.

Villagers3.text: I am not a murderer! Mercenaries, you believe me, don't you? You've already spared me once!

Start.text: So, have you killed him? The Plague-ridden man who ate his parents?

Villagers1.text: Ha! Good riddance! You did well. Anyone infected by the Plague needs to be killed as soon as possible to stop them infecting others.

Villagers2.text: Take this. The village's food supplies are running low, but you have done so much for us!

Start.text: Where do you think you are going? Just hand over the reins, nice and slow!
Why has this bridge collapsed? Who are you? Where is our patrol?

MissionDesc.text: Report to the abbot.

Start.text: Mercenaries, I have bad news: there is no sign of the tax collector's carriage. I think the men you slaughtered were only patrolling the area.

Next.text: But let's not dwell on such a trivial mistake! These people may the Light forgive me for saying this they deserved to die. Worry not for your salvation, killing heretics is not a sin.

Next2.text: I have another idea: the tax collectors always cross a small bridge not far from here. We could ambush them.

MissionDesc.text: Go to the bridge with the abbot.

Start.text: Who... Who are you?
I got you! Is poisoning wells a joke to you? You are going to regret this!
Mercenaries? Where were you?

Next1.text: You have killed the saboteurs? Unbelievable! I take this path every day, and I never noticed this hole! Nothing gets past you!

Next2.text: Well done, Mercenaries! I am glad I hired you. Here is your reward, with the blessing of Lord Vernalis.

SettingLogVernalisEnd.text: You have prevented the poisoning of Lord Vernalis' last well.

Alt1.text: Ah! Mercenaries! I came to warn you as quickly as I could.

Alt2.text: The saboteurs have contaminated our last well. Your mission is now obsolete.

Alt3.text:
You've already killed them? Oh! Well, that is most inconvenient. If only you'd arrived earlier, this mission wouldn't have been such a failure for all involved.
Take this for your efforts. Thank you for trying to help.

SettingLogLaheartEnd.text: All of Lord Vernalis' wells have been poisoned.

NotSeen1.text: Hang on, Mercenaries! My name is Asertia, I am one of Lord Vernalis' lieutenants. We are looking for the scoundrels who are poisoning our wells. Any clue would be useful.

NotSeen2.text: What? You've killed them? I can't believe it! There was a bounty on their heads. I think it is only fair that you should have it.

NotSeenAlt1.text: In the name of Lord Vernalis, I order you to stop!

NotSeenAlt2.text: Are you the cowards who are poisoning our wells? Have you sold your soul to Count Laheart?

NotSeenAlt3.text: ... You killed the saboteurs? By Jeru! There was a reward for their capture, but that was before they poisoned the last well. Take your share. Their death is a revenge in itself.

CommandantMissionDesc1.text: Find a black caravan and follow it.

DesertersTrigger.text: The Legion invites you to join their ranks.

DesertersVernalis.text: Report to Sergeant Preast to receive your reward.

DesertersLaheart.text: Report to Sergeant Odrin to receive your reward.

DesertersLegion.text: Report to the Legion Sergeant to receive your reward.

LaheartEndMission.text: Report to Count Laheart in his castle.

VernalisEndMission.text: Join Lord Vernalis in his castle.

ChaosEndMission.text: Report to Colonel Rhoveres in the Legion Camp.

RousteAllowed.text: A message arrived from the Edoranian Quartermaster: legionaries are allowed to play Rouste.

Start.text: I'd rather die than go back to Laheart's army! This man is evil!

line0.props.tipText: Execute Deserters for the Legion.

line1.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Vernalis' army.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Laheart's army.

Vernalis.text: Yes! You are right! If I joined Vernalis' army, I could take my revenge on Laheart in a dignified way.

Laheart.text: You really think Laheart will win? If this is the only way to end this war, then so be it.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

Start.text: Why are you looking for us? I'd rather cut my leg off than go back to this degenerate army.

line0.props.tipText: Execute Deserters for the Legion.

line1.props.tipText: Convince them to come back in Vernalis' army.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Laheart's army.

Vernalis.text: Fine! No need to insult my mother. I'll go back.

Laheart.text: Pah! I might as well fight under Laheart's banner...

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

Start.text: I never believed in this *Chosen by Jeru* fable. Vernalis is just power-hungry, like his mother.

line0.props.tipText: Execute Deserters for the Legion.

line1.props.tipText: Convince them to return to Vernalis' army.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Laheart's army.

Vernalis.text: You are right, serving this impostor is better than struggling to survive in the woods.

Laheart.text: If Laheart pays us and treat us better than Vernalis did, we are happy to follow him to Garussa.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

Start.text: We might be traitors in your eyes, but what would you do if you were in our shoes? They are ordering us to fight a man chosen by Jeru!

line0.props.tipText: Execute Deserters for the Legion.

line1.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Vernalis' army.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them to return to Laheart's army.

Vernalis.text: They would be willing to recruit us? Say no more, we're in.

Laheart.text: My family needs the money... I guess this is the price I am willing to pay for eternal damnation.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

Start.text:
<narrator>As they approach the old well, your Companions hear a voice:</narrator>
What's the password?

line0.props.tipText: Say the password.

NoDlc.text:
<narrator>As they approach the old well, your Companions hear a voice:</narrator>
What's the password?

Start.text: Judging by the many footprints along the forest edge, there was a gathering here recently.

Next.text: Wheel marks in the mud lead east. It could be a caravan or a Legion carriage.

Start.text: The poor man looks terrified. Footprints lead away from the trail, towards the north-east.
I wanted to go back down and look for my friends, but my leg... I barely move and it starts bleeding again. I was bitten last night.

Help.text:
My leg feels much better, thank you.
Can I come with you? I want to find my friends.

Refuse.text: Oh, I see... Well, stay on your guard in these dark halls.

End1.text: So, did you find them?

End2.text:
Oh... I see.
I guess I'll just go back home now.

End3.text: Take this, it belonged to the Scholar taking part in this expedition. I have no reason to keep it.

Start.text: A low growl resonates all around you. You are surrounded!
The inscription reads Erkeshet, known as the Builder.
You can see a room below, several metres under your feet. A piton has been driven into the edge of the platform you are standing on, but the rope has been removed.

line0.props.tipText: One of your Companions could be injured in the process.

Start.text: That door is out of reach!
The scholar is holding a parchment on which is scrawled a rune.
A few pieces of wood have been nailed to the wall and are held together by a padlock to create a makeshift barricade.

line0.props.tipText: Will brute force do the trick?

Injured.text: ::name:: was injured as they were trying to break the door open: <status>::injury::</status>

Start.text: This woman was eaten by something.
The ground looks very unstable here. One might easily get hurt.
A shadow emerges from the depths of the well. You are under attack!
There is a bucket on the side of the well, but there is no telling what it contains.

Touched.text: Reaching for the bucket, your Companion makes it tumble into the well. The clatter it makes as it falls sends tremors throughout the tomb.

Touched2.text: Drums can be heard in the distance... They are coming...

Start.text: The door is locked.
The door mechanism must be triggered from the other side.
Two gems glimmer in the monster's eye sockets. Taking them should be child's play...

LeftFirst.text: A shiny ruby! Take the other gem?

RightFirst.text: A deep blue sapphire! Take the other gem?

End.text: Now deprived of the gems, the monster's gaze seems less intimidating.

Start.text: You can hear jaws snapping in the dark. You are under attack!
The explorer dragged himself into this room to die.
I am sorry but I cannot come with you. I must get back to my friends.

End1.text: This is where we part ways, Mercenaries.

End2.text: Thank you for helping me look for my friends, though I wish we had found them alive...

End3.text: I hope this present will help you in your adventures. I pray that they will be met with more success than ours.

line0.text: Find the expedition members in the Tomb.

Start.text: This beast gives off a putrid stench.
The water is fresh and pure.

line0.props.tipText: Throw a carcass in the water.

Pig.text: Brown liquids leak from the carcass and spread into the pristine water.

End.text: This water looks contaminated and should not be drunk. Probably because of a dead pig...

Start.text: The water is fresh and pure.

line0.props.tipText: Throw the pig carcass in the water.

Pig.text: Brown liquids leak from the carcass and spread into the pristine water.

End.text: This water looks contaminated and should not be drunk. Probably because of a dead pig...

Start.text: I volunteered to poison the wells. It's far safer than having to fight on the war front.
I can't feel my legs! We've pulled these carcasses over miles on end!

What business have you here, Mercenaries?
Pah! Never mind... How would you like to poison a well? Vernalis is down to his last well. You won't get another chance! And we'll make it worth your while, believe me!

Next.text: Oh, come now, why so glum?! It's not a heroic deed by any stretch of the imagination, But Vernalis is the one who started this war. And we've got to put an end to it one way or another... right?

Next2.text: It'll be easy as pie, you'll see. Just throw any old carcass in the water! We brought this one, but you can also use one of yours.

Attack.text: Poisoning a well is beneath you, is that it? Or are you stupid enough to believe that Vernalis really is Jeru's Chosen One?

Wait.text: Oh, go on! You can do it! Everyone's watching!

Reward.text: Perfect! Now that's proper sabotage! Here, take this gold from my wages. And stay out of sight when you leave. Lieutenant Asercia almost caught us red-handed last time.

SettingLog.text: All of Vernalis' wells have been contaminated.

line0.text: Poison Lord Vernalis' well.
Kill the Inquisitors or give them 15 Wood to burn their victim.

line1.text: Talk to the woman.

Start.text: How are we to burn this heretic at the stake?

Next.text:
All our wood was ruined by the rain. If we try to set it on fire now, the prisoner will agonise for hours.
We cannot do such a thing, we are not monsters!

Next2.text: Could you possibly donate a few logs in exchange for our blessing?

Give.text: May the Eye gaze upon you and your Companions and your families and guide you wherever you go!

End.text: Just a last few details to sort out, and we will be ready to rid the world of this wretched creature. We are most grateful for your help.

Start.text: What? Ah! The heretic! Her house has been struck down by the Eyes Reckoning! We require no further proof of her sins.
I... I am not a heretic! Oh, please! You must believe me! I don't know why my house was beset by the Light!
Thank you! I am so grateful! You saved my life. Here, take this. It is all that I could save when the Inquisition came to get me.

Reward.text: Would... would you take me with you? As one of your Companions, I mean? I could make myself useful! I am well versed in the arcane arts of Alchemy!

Start.text: Pilgrims come to this altar to make offerings to Saint Septimus in the hope that he will protect them on their holiest of journeys.
At this altar, pilgrims offer their gifts to Saint Eleor and pray in the hope that she will guide them on their journey.

This statue honours the greatest hero of the old Empire of Jeru: Belerion Halios.
People still place offerings to him here.
The bodies are riddled with Harag arrows.
Refugees who were fleeing through the mountain. They were killed in their sleep by archers.
These boats probably belong to smugglers.
Usually, I'm only allowed to tend to the animals. But don't let that worry you, man and beast are not that different.

Next.text: There! All bright-eyed and bushy-tailed!

Start.text: <narrator>... Jeru's companions were overcome with fear when the Beast appeared before them. They did not even attempt to fight it, for all knew that no worldly weapon could possibly defeat such a fearsome creature.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Then Jeru stepped forth, facing the monster with nothing but his walking stick in hand. He raised his arms to the heavens and thrice called to the All-seeing Eye.</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>The God of Light answered the third call and unleashed His Reckoning unto the Beast. Overwhelmed by the power of the Almighty God, the wretched creature retreated to the darkness, leaving the Guide to continue on his way...</narrator>

Start.text: Despite my old age, I became a priest only recently. I still find some prayers challenging, but I know I can help people and make amends for all the harm I have caused.

Next1.text: In another life, I was a smuggler of the worst sort, the champion of their arena. Ah! How despicable I was among those lowlifes...

Next2.text: If youre willing to teach these Bandits a lesson by beating them on their own turf, I will share my best arena tactics with you.

End1.text: Did you drum some sense into those scoundrels? Blessed be the All-seeing Eye. I hope they will reflect on their actions.

End2.text: As promised, I will impart my knowledge to you. I trust you will put it to good use in service of the Light.

End3.text: Please use my knowledge to serve justice and faith.

line0.title: An Eye for an Eye
line0.props.helpTip: Return to the priest after completing the Smugglers' Arena.

Start.text: This church is dedicated to Saint Septimus, the seventh son of Jeru, our guide and founder of the Faith of the Light.

Next.text: Jeru and all the other saints are hallowed individuals, but they are only human. The only divine being, the eternal one who will welcome us at death's door, is the All-seeing Eye.

Start.text: I pray each day for this war to end.
I do not believe in Lord Vernalis' so-called vision for one second! Jeru came to him in a dream? How very providential... Everyone knows his mother has always dreamt of becoming a countess...
Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

Start.text: Finally a building in Arthes thats not on the verge of collapsing!

Next1.text:
You can store your things in the chest and plop your Companions down on these stools for as long as you wish.
But most importantly, I can arrange trips from here to other travel posts you built.

Next2.text: Where would you like to go?

line0.props.disableReason: Build travel posts in other villages to travel there quickly.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: Before the war, this travel post was bustling with merchants, caravans and travellers.

Next1.text:
I hope to see it rebuilt one day. I could help with that, but youd need to buy the lot and hire craftsmen.
What do you think?

line0.props.tipText: Build the Arthes Travel Post.

Build.text: Wait here, locals will be happy to work for your shiny Krowns.

Start.text: There were two of us working here until Count Laheart enlisted my cousin in his army. I haven't heard from Claes since.

Repair.text: There, that should do the trick.

Start.text: May the All-seeing Eye strike me down if I lie! I saw him, I swear! Three days ago, I was collecting firewood with my husband when the Hunter's ghost attacked us! We managed to flee to the mountains, but it was a very close call!
Don't believe a word she says... She probably came across a band of Deserters. They have been running rampant in these parts since the beginning of the war.
My meat is quite pungent, I admit, but I can assure you it is still perfectly edible.
The war drags on, and Laheart and Vernalis requisition anything they come across. I barely have anything left to sell, let alone eat...
You seem lost. Are you in need of any particular information about Arthes? Are you looking to take on jobs the Emissary wouldn't dare post?

Done.text: Promising, isn't it? Is there anything else you'd like to know?

line0.props.tipText: Commander Hostes needs to infiltrate the enemy territory.

line1.props.tipText: Abbot Theocene is willing to do anything to help Lord Vernalis win the war.

line2.props.tipText: The Legion is concerned for the fate of Arthes.

line3.props.tipText: Lord Vernalis' wells are giving off a strange smell.

HostesCommandant.text: Commander Hostes needs to infiltrate the enemy territory.

TheoceneAbbot.text: Abbot Theocene is willing to do anything to help Lord Vernalis win the war.

Deserters.text: The Legion is concerned for the fate of Arthes.

Wreckers.text: Lord Vernalis' wells are giving off a strange smell.

DeliverMessage1.text:
<narrator>The Informant snatched the letter as soon as it touched the table.</narrator>
I hope you didnt open it.

End.text: Unfortunately, I have nothing further to tell you.

PathCrime1.text: I was informed that you have already dealt with one of the security systems. Would you tackle another one?

PathCrime2.text: Because of the war, I wouldn't be surprised if Laheart bought a cheap version of this system. You should probably try another one before drawing any conclusions.

PathCrime3.text: I was told that this key belonged to a Broker. That's all I know.

PathCrimeEnd.text: Keep what you did to yourselves, Mercenaries.

line0.text: Buy the Broker's Key from the Informant.

line1.text: Find and thwart the security system matching the Broker's Key.

Start.text: Look how empty this room is! Before the war, there were two taverns in Cortia, and we were still completely full on market days!

MissionDescEnd3.text: Meet up with your allies at Forecastle Rock and begin the final assault.

line0.text: Take on Countess Montrevel's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: We have come together in the Montrevel family chapel to celebrate this house's union with Jarl Sigurdr...

Next1.text: I accept!

Next2.text: I... wait, first I must recite a prayer to the God of Li...

Next3.text:
Time's running short, let's get this over with!
I accept, too.

Next4.text:
Er... well...
In that case, I declare you joined in the Light.
May his faith illuminate your lives and each of your decisions.

Start.text: Oh! Mercenaries! You missed the ceremony for my conversion to the Light. But luckily, you were there for our wedding. A most curious custom, are you familiar with it?

Next1.text:
You must be surprised with this turn of events.
And to be perfectly honest, so am I!

Next2.text: But this wedding was the only way to unite Ormance's forces and those of the rebel Skelmar under the same banner. It's still a small price to pay to retake my County.

Next4.text: Our allies were just waiting for this ceremony before attacking Forecastle Rock. Will you stand with us once again? Apparently, it's traditional to offer the newly-weds a present.

Accept.text:
Ah, wonderful! Your countless talents will be a great help to us!
To Forecastle Rock!

Start.text: Should I have been firmer?
The General will approve of this union if it can carry us to victory.
Have you seen the power of the God of Light?

Next1.text: Through Him, Sigurdr the savage has been converted and wed, and is preparing to slay his own brethren.

Next2.text: What a beautiful day!

Start.text: Sigurdr is a hypocrite! He doesn't care about the Countess or the God of Light! Why am I the only one who finds it outrageous?

Congratulations, Mercenaries! May Saint Eleor bless you for saving the Countess!
It would have been a shame to miss such a sincere union.
May the new Count be less cowardly than his wife.

Such a lovely ceremony!
What a joy to see our Countess wed!

E2R1CountessCastleMainBookshelf.npc.name: On the Skelmar, by Professor Tacius Goth

Start.text: <narrator>No tribe is more despicable than the Skelmar! Even the savages of Harag have the decency to stay in their putrid swamps and refrain from inflicting their heretical presence on the civilised world!</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>All attempts at negotiation and diplomacy have ended with the death or capture of the emissary. The only thing that matters to these barbarians from the World's Edge is pillage and murder!</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>In just a few decades, their brutal raids have utterly transformed Ormance County. Our farms have turned into fortresses, and our villages into citadels! If Forecastle Rock, the Montrevels' Redoubt, were not there to protect the rivers, I dare not think what would become of our poor baronies!</narrator>

MissionDesc1.text: Talk to Captain Pallas' lieutenants.

MissionDescEnd2.text: Meet up with your allies at Forecastle Rock and begin the final assault.

line0.text: Take on Captain Pallas' mission.

line1.text: Find and save the Countess, who is being held prisoner somewhere in Ormance County.

line0.text: Take on Countess Montrevel's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
I've searched the whole dungeon!
Countess Montrevel is nowhere to be found!

Next1.text:
May the God of Light come to our aid!
The Skelmar kidnapped her while we were fighting!

Next2.text:
Even Captain Pallas failed! Nothing matters any more!
Take your reward and go far away from here. Save your life, as we should have done!

Next3.text: The Skelmar are a blight! A parasite on Ormance County!

Wait.text:
Captain Pallas is right!
We mustn't give up!

Wait1.text: Tell us what you need! The Guard will do whatever it takes to help you.

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the barony of Belestan.

WarEffort.text: We're not the only ones who can contribute to the War Effort. Other places can produce resources or fighters. Free all that you can, and rebuild them if needed.

Start.text:
Don't let my lieutenants discourage you.
It's true, we can't find Countess Montrevel. She may even have been captured by the Skelmar.
But this battle was far from a failure.

Next1.text: The Barony of Belestan is free now, thanks to you. By toppling its Bastion the Countess's castle you've made it possible for us to retake control of it. This is the first time since the start of the invasion that our forces have achieved such a victory.

Next2.text: You've proven to us that Ormance County isn't doomed to fall into the Skelmar's clutches! We have to share this hope with the other baronies, and liberate them one by one until the whole County is free.

Next3.text: Join me, Mercenaries! Join the Guard and all those who will lend their swords to this noble mission! I promise you honour, glory and Krowns!

Accept.text:
I'll defend the Barony of Belestan while you're gone.
Help the baronies that require your assistance, and find Countess Montrevel to lead them!

Wait.text: Belestan's defence is coming together. We still hope to find clues leading to Countess Montrevel.

Wait2.text: The Countess's death is terrible news indeed. Who should the Guard obey now?

SpecialSkill.text: You can now use the Guard's Strategic Skill <skill>Volley</skill> anywhere in Ormance County.

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the Barony of Belestan.

Start.text:
Mercenaries! It's so good to see you!
Did you receive your reward? What would we have done without our beloved Countess?

The castle was in such terrible condition before I arrived!
I had to oversee the clean-up myself!
Finally!

Next0.text:
If you hadn't saved me, I would have punished you for taking so long!
To think, a Countess reduced to waiting for a bunch of hired killers...

Dialog5.text:
As if you cared about that! Please excuse this ridiculous woman she imagines you're some sort of paladins, riding nobly over hill and dale to save widows and orphans in every village!
You and I know what Mercenaries really fight for.

Dialog6.text:
On that note, I've promised a part of the treasure of Forecastle Rock to whoever rallies my banner.
What do you say? Isn't that an incredibly generous offer on my part?

Accept.text:
I knew I could count on the greed of the lowborn!
Meet us at Forecastle Rock, and I'll personally give the signal to attack.

Start.text: The General is very pleased that the Military Academy has been retaken. He asked me to give you his personal thanks.

Dialog1.text:
We were most eager to see you again.
We couldn't have held this strategic meeting without the men who foiled the assault on the capital.

Start.text: Ever since we've been protecting the relic, the Eye's Reckoning hasn't once struck the Barony of Clerone.

Dialog3.text: The baronies you liberated have joined forces. We're ready to take the Fortress of Forecastle Rock by storm and take Ormance County back from those heretics.

Start.text: The Guard has sworn allegiance to Her Ladyship. We couldn't violate that oath, even if we wanted to.

Dialog4.text: It would be an honour to have you alongside us once more. Since your time in Belestan, you're all the Guard ever talks about. We've been following each and every one of your victories!

Start.text: I decided to leave Tella to the Barony of the Isle to avoid causing a scene.
I've already sworn allegiance to Countess Montrevel, but I must admit I have some doubts as to her abilities as jarl.

The God of Light chose the noble families eons ago.
True believers cannot doubt in their competence.

What do you think of my waistcoat, Mercenaries?
Don't I make a worthy Count of Edoran?

Who let you in here?
There will be no peasants in my castle!

What do you think of my waistcoat, Mercenaries?
Don't I make a worthy Count of Edoran?
The Guard abandoned this place in a hurry.
Through the portcullis, your Companions can see burned farms and fields.

I can't believe it! My pony waited for me all this time!
What an extraordinary beast!

NoPoney1.text:
Have you seen my pony, by any chance?
I panicked and lost track of poor Snapdragon! I had to flee the County without him!

InGroupPoney3.text:
I'm begging you... Please give me my pony back!
He's all I have left. I need him!

line0.props.tipText: Give back the pony called Snapdragon.

line1.props.tipText: Keep the pony called Snapdragon.

GiveBack.text:
Thank you, Mercenaries! Thank you so much!
I promise I'll take excellent care of him!

Repeat.text:
Thank you, Mercenaries! Thank you so much!
I promise I'll take excellent care of him!

Refuse.text:
I... I'll report you to the Guard!
Scoundrels! Louts! Pony thieves!

Wanted.text: You refused to give a pony back to its owner.

Start.text: Poor Snapdragon was abandoned!
The animal looks overjoyed to be reunited with its owner.

Don't worry!
I may not own this farm, but I can do the work!
Just tell me what I can do to help the Guard!

End.text:
Don't worry!
I may not own this farm, but I can do the work!

Start.text:
I always envied Ansald, that old donkey! His farm was the finest in the County.
Now that the Skelmar have given him his due, this little paradise is all ours!

line0.text: Liberate the Barony of Belestan to rebuild this place.

line1.text: Rebuild this place so that it can contribute to the War Effort.

Start.text:
We were at the end of our tether. If it weren't for you, my men would be dead now.
How can I thank you?

Next1.text:
Countess Montrevel?
I'm sorry, but I don't know what's become of her. When the Skelmar seized the castle, I was holding the south gate. I suppose if she fled, it must have been some other way.

Next2.text:
I'm sorry I can't be more helpful. The violence of the Skelmar attack threw our ranks into complete chaos.
All I could grab before leaving was this. I hope it's more useful to you than it is to me.

Accept.text:
My men and I are leaving for Two-Shores. If what you say is true, Captain Pallas will need reinforcements to protect the town.
May Saint Jeru protect you!

SettingLog.text: You saved the Guards on Ansald's Farm.

Start.text: Destroying such a beautiful building is sheer heresy. The ones who did this are barbarians of the worst sort.

Next1.text: Let the Order of Saint Lenaid rebuild this farm for the pious people of the barony. It will make your fight against the Skelmar that much easier.

Start.text:
You can't imagine how much this mill means to my family.
It would be my honour to serve you.

End.text:
You can't imagine how much this mill means to my family.
I can't thank you enough for taking it back from the Skelmar.

Start.text:
Footprints.
If you follow them, perhaps you'll find survivors.

line0.text: Liberate the Barony of Belestan to rebuild this place.

line1.text: Rebuild this place so that it can contribute to the War Effort.

line0.text: Search the area for clues.

line1.text: Follow the footprints to find survivors.

Start.text: It won't be easy, but the Order of Saint Lenaid is determined to relieve Ormance County and its baronies of their suffering. Rebuilding this mill will restore hope for these good souls, and could be quite useful to you as well.

Next1.text: We humbly ask that you provide us with supplies to rebuild at this site. We'll handle the work ourselves.

Start.text: The jaw of Saint Guilhem, one of the most sacred relics of the Light.

MissionDescPriest.text: Find the Inquisition in this area.

SpecialSkillNotif.text: You can now use the Inquisition's Strategic Skill <skill>Inferno</skill> anywhere in Ormance County.

Ceremony1.text: We have gathered in this sacred place, the abbey of Saint Guilhem, to welcome Jarl Sigurdr into our community...

Ceremony3.text:
Jarl Sigurdr has been enlightened!
Praise be to the God of Light, Saint Guilhem and our guide Saint Jeru!

line0.text: Talk to Abbess Cassibelle.

line1.text: Talk to the Priest of the Light Salvien.

line2.text: Accept the Priest of the Light Salvien's mission.

line3.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line0.text: Find the smugglers.

Start.text:
Pay us no mind.
We are but humble merchants of Gosenberg.

Alt2.text:
Have you come to save us?
Thanks be to Hessura! We've been waiting for news from the Treacherous Tower for weeks!
Have you reopened the passage?

Alt3.text: Here! You can keep our whole inventory! I insist, keep it all! And thank you!

Start.text: You've come from outside? How did you manage that?

Next1.text: The Smugglers! And here I was, wondering how the novices were getting hold of wine!

Next2.text: Thank you for coming to tell us about this secret passage, but we will not abandon the oldest Abbey of the Light to these barbarians. You are dismissed. I have a siege to prepare.

MissionDesc.text: Talk to the Priest of the Light Salvien.

End.text: If you need the citadel and its men, we will come to your aid without hesitation.

Start.text:
I overheard your conversation with our esteemed abbess.
She doesn't seem to grasp the passage's full potential.

Next1.text: The Saint Guilhem citadel has been resisting the Skelmar invaders for weeks, but our supplies are running low, and we haven't enough soldiers to break the siege.

Next2.text: I would like to go with you beyond the battlements to seek out support. Would you be willing to guide and protect me?

Next3.text: I have it from a reliable source that the Inquisition is in the Barony of Clerone. Find their camp and rally them to our cause.

Start.text:
