The Saint Guilhem citadel and its abbey are sacred!
It would be a crime to let them fall into those barbarians' hands!

Next1.text:
Why hasn't the Hierophant sent the Inquisition yet to rescue us?
We're willing to support the efforts of whomever saves us from the Skelmar!

End.text:
The Inquisitors have such a unique way of fighting!
How I would have loved to join their ranks!

End2.text: Tell me what they need to support their fight. The Saint Guilhem abbey owes them a great debt of gratitude.

Start.text:
The Barony of Clerone is free, the abbey is safe and the Inquisition has joined our cause!
None of this would have been possible without you.

Next1.text:
Thank you, Mercenaries, on behalf of the entire citadel.
Our blessed founder would be proud to see how fervently you defended his work.

Next2.text: I wish to thank you as well. You and Priest Salvien have not only saved Saint Guilhem, but also our souls.

Next3.text:
Face the future without fear, for the Inquisition shall protect the citadel and the Barony of Clerone.
Our mission was to bring the relic of Saint Guilhem to safety, and now we have done so.

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the Barony of Clerone.

Start.text:
Ah, you're finally here, Mercenaries!
You nearly missed my Conversion Ceremony!

Dialog6.text:
That's what you're here for!
You are the esteemed witnesses to my... Enlightenment.
Ready?

line0.props.tipText: Attend the Conversion Ceremony

End1.text:
And now, Mercenaries, how would you like to drive the heretics from my County?
Our allies have already sworn allegiance to me, so all I need now is your help.

line0.props.tipText: Attend the Conversion Ceremony

AcceptFight.text:
Meet us at Forecastle Rock!
High Jarl Sven's hour has come!

Start.text: I never stopped praying for your safety, Mercenaries.

Dialog1.text:
It's reassuring to learn that you know this Skelmar well.
When he came to us, so keen to join the community of the Light, I somewhat doubted his sincerity.

Start.text: I would never dispute the General's orders... but you must admit, it's a rather strange situation.

Dialog2.text: Jarl Sigurdr managed to convince the General that with his knowledge of the enemy, he'd be able to defeat the Skelmar.

Dialog3.text: In exchange for the title of Count, he and his men would watch over the shores of Edoran and counter any future invasion.

Start.text:
You've come a long way since our first encounter.
I am proud to have fought by your side.

Dialog4.text: Since the Countess is now dead, there was no one else to lead the County. I suppose that whoever drives the Skelmar from our lands will earn the right to command us in the future...

Start.text: I've watched over the Saint Guilhem citadel night and day, and the Eye's Reckoning hasn't struck once.

Dialog5.text: The Hierophant has placed a condition on this ennoblement... The new Count must be a follower of the Light! Ormance would never stand to be led by a heretic!

Start.text: I can't believe my eyes.
Nothing can be worse than the Countess.

The Smugglers are restarting their operations?
I thought they'd blocked the passage!

Repair.text: That's fine, no need to say a thing! I'd rather not know.

Start.text:
Only the complete recapture of Ormance County will return this Travel Post to its former prestige.
Given the circumstances, the Kingdom of Gosenberg is quite inclined to assist you.

The complete recapture of the County is starting to bear fruit!
I've received my first few shipments from Gosenberg!

The Order of Saint Lenaid is most efficient, no?
The Gosenberg clergy made a grave mistake when they didn't entrust them with the construction of the Gosenberg cathedral.

MissionDesc1.text: Talk to the Priest of the Light Salvien.

MissionDesc2.text: Talk to the Gosenberg Merchant to obtain some Alazarian Powder.

MissionDesc3.text: Challenge the Inquisitors to create a diversion.

line0.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.
Liberate the Barony of Clerone to rebuild this place.

line1.text: Rebuild this place so that it can contribute to the War Effort.

Start.text: Exactly where I thought I'd find it! Look at all that Alazarian Powder, Mercenaries!

Next0.text: This is how we're going to convince the Inquisition. Have you noticed the similarity between the damage caused by this invention and the Eye's Reckoning?

Next1.text: We need that cart! I'm sure you can persuade its owner. After all, he owes you his life.

Kill.text: That was... brutal. May the Eye forgive your actions.

End1.text: I'll take this cart directly to the Inquisition camp. Your job is to get them out of there.

End2.text: Provoke them, challenge them, call them heretics... whatever it takes! The Inquisitors must clear the area while I summon the Eye's Reckoning. Try to hold them back as long as possible. Good luck!

End3.text: Once you've created a diversion, I'll spring into action with the powder.

Start.text: The... the Skelmar are dead? Can it really be true?

Next1.text:
Praised be Saint Eleor!
You can't imagine how badly they treat their slaves! It was miserable!

Next2.text: I think I need time to recover.

Alt1.text: Thank you, Mercenaries! Thank you! You are true he...

Alt2.text: What do you mean, you want my supply of powder?! Impossible!

Alt3.text:
You've no idea of its value! Even before the invasion, Alazarian Powder was worth its weight in gold! Imagine how much it will go for now!
I need those Krowns to rebuild my Travel Post!

Bribe1.text:
Of course!
Of course, you can have the whole thing if you pay for it! I'll even throw in the cart and the pony!

Convince1.text:
I... What can I say to my saviours?! My life is yours, right?
Very well, take my supply... I'll get back to Gosenberg one way or another...

Convince2.text: I'll get back to Gosenberg one way or another...

Start.text:
The framework was brand new!
Our order rebuilt it last winter!

Next1.text:
The disciples and apprentices of Saint Lenaid can fix this.
We just need a few materials... the profits from this reconstruction will be yours.

Start.text:
The Skelmar deserved to be massacred!
They dared to use us as slaves...

Next1.text:
They took our armour! Our weapons, too!
I wish I'd been in your place, to cut their throats myself!

Next2.text: My boys and I will make the Skelmar pay for what they put us through! Tell us how we can be of use to you!

EndSetting.text: As long as there's even one Skelmar left alive in this County, the Bandits of Clerone will obey you!

Start.text: The Skelmar showed up so fast. I didn't even have time to understand what was happening.

MissionDesc.text: Break the rock and go through the trapdoor to enter the secret passage.

line0.text: Talk to the smugglers.

line1.text: Search the cave for clues.

Start.text: There is a note on this man.

Next1.text: Don't leave the hideout without sealing the secret passage to the citadel. Use stones, branches, anything our friends are still in Saint Guilhem, so the Skelmar mustn't get in!

Start.text: I love feeding Scruffy. He eats absolutely everything, and so eagerly, too! He reminds me of my brother.
Our business with the abbey was booming before those Skelmar degenerates invaded the County!

Ansi.text:
The boss sent Ansi to help us?
I'm not surprised that old swindler got captured!

Start.text: What have you done with my bears?

Next1.text: Mihr be cursed! Have you any idea how much they cost me?

Start.text: Scruffy let you in?

Next1.text: Mihr be cursed! The trainer swore he could keep guard! I've been taken for a fool yet again!

Next2.text: I'm so naive! I even believed the folks who said there was no danger in Ormance. I fell for the rumours of easy Krowns. And look at me now! Hiding at the back of some cave, unable to help my friends trapped in the citadel!

Next3.text: I need help, Mercenaries. Really.

Accept.text: If you can get through the Skelmar patrols, there's a secret passage in our old hideout, the Treacherous Tower. We hid it under some rocks... It'll lead you straight to Saint Guilhem Citadel.

MissionDesc.text: Follow Priest Salvien out of the camp.

line0.text: Find a way to convince the Inquisition to help the Saint Guilhem citadel.

Start.text: The preparations are nearly complete.

High Inquisitor!
Blessed be the Eye, I've finally found you!
You may not be aware of this, but the Saint Guilhem citadel is in grave danger, and...

Next1.text: The Inquisition has not been ordered to secure the citadel. We are here to recover the relic of Saint Guilhem and bring it to safety.

Next2.text:
Is this some kind of joke?
Surely the Hierophant won't let the Skelmar destroy this abbey! It's a jewel of the Light!

Next3.text:
The citadel is already lost, Priest. As is all of Ormance County.
In his great wisdom, the Hierophant chose to save what could be saved, with no unnecessary loss of life.

Next4.text: This is heresy! A crime against the Eye's will!

Next5.text: Come, Mercenaries! Let us leave this godless place!

Start.text:
The High Inquisitor has forbidden me to light my pyre.
I put my heart and soul into building it!

End.text:
I deserve to be burned on the pyre.
You were right! We are miserable heretics!

Start.text:
The High Inquisitor has tasked us with arresting and burning all the Skelmar in the barony.
How I've waited for this!
Let me take your Skelmar prisoners off your hands. I have so many questions for them.

Deliver.text: Wonderful! Maybe he'll have something to tell us this time!

NoSlotAvailable.text: I've already got enough Skelmar to question. Come back when I've finished with those.

Start.text: Speak with my subordinates. My thoughts are fully occupied with my holy mission.

Next1.text: That priest... did he come from the abbey? Did he find a way to circumvent the siege?

Next2.text: If the Eye wills it, then we shall liberate the Saint Guilhem abbey if it costs us our lives!

Start.text: <narrator>We were sailing for the capital of Edoran when we spied the Skelmar skiffs. They were puny compared to our vessel, and our Belerian helmsman assured us that he could overtake them with no trouble.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Yet as we drew closer to the barbarians, we observed great activity aboard their boats. A song rose from their ranks, and dozens of oars swung in rhythm. Had some madness befallen the Skelmar, driving them to try to board our ship?</narrator>

Next2.text:
<narrator>I will long remember the fury I felt that day. I had not survived Mihr's Curse to let a gang of looters drown my crew!
Our ballistae pierced their hulls, and the horde sank off the coast of Ormance. Their song fell silent, and we continued on our way.
</narrator>

Start.text: An enigmatic pile of rocks.
<narrator>There is something written on this note.</narrator>

Next1.text: Stop feeding Scruffy! He needs to stay aggressive to protect the camp!

line0.text: Pick the lock to free the smuggler.

line1.text: Talk to the Smuggler to get your reward.

line0.text: Find out what happened to the other Smugglers.

Start.text: I can't feel my hands.

May Hessura bless you for saving me!
I was sure I'd wind up chained to their ships, setting sail for the World's Edge.

Next1.text:
I didn't even know the Skelmar were invading the County!
All the boss told me was to come to Ormance, meet up with some people at this tower, and deliver the goods!

Next2.text: What a disaster! My friends are surely dead, and the Skelmar have pillaged all that I had. I don't even have enough to pay you for your help.

Next3.text: The best I can do is contact the Smugglers from the other kingdoms to give you some help. Would that be enough to pay back my debt?

Next3Back.text: I have contacts in the other Counties of Edoran, and in the Belerion Archipelago. Tell me what you need, and I'll supply it!

Next3Alt.text: My friends survived? Finally, some good news! I truly don't know what I'd do without you, Mercenaries!

Next4Alt.text:
My debt to your company is now greater than ever.
Let me draw on my contacts in the other Counties of Edoran and in the Belerion Archipelago. I can acquire everything you need.

RebuiltEnd1.text:
Oh! Perfect timing! I was just about to leave! I have to board a ship in western Arthes early in the morning.
This time, I'm headed back to Belerion.

RebuiltEnd2.text:
I wanted to thank you. For saving me.
It feels like a million years ago.
Be well, Mercenaries.

RebuildAlt1.text:
Now all I can do is go back to where I came from.
But at least I'm alive, right?
Thanks again, Mercenaries.

Start.text: Light! I never thought I'd see the light of the heavens again! And fresh air! I can feel it on my face!

Next1.text: Ah, may Sage Aeda's blessings be upon you! Praise be to her for sending you to find me! Long may her name be sung for sparing my life!

Accept.text:
And you! If it weren't for you, I'd still be trapped in that accursed place!
Take my weapon, it's the only thing of value that I have on me.

Start.text: A statue of Dumuzi and his companion. A complicated text is carved into the base of the statue.

Text.text: The inscription reads: The good citizen gives aid to injured and abandoned beasts; he cares for them and sees to their happiness.

Start.text: This flagstone is linked to the door.

line0.props.tipText: Place a Companion on the flagstone.

Start.text: The door is linked to a large flagstone.
A statue of Dumuzi. A complicated text is carved into the base of the statue.

Text.text: The inscription reads: The good citizen ensures that his table is always ready to welcome those who have nowhere to eat.

Start.text: The altar near the door is likely awaiting your offering.
The door is linked to an altar.
This passage is blocked on the other side.
They're all around me! They're in the darkness! I can feel their presence

Next1.text:
I have to get out of here! I can't stand this tomb a second longer!
Oh! Thank the gods! Whoever you are, I beg of you Get me out of here!

line1.props.tipText: Help the Skelmar out of the Tomb.

Start.text: The entrance to the corridor is scattered with small stones. Your Companions can clearly hear the sound of falling rocks from inside the passage.

line0.props.tipText: One of your Companions could easily be injured.

line1.props.tipText: Use shields to protect yourselves from falling rocks. The company will move more slowly.
line1.props.disableReason: None of your Companions has a shield equipped.

Start.text: This passage is blocked on the other side.
The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.
A statue of Dumuzi and his best friend. A complicated text is carved into the base of the statue.

Text.text: The inscription reads: The good citizen is loyal and true. He knows no thought of treachery and can count on those he calls his friends.

Start.text: Two identical flagstones are linked to the door.

line0.props.tipText: Place Companions on the flagstones.

Start.text: The door is linked to two identical flagstones.

Failure.text: The door remained closed for ::name1:: and ::name2::.

Start.text: A Scholar Companion might be able to decipher the inscriptions on this headstone.

Next1.text: The inscription reads: In accordance with citizen Dumuzi's last will and testament, visitors are invited to take whatever they need.

Start.text: Something is running after you!
Sounds of fighting echo in the corridor.
The door is locked.
The shaft of the lever is missing.
The door is blocked on the other side.

Skelmar bodies, covered with tooth and fang marks.
Your Companions don't see any torches nearby.
The monsters have laid a trap for you!
Cannot reach the room above this one.
The door is locked.
Huh wha who are you?
Have you come to save us? Did the Countess send you? The Legion? The Inquisition, perhaps?

Next1.text:
Dammit! Doesn't anyone in Ormance care if we die down here in the dark?
What's taking the Guard so long to recapture the barony? We haven't seen the light of day in a fortnight!

Next2.text: If that's how it is, then we'll pay you ourselves! We'll build you the best catapults you'll find anywhere, and you'll drive the Skelmar out of our barony.

Next3.text: Meet us at the Sawmill. Since you've already driven out the Skelmar, our business will be completed quickly.

Wait.text: What are you waiting for? Open this door! Those catapults won't build themselves!

AltNext3.text: You'll need to start with the Sawmill! Without our equipment, we can't build the siege engines. Once you've liberated it, we'll meet you there.

AltWait.text: So? Has the Sawmill been liberated?

MissionDesc1.text: Meet up with the craftsmen at the Ormance Sawmill.

MissionDesc2.text: Liberate the Ormance Sawmill.

SettingLog.text: You rescued the craftsmen in the Ormance Tomb.

Start.text: We're used to mole-rat meat, believe me. After a while, it even starts to taste a little bit like chicken.

We took refuge in the Tomb as soon as the Skelmar moved into the Barony of Puy-Corbin.
Those barbarians came rushing in after us. Too bad they didn't bring any torches with them.
You can see a room below, several metres under your feet. A peg has been driven into the edge of the platform you are standing on, but the rope has seen removed.

line0.props.tipText: One of your Companions could easily be injured.

line0.text: Look for survivors in the Tomb.

line1.text: Take on the craftsman's mission.

MissionDesc.text: Find out what happened to the Ormance craftsmen.

line0.title: Liberation
line0.props.helpTip: Talk to Plautaire the craftsman.

line0.text: Take on the craftsmen's mission.

line1.text: Take down the Skelmar bastion in the barony of Puy-Corbin.

Start.text:
You've defeated the Skelmar? Really?
Oh! Thank you, Mercenaries!
I don't know how much longer we could have held out.

Next2.text: Since invading the barony, the Skelmar have got it in their minds to turn the Brotherhood Training Grounds into some sort of impenetrable fortress. They force us to work day and night until we faint from exhaustion.

Next3.text: Some of our people have managed to escape to the mountains. I don't know if they've found refuge there. There's nothing there but wild beasts and that scary Tomb

SettingLog.text: You rescued the craftsmen at the Ormance Sawmill.

Start.text: I don't know if I'll ever get over being a slave.

We owe you our lives and our freedom.
Please let us help you.

EndRebuilt.text: I'm proud to have played a part in reclaiming our County.

Start.text: You've done it! Thank you! The Sawmill is free!

Next1.text: You're alive! What happened? How did you get away from the Skelmar?

Next2.text: And you! You're not dead? I thought you'd all been massacred by those savages!

Start.text:
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts, Mercenaries.
If it weren't for you, we'd still be at the Skelmar's mercy, and our friends would still be trapped in that horrible tomb.
You've saved us!

Next1.text: Well! Now that everyone is here, it's time to take our revenge! The Skelmar are about to find out what happens when you tangle with the best craftsmen in the Five Kingdoms! You're still with us, right?

Next2.text:
Don't leave us!
None of us knows how to fight! We need warriors!
If you free the barony from the Skelmar's clutches, I swear on Saint Eleor's shield that we'll build you all the catapults you could ever want!

Accept.text: What a relief! I was sure you were going to say no! Let's meet up at the Brotherhood Training Grounds. We'll bring the catapult there as soon as it's ready.

Start.text: All in all, I guess I'm pretty sick of mole-rat meat.
I'll work day and night if I have to! The Skelmar are going to pay for what they put us through!
What brings you here, Mercenaries?
The baronies are rebuilding nicely. There is no shortage of work for us.
The craftswoman seems very focused on her task.
You wouldn't want to distract the craftswoman.

The Skelmar treat the Trackers with more respect than the Edoranians.
To be honest, I don't think I've ever seen anyone act that way towards us.

Next.text: From what I understand, the Beast is some sort of evil god for their people. And I suppose that makes us heroes.

Next2.text:
We can't afford to disappoint the Skelmar. They're far too unpredictable.
If you think you can defeat a Ghost Pack, we wouldn't mind a bit of help.

Accept.text:
Thanks, Mercenaries, I appreciate it.
Take this message from our scouts it'll tell you a bit more about the Pack we're looking for.

Wait.text: Don't take the Hunt lightly. Those monsters strike such fear into your heart that you risk losing your mind.

End.text:
Good news! That should reassure our warlike admirers.
Here, take this reinforced layer. I hope you'll find some use for it.

AcceptWait.text:
I'll try to learn more about the Skelmar religion.
The Beast may have chosen their lands as a place to hibernate, or some such.

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Ormance Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Andraste.

Start.text: The Skelmar have pursued the barony's craftsmen into the Tomb of the Ancients. No one has come out. The gods do not like to be disturbed.

Next1.text:
Apparently some craftsmen survived in the Tomb of the Ancients?
I hope they'll make the appropriate offerings to thank our god for being so lenient!

Start.text: War paints can only be worn by the brave few who have completed their initiation in the Tules' Glade in Ludern.

Tatoo1.text:
It's rare for outsiders to show interest in the customs of Harag. It's a pleasure to share them with you.
Which of your Companions wishes to wear the war paint?

Tatoo2.text: Does anyone else among your Companions want an ornament?

Start.text:
The Broker Council has tasked me with assisting you.
Gosenberg is eager for trade in Ormance to resume.

If your company's going to take on the Skelmar, it can't be carrying any dead weight.
Each of you must be at the very peak of their skills.

line0.text: Rebuild this place so that it can contribute to the War Effort.

Start.text: Now that the barony has been liberated, the Merchants will return soon! I'm long overdue for a halfway decent new outfit!
We've done it! Mercenaries! Puy-Corbin is free! Free!

Next1.text: I can't believe it! All of our suffering! All of those horrors! And now we've emerged victorious!

Next2.text:
Promise made, promise kept! The Ormance Sawmill will continue to provide you with its finest catapults.
I also have a more personal gift for you. Just my way of thanking you for all that you've done for us.

Wait.text:
I miss the Mercenaries from the Brotherhood!
Without them around, the Barony of Puy-Corbin is a pretty dull place.

SpecialSkillNotif.text: You can now use the Craftsmen's Strategic Skill <skill>Catapult</skill> anywhere in Ormance County.

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the Barony of Puy-Corbin.

Start.text: The Brotherhood would never agree to come back under these conditions. The walls are barely holding together!

Next1.text:
Our Order would be more than happy to rebuild it all, as long as you provide us with the necessary resources.
It will be difficult to retake Ormance without the Mercenaries of Gosenberg.

line0.text: Talk to the Bandits.

Start.text:
I I can't believe I'm still alive
Thank you! Truly, all my thanks, Mercenaries.

Alt.text:
You saved us, Mercenaries!
Thank you! Thank you!

Start.text: All the prisoners are safe and sound! We did it, Mercenaries!

Next1.text: At first, I had my doubts about your company after all, not everyone is cut out to be an assassin. But I must admit, you have real talent!

Next2.text: Take your reward. Our leader will jump for joy when we tell her you saved everyone!

Next2Alt.text: Take your reward, and come and see us at our camp! Our leader will be delighted to meet you!

End.text:
We steal what we can, then leave before the Skelmar reinforcements show up.
Only a fool would settle for the lord mayor's reward.

MiddleSuccess1.text:
By the Beast's fangs, we could have done it! We could have saved all those people!
Why did you have to rush it?

MiddleSuccess2.text:
Fortunately, there are some survivors. Else what would they have thought of us when we came back to camp?
Grr! Just take your reward and go!

MiddleSuccessEnd.text: I won't pay you any more. Maybe if you'd saved all the prisoners

Failure1.text:
What a disaster! We never should have attacked!
So many deaths! We're nothing but a bunch of incompetent fools!

Failure2.text:
And you!
Get out of here! I never want to see you again!

Failure2Alt.text:
And you!
Get out of here! I never want to see you again!
And don't even think of coming anywhere near the hideout! We've quite enough problems as it is!

FailureEnd.text: I told you to get the hell out!

SettingLog.text: You helped the Bandits destroy the Skelmar camp.

Start.text:
Praise be to the Order of Saint Lenaid!
My farm is even better than I remember it!

Next1.text: I don't have as much livestock as before the invasion, but I'll do whatever I can to thank you.

Start.text: The Order of Saint Lenaid has done tidy work here: you'd never know what happened while we were gone.

Next1.text: Still, sometimes I get a strange feeling at night. I hear voices whispering in Skelmish.

MissionDesc.text: Your services may be needed at the Bandits' Lair.

line0.text: Liberate the Barony of the Isle to rebuild this place.

line1.text: Rebuild this place so that it can contribute to the War Effort.

line0.text: Align yourself with either the Bandits or the farmers.

Start.text: The Skelmar are in a pretty rough spot.
I really hope you know what you're doing.

Hide.text:
Let's not waste time, Mercenaries.
We must bury the Skelmar's bodies before their accomplices find us.
Have you got something to hide the graves with?

Give1.text:
Excellent!
Leave us to it, this won't take long.

Give2.text: We're ready to leave! Thanks again for your help, and I hope this reward will be satisfactory.

Give2Alt.text:
We're ready to leave!
Here's your reward. And if you want more, we could use some reliable allies. Come find us at our camp in the north of the barony.

SettingLog.text: You convinced the scouts to come back to the camp.

MissionDesc.text: Give 8Hemp to the Bandit.

Start.text:
Ah! I knew it!
Nothing beats good old-fashioned intimidation!

Hang.text: The Skelmar aren't ready for what I've got in store for them! If you can get me some rope, I promise we'll make quick work of it!

Give1.text: Such efficiency, Mercenaries! You can count on us to follow your example!

Give2.text:
Exactly as I imagined it! A true vision of horror!
Thanks again for your help, and I hope this reward will be satisfactory.

Hide.text: What's the use in killing Skelmar if we don't get to brag about it?

Give2Alt.text:
Exactly as I imagined it! A true vision of horror!
We could use more allies like you. Why not come and meet us at the Bandit camp?

SettingLog.text: You convinced the scouts to return to the camp.

MissionDesc.text: Give 4 Ropes to the farmer.

Start.text: If we don't hide the bodies, we'll be putting our whole hideout in danger.

Next1.text: What, and hide our victory? The Skelmar need to see what we're capable of!

Next2.text: But that's the whole problem! When they see their friends strung up here, they'll do anything to avenge them!

Next3.text: I'm not going back to camp until every one of these rats is hanging from the beams of this bloody farm!

Next4.text:
Well, then, I guess we'll all just sit here until the Light calls us home, because there's no way I'm letting you put my companions in danger!
Mercenaries! Say something! You know this kind of work!

line0.props.tipText: Say that they should hang the bodies.

line1.props.tipText: Say that they should hide the bodies.

line2.props.tipText: Suggest sparing the Skelmar.

Spare1.text: That's the stupidest thing I've ever heard.

Spare2.text: Forget what they just said, and let's continue our conversation, my dear.

MissionDesc.text: Decide the Skelmar prisoners' fate.

Start.text:
You can just feel that this farm's got history, right?
Far be it from me to erase it but perhaps we can write a new chapter.

Next1.text: That's why the Order of Saint Lenaid was sent to Ormance. If you provide me with adequate materials, my apprentices and I will show you a whole new side of this farm.

MissionDescSiege.text: Lay siege to Lycia and the Skelmar.

line0.text: Take on Lord Mayor Septin's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Talk to Lord Mayor Septin.

line0.text: Accept Bandit Chief Tella's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line0.text: Take on the mission from the Bandit named Mortis.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: What you see before you is all that remains of Lycia.

Next1.text:
These people may not be warriors, but they're prepared to do whatever it takes to reclaim their homes from the Skelmar.
If you're willing to help them, I will pay you.

Next2.text: Our apothecary, our blacksmith and some other honest villagers have been captured by the Skelmar. You know what you have to do.

Wait.text: Craftsmen are the Skelmar's favourite targets. They can sell them at a higher price than a mere farmer.

OneSaved.text: I'm told you've saved people from the Skelmar before. Keep it up and you'll be rewarded.

TwoSaved1.text: It's such a relief to have our apothecary and our blacksmith back. Thanks to you, Lycia will remain alive.

TwoSaved2.text: No one has ever so richly deserved their reward. I hope you'll like these trinkets I saved from the Skelmar attack.

Wait2.text: Once there are enough of us together, we'll take back the village of Lycia!

MissionDesc1.text: Save the prisoners from the Skelmar.

MissionDesc2.text: Save the prisoners from the Skelmar.

SettingLog.text: You rescued the Lycia craftsmen.

Village1.text: We have a new mission for you, Mercenaries: take back the village of Lycia from those miserable Skelmar.

Village2.text: You won't be alone my gang and I will be right by your side. Some of the locals and Bandits you've saved will be willing to assist you.

Village3.text: It'll be a tough fight, but thanks to you, victory is within our reach. We're certain of it.

Village4.text: Help us take back Lycia, and I'll help you to save Countess Montrevel. That's my one condition.

VillageAccepted.text: Excellent. Meet us outside the village. We'll wait for you before launching our attack.

Start.text:
Well, well! You're looking for Countess Montrevel?
Tell the Guard that she got what she deserves: the Skelmar have captured her and locked her up in her own prison!

Next1.text:
That coward fled from the barbarians' advance and left the village of Lycia for the taking.
If my gang hadn't been there, all these honest villagers would be slaves now!

Next2.text: Even now, we're still fighting to save her villagers! Some of my men are preparing to attack one of their camps. Help them, and perhaps I can find a way to get the Countess out of her prison.

Accept.text:
Meet them at nightfall they're planning a surprise attack.
I hope you'll be able to mobilise enough men to take action.

Meet.text:
You've met my men, right? So you've seen with your own eyes those who remember the villagers' fate.
Help them, Mercenaries, and we'll pay you from our loot.

Wait.text: I don't understand how that Countess could be of the slightest use to you.

End.text: Saving prisoners isn't an act of charity. Every man or woman set free is a potential soldier. Once we have enough of them, we'll attack Lycia and reclaim it from the Skelmar.

Alt1.text: So it's you. The Mercenaries who wiped the Skelmar camp off the map. Gislidis told me about you and your methods. What brought you to this barony, pray tell?

Alt2.text:
Well, well! You're looking for Countess Montrevel?
Tell the Guard that she got what she deserves: the Skelmar have captured her and locked her up in her own prison!

Alt3.text:
That coward fled from the barbarians' advance and left the village of Lycia for the taking.
If my gang hadn't been there, all these honest villagers would be slaves now!

Alt4.text: Even now, we're still fighting to save her villagers! Help us drive the Skelmar out of the Barony of the Isle, and perhaps I can find a way to get the Countess out of her prison.

Start.text:
You see! The Skelmar were so terrified to see their friends hanged by the neck that they didn't dare attack us!
You made the right choice!

Hide.text: The Skelmar didn't deserve proper graves! You can count on me to dig up their bodies and throw them in the river when all this is over!

Start.text:
I'm certain the Skelmar will eventually attack us to avenge their lost men.
We must strike Lycia to pull the rug out from under them.

Hide.text: No sign of the Skelmar! And it's all thanks to you, Mercenaries. We successfully concealed the bodies.

Start.text:
I don't like this.
Our scouts should have been back by now.

Next1.text: Some villagers insisted on going along with them. I hope they haven't ruined the whole mission.

Next2.text: I don't suppose you could go and have a look around Casselia's Farm, could you? If you find them, bring them back quickly. We need them to recapture Lycia.

Reward.text: I can't believe the scouts spent an entire day bickering. Thank you for making them listen to reason.

MissionDesc.text: Find the scouts at Casselia's Farm.

Start.text: The man is hard at work. Your Companions would rather not disturb him.

My supplies are all back in Lycia, but I've managed to whip up a few potions!
Buy whatever you like it's an honour to have you as customers.

Heal.text: You're ready to fight the Skelmar, Mercenaries!

Start.text: Once we've retaken Lycia, I can offer you my full range of items.

Repair.text: It was the least I could do.

Start.text: What can the Black Market do for you, my Mercenary friends?
Oh, so you've liberated the Barony of Belestan?

Next1.text:
If you're willing to be as cooperative with us as you were with the Guard, the Bandits of Ormance will be happy to assist you.
What do you need?

Start.text: We're alive! The Barony of the Isle is free! You've done it!

Next1.text: And even more important, you've cleverly rid yourselves of the Countess! Believe me, she was a dreadful woman you did well to let her die.

Next2.text: Don't worry about what's next. I'll send a message to Belestan, and the Guard will be bound to back the Lord Mayor of Lycia. I bet they'll even pay you just for reclaiming their beloved prison.

Accept.text: And now I must leave you, if you don't mind. This place makes me uncomfortable.

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the Barony of the Isle and let Countess Montrevel die.

Start.text:
So it's you I have to thank for setting me free?
I am unpleasantly surprised to learn that my Guard preferred to pay Mercenaries to save me rather than risking it themselves.

Next1.text:
Captain Pallas doesn't have what it takes to be a leader, and I should have suspected that she wouldn't have the strength to take on the Skelmar either.
Fortunately for the County, I'm now in a position to command the Guard myself.

Next2.text:
You have earned your reward, Mercenaries.
I'll be sure to send it to you once I have returned to my castle in Belestan.

Accept.text: The good people of Ormance will be thrilled that I've been freed. I'm most eager to let them know.

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the Barony of the Isle and saved Countess Montrevel.

Start.text: I don't understand you. That woman will be like a ball and chain dragging you down for you, the Guard and the people of Ormance, and for the effort to win back the County.

Next1.text: But at least, you'll have made those simpletons in the Guard happy.

Next2.text: I'll let the Lord Mayor find her an escort. Our deal doesn't extend that far.

Start.text:
For services rendered to the County of Ormance, the Bandits are absolved of their past crimes.
I've been ordered to accept only Skelmar.

Deliver.text: Don't worry, that louse won't have time to get bored here. The gallows is already prepared.

NoSlotAvailable.text: We'll have to wait for a few of our boarders to be hung before any more can be brought in.

SettingEnd1.text:
The Bandits have decided to go back underground, for their past assistance is no longer enough to make up for their crimes.
Bring me the worst scum in Ormance, I'll be happy to take them all in.

SettingEndDeliver.text: Don't worry, that louse won't have time to get bored here. The gallows is already prepared.

Start.text:
The Countess and I were imprisoned at the same time.
Believe me, I'm dying to take revenge!

Next1.text: Ormance Prison has seen better days, but I promise I'll make our inmates work harder than ever for the sake of reclaiming our county!

line0.text: Liberate all of the baronies in Ormance to access this content.

line1.text: Win a Rouste Match in Ormance.

Start.text:
The Mercenaries!
That's you, right? The heroes of Ormance and all of its baronies! We were just celebrating our victory over the Skelmar!

Next1.text: Stay right there! We'll make room for you in the stands! We mustn't let the stench of the rabble disturb you during the show! Unless

Rouste1.text:
Do you want to take part?
Oh! Please say yes! The people of Ormance would absolutely love to see their saviours crush their local team!

Rouste2.text:
You won!
Oh, Mercenaries! It's unbelievable!
First the Skelmar Now the Ormance team! It's unprecedented! What an incredible show!

Rouste3.text:
The crowd is going wild! And they all want one thing: to see you play again!
I'm sure our team will do everything it can to make this match even more exciting!

RousteDiff1.text:
Just say the word and I'll start the match.
The crowd's waiting for you the heroes of the County and Rouste champions!

line0.props.tipText: Play Vertruse's team in Hard mode.

RousteDiff2.text:
Another win! Incredible! Simply incredible!
I yelled so much, I won't be able to talk for days.
Take your reward before my voice gives out entirely!

RousteDiff3.text:
Well! Ahem.
It seems our rewards are giving out too, not just our voices.
You can participate, of course, but I won't be able to reward you if you win.

RousteEnd1.text:
Care for another match?
Just remember, at this point our rewards are like my voice All used up.

line0.props.tipText: Play Vertruse's team in Hard mode.

RousteEnd2.text: So many wins I may never get my voice back.

Start.text:
Oh, how I missed Rouste!
Building a field was the first thing I thought of when I heard of the Skelmar's defeat!
I haven't played Rouste in so long, I'm worried I may have forgotten all the rules.

When the Skelmar pillaged my farm, I swore that if I made it out alive, I'd become a Rouste player!
You only live once, dammit!
The champion, Attia, is feeling much better! Thanks to you!

Next1.text: The Arena will share its resources with you until Ormance County is completely rebuilt.

Start.text:
I know you beat the jarl who had occupied the arena, but he wasn't our real champion.
If you want to buy my wares, you'll have to beat Attia, and her alone.

Alt.text:
Not only have you saved our arena from the Skelmar, you've also defeated Attia!
It's an honour doing business with you!

Start.text: Welcome, Mercenaries! The real County arena is proud to welcome its liberators!

Next1.text: It's all been repainted, the floors have been cleaned and the banners re-sewn, and we've brought in new fighters from all the different kingdoms to replace the ones who anyway, you get the idea.

Next2.text: The point is, our Arena is rising from the ashes, and we'd be honoured if you were the first to fight here!

OnLeaveArena.text: Why stop now? You were winning!

Completed.text:
I knew it! We all knew it! Even Attia was certain you'd defeat her!
She even cleaned her weapon for you so she wouldn't waste your time!

ArenaLost.text: Don't stop after one little defeat! You defeated the Skelmar, so, of course, you can win these fights!

ArenaDiff.text:
Don't tell me you're ready to go back into the arena?!
We would love that! Attia's been training as hard as she can to give you a more thrilling fight than ever!

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text:
What a fantastic performance! Mercenaries, you're just the competitors this arena needed to bring it back to life!
The reward is all yours.

CompletedDiff2.text:
Come back and fight here as often as you like! I promise you the crowds will show up every time.
Unfortunately, the arena's coffers aren't as full as they once were, so we won't have any more rewards for you.

ArenaAgain.text:
Impossible! You're back?
Well, by all means, you know your way in!
Still, I should remind you that we have no more rewards to give you.

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedAgain.text:
I can feel the old spirit of the Ormance Arena coming back. Just take a look at that crowd!
It seems they never tire of watching you win.

Show.text: These legionaries didn't survive their encounter with the new arena champion.

MissionDesc1.text: Enter and win fights in Attia's Arena.

MissionDesc2.text: Take Jarl Jorn's weapon from his body.

MissionDesc3.text: Eliminate the Skelmar in Attia's Arena.

SettingLog.text: You have defeated Jarl Jorn.

line0.text: Complete Attia's Arena.

Start.text: Come on over, warriors! Come try out my arena! I want to know what Edoranians think of what I've done with it!

Next1.text:
No more of this "sparing your opponent"!
If you want a reward, you must tear it from your enemy's bloodied corpse!

Next3.text:
Sounds pretty good, right?
A real challenge, for real warriors!

NoBeginArena.text: You think you're too good for my arena?

OnLeaveArena.text:
What? Afraid to die?
Edoranians are all cowards.

ArenaLost.text: You're lucky you're still alive. For that reason only, I'll give you another chance.

Start.text:
If the jarl decides to put on arena fights, then we'll put on arena fights.
Whatever that means.

End1.text: Jorn got what he deserved. Only an idiot would go wasting perfectly good slaves like that.

End2.text:
Now that he's dead, there's no reason to sit around here gathering dust.
I don't know about the others, but I'm taking the loot and heading home.

line0.props.tipText: Fight the Skelmar.

line1.props.tipText: Let the Skelmar go.

Accept.text: We're already leagues away.

SettingLog.text: You have defeated Jarl Jorn.

Start.text:
We should have killed that woman as soon as we got here.
The jarl is constantly going to see her. He asks her all kinds of questions
The Skelmar shouldn't be taking advice from slaves!

End.text:
Keep that slave and let me go.
She has the same name as this place. She must be quite valuable.

Start.text:
I'm begging you! Please don't go into the arena!
The jarl only puts slaves in there! Farmers and fishermen who barely know how to fight.

I can't take it! I can't take it any more!
I never want to see another fight in my life!
Don't go too hard on our champion Attia. Give her some time to recover. We've seen terrible things, Mercenaries.

Next1.text:
I'll try to organise a defence of this place and the surrounding countryside.
The arena's not what it once was, but we'll do our best to help you if we can.

MissionDesc.text: Meet up with the Legion and Colonel Volusia outside the Military Academy.

line0.text: Take on Colonel Volusia's mission.

line1.text: Confront the jarls of the occupied areas in the Barony of Mayance.

line0.text: Take on Colonel Volusia's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
I hope you weren't intending to go to the capital.
The General has given orders to keep the border sealed.

Not many people make it clear across the barony in one piece. If you wish to fight under our banner, you're welcome to join us.
The battle ahead will be even more brutal than the one that destroyed Forecastle Rock.

Next1.text: This Border Crossing is the last bulwark that separates the Skelmar from our kingdom's capital. And the presence of so many jarls that's what those savages call their warlords can only mean one thing: an attack is imminent.

Next2.text: I don't know what the Skelmar are waiting for, but we'll need to use every remaining moment of calm to shore up our defences and weaken their army. Are you willing to help us? A battalion of legionaries will follow your orders.

line0.props.tipText: Obtain the Legion's Strategic Skill: <skill>PreliminaryAssault</skill>.

Accept.text: In this case: get rid of the jarls. Defeat them, kill them, convince them to abandon their clan it makes no difference. Their disappearance should cause enough chaos in their ranks to give us a chance to beat them.

Wait.text: The jarls are hiding away in the places they've occupied. Go introduce yourselves to them their pride should make it easy for you to approach them.

IntroAlt1.text: The jarl-killing Mercenaries! Your names are known throughout the barony. I don't know what drove you to slaughter these warlords, but you've saved more lives than you can imagine.

IntroAlt2.text: Those savages were preparing to attack our Border Crossing, the Legion's last defence before the capital of Edoran. The General himself asked me to inform you of his approval.

RewardAlt.text:
Now that our hands are free, the Legion can retake the Military Academy.
Will you join us? You could take command of an entire cohort

line0.props.tipText: Obtain the Legion's Strategic Skill: <skill>PreliminaryAssault</skill>

AcceptEnd.text: In this case, we're ready to attack the bastion in Mayance. Meet us there.

End1.text: The jarl-killers! You're finally back! I sent scouts out all over the barony to look for you!

End2.text: You've done it! The Skelmar are disorganised and divided, and some have even left these lands entirely! Not only is the capital no longer in danger, we'll even be able to attack their bastion now!

End3.text: The General himself sends you this reward. He promises an even greater one if you help us to retake the Military Academy and drive the Skelmar out of Mayance.

Start.text: Those sons of! They've deserted!

Next1.text: I swear, if I ever see Sergeant Oredel again, I'll hang him!

Give1.text:
By the Beast's fangs! Is that Oredel!
Blimey, I'll get the gallows ready!
Take this as thanks for finding him for me!

End.text: Sergeant Oredel will be tried by a military tribunal, but I'm not holding out any illusions about the outcome

Start.text:
As you might guess, I've got plenty of work to do.
Make it quick. You're not the only ones who want a piece of the Legion's resources.

This framework is even more magnificent than I remember!
I swore to the disciples of Saint Lenaid that when spring arrives, I'll make a pilgrimage to their abbey.

Next1.text:
But first, I want to make myself useful to the company that took my farm back from the Skelmar.
What do you need? Don't hold back!

Start.text:
No! No!
The Skelmar are coming back! They'll be back any minute!

Should I call the priest back?
I'm worried about him. His condition isn't improving.
The jarl's bed. Nothing useful here.

The jarl's loot. It's intact.
Your Companions don't find any clues here.
Footprints. Someone ran away from here.

MissionDesc1.text: Take on Hetha's mission.

MissionDesc2.text: Search the area for a lead.

line0.text: Liberate the Barony of Mayance to rebuild this place.

line1.text: Rebuild this place so that it can contribute to the War Effort.

line0.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line1.text: Follow the trail to find and kill the escaped jarl.

Start.text: That coward! He ran away! He refused to fight!

Next1.text: The word of the gods has been violated! This affront must be washed away with blood, or the whole clan will be cursed!

Next2.text: Help us find that miserable cur! We'll give you whatever you want in exchange! The clan's honour is worth all the loot in Edoran.

Accept.text:
He must have left some trace of his vile presence!
Search this place! Look in every barrel!
The clan demands vengeance!

Start.text: Kraven is worthless trash! Why didn't the gods designate me instead of him?

Running from a fight?!
I would have hung myself in shame.

You may consider this place beyond repair, but not for the Order of Saint Lenaid.
Faith and practical know-how are the stock-in-trade of even our humblest disciples.

Next1.text:
Unfortunately, our community has neither a lumberjack nor a quarryman.
I need all the resources you can bring us so that I can get to work.

Start.text: Well, if the Legion orders me to be a fisherman, I suppose I can be a fisherman!

Next1.text:
Just don't expect any miracles.
This is the first time I've seen a fishing rod in my life, outside of the tomes at Edoran University.

Start.text:
By order of the High Jarl, we're stuck here in this barony. There's been nothing new to pillage for weeks! My men are dying of boredom!
Entertain them, strangers!

Next3.text: Let's bet on whether you can beat me in a verbal sparring match. If you win, I give you the legionaries. If you lose, I keep them. And I'll hold on to the Krowns as well.

line0.props.tipText: Bet on your victory in a verbal sparring match.

line1.props.tipText: Fight the jarl and her men.

Fight1.text:
Hm? I see you prefer another type of sparring!
Well, that's fine by me.

Wait.text: Thanks for the Krowns, strangers. It was quite entertaining.

line0.props.tipText: Participate in a verbal sparring match.

line1.props.tipText: Fight the jarl and her men.

Start.text: It's obvious you've been travelling from the smell alone. You exude the scent of those muddy roads lined with gallows where traitors' corpses rot in the sun.

Next1.text: I should punish you with a mace to the skull, but by the look of yours, you seem to like that kind of thing. Your heads are so misshapen you couldn't fit a helmet on! You look like you've toured the whole country taking beatings from everyone, and now you've come here for the grand finale!

Answer2.text:
By Aeda, how did you know that?
I'll make you choke on your insults!

Next2.text: How dare you defy me, when you have no clan and no honour! You're nothing but vagabonds who get chased out of every village by stone-throwing mobs! Pariahs that no one will talk to except lowlifes with a son-in-law they want murdered and not enough guts to do it themselves!

Answer3.text: You're right! I'm nothing but worthless rubbish.

Start.text:
I've released the prisoners. They can go wherever they like. Just like my men.
Your victory was so humiliating, I don't deserve to keep the title of jarl. I might as well just crawl into a hole and die!

Next1.text:
Unless you'd accept me into your troop?
By Aeda, I have so much respect for your companions!

GoodBye.text: I understand. I can't be angry with you I wouldn't have wanted me either.

Start.text:
So when are we going off to war?
Skeda's little shows are entertaining, but they can't beat sacking a village.

Next1.text: Skeda failed I can't obey such a mediocre jarl.

Start.text:
High Jarl Sven promised us war and riches!
That's what he told us to wait for here!

Next1.text: The other clans are weak! They're taking too long to conquer Ormance!

Next2.text:
I don't work with amateurs!
That clan can sod right off, I'll just go pillaging on my own.

Start.text: My parents were fishermen. Before they entrusted me to Saint Lenaid's Abbey, I grew up in a place not unlike this one.

Next1.text: As soon as you've given me the necessary resources, I'll set to rebuilding it. You won't recognise the place.

Start.text: <narrator>Defeated by boredom, the creature has fallen asleep.</narrator>
You've come to get us out of here, right? Right?

MissionDesc1.text: Talk to Jarl Skeda.

MissionDesc2.text: Report your success to the Legion, near the Fishery.

line0.text: Liberate the Barony of Mayance to rebuild this place.

line1.text: Rebuild this place so that it can contribute to the War Effort.

line1.title: Fighting Boredom
line1.props.helpTip: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

SubRegion5End.text: You have liberated the Barony of Mayance. Others now await your help.

line0.text: Liberate all of the baronies in Ormance to access this content.

line1.text: Return to the instructor after completing Attia's Arena.

Start.text:
Come closer, Mercenaries.
Your feats deserve proper compensation.

Next1.text: Without your help, the jarls would have overrun us, and we would never have dared attack the Academy. We would have been left waiting to be crushed at the Border Crossing. To thank you, the Legion will support you in all of your battles in Ormance.

Next2.text: This victory will convince the General to send us reinforcements in fact, he must already be thinking of retaking the entire County. Soon the good people of Edoran will no longer have to suffer under the Skelmar plague.

SettingLog.text: You liberated the Barony of Mayance with the Legion's help.

Start.text: By the Beast's fangs! Look at this wreck! Look what those savages have done to our Academy!

Next1.text:
They must pay for this! They'll never dare approach our shores again!
The entire Legion will join in this undertaking!

Start.text: All legionaries start out at this Academy. This is where simple farmers become proud soldiers, and where foolish petty nobles become bold officers.

Next1.text:
In more ordinary times, your Companions could have benefited from my teachings.
But alas, I have a horde of commoners and farmers to train in the art of war.

Next2.text: I always advise new recruits to train themselves in other forms of combat. Learning dirty tricks from the Bandits or clever strategies from the arena champions can make all the difference on the battlefield!

Next3.text:
Just look at me! Before becoming a captain and instructor, I was champion of the Ormance Arena!
Prove to me that you too can excel there, and I'll teach you how to hold a crossbow properly.

End1.text:
I heard the cheers from the arena all the way back here!
I want all the details! Tell me how you did it!

End2.text:
Why not test that technique on the Skelmar still skulking around the County?
They're the ideal targets!

MissionDesc1.text: Lend your assistance to Jarl Tyrra or her contagious adversaries.

MissionDesc2.text: Get rid of the plague-ridden rats.

MissionDesc4.text: Collect your reward from Jarl Tyrra's body.

line0.text: Lend your assistance to Jarl Tyrra or her contagious adversaries.

line1.text: Get rid of the Plague-ridden Rats.

line2.text: Heal or execute Jarl Tyrra.

Start.text:
You! Do you know what these creatures are?
Where did they come from? Why are there so many of them?

Next1.text: I've been bitten! Wh What's going to happen to me?

Help.text: Thank you! Thank you for healing me. I thought I was going to die.

Help2.text:
I never should have agreed to come to this cursed land!
The High Jarl's orders aside, I'm not going to sacrifice my clan for him!

End.text:
These lands are cursed!
We never should have come here!

Next1.text: The rats don't seem very grateful.

Start.text: The man is struggling to catch his breath.
This woman is too exhausted to speak to you.

Everyone knew Portius and his wife.
I'm sure they would have wanted to help you in your fight against the Skelmar.
Tell me what purpose to put this farm to I'll do it for them.

End.text:
Everyone knew Portius and his wife.
I'll take good care of their farm you can count on me.

Start.text: Portius was one of the last veterans of the Harag campaign. Dying like that after serving under General Edoran himself He deserved better.
The old folks' bodies have been rotting here for weeks.

line0.text: Liberate the Barony of Goella to rebuild this place.

line1.text: Rebuild this place so that it can contribute to the War Effort.

line0.text: Talk to the Skelmar.

line1.text: Use an Ornate Key to open the trapdoor.

line2.text: Eliminate the Skelmar

line0.text: Destroy the rats' nest.

Start.text: Oh, is this what Mercenaries look like? Is it true we can pay you to do things so we don't have to?

Next1.text: Well, then! Open this damned trapdoor! There's Krowns in it for you.

Next2.text: I have to say, these Mercenaries are handy to have around. The only problem is, we don't really want to pay them

Start.text: We should have asked the farmers where they hid their key before killing them.
Nothing was spared here.

Next1.text: I can't bring the dead back to life, but if you'll permit me, by providing our Order with adequate resources, I can give this place a fresh start.

Start.text: Some rats have made a nest in this cave!

MissionDesc1.text: Eliminate the Skelmar from the lighthouse.

MissionDesc2.text: Save Jarl Sigurdr from his precarious position.

MissionDescMine.text: Find and rescue the members of Jarl Sigurdr's clan.

MissionDescStables.text: Find and rescue the members of Jarl Sigurdr's clan.

MissionDescTower.text: Find and rescue the members of Jarl Sigurdr's clan.

line0.text: Eliminate the Skelmar.

line1.text: Rescue Jarl Sigurdr.

line0.text: Take on Jarl Sigurdr's mission.

line1.text: Rescue the members of Jarl Sigurdr's clan in the Barony of Goella.

Start.text: Help!

Next1.text:
I I'm all out of strength!
You've got to pull me up. Please!

line0.props.tipText: Choose a strong Companion to rescue Sigurdr.

CampDialog.text: I prefer to avoid fighting It would be a shame to die before I can give you your reward!

Start.text: Oof, that was a close one! Jorn devour me, I didn't think I'd make it through this day alive!

Next1.text: Now that you've saved me, you've got to help me get revenge! Those dogs call me a traitor, but I'm the only real Skelmar here!

Next2.text: Do you know why they want me dead? Because I opposed the plan to conquer Edoran! Setting down roots in distant lands goes against the nomadic spirit of the Skelmar! And so does not sharing the loot fairly

Next3.text:
Make a pact with me: help me kill the High Jarl, and half of his treasure is yours! Better yet! Once I've replaced him, I'll bring my people back to the World's Edge.
You'll be heroes here in Edoran. Very rich heroes!

Accept.text:
Perfect! First, we'll have to get my clan back together. I can't rule without them.
My clan members have almost all been captured, and the rest are surely being hunted down by the High Jarl's followers. Let's go help them, and they'll join us in our fight. I'm almost sure of it

SettingLog.text: You saved Jarl Sigurdr from certain death.

Start.text: Get lost! The reward is ours! We found Jarl Sigurdr first!

MissionDesc1.text: Help the Priestess of the Light.

MissionDesc2.text: Talk to the Priestess of the Light.

MissionDesc3.text: Listen to the conversation between Jarl Sigurdr and Liv.

line0.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Praise be to Saint Eleor for sending you to us! You saved us all! Thank you, Mercenaries!

Next1.text: My new flock deserves valiant protectors they've suffered so much! Just imagine: their own leader betrayed them, dooming them to be hunted and pursued unto death by other barbarians.

Next2.text:
And in the depths of their despair, they found me and with me, the comforting faith of the Light.
I swore to protect these repented souls, and thanks to you, I was able to keep that vow. My most sincere thanks!

End.text: I shall teach these converts everything I know of the teachings of Saint Jeru. Our faith will guide us and help bring you victory over the Skelmar.

End2.text: Those who wish to renounce that dreadful Skelmar religion will find enough hard work here to occupy their minds, and enough uplifting scripture to find redemption.

Final.text:
I have decided to use hard work and scripture to more effectively convert the Skelmar.
Don't worry, my flock will soon be a part of the kingdom of Edoran!

Start.text:
The Skelmar gods chose that tyrant Sven as High Jarl.
How could I have kept faith after that?
The priestess only agreed to hide us if we converted to her weird religion.

Next1.text: It's a fair trade.

Start.text: You want to know what I think about Sigurdr?

Next1.text:
That idiot should never have openly rebelled against Sven.
He should've just set sail! Left these accursed lands to the tyrant!
But no! Sigurdr just had to try and seize the war loot for himself!

Next2.text: Dammit! I must calm down, or I won't be able to pray properly

Start.text:
Liv! May the gods smile upon our reunion!
I'm so relieved to see you all alive!

Next1.text: How dare you show your face here, you you heretic. Your stupid bloody rebellion nearly got us all killed!

Next2.text: It's true! It's true! I went about it the wrong way. But could I really have kept obeying Sven's orders? Should we have settled in these lands? Should we have left him all the loot?

Next3.text: But I Wait!

Next4.text:
Of course not, Liv!
We had to rebel! We simply had to! Our honour as Skelmar commanded us to act. And it's still commanding us now!

Next5.text: I'm certain that's what your new god commands, too? To drive out the heretics from your sacred kingdom, and all that. Join me! Join me as the Mercenaries have, and I promise we'll rid Edoran of the High Jarl.

End.text: Don't worry. Liv is already convinced.

SettingLog.text: You saved Liv and rallied her to your cause.

Start.text: Sigurdr is a slick talker, but he's right.

Next1.text:
The God of Light wants no heretics in his kingdom. We must drive out our former brothers!
You can count on our support, Mercenaries.

SubRegion6End.text: You have liberated the Barony of Goella. Others now await your help.

Start.text:
The Eye of the Light guides your decisions. That's what the priestess taught us.
Tell us what we need to do to drive the heretics from Saint Jeru's lands.
The one time that idiot Sigurdr tells the truth, he winds up dead in battle!

Next1.text: We'll honour our jarl's memory back there, at the World's Edge, as he wished.

Alt1.text: For once, I was actually right to let Sigurdr convince me of something. I'd almost be willing to forgive him his previous failure!

Start.text:
It's always sad when a warlord isn't there to savour his clan's victory.
A jarl's life can be so thankless

Next1.text: Look at all this loot, Mercenaries! I can't believe my eyes!

Next2.text:
You can count on me in your fight against Sven!
To think that jackal refused to share all this gold

Start.text:
This loot is incredible! I could stare at it all day long!
And it's only a part of Sven's spoils!

Next1.text:
Go ahead and take your share, Mercenaries! I never could have done it without you!
My clan would be dead and the High Jarl would be dancing on my grave.

Accept1.text:
I'm getting ready to attack Forecastle Rock and knock the High Jarl off his perch.
Soon my clan will set sail back to our homeland, our holds filled with gold and slaves!

Accept2.text:
Should I bring some priests of the Light along, too? I find their strange religion very intriguing.
Besides, we need to find a replacement for the bad gods who named Sven their chosen one.

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the Barony of Goella and spared Jarl Sigurdr.

Start.text: Looks like you've decided to trust Sigurdr.

Next1.text: May Saint Jeru reaffirm your decision, Mercenaries.

Start.text: Too bad Sigurdr got caught by a stray arrow, huh?

Next1.text:
Well, thanks to Saint Eleor, we've got plenty to comfort us in our grief.
Look at this, Mercenaries. The High Jarl's loot! All these riches and to think, this is only a part of it!

Next2.text:
The rest is at Forecastle Rock, guarded by the High Jarl's most die-hard followers. He's waiting for us to come and take it.
When you're ready to attack the fortress, my Skelmar will be there.

Accept.text: I'll lead the clan. Those who refuse to convert will have to return to the World's Edge. These lands will soon be purged of heretics!

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the Barony of Goella and killed Jarl Sigurdr.

Start.text: This Skelmar was brutally killed.

MissionDesc1.text: Talk to Jarl Sigurdr's companions.

MissionDesc2.text: Claim your reward from Jarl Sigurdr.

line0.text: Take on the mission from the Skelmar named Thorkell.

line1.text: Track down Sigurdr with the help of his imprisoned fellow companions.

line2.text: Eliminate the Skelmar occupying this place.

line3.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: I'm trying to ignore the fact that there's a Skelmar right behind me. You should do the same.

End.text: What can I do for you, Mercenaries?

Start.text: Are you what they call Mercenaries? Rumour has it that we can hire you for money.

Next2.text:
We're looking for a Skelmar, a traitor by the name of Sigurdr. He escaped from his cage last night, then killed his jailer.
Bring him back. Dead or alive.

Accept.text: Question his former companions. They know something, I can feel it! Torture didn't yield any results, but you must have your own techniques in Edoran, right?

Start.text: I don't know where Sigurdr is! You're wasting your time!
Go ahead and torture me to death! I'll never betray my jarl!

Convinced1.text:
You're right!
That son of a jackal doesn't deserve my protection!

Convinced2.text: When Sigurdr ran off and abandoned us, he headed due south. He must be looking for a ship along the coast!

Start.text:
Jarl Sigurdr is a traitor! A traitor!
Rebelling against the gods' chosen one is a crime! He deserves to die!

The High Jarl promised us conquest and riches. We've done all right for the first one, but the second! All Sven has left us are crumbs.
Sigurdr didn't have any trouble finding supporters for his rebellion.
Sigurdr is a good jarl. His plan may have failed once, but next time, it'll work!

Next1.text: Let me look after these stables I'll organise everything so Jarl Sigurdr has whatever he needs.

Start.text: I might have had some doubt for a minute there
Sigurdr! You're alive! You came back for us!

Next1.text: I knew you would! I never doubted you!

Next2.text: Everything is fine now! We can pick up right where we left off!

Next3.text: Prepare yourselves, friends. Once we've rescued the rest of the clan, we'll invade the main camp! This so-called High Jarl's reign is coming to an end!

Start.text:
Aren't they courageous?
Better to have two loyal warriors than an army of traitors, am I right, Mercenaries?

Next1.text: Don't be put off by what that old biddy Thorkell tells you. She'd obey the High Jarl even if he told her to jump in the river. She's a gullible old woman! A fanatic!

Next2.text: You've got to trust me! I have no reason to betray you! Our goals are the same! To kill the High Jarl and send the clans back where they came from!

SettingLog.text: You eliminated Thorkell and rallied the members of the imprisoned clans.

Start.text: <narrator>This creature's fangs are quite impressive.</narrator>

MissionDesc1.text: Talk to the imprisoned captain.

MissionDesc2.text: Capture and hand over ::vars.amount:: prisoners to Rolf.

line0.text: Take on Rolf's mission.

line1.text: Deliver ::vars.amount:: slaves to Rolf.

Start.text:
If Rolf doesn't trust you, then neither do I.
How do I know you won't leave without paying?

Tatoo1.text: All right, warriors, so you want to look like real Skelmar? Intimidation is all part of the fight!

Tatoo2.text: Have a seat on the stool, you won't feel a thing! I'm even better with a needle than I am with an axe.

Tatoo3.text:
Try not to scratch at your scabs, it'll smear the ink.
Who's next?

Start.text:
You've joined forces with a Skelmar?
Have you lost your mind?

Shout.text:
Wait! Come back, Mercenaries!
Come back here!

Please1.text:
Surely you're not going to go and capture innocent people to turn them into slaves!
Please tell me you haven't sunk so low?

Please2.text: Hmph! Is that a problem, Mercenaries? The Skelmar make good slaves, too, but they're harder to catch.

Please3.text: I don't know why you're following Skelmar orders, Mercenaries, but just don't let it hurt the people of Edoran.

Wait.text: I don't know why you're following Skelmar orders, Mercenaries, but just don't let it hurt the people of Edoran. Please!

BadEnd1.text: You're despicable! How could you just hand over honest folk to those barbarians?

BadEnd2.text: Sooner or later, the Eye's Reckoning will strike you down! The Skelmar will betray you in the end! And you'll deserve every bit of it!

GoodEnd1.text: Thank you for sparing the people of Edoran. I really thought you'd abandoned all of your morals!

GoodEnd2.text: You have my respect at least a little bit. Buy my freedom and you'll also have my weapons.

Start.text: You've obtained redemption for the High Jarl, it seems. How much did it cost you? Your honour, and the little bit of loot that Sven didn't keep for himself?

Next1.text:
That's right, go ahead and lecture us, you coward!
We're only here because of you and your blasted rebellion! If we knew how pathetic your plan was, we would have been satisfied with what the High Jarl gave us!

Next2.text:
Warriors like you deserved better!
Luckily, I'm back now, and supported by the most fearsome warriors in all of Edoran. This time, the High Jarl's loot will be ours!

Next3.text:
I know you, Sigurdr! These people could easily be just a bunch of farmers dressed in armour!
Let your new minions prove their worth, and maybe we'll think about joining you.

Next4.text: Excellent! My warriors are unmatched when it comes to capturing slaves! You'll be rich soon! Too bad we're out of time

Next5.text: Two, Sigurdr. I want two slaves. No fewer.

Slaves1.text:
Where are my slaves?
I won't follow Sigurdr just because he asked me to! I want proof!

SlavesWait.text: Where's the other slave, Mercenaries? Sigurdr promised us two!

Slaves3.text: High-quality slaves, Mercenaries! Sigurdr wasn't lying about your worth.

Slaves5.text: You can consider your part of the pact complete. Sigurdr will have our support. With allies like you, he can't fail!

SettingLog.text: You have convinced Rolf and his men to join Sigurdr's cause.

Start.text: This is our last slave. The High Jarl didn't want him.

I'm happy to see Sigurdr alive.
He may not be brave or honest, but at least we're never bored when he's around.

Next1.text: Sigurdr is our jarl again? Then the clan will give him what he needs. What does he want?

Next2.text: As a humble convert to the religion of the Light, it would be an honour to help you drive the heretics from our lands.

Start.text: The tattoo artist is gone, but where did he go?
<narrator>The builder monks of Saint Lenaid have finished my fortress. Praise be to the God of Light and to Saint Jeru our guide for letting me see my life's work completed!</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Forecastle Rock stands higher and prouder than any other bastion! Where once there stood only a wind-blasted rock now rises the Lock of Ormance! The Montrevels' Redoubt against barbarians of all kinds! </narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>May it protect the sacred lands of our empire and our family for centuries to come! </narrator>

Start.text:
We did it, Mercenaries!
The High Jarl is dead! Forecastle Rock has fallen! The war treasure is ours!

Dialog5.text: I'll never make the same mistake as the High Jarl so as promised, some of his treasure is yours. You've helped us achieve much more than mere revenge!

Accept.text: I'm sure I'll make a suitable Count. You can continue on your way with confidence.

End.text: If I'd known how much it would take to reach this point I would have hired you much earlier! Haha!

SettingLog.text: You've liberated Forecastle Rock.

Start.text: I can't wait to make my report to the capital. I hope to see you again someday.

Dialog2.text:
The fall of Forecastle Rock is the final turning point in the recapture of Ormance.
The General will be very satisfied to learn that his County has been freed of the Skelmar.

Start.text:
Faith has triumphed over heresy!
Praised be Saint Jeru!

Dialog3.text:
Faith has triumphed over heresy!
Praised be Saint Jeru!

Start.text:
Have no fear for the safety of Ormance!
The Guard has already sworn its loyalty to the new Count.

Dialog4.text: The Skelmar army is in complete disarray. Any that didn't reach their ships in time will be hunted down and executed. Never again will the people of Ormance suffer under their cruelty!

Start.text:
You won't see me kneeling in front of the Count.
I didn't fight the Skelmar to become a law-abiding citizen.

Sigurdr promised that all converts would be pardoned by the Count.
I'm going to make sure he doesn't break his vow.

May Saint Jeru bless the day when the Montrevels kicked all the invaders out of their lands and reconquered their County.
I hope you realise what an honour it was for you to fight under my banner.

Dialog4.text:
And now, your reward.
I know this is all you care about... I'll settle my account with you promptly so you can leave my County as quickly as possible.

Accept.text: No need to thank me any further. You are dismissed. I'm sure other contracts await you.

SettingLog.text: You've liberated Forecastle Rock.

Start.text: This may be the last time we see each other: I'm returning to the capital tonight to report the details to the General.

Dialog2.text:
The battle of Forecastle Rock is a huge success: the Skelmar have been routed, and the County has regained its rightful ruler.
The General will be altogether satisfied.

Start.text: There are still a few isolated Skelmar in the region. I intend to leave a few men behind to take care of them.

Dialog3.text:
The same goes for the Hierophant.
I'll tell him how we killed the heretics and drove them all the way back to their ships. Ah! Dozens of them must already have drowned in their attempts to escape!

Start.text:
We've done it! We've done it!
I knew the Countess would lead us to victory.

You won't see me licking the Countess's boots.
The truce between the Bandits and the Guard was only temporary.
Don't worry, I'll make sure the Skelmar converts find their place in Edoranian society.
My recapture of Ormance has ended in most excellent fashion. They will sing of this battle on every street corner in the Five Kingdoms.

Dialog5.text:
In my generosity, I add to these spiritual offerings a part of the treasure that the High Jarl dared to steal from me.
Yes, you may thank me.

Accept.text: Ormance has no further need of your services. You are dismissed.

SettingLog.text: You've liberated Forecastle Rock.

Start.text:
All this gold! Bloody hell!
I didn't think there was this much in the whole world!

Dialog2.text:
After everything you did to the High Jarl, those clans won't be setting foot in the kingdom again.
Ha! The survivors must be clambering for their spot in the last few boats headed for the World's Edge!

Start.text: Of all the events we've experienced, the wedding of the Countess to that barbarian was the most surprising.

Dialog3.text:
The General will be happy to know that peace has returned to his kingdom.
I'll be sure to mention your decisive role in this victory.

Start.text: Any Skelmar who decide to stay in Ormance will have a choice to make: conversion or death.

Dialog4.text: I'll do the same with the Hierophant. You may not be saints, but what you've done for Ormance certainly deserves an altar to your glory.

Start.text: We couldn't have dreamed of a better ending.

The new Count is no better than his wife.
You won't see me licking their boots.

Sigurdr promised that all converts would be pardoned by the Count.
I'm going to make sure he doesn't break his vow.

We've done it! Mercenaries!
Forecastle Rock is ours! Ormance County is free!

Dialog5.text: We've got a lot of work ahead of us before Ormance rises from the ashes, but just know that you will always be welcomed here as heroes, Mercenaries.

Start.text: I won't leave out any details when I tell the Hierophant of your feats.

Dialog2.text:
Saint Jeru watched over our victory, and in his immense generosity, he sent you to guide us, Mercenaries.
Praised be the Eye of his Light!

Start.text:
We mustn't fool ourselves the General will end up giving Ormance County to some noble family.
The Lord Mayor's role in this victory won't mean much against the Kingdom of Edoran's traditions.

Dialog3.text: The General is very pleased with your victory, Mercenaries. It is a great relief for the Legion to know that our kingdom is free of the Skelmar threat.

Start.text:
Don't expect me to support the Lord Mayor.
I didn't risk my life in hopes of becoming a law-abiding citizen.

Dialog4.text:
You've earned your reward, Mercenaries.
Take this. This comes from our late Countess's treasury. I'm sure she'd have no objections to your taking it.

SettingLog.text: You've liberated Forecastle Rock.

Start.text: With no lord or lady to look to, the Guard will obey the Lord Mayor of Ormance.
Don't worry, I'll make sure the Skelmar converts find their place in Edoranian society.

This is it, Mercenaries! The moment of truth!
We mustn't fail!

Next1.text:
The men are dedicated to you. You can count on them to carry out your orders.
Simply tell them when to act.

line0.props.tipText: Obtain the Guard's Strategic Skill: <skill>Volley</skill>.

Start.text:
Victory is ours! We've done it, Mercenaries!
The Skelmar have been routed! The castle has been retaken! The Barony of Belestan is free!

Next2.text: Let's hurry inside, I must see our Countess immediately.

Start.text: Give us the fugitives! The jarl said "no survivors".
The place is occupied by unknown warriors.

The Skelmar are hot on our heels! We don't know where to run to!
Help! Please! We're exhausted!
Saint Eleor bless you! We haven't stopped running since the castle fell!

Next1.text: But what are you doing here, Mercenaries? The barony is lost! It's all over for Ormance County! You should flee, like the rest of us!

Next2.text: Pallas sent you to find the Countess? So the captain hasn't given up hope. What an admirable woman!

Next3.text: I wish I had better news to report. Our battalion defended the western rampart to the very end, and we never saw Countess Montrevel come through.

Accept.text: You can count on us to join the captain's ranks. Under her orders, we will protect Two-Shores with our very lives!

SettingLog.text: You saved the Guard from their pursuers.

Start.text: The Guard is facing off against adversaries unknown to your Companions.

Next0.text:
Over here! Whoever you are!
In the name of Saint Eleor, please help us!

Start.text:
The Guard tore down this bridge. Supposedly to slow down the Skelmar.
But now we're trapped like rats!

Next1.text:
Bring me some materials and I'll show you how to patch this pile of rubble back together.
Then my animals can cross over, and you'll have learned a new skill!

Next2.text:
Just like new! Good materials make good bridges!
Try it, you'll see!

Start.text:
I'm staying in Goella. As long as this barony is in my enemies' hands, I refuse to leave this place.
I'll meet up with you when you return.

I understand that you're concerned with the fate of the other baronies, but it's my duty to watch over our abbey.
We'll meet again when you return.

The siege is broken! Praised be Saint Eleor and Saint Guilhem!
Grace be upon them!

Next1.text: Follow me inside! Your reward awaits!

Start.text: Perfect timing, Mercenaries! The assault has just begun. The Inquisition seems to have things well in hand, but it would be foolish not to take every advantage we can get.

Next1.text: Saint Guilhem abbey will be generous to its saviours. I can promise you that.

Start.text:
Well done, Mercenaries.
We gave them a show worthy of the kingdom's finest jugglers!

Next1.text:
Of course, impersonating the God of Light is a sacrilege, but ultimately, wasn't it only the better to serve him?
I'm sure our souls have nothing to fear.
