Next2.text: Take your reward. I'll make sure that the Inquisitors are fully prepared to break the siege on the citadel.

Reward.text: If you wish to follow us in this holy undertaking, I promise that the abbey's coffers are full enough to pay you more than adequately for your services.

SettingLog.text: You convinced the Inquisition to help the Citadel of Saint-Guilhem.

Start.text:
The Eye has unleashed its reckoning upon you, heretics that you are!
You refused to defend a sacred place! Your souls will never join the Light!

Next1.text:
Those were the Hierophant's orders!
We were just following them!

Next2.text: Obeying a man instead of your own god? Such impiety is unworthy of the Inquisition!

Next3.text: Redeem yourselves! Redeem your souls by fighting alongside the God of Light to save His abbey!

Next4.text:
We'll obey the Light! We'll do everything in accordance with His will!
Give the command, and we will follow! I swear it!

line0.props.tipText: Obtain the Inquisition's Strategic Skill: <skill>Inferno</skill>.

Start.text: Th the Eye's Reckoning!

What do you want, Mercenaries?
I don't see any Skelmar patrol! Why did you call us?

Next1.text: How dare you insult the Inquisition? You call us... Heretics? Ours is a sacred mission, and

Next2.text:
... What did you say about my mother?
I'll make you eat your words!

Start.text: I'm not giving up. The Inquisition must come and help us.

Next1.text: Take me to the Gosenberg Travel Post, I'm sure I'll find some convincing arguments there!

Start.text: One of these bears is wearing a collar labelled Scruffy.

line0.props.disableReason: There must be some way to distract Scruffy and his companion.

Alt.text: One of these bears is wearing a collar labelled Scruffy.

Eat.text: The bears don't seem interested in you.

Start.text: This way, Mercenaries!

Next1.text:
Look at this little marvel!
A catapult, straight from our Sawmill! Plautaire really outdid himself he's never made one this precise!

line0.props.tipText: Obtain the Craftsmen's Strategic Skill: <skill>Catapult</skill>.

Next2.text:
Hm? Oh, you don't know how to use this type of weapon?
Don't worry, if the Legion can do it, anyone can.
Be bold, Mercenaries! Our barony's future is in your hands!

Start.text: Please allow me one personal remark before putting my men's lives and my own at risk.

Next1.text: Countess Montrevel doesn't deserve to have you save her. The Guard thinks they can't do without her, but they're wrong. The recapture of Lycia was proof of that.

Next2.text:
Besiege the prison, liberate the entire Barony of the Isle, but don't waste your time saving that troublesome hostage.
That will be my final piece of advice.

Start.text:
Well!
Good thing you've got catapults!
What are you waiting for? Quickly! My men are already on the frontline!

Next1.text: With your help, we can liberate Lycia!

Start.text: It's the slaves you want? And you're willing to pay?

Give.text:
They're all yours.
In any case, they didn't seem too likely to survive the Crossing.

Start.text: Oh my! We're free!

Next1.text:
Please! You must save my wife! She was kidnapped, too!
I'm sure Lord Mayor Septin will pay to have us back!

Alt2.text: ... You saved my wife, too? Praised be Saint Lenaid! Thank you!

Alt3.text: I'll lead the other villagers to the Bandits' Lair. Let's meet up there. Lord Mayor Septin will pay you handsomely when he sees we're all safe and sound!

MissionDesc.text: Claim your reward from Lord Mayor Septin.

Start.text: These slaves are ours! We captured them! Find your own!
Thank you! Thank you, Mercenaries! Thank you for coming to save us!

Next1.text:
Please! You must save my husband! He was kidnapped, too!
I'm sure Lord Mayor Septin will pay to have us back!

Alt1.text: Thank you! Thank you, Mercenaries! Thank you for coming to save us!

Alt2.text: ... You saved my husband, too? Praised be Saint Lenaid! Thank you!

Alt3.text: I'll lead the other villagers to the Bandits' Lair. Let's meet up there. Lord Mayor Septin will pay you handsomely when he sees we're all safe and sound!

MissionDesc.text: Claim your reward from the Lord Mayor.

Start.text: The Skelmar have prisoners! If you alert them, those prisoners will be killed! The Lord Mayor promised a reward for each farmer we save!

Next1.text:
Our plan is to sneak into the camp and kill the Skelmar in their sleep.
There are a lot of those bastards, so we wouldn't mind a bit of help. We'll share the reward equally.

Next2.text: Your men and mine must be perfectly coordinated. If you have an order to give, choose the right time for it.

line0.props.tipText: Obtain the Bandits' Strategic Skill: <skill>MurderByStealth</skill>.

Day1.text: Don't enter their camp! The Skelmar have taken prisoners! If you attack them head-on, they'll kill those poor wretches!

Day2.text:
The plan is to wait until nightfall. Once those savages are sound asleep, we'll strike. By the time they figure out what's going on, we'll have freed our companions.
Sound good?

Day3.text: If you want to join us, come back here at sunset. The Lord Mayor is offering a reward for each prisoner freed. In the meantime, why not go and look around at our lair? They may need you back there.

MissionDesc.text: Attack the Skelmar camp at nightfall.

Start.text: The Skelmar invasion has forced our guild to stay away from Ormance. Fortunately for the locals, we're back now.
To arms, Legionaries! This battle is yours! And on this day blessed by the Eye, we're going to take back our Academy from the Skelmar!

Next1.text:
With our blades and their blood, the Legion will wash away the affront it has suffered! We shall crush our enemies, and our names will be sung from here to the Capital!
Let us liberate our Academy! Our Barony! Our County!

Start.text: Halt, Mercenaries!

Next1.text:
If you've come to fight the Skelmar, I'll have to ask you to set your plans aside.
Those barbarians are holding our companions hostage.

Next2.text: We've sent an emissary to negotiate with their jarl. I won't let you ruin their progress

Start.text: I it's By Saint Eleor! The lieutenant has failed!

Forget everything I said you've got to help us!
Enter their camp, challenge Jarl Skeda and bring back our companions. We can't afford to lose any more men!
Please, I'm begging you!

My men told me everything! You're heroes, Mercenaries!
The Legion and the entire barony are in your debt.

End2.text: The Skelmar are a pain, but with a jarl leading them, they become a real scourge. Thanks for stepping in!

EndFightDead1.text: I thought I heard fighting Surely you didn't

EndFightDead2.text:
Noooo!
Our men! Why did you attack the jarl when she had hostages?! It's a disaster

EndFightDead3.text: I'll tell you what you can do with that blasted reward!

SettingLog.text: You have defeated Jarl Skeda.

Start.text: What have you done with the rats? Why can't I hear anything now?

Next1.text:
You've killed them? By the Beast's fangs! Do you know how long it took us to capture them and release them in the Skelmar camps?
We were bitten at least eight times, and

Next2.text:
Of course we thought of the risks of an epidemic
Ah, well! What matters is that we're rid of Jarl Tyrra! Let's call it even, all right?

Next3.text: Take this. In exchange, don't say anything to the Colonel. All she needs to know is that there's one fewer jarl in the barony.

SettingLog.text: You got rid of Jarl Tyrra.

Start.text: Creatures are wriggling and squirming inside the camp.

line0.props.tipText: Enter the Skelmar camp.

Start.text: The camp seems to be occupied, but no one is guarding the entrance.

line0.props.tipText: Enter the Skelmar camp.

Start.text: You hear sounds of fighting from outside the Skelmar camp.

line0.props.tipText: Enter the Skelmar camp.

Start.text:
What a disgrace for the clan!
Lucky thing you were there to catch him and kill him.

Next1.text: We'll throw his body in the sea and hope the gods accept the offering.

Next2.text:
After that well
Naming a jarl takes a long time. Especially if the gods are angry.
It's better for the clan if we go back to more familiar lands.

SettingLog.text: You have defeated Jarl Kraven.

Start.text: Let me be! I didn't do anything to become jarl! I don't know why the gods chose me!

Next1.text: All I wanted was to pillage a few towns and go home! Not become jarl! Not fight the Legion! Oh, by Aeda, why me?

Start.text:
You want to fight us?
Perfect timing, warriors!

Next1.text: The gods have just chosen a new jarl for the clan. Nothing like a fight against the odds to prove his worth!

Next2.text: Come on! Follow us, I'll take you to him.

line0.props.tipText: Enter Majora's Farm.

Wait.text: Any news about that coward Kraven?

line0.props.tipText: Enter Majora's Farm.

Start.text: Sheathe your weapons, strangers. Our jarl bids you welcome.

line0.props.tipText: Enter Attia's Arena.

Start.text: You've rebuilt the bridge?

Next1.text:
Praised be Saint Eleor!
We've been worried for days that we'd have to find some other way to cross!

Next2.text:
We'd love to invite you for a drink in celebration, but we've got a long road ahead of us!
Give the Legion our best!

line0.props.tipText: Let the deserters go.

Start.text:
I recognise you!
You're the Mercenaries who rebuilt the bridge! How are you doing?

I'll be damned! We've done it! The camp is ours, Mercenaries!
Take a minute to soak in our victory!

Wait, Mercenaries.
I have something to tell you.

Next1.text:
The priestess taught us that true believers support one another against heretics.
Therefore I must ask you to kill Sigurdr.

Next2.text:
I've known him my whole life, and he has no intention of leaving these lands, nor of sharing the loot.
If you want to drive the heretics from Edoran, you'll have to take him out.

Next3.text: He'll be vulnerable after the battle. Your hand must not falter!

Start.text:
We're here! The camp is just ahead!
Do you all know what to do?

Next1.text: Show no mercy! This camp must fall if we're to reach the High Jarl! Its occupants supply the fortress at Forecastle Rock. Without them, Sven will be trapped on his little island. And without food, his men will rebel in turn.

Next2.text:
I'm counting on you, and on my brave Mercenaries as well. Follow their orders as though they came directly from me.
In the meantime, I'll remain on the hill. For a better view of the battle.

Start.text: Our alliance has borne fruit, Mercenaries! I knew I wouldn't regret teaming up with warriors of your skill.

Next1.text: It's just that, before I can pay you, I need my enemy's treasure. Do you see where I'm going with this?

Next2.text: We'll have to attack the Large Camp in the western part of this barony! Thanks to you, and to the members of my clan that we've deftly rallied to our cause, it should be child's play.

Start.text: Such efficiency, Mercenaries! You have a most exotic way of fighting.

Next1.text: We haven't saved the whole clan yet, but there are enough of us that my men can support you in combat.

line0.props.tipText: Obtain the Skelmar's Strategic Skill: <skill>HornOfValor</skill>.

Next2.text: Don't hesitate to call on them at any time. It's their duty to obey their jarl.

Next3.text: Let's keep going, we're nearly there.

Start.text: Are you the Mercenaries everyone's been talking about? Thorkell wants to see you. She's set up camp at the Ormance Stables.

NoSigurdr.text:
Thorkell's asked you to find Sigurdr?
Make sure you strangle him before he tries talking to you.

Sigurdr1.text:
Well, well! Is that the traitor Sigurdr by your side?
Don't tell me he actually convinced you to obey him!

line0.props.tipText: Enter the tower.

Start.text:
These men are under the protection of the God of Light! You have no rights over them!
Leave, vile Skelmar!

Next1.text:
Wha?!
What are you talking about?

Next2.text: These men are ours! They are Skelmar! Their clan has been dishonoured, and the gods demand their deaths for their jarl's betrayal!

Next4.text:
I can't let you murder these converts to the word of the Light!
You! Mercenaries! Help us!
Those who protect true believers deserve honours and a reward!

Start.text: Sheathe your arms, strangers. I have a proposal for you.

line0.props.tipText: Enter the occupied location

Sigurdr1.text: Ah, wonderful! You've brought the traitor Sigurdr back to us

Sigurdr2.text: Wait! Why isn't he tied up?

Sigurdr3.text:
Idiots! You've let yourselves be taken in!
This dog will betray you like he betrayed his own people!

Start.text: This place isn't guarded, but you can hear screams from inside the dilapidated lighthouse.

line0.props.tipText: Enter the lighthouse.

Start.text: To arms! To arms, people of Edoran! Death to the heretics!

Next3.text: Death to the heretics!

Next4.text: For Ormance!

Next5.text: Glory to the Kingdom of Edoran!

Start.text:
The time has come to take what is rightfully mine!
For the horns of war to herald my glory!
Tonight, my banner shall wave over the ramparts of Forecastle Rock!

Next1.text: For Countess Montrevel!

Next2.text: Glory to Edoran! Glory to the General!

Next3.text: For the God of Light and our guide Saint Jeru!

Start.text: To arms, people of Ormance!

Next0.text:
The time has come to take what is rightfully mine!
For the trumpets of war to herald my triumph!
Tonight, my banner shall wave over the ramparts of Forecastle Rock!

Next1.text:
Attack, my brothers!
The High Jarl must pay for what he's put our clan through! Show no mercy! Die!

Next2.text:
Die! Die!
For Ormance County!

Start.text:
People of Ormance! This battle is yours!
Don't fight for a jarl! Don't fight for a Lord!
Fight for your land! For your families! For all you hold dear!

Next1.text:
Let us take vengeance on these looters and killers!
Let us drive from our lands those who have brought so much death and destruction!
The Skelmar must perish! Ormance is ours!

Start.text: We all knew it would end like this.

Next1.text: It's too bad I rather liked you.

Dead Skelmar. They were tortured with extremely refined techniques.
A massacred Skelmar patrol.

Some farmers tried to hide in the forest.

It's a pleasure to welcome you to my shop!
I feel like I could heal or treat just about anything!

Next.text: When I tell my wife you came through here, she'll be green with envy!

Feel free to travel from our lovely, peaceful County to more dangerous locales I'll plan your trips for you.

Next1.text:
It's too bad the County is at war, isn't it?
All the available resources and workers have been directed to the war effort.

Start.text: Now that the lovely old house that used to stand on this plot has gone up in smoke, there's enough room to turn it into a Travel Post!

Think of it as an act of charity!

Build.text: Excellent! I'll go right out to find some workers who haven't been too badly crippled in the war. With a bit of luck, I might even run into a disciple of Saint Lenaid!

Start.text:
Just imagining those Skelmar with their dirty paws all over my tools
Let me take care of your armour, I need to keep my mind occupied.

Repair.text: This forge is mine, and mine only.

Start.text: Who would have guessed that learning to count would take me this far?

Next1.text: The Lord Mayor has appointed me treasurer! I'm in charge of providing whatever you may need to fight the Skelmar.

EndRebuilt.text:
Now that I'm treasurer, why go back to being a Bandit?
My life is much quieter between these walls!

Start.text: You've done it! Mercenaries! Lycia is free! We've got our village back!

Next1.text: By Saint Eleor's shield! We did it all by ourselves! No need for the Guard or the Legion it's the people of the Isle who did this. With your help, of course.

Next2.text: On behalf of all the inhabitants of this humble barony, please allow me to present you with this. It's not much compared to everything you've done, but it's the best we can offer you.

Wait.text: Oh, it feels good to be home!

SettingLog.text: You have liberated the village of Lycia.

Start.text: Don't look at me like that! The Lord Mayor's the one who's got your reward.

Countess1.text:
Countess Montrevel yes
I may not have told you absolutely everything.

Countess2.text: It's not that I don't want to help you, especially after all you've done for Lycia, but the prison is completely impregnable. You'd need equipment that no one in this barony has.

Countess3.text: Siege engines catapults, for example. The kind of thing we don't have on hand in a trading town like Lycia, that they only build way out at the other end of Ormance, in the Barony of Puy-Corbin.

Countess4.text: The best I can do right now is to pray that the Skelmar haven't massacred all the craftsmen with the know-how to build them. While you're gone, I truly swear to watch over the good folk of Lycia.

CountessAlt1.text:
You haven't given up on the idea of rescuing the Countess?
I don't understand you, Mercenaries. You don't need that coward!

CountessAlt2.text: Look at Lycia: the village was liberated by locals, Bandits and Mercenaries. Only the Guard wants to see her liberated!

CountessAlt3.text:
But so be it! I promised you my support, and you shall have it.
Let me know when you're ready. And don't forget your catapult. The prison is much more heavily fortified than Lycia.

Countess5.text: You've found catapults? By the Beast's fangs, I thought they'd all been destroyed.

Countess6.text: Well, that certainly changes things! The craftsmen of Puy-Corbin make the best siege engines in all the Five Kingdoms. What a shame to use these marvels to free someone like Countess Montrevel!

Countess7.text: But so be it. I promised you my support, and you shall have it. Just let me know when you're ready.

Start.text: I am glad to see you, Mercenaries. Our allies were beginning to doubt in our ability to retake Ormance County.

Dialog8.text: Tella is right. Acting in the County's interest is what allowed the Barony of the Isle to liberate itself all on its own.

Dialog9.text: As for the coordination between our armies, we could entrust you with that task, Mercenaries. All of us here have borne witness to your talent. It's just a matter of whether you'll accept this role.

Accept.text:
In that case, it's settled! Let's move!
We'll take Forecastle Rock by storm and kick the Skelmar out of our county!

Dialog6.text:
Silence!
We have no need for a jarl, a hierophant or a general!

Dialog7.text: All that matters is saving our county from the Skelmar! Stopping those savages from pillaging and slaughtering our people! That's why we must unite!

Dialog2.text: Without Countess Montrevel, there's no banner to join our forces under! Who will give the order to attack? And by what right?

End.text: If the Legion doesn't take part in this battle, and if by some miracle, the Bandits manage to win, we'll have a civil war on our hands.

Dialog3.text: I've already recommended that we fight in the name of the God of Light. Our faith is what makes us natural allies against the heretics!

End.text:
The Inquisition will fight alongside the faithful.
This County must not devolve into heresy.

Dialog4.text:
I agree with the fanatic!
My men want to prove their worth to the Eye by driving their heathen brothers from their lands!
Let the Inquisitor be our jarl!

End.text: Fight without a jarl? By Saint Jeru, that's a risky idea

Start.text:
Since our victory at Forecastle Rock, our County is still waiting for a lord to be named.
The noble families in the capital must be busy killing each other to acquire new lands.

Next1.text: As for Tella, all I know is that she's assisting in the reconstruction of Ormance. Thanks be to Saint Jeru that it's keeping her far away from her old life.

End.text: I'd like to give you news about Tella, but all I know is that she's assisting in the reconstruction of Ormance. Thanks be to Saint Jeru, it's keeping her far away from her old life.

EndRebuilt.text:
Now that the reconstruction of Ormance is complete, I don't have any illusions about what Tella's likely up to.
The Bandits have re-established their grip on the roads of the County.

line1.text: The Gosenberg Merchant has finally received some inventory.

Start.text: Good to see you again, warriors!

Tatoo2.text: Say You wouldn't want a tattoo, would you? It's just I'm still awfully short on customers! If the people of Edoran see their heroes all inked up, they'll line up for my services in a hurry!

Tatoo3.text: With that one, even the Guard will show up!

Start.text: It's not all entirely fresh, but with all the damage the Skelmar have done to our crops, we'll have to make do.

Ormance County, and the Barony of the Isle in particular, are quite famous for their cold cuts.
The Skelmar caught on, and cleaned out my whole stock!

It's just I haven't anything to sell you!
The Gosenberg Merchants refuse to re-establish all their Trade Routes until the County has been fully liberated.

Lycia is the last stop before the capital of Edoran.
The Gosenberg Merchants were very eager to get back there.
I have my kegs brought in from the town of Two-Shores. The Skelmar methodically drank up all of my reserves.
You've come to defend us against the Skelmar, right? Is that why the Guard is on the Market Square?

Next.text:
I've healed you up as best I could.
All of our hopes now rest on you, Mercenaries.

End1.text: They say that Mercenaries helped Captain Pallas to retake Belestan. I hope they'll do the same for the whole County!

EndNext.text: Give my best wishes to your colleagues.

Start.text:
The Skelmar don't know who they're dealing with!
I'll die fighting before I let them turn me into their slave!

Repair.text: You look ready to eviscerate some Skelmar!

End1.text:
Are you the Mercenaries everyone's talking about in Belestan?
I'd be honoured to repair your armour.

line0.text: Take on Captain Pallas' mission.

Start.text: We've failed! It's over! The castle has fallen! The last free barony is lost! Ormance County is in the Skelmar's hands now!

Next1.text:
It's only a matter of hours until those barbarians sweep in here to slaughter us!
Oh! May the God of Light come to our aid!

Next2.text: Huh? Who are you? I don't have any missions for you. Unless

Next3.text: If you're in fighting condition, you could go out to look for Countess Montrevel There may be a chance that her escort escaped in time during the siege.

Accept.text:
In that case, search all over the barony: the escort may have hidden on a farm to get away from their pursuers.
With our lady leading us, we could organise what's left of the Guard and protect Two-Shores.

MissionDesc1.text: Search the area for Countess Montrevel.

MissionDesc2.text: Search the area for Countess Montrevel.

End1.text:
Thanks to the Guards you saved, we're almost certain that Countess Montrevel and her escort never crossed the castle's ramparts.
If she's still alive, we'll have to act fast!

End2.text: There are enough of us to try and break through. The Skelmar didn't have time to repair the defences that they broke through themselves.

End3.text:
This is our only chance: we must attack the castle and take the Countess back from those barbarians.
Are you willing to help us?

EndAccept1.text:
The men are happy to have you with us.
You've brought us hope at a time when so many others have abandoned Ormance to its fate.
Thanks to you, the Guard is getting things back under control!

MissionDescEnd.text: Liberate the castle from the Skelmar.

Start.text: Captain Pallas has my full confidence. Under her command, I'll never flee!
I owe you my life, Mercenaries. If you order me to fight, I'll fight!

I I ran as fast as I could!
Too bad about my shield. The barbarians can keep it!

End.text: You saved our companions, Mercenaries! You are heroes!

Start.text: The Skelmar have no mercy for the wounded. Those who weren't able to make it this far are dead.

It's too late for this man.
All we can do is to say a prayer to help him join the Light.

End.text: I've buried the Guards. They received the honours they deserved.

Next1.text: These men are too badly wounded to fight.

Start.text: It's not the first time I've fled before the Skelmar's advance, but this time I truly thought it would be the last.

End.text: I didn't think I'd see the lieutenant alive again! Thank you for bringing them back from the Skelmar!

Start.text: Has the castle really fallen? Who will prevent the Skelmar from pillaging the town?

End.text: The Barony of Belestan is free! All hail the Belestan Guard!

Start.text: If you think a barbarian invasion will make me lower my prices, you must not know me very well!

End.text: The people of Belestan are so relieved to be alive that they'd buy my wares at any price!

Start.text: These men are too badly wounded to fight.
As the barony is occupied, I'm afraid I'll be too busy seeing to my own survival to help you. However, I may have heard that the surviving Guards are gathering on the Market Square

Next1.text: Now that the Skelmar stench has abated, the air in Belestan is more refreshing than ever. Its cool breezes even blow fascinating news my way at times.

Done.text: Do I smell the scent of revenge?
