The craftsmen make offerings to Saint Lenaid and ask her to bring prosperity to their businesses.
At this altar, pilgrims offer their gifts to Saint Eleor and pray in the hope that she will guide them on their journey.
This altar dedicated to Saint Jeru is handmade and fairly recent. Its purpose remains unclear.
The old Bandit camp has already been cleared by the Brotherhood.
It seems a member of the Legion stayed in this camp before it was hastily abandoned.
I'll never convince Joren to sell up! My offer for his dump is more than generous!

Next.text: Why won't he settle? It's been two weeks since his uncle's disappeared, and his nephew and apprentice is still waiting for his return. How can we make him understand that the old apothecary has gone into the Light?

End.text: Happy? Joren wants to keep the old shop in honour of his uncle! What am I supposed to invest in now?

Start.text: If you're here to tell me to sell up, my answer is no! My uncle will be back soon.

Next.text: He went to study the disease affecting the vineyards for Broker Ald Marheim. This letter proves it! He asked me to join him there!

Next2.text: If you're looking for work, I could do with an escort... Vertruse is rife with bandits and wild animals...

line1.props.tipText: Ask about the strange tuber.

Ask1.text: A strange tuber... Mmm, no, doesn't ring a bell, I'm afraid. My uncle would probably know, but I'm just an apprentice. Are you sure you found this in Vertruse?

Ask2.text: If you get more, I'd be willing to buy them off you. Who knows what I could make of them!

Accept2.text: Perfect! This is the meeting place! If you ever need to buy any potions, you can always bring me back here so that I can prepare some.

Start.text:
Ah! I've missed this shop. Being outdoors is much more exhausting than anticipated.
What can I get you?

line0.props.tipText: Ask about the strange tuber.

End.text: It's all so confusing to me. Who would do this to my family, and why?

line0.props.tipText: Ask about the strange tuber.

Ask1.text: A strange tuber... Mmm, no, doesn't ring a bell, I'm afraid. My uncle would probably know, but I'm just an apprentice. Are you sure you found this in Vertruse?

Ask2.text: If you get more, I'd be willing to buy them off you. Who knows what I could make of them!

line0.text: Take on Joren Toverdrank's mission.

line1.text: Use the Apothecary's Meeting Place item to find where they will be meeting.

line2.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
Ah! Working here is so refreshing!
Marheim craftsmen really know their trade!

Next1.text:
I placed a chest in which you can store anything weighing you down, and a few stools for fighters you'd rather leave behind.
If you have other travel posts, I'll gladly arrange trips between them.

Next2.text: Where are you off to this time?

line0.props.disableReason: Build travel posts in other villages to travel there quickly.

Start.text: Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: This piece of land is for sale, and it's a great spot for a travel post.

Next1.text:
And as the All-Seeing Eye's generosity knows no bounds, it just so happens that I am currently unemployed!
Do you want to make the most of this opportunity and build your travel post here?

line0.props.tipText: Build the Vertruse Travel Post

Build.text: Don't worry, your belongings are in good hands!

Start.text: I just know this year will be a breeze. Without the vineyards, no need to circle new barrels.

Repair.text: Here we go: your armour is as good as new!

Start.text:
<narrator>Spendings of the City of Marheim for the Festival of Light 990th year after the Advent of our Guide Jeru.
35 cockerels, chicken, geese...
11 whole pigs and sheep,</narrator>

Next1.text:
<narrator>
47 heads of cabbage,
16 bags of beans,
106 kegs of wine from House Loop and Molen,
...</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>Not recorded are expenses related to damage of all kinds caused by brawls and displays of religious fervour.</narrator>

Next3.text: I recommend calling upon Broker Clemens Ald Marheim's charity to cover some of the cost, and I urge for moderation during the preparations of the next Festival of Light. Treasurer Neema

line0.title: A Strange Smell
line0.props.helpTip: Find out why the sewers are stinking out the market.

Start.text: Since Alazar sold us their latest invention, the stench of dead rats has permeated the whole market.

Next1.text: Shop owners are filing in here all day long to complain! The sewers stink, Lady Beate... Lady Beate, the stench of the sewers is driving the clients away!

Next2.text: Of course, it's driving the clients away! But what can I do? Now that the sewers are installed, we can't remove them.

Next3.text: The stench came from a rats' nest? How vile! You have my thanks for ridding us of this revolting horror.

Wait.text: What can I do for you?

Start.text: I just don't understand where the village's money is going!

Next.text: I double-check everything several times a month, but there's no denying it, we've got leaks. Someone is robbing us blind!

line0.props.tipText: Tell the treasurer that the Lady Mayoress is embezzling funds.

Warn.text: What? The Lady Mayoress has sticky fingers? Not on my watch! The Guard will know of this!

End.text: The sewer problem has had such a negative impact on Lady Beate's reputation that the citizens would never have re-elected her. She must have been stealing to prepare for the aftermath.

Rat1.text: I've taken on the mayoral duties as we await the next elections.

Rat2.text: I must solve our sewer issue... The stench on the market square is unbearable, but I don't know how to go about it. You're well-travelled. Do you think this is normal?

RatEnd.text: The stench came from a rats' nest? How vile! You have my thanks for ridding us of this revolting horror.

line0.title: Krown Misappropriation
line0.props.helpTip: Find Marheim's crate.

Start.text: Come, come, good people of Marheim! Take a look at the Great scholar Quickwit's latest invention!

Next.text: The Hair Growth Lotion!

line0.props.tipText: Make the crook pay for this debacle.

Start.text: No, please! I'm sorry! I'll leave! Youll never hear from me again.

Next.text: Here, take today's takings and let me go!

Start.text:
This crook has been screaming his head off for days.
I am this close to making him eat his cart.

line0.props.tipText: Talk about Broker Aldeberth's offer with the merchant.

Peddler.text: Thank you for muzzling that crook.

line0.props.tipText: Talk about Broker Aldeberth's offer with the merchant.

PathTrade1.text: Aldeberth, you say? Yes, he almost begged me to help him, but I already sell another Broker's wares. I have no reason to change providers.

Bribe1.text: You make a strong case. However, I cannot let myself be swayed by my emotions. I need to be sure this Aldeberth fellow is reliable.

Bribe2.text: I heard about a certain Cortian commodity. What with the recent conflict, it has become extremely difficult to source. Bring me a sample, so I can assess Aldeberth's logistics.

Convinced1.text: Ah! You are right! My stall and clients do deserve the very best. If Aldeberth can deliver, I will agree to work with him.

Convinced2.text: Bring me proof of the quality of his wares and the reliability of his caravans. Ive heard of a certain Cortian commodity Id be interested in... I require a sample.

Accepted1.text: Lovely! And you brought these fairly quickly...

Accepted2.text: Yes, I think I can trade with your Aldeberth. However, youll have to handle the Broker's henchmen Im about to set free.

Accepted3.text: If you dont explain it all to them, Ill have to pack up and leave, and your efforts will have amounted to nothing. I think they are lurking around the city.

MissionDesc1.text: Bring gems to the Marheim Merchant.

MissionDesc2.text: Deal with the men who are threatening the Marheim Merchant.

End1.text: Everything seems in order. Its a pleasure doing business with you.

End2.text: Tell your client that Im willing to sell his wares whenever he so wishes.

Start.text: How can we sell anything in this stench?! I complained to the Lady Mayoress at least ten times this week!

Next.text: Strange... The market doesn't stink quite as much now.

Start.text: I would offer wine to go with your cheese, but the disease has all but destroyed our vineyards.
Just look what I've found for you, Mercenaries!

Next1.text:
Right in the centre of Marheim, a stone's throw from the market and artisans' workshops, this Tavern has the best view of the well in the whole town.
Everyone will envy you, I can promise you that!

Next2.text: There's no reason to hesitate! That old dump of yours in Stromkapp will never get you the fortune and Prestige you deserve! Think bigger! Think "Marheim".

line0.props.tipText: Buy the ruined Tavern.

Buy.text:
What wonderful ambition!
With that attitude, I bet you'll have it cleaned up in no time!

Start.text: On behalf of the Brotherhood, the greatest mercenary company in the Five Kingdoms, thank you for answering our call.

Next1.text: We want you to undertake a challenging mission, so that we might assess your worth and talents. Should you succeed, the Brotherhood will call upon your troop for future prestigious assignments.

Next2.text: We lack time to honour all our contracts. It is therefore necessary for us to rely on other Mercenaries, all of which are carefully hand-picked.

Next3.text: The mission in question is fairly straightforward: you are to rid Tiltren of a group of Bandits. However, know that these men are more fearsome and better organised than your regular crooks. Are you up to the challenge?

Accept1.text: I recommend you scope out their lair before launching a frontal assault.

Wait.text: Mercenaries of your reputation should make short work of this.

MissionDesc.text: Find the Bandits' Lair in Tiltren.

End1.text: The Stromkapp authorities informed us that youve accomplished your mission. Congratulations are in order.

End2.text: We only assign these missions to the best of the best, and always expect a resounding success, in your dealings with enemies and allies alike. My apologies for not warning you. This was part of the assessment.

End4.text: Please accept this recipe on behalf of the Brotherhood.

End3.text: Now that youve proven your worth, you can wear this layer with pride, and are officially our allies. We will be sure to offer you prestigious missions, which will make your troop a prominent group among Mercenaries.

line0.text: Take on the Brotherhood Emissary's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: It was a sign, I'm sure. How else can you explain what I saw?

Next1.text: After a night spent in Smot's Arena, I went down to the beach to nurse my hangover. But as I was watching the sun rise, I saw a huge wolf come out of the water, with a fish in its maw!

Next2.text: Call me crazy, but I know it was a sign from the Eye! It is ordering me to stop betting on gladiator fights and to go and find myself a wife.

Start.text: Vertruse Province is beautiful, isn't it? And rich, at that! Stay loyal to the emissary, and you will get the best missions.

Done.text: Promising, isn't it? Is there anything else you'd like to know?

line0.props.tipText: The apothecary's nephew and apprentice received a strange letter from his uncle asking to join him in an isolated meeting place.

line1.props.tipText: There is growing unrest among the Vintners: they have decided to join forces and take justice into their own hands.

line2.props.tipText: Brunhilde Adr Alazar needs savvy and unscrupulous mercenaries for a delicate mission.

line3.props.tipText: Mrs Loop owns the last healthy Vertrusian vineyard and is determined to protect it.

Apothecary.text: The apothecary's nephew and apprentice received a strange letter from his uncle asking to join him in an isolated meeting place.

Scapegoat.text: There is growing unrest among the Vintners: they have decided to join forces and take justice into their own hands.

Brunhilde.text: Brunhilde Adr Alazar needs savvy and unscrupulous mercenaries for a delicate mission.

AttackVictim.text: Mrs Loop owns the last healthy Vertrusian vineyard and is determined to protect it.

DeliverMission1.text:
<narrator>The Informant tucked the letter away inside his sleeve.</narrator>
Thank you. You can go.

End.text: Apologies, but I have nothing of interest for you.

PathCrime1.text:
All of us Informants have heard of your skills as robbers.
We would like to continue working with you.

PathCrime2.text:
It will come as no surprise that we're not the only ones aware of your talents. Our dear inventor went to great lengths to improve his system.
And now, we need you to put his latest version to the test.

PathCrime3.text: I doubt this key belongs to noble clients.

PathCrimeEnd.text: I hope you didn't come all this way only to report to me.

line0.text: Buy the Smuggler's Key from the Informant.

line1.text: Find and thwart the security system matching the Smuggler's Key.

Start.text: I'm concerned about the vineyard disease. It's confined to Vertruse at the moment, but imagine if it spreads to all of Gosenberg! We'd have to drink beer!
Be careful if you go into the hills south of here. I heard farmers mention plagued rats.

Repair.text: With this kind of armour, you can face anything!

Start.text: The other day, a woman with an Edoranian accent bought enough supplies to last several days. I wonder where she lives.
This inn is mostly a rest stop for travellers on their way to Marheim. Most people only stay for one night.

Unlock.text: You find an unsigned letter, addressed to the Alazarian Ambassador: The Rooks' contact is pretending to be a merchant. To reveal their true identity, sell them some eel soup.

Start.text: This official document is dated the night of the Broker's murder. It is a diplomatic treaty aiming to foster the slave trade between Gosenberg and Alazar.

Next1.text: The Alazarian Ambassador signed the document, but the section for Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's seal is empty.

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>Alazarian Ambassador</narrator> needed the Broker Hoevendorp's signature on a treaty.

Alt.text: You don't know what to look for. If you took part in the <narrator>Brotherhood's investigation</narrator>, these documents might make more sense?

line0.text: Find a way to access the Alazarian Embassy.

line1.text: Search the Embassy.

Start.text: You can hear chilling noises in the tunnel.
Had Broker Hoevendorp taken my potions, she wouldn't be dead! Believe me!

Next.text: See? My potions work miracles! Tell everyone about them. I have a lot of competition in this city.

Questioned.text: It's not the first time the Broker was attacked, you know. Last month, the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> tried to set her manor on fire.

Start.text:
Got any merchandise you're looking to get rid of?
I won't ask where you got it.

line0.text: Give Bernna's Arena a new lease of life by defeating its champion.

Start.text: My new champions! I had to congratulate you in person!

Next1.text: Never have I seen someone defeat my champions with such panache! What a show!

Next2.text: The <narrator>Arena Clash</narrator> would be a unique opportunity for you to fight in front of a larger audience! And as luck would have it, I'm looking for someone strong enough to take part.

Next3.text:
You could represent us!
Imagine that! Taking part in the greatest show in Gosenberg, facing the fierce Hoevendorp contenders, securing the title for Bernna's Arena for the first time in four years... you'll think about it, won't you?

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Accepted.text: I knew it. I knew you had heart! I'll await your final answer outside Hoevendorps Arena, where the Clash will take place.

End.text: What brings you here, Mercenaries?

EndTrial.text: Are you going to accuse me again, Mercenaries?

Start.text: Even when times were hard, I stood by Broker Godrik Ald Bernna. I'm passionate about fighting. Money was never the point.

Questioned.text: Weve lost many fighters over the last few months, as Broker Godrik Ald Bernna had to cut back on prize money. But I knew that he'd find a solution eventually; he'd do anything for this arena!

EndSetting.text: How could you betray Broker Bernna! You've condemned him to certain death!

Start.text: It's not that I don't want to sell you my wares... I'm afraid they're reserved for our fighters and champions.

Alt.text: Ah! I saw you fight! I couldn't believe my eyes. You people are natural born fighters!

Start.text:
You want to take part? Blessed be Saint Eleor!
Our best fighters have joined our competitors, and our current champions have already lost three times against the Hoevendorp champion. If this goes on, the stands will soon be empty!

line0.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Questionned1.text: This arena used to be very popular, with potential champions queuing at the door, but <narrator>Broker Godrik Ald Bernna</narrator> had some financial difficulties, and the fighters' pay suffered. The Broker was desperate, this arena is his family's pride and joy.

SettingLog.text: <narrator>Broker Bernna</narrator> is very attached to his arena.

OnLeaveArena.text: You will come back, won't you? You can't leave us like that!

Completed.text:
Well done! You won!
The arena was packed for your last fight, I hadn't seen such a crowd in ages, business is booming.
You've more than earned your prize.

Completed2.text: While we're at it... How would you feel about representing us at the <narrator>Arena Clash</narrator> against Hoevendorp? The competition will start very soon. With champions like yourselves, we finally have a chance.

ArenaLost.text: I just know we can win the next one. Please, you can't give up! Don't give up on us!

EndTournament.text:
What a victory! That was incredible!
Winning the Arena Clash is every fighter's dream!

MissionDesc1.text: Win in Bernna's Arena.

MissionDesc2.text: Speak with Godrik Ald Bernna.

SettingFinished1.text: I... I suppose this arena will be renamed now...

ArenaDiff.text: In the meantime, you can challenge Kogo and Toro if you want. They need to take out their frustration on something after what happened.

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text: You really are strong, Mercenaries. I'm sure Broker Bernna would have loved to see you fight.

CompletedDiff2.text:
Take this reward, it's probably the last one this arena will ever give.
With no owner, our coffers are empty again.

ArenaAgain.text: You're back? If you wish to challenge our fighters, I'm sure they will welcome the distraction. However, I have no rewards to give you if you win.

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedAgain.text: Thanks for visiting, it reminded us of the last Arena Clash.

line0.title: Eyes closed!
line0.props.helpTip: Get the Grinmeer Black Market reward.

Start.text: I knew you were made for pit fighting!

Next1.text:
Bets are through the roof, thanks to you.
Ah! If only all gladiators could captivate the crowd the way you do!

Next2.text: I don't know if our paths will cross again in the Black Market, so I wanted to give you a little goodbye gift. It's not much, really.

Wait.text: I've still got a few things to take care of before leaving.

Start.text:
Welcome to the Grinmeer pit!
The most famous and prestigious pit in all the Five Kingdoms!
Shall I reserve a place in the stands for you?

Next1.text: Oh! You're the Mercenaries! By Saint Eleor's shield, the Baron has nothing but good things to say about you! It seems you swept through the other pits with a flair to rival Belerion himself. I simply can't wait to see you at work!

Next2.text: Give me your volunteers' names, I've been waiting for ages to sign them up for this pit!

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

FightLost1.text: You can chalk that loss up to the lack of visibility. It's quite a rude shock when you're not used to it!

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

FightWin1.text:
I knew you would win and the punters were right on the money, too!
The reward is all yours!

FightWin2.text: Want to move right on to the next fight? It'd make for a wonderful gift to our humble audience.

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

Renounce.text: I can't believe that legends like yourselves would give up without even trying.

FightRedo.text: That fight was really exciting. Too bad it all felt a little too familiar.

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

WholePitWin1.text: Five victories! Already! At this rate, you'll get through all the fights in our pit in no time! I've never seen the likes of you, Mercenaries!

WholePitWin2.text: It is my honour to present you with Grinmeer's unique reward. This is a dream come true.

WholePitWinAgain1.text:
You're the best fighters this pit has ever seen!
Bandits and smugglers have come from every corner of the Five Kingdoms to see you battle it out in this last fight.

WholePitWinAgain2.text:
Today marks a new page in our history.
I hope you'll remember it as fondly as we will, Mercenaries.

PitNoGain.text: You're back? I can sign you up for a fight you've already tackled, but there are no more rewards to be earned in our pit.

line0.props.tipText: Fight in the pit.

Start.text:
I chopped a Merchant to bits this morning.
I could use a little fight to unravel my nerves.
This is the only pit where I'll deign fight!
As long as Lieutenant Eusebia doesn't rat me out to the Hierophant, I won't rat her out to the General.
The smugglers are doing incredible work these days. I've got everything you could possibly need.
The city of Gosenberg lends its name to an entire kingdom. That's how important it is.
Oh! You can go through. This checkpoint is within the Kingdom of Gosenberg, no need to pay.
The border is closed. No need to insist.

Next1.text: Something terrible has happened in the city! By order of the Broker Council, no one can come in or out.

Start.text: We are expected in the new Gosenberg Cathedral! Tis heresy to refuse us passage!

Door.text: A thud sounds against the trap door.

line0.text: Use a Golden Key to see what is behind the door.
Question the Midnight Garden workers.

Next0.text: Are you quite finished harassing my friends with your sordid questions and crass accusations? We know nothing about this murder!

Next0Bis.text: We're honest workers, we will not be insulted like this by our patrons.

Next0Ter.text: I pay the Brotherhood good money for protection! Get this rabble out of here!

Next1.text: This way, Mercenaries. Can't you see no one wants to answer your questions?

Next2.text: Either you leave without a fuss, or we'll make you leave.

Start.text: You've come to rescue me? Did Mother send you?

Questioned2.text: How would I know? I've been locked up for days!

Questioned3.text: They wanted to sell me into slavery! I beg you! Don't let them do this...

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>Hoevendorp son</narrator> was taken prisoner in the Midnight Gardens on the night of the murder.

Start.text: Hey, you! Stop pestering my friends!

Next0.text: You'll drive our patrons away with your macabre questions.

Again.text: This is a place for merrymaking and honest work. We have no time for murder!

Next1.text: What have you done to my security personnel? You monsters!

Next2.text: What do you want from us? We don't know anything about a murder!

Questioned1.text:
Lyderic? You've done this for him?
You shouldn't have gone to all that trouble. The fool isn't worth it.

Questioned2.text: He was here when his Broker of a mother died. Then some Bandits came and took him away. I'm not sure what they were talking about, but they mentioned Krowns. A lot of Krowns...

Questioned3.text: Go and find those Bandits! Some of my friends know where they hide out.

Lyderic1.text: Hold on, Mercenaries! You can't take him away like that!

Lyderic2.text: It's not just the Bandits that this son of a crocswine owes money to. He's got a hefty tab here, too. Who's going to settle up?

Lyderic3.text:
You can have him if you want, but it'll cost you.
Otherwise, he'll be off to the Alazarian slave market tomorrow.

line1.props.tipText: Lyderic will now be part of your company.

Questioned4.text: How were we to know his mother would be murdered on the very night we planned to kidnap him? Not that it would have made a difference! She's refused to pay for him in the past.

End.text: Good riddance.

MissionDesc.text: Find out where the hideouts are located.

Rats.text: Don't worry, it's probably just a rat.

Wait.text: You haven't found Lyderic? What a shame...

Start.text: The boss doesn't want you here. Get lost!

Well, well... Mercenaries!
I wanted to be a Mercenary, too, but working here pays much better.

Questioned.text: I've seen Bandits prowling around the University to rob defenceless scholars. They're particularly devious, so don't underestimate them.

QuestionedAlt.text: My profession is clearly more honourable than yours. How dare you make such insinuations towards an honest worker?!

MissionDesc.text: Discover the link between the Bandits and Lyderic.

Start.text: Are you looking for someone in particular, or are you open to offers?

Questioned.text: There's a well-known hideout near Bernna's Arena. These Bandits are very aggressive, real killers.

QuestionedAlt.text: Murder? How would I know anything about a murder? I don't like what you're implying, Mercenaries.

MissionDesc.text: Discover the link between the Bandits and Lyderic.

Start.text: Are you missing something? Go on, I won't judge.

Questioned.text: Ah! Lyderic, Bandits... I'd rather not be involved.

QuestionedAlt.text: Listen, I can put up with a lot, but being accused of murder... !

Start.text: If you don't mind, I'd rather you took a bath first.

Questioned.text: I don't recall working with those particular Bandits, sorry.

QuestionedAlt.text: Why would I care about the fate of a Broker? Just because I work here does not make me a criminal!

Start.text: The other Trackers think that I'm out following the Ghost Pack.

Next1.text: I mustn't ruin my war paint or they'll suspect something.

Questioned.text: Sorry, I don't work here. I only arrived in town yesterday.

line0.text: Bring 20 Wood or 10 Sandstone to the priestess of the Light
Find the lost emblem somewhere south of Grinmeer.

Start.text: Carved in a sacred rock called quartzite, this emblem will adorn the cathedral spire.
May the All-seeing Eye bless you.
The faithful can make all sorts of charitable donations, but I must confess that wood or stone would be particularly appreciated.

line0.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Next1.text: How generous of you, Mercenaries! We are very grateful.

Questioned1.text: I am convinced the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> is behind this gruesome murder. The common folk have loathed Wylla Ald Hoevendorp ever since she opposed the abolition of slavery.

Questioned2.text: These paupers don't understand the real cost of labour: imagine how much this cathedral would have cost if we'd relied on paid workers!

SettingLog.text: Broker Hoevendorp opposed the abolition of slavery, which the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> was fighting for.

Start.text: Gosenberg is the first city outside of Edoran to have a cathedral. Is that not proof of our fervour?

Questioned.text: I was saddened to hear of Broker Hoevendorp's passing into the Light. She was instrumental in building this cathedral and making the Faith of the Light shine so brightly in Gosenberg.

Start.text: Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp had ordered an emblem to adorn the cathedral spire.

Next1.text: As members of the Church of the Light and heralds of the Law of the All-seeing Eye, we've come for the attachment ceremony.

Next2.text: Unfortunately, the caravan transporting the emblem from Edoran is late. It was last spotted by a group of merchants several days ago in the south of the region.

line0.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Questioned.text: Ah! Wylla's death? Sorry, we weren't in the city yet. I know nothing.

Inquisition1.text:
So, you are the ones who rescued the emblem and our Inquisitors!
The Church applauds your piety, Mercenaries.

Inquisition2.text: To be part of the Church of the Eye, all buildings, especially cathedrals, must be adorned with such an emblem. You've saved both the honour of Edoran and the faith of Gosenberg.

Alazar1.text:
No trace of the caravan? This is a disaster! Gosenberg will have to pay for a new emblem...
Thank you for your efforts, we are very grateful.

End.text: May the All-Seeing Eye set its gaze upon you.

line0.text: Take on Sister Franny's mission.

line1.text: Investigate Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's murder throughout Grinmeer.

Start.text: The Mercenaries! By Saint Eleor, I've been hearing about you for ages! Let me look at you it's not every day I get to meet real celebrities!

Sword1.text: People say you're the best there is with a sword! That they've never seen such elegant and effective swordsmen other than yours truly, of course!

Sword2.text: In the name of the solidarity that unites the Mercenaries of the Five Kingdoms and perhaps, in hopes of hiring your company the Brotherhood has tasked me with teaching you a few new moves that will advance your mastery of the sword even further. What say you?

AcceptSword1.text:
Excellent!
Now, watch each of my movements, and try to reproduce them. Pay close attention most students pay handsomely for this!

AcceptSword2.text: And there you have it! Your company now knows the most arcane and secret mysteries of the sword. Be proud of yourselves, my Mercenary brethren!

Axe1.text: Rumour has it that no one can handle an axe as audaciously as you other than me, at my last demonstration on the Gosenberg Artists' Square! Ha ha!

Axe2.text: How would you like to finally reach my level of mastery? In the name of the solidarity that unites the Mercenaries of the Five Kingdoms and the potential profit to be made the Brotherhood has tasked me with teaching you some of my most famous techniques.

AcceptAxe1.text: I love your enthusiasm! Very well, then sit back and relax, and I'll show you how a master-at-arms wields this noble weapon!

AcceptAxe2.text:
Impressed?
Of course you are!
And the most incredible part is that your company can now do the same!

Mace1.text: Rumours spread like wildfire across the Five Kingdoms and your feats with the mace are the topic of endless discussion amongst jugglers! A few of the more excitable ones even compare you to me! Ha ha! Those little jokers!

Mace2.text: And yet! I know a few moves that will turn those fantasies into reality. The Brotherhood has asked me and paid me a handsome fee to teach them to you. I guess they're hoping you'll join them one day!

AcceptMace1.text:
I expected no less from your company!
Now watch carefully the jugglers say I swoop down on my opponents like an eagle on its prey.

AcceptMace2.text: Got all that? In that case, I can officially declare that you've mastered all the secrets of the mace! Until they come up with some new ones!

Polearm1.text: Your way of skewering Bandits has earned you plenty of admirers. Not nearly as many as mine, of course, but still quite impressive for a little company like yours!

Polearm2.text: In hopes of seeing you continue to hunt those scoundrels down and perhaps hiring you on? the Brotherhood has asked me to share my mastery of polearms. In your hands, even a lowly pike will become an instrument of death!

AcceptPolearm1.text: Wise decision! Observe my movements carefully, for I'll be as swift as the wind.

AcceptPolearm2.text:
I wasn't too fast for you? No?
Glad to hear it! Grab the nearest halberd and show the good people of the Five Kingdoms how much progress you've made.

Bow1.text:
Your deadly skill with the bow has impressed even the Trackers of Harag! Those charming savages even compared you to me!
Ah, they're a funny lot.

Bow2.text: Still, I think you may be ready to receive my teachings. Fear not, the Brotherhood will be paying part of my usual wages no doubt so that you'll be in their debt one of these days!

AcceptBow1.text: Pay careful attention, for I shall only shoot three arrows!

AcceptBow2.text:
Pretty instructive, eh? A whole new world has just opened to you!
I can tell you're just itching to try out these new techniques!

Dagger1.text:
The Baron himself and I'm sure you know the one I mean! has told me great things about you. He says no Bandit can kill as effectively as you.
Of course, I left their ranks long ago!

Dagger2.text: That's also what led the noble Mercenaries of Gosenberg to call on my services. They've tasked me with teaching you all I know about the art of the dagger. Who knows, perhaps they have big plans for you!

AcceptDagger1.text: I love your enthusiasm, but please, try to remain calm. My talents are so refined that complete attention is needed to perceive my movements.

AcceptDagger2.text:
So? Never seen anything like it, eh?
And the best part is, you'll now be able to do all that yourselves!

Crossbow1.text:
The crossbow is one of our newest weapons, and understanding how it works is an accomplishment in itself! Mastering it enough to become known for one's skill is truly exceptional.
Until now, I was the only one to achieve it

Crossbow2.text: That's why, in the name of the solidarity that unites the Mercenaries of the Five Kingdoms, the Brotherhood has asked that I teach you to make full use of this marvellous invention's potential.

AcceptCrossbow1.text: You won't believe your eyes. I've perfected techniques that you'd never have thought possible!

AcceptCrossbow2.text: I love the expressions on your disbelieving faces! Masters-at-arms always have that effect on people. Especially me! Ha ha!

Fist1.text:
If I hadn't heard it directly from a Belerion pirate, I wouldn't have dared believe it! It seems you are nearly as skilled as I at wielding the katar and the cestus.
I must admit, I was getting bored, all alone atop the pantheon of warriors

Fist2.text: So it was a great relief to accept the Brotherhood's mission: to give you the knowledge that will finally let you compete with me, the master-at-arms himself!

AcceptFist1.text:
I expected no less!
Now stand back and watch carefully

AcceptFist2.text: So? Did you ever imagine a katar could be used like that? Well, now you know!

Wait.text: I'd be more than happy to teach you new skills, but you're not ready yet.

Start.text: You should listen to what he has to say first.

Next0.text: A word of warning: this mission is not for the faint-hearted. The body of Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp was not the only one found in the alley: there were also around a dozen of our Brothers, who had been tasked with her protection.

Next1.text: The assailants left without a trace, but we do know that they were well organised and outnumbered our men. They were probably Bandits, rebels... or Mercenaries, perhaps.

Next2.text: So? Are you still interested?

Accept1.text: Very well, your company is now registered. The residents of Gosenberg will answer any queries, so remember to question them.

Accept2.text: Some may be reluctant to confide in you, but persevere and you will find a way to convince them. Good luck.

Advices.text: If you don't know where to start, speak to the Informant. He knows everyone in Grinmeer.

SettingLog.text: <narrator>Broker Hoevendorp</narrator> was murdered in Gosenberg.

Start.text: It would be advisable for you to train more before taking on this investigation. Competition between the companies will be fierce.

Respec.text: Not bad, eh? It's from Grinmeer.

EndSetting.text: After all you've done, I'm not sure you need anything!

Start.text:
Mercenaries, members of the Brotherhood, thank you for heeding our call in such numbers.
We will need all the help we can get for this <narrator>mission</narrator>.

Next1.text: The <narrator>Broker Council</narrator> has asked us to track down who murdered one of their own: <narrator>Wylla Ald Hoevendorp.</narrator>

Next2.text: The Broker is dead?

Next3.text: Good riddance!

Next4.text: Shut up! We can't hear anything!

Next5.text: All those who wish to be involved in this investigation are welcome. The reward will be commensurate with that of a mission offered by the Council itself.

Next6.text: Franny will register all companies who wish to take part.

MissionDesc.text: Take on Sister Franny's mission.

Start.text: These Mercenaries seem to be listening to the speech over and over.
These Mercenaries seem to have come from far away.
The Brothers-in-Arms are listening carefully.
According to our sources, your Mercenary troop was the most competent in its investigation. In any case, you are the ones making the most noise.

Next1.text: Not to pressure you, but we need names. The Broker Council is getting more restless by the day. It is time to intensify your efforts.

Next2.text: Don't limit yourselves to questions any more. If anyone strikes you as suspicious, <narrator>accuse them</narrator> and bring them to justice.

Accusation.text: Exactly! You will then be taken to the court with the accused, and the trial will begin.

Accept.text: But don't point fingers at random either! Convening the Broker Council is expensive. If the court session is a failure, you will be made to pay. Literally.

End1.text: So? Have you found the culprit?

SettingFinished1.text: You are now the most celebrated mercenaries in all of Gosenberg. The Brotherhood should be wary of competitors such as yourselves.

SettingFinished2.text: It's been a pleasure working with you. I hope you are satisfied with the Council's reward.

Start.text: Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: You are now the proud owners of a plot of land in Gosenberg City. You're going up in the world!

Next1.text:
I've made sure that your travel post is fitted with everything you'll need: you can leave cumbersome gear in this chest, and Companions you don't need can sit on these stools.
And of course, I will personally arrange trips to other travel posts for you.

Next2.text: Is there somewhere you wish to go to?

line0.props.disableReason: Build travel posts in other villages to travel there quickly.

Start.text: There are very few vacant lots left in Gosenberg City. If I were you, I would jump at the chance to buy this one!

Next1.text: I know it's a costly endeavour, but travel posts are a long-term investment. Imagine how much time you'll save travelling!

line0.props.tipText: Build the Grinmeer Travel Post.

Build.text: I will find someone to build your travel post at once. It won't take long.

Start.text: The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.
The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.
When I retire, I plan to move out of the city to my own quiet little haven and spend the rest of my days fishing.

Next1.text: But by Jeru! The only thing I know about fish is how to cook it!

Next2.text: I'll need someone experienced to show me how to catch them. No more than two or three times... I'm sure that with a good angler, I could pick it up in no time.

End1.text: By Saint Eleor, is that how you do it?

End2.text:
Good thing you showed me! I wasn't about to eat fish.
Speaking of which, I'll give you my recipe as a reward. Broker Armeman used to love it, so I hope you will, too.

Wait.text: Do you think there are any pikes here?

Start.text: My husband and I used to work for Broker Armeman and his family. When he lost his titles and wealth, we decided to retire.

Next1.text: After a life of service, we were able to afford this pretty little fishery.

Next2.text: Every morning, I get up whenever I want, I watch the sun dance on the waves, and no one orders me to clean the latrines.

Start.text: I don't know what's going on at the <narrator>Hoevendorp Mine</narrator>. I haven't received any ore in days. This cannot be allowed to continue.

Repair.text: Now, that's a job well done!

Questioned1.text: With these ore supply problems, I don't really have the time to chat about Broker Hoevendorp's death.

Questioned2.text: Broker Bernna wants me to renew all his fighter's equipment, so I've work to do and suppliers to chase up.

Start.text: Let me be! I'll forget Lyderic's debt!

Questioned1.text: I don't know where he is! We've been looking for him for weeks to get our Krowns back, he's slipped through our fingers every time!

Questioned2.text: And we're not the only ones after him! His gambling debts are so high that all the punters are on his tail.

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>Hoevendorp son</narrator> had massive gambling debts.

Start.text: Did Lyderic Hoevendorp send you?

Next1.text: Maybe now you can give us the Krowns he owes us!

Start.text: What do you want from us? We're not even wanted by the Guard!

Questionned1.text: The Hoevendorp son? Why are you looking for him? Does he owe you money, too?

Questionned2.text:
We don't have him! We don't know where he is!
That night, we saw him enter the brothel, we waited all night for him to come out, but when we went in the next morning, he wasn't there!

Questionned3.text: I don't know how he did it, but he disappeared!

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>Hoevendorp son</narrator> owed Bandits a lot of Krowns.

Start.text: Who goes there? What are you doing here?
Ah! I'm glad to see you! We've not managed to contact the Brotherhood. This manhunt has scattered them all across the city.

Next1.text: The Alazarian Embassy is surrounded by the mob, and there are fears of a riot breaking out. The people are accusing the ambassador of murdering the Broker.

Next2.text: They might have a point, nobody would argue with that, but we cannot have plebs gutting him in the street. This kind of diplomatic incident would be damaging to the entire kingdom.

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to expect something from you.

Accept.text: Very well. Talk to the guards who are containing the crowd, they desperately await your arrival.

MissionDesc.text: Exfiltrate the Alazarian Ambassador from his home.

End1.text: Is the ambassador safe?

Given1.text: Perfect, you've done well, Mercenaries. Here is your reward for having stopped the mob from lynching the ambassador.

Given2.text: We will question the ambassador about Wylla's murder. If he is innocent, we will help him to return to Alazar, until things settle down here.

Questioned.text: I won't lie, in the past, Alazar turned to the <narrator>Rooks</narrator> to take out troublesome Brokers. It could be the case here, too.

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>Kingdom of Alazar</narrator> had Brokers killed by assassins called the Rooks.

line0.text: Take on Captain Arnoud's mission.

line1.text: Exfiltrate the Alazarian Ambassador from his refuge.

Start.text: The people hated Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp, but they still want to see the murderer hang.

Next1.text: Maybe they are angry they did get to kill her themselves?

Start.text: Don't worry, I will keep a close eye on him.

Next1.text: In any case, if he tried to escape, the crowd would rip him to shreds.

Start.text: The interrogation may last a while, but I much prefer facing the Guard than the fate that the crowd had in store for me.

Next1.text: Thank you for bringing me to safety, I will be sure to mention this to the king of Alazar.

Questioned.text: I had nothing to do with Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's death. In fact, I had a business meeting planned with her that evening at the Embassy.

SettingLog.text: Broker Hoevendorp was supposed to meet the <narrator>Alazarian ambassador</narrator> the night of her murder.

Start.text: Thank you for coming to our aid. Without you, we were lost.

Next1.text: We were separated from the other slaves during our escape. When the Guard gave chase, I thought we were done for.

Next2.text: Please accept this. I took it from a foreman's corpse.

End.text: If there is anything I can do for you, just ask.

Questioned1.text: The owner of the Mine is dead? By the Eye, this was a blessed evening!

Questioned2.text: It was that very night that citizens of Gosenberg rescued us!

Start.text: It's the first time that I've felt safe since the uprising.

Questioned.text: Ah, you want to know what <narrator>The All-seeing Eye guides us</narrator> means? I believe it's the name of a prayer, but those who rescued us used it as a rallying cry. I thought they sent you, so I repeated it just in case...

Start.text: Thanks for your help, Mercenaries. You give the Brotherhood a run for their money.

Next1.text: We cannot abide slaves tearing up the countryside, especially after murdering their foreman. We can't have the others getting some ideas.

End1.text: If only you'd arrived earlier, none of them would have escaped.

Questioned.text: The uprising occurred just as Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp was murdered. Apparently, citizens provided the slaves with weapons and helped them kill their guards.

Start.text: My leg hurts. These maggots got me.

Questioned.text: <narrator>The All-seeing Eye guides us</narrator>? Its the name of a prayer, but on their lips, it sounds more like a rallying cry. Perhaps they learned it from their rescuers?

Start.text: Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp must be questioned! If only Lady Malvina could remember where she saw her brother last...

End.text: What have you done? Lady Malvina is now refusing to talk about her brother!

Start.text: My mother was murdered, and my brother didn't even turn up! I don't know where that loafer is, but I hope for his sake that he wasn't involved!

Next1.text: Find Lyderic, and I will give you a fitting reward, Mercenaries.

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Next2.text: I dont know where hes disappeared to, or when he went missing, but Ive told the help not to touch his room. Its upstairs. Feel free to take a look, maybe he left some clues.

MissionDesc.text: Search the Hoevendorp manor to find clues leading to Lyderic.

EndSon.text: I'd rather you didn't mention my brother in front of me. Nor in front of anyone else.

MissionDesc2.text: Find out what the Rooks stole from the Hoevendorp family.

line0.text: Take on Malvina Ald Hoevendorp's mission.

line1.text: Find Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp.

line0.text: Search the Magnificent to find the document the Rooks were after.

Start.text: Did you expect to find me overwhelmed with grief or tortured by resentment?

Next1.text: I do not have time for that. I now have two arenas to run and the title of Broker to earn. I hope that your adventures to come are more exciting than what awaits me.

Start.text: I am responsible for Lady Malvina's security.

Questioned.text: The Brothers-in-Arms who protected Broker Wylla were veterans, so their assailants must have been quite formidable.

Start.text: Clues... yes. I must find clues.

Questioned.text: Leave me, I need to focus.

Start.text: I'm sorry, but you cannot go upstairs without Lady Malvina's permission.

Next.text: I've been Lady Malvina's personal bodyguard for three years now.

Questioned.text: Between you and me, I believe that Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp is capable of killing his own mother. They hated each other so much that Broker Hoevendorp regularly threatened to disinherit him.

Start.text: There is nothing of value in this box.
This small money box is sealed with a puzzle mechanism.

PuzzleSolved.text: The box contains a number of soppy letters between Lyderic Al Hoevendorp and a juggler named Adelise. The last letter refers to a tryst on the <narrator>Artists' Square</narrator>.

Start.text: The library is filled with poetry books and transcriptions of plays.

MissionDesc.text: Meet Adelise on the Artists' Square.

line0.text: Win the tournament by defeating the Hoevendorp Champion.

line1.text: Speak to Broker Bernna.

line0.text: Bring 5 Comfrey to Aletta.

Start.text: A shrine in memory of Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp.
What a mess! I had just left Bernna's Arena!

Next1.text: Apparently, the situation has improved, but until recently, Broker Bernna paid us so poorly that we couldn't even afford to go to the apothecary. Most of us went to the competition.

Questionned.text: If you want my opinion, Alazar is behind the Broker's murder. Whenever there is something fishy going on around here, they're always in on it.

Start.text:
<narrator>The fighter struggles to hold back tears.</narrator>
What will become of us without Broker Hoevendorp?

line0.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Questioned1.text:
Don't repeat this to anyone, but... I think that the rumours are true. Broker Bernna killed Wylla Ald Hoevendorp!
He never got over the fact that his best fighters left to join his rival, so he murdered her!

Give.text: Oh! That's... that's so thoughtful of you. Thank you!

SettingLog.text: <narrator>Broker Bernna</narrator> lost his fighters to his rival, Broker Hoevendorp.

Start.text: Today's fights are cancelled. The arena is closed, to allow the fighters time to mourn.

Questionned.text: Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp was the owner of this arena. We are greatly saddened by her death and shocked by our rivals' behaviour. Bernna's Arena did not even come to pay their last respects!

Start.text: Don't become like me, Mercenaries. Above all, don't ever gamble!

Next1.text: If you don't have enough to cover your losses, or you win a bit too much, they will come after you.

Start.text: You could have let Hoevendorp's Arena win. It was the least you could do to pay your last respects to my late mother.

Questioned.text: Godrik Ald Bernna looks a bit too pleased with his victory. I would keep an eye on him if I were you. He seems on edge at the moment.

Start.text: You won! You did it!

Next1.text: Bernna'll Never Walk Alone! Bernna'll Never Walk Alone!

line0.props.tipText: Please Broker Bernna by supporting him.

Next2.text: Are you happy with this reward? Ask me anything! You're my little champions! My favourite heroes!

End.text: Ah, my favourite little champions!

Questioned1.text:
Oh... I wasn't expecting a question about Wylla...
I know it's not very respectful of her memory, but I'm glad that she's joined the Light. That woman spent her whole life trying to ruin my family.

Questioned2.text: The Bernnas have always opposed slavery, so when we finally got the chance to vote for its abolition at the Broker Council, I thought our time had finally come. I was so certain the reform would pass that I hired people, bought mines and businesses...

Questioned3.text: But at the last minute, Wylla turned the Council against me! They voted to keep slavery. All my investments were lost... It nearly destroyed my family.

SettingLog.text: Broker Hoevendorp ruined <narrator>Broker Bernna</narrator>.

Start.text: This store is for our fighters only. If it's beer you're after, there's a vendor in the stands.

Alt.text: Well... I suppose that I can't refuse you my finest wares...

Start.text:
Welcome to the <narrator>Arena Clash</narrator>, Mercenaries! The most important event of the year, save for the Festival of Light!
Who would you like to bet on? Who will win the title this year?

Next1.text: Oh! You're representing Bernna's Arena? Haha! That's sporting of you, Mercenaries, but you don't stand a chance. Hoevendorp won the title four years in a row. Broker Bernna is completely out of his league.

NoBeginArena.text: I see! Even the best can cave under pressure, eh?

OnLeaveArena.text: See you soon, Champions of Bernna!

Completed.text: I wish you'd lost... Nothing personal, but no victory means no bonus for us.

Completed2.text:
Oh well!
One has to be a good sport, eh? At least, you gave us quite a show. Take your prize, the rest will be sent to Bernna's Arena.

ArenaLost.text: Nothing to be ashamed of. Our fighters are just better trained.

End.text:
No fighting today, we need to clean up the mess left by the Arena Clash.
Which means you'll have time to investigate, right?

ArenaDiff.text: You're back to challenge our fighters? Ha! Just because you beat them once doesn't mean you can do it again!

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text:
All right, you did it again.
Take this reward, Bernna would be proud, Champions.

CompletedDiff2.text: The arena remains open to you if you wish to fight again, but Malvina Ald Hoevendorp didn't say anything about a third reward.

ArenaAgain.text: Do you miss Trivette Ragnol? You can always challenge her, but know that there won't be any reward if you win.

CompletedAgain.text: It's starting to get boring. If this keeps up, our champion will lose heart and leave the arena...

line0.text: Follow the clues to discover what happened.

Start.text: A trail of footprints seems to lead outside. Following them might lead you to survivors.
This Hoevendorp foreman's throat has been cut.
This slave appears to have been trampled by a crowd.
The foreman received a blow to the back.
The foreman and the slave killed each other.
Want to do business? The death of Wylla the Witch will bring you good luck, for sure!

Questioned.text: To tell you the truth, I'm not from round here. I arrived in the city yesterday, and I'm trying to blend in.

Start.text: Glad you gave the Guard the slip, Mercenaries! I'm trying to keep a low profile until the People's Fellowship overthrows the Broker Council...

Questioned.text: I don't know if the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> killed Wylla, but I'd sure be glad if they did. Poor lads, they looked so crestfallen when she got away last time!

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> has tried to assassinate Broker Hoevendorp in the past.

Start.text: Broker Hoevendorp got what she deserved. For years now, we've complained about the Bandits lurking in the alleys at night, yet she always refused to increase the Guard.

Questionned.text: Wylla Ald Hoevendorp was killed in the well-to-do part of town, where wealthy Merchants and Brokers thought they were safe.

Start.text: The <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> is right: This city only looks after the wealthy, and doesn't care about the common folk.

Questionned.text: Just look around you! Mercenaries flock from everywhere when a Broker dies, but when it's a pauper, the Guard doesn't even raise a finger!

Start.text: I won't mourn the death of a Broker, especially not Wylla! That daughter of a crocswine never showed an ounce of compassion for the populace.

Questionned.text: Look at the squalor around you! Do you think that the Brokers could share a fraction of their wealth? Never! They keep it all for themselves.

Start.text: We're celebrating the death of Wylla the Witch! Wanna join in? We've made an effigy and we're going to set it on fire.

Next1.text: We have almost everything we need, but if you want to help, we'd appreciated it.

line0.props.disableReason: This person seems to be waiting for something from you.

Questionned.text: I don't know if the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> killed Wylla, but I'd sure be glad if they did. Poor lads, they looked so crestfallen when she got away last time!

End1.text: Perfect! Stick around, the effigy will be ready in no time. I'll give it a head that's just as ugly as the real thing was.

End2.text: I placed the effigy on the pyre. Take a good look, it's about to go up in smoke!

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> tried to assassinate Broker Hoevendorp in the past.

line0.text: Give 10 Wood and 10 Cloth to Lennert.

line1.text: Give 10 Wood to Lennert.

line2.text: Give 10 Cloth to Lennert.

Start.text: As soon as the Broker's effigy is ready, I'll light the pyre, and the celebrations can begin! This is only the beginning of the uprising, but we must mark the occasion!

DollReceived.text: You gave us the materials needed for this effigy: you've earned the honour of setting it on fire! Ah, the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> lads and lasses would be so proud of you!

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to be waiting for something from you.

line0.text: Use 1 Torchto set the pyre alight.

Start.text: The mob seems mesmerised by the flames.

line0.text: Bring the stolen pig to Ariett.

Start.text: Edor is thrilled to be back home.
It's been three days since I asked the Brotherhood for help, and I still haven't heard back!

Next1.text: The Broker's murder has rallied every last mercenary in Gosenberg. Nobody cares about the common folk's problems these days!

Next2.text: My best boar's been stolen! An actual prize-winner! We've won title after title in county fairs with that one. But no one gives a damn!

Next3.text:
You want to know the worst bit, Mercenaries?
A customer told me the thieves were on the other side of the river, between the <narrator>city</narrator> and the <narrator>Rouste Field</narrator>.

line0.props.disableReason: This person wants something from you.

End1.text: Is that... ? Could it be my sweet Edor?

End2.text: I call this boar the General. Suits him, don't you think? Just see that wicked look in his eyes.

End3.text: Edor was a gift from my favourite punter back when I worked in the Midnight Gardens. What started as a joke became a calling, and this animal turned out to be a champion.

End4.text: Here's your reward, plus a bonus - I kept a trinket from back then, something of a souvenir. Have this as thanks - the cupboard it opens was used for contraband, so it might still contain something useful.

Accept.text: Say hello to my old friends for me.

Wait.text: Edor was a gift from my favourite punter back when I worked at the brothel. What started as a joke became a calling, and this animal turned out to be a champion.

Questioned2.text: I wouldn't be surprised if Alazar hired <narrator>Bandits</narrator> to attack Broker Hoevendorp. One of the marauders once tried to trade me a pig for some items from the Embassy.

Start.text: We only sell quality meat, a product you can trust.

Questioned.text:
Ever heard of the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator>?
The poor folk in Gosenberg organised so as to fight the rich. Broker Hoevendorp was their nemesis.

Start.text: This time, Mercenaries, I've found you the PERFECT building. It'll make you the most prestigious Tavern Keepers in all the Five Kingdoms!

Next1.text: It's got one amazing feature after another: breathtakingly high ceilings, a reception hall the size of the Broker's Palace, and that hearth! Oh, that hearth! I'll bet you could roast two whole boars in there at once!

Next2.text: But you'll want to be quick, Mercenaries! A building like one this won't stay empty for long in Gosenberg City.

line0.props.tipText: Buy the ruined Tavern.

MissionDesc.text: Bring Yorvenn back to the People's Fellowship.

line0.text: Contact the People's Fellowship.

line1.text: Get Yorvenn out of jail.

line2.text: Bring Yorvenn back to the People's Fellowship.

Start.text: You can come closer - I won't try and bite you through the bars.

Next1.text: No hard feelings, Mercenaries. I hope you find much success in your adventures.

Next2.text: I knew the risk when I decided to murder Wylla. As luck would have it, misfortune followed me and put you in my way.

Next3.text: Thanks to you, I experienced the most thrilling Arena Clash of my life. I can now die in peace.

Start.text: Quickly! Let's get out of here! The jailer went to fetch the Guard!

Next1.text: Bring me to Betje - she'll be able to hide me!

Start.text:

We travel far and wide to offer our customers the most valuable goods in all the realms!

Next1.text: I'm... I'm just an innocent Merchant. I don't know what happened.

Start.text:
<narrator>Eel soup?</narrator> Ah, you're familiar with the <narrator>Rooks' code</narrator>, I see! And here I thought you were decent folk.
Need to murder someone or are you just after some illicit items?

Next1.text: We're no ordinary contract killers, Mercenaries.

Next2.text: No Rook has ever revealed their client's identity. Those who request our services are never at risk of exposure, otherwise we'd soon be out of business.

Next3.text: So, even if we did take out the Broker, we wouldn't tell you. Not even under torture.

End.text: I left my post for an hour, and everyone was dead when I got back! What happened?

Looters often end up dying in this tomb, but few ever make it this far.

Start.text: Citizen Pietr! The choice is simple: either hand over the timber the Church of Gosenberg bought, or be charged with roguery.

Next1.text: I shall do neither, priestess!

Next2.text: The amount of Krowns your Church paid wasn't even half of what I asked for.

Next3.text: Your prices are outrageous! The Church paid you a fair sum, based on the going rate in Tiltren...

Next4.text:
In Tiltren? That county full of yokels?
The cost of living in Gosenberg is much higher! If you factor in the cost of labour...

Next5.text: You use slaves! Don't try and tell me you're stifled by production costs!

Alt1.text: This timber will be used to build the Gosenberg Cathedral! Taking part in this sacred work is a reward in its own right.

Alt2.text: Either Citizen Pietr gives us that timber, or we will drag him before the Brokers' Court! Make him see reason, and everyone will be happy. You most of all.

line0.props.tipText: Teach the priestess and her guard a lesson.

line1.props.tipText: Persuade the priestess to pay.

Convinced.text: I'll admit that feeding and housing slaves isn't cheap. That much is true. And their timber is far superior to that found in Tiltren.

Alt4.text: All right, the Church will make an effort. You can apprise him of our decision.

AttackEnd.text: We'll pay! We'll pay whatever he wants!

End1.text: Well? What was the reply?

End2.text: Perfect! I'll have our slaves bring all this timber to the cathedral worksite. The Church of Gosenberg is very grateful for your involvement.

Wait.text: For what you've done today, all your sins are forgiven.

WaitAlt.text: We'll wait for our slaves to collect the timber, then we'll leave.

Start.text: They won't get a single splinter until I'm paid!

Next1.text: If you can get them to cough up my asking price, I'll pay you the same wages as my bodyguards!

Threat1.text: How was I blasphemous? I... No! These Brothers are only here for my protection. I would never lay a hand on a priestess of the Light!

Threat2.text:
... Look! To prove my claim and show the true extent of my faith, I will donate this timber to the Gosenberg Cathedral.
Happy?

AttackEnd.text: Okay! Okay! Just take the sodding wood!

Wanted.text: You've threatened a citizen of Grinmeer.

End1.text:
The priestess saw reason?
Glad to hear it!

End2.text: All those Krowns spent on Mercenaries finally paid off!

Wait.text: I'll never produce anything else for the Church of Gosenberg again. I swear by the Eye.

O Saint Eleor,
Who once shielded Jeru from his enemies,
May you do the same for us now,
Upon the heretics' heads, bring down thy sword
Thy worshippers' souls, cover with thy shield.

Start.text:
Welcome to the People's Fellowship, Mercenaries.
It's always a pleasure to meet new members and greet our supporters.

Next1.text: We created the People's Fellowship to unite and defend the people against the Brokers, who get rich at their expense while hoarding wealth and trade.

Next2.text: Naturally, the Brokers' Council tries to clamp down on us, fearing the prospect of their privileges and fortunes being undermined.

Next3.text: They plan to execute one of our own to make an example. We are in desperate need of people like you to rescue our friend and bring him back.

line1.props.disableReason: This person wants something from you in exchange for information.

Wait.text: Bring Yorvenn back in one piece.

Next3.text: Did you give 'em a beating? Good! Kogo and Toro were unbearable!

Next4.text: Come here, and I'll tell you all about it.

Enjoy the many talents of our Gosenbergers.

Questioned.text: Broker Bernna cares about the common folk. Between the Rouste games and the arena, he makes sure no one gets bored.

I sell refreshments to the crowd and the players.
Have as many drinks as you like - it eases the pain.

Want to join a Rouste match?
Step right up! Don't be shy! The more the merrier.

Next1.text: A game of Rouste is played in teams of 8: 6 on the pitch and 2 substitutes. The aim is to get the ball to the opponent's end zone! Anyone can play, so long as they don't mind losing an ear or a nose.

Next2.text: There's an amazing reward for the winning team: a fine pony for ploughing fields, generously donated by Broker Bernna!

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Start.text: Good to see you again!

Questioned.text: You should head to <narrator>Hoevendorp Manor</narrator>. The Broker's daughter has a search going there.

Questioned2.text: Not to be rude, but you can go whistle.

Start.text: Good to see you again!

Questioned.text: We were there on the night of Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's death. I remember Broker Bernna was also there, but I don't think I saw the Broker's son or the Alazarian Ambassador.

Start.text: How have they still not found Broker Hoevendorp's killer?

Next1.text: Just look around you! The streets empty the minute the sun sets! Everyone's afraid to go outside! It's already taking a toll on business.

Next2.text: I commiserate, dear lady, but I can assure you the Broker Council is doing everything in its power to resolve this.

Next5.text: The discussion could last a while longer.

Start.text: Wise Broker Council, citizens of Gosenberg, the Mercenaries have given me proof of their claims.

Next1.text: This contract confirms the sale of Bernna's Arena, dated a few weeks before her assassination.

Next2.text: Broker Bernna sold his arena?

Next3.text: That would explain his sudden wealth...

Next4.text: The crowd and the Brokers are somewhat agitated.

Next5.text: I was unaware this document existed until the <narrator>Rooks</narrator> raided our home and took it. These Mercenaries fought hard to recover it.

Next6.text: This contract proves that Broker Bernna is guilty. He's the one who told the Rooks to assassinate my mother and take the document linking him to her.

Start.text:
Enough!
Silence!

Next1.text: Yes! I killed Wylla Ald Hoevendorp! Yes! I hired the Rooks to do it!

Next2.text: She sullied our good name and ruined our family, just like she'd done with the Armemans!

Next3.text: I sold her my arena with the proviso that she would only announce the news after the Arena Clash, giving me a chance to go out on top by winning the fight.

Next4.text: But I was never going to let her enjoy my ancestors' legacy. The Rooks cost a great deal, but they got the job done...

BadEnd1.text: I realise this is disturbing, but it could be an unfortunate accident!

BadEnd2.text: My involvement hasn't been established. The Mercenaries' accusations have been very unreliable so far.

Start.text:
<narrator>The room is packed. Many locals have come to attend these proceedings.
The Broker Council seems restless.</narrator>

Next0.text: ::G2TrialPalaceAccused::, you are accused of murdering our colleague, Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp.

Next1.text: The Mercenaries who accuse you claim to have evidence of your guilt.

Next3.text: If, by the Eye's grace, they manage to prove this, they will receive the sum promised by the Broker Council. If they fail, if this assembly finds that they made slanderous allegations against you, they will be ordered to pay <gold>300</gold> to our great city.

Next4.text: And now, having reviewed the rules of this court, we can begin.

Start_F.text: <narrator>The room is packed. Many locals have come to attend the proceedings. The Broker Council seems restless.</narrator>

Next0_F.text: ::G2TrialPalaceAccused::, you are accused of murdering our colleague, Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp.

Next1_F.text: The Mercenaries who accuse you claim to have evidence of your guilt.

Next3_F.text: If, by the Eye's grace, they manage to prove this, they will receive the sum promised by the Broker Council. If they fail, if this assembly finds that they made slanderous allegations against you, they will be ordered to pay <gold>300</gold> to our great city.

Next4_F.text: And now, having reviewed the rules of this court, we can begin.

Start.text: Firstly, Mercenaries, let's revisit the circumstances which led to the death of our esteemed colleague, Wylla Ald Hoevendorp.

Next1.text: In all likelihood, Wylla Ald Hoevendorp was killed in the middle of the street, in the more affluent part of our city. Is this man the one accused of dealing the fatal blow?

line0.props.tipText: Yes, he's the one.

line1.props.tipText: No, he wasn't at the scene.

Next2.text: You see! I wasn't even there! Even these Mercenaries admit it. How could I have killed the Broker?

Next2Bis.text:
Silence!
Mercenaries, I don't understand. Where was the accused that night?

line0.props.tipText: The accused was at the Broker's Palace.

line1.props.tipText: The accused was in the Midnight Gardens.

line2.props.tipText: The accused was at home.

line3.props.tipText: The accused was at the Hoevendorp Mine.

AlazarRight.text: Yes, I was at home. I even had an appointment with Broker Hoevendorp, but she never came. May the Eye welcome her into the Light.

AlazarWrong.text: That's ridiculous! I was home that night. All my servants can confirm this.

SonRight.text: I'm ashamed, but the Mercenaries speak the truth. That night I was held captive in the Midnight Gardens.

SonWrong.text: What? That's preposterous! I was kidnapped and held captive by those wretches in the Midnight Gardens! How could I have killed my mother?

RivalRight.text: I was indeed here in the palace, along with my esteemed colleagues. You can vouch for it yourself, Broker Ald Marheim.

RivalWrong.text: Ah! Mercenaries, I expected more from you! This entire Council could have answered that question, as I was at the Brokers' Palace with them that night.

LeagueRight.text: The Mercenaries are right. That night, the People's Fellowship occupied the Hoevendorp Mine, on the other side of Grinmeer.

LeagueWrong.text: That's not true! The Fellowship was out of town that night. We were on the opposite end of Grinmeer Province, in the Hoevendorp Mine.

People.text: How, by Saint Septimus, could I have been there when I was at the Artists' Square! The performers, the crowd, they all saw me!

Guard.text: Don't listen to these lies! I was at the Guard post all night. My superior can vouch for me!

Noble.text: Don't be absurd! That night, I was at a colleague's for business. I didn't return home until the next morning.

Scholar.text: Lies! Poppycock! I spent the night studying flat Earth physics with other students. The results of our research can prove it.

MiddleEnd1.text: I believe the accused has evidence to prove you wrong, Mercenaries. Hopefully, there will be no more setbacks.

MiddleEnd2.text: Esteemed colleagues, I shall let you carry on.

BadEnd1.text: Mercenaries, are you absolutely certain you want to accuse this person? It appears your accusation is unfounded, and this response alone entirely refutes it.

BadEnd2.text: The Broker Council cannot assemble at the drop of a hat. This court is not intended to hear the fabrications of reward-starved Mercenaries.

BadEnd3.text: The Broker Council hereby acquits the accused ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: and sentences you, Mercenaries, to pay a fine of <gold>300</gold> to the city of Gosenberg.

LeagueRight_F.text:
The Mercenaries are right. We freed the slaves.
But then, how could we have murdered the Broker on the other side of Grinmeer at the same time?

LeagueWrong_F.text: That's not true! The Fellowship was out of town that night. We were on the opposite end of Grinmeer Province, in the Hoevendorp Mine.

Start.text: So the defendant wasn't there when our late colleague was brutally murdered...

Next0.text: Please explain to this Council how the man you're accusing was able to kill Wylla Ald Hoevendorp and the twelve Brothers protecting her without being at the scene.

line0.props.tipText: With the help of Bandits.

line1.props.tipText: With the help of Mercenaries.

line2.props.tipText: With the help of the Rooks.

line3.props.tipText: With the help of the People's Fellowship.

Next1.text: I fail to see the legitimacy of your claim, Mercenaries. While it would be possible for a large group of these scoundrels to overcome the bodyguards and kill the Broker, what links them to the defendant?

line0.props.tipText: The defendant hired them to assassinate Broker Hoevendorp.

line1.props.tipText: The defendant is their leader.

line2.props.tipText: The defendant is a member of the group.

Alt1.text: The defendant claims he can prove that he wasn't at the scene.

Alt2.text: Are you simply mistaken, Mercenaries, or are you wasting our time on purpose?

Alt3.text: Please explain to this Council how the man you're accusing was able to kill Wylla Ald Hoevendorp and the twelve Brothers protecting her without being at the scene.

line0.props.tipText: With the help of Bandits.

line1.props.tipText: With the help of Mercenaries.

line2.props.tipText: With the help of the Rooks.

line3.props.tipText: With the help of the People's Fellowship.

AlazarRight1.text: Don't be absurd! This is the oldest accusation in the book. I was almost lynched right there on the street because of such falsehoods.

AlazarRight2.text: ::G2TrialPalaceAccused::, please refrain from speaking out of turn.

AlazarRight3.text: However common this accusation may be does not make it baseless. Under these circumstances, it even seems legitimate.

AlazarRight4.text: On that note, Broker Rijkman, you have the floor.

AlazarWrong1.text: Alazar would never stoop to hiring wretches to assassinate such an important Gosenberger. We have much more respect for the Council than you think, Mercenaries.

AlazarWrong2.text: Must I explain to the esteemed members of the Broker Council why this accusation is preposterous? Do you really think Alazar would risk letting their Ambassador take an active part in a guild of assassins?

AlazarWrong3.text: Must I explain to the esteemed members of the Broker Council why this accusation is preposterous? There is not one shred of truth in the Mercenaries' claims.

RivalRight.text: What? The Rooks? That's completely untrue! I don't know the Rooks! I've never even heard of them!

RivalWrong1.text: You Mercenaries have quite an imagination! Esteemed Council! Why would I bother hiring someone to commit murder when I'm surrounded by gladiators who would gladly kill for me?

RivalWrong2.text: Haha! How entertaining, Mercenaries! Assuming I was part of such a group, I certainly would not have asked them to kill someone so close to me.

RivalWrong3.text:
Haha! I'm glad I chose you as my champions, you turned out to be quite entertaining.
Just pay your fine, and let's put an end to this farce.

SonRight.text: Wait! I admit I know quite a few Bandits in this city, but I owe them so much money that they would never take such a risk for me!

SonWrong1.text: This is ridiculous! How could I afford to hire a killer when I'm so deep in debt? No one works for free in this city.

SonWrong2.text: How can you accuse me of such a thing, Mercenaries? Was I not hounded by the very same Bandits, long before my mother's death?

SonWrong3.text: Esteemed Council, do not listen to them, I beg of you! They're lying, trying to mislead you! You cannot believe a word they say. Their accusations are nothing more than slander.

LeagueRight.text:
Preposterous!
How could the People's Fellowship free slaves and assassinate Broker Hoevendorp at the same time? These events took place in two different locations, hours away from each other!

LeagueWrong1.text: Not even I can bribe the People's Fellowship. If that's what you think, Mercenaries, then you really don't understand our cause.

LeagueWrong2.text: Are you even aware of the disastrous decisions these Council parasites took this moon alone? Do you think I have time for anything else than defending the people?

LeagueWrong3.text: Esteemed Council! If I'm convicted on such flimsy grounds, the people will see how little you think of them. You will have an uprising on your hands, I guarantee it.

GoodEnd2.text: Every time you open your mouth, I'm increasingly inclined to believe the Mercenaries.

GoodEnd3.text: On that note, Broker Rijkman, you have the floor.

BadEnd1.text: I'm afraid ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: is right, we're wasting our time.

BadEnd2.text: Broker Rijkman, do you have anything to add, or can we demand that the Mercenaries pay the <gold>300</gold> fine without further ado?
