Threat3.text: The two of them went around the hill behind the Moritagre Farm, straight to the cursed village of Lethyre.

Threat4.text: If you decide to go after them, you'll need what we're selling. The place is crawling with Plague-ridden monsters.

Wanted.text: You threatened the denizens of Harag.

Start.text: You've done it! Mercenaries, you saved us all!

Next1.text: The others are already headed to the market. Let's make haste and join them.

Start.text: We got you! Mercenaries, it's your lucky day - these Smugglers have a bounty on their heads!

Next1.text: No need! We've already hired them. Right, Mercenaries?

Next2.text: How did you...! You've been careful not to say why you were wanted, haven't you?

Next3.text: Look at them, Mercenaries. They're nothing but profiteers charging a fortune for the Plague cure. No! They raid our Tombs, where the gods dwell, and then sell our relics to the highest bidder!

Next4.text: Relics? Those little shards of baked clay? I'm surprised we can even find buyers for that rubbish! You should be thanking us - we're cleaning up your old ruins.

Next5.text: How dare you? Mercenaries! You can't defend Bandits who scorn our gods and our relics!

Start.text:
Thank you for your help. We couldn't have fought off the Guard without you.
We'll manage from here on out. The secret dock should be close.

Next1.text: As for your reward... It awaits you in the basement.

Start.text: We heard a commotion! What happened?

Next1.text: You killed the Smugglers?

Next2.text: They got what they deserved... We've been looking for them for weeks. Take this as a token of our gratitude.

EndFight1.text: That was an impressive fight. We're glad to be rid of those Smugglers.

EndFight2.text: Good work taking out that group - here's your bounty.

MissionDescDeadCity.text: Find Senuna in the Cursed Village.

MissionDescGhostTrack.text: Go to the Secluded Cottage in Ludern.

MissionDescBeastTrack.text: Investigate the situation at the Large Tracker Camp.

MissionDescTrackerConclusion.text: Respond to the Garussa Clan's request by going to the Swamp Threshold Market.

MissionDescScholarConclusion.text: Find the Alazarian Scholars in their lair.

MissionDescBeastCamp.text: You may not want to tread here.

Start.text: The expression on this man's face is even more terrifying than his wounds.
Clay figurines representing a Tule gathering have been placed in front of the altar. These swamp spirits are very popular in Ludern.
Someone has placed a crocswine figurine among the offerings.
This altar is dedicated to the Tule Queen.
Someone slit this merchant's throat before devouring his leg.
Hunters don't seem to use this camp year round.
There are carcasses all over. This must be a hunting camp.
This camp looks like a drop-off site for Smugglers.
A massacre took place here. All these soldiers are wearing Alazarian armour.

End.text: A massacre took place here. All these soldiers are wearing Alazarian armour.

Start.text: As your Companions rummage through the room, one of the shelves starts shifting forward slowly. A suitably brawny Companion should be able to prop it back up.

line1.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text: In the centre of the room stands a Plague-ridden man oblivious to your presence. You can leave unseen or try to slay him stealthily.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text: A gust of wind fills the room. You hear a sinister creak... The door through which your Companions entered is closing! It could slam shut at any moment and reveal your presence, but perhaps one of your Companions is nimble enough to stop it in time.

line1.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text: This bag is full of crockery, trinkets and rusty tools. However, something shiny catches your eye at the very bottom, among the useless knick-knacks. A willing and very determined Companion should be able to grab it.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text: This time I've got you! You can't escape!

Next1.text: You're completely insane! The Plague-ridden will be here any minute!

Next2.text: That's your problem! You're the one who chose to come here, Scholar. You should've known it'd be crawling with plague rats.

Next3.text: Shhh! For the Eye's sake, be quiet!

Next4.text: Mercenaries! Shut her up! I'll give you anything you want, but we must leave before...

Next5.text: Argh! They're already here!

Start.text: As they make to leave, your Companions are shocked to find the door jammed shut. Someone strong enough could lift it off its hinges. Otherwise, you'll have to go through that fissure in the wall.

line0.props.tipText: Jump through the fissure.

line1.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text: This armour has rusted to encase the weapon. Prying it out will be no mean feat, but perhaps a determined Companion could manage it.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text: This chest looks tempting, but you will have to avoid all sorts of debris to reach it. A nimble Companion might be able to cross without making any noise.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text: Your Companions' eyes immediately turn to this worm-eaten beam. The slightest gust of wind or vibration could bring it down. If your troop wants to explore this room, a suitably stalwart companion will need to hold it in place.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Start.text:
<narrator>As you come closer, you hear a voice whispering.</narrator>
You... you aren't Plague-ridden?
Oh I beg you, get me out of here!

line0.props.tipText: Destroying these planks will make noise.

Start.text:
With all the Plague-ridden about, I couldn't call for help.
Truth be told, I thought Id starve to death behind these planks.

Next.text:
You saved my life, Mercenaries. Thank you for taking such a risk.
Take this. I found it in the village before I became trapped.

Reward.text: I'll be on my way now. You should do the same, what with all the noise we just made...

Start.text: You won't find any Plague remedies in this shop. Alazar refuses to give us any. Try the Smugglers.

Next.text: Your wounds have been dressed - you're ready to start fighting again.

Start.text: Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: So, what do you think? Quaint, isn't it?

Next1.text: I made sure to furnish it with everything you might need: a chest for your belongings and stools for Companions you don't want to take with you. And of course, you can call on me at any time to arrange trips from one travel post to another.

Next2.text: Are you ready to travel?

line0.props.disableReason: Build travel posts in other villages to travel there quickly.

Start.text: When I was young, I travelled the world on the Ghost Pack's trail. You won't find a better steward in all of Ludern.

Next1.text: All you have to do is buy the land and pay craftsmen, and you'll soon have a travel post at your disposal in Garussa.

line0.props.tipText: Build the Ludern Travel Post.

Build.text:
Don't worry, I know what I'm doing.
This travel post will be up and running in no time.

line0.title: Tomb Raiders
line0.props.helpTip: Look for the Smugglers' hideout.

Start.text: Sheesh, what with the Plague-ridden hordes and the crocswines, we already had a lot on our plates... But Smugglers, too? They better hope the Guard finds them before I do!
We're looking for a hideout used by a group of Smugglers.

Next1.text: Normally we turn a blind eye - but these ones crossed a line.

Next2.text: Under the guise of supplying us with a cure for the Plague, they sneaked into the Tombs of the Ancients to raid them!

Next3.text: We've been monitoring the Smugglers lurking in the region. They think their accomplices are holed up in North Ludern. If you find that hideout, exterminate those inside. We'll make it worth your while.

End.text: We're keeping a close watch on the other groups of Smugglers.

Start.text: Alazar won't sell us their damned medication because we sealed off the Tombs of the Ancients.
The Tombs of the Ancients are sacred. These outsiders are not worthy of entering them.
The Scholars said we could make it... But it was impossible! There were so many monsters! ... They said we were pursuing knowledge! ... Knowledge!

line0.props.tipText: It shouldn't be too hard.

Start.text: So, you're still alive, I see! Tules be damned! There's just no killing you!

Next1.text:
This little reunion will have to wait, Voseg.
We have precious little time.

Next2.text: The Beast you saw, that invincible monster... We now know why Alazar lured it here.

Next3.text: Their aim was simple: distract us so that their Scholars could get their hands on what they've been eyeing for centuries... The Tomb of the Ancients.

Next4.text: The woman who fled during the fight will stop at nothing to reach her goal. We are sure of it.

Next5.text: We will go to the Tomb and stop her from desecrating this holy place. Come with us. We fully trust your men and their skills.

Accept.text: Good. We'll meet in front of the Tomb. You are now permitted to enter.

MissionDesc.text: Find the Trackers outside the Ludern Tomb.

line0.text: Take on Master Tracker Brighid's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Explore the Ludern Tomb and protect it from the Alazarian Scholars.

Start.text: We should set the Beast loose on their precious university. We'll see how they like that diversion!
So, heroes of Ludern, are you ready to save us once again?
A diversion. Alazar thinks the Beast, Killer of Realms, is a diversion.
I don't sell crocswine meat: it tastes like swamp water.
You are not from Edoran, right? We fought those vermin for 30 years. I won't start selling them our products now!
These pelts are so pristine that Gosenberg traders are willing to fight Plague-ridden hordes and swamp creatures to buy them.
Ludern is probably the most hostile, dangerous region you'll ever see. But it also holds very profitable missions.

Done.text: I'm sure I would have made the same choice.

line0.props.tipText: We haven't heard from the Nerprun Clan since the landslide... The survivors seem to be completely isolated.

line1.props.tipText: The Trackers who keep watch over the entrance to the Ludern Tomb have reported that one of their colleagues went missing.

line2.props.tipText: A person of influence seems to be waiting for something at the border crossing between Harag and Gosenberg.

BoarVillage.text: We haven't heard from the Nerprun Clan since the landslide... the survivors seem to be completely isolated.

DeadCity.text: The Trackers who keep watch over the entrance to the Ludern Tomb have reported that one of their colleagues went missing.

LostSoldier.text: A person of influence seems to be waiting for something at the border crossing between Harag and Gosenberg.

DeliverMission1.text:
<narrator>A strange smile spreads across the Informant's face as she grabs the letter.</narrator>
I didn't think I'd receive word so quickly.

End.text: I believe you know all there is to know about this region.

PathCrime1.text:
It looks like you are keen to drive our dear inventor to madness.
Would you like to keep at it? He's close to admitting defeat, and it just so happens that I got my hands on another key.

PathCrime2.text:
His previous clients are furious. Especially the Smugglers, they don't like being taken for a ride...
For his sake, I hope your next targets will be more forgiving.

PathCrime3.text: This key could belong to any priest... Good luck.

PathCrimeEnd.text: So, you robbed Saint Serene Church? Better hope the Eye's Reckoning doesn't smite you.

line0.text: Buy the Holy Key from the Informant.

line1.text: Find and thwart the security system matching the Holy Key.

Start.text: My grandfather was a soldier in the Edoranian Legion. He fell in love with my grandmother during the war. You know what he did? The blighter switched sides!
Here's a piece of friendly advice: Maintain your armour properly. The cardinal mosquito of Ludern can pierce through plate and armour.

Repair.text: Now, that's a job well done!

Start.text: I crossed Arthes and Tiltren to get here. But nobody wants me.

Next1.text: I'm on my last legs... There's nothing waiting for me in Edoran. The war between Lord Laheart and Lord Vernalis destroyed what little I had.

Next2.text: Take pity, Mercenaries. Convince the judge to let me stay. Don't let him send me back.

line0.title: Asylum Seeker
line0.props.helpTip: Convince the Judge to let the Refugee stay.

Start.text: He said I could stay? Jeru - erm... the Ancients and Tules bless you!

End2.text: Here, this is the only thing still connecting me to my old life. Now that I'm starting a new one, it's of no use to me.

Wait.text: Will I become a Tracker? A Woodcutter...? What do they do in Harag?

Start.text: The refugee? The Guard will return him to the border. Our chief went to warn them.

line0.props.tipText: Ask why he's expelling the Refugee.

Questioned1.text:
Is this a joke, Mercenaries?
He's Edoranian! His ancestors occupied Ludern and slaughtered my people for 30 years.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the judge to let the refugee stay.

Questioned2.text: I dare say your reasoning makes sense, Mercenaries. This poor man is a humble farmer, so young he cannot have taken part in the Edoranian War...

Questioned3.text: All right, we'll keep him. But trust me, life is hard in Ludern. He'll regret not getting arrested in Tiltren.

Start.text: Living in the swamp isn't always easy, but it's our clan's way. The elders say what doesn't kill you makes you stronger.
These beasts... Don't be fooled. They're smarter than your average boar. See how they cut us off from any retreat.

Next.text: Come and see me again if you're injured. I'm not going anywhere, anyway.

Start.text: Are you ready to light the warning beacon?

line0.props.tipText: Once the beacon is lit, the crocswine will attack the town.

MissionDescWood.text: Bring 20 Wood to Chief Bricta.

MissionDescTalk1.text: Talk to the merchant asking for your help.

MissionDescBoar.text: Light the warning beacon and trigger the fight with the boars.

line0.text: Take on Chief Bricta's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
<narrator>The merchant looks uneasy.</narrator>
Ah! You don't see creatures like that in Gosenberg!

Help.text: Ahem... Could we find somewhere more private to talk? Just a moment...

Wood1.text: It's possible that I'm not actually a merchant and that - perhaps - I'm not unconnected to the crocswine attack...

Wood2.text:
All right, I admit it! It's all my fault!
I made a mistake! It was an accident! I thought this experiment posed no risk, that the reagents were safe... But my measurements were off.

Wood3.text: I am an Alazarian Scholar of note. I hold a university professorship! But these barbarians don't care. If they find out I'm responsible for their troubles, they'll have me hang!

Wood4.text:
Let me slip away quietly before they start asking questions. Distract them when the reinforcements arrive!
I beg you! I have a family! I'll give you all the Krowns I have.

Wait.text:
Let me slip away quietly before they start asking questions. Distract them when the reinforcements arrive!
I beg you! I have a family! I'll give you all the Krowns I have.

End.text: You remember our agreement, right? Go on... Distract them! I'll make myself scarce. Thanks again. I knew I could count on you.

T4terMarketplaceLeader.npc.name: Bricta, Chief of the Nerprun Clan

Start.text: You managed to get in despite the crocswine? I don't know what's gotten into them. Those wretched things usually stick to the swamp!

Next1.text: For days now, they've been attacking anyone who tries to leave the village. The minute we let our guard down, they try to get inside the houses.

Next2.text: The situation is dire. We're out of wood to light the warning beacon, and there aren't enough of us to wait for reinforcements. A little help would be appreciated.

Next3.text: Ah! How kind of you! First we need to deal with the warning beacon. We've already cut up everything we had - only our walls are left! Find us some wood so we can warn the other clans.

Wood1.text: This firewood could be our salvation! Thank you, Mercenaries.

Wood2.text: Meet me in front of the fire. I'm going to prepare it.

Wait.text: Rest for a bit. The fire will be ready soon.

Start.text: Perfect, the oil and wood are all set. Once they see the warning beacon, the Yeble and Garussa Clans will rush to our aid! There'll be enough of us to slay the crocswine.

Next1.text: But in the meantime, everything rests on your weapons. Flames drive the crocswine mad. As soon as the fire is blazing, they'll attack.

Next2.text: Steel yourselves. It's going to be a long fight. You can ignite the warning beacon whenever you're ready.

Start.text: Do you think we stand a chance? What if the other clans don't come?

Next.text: I didn't doubt it for a second! The clans always come to each other's aid!

Start.text: Would you like to buy something? Please do! If you can help us, I'll sell you anything.

Next.text: Our heroes have returned? I pray to the Tules as often as I can to show my thanks.

Start.text: I nearly broke my leg on the way! Twice even! I'm too old to be running like that!

Next1.text: I was having a bath when I saw the beacon. I had to get dressed on the way. The market vendors won't soon forget that.

Next2.text: Poor souls...

End.text: Rescuing other clans is expected of us all. Nerprun would have done the same for Yeble or Garussa.

Start.text: Cheers, Mercenaries!
Solidarity is what's held Harag together for a thousand years!

Next.text: When a clan is attacked, the others stand ready to lend their aid. Always!

Start.text: Don't be shy, Mercenaries! Help yourselves. This feast was prepared for you.

Next1.text: All this is in your honour. Without your help, we all would've ended up as crocswine food. You are part of the clan now - part of the family, so to speak. So, please accept this gift as a token of our appreciation.

line0.props.tipText: Report the Alazarian Scholar and his dubious experiments.

line1.props.tipText: Silently accept the reward.

Accuse1.text: What? That scum is responsible for everything? By the Groattle's antlers, get him!

Accuse3.text: We'll make do without a judge. It'll be sorted quickly, believe me. His death will make this feast all the merrier!

SettingLogAccuse.text: You saved the Nerprun Clan and reported the culprit.

SettingLogSpare.text: You saved the Nerprun Clan and spared the culprit.

Wait.text: You're part of the family now. Call on us for anything and we'll be there.

Start.text: I don't trade with no-name Mercenaries. Build a reputation for yourselves among warriors and come back to challenge our champions. Then we can talk business.

Next1.text: You qualify for participation, that's it! You can't expect me to sell you my wares when you haven't even won a fight!

Alt.text:
Buy whatever you want! That's what my shop is for.
And remember, I'll be allowed to offer you unique items after each new challenge!

End.text: I didn't think anyone would ever defeat Hiltrerd... I suppose I can sell you everything I have, now.

Start.text: Only the elite can fight in this arena. Mercenaries like you have to settle for regional arenas.

Welcome1.text: Try to build your reputation. Who knows, maybe one day you will be among our honoured guests.

line0.props.disableReason: Your troop has not yet reached Tier 8 of the <narrator>Power and Glory</narrator> Path.

FirstLevel1.text: Oh! It's you, Mercenaries. I take it you received my letter?

FirstLevel2.text: It is my honour to tell you that you are now among the chosen few allowed to fight in the Arena of Legends. This is a privilege bestowed only upon the strongest warriors in the Five Kingdoms.

FirstLevel3.text: There are no ordinary fighters here! Contestants like you must face champions from other regions in a series of back-to-back fights with various configurations. For now, your rank only allows you to join the <narrator>Fifth League</narrator>. Are you up to the challenge?

FirstLevelReward1.text: By Saint Jeru, that was incredible! No one has ever defeated those champions so quickly.

FirstLevelReward2.text: Here is your reward. I hope you will find it worthy of your talents.

FirstLevelReward3.text: Feel free to fight the Fifth League champions again. You need to improve your reputation before you can challenge the Fourth League.

FirstLevelRewardDiff1.text: Well now! The Fifth League really is too easy for you. I can't wait to see how you'll fare in the next one!

FirstLevelRewardDiff2.text: Please allow me to give you this reward.

FirstLevelRewardDiff3.text: You can take on this league again if you're not tired of it, or move on to the Fourth League, provided your reputation is good enough.

SecondLevel1.text: You have enough reputation to challenge the <narrator>Fourth League</narrator> of champions, but you can continue fighting in the fifth league if you so wish.

SecondLevelReward1.text: Most contestants can't get past Kogo and Toro. You definitely deserve your reward.

SecondLevelReward2.text: You can continue challenging the Fourth League champions, who now know how you fight! As soon as your reputation increases enough, I will summon the Third League.

SecondLevelRewardDiff1.text: Again? By Saint Jeru, I thought our arena would offer you a greater challenge! Take this reward, with our compliments.

SecondLevelRewardDiff2.text: Enjoy this reward, as it is the last one you can get from the Fourth League.

ThirdLevel1.text: The <narrator>Third League</narrator> champions await! I don't want to spoil the surprise, but you're in for a tough fight, this time!

ThirdLevelReward1.text: Ah... I guess it wasn't that tough for you, eh? Take your reward. No one can deny you earned this victory.

ThirdLevelReward2.text: I hope Elicia will get over it, she looked really down... Maybe you could fight her again to cheer her up?

ThirdLevelRewardDiff1.text: This time, it's Trivette who looks disheartened. She won't be happy to hear that you got a reward for humiliating her...

ThirdLevelRewardDiff2.text: I wonder how many champions will give up on their careers after facing you...

FourthLevel1.text: Time to get serious, Mercenaries! <narrator>The Second and First Leagues</narrator> are on a whole other level. Are you well prepared?

FourthLevelReward1.text: A masterful fight! Our champions gave it their best, but you were even more fearsome! I bet you'll like this round's prize!

FourthLevelReward2.text: So? What do you think? It was worth fighting Smot's rats, wasn't it?

FourthLevelRewardDiff1.text: You are truly formidable fighters, Mercenaries. Maybe you should open your own arena when you retire?

FourthLevelRewardDiff2.text: Should you ever need a servant or a referee, you know where to find me!

FifthLevel1.text: We have reached the final stage: you can now take on the <narrator>First League</narrator>.

FifthLevel2.text:
Few have managed to get this far.
Honestly, I wasn't sure I would see it in my lifetime.

FifthLevel3.text: A special champion has arrived here for this occasion. She's the best warrior in all of the Five Kingdoms, if you ask me, made of the same stuff as the legendary Belerion.

FifthLevel4.text: So, do you still feel up to challenging the <narrator>First League</narrator>? Do you have a good strategy? Is your gear in perfect condition?

FifthLevelReward1.text: I can't believe it! You defeated Hiltrerd! That's... I think that might be a first.

FifthLevelReward2.text:
You are champions among champions!
Please allow me to give you this trophy. It's a great honour.

FifthLevelReward3.text:
So, you managed to conquer the Arena of Legends...
What would you like to do now? Challenge our champions again, maybe?

FifthLevelRewardDiff1.text: I had no doubt that you would win! The champions of the Fourth and Fifth League even came to congratulate you!

FifthLevelRewardDiff2.text: You will always be welcome here, but as you just won the hardest fight we can offer, I'm afraid we are now unworthy of your prowess.

RedoLevel.text: Your reputation as warriors is not good enough to join a more prestigious league. But maybe you feel like challenging one of the previous leagues? Fighting the same configuration a second time earns you an extra reward.

RedoEnd.text: Is there a particular league you'd like to challenge? All of them are now available.

NoBeginArena.text:
I understand.
Challenges of this kind are always intimidating.

OnLeaveArena.text: The Arena of Legends is home to the very best. Forfeiting is not unusual at all.

ArenaLost.text: Maybe we should have waited a bit before letting you take on our champions...

ArenaRedo.text: I will never tire of this show! I almost regret not having a reward to give you...

line0.text: Challenge and defeat the Fifth League.
Challenge and defeat the Fourth League.
Challenge and defeat the Third League.
Challenge and defeat the Second League.
Challenge and defeat the First League.

Start.text: Mercenaries? Are you trying to avoid the Border Toll? Are you climbing Mount Altis because you have no Border Pass?

Next1.text: The Guard would be completely swamped without us...

Next2.text: Go on, hand over <gold>200</gold>, and lets be done with it.

Give1.text: Ah, what fine folk you are!

Give2.text: You go on through! Quickly now.

Start.text: Pay up or leave!

Next1.text: The door's open, what are you waiting for? Leave!

Start.text: You pay or you leave...

Next1.text: What are you still doing here?

Start.text: Don't touch the crocswine. It bites.
The creature has its eyes on you...

line0.props.tipText: Touch the crocswine

Start.text: The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.

line0.text: Defeat Alvrick and his gang.

line1.text: Talk to the Steward.

line2.text: Free the Steward and become the Masters of the Castle.

Start.text: As lord of this place, I make it a point of pride to personally welcome all those who come here for the first time.

Next1.text: This fortress is not much more than a ruin at the moment, but with a bit of effort, it will become the heart of a prosperous kingdom. A Fief where we Bandits and Outlaws can establish our own laws, far from the Lords Mayor, the Brokers and the General.

Next2.text: So pledge your allegiance to me, and I shall make you my loyal subjects!

Next3.text: Silence!

Next4.text: Do not listen to my Steward. He gives the same speech to everyone who shows up here, in hopes of seeing us kill each other. But we're smarter than that, aren't we?

line0.props.tipText: Seize the fortress from Alvrick.

Start.text: We went all the way to Vertruse to capture this Steward. Every lord should have one.
This isn't a Tavern, you know! Address our lord Alvrick with respect, and say Your Majesty.
Oh! By Saint Jeru! How did I wind up here?

Next1.text: Please don't!

Next2.text: Are... are you simply going to accept being this Bandit's subjects? You could be the lords of this place! Yes! You could rule over these mountains, and even...

Wait.text: What are you waiting for? Kill this Bandit! You could be the masters of this place!

Start.text: Free at last! I knew this plan would work out eventually.

Next1.text: Well, I suppose you're the new masters here. This pile of rubble is all yours. Congratulations. Really.

Next2.text: If I may say so, a domain like this especially in this condition won't be easy to administer. Of course, the ruffians who captured me also murdered my previous employer. Which means I'm suddenly free of all obligations...

line0.props.tipText: Start the tutorial missions for the Fief.

FirstMission.text:
Excellent!
I've already had plenty of time to think about the most pressing improvements to be made while I was rotting in my cage.

FirstMission1.text: Why not start with this Throne Room? You can't receive your subjects properly in this hovel, let alone representatives from other kingdoms.

NoTutorial.text:
Fair enough! If you think you can manage without my help, I won't get in your way.
I'll await your orders here in your Throne Room. Don't hesitate to come and see me if you need anything.

Start.text: Outsiders? Sit down, make yourselves at home! It's not often we get news from the outside world.

Unless you like smelly swamps and giant mosquitoes, you should turn back.
To the north of here lies Ludern, one of the worst quagmires in the world.

Next1.text: I see you are well-travelled! Where would you like to go: south to Tiltren or north to Ludern?

Start.text: Who dares approach Lord Alvrick's fortress?

Next1.text: Oh! Have you come to join us? Wonderful! We could use some strong arms around here these ruins aren't going to rebuild themselves!

Next2.text: Go on in and introduce yourselves to our leader. He'll decide what to do with you.

NoDLC.text:
Return from whence you came, Mercenaries!
This fortress belongs to Lord Alvrick! He needs no one but us to serve him!

Start.text:
Ah! My most loyal subjects!
Just look at the masterwork you've helped me to build. A worthy home for Count Jan Ald Brigga!

Next1.text:
Inside, I'll welcome all the peasants who will acknowledge me as their sole master.
Our County will be so prosperous that Gosenberg will beg me to join the Broker Council!

Start.text: I've come from Grinmeer to see Jan Ald Brigga!

Next1.text: He has been chosen by the Beast! He is the sacred one!

Start.text: Jan Ald Brigga is not only a great Count, he's the chosen of the Ancients!

Next1.text:
Before him, no one ever managed to build anything in these cursed lands!
His greatness will protect us from the Ghost Pack and the Beast!

Start.text:
Glory to Count Jan Ald Brigga! The legitimate lord who will save these cursed lands from ruin!
He is Saint Jeru reincarnated!

line0.text: Talk to Madman Jan to learn more.

line1.text: Bring ::vars.amount::Wood to Madman Jan or make him listen to reason (::vars.amount2::).

Start.text: Bow down before the Count of Brigga, for you are guests in his home!

Next1.text: My palace is currently under construction! It's only a matter of time and materials before it rises proudly over these uncultured lands!

Next2.text:
You know, as my subjects, it's your duty to help your lord.
I expect you to bring me all the wood you can find in my lands.
But fear not, a magnanimous Count like myself will reward your loyalty.

line0.props.tipText: Make Madman Jan listen to reason.

Convince2.text: By the Ancients! What possessed me to come here?

Convince3.text: I must leave this place! Right away! The Ghost Pack is probably hot on my heels already!

Give1.text: Saint Lenaid bless you! Thanks to you, construction can continue!

Give2.text: You are dismissed, my admirable subjects. A lord must take on his part of the work as well.

Start.text: I don't care if the Beast went off for a stroll in Ludern! All I know is that today, it's come back to Brigga! Our task remains the same!

Next0.text: Finding the Beast's lair is the most important mission that a Huntsman can be entrusted with. It's the only place where the monster is vulnerable. It's the only chance for the clans to ambush it.

Next1.text: Pay attention to the details! Find me even the slightest trace that's out of the ordinary don't settle for the obvious. Meticulously analyse everything you find, then come back here and report to me.

Next2.text:
Got that?
Now get to work! All of Harag is counting on us, boys!
And remember, the reward will match the difficulty of your task.

Accept1.text:
What? You want to join in, too?
Have you at least got a Huntsman in your company?

Accept2.text: In that case, you'd better not waste any time catching up to the other participants. With a little luck, you'll find someone to show you the ropes!

Accept2Alt.text:
In that case, maybe you've still got a chance...
Catch up to the other participants and follow their lead. With a little luck, maybe you can be of some use to them.

Wait.text:
None of the Huntsmen have returned yet.
This Hunt is the toughest I've ever had to lead. Normally, we find the lair in no more than a week.

End1.text:
Ah! Mercenaries! We've been waiting for you!
I hope you haven't shown up empty-handed!

End2.text:
Tules be praised, all of the Huntsmen have returned safe and sound.
I expect a full report from each of you on your Hunts.
Don't leave out a single detail! Even the most insignificant tuft of fur could turn out to be a critical lead.

line0.props.tipText: Report on the Hunt.

End3.text: That is... troubling.

End3bis.text: If you've all correctly interpreted the traces left by the Beast, they lead us... straight to the top of Mount Urach.

End5.text: We've got to find a cave on that damned wall?

End6.text: We'll have to make the clans climb?

End7.text:
Ah, well, not to worry. We'll find a solution!
I'll head to Redane. Master Tracker Versinn will know what to do.
Rest up and enjoy your rewards. You'll need all your strength for what lies ahead.

MissionDesc1.text: Find a Huntsman who's willing to share their knowledge with you.

SettingLog.text: You have found where the Beast's lair is located.

line0.text: Take on Master Tracker Videss's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Find at least ::vars.amountCount:: traces of the Beast before reporting back (::vars.amount::/::vars.amountCount::).

line3.text: Report to Master Tracker Videss.

Start.text:
Knowing Master Tracker Versinn, he'll want to climb the mountain.
Get ready, this won't be a pleasure hike.

The icy winds that blow on Urach will make the climb pure hell.
Not to mention that we'll have to get a whole army of Trackers to climb who are more used to swamps than high places!

I'm sorry that your help was in vain.
Climbing that Eye-forsaken mountain is impossible!

Next1.text:
Ah! Damn it! The Beast will escape and devastate the Five Kingdoms!
What can we possibly do?

Start.text:
Might as well head straight back to Ludern and prepare for the Beast's arrival!
There's no way I'm going to die climbing a mountain!
Part of the bag's contents has become mouldy.
There's some sort of notebook next to the skeleton.

Read1.text: Day 34 of the Hunt We found Llyr at the edge of the forest! Alive! For someone who faced the Beast in single combat, he was in fairly good shape! Credne ordered us to make camp and open the bottles of mead in his honour.

Read2.text: Day 36 of the Hunt Many of us think that Llyr's mind has been shattered by terror, but Credne refuses to believe us. He claims that Llyr's behaviour is merely due to his sadness at losing his companions, and that it will pass before long.

Read3.text: Day 39 of the Hunt Llyr has completely stopped talking. This morning, I noticed he had a strange gleam in his eye and that his hair had turned white. I don't think this is just from either sadness or terror. There's something else.

Start.text: The Beast is asleep! Now's your chance to attack!

line0.text: Help Tracker Issa to escape.

Start.text: So wait, I'm not allowed to take part in the Hunt, but you are? Outsiders?

Next1.text:
Treason! Treason!
Curse them all! May the Tules drown them! May the gods reject them! May the Beast devour them alive!

Next2.text:
I must get out of here! Open this cage, Mercenaries!
I've got to make them pay! This affront can only be avenged with blood!
Take my fangs and let me out!

Start.text:
They'll be sorry they ever locked me up! I won't give them a moment's peace!
They'll see I was ready for combat!
The lake feeds directly into the basin.

line1.props.tipText: Fill a flask with water from the lake.

Alt.text: The water in the basin looks different somehow.

line0.props.disableReason: No animals influenced by the Beast.

line0.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
Curses! Those bastards can really fight.
Not sure we could have taken them alone.

Next1.text:
Good thing you came along to straighten things out!
Business can get back to normal!

Next2.text: The Trackers believe that the water in this lake has been blessed by their gods. They claim it cleanses their animals of the Beast's influence. Needless to say, they all rush here during the Hunt.

Next3.text:
We figured it would be a waste not to take advantage of it. Especially since the Ghost Pack doesn't come around these parts.
Minimum risk, maximum profit.

Wait.text: As long as the Trackers pay, they can drink all the water they want.

SettingLog.text: You allowed a group of Bandits to sell access to the Mirror of the Ancients.

Start.text: What's the big idea? You think just because you helped us, you can drink our water for free?

Next1.text:
The best I can do is a friendly discount.
After all, your animals' lives are at stake here! Surely they're worth a few krowns!

Start.text:
There's something weird sparkling down there in the water.
Did you see it too?

What's all this nonsense about krowns?
Why doesn't anyone chase those bandits away?
<narrator>The Beast's influence is starting to show.</narrator>

What have you done?
Why is the lake different?

Next1.text:
We've got a business to run! If this water isn't magic any more, it's worth nothing!
Give us back what you took! Right now!

MissionDesc1.text: Eliminate the witnesses to your misdeeds.

MissionDesc2.text: Talk to Huntsman Mervice.

Start.text:
They stood between the Trackers and their sacred mission!
These bandits deserve a punishment worse than death! Curse them! May their bodies rot unburied!

Next1.text: You, the outsiders who restored justice! You deserve to be rewarded!

Next2.text: In the name of the Gods in the depths of their tombs! In the name of the Tules who rule over nature! Accept this gift from the hands of druid Abraxa!

Accept1.text: Thanks to you, the Blessing of the Ancients will ward off the Beast's influence. Yes! The Trackers will give their loyal companions lake water to drink, and it will save them from the monster!

Accept2.text: The Beast will die, again and again! The clans will accomplish their mission!

SettingLog.text: You let the Trackers retake possession of the Mirror of the Ancients.

Start.text:
The Ancients have given us their blessing.
It is an immense honour and a great responsibility.
I swore that I'd be worthy of it.

Bellarde managed to drink the lake water in time, but it was all very last minute.
I was this close to paying those bandits.
A she-wolf in top form.

What have you done?
Why has the lake stopped shining?

Next1.text:
You've broken the Ancients' blessing! You've doomed us all!
You filthy traitors!

MissionDesc1.text: Eliminate the witnesses to your misdeeds.

MissionDesc2.text: Talk to Huntsman Mervice.

Start.text:
All those people dead...
Was it you who killed them?

Next1.text:
Oh! By the gods! Murdering a druid...
I'll be banned from Harag!

Next2.text:
We have no other choice! This has just got to work!
These horrors can't have been committed in vain!
Let's hurry and get this over with!

Bandits1.text: Well, I suppose it was the will of the gods. Daring to steal from the brave souls fighting the Beast... they deserved a harsh punishment! You've done well.

Bandits2.text:
Let's hurry back to the Tomb of the Ancient One.
The Trackers will need the blessing. I don't want to keep it to ourselves any longer than necessary.

MissionDesc1.text: Place the blessing on the door of the Tomb.

Start.text: A seal is needed to open this door.
You've interrupted some creature's meal
According to the inscription, this man is called Urashu.
Your Companions notice two red eyes in the shadows.
There's something under the bookshelf.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Miner.

line1.props.tipText: Select 2 Companions strong enough to move the bookshelf.

Start.text: A seal is needed to open this door.
Something is moving in the darkness.

The door is stuck.
A sufficiently nimble Companion might be able to slip through the gap and open it from the other side.

line0.props.tipText: Select a nimble Companion.

Start.text: The remains of a very old machine.
Your Companions recognise the outlines of an ancient workshop. Half of a Copper Seal has been abandoned here.

line0.props.tipText: Reassemble the two halves of the seal.

Start.text: The stone is covered with intricate inscriptions. You'll need a Scholar's help to decipher them.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Scholar from among your Companions.

End.text: Your Companions have deciphered the recipe for the Iron Seal. They should be able to craft it now.

Start.text: A seal is needed to open this door.
The door is locked.
Someone used this anvil to break a steel seal.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Blacksmith to repair the seal.

Start.text: The door to the Tomb is completely closed.

Next1.text: The door to the Tomb is completely closed.

Start.text: You came? Oh! By the Eye!

Next0.text: May the Tules forgive me for what I'm about to tell you!

Next1.text: I know how to reach the top of the mountain and the Beast's lair... By passing through the Tomb of the Ancient One! It's the only way to defeat the Beast without running the risk of losing all of our men on the climb.

Next2.text:
You've got to help me! No Tracker will agree to set foot in these ruins. It's taboo for our people!
I beg of you, this scourge affects all of the kingdoms... and... and you can keep the reward from the Hunt all to yourselves!

Accept1.text: I thought for sure you'd refuse.

Accept2.text:
First let's open the Tomb.
If our legends are true, we'll have to commit the first of our blasphemies.
Follow me, and let's pray together for the gods to have pity on us.

NextLudern1.text:
I'm no better than those Alazarian looters!
May the Tules forgive me for what I'm about to tell you!

MissionDesc1.text: Help Huntsman Mervice.

MissionDesc2.text: Find Huntsman Mervice.

End1.text:
Here we are. All that's left is to place the blessing in its receptacle.
Here's hoping I interpreted the druids' chants correctly...

OpenDoor1.text:
I was right! The doors are open! We've done it!
The Ancient One will lead you straight to the Beast's lair!

OpenDoor2.text: Once you're face to face with the sleeping monster, show it no mercy! Hit as hard as you can! The first strike must be powerful enough to bring down its defences! You won't get a second chance!

OpenDoor3.text: One last piece of advice, Mercenaries. Our legends say that this tomb is truly immense. As tall as the mountain itself! Some druids even claim that the tomb was built before the mountain. So... prepare yourselves. And be careful.

MissionDesc3.text: Make your way through the Ruin to find the Beast's lair.

line0.text: Take on Huntsman Mervice's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: By the Tules!

What do you want?
Can't you see I'm praying?
This man is still breathing, but his life is hanging by a thread.
Why did you heal me? Why didn't you let me die? My clan has been wiped out! I don't deserve the title of Master Tracker!

Next1.text: Look around you! It's all my fault! My clan was counting on me, and... when the Herald showed up to join the fight, I lost it! I panicked!

Next2.text:
Here, take this. It was supposed to be for our return trip...
I can't bear to show my face to their families.

Start.text: This Tracker was crushed by an immense paw.
This woman was thrown by something with titanic strength. Her skull split when she hit a rock.
Huge teeth have ground up this Tracker's legs.
This woman's face is frozen in fear.
Did you see those blokes curled up on the stretchers? That's all I've got left to fight the Heralds of the Beast! The others were devoured!

Next1.text:
Damn it! We can't kill the Beast as long as its damned lackeys are alive! It'll summon them as soon as we start to get the upper hand!
The Hunt will fail because of us! The whole clan will be dishonoured!

Next2.text:
You've got to help me, Mercenaries!
Rid us of those Heralds! The fate of the Five Kingdoms depends on it!

Accept1.text: Take the scouts' reports. They'll tell you where the Heralds were last seen. Then just wait for nightfall and follow the trail.

Accept2.text: Stay alert! These creatures aren't just ordinary monsters from the Ghost Pack. These are Heralds. They're much stronger and smarter!

Wait.text: Take this mission seriously. My whole clan is counting on you.

End1.text: Back already? Please tell me you got at least one!

End2.text: All three? You defeated all three Heralds that quickly? That's incredible, Mercenaries! How on earth did you manage? You're... This is a feat worthy of the best Trackers of Harag!

End3.text:
I hope this reward will be sufficient.
Not only has my honour and that of my clan been saved, but now we finally have a chance of bringing this Hunt to a successful finish. The Beast won't be able to call on its lackeys for help!

EndWait.text: I'll be there to help take on the Beast! You can count on me!

SettingLog.text: You have killed all three Heralds of the Beast.

line0.text: Take on Master Tracker Tiercos's mission.

line1.text: Use the scouts' reports to track down and kill the Heralds of the Beast (::vars.amount::/3).

Start.text: The incompetence of Tiercos and his clan is putting us all in danger.

Next1.text: The Beast will call on its Heralds if it finds itself in any trouble. Fighting all four of those monsters at once is a guaranteed death sentence!

End1.text: Do you know why those monsters are called the Heralds of the Beast?

End2.text: They appear before the Beast is reborn. Those creatures are how we know that Harag has to prepare for the Hunt.

Start.text: I... I'm fine...
The Tracker is struggling to breathe.
Something is wrong. The Tracker isn't moving.
Mercenaries! Is that you?

Next1.text:
Then you know what to do!
The ambush was successful, all that's left is to finish off that monster!

Alt11.text: Tules take me, this monster just won't die!

Alt12.text:
It's already nearly escaped from our ambush!
Hurry, Mercenaries! Help us finish it off!
My Trackers are exhausted!

Alt21.text: This time the Beast was easy to find! You haven't missed anything!

Alt22.text: Are you ready to fight? It's time for the grand finale!

Ludern1.text:
The rebirth happened much too fast!
What did Alazar do?

Ludern2.text: My men are still exhausted from the last Hunt! We won't last long without your help!

Start.text:
This obviously isn't your first Hunt!
Your movements are much more confident than last time.
Take your part of the reward, you've earned it.

Next1.text: May the Tules see to it that our paths cross again someday.

Alt11.text:
You have answered our call once again. I am honoured by your loyalty.
Here is your part of the reward. For risking your lives alongside us once again.

Alt21.text: I knew you'd come! The men couldn't stop talking about you during the Hunt.

Alt22.text: You're part of our team. This reward is nothing compared to the high esteem Harag has for you.

Ludern1.text:
Damn! That could have been a lot worse.
How did Alazar manage to summon the Beast? Can they do it again?

Ludern2.text: I need to go to Canopus to make my report. If the Northerners can control the Beast's rebirths, we're all doomed.

Start.text: Don't come any closer! I can do it! Velba will return to her senses! Whatever you do, don't distract her!

Next1.text:
Calm down! Please!
The Mirror of the Ancients isn't far now! We're almost there, you can do it!

line1.props.tipText: The Beast's influence is too strong. The bear will never make it to the Mirror of the Ancients in time.

Start.text:
Noooo!
What have you done?!

Thank you! Thank you! Whoever you are!
Velba has been my partner for as long as I can remember. I don't know what I'd do if I lost her.

Next1.text:
Here! This is our share.
I'm sure the clan will be relieved to have us both back.

Start.text:
You're monsters! Why didn't you listen?
Why didn't you give us a chance?
Versinn and the clans thought we were mad, but we were right all along! The mercenaries who joined the Hunt... that was you!

Next2.text: Do they know what you did in Ludern? Desecrating the Tomb of the gods? Murdering Master Tracker Brighid? Summoning the Beast?

Next3.text: Oh! You can count on us to tell them all about it! Including how we avenged Ludern by killing you!

line1.props.tipText: Pretend you're someone else.

Convinced1.text: Why do you outsiders all love robbing corpses so much? We were just about ready to kill you!

Convinced2.text:
We should arrest you for looting!
If it were anyone other than these scum, you'd be rotting in the Ludern Jail by now!

Convinced3.text: There's no way I'm giving you the whole bounty. You've already helped yourselves more than enough.

Start.text:
Well, Mercenaries? Heading out to hunt some monsters?
You're letting out your wild side, is that it?

Next2.text: Ah! Your troop is exactly as you were described. A ramshackle gang who betrayed Alazar and turned their back on Knowledge to protect the superstitions of some barbarian horde.

Next3.text:
The King of Alazar is very unhappy with the loss of his greatest scholars. And as for me, I'm very unhappy I've had to come all the way here from Drombach to find you.
I'll make you pay for that.

line1.props.tipText: Pretend you're someone else.

Convinced1.text:
Other mercenaries?
You mean you're wearing the armour of those scoundrels who killed Hadwige and Winfrith?

Convinced2.text: Ugh! This habit you mercenaries have of looting your victims' bodies is positively disgusting.

Convinced3.text:
Well, if the traitors are dead, there's no reason I should keep wading around through this kingdom's muck.
Go back to your scavenging, I suppose.

Start.text: They're all dead! Every last one! The Ghost Pack has killed off my clan!

Next1.text: They locked me in this cage to protect me! They knew I wasn't ready yet... They wanted me to survive! They saved me!

Next2.text: I'll never doubt my companions' word again! I'll trust in them! I'll be Harag's most reliable Tracker! I'll keep my clan's memory alive!

line2.props.tipText: Offer something to honour Limbre's clan.

Recruit.text:
Count on me, Mercenaries!
I'll follow you wherever you go!

Empathize1.text:
That's a nice offering. I think they would have liked it.
Count on me to conduct the most beautiful ceremony for them.
Take this, for what you've done for me.

Start.text: It was an honour to meet you, Mercenaries. I'll never forget your trust in me.

Next1.text:
Going on this mission with you was the most terrifying thing I've ever done and the most heroic.
I hope you'll forgive me for making you break so many taboos.

Next2.text: Farewell, my friends. I'll pray for our paths to cross again one day.

Start.text: The Beast...

Next1.text:
The Beast is dead! The Five Kingdoms are saved!
May the gods bear witness to our courage: we have fulfilled our sacred mission!

Next2.text: No words can fully express my admiration and gratitude, Mercenaries.

Next3.text: Huntsman Mervice told me how you decided to climb the mountain barehanded rather than putting our Huntsmen' lives at risk.

Next4.text: Not to mention the mortal blow you dealt to the Beast, up there in its lair. Try as it might to escape, it was so weak that our reinforcements had no trouble stopping it. That final battle only added to your legend.

Next5.text: The reward is all yours, Mercenaries. Accept it on behalf of the people of Harag. Your valour is an example to us all.

Accept1.text: May the gods grant us many years of peace before the Beast is next reborn.

Start.text: This way, Mercenaries! Over here!
Unbelievable! You're alive!

Next1.text: When I saw the Beast crashing down the mountain with no one behind it, I thought for sure you'd sacrificed yourselves, or something along those lines...

Next2.text:
But here you are! Still alive, while the creature is in its death throes!
I don't know what you did up there, but it was a huge success!

Next3.text: Come on, then! Finish what you started! The Hunt ends today!

Start.text: We have no choice: to defeat the Beast, we must climb Urach.

Next1.text: I've asked the few mountain climbers that the Trackers have in their ranks to go ahead as scouts. I hope they'll find a route that the others can manage without too much trouble.

Start.text: Have you been here before? If so, you must have noticed that there's something shining at the bottom of the lake. The druids say it's the mark of the Ancients' blessing. Well, I think that is what will open the door to the Tomb.

Next0.text: Of course, if we take it, there's a risk that the lake water won't heal the animals any more...

Next1.text: We'd only be borrowing it! I swear on my honour that as soon as we don't need it any more, I'll put everything back where it was!

Next2.text: Go on, Mercenaries! Just think of all the lives we'll be saving!

Accept.text: Once we're inside... the occupants of the Mirror of the Ancients may not approve of our methods. Try to act natural. Blend in with the crowd, all right?

MissionDesc1.text: Grab whatever's shining at the bottom of the lake.

Start.text:
You're joining the Hunt?
Best of luck, Mercenaries.
It warms my heart to see the other Kingdoms finally giving a damn about this mission!

Next1.text:
Oh! You want to know how to track the Beast?
It's a complicated art, it'll use up a lot of my valuable time...

Convinced1.text:
By the Tules, you're right! The time I spend teaching you the basics of the Hunt will be time saved in our search for the lair!
Now, listen carefully!

Bribe1.text:
That's very generous of you. I never imagined I'd be paid for my art!
Let me explain how I go about it...

Trapper.text:
...and then once you've found the print, your Huntsman will have to examine it very carefully. Take your time with it! Even the tiniest detail might reveal where the lair is located!
Give it a try with this one. I'll be right here beside you!

Wait.text: Don't be shy, Mercenaries. I know you can examine this trace properly!

End1.text:
Fine work, Mercenaries! Many Master Trackers wouldn't have done as well!
I guess I must be a good teacher! Ha ha!

End2.text: Keep it up, you're on the right track! Gather as much information as you can, and it will lead you to the Beast's lair. Once you know its location, come back to the Monstrous Carcass to make your report.

MissionDesc1.text: Give ::vars.amount1:: Fangs or ::vars.amount2:: to Huntsman Mervice to benefit from his knowledge.

MissionDesc2.text: Examine the trace left by the Beast.

Start.text: Come on over, folks! Four crowns per person! A real bargain!

Next1.text: You're making a profit off the blessing of the Ancients! It's despicable! It's a sacrilege!

Next2.text:
A sacrilege?! Let's not get carried away!
We're just earning a living!

Next3.text: Besides, you and your boors should be grateful we even let you into our hideout. I don't know many other gangs as accommodating as ours.

Next4.text:
Don't talk down to us, you great souse!
This isn't your lair! The Mirror of the Ancients belongs to the people of Harag!

Next4Bis.text: Kill them, Mercenaries! Kill them! The Trackers won't pay to fight the Beast!

Next5.text: Yeah, they'll defend us! These Mercenaries are civilised people! They can see that you're all just barbarians, and that we're honest folk willing to pay for their services!

Start.text: Damn it! They're surrounded! We've got to get them out of there!

Next1.text:
My clan will create a diversion!
Take care of the scouts and run for it! Don't stop!

Start.text:
We... we survived! Oh, thank you!
Without you and Sevella...

Next1.text:
Wait!
Where's Sevella?

Start.text:
Curses...
That's her, all right. That's Sevella.

End2.text:
May the Tules curse me! She gave her life for us.
I'll never be able to look her parents in the eye again.

End3.text:
I'd better take what's left of her body back to the village of Redane... and report to Master Tracker Versinn.
Come with us, Mercenaries. I'm sure he'll want to hear your version.

NotifEndFirstEncounter.text: You've managed to escape the Beast.

MissionDescEndFirstEncounter.text: Find Tracker Sevella in the area.

MissionDescIntro2.text: Give your report on the fight to Master Tracker Versinn.

MissionDescSpawnKill.text: Talk to Master Tracker Tiercos to get your reward.

MissionDescTrackEnd.text: Report back to Master Tracker Videss.

MissionDescLakeBandits.text: Talk to the Bandit Chief to get your reward.

MissionDescLakeTracker.text: Talk to the Harag Trackers to get your reward.

MissionDescBeastFight1.text: Catch up to the Beast and defeat it.

Start.text: You dug up a chest.
This Brotherhood Mercenary must have been one of the outsiders who came to try their luck in the Hunt.
The dismembered body of a Tracker.
The corpse gives off an unbearable smell, as though the Tracker had died of some gruesome disease.
The Beast crushed this wolf with all of its weight. It's now little more than a smear on the ground. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information from it.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: Among the animal remains, ::vars.name:: discovered a tuft of fur belonging to the Beast. It's covered with some sort of black dust.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

Start.text: There's not much left of this animal, which appears to have been chewed up in a gigantic maw and spat out again. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information from it.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: While inspecting the wolf, ::vars.name:: discovered petals from a snow iris, a flower that only grows at high altitude.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: Enormous tracks sunk deep into the ground. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information here.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: ::vars.name:: has made a surprising discovery in one of the tracks: a pair of mole-rat incisors. The Beast may have been unwittingly carrying them around.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: These tracks are less widely spaced than usual. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information here.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: These shorter strides indicate that the Beast was moving more slowly than usual. Perhaps it was tired when it headed eastward?

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: Another crushed animal. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information from it.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: Upon closer inspection, ::vars.name:: found a small fragment of painted stone in the wolf's fur. It may have fallen from the Beast as it trampled the animal.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: Trees knocked down and heavy prints in the ground. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information here.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: Among the branches, ::vars.name:: found one of the Beast's many arms. Though torn off, it still holds a piece of rock in its claws.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: The Beast damaged this Ancient structure. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information here.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: The damage is considerable, even for the Beast. The only possible explanation is that it fell onto the aqueduct.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: Nothing remains of this Trackers' Camp, utterly ravaged by the Beast and its Pack. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information here.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: Among the collapsed tents, ::vars.name:: catches sight of a sticky mass the remains of a very old spider web. It must have got caught in the Beast's fur, then fallen off during its rampage.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: The trees have been blown flat, smashed to the ground by some incredible force. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information here.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: Upon lifting a fallen trunk, ::vars.name:: discovered petals from flowers that don't grow at this altitude. This snow iris is far from its mountain home.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: The bear is still warm: the Beast must have feasted on it recently. A Huntsman may be able to glean more information from it.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Trapper.text: It's not the bear carcass that most interests ::vars.name::, but the direction of the tracks, which point toward the top of the mountain.

SettingLog.text: A trace has provided some information on the Beast's lair.

StoryDone.text: This trace left by the Beast is quite old. It will not lead your Companions anywhere, but could tell you more about the creature.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a Huntsman from among your Companions.

Start.text: An offering to the Tules certainly wouldn't go amiss when facing the Beast.
The Tules are described as curious spirits who accept all kinds of offerings.
A fair portion of the offerings have already been nibbled at.
You found the previous lighthouse keepers.
Be sure to stock up well you never know what might happen in Brigga...
I'm not familiar with your faces. What clan are you from?

Ludern.text:
How did Alazar manage to get the Beast out of Brigga?
Do they have the power to control it?

Start.text: Don't worry, I'm a veteran of the Hunt. This is actually the third one I've been on.

Heal.text: With a bit of luck, you might make it through unscathed!

Start.text: Oh my, what an honour! I'm being forced to go along with the Trackers! Just wait until I find out who volunteered me... I'll make them wish they were never born!

Repair.text: I've done what I can. Your armour should hold together a little while longer.

Start.text:
The bridge guard let you pass?
You must really be good at your jobs, Mercenaries!
I just so happen to have some information for people like you...

Done.text: Excellent choice. I can't wait to see where that leads you.

line0.props.tipText: The temporary village of Redane awoke to a violent dispute.

line1.props.tipText: A gang of Bandits has apparently taken refuge in one of Brigga's most sacred places.

line2.props.tipText: The lair remains elusive, but the Huntsmen show no signs of giving up the search.

line3.props.tipText: The heralds of the Beast are still on the prowl in Brigga. Master Tracker Tiercos must have failed in his mission.

Sevella.text: The temporary village of Redane awoke to a violent dispute.

Lake.text: A gang of Bandits has apparently taken refuge in one of Brigga's most sacred places.

Carcass.text: The lair remains elusive, but the Huntsmen are redoubling their efforts to find it.

Spawn.text: The heralds of the Beast are still on the prowl in Brigga. Master Tracker Tiercos must have failed in his mission.

DeliverMission1.text:
And here I thought I'd been forgotten in the wilds of Brigga! I'm so glad to see that we're still in the race.
Thank you very much, Mercenaries!

End.text: You know as much as I do about Brigga.

Start.text:
I've got an army of Trackers to feed, so I'd better warn you, this is no time to be picky.
We're not in Gosenberg here.

MissionDesc1.text: Follow Sevella to the Beast.

line0.text: Listen to the interaction between the Trackers.

line1.text: Talk to Tracker Sevella to learn more.

line2.text: Take on Tracker Sevella's mission.

line3.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Sevella has already been buried. A few of her Companions have placed offerings on her grave.

line0.props.tipText: Pay tribute to the Tracker.

Start.text:
Evros told me what happened.
She and her men fought hard for their lives.

Next1.text:
I don't blame you for anything. Sevella was as stubborn as a crocswine. She would have sacrificed her life with or without your help.
At least your support allowed her to achieve her goal. So her promise has to be honoured.

Next2.text:
You survived, and your spirit doesn't seem to have been broken by terror. I'd be happy to have warriors like you in my ranks.
This Hunt is turning out to be tougher than the previous ones.

Next3.text: Stopping the Beast from spreading destruction is the most sacred mission that the Ancients have entrusted to the people of Harag. Each time that behemoth emerges from the bowels of Brigga, the clans come together to defeat it. Time and again.

Next4.text: Facing this monster head-on is certain to fail, though. Our only chance is to take it by surprise, when it's vulnerable and separated from its ghostly lackeys.

Next5.text: Harag's various clans have already divided up the task. Help them, and you'll be rewarded.

Wait1.text: Finding the Beast's lair is the only way to take it by surprise.

Ludern.text: The Beast has been seen in Ludern. This rebirth is different to the others. I hope there's still time to find its lair.

Moutain.text:
How do we get to the lair?
I'm thinking, Mercenaries. I'm thinking.

SettingLog.text: You helped the scouts to avoid their grim fate.

Start.text:
Don't worry.
Master Tracker Versinn will find a solution to our problem.
That's why the clans chose him.
<narrator>The animal's name suits it well.</narrator>

Scabby won't let me near him. He hates me!
He knows it's my fault Sevella died.

Next1.text: But I've got to get him to the Mirror of the Ancients! Without that lake water, he'll turn into a monster like the other animals!

Next2.text:
Versinn has only given me a couple of days to heal him of the Beast's influence. After that, I'll have to put him down myself...
He's asking me to kill Sevella's boar!

line0.props.tipText: Recruit Scabby the boar.

Accept1.text: Are you sure? Then hurry up and heal him! Take him to the Mirror of the Ancients or find a cure before he changes.

Wait.text: Take good care of Scabby. He's all I have left of Sevella.

Start.text:
Sevella should have let us die!
She was killed because of us.
Scabby has every reason to hate me.

BoarDead.text:
Sevella should have let us die!
She was killed because of us.
I couldn't even save her boar!

End.text:
Versinn led the others to the foot of the mountain.
I haven't the strength to go with them.

Start.text: I can't mark the face of a non-initiate. Only those who have completed the ritual of Tules' Glade are worthy of such an honour.

Tatoo1.text:
War paint is a gift from the Tules to the people of Harag.
No Tracker would confront the Beast without the forest spirits' protection.

Tatoo2.text: Does another one of your Companions want war paint?

Start.text: We can't just let our scouts die like that! We've got to send in some men!

Next1.text: Send in some men? I won't sacrifice lives to save others!

Next2.text: Our best Huntsmen are with them! How do you expect to find the Beast's lair without their help?

Next3.text:
How will we deal with the lair if we have no one to send there?
Focus, Sevella! Your men know the risks!

Next4.text: By the Tules! You can't let them be eaten like that!

End1.text:
Attacking the Beast head on is bound to fail. These scouts are already dead.
My duty is to protect the living.

Start.text: I don't give a damn what Versinn thinks! I won't sit around and let my brothers be slaughtered!

Next1.text:
Come with me, Mercenaries! We can still save them!
My clan will give you whatever you want in exchange!

Next2.text: There's no time to lose! Follow me!

Start.text: Letting your companions die is sometimes the wisest path.

Ludern.text:
If the Beast was really seen in Ludern, then Master Tracker Versinn is right to be concerned.
The Beast isn't supposed to leave Brigga that quickly.

Start.text: Of all the Master Trackers who join in hunting the Beast, the clans chose Versinn to guide us.

Next1.text: We must be willing to put our lives in his hands.

Start.text:
After each rebirth, the Beast stays in Brigga for a while to gather its strength.
We can't miss this opportunity!

Ludern1.text:
They say that Alazarian scholars were able to draw the Beast to Ludern.
What would have happened if it hadn't returned to Brigga?

Ludern2.text:
Foreigners don't understand what a scourge it represents!
They don't know what we go through every cycle to protect them!

TradePath1MissionDesc3.text: Negotiate the terms of a trade partnership between a Marheim merchant and Aldeberth.

TradePath1MissionDesc4.text: Meet with Aldeberth in the Tiltren Tavern.

TradePath1MissionDesc5.text: Go back to speak with the Tiltren merchant.

TradePath1MissionDesc6.text: Go back to speak with the Marheim merchant.

MightPath1MissionDesc2.text: Defeat the groups of Bandits so that you can easily assault the lair.

MightPath1MissionDesc3.text: While you were busy, the Harag's Bane gang defeated a group of Bandits.

MightPath1MissionDesc4.text: Join the Harag's Bane gang outside the Bandits' Lair.

MightPath1MissionDesc5.text: Go to the Marheim Tavern to collect your reward from the Brotherhood.

MightPath3MissionDesc2.text: Go to the Brotherhood's Rouste Pitch to play a game.

KnowledgePath1MissionDesc2.text: Find the artefact hidden in Saint Eleor Abbey.

KnowledgePath1End.text: You won't learn anything new here. You must inform your client of what happened.

MissionDescMightPathArena2.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and defeat the Fourth League.

MissionDescMightPathArena3.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and defeat the Third League.

MissionDescMightPathArena4.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and defeat the Second League.

MissionDescMightPathArena5.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and defeat the First League.

QuestAudience_10.text: Some residents of the Fief have disappeared! Find them and punish their captors.

QuestAudience_24.text: A Ghost Pack is haunting Mount Altis and threatening your residents.

QuestAudience_25.text: It's only a question of time before the Mount Altis Rat Infestation spreads the Plague to your Fief.

QuestAudience_26.text: Send your Mercenaries to inspect the place where a caravan disappeared and recover its cargo.

QuestAudience_44.text: Some Smugglers are shamelessly enriching themselves on your backs. They need to be taught a lesson.

Locate_A1CryptAdmiral.text: Explore the Sepulchre revealed by the Fief's Scholars.
