Start.text: How dare you attack the Brothers?

Next1.text: Wait! What? Was it the Brotherhood who put a price on our heads?

Start.text: Do not oppose the will of the All-Seeing Eye!

Next1.text: Tis the Eye's command that heresy be purged by fire!

Start.text: Defending the weak and the fatherless is easy on a full belly!

Next1.text: But when you go hungry, chivalry and fealty go out the window!

Start.text: Out of our way, peasants! You cannot begin to understand the noble intentions we pursue!

Next1.text: Colonel Deteore's legacy is rotting away in the Ludern swamps! We must wrest her belongings from the mud and the hands of these savages!

Start.text: The Guard was already after me long before you were born!

Next1.text: If you think you can do better than your predecessors, you're as foolish as they are.

Start.text: I will not back down! Animals must be treated with respect!

Next1.text: Minstrels are treating them like dirt! They beat them if they don't comply, deprive them of food, all for the plebs entertainment!

Next2.text: Our cause is worthy, you will not stop me!

Start.text: I can't stand these yokels and their constant moaning. You have burned down the Tavern!, Bartes is a drunk!, He gives the Brotherhood a bad name...

Next1.text: They'll rebuild that hovel in no time!

Next2.text: I don't get what they're complaining about!

Start.text:
Oh! Mercenaries?
Has the good king of Alazar finally forked out the Krowns?

Next1.text: Had he given us the raise we deserve, I wouldn't have spat in his face!

Next2.text: Believe me, whatever the old miser promised you for our heads is nowhere near enough!

Start.text: You're too late to save the children: they've gone up North with the slave traders.

Next1.text: Don't look so disappointed, Mercenaries. Most parents would be dismayed to see their offspring return so quickly...

Next2.text: In these times of famine, I barely have to negotiate to buy their young ones. These peasants are all very keen to sell off a few mouths they won't have to feed.

Start.text: Run, heretics! Fear the divine wrath of the All-Seeing Eye and Saint Jeru!

Next1.text: These lands must be cleansed of ungodly souls! Blood will wash away their sins.

Next2.text: Death to the heretic Trackers! Let the Light sweep away their pagan idols and bestial gods!

Start.text: Why confront us? We are only doing what the Guard dares not do!

Next1.text: Trials, prison... It's all pointless! Look at what has become of this Province! Look! Honest folk can't live here in peace!

Next2.text: It's high time someone rid us of the bandits, the raiders, the thieves... Pure and simple extermination... These parasites deserve nothing less!

Start.text: Go away, Mercenaries. This is no concern of yours. The Legion alone will deal with this matter.

Next1.text: What? The Broker Council wants to drive us out? They have no right! The Legion can go wherever it pleases in Gosenberg! This land is theirs only because we allow it.

Next2.text: Go on, then! Fight me! And they better not come crying when Alexa Grathan tries to take over their kingdom, too!

Start.text:
Slave traders? You must be joking, Mercenaries!
We are but humble traders looking to satisfy our clients.

Next1.text: There aren't enough convicted criminals in chains to meet the demand. If the laws weren't so strict, people like us could stay nice and warm in our homes.

Next2.text: This is no mean feat! These Harag savages can sure put up a fight, the risks are great and the journey perilous. Now, if you don't mind, we'll take our catch and leave...

Start.text: It's true what they say, isn't it? The Legion never gives up...

Next1.text: We've been in hiding for over five years but they've still managed to track us down.

Next2.text: Ha! No matter. We're tired of running from these bloodhounds! If this is our last stand, then so be it! We won't go down without a fight!

Start.text: I'd recognise your stench anywhere. People like you reek of greed and indifference.

Next1.text: For the right price, you'll turn a blind eye to what your employers are selling.

Next2.text: Who cares about slaves as long as you bring in the Krowns!

Next3.text: You're no better than them. I will enjoy killing you.

Start.text: I warn you, Mercenaries! Call me a sore loser and I'll have your head!

Next1.text: Victory was ours! We were this close to winning the Rouste Tournament! But those blasted craftsmen cheated! They should consider themselves lucky we didn't kill them all before we left.

Next2.text: These Krowns are ours. If they want them back, they'll have to pry them from our cold, dead fingers!

Start.text: Looking for a little tipple? I should warn you, this Gosenberg wine is for connoisseurs. Only the most discerning palates will truly appreciate it.

Next1.text: What do you mean, vinegar? Since when are Mercenaries wine specialists?

Next2.text: The Gosenberg Vintners' claims are baseless! Who says they didn't get their barrels from us anyway? Huh?

Start.text: If you're here to recover what we took from the Guard, you're too late.

Next1.text: We've paid for safe passage into Gosenberg, and the Brotherhood has agreed to let us join them. The Ludern Guard will have no further trouble from us.

Next2.text: You understand, don't you? Who'd want to stay here when our neighbours live on fertile lands with more Krowns than they know what to do with?

Start.text: Don't come any closer! Back off! No one will disturb the Ancients' sleep!

Next1.text: Whoever you are, you will not enter and defile our gods!

Next2.text: Not you, nor anybody! From this day forth, we will protect the Tombs with our lives!

Start.text: On the way to the Throne Room, I couldn't help noticing that some of your residents were cooking up the soles of their shoes for food. I'm afraid they might turn to worse things yet, if you don't act to ease their hunger.

line0.props.tipText: Open the Militia's grain stores to feed the population.

line1.props.tipText: Let residents use their creativity to deal with the food shortage.

Start.text: Pardon my impudence, my Lords, but... the grain stores are empty! We've nothing left to eat! Your citizens are growing angry!

line0.props.tipText: Send the malcontents to the dungeons to discourage the revolt.

line1.props.tipText: Buy food supplies from neighbouring kingdoms.

Start.text: What a waste, my Lords, to leave so much food to spoil in your granaries!

Next1.text: Selling some of it would be a fine way to feed our customers' hungry mouths and fill your residents' pockets. What say you? Shall I order your subjects to sell their surplus right away?

line0.props.tipText: Part of the food surplus will be sold to the highest bidders.

line1.props.tipText: The surplus should be given to the orphans and paupers in the Fief.

line2.props.tipText: The surplus will stay right where it is. A poor harvest could hit us at any time.

Start.text:
What ever will we do, my Lords? The hail has destroyed everything!
Our trees are battered, our fields are ruined... There's nothing left! Nothing!

line0.props.tipText: Buy food from another kingdom.

line1.props.tipText: Open the Militia's and Scholars' grain stores.

line2.props.tipText: The residents will have to tighten their belts until the next harvest.

Start.text: It's no wonder your Fief has been invaded by mice: your granaries are overflowing with food! Your farms are turning out food faster than your residents can eat it!

Next1.text: If we don't find an answer to this storage problem soon, we'll never be able to get rid of the rodents!

line0.props.tipText: Order the Craftsmen to make enough crates and clay pots to protect the food from mice.

line1.props.tipText: Acquire a few cats to protect the Fief's granaries.

line2.props.tipText: Losing part of your production is acceptable.

Start.text: There aren't enough men to watch over your domain, my Lords. Why, just yesterday we saw a shadowy figure prowling around near the food reserves. They fled when we approached, but they could easily come back.

line0.props.tipText: Force some peasants to join the Militia.

line1.props.tipText: The Militia already have more than enough people.

Start.text:
This place is a real cesspool! Yes! It's the only word for it, my Lords!
What else can you call a city where thieves help themselves from the market stalls in broad daylight? Or rob our customers right up to the Throne Room door?
You must protect our goods, or the Merchants will leave to trade elsewhere!

line0.props.tipText: Recruit new Mercenaries to strengthen the Militia.

line1.props.tipText: Let the Merchants and traders fend for themselves.

line2.props.tipText: Throw the alderman out of the Throne Room.

Start.text: Thieves are getting far too comfortable in your city. Let's hang a few of them in the market square. That should get the others' attention.

line0.props.tipText: Approve this excellent idea.

line1.props.tipText: Death is excessive, but the punishment should serve as a deterrent.

line2.props.tipText: Refuse to use such barbaric punishments.

Start.text: The fountains have been poisoned, and many people have fallen ill. You can't claim to rule a Fief without ensuring its people the safety they deserve.

line0.props.tipText: Send the Scholars out to track down the poisoner.

line1.props.tipText: Give the Militia more resources to watch over the fountains.

line2.props.tipText: The commoners can just get their water from the lake.

Start.text: The Bandits who kidnapped your residents have also damaged the door to our sentry box. They nailed up a ransom note.

line0.props.tipText: Send Mercenaries out on the Bandits' trail.

line1.props.tipText: Your Troop will personally find the missing persons.

line2.props.tipText: Pay the ransom.

Start.text: No realm has ever been as safe as yours, my Lords! No one dares step out of line, and all the residents bow down to our Militia!

line0.props.tipText: Congratulate the Militia on their good work.

line1.props.tipText: Order the Militia to be less rigid with the residents.

Start.text: There are children among your subjects, some with promising minds. Let us not waste their potential by leaving them to chase chickens all day! Entrust them to me and I shall educate them, to raise them into enlightened adults.

line0.props.tipText: Entrust the children's education to the Scholars.

line1.props.tipText: The peasants don't need to know how to read to cultivate their fields.

Start.text: I pulled the drowned child's body out of the water. Ever since, I see his little face every time I close my eyes...

line0.props.tipText: Ask the fisherman to teach the residents to swim.

line1.props.tipText: Accidents will happen no matter what we do.

Start.text: Your residents are as dumb as a pile of rocks! They spend good money on Edoranian swill and think they can cure their baldness with potions from back-alley charlatans! Their ignorance will make those crooks the new masters of this Fief!

line0.props.tipText: Order the Scholars to educate the populace.

line1.props.tipText: Order the Militia to inspect the goods.

line2.props.tipText: The residents are free to do their own product research.

Start.text:
Your Scholars have made quite a reputation for themselves! Even in Alazar, we've heard all about their wisdom.
Our University would be honoured to host some of your finest academics.

line0.props.tipText: Send a scholarly delegation to Alazar.

line1.props.tipText: The Fief needs its Scholars.

Start.text: Children running amok in the streets may seem cute, but for how long? Idleness will soon turn them into drunkards and thieves! Send your subjects' children to the Militia! We'll turn them into strong, proud soldiers!

line0.props.tipText: Hand the children over to the Militia.

line1.props.tipText: Children should enjoy their innocence while they can.

Start.text: I had three tables broken last night alone! And last week, those good-for-nothings set fire to my stools. This can't go on like this you've got to keep your people occupied!

line0.props.tipText: Organise a Rouste tournament.

line1.props.tipText: Hire Jugglers to entertain the people.

Start.text: Among the Jugglers who perform in your Fief, my men have located one company whose material seems quite seditious. Under the guise of entertaining the people, they're mocking you and your rule. Should I intervene?

line0.props.tipText: Lock up the agitators.

line1.props.tipText: Let the artists say whatever they like.

Start.text: My Lords, the show put on by the new Jugglers' troop has been a real revelation. Some of your residents think you should share some of your power with the rest of us. After all, we know our professions and businesses best. We could offer some good advice!

line0.props.tipText: Agree to rule the Fief with your people.

line1.props.tipText: Imprison these peons who think they have the right to govern.

Start.text: Do business? With what money, by Saint Jeru? Your residents are poorer than most other places' beggars! The Merchants will leave your domain before long if they don't find customers to sell their wares to!

line0.props.tipText: Promise to improve the Fief's financial situation.

line1.props.tipText: Well, then! Let them leave!

Start.text: The Bandits are up to something, my Lords. Some say they're going to attack to try and take this place back! We must prepare ourselves!

line0.props.tipText: Upgrade the Militia's weaponry.

line1.props.tipText: The realm is already prepared.

Start.text: The stench in our streets is unbearable! Residents don't even bother walking down to the lake to dump their filth! We must do something before your people suffocate one summer!

line0.props.tipText: Prepare to take action against the noxious air.

line1.props.tipText: Build sewers.

line2.props.tipText: All cities stink in summer!

Start.text:
The Festival of Light is coming, my Lords! The Festival of Light!
We must prepare for it right away, or the Eye's Reckoning will wipe this godless Fief from the face of the earth.

line0.props.tipText: Prepare the Festival of Light.

line1.props.tipText: Organising religious festivals is the Church's job.

Start.text: The Ghost Pack that prowls your lands is more powerful than anticipated. Three of our men have already died. The lords of foreign kingdoms are still refusing to give us any help, but it seems you're different.

line0.props.tipText: Agree to send Mercenaries.

line1.props.tipText: Your Troop is quite willing to wipe out this pack themselves.

line2.props.tipText: Refuse to send your people to fight Ghost Pack monsters.

Start.text: I... I ran as fast as I could when I saw it! A Rat Infestation! There's a nest right next to the Fief! The Plague will infest the city!

line0.props.tipText: Agree to send Mercenaries.

line1.props.tipText: Your troop will personally handle this Rat Infestation.

line2.props.tipText: Simply prohibit the Fief's residents from going anywhere near the nest.

Start.text: For the time being, we have enough meat to prevent those sick with the Plague from losing their minds, but how long can we keep this up? We need remedies!

line0.props.tipText: Our Apothecaries must contain the epidemic.

line1.props.tipText: Send a request for help to the kingdom of Alazar.

line2.props.tipText: The sick will have to be put down to stop the disease from spreading.

Start.text: You know me, my Lords... I never come to you without a very good reason.

Next1.text: For example, I've never dared to bother you for a missing caravan! And yet, Saint Jeru knows they do vanish!

Next2.text: Ahem... Anyway, this caravan is somewhat different. It was coming back to our Fief, loaded with Krowns. A lot of Krowns. So I deemed it wise to inform you of this terrible loss for our domain.

line0.props.tipText: Agree to send Mercenaries.

line1.props.tipText: Your Troop will personally find the caravan.

line2.props.tipText: It's still just one more disappearance.

Start.text: Someone needs to watch over the eateries in your city! The food they're selling should be fit for consumption! I'm tired of finding sand in my meat and nail trimmings in my wine.

line0.props.tipText: Assign the Militia to watch over the eateries.

line1.props.tipText: Assign the Scholars to inspect the eateries.

line2.props.tipText: Residents should just be more careful about which taverns they go to.

Start.text:
You're all that people are talking about in Edoran.
I'd love to be your advisor. May I?

line0.props.tipText: Recruit this unknown noble.

line1.props.tipText: Send this maniac back where he came from.

Start.text:
May I talk to you about the noble you agreed to take on as an advisor?
Has he shown any talent since he started working for you?

Next1.text:
The few times I've seen him involved in the Fief's affairs, he was flirting with some peasant girl or getting drunk at the Tavern!
My Lords, it's my duty as alderman to warn you: I fear he's taking advantage of your kindness!

line0.props.tipText: Relieve the noble of his duties as advisor.

line1.props.tipText: Keep the noble in his role.

Start.text: ::vars.amount:: [Fief_Currency_Money] are missing from the Fief's coffers! And guess who disappeared without a trace three days ago? Your advisor! That petty noble who turned up out of nowhere!

line0.props.tipText: Curse your gullibility.

Start.text: I have come to inform you of my departure, my Lords. The prestigious position you offered me has helped me secure the most advantageous marriage proposal. I will be returning to Edoran with full pockets!

Next1.text: It's only fair that I should share part of the dowry with you.

line0.props.tipText: Bid this strange advisor farewell.

Start.text: A few of us lads are putting together a fishing competition. And since we like you, my Lords, we thought we'd invite you.

Next1.text: We know you're quite busy, so if you don't want to come, we understand.

line0.props.tipText: Promise the residents that you'll send a few Companions.

line1.props.tipText: Decline the invitation, but thank the residents for thinking of you.

line2.props.tipText: Throw these troublemakers in prison. You never authorised any fishing competition!

Start.text: Our informants among the population are quite certain: there's a revolt brewing. They haven't identified any leaders, but a few random hangings should be enough to bring the people back to their senses.

line0.props.tipText: Authorise the Militia to terrorise the populace.

line1.props.tipText: Ask the Militia to continue their investigation and arrest the leaders.

line2.props.tipText: Give a speech to the people to quell the discontent.

Start.text: Our harvests are good. Through our efforts, your subjects are eating their fill.

Next1.text: So, my Lords, with the Sheep Festival coming up, we were wondering if you might help us with the celebrations... as a sort of thank you, so t'speak...

line0.props.tipText: Agree to give the people what they need to celebrate the Sheep Festival.

line1.props.tipText: Send the peasants back to work.

Start.text: Your militiamen are a load of drunks! Good-for-nothings who spend more time drinking than guarding!

Next1.text: Sure, they're always there to help celebrate your Fief's prosperity... But when the time comes to defend our warehouses, your sellswords are so drunk that the thieves don't even bother running!

line0.props.tipText: Prohibit the Militia from drinking on duty.

line1.props.tipText: Your militiamen have every right to relax.

Start.text: Your management of this domain is quite impressive! Your residents eat their fill, sleep soundly, enjoy riches that some nobles couldn't even dream of, and most surprising of all, some can even read halfway decently!

Next1.text: It's only fair that your Fief pay tribute to you. Let me handle the preparations. It will be magnificent!

line0.props.tipText: Hold a festival in your honour.

line1.props.tipText: A festival would risk disrupting the management of your Fief.

Start.text: Please, this slaughter must be stopped! Your Farmers are felling every tree they find without performing any sort of ritual! The Tules will be furious!

line0.props.tipText: Suspend the construction of new districts until the proper rituals are performed.

line1.props.tipText: Throw this heretic out. The Tules aren't even real!

Start.text: My husband had a terrible fall whilst helping to build your new district. He survived, Saint Eleor be praised, but he can't get around on his own any more. What will become of us without his wages?

line0.props.tipText: Take care of the disabled and their families.

line1.props.tipText: Give this poor woman a bit of gold.

line2.props.tipText: The residents of your Fief must learn to stand on their own two feet.

Start.text: With no place for your population to pray or worship, the plague of heresy could spread at any time. Your Fief could fall prey to decadence, my Lords!

Next1.text: Preserve the faith! Preserve public order!

line0.props.tipText: Promise to build a church.

line1.props.tipText: Other buildings must be built first.

Start.text: It's all got to stop! Absolutely everything! No more construction! Nothing! Until further notice!

Next1.text: We've found traces of an Ancient site just beneath this Fief! With any luck, it could be the home town of Dagan the artist. What a discovery that would be!

Next2.text: I beg of you, my Lords! You must understand the importance of our work. Give us time to excavate the relics before they're buried forever under some miserable gambling den!

line0.props.tipText: Agree not to build anything else until the Scholars have finished their digs.

line1.props.tipText: Nothing shall prevent your Fief's development, not even the Ancients.

Start.text: Your city is certainly quaint, that much is true. Every shanty, every square seems to have been placed at the spontaneous whims of your residents. It all adds up to a very... modern look.

Next1.text: And yet, my Lords, I think that some of your subjects may desire a return to greater order and tradition. Perhaps in separate districts, to avoid inconveniencing the other residents of your Fief.

Next2.text: In a word, we nobles would like more elegant homes.

line0.props.tipText: Create homes for your noblest residents.

line1.props.tipText: The nobles can build the homes they want at their own expense.

line2.props.tipText: All of your residents are housed on an equal basis.

Start.text: The General's birthday is coming up, but I haven't noticed any preparations here. Might I suggest that you hurry? You will never be Edoran's ally if your emissaries show up in the capital empty-handed.

line0.props.tipText: Prepare a gift for the General.

line1.props.tipText: Expel the Ambassador. You won't bend to the General's whims!

Start.text: The clans of Harag are too proud to ask for your help, but I don't share their misgivings!

Next1.text: Swamp fever is ravaging the clans, and we don't have enough Druids and Apothecaries to confront the full scale of the epidemic. I beg of you, my Lords, please help your neighbours.

line0.props.tipText: Your Apothecaries will prepare something to care for the people of Harag.

line1.props.tipText: Let the clans figure it out for themselves.

Start.text: It goes without saying that the Kingdom of Alazar sees your Fief as the trading partner it's been lacking.

Next1.text:
But since Alazar is not Gosenberg, its king requires more than a flourishing economy to consider you an ally.
The people of the north care more for Knowledge than for Krowns...

line0.props.tipText: Show Alazar the extent of your Knowledge.

line1.props.tipText: Alazar will have to settle for a trading partner.

Start.text:
Have you ever heard of the Arena Clash?
Bah! What am I saying?! Of course you have! You're people of culture!

Next1.text: Well, it seems that this year, there's a bit of uncertainty about the planning for Gosenberg's most eagerly-awaited tournament. The vineyard harvests in Vertruse have been disappointing, to say the least, and the Broker Council fears that Grinmeer's won't be enough to quench the spectators' thirst.

Next2.text: The Brokers would greatly appreciate it if their preferred trading partner in other words, you would graciously provide them with the drink their people require. What say you, my Lords?

line0.props.tipText: Agree to produce wine for Gosenberg.

line1.props.tipText: It won't do the citizens of Gosenberg any harm to drink water for a change.

Start.text: Do you know what I heard just this morning from some Vertrusian merchants?

Next1.text: Well, I'll tell you!

Next2.text: The Smugglers are out there selling Mount Altis silks! They're passing off rough fabrics from Tiltren as your residents' creations! They're getting rich off our backs and damaging our reputation! This cannot stand!

line0.props.tipText: Agree to send Mercenaries.

line1.props.tipText: Your Troop will personally handle these freeloaders.

line2.props.tipText: This is a problem for the Vertrusians to deal with.

Start.text: Oh my Lords, how happy I am to live in your Fief! I've long suffered under the tolerance of those other hypocritical lords! Oh! Cursed be those heretics who claim to revere the God of Light, but allow the common rabble to worship the Tules.

Next1.text: Allow me to offer my assistance: I shall guide you on the path of faith. Together, we will make Mount Altis a holy land.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the priest's help.

line1.props.tipText: Let the people be free to practise any religion they choose.

Start.text:
I've heard that you asked the Tules' permission before felling the trees in their domain. Is that true?
And the temple that you've dedicated to the little gods... did you really build it yourselves?

Next1.text:
Oh! Thanks be to the Ancients! You are of our tribe, my Lords!
Let us make this Fief the refuge of the true gods! Let us help outsiders to meet them!

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Druid's help.

line1.props.tipText: The people are free to practise any religion they choose.

Start.text:
Oh! What a handsome pony!
What's it doing here?

line0.props.tipText: Send to the stables.

line1.props.tipText: Appoint as general.

Start.text: My Lords! This situation simply can't be allowed to continue. All these ruffians roaming hither and yon through your Fief, rowdy and inebriated, and shouting their inanities under the very windows of our Academy! How are our students meant to concentrate?

line0.props.tipText: Ask the Militia to calm the Bandits down.

line1.props.tipText: The Scholars will just have to get used to the noise.

Start.text: What a pleasure to see noble lords like yourselves welcoming our activities with open arms!

Next1.text: Once I learned of your interest, I hurried here in hopes of offering my humble services.

line0.props.tipText: Hire the Baron as an advisor.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to form an alliance with the Black Market.

Start.text: Though I've dedicated my whole life to Knowledge, I find no words strong enough to express the pride you've inspired in me.

Next1.text: When I left Alazar, I never dreamed I'd find lords this dedicated to the search for the Truth and the Mysteries of this world. Yet find you I did!

Next2.text: You have made this place a great centre of Knowledge, a lighthouse in the gloom of ignorance and obscurantism. My Lords, your Scholars and I are ready to govern for you.

line0.props.tipText: Celebrate the triumph of Knowledge

Start.text: Are you aware of what's going on in the cemetery? Did you authorise this?

Next1.text: It's your Scholars! They're sneaking around the graves like vultures and digging up our recently buried dead!

Next2.text: Have they lost all sense of what's sacred? What sort of Knowledge are they after in there?

line0.props.tipText: No Knowledge can justify disturbing the sleep of the dead.

line1.props.tipText: Knowledge should be gathered by any means necessary.

Start.text: We like your Scholars, my Lords. They're lovely neighbours, they don't make much noise, and they always say hello, but...

Next1.text: They stick their noses into everything! First we're not using the right tool, then we're not working efficiently enough, then the Blacksmiths shouldn't do this, and the Merchants should do that...

Next2.text: We can't take it any more! You've got to explain to them that we know what we're doing! Tell them to stay in their libraries!

line0.props.tipText: Ask the Scholars to stop meddling in other residents' affairs.

line1.props.tipText: The Scholars can bring improvements in many different domains, and the peasants should welcome that.

Start.text: All my wine... lost! Spilt out over the stones of the market square. Barrels that I brought here from Gosenberg at great expense!

Next1.text: Why? Because your residents are the worst sort of brutes! In their admiration for your Mercenaries and Militia, they seek out any opportunity to fight. One wrong look or one ill-chosen word, and they smash everything in their path.

line0.props.tipText: The Militia and Mercenaries shouldn't be role models for the residents.

line1.props.tipText: There's nothing wrong with settling conflicts on their own.

Start.text: Your Merchants are thieves! Not only do they enrich themselves on our backs, but they sell our products for much more than they're worth!

Next1.text: It's unbelievable! Yesterday I sold one of those troublemakers a leg of lamb, then saw it on sale for three times the price in another district!

line0.props.tipText: Goods will be regulated and the profits will be shared with the producers.

line1.props.tipText: It's up to the customers and producers to be more cautious.

Start.text: It was an honour to serve you, my Lords. I'll never forget my time in your Militia.

Next1.text: Oh! No! I'm not leaving the Fief! One of your Merchants has hired me, the one who sells fabrics from Vertruse. I work for him now.

line0.props.tipText: Forbid the Merchants from maintaining private Militias.

line1.props.tipText: Allow the Merchants to defend themselves.

Start.text: My cart got bogged down in your damned alleyways. Completely stuck in the ruts. And while I was off looking for help, a group of troublemakers ran off with my cargo!

Next1.text: I demand compensation!

line0.props.tipText: Send the Militia to track down the thieves.

line1.props.tipText: Have the worst streets in the Fief paved to avoid future incidents.

line2.props.tipText: Expel this impudent fool from your Throne Room.

Start.text: Finding homes for the influx of new residents has been no easy task, my Lords! As an alderman, I've had to show quite a bit of cunning and creativity!

Next1.text: Unfortunately, all of these new shanties might possibly be made entirely of wood and straw. To save time, you see?

Next2.text: I worry they might pose a bit of a fire hazard...

line0.props.tipText: Demolish the shanties and rebuild them with stone..

line1.props.tipText: Prevent fires by prohibiting residents from lighting candles in their shanties.

line2.props.tipText: The residents will just have to be careful.

Start.text: This prohibition is unacceptable! How can our Scholars study without candlelight? Do you think Knowledge can wait for daybreak?

line0.props.tipText: Allow residents to light their homes with candles.

line1.props.tipText: Knowledge isn't worth risking a fire.

line2.props.tipText: Demolish the shanties and rebuild them with stone, then allow the use of fire.

Start.text: You summoned me, my Lords? Is this about the recent fire?

Next1.text: I'm afraid that candlelight and straw roofs are a dangerous combination. Might I suggest that you either ban the one, or rebuild the other?

line0.props.tipText: Demolish the shanties and rebuild them with stone..

line1.props.tipText: Prevent fires by prohibiting residents from lighting candles in their shanties.

line2.props.tipText: None of these solutions are appropriate.

Start.text: As soon as we first met, my Lords, I knew we were cut from the same cloth. I trusted you immediately. And how right I was, by Saint Lenaid!

Next1.text: You have made this Fief into a land of plenty! We're as rich as the Brokers! Even Gosenberg City pales in comparison to your fortune!

Next2.text: The merchants of your Fief are more eager to follow you than ever, and to provide you with their best advice.

line0.props.tipText: Celebrate the Fief's newfound wealth.

Start.text: When you knocked off that old fool Alvrick, I thought you wanted to turn this ruin into another kingdom full of Guards and good people...

Next1.text: But in the end, you've made it a place of vice and debauchery. Ha! You certainly kept your cards close to your chest, Mercenaries|

Next2.text: Every Bandit I know would sell their soul to work under your command. So don't miss your chance to command them! You're the new Baron.

line0.props.tipText: Descend into crime.

Start.text: You've restored Old Mount Altis Fortress to its former glory! Not since the Edoranian War have these walls stood so tall!

Next1.text: My Lords, any soldier would be proud to serve leaders like yourselves. Thanks to you, our modest Militia has grown as powerful as an army. In years to come, it will surely rival the Legion itself.

Next2.text: Allow me to assure you of your Militia's and Mercenaries' undying support.

line0.props.tipText: Celebrate the Fief's military might.

Start.text:
Tavern Keeper, would you be so kind as to show these peasants out?
I don't care for their smell.

line0.props.tipText: Ban Peasants from the Tavern.

line0.text: No Farmers for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line1.props.tipText: Ban Nobles from the Tavern.

line0.text: No Nobles for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line2.props.tipText: Deny the request.

line0.text: Annoyed, the Nobles will spend less freely for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

Start.text: By the Beast's fangs, look what I've found! One of your patrons forgot their coin purse!

line0.props.tipText: Say thank you and keep the purse for yourself.

line1.props.tipText: Send a Bouncer to bring the customer their purse back.

TavernEvent.text: The owner of the forgotten coin purse has sent you a reward.
Your Bouncer kept the customer's lost purse for himself.

Start.text:
Ahem! Tavern Keepers! I have a special request for you.
Princess Edda Adr Alazar is currently visiting Gosenberg City. Could you reserve your Tavern for her personal use?

line0.props.tipText: Reserve the Tavern for exclusive use by the princess.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to turn your patrons out.

TavernEvent.text: Princess Edda Adr Alazar was thrilled with her time at your Tavern.
Princess Edda Adr Alazar cancelled her visit at the last minute, leaving you with no patrons.

Start.text: Please send the bill to my father. I haven't any money on me.

line0.props.tipText: Send the young man's tab to his father.

line1.props.tipText: Pay up, kid!

TavernEvent.text: The young man's father paid his son's tab.
The young man's father refused to pay his son's tab.

Start.text: Residents called us in after seeing plague-infected rats in the streets.

Next1.text: You should let me inspect your establishment. You can never be too careful with the Plague.

line0.props.tipText: Pay the Purifier to inspect your Tavern.

line1.props.tipText: No need to frighten your customers.

TavernEvent.text: Plague-ridden rats attacked your customers.
No plague-ridden rats have turned up.

Start.text: I've been dining in your lovely Tavern ever since it first opened. I simply had to come here to celebrate my eighty-third winter!

Next1.text: I don't suppose you'd have a special tipple on hand for your most loyal customer?

line0.props.tipText: Give your customer a free bottle of wine.

line0.text: Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

line1.props.tipText: Pay for your customer's meal and drinks.

line0.text: Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

line2.props.tipText: This lady is a customer, not your beloved granny!

TavernEvent.text: You have inherited a loyal customer.

Start.text: Your Tavern would be absolutely perfect for the new show my troupe and I have put together. How about hosting me and my incredible performing bears?

line0.props.tipText: Agree to host the trained bear show.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to let bears into your Tavern.

TavernEvent.text: The jugglers' bears attacked some of your customers.
Your customers loved the bear tamers' performance.

Start.text: Shhhh. Don't look at me. Just act as if I weren't here

Next1.text: We wouldn't want your customers to suspect they're eating side by side with the People's Fellowship. Some of them might be inclined to report us to the Brokers.

line0.props.tipText: Let the People's Fellowship prepare their revolution in peace.

line1.props.tipText: Report the People's Fellowship to the Grinmeer Guard.

TavernEvent.text: To thank you for your hospitality, the People's Fellowship have sabotaged a rival Tavern.
The People's Fellowship have been apprehended, and you're being accused of aiding and abetting them.
In retaliation, the People's Fellowship have punctured your liquor barrels.
Agents of the People's Fellowship have been arrested thanks to your tip.

Start.text:
Your Tavern is a den of iniquity!
Instead of studying, our students spend their time drinking and gambling in this dive!
This has to stop!

line0.props.tipText: Ban University scholars from your Tavern.

line0.text: No Scholars for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line1.props.tipText: Promise to keep the students' drinking in check.

line0.text: Scholars will spend less freely for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line2.props.tipText: Refuse to turn away your most loyal customers.

Start.text:
Your Tavern plays host to all manner of blasphemous depravity!
Atone for your sins, Mercenaries, or the Eye's Reckoning shall purify this place in your stead!

line0.props.tipText: Prohibit all blasphemous activities.

line1.props.tipText: Ignore this fanatic's threats.

TavernEvent.text: Your Tavern was struck by lightning. Could this be the Eye's Reckoning?
You've avoided the Eye's Reckoning.

Start.text:
Your neighbours are complaining about the noise, Mercenaries.
It must stop! Now.

line0.props.tipText: Bribe the Guard with a free round.

line1.props.tipText: Make everyone quiet down to avoid any problems.

Start.text: We've had a tough hunt this time, Mercenaries. We're tired, and some of us are injured.

Next1.text: I know our presence can be frightening to the people of other kingdoms, but we need some time to recover in your Tavern. We're willing to pay extra.

line0.props.tipText: Letting in such a big group of Trackers is out of the question.

line1.props.tipText: Hunting down the Ghost Pack is important for everyone's safety.

line0.text: Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

TavernEvent.text: The Trackers defeated the Ghost Pack and have given you a trophy in thanks.

Start.text:
This food smells a bit off, don't you think?
I'm not sure I want to eat this

line0.props.tipText: Replace the customer's order.

line1.props.tipText: Defend your Cook's integrity.

TavernEvent.text: One of your dishes made a customer sick.

Start.text: How dare you serve your customers in such a dump? Your Tavern is disgusting!

Next1.text: I'm surprised I don't see mice eating right on the tables! This is unacceptable!

line0.props.tipText: Ask your Bouncers to do a bit of cleaning.

line1.props.tipText: Pay villagers to clean the place.

line2.props.tipText: A Tavern's not a Tavern without a little grit and grime.

TavernEvent.text: Drawn by the filth, mice have invaded your Tavern.

Start.text: Tavern Keeper are there some Inquisitors behind me? Do you think they've seen me? Are they looking this way?

Next1.text: Oh, by Saint Jeru! Please let me hide in your cellar! Just until they find some other victim to burn! I'll give you everything I have.

line0.props.tipText: Hide the heretic.

line1.props.tipText: Report the heretic to the Inquisition.

Start.text: Arr! Your Tavern's not bad, but it could be even better! If your Tavern Keeper knew the rules of arm wrestling, he could teach them to your customers. Everyone would have a much better time!

line0.props.tipText: Pay the Pirate to acquire his knowledge.

line1.props.tipText: Pirate games have a reputation for turning ugly.

Start.text:
I must say, your cooking is very good! But there's so much meat
Why not put some fish on the menu? Travellers from Belerion would become your most loyal customers!

line0.props.tipText: Thank the Ihrian for her advice

Start.text:
Have you heard about the Great Scholar of Alazar's magical stones? No?
All the most successful Tavern Keepers have at least one!

Next1.text:
Simply place a stone somewhere in your establishment, and well-to-do customers will come running. Not bad, right?
So How many shall I put you down for?

line0.props.tipText: Refuse to buy the stone.

line1.props.tipText: Buy one of the Great Scholar of Alazar's magical stones.

Start.text:
All of this good food reminds me of a riddle. Want to hear it?
If you can solve it, I'll give you a reward.

Next0.text:
Wonderful!
Now, listen carefully, Mercenaries. Really focus.

Next1.text: You have to cross a river with a wolf, a crocswine, and a crate of apples. But you can only carry one person at a time. How many crossings do you need to get them all across in one piece?

line0.props.tipText: Answer that five crossings are required.

line1.props.tipText: Answer that seven crossings are required.

line2.props.tipText: Answer that only one crossing is required.

Failure.text: Sorry, you lose! You can only carry one person at a time. But neither the wolf, nor the crocswine, nor the crate of apples are people!

Success.text:
That's right! Neither the wolf, nor the crocswine, nor the crate of apples are people!
Take this, with my compliments!

Start.text: After eating and drinking at all the questionable eateries in the Five Kingdoms, I've finally found a Tavern worthy of my talent. Your Tavern, Mercenaries!

Next1.text: No reason to hesitate I'm any Tavern Keeper's dream Cook!

line0.props.tipText: Recruit the famous Cook.

line1.props.tipText: You already have what you need in the kitchen.

Start.text: Your Bouncers are managing all right, but they should leave it to the professionals. See, I've got decades of Tavern-minding experience under my belt. With a bloke like me around, you'll never have problems again.

line0.props.tipText: Hire the Bouncer.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to hire another Bouncer.

Start.text: For a modest fee, my troupe and I are willing to perform any piece from our repertoire!

Next1.text: Come on, then! We're not expensive, and it'll add a little atmosphere. Just choose which piece you'd like us to put on.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a very serious and slightly boring religious piece.

line1.props.tipText: Choose a silly, light-hearted farce.

line2.props.tipText: You can't afford to hire jugglers.

Start.text: It's true I haven't any coin to pay for my meal...

Next1.text: But wait! Don't report me to the Guard right away! I'm a carpenter by trade. I can take on a few jobs for you to pay my debt!

line0.props.tipText: Ask the carpenter to reinforce the door.

line1.props.tipText: Ask the carpenter to sand the tables.

Start.text:
Don't worry. My customers know how to behave, and I promise they won't cause any problems for you.
I just need a place where I can trade with them discreetly.

line0.props.tipText: Refuse to let the Black Market into your Tavern.

line1.props.tipText: Let the Black Market set up shop for a while.

TavernEvent.text: The Black Market agent is very upset that you turned her away.
The Black Market agent won't be coming back.
The Black Market's customers started a brawl.
The Black Market turned such a big profit that the agent gave you a cut.

Start.text: Someone's just said Death to the General! I heard it! They'd better confess, or I'll burn the whole place down!

line0.props.tipText: Calm the Legionary down by offering her a drink.

line1.props.tipText: Tell your Bouncers to show this customer the door.

TavernEvent.text: The Legionary you threw out came back to take revenge on ::target::.
By throwing a Legionary out of your Tavern, you've given a warning to any would-be troublemakers.

Start.text:
Taverns with a dodgy reputation tend to lose customers.
If only there were some way to make your Tavern safer...

line0.props.tipText: Pay the Guard a bribe to patrol outside your Tavern.

line1.props.tipText: Give the Guards a discount to keep an eye on your customers.

line0.text: Bouncers are less profitable for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line2.props.tipText: Assure her that you'll get along just fine without the Guards.

Start.text:
I might have an inkling of who set fire to your fine establishment.
I might even have seen them do it.

Next1.text: But my memory's not what it used to be. I'll need something to help me remember his face...

line0.props.tipText: Pay a few coins for information.

line1.props.tipText: Threaten to unleash your staff on the old woman.

line2.props.tipText: This minor act of vandalism isn't worthy of your attention.

Give.text:
It's all coming back to me now!
Your vandal was a redhead, dressed as a priest.

Threat1.text: No, please! By Saint Eleor! Don't hurt me!

Threat2.text: Your vandal was a redhead, dressed as a priest.

Ignore.text: Hmph. You're such a tightwad, you won't even pay to stop a vandal.

Start.text:
Huh? What?
What do you want?

line0.props.tipText: Capture the vandal to turn him in to the Guard.

Start.text: Nice Tavern you've got here, but your Bouncers are a bit too attentive. Bad for business, that.

Next1.text: Couldn't you tell your men to look the other way once in a while? I'd be willing to share a part of my bounty.

line0.props.tipText: Just tell your Bouncers to ease off the pressure for a bit.

line0.text: Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to let the Rooks commit a murder in your Tavern.

TavernEvent.text: The Rooks killed someone in your Tavern.

Start.text:
Obviously we feel safe here and all, but...
By Saint Eleor! Do your Bouncers really have to follow us around like Inquisitors?
Tell them to relax a bit!

line0.props.tipText: Ask your Bouncers to be more lenient.

line1.props.tipText: Don't change how your Bouncers do their jobs.

Start.text: Your Bouncer's just bent my ear for ten minutes because I, quote, carry on like a rowdy child when I'm playing dice. I'm sorry, I could have sworn this was a Tavern, not a church!

line0.props.tipText: Ask your Bouncers to be more lenient.

line0.text: Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

line1.props.tipText: Don't change how your Bouncers do their jobs.

Start.text: Today's Arena Combat day, and our champion looks set to win it all...

Next1.text: How's about letting us celebrate in your lovely Tavern? Our community of fans would be terribly grateful.

line0.props.tipText: Agree to host the fans.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to host a group of already-drunk fans in your Tavern.

line2.props.tipText: Pay the Guard to help your Bouncers during the party.

TavernEvent.text: The Arena fans got in a brawl.
Your customers had a memorable evening thanks to the fans.

Start.text: Have you got room to host today's proud winners?

Next1.text:
We've just beat the lumberjacks' team during a game of Rouste!
I think that calls for a little celebration at your Tavern!

line0.props.tipText: Buy a round for the Rouste players.

line1.props.tipText: Give the Rouste players a free meal.

line2.props.tipText: Refuse to let Rouste players celebrate in your Tavern.

Start.text:
Can't you feel the Light shining into your hearts, Mercenaries?
I'm certain you can. And I'm certain you'd let a few unfortunate souls make a brief stop in your Tavern, sick though they are with the Plague.

Next1.text:
These poor, suffering wretches need a brief rest in their long journey to Gosenberg City and to healing, if Saint Jeru wills it.
I promise to ensure your customers' safety.

line0.props.tipText: Allow the Plague victims in for a short time.

line1.props.tipText: Categorically refuse to let the Plague-ridden into your Tavern.

TavernEvent.text: Allowing the Plague-ridden to enter left your customers terrified, but earned you the Church's gratitude.
The Plague-ridden attacked your customers and injured your Bouncer.

Start.text: Your establishment is perfectly located, spacious... and quite inexpensive.

Next1.text: I represent Broker Lied Ald Rijkman, and he'd like to make this a regular stop for one of his caravans. What say you? It would assure you a regular source of income, and plenty of customers.

line0.props.tipText: Become an official caravan stop.

line1.props.tipText: Decline the offer from Lied Ald Rijkman's representative.

Start.text: Someone forgot their animal here...

line0.props.tipText: Mascots are always welcome.

line1.props.tipText: Shoo the hen out.

line2.props.tipText: Why waste good meat?

TavernEvent.text: Your customers loved your new roast chicken recipe.
The customer who forgot his hen was mortified to find it on his plate.

Start.text: A pig has made its way into the Tavern and is looking hungrily at the customers' food.

line0.props.tipText: Ask a Bouncer to drive the animal out.

line1.props.tipText: Hire the pig as a Bouncer.

line2.props.tipText: That pig looks delicious!

TavernEvent.text: Your customers were highly entertained by the epic struggle between the wandering pig and the flustered Bouncer.
::target:: was bitten by the pig.
Your customers enjoyed their pork roast.
The pork roast you served to your customers was positively succulent!

Start.text: Want to know why your Tavern's losing money?

Next1.text: Because your Scullion is useless! The food is raw! RAW!

Next2.text: I'm your last chance to fix things up before this place fails. So put your ego aside and let me turn that miserable Cook into a proper chef!

line0.props.tipText: Agree to let Chef Brandon Lesley help your Scullion.

line0.text: Chef's Training for the Tavern's Scullions for 5 days.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse Chef Brandon Lesley's help.

Start.text: There's no doubt about it, Mercenaries... Your Tavern is haunted.

Next1.text: All that creaking and screaming that people are hearing in your establishment are unmistakably signs of a curse. If you don't want misfortune to befall your customers, you'll need to have the whole place purified!

line0.props.tipText: Pay the Priest of the Light to purify your Tavern.

line1.props.tipText: Send a Bouncer to investigate the creaking noises.

line2.props.tipText: It's only the wind!

TavernEvent.text: The ritual of the Light had no effect, and customers are still hearing terrifying noises.
Your Bouncer discovered that the screaming was due to the wind. Your customers are reassured.
Your customers are terrified by creaking and screaming noises they're hearing in your Tavern.
No one has heard any suspicious creaking for several days now.

Start.text: You must do something! I've already spilled my drink three times today! Bring in a priest, a druid, anyone just get those damned ghosts out of this Tavern!

line0.props.tipText: Send a Bouncer to investigate the creaking noises.

line1.props.tipText: It's only the wind!

Start.text: Your story has inspired me. I'm also leaving the Mercenary life to open my own Tavern!

Next1.text:
All I'm missing now is one of the Great Scholar of Alazar's magical stones. From what I hear, every Tavern Keeper needs to have one.
Would you be willing to pass yours on to me?

line0.props.tipText: Sell her your stone.

line1.props.tipText: Never! It's YOUR magical stone!

line2.props.tipText: Explain to the future Tavern Keeper that the magical stones are just ordinary rocks.

Start.text: Have you ever thought of organising themed nights in your Tavern?

Next1.text: I got hold of some particularly bad-tempered cockerels that'll really impress your customers!

line0.props.tipText: You're not about to allow cockfighting in your Tavern!

line1.props.tipText: Cockfights are gruesome, but very popular.

Start.text: For us common folk, this Tavern is like a second home. Thanks to you, we finally have a place to get together after a hard day's work.

Next1.text: We wanted you to know what this place means to us, so we all pitched in and bought you some nice decorations.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Farmers' gift.

Start.text: I've got a little something for you, from all the boys in the Guard.

Next1.text: Oh! It's nothing much, nothing to get too excited about, but we did want to thank you for being so welcoming. It's not every Tavern Keeper who'll let in a whole regiment of hungry soldiers every night.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the gift from the Guard.

Start.text: Your Tavern is very important to us Trackers. It's one of the few places we feel truly welcome.

Next1.text: So on behalf of our whole brotherhood, I wanted to give you this gift.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Trackers' gift.

Start.text:
Without the unwavering support of strong drink, many of us would never have graduated from the University this year.
We owe a big part of our success to your Tavern, Mercenaries.

Next1.text: To celebrate the end of our exams and your kind hospitality, we've had this little gift made for you.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Scholars' gift.

Start.text: Before I first came to your fine Tavern, I thought all foreign cuisine was bland and uninspiring. But thanks to your scullion, I've changed my mind. And I'm not the only one!

Next1.text: Almost all of our comrades were quite homesick before you set up shop here. If your delicious dishes hadn't been there to boost their morale, some of them would have deserted.

Next2.text: So as their captain, I wanted to offer you this gift as a token of our gratitude.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Alazarian Soldiers' gift.

Start.text: The missions that the Legion is assigned to outside of Edoran are incredibly important, and must be completed with great diplomacy and rigour. That puts a lot of pressure on our soldiers.

Next1.text: And your Tavern opened up at just the right moment, Saint Jeru be praised! We finally have a place to loosen up our armour and relax.

Next2.text: And speaking of armour, we wanted to give you a set. I insist our troop, and all the Legion's soldiers, really owe you a debt of gratitude.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Legion's gift.

Start.text: Your Tavern is a haven of peace and comfort for the Inquisition. You see, Mercenaries...

Next1.text: In other such establishments, our appetites are spoilt by heresy and depravity, but with you as our host, we can enjoy earthly pleasures among respectable, upstanding people.

Next2.text: So to thank you, the Inquisition has decided to offer you this distinction, with our compliments.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the gift from the Inquisition.

Start.text: Your Tavern gives hope to all the mercenaries of the Brotherhood that after a lifetime of fighting, we too can start up our own business and live our lives in peace.

Next1.text: We sincerely hope that your success will continue for a long time to come, and we wanted to give you this gift to help you along.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Brotherhood's gift.

Start.text: As soon as one steps into this Tavern, one immediately feels safe here. And let me tell you, that's not true of every Tavern!

Next1.text: Your Bouncers do an excellent job, and my fellow courtiers and I decided we should reward them with this magnificent divan. It'll be perfect for them to rest their tired legs.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the gift from the Courtiers.

Start.text: I never imagined I'd one day set foot in a Tavern, but I'd heard so many great things about yours, I simply had to come.

Next1.text: And I must say that it was an altogether entertaining experience. You've clearly earned your reputation! Once a man's tasted dishes like these, there's no living without them.

Next2.text: I hope you don't mind my offering you this tapestry. Visitors from the nobility appreciate a dcor that is worthy of their tastes.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Nobles' gift.

Start.text: I've travelled a lot in my life, and I think I can truly say I've eaten in every Tavern in the Five Kingdoms. But never never! have I been treated as well as I have been by your staff.

Next1.text: And I'm not the only one who thinks so! Your name is well-known to all of Gosenberg's merchants, all of them deeply impressed with the comforts of your Tavern.

Next2.text: So on behalf of all the caravans, pedlars and traders in the city, please accept this gift as a symbol our thanks.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Merchants' gift.

Start.text: Your li'l' place here may not be to ev'ryone's liking. Some folks might complain about the fightin' and the thievin'. But for us pirates, this Tavern's the only one worth comin' to.

Next1.text: Stay just as you are! Don't change a thing! The bandits and cutthroats love this place.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Pirates' gift.

Start.text: A sailor's life isn't easy, Mercenaries. We often feel quite homesick.

Next1.text: Fortunately, there are places like your Tavern where we can get together with friends over a dish that reminds us of home.

Next2.text: So to show our appreciation, a few of us have chipped in to give you this Belerian trophy.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the Belerian Villagers' gift.

Generic1.text: If you pay well, I'll come with you!

Generic3.text: I'd like to discover new places and travel the world.

Generic4.text: I am at your service, provided you pay me handsomely.

Generic5.text: I won quite a few fights in the tavern. You can count on me.

Generic6.text: If I join you, I'll no longer be a burden for my family.

Generic7.text: I want to see the world before settling down.

Generic8.text: Nothing scares me, and I'm a quick learner. You won't find a better Companion.

Generic9.text: I was part of another group of Mercenaries, but one morning, they left without me...

Generic10.text: As long as I eat my fill, I make a great Companion.

Generic1.text: The Bandits took everything I had. I have nothing left to lose.

Generic2.text: I'd rather become a Mercenary than beg on the market square.

Generic3.text: Ive had enough of my nightmare neighbours. Take me far away from here!

Man1.text: Don't be fooled by these rags. Before becoming a refugee, I used to be a soldier.

Woman1.text: Don't be fooled by these rags. Before becoming a refugee, I used to be a soldier.

Generic1.text: Just because the Legion didn't hire me doesn't mean I'm not worth my salt.

Generic2.text: The nobles' wars are of no interest to me. What I want is a life of adventure.

Generic3.text: I want to travel before joining an abbey.

Man1.text: I've always known that the life of a farmer wasn't for me.

Woman1.text: I've always known that the life of a farmer wasn't for me.

Generic1.text: Life in Gosenberg is much too quiet for me.

Generic2.text: My family used to be part of the Broker Council. But today, I must sell my services to pay back my debts.

Generic3.text: My services aren't free, but I guarantee you will be satisfied.

Generic4.text: I need to save up for my son's wedding.

Man1.text: I've dreamt of becoming a Mercenary since I was a child.

Woman1.text: I've dreamt of becoming a Mercenary since I was a child.

Generic1.text: The Tules predicted I would thrive as a Mercenary.

Generic2.text: Killing animals is good for Trackers! I need opponents who can put up a real fight!

Generic3.text: All I ask for is honest wages and a life far from the swamps.

Generic4.text: Promise to take me to the Tombs of the Ancients, and I'll join you.

Generic5.text: I don't mind sleeping under the stars.

Generic1.text: I'm done serving my sentence and being a slave! All I want now is to make up for lost time.

Generic2.text: Snow and mountains are all I've ever known, so I'm dying to discover something new.

Man1.text: I was a soldier in my youth. Fighting is all I know.

Woman1.text: I was a soldier in my youth. Fighting is all I know.

Man2.text: I'm not cut out to be a Scholar! My place is out in the field!

Woman2.text: I'm not cut out to be a Scholar! My place is out in the field!

Generic1.text: I may not have my sea legs yet, but I can still make myself useful.

Generic2.text: The pirates burned my village I've got nowhere to go.

Man1.text: Looking for a handy Companion? I've got five years of smuggling experience!

Woman1.text: Looking for someone handy? I've got five years of smuggling experience!

Man2.text: I've even beaten a saurian in hand-to-hand combat... I'm ready for adventure!

Woman2.text: I've even beaten a saurian in hand-to-hand combat... I'm ready for adventure!

Man3.text: My mum always said I'd make a good warrior.

Woman3.text: My mum always said I'd make a good warrior.

Generic1.text: My farm and my fields all went up in flames. I have nothing left to lose.

Generic2.text: I don't want to stay in this County. Take me away, that's all I ask.

Generic3.text: No enemy scares me, whether Bandit, Pirate or Skelmar.

Generic4.text: Neither the General nor the Legion have protected us, so I don't owe this County anything.

Generic1.text: I've converted to the God of the Light. I never said I'd stop fighting!

Generic2.text: Too many pillagers spoils the pillaging. Maybe it's time to move on to something else.

Generic3.text: My clan left without me. You need a new Companion. It's a win for everyone involved!

Generic4.text: It's your fault my jarl is dead. You owe me a place in your troop.

Man1.text: I dare you to look at me and tell me I don't look like a warrior.

Woman1.text: I dare you to look at me and tell me I don't look like a warrior.

Generic1.text: Free me! I swear I'll never steal again!

Generic2.text: I don't want to die here...

Generic3.text: As long as I am well fed, I will follow you wherever you go!

Generic4.text: This is a miscarriage of justice! I demand a trial by combat!

Generic5.text: Pay for my freedom and I will be yours.

Generic1.text: I know how to sail and steal from Merchants. What more could you possibly want?

Generic2.text: My crew was captured by the Guard. I need a new one.

Generic3.text: Why stop at terrorising the high seas when you can do the same on land, too?

Generic4.text: For the right wages, I'd happily become a Mercenary!

Man1.text: The captain didn't abandon me! I left of my own free will!

Woman1.text: The captain didn't abandon me! I left of my own free will!

Generic1.text: Did you come back to free me? Oh, thank you!

Generic2.text: Quick, free me! I can't wait to see the others!

Generic3.text: At last! Do you know how long I have been rotting in this place?

Generic1.text: I... I can't believe I'm never getting out of here.

Generic2.text: I'll never see the sun again.

Generic3.text: You could have fought for me, but you chose to sentence me to death!

Guard_Generic1.text: My brothers-in-arms... They chose to believe you!

Guard_Generic2.text: Did you come here to laugh at me?

Inquisition_Generic1.text: Curse you! Curse you and all of your descendants!

Inquisition_Generic2.text: You may have deceived my weak-hearted colleagues with your lies, but the Eye sees you and knows the truth!

NotifyDuel_Insult_1.text: I'm gonna sink your ship and watch your Companions drown.

NotifyDuel_Insult_2.text: I could kill you with my bare hands.

This camp was attacked by animals. The food is untouched, so they must have acted out of fear.

Well, well, well... Our spies have come through for us... This carriage is loaded with gold!

HostesCommandant1.text: Where do these Krowns come from? Who gave them to you? Where?

CoachDriver1.text: In... in the woods, over there... At the end of the hidden path, there's a campsite. Their men load up our carriages, but drivers like myself are not allowed to speak to them.

CoachDriver2.text: I beg of you, spare my life! Lord Vernalis forced my hand! I had no choice! Please!

HostesCommandant2.text: Don't look at me like that! You have nothing to fear from me, I won't kill you! Count Laheart's so-called cruelty is nothing but a lie stoked by Vernalis to make everyone forget that he is the one who started this war.

HostesCommandant3.text: Well, Mercenaries, I think we've got a lead. What do you say we visit this mysterious campsite together? Let's find another black caravan we can follow. It will lead us to that hidden passage.

Start.text: Who are you? What do you want from me?
Stand back, peasants! These valuable commodities are only for those who can afford them.

Hiding amongst the Skelmar to escape the Guard that could have been a great idea!
