DaggerCommonOutlaws.name: Damaged Dagger
DaggerCommonOutlaws.desc: The dulled blade of this dagger can still inflict considerable damage.

DaggerCommonPirates.name: Pirate Machete
DaggerCommonPirates.desc: Whether it's clearing brush, cutting meat, or mowing down enemies, a true pirate can always put a machete to good use.

DaggerCommonBelerion.name: Ihrian Khanjar
DaggerCommonBelerion.desc: The curve of its blade brings to mind the ritual daggers carried by Mihrian priests.

DaggerRarePit1.name: Pit Dagger
DaggerRarePit1.desc: A handsome blade offered to participants from the Black Market's equally handsome profits.

DaggerArena.name: Arena Dagger
DaggerArena.desc: Although the hilt is slightly worn, the blade is barely chipped.

DaggerUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Dagger
DaggerUncoCraftT1.desc: This dagger has a fearsome blade.

DaggerUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Billhook
DaggerUncoCraftT2.desc: This weapon exudes an odd and frightening energy.

DaggerUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Ballsy Blade
DaggerUncoCraftT3.desc: This dagger's pommel has a very suggestive shape.

DaggerUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Stiletto
DaggerUncoCraftT4.desc: This weapon can slip through weak points in any armour.

DaggerRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Dagger
DaggerRareCraftT5.desc: Designed to leave your enemies no time to admire it.

DaggerUncoGuard.name: Tactician's Dagger
DaggerUncoGuard.desc: If a weapon could bring luck, this one would.

DaggerUncoInquisition.name: Inquisition Pugio
DaggerUncoInquisition.desc: A sharp weapon, as fearsome as the inquisitors who wield it.

DaggerUncoTrackers.name: Harag Billhook
DaggerUncoTrackers.desc: The longer you look at this billhook, the more it resembles a beast's fang.

DaggerUncoSkelmar.name: Skelmar Knife
DaggerUncoSkelmar.desc: Skelmar knives aren't known for their sturdy construction it's their versatility that makes them such useful weapons.

DaggerRareOutlaws.name: Ringleader's Dagger
DaggerRareOutlaws.desc: A short blade, practical and sharp. Highly sought after by bandits.

DaggerRareFugitive09.name: The Ogress
DaggerRareFugitive09.desc: The Ogre has often wielded this blade not to kill, but rather to convince many a reluctant parent to sell off their children.

DaggerRareFugitive16.name: Elderguard
DaggerRareFugitive16.desc: This dagger's hilt has proven very useful for smashing enemy heads.

DaggerRareDeserters.name: Looter's Dagger
DaggerRareDeserters.desc: This dagger slit the throats of many innocent villagers.

DaggerRareTraitor.name: Traitor's Dagger
DaggerRareTraitor.desc: This dagger is proof that the Marheims don't owe their seats in the Broker Council to luck alone.

Viper.name: Viper
Viper.desc: A weapon designed to leave no chance to one's opponent.

DaggerLegendaryRuinG2.name: Behedite's Kris
DaggerLegendaryRuinG2.desc: The Ancients crafted this weapon as a tribute to Behedite. It was never actually his.

DaggerCrook.name: Kruppe's Saex
DaggerCrook.desc: Light and sharp, Kristoff Kruppe's weapon is unmatched when it comes to cutting throats.

DaggerLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Fighter's Cinquedea
DaggerLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: Although the Brotherhood usually disdains daggers, its members like to wield the cinquedea in the arena.

DaggerLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Dagger
DaggerLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: This dagger was originally used for bleeding big game. Its use in combat only dates back to the Edoranian war.

MaceStart.name: Old Club
MaceStart.desc: An old club with a split handle.

MaceCommonCivilian.name: Club
MaceCommonCivilian.desc: From table legs to broken branches, resourceful people can use anything as a club.

MaceCommonGuard.name: Bec de Corbin of the Guard
MaceCommonGuard.desc: Very easy to handle, this weapon is very commonly used by members of the Guard.

MaceCommonInquisition.name: Inquisition Flanged Mace
MaceCommonInquisition.desc: This mace strikes fear in fighters hearts from Belerion to Alazar.

MaceRarePit1.name: Studded Pit Mace
MaceRarePit1.desc: The incredible weight of this mace is balanced by its impressive efficiency.

MaceArena.name: Arena Spiked Mace
MaceArena.desc: This weapon may lack elegance, but none can withstand it.

MaceUncoAlazar.name: Alazarian Flanged Mace
MaceUncoAlazar.desc: The flanges on this mace call to mind Alazar's jagged mountains.

MaceUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Studded Mace
MaceUncoCraftT1.desc: While not the most sophisticated of weapons, this studded mace is more than suitable to kill someone.

MaceUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Mace
MaceUncoCraftT2.desc: The strength of this small and unassuming mace lies in its excellent balance.

MaceUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Flanged Mace
MaceUncoCraftT3.desc: Wielding this dangerously efficient weapon can be quite messy.

MaceUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Morning Star
MaceUncoCraftT4.desc: Nothing can withstand a blow from this morning star. Armour, shields, skulls... It crushes everything with ease.

MaceRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Morning Star
MaceRareCraftT5.desc: This morning star handles as easily as a club for maximum impact.

MaceUncoBandits.name: Crook's Studded Mace
MaceUncoBandits.desc: The rust on this weapon's spikes makes it even more terrifying.

MaceRareDeserters.name: Fugitive's Hammer
MaceRareDeserters.desc: A sturdy hammer featuring a handle adorned with runes.

MaceRareFugitive03.name: Misery
MaceRareFugitive03.desc: Meliance the Traitor has meticulously polished the metal to remove Lord Laheart's crest.

MaceRareFugitive10.name: Purgatory
MaceRareFugitive10.desc: This mace crushed many a skull for the heretic thoughts they contained.

MaceRareFugitive17.name: Basher
MaceRareFugitive17.desc: Despite its simplistic name, this mace is of superb quality and was forged with care.

MaceRareLegion.name: Hothead's Mace
MaceRareLegion.desc: The Legion started using maces during the Alazarian invasion.

MaceLegendaryRuin.name: Erkeshet's Mace
MaceLegendaryRuin.desc: No present-day blacksmith could ever hope to reproduce this weapon; the technique used to balance it is only known to the Ancients.

MaceLegendaryArena1A1.name: Iceward
MaceLegendaryArena1A1.desc: Made to crush and tear off armour plates, this bec de corbin is a dangerous weapon.

MaceLegendaryArena1E1.name: Stubby
MaceLegendaryArena1E1.desc: This bec de corbin was made for easier shield handling.

MaceLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Studded Mace
MaceLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: Maces aren't widely used in Harag, so there's a good chance that whoever designed this weapon was more of a bandit than a hunter.

Mace2HStart.name: Rusty Two-handed Hammer
Mace2HStart.desc: A massive hammer covered in rust.

Mace2HCommonDeserters.name: Deserters' Two-handed Hammer
Mace2HCommonDeserters.desc: Albeit not very subtle, this two-handed hammer is plenty effective.

Mace2HCommonSkelmar.name: Skelmar Mjllnir
Mace2HCommonSkelmar.desc: No weapon defines the Skelmar quite like the mjllnir, a warhammer that is terrifyingly effective against the heavy armour of the Five Kingdoms.

Mace2HRarePit1.name: Large Studded Pit Mace
Mace2HRarePit1.desc: Rumour has it that this mace actually comes from one of the Pit traps. After losing his weapon, a desperate fighter supposedly tore it out of the mechanism.

Mace2HUncoPirates.name: Pirate's Two-handed Mace
Mace2HUncoPirates.desc: You can look at the head of this mace from any angle, and it still looks like an Ichtyan face.

Mace2HUncoGuard.name: Two-handed Hammer of the Guard
Mace2HUncoGuard.desc: While Guard leadership had little taste for this weapon at first, its sheer might gradually won them over.

Mace2HUncoInquisition.name: Inquisition Hammer
Mace2HUncoInquisition.desc: This terrifying weapon has gradually fallen into disuse within the Inquisition, and is now only wielded by certain highly placed individuals.

Mace2HUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Two-handed Hammer
Mace2HUncoCraftT1.desc: Carrying this hammer is no easy feat, but it is well worth the effort once on the battlefield.

Mace2HUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Two-Handed Mace
Mace2HUncoCraftT2.desc: The spectral leather ensures a perfect grip... almost too perfect.

Mace2HUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Flanged Great Mace
Mace2HUncoCraftT3.desc: This mace can smash a helmet as if it were made of butter.

Mace2HUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Two-handed Morning Star
Mace2HUncoCraftT4.desc: Heavy but extremely sturdy, this morning star is known to wreak havoc on the battlefield.

Mace2HRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Two-Handed Morning Star
Mace2HRareCraftT5.desc: At the end of the fight, the head of this morning star should be as red as the vairmeil of its handle.

Mace2HRareCompanions.name: Goon's Two-Handed Mace
Mace2HRareCompanions.desc: The mere sight of this mace is enough to make smugglers break out in a cold sweat. So say the Mercenaries of the Brotherhood, at least.

Mace2HRareAlazar.name: Colossal Flanged Mace
Mace2HRareAlazar.desc: The Colossi of the Alazarian army are so named because they wield this impressive flanged mace.

Mace2HRareFugitive01.name: Rogue
Mace2HRareFugitive01.desc: Rojen used this mace to murder in their sleep the merchants he was meant to protect.

Mace2HRareFugitive15.name: Hope-Slayer
Mace2HRareFugitive15.desc: The shadow cast by this mace still haunts the residents of Harag.

Lucilla.name: Lucilla
Lucilla.desc: A two-handed morning star with a handle wrapped in human skin. Who did it belong to?

Mace2HInsect.name: Bog Thunder
Mace2HInsect.desc: Sensible travellers will overlook how ridiculous the Bog Thunder is and hold on to it for being remarkably effective against cardinal mosquitoes.

Mace2HLegendaryRuinS1.name: Dagan's Hammer
Mace2HLegendaryRuinS1.desc: This hammer's embellishments leave characteristic impressions on its victims' flesh. A peculiar way of decorating the battlefield...

Mace2HLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Fighter's Two-Handed Mace
Mace2HLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: Sergeant Ada is famous for wielding this awe-inspiring mace.

Mace2HLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Large Studded Mace
Mace2HLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: One of the most popular children's songs in Harag recounts how a druid named Segune decided to go rabbit hunting with a big mace. The chorus is famously hilarious.

Mace2HLegendaryChampion22.name: Macabre
Mace2HLegendaryChampion22.desc: Whatever this weapon's original name was, none could suit it better now.

AxeStart.name: Rusty Felling Axe
AxeStart.desc: This axe has been eaten away by rust.

AxeCommonDeserters.name: Chipped Axe
AxeCommonDeserters.desc: This axe was designed to chop wood, but it is used for something a little different now.

AxeCommonTrackers.name: Trackers' Axe
AxeCommonTrackers.desc: The intricate patterns on the blade are meant to repel the Ghost Pack.

AxeCommonSkelmar.name: Skelmar Axe
AxeCommonSkelmar.desc: The axe is a big part of Skelmar culture. It's the first weapon that young warriors learn to handle, and the emblem of numerous tribes.

AxeRarePit1.name: Pit Cleaver
AxeRarePit1.desc: This weapon is very popular in the Black Market Pit, and guarantees a rousing show every time.

AxeUncoPirates.name: Pirate's Axe
AxeUncoPirates.desc: This axe has a razor-sharp blade.

AxeRareBelerion.name: Ihrian Bardiche
AxeRareBelerion.desc: Forged from Akhedian steel, this small axe is decorated with Hessura's symbol.

AxeUncoTrackers.name: Hunter's Axe
AxeUncoTrackers.desc: This axe is adorned with every last feather of a marshland tit.

AxeUncoInquisition.name: Inquisition Axe
AxeUncoInquisition.desc: Considered barbaric and too similar to the Trackers weapons, this axe is rarely used within the Inquisition.

AxeArena.name: Arena Axe
AxeArena.desc: Small scratches indicate that this axe has been sharpened more than necessary.

AxeUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Axe
AxeUncoCraftT1.desc: The haft of this axe is covered in thick leather, allowing for a better grip on the weapon.

AxeUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Axe
AxeUncoCraftT2.desc: Trackers say that these axes recognise the blacksmith who forged them as their only master.

AxeUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Axe
AxeUncoCraftT3.desc: The rimesteel contained in this axe's blade shines brightest in the moonlight.

AxeUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Axe
AxeUncoCraftT4.desc: It takes such skill to craft this axe that successfully forging one is enough to make a blacksmith rich.

AxeRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Axe
AxeRareCraftT5.desc: The decorative motif on the head of this axe is a three-leaf clover. A fourth would have completely thrown off the weapons balance.

AxeRareFugitive07.name: Joras
AxeRareFugitive07.desc: Judging by the name carved on this axe's handle, Joras was probably the weapon's owner before it came into Bartes' possession.

AxeRareFugitive18.name: Traitor's Axe
AxeRareFugitive18.desc: Using the Krowns stolen from the Ludern Guard, Maudeg has improved this axe whilst on the run.

AxeRareCompanion.name: Peacebearer's Axe
AxeRareCompanion.desc: It is said that peacebearers were given their name because of their distinctive axes, the mere sight of which is enough to appease tensions.

AxeLegendaryHarag.name: Devotion
AxeLegendaryHarag.desc: For nearly 20 years, Bionn has firmly gripped the handle of this axe.

AxeLegendaryArena2G2.name: Victorious
AxeLegendaryArena2G2.desc: Trivetta Raniel has diligently marked every Arena Clash she's won using Victorious on the weapon's handle.

AxeLegendaryRuins.name: Neptis Axe
AxeLegendaryRuins.desc: The engravings on this axe are so fine and delicate that it looks more like a ceremonial weapon than a deadly tool.

AxeLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Axe
AxeLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: The hide that covers the shaft of this axe is always dyed black, in honour of friends lost to the Hunt of the Beast.

Axe2HStart.name: Old Two-handed Axe
Axe2HStart.desc: An old axe with a partly mouldy handle that seems to be crumbling away.

Axe2HCommonCompanions.name: Brotherhood Two-handed Axe
Axe2HCommonCompanions.desc: This axe was recently adopted by the Brotherhood under the influence of Belerion.

Axe2HCommonTrackers.name: Trackers' Great Axe
Axe2HCommonTrackers.desc: This axe is imbued with three animal spirits: marshland tit feathers, a crocswine fang, and the fur of a Ghost Pack monster.

Axe2HRarePit1.name: Pit Great Axe
Axe2HRarePit1.desc: Black Market rules state that the blade of this great axe must be dulled. But no one has really taken the time to check.

Axe2HUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Two-Handed Axe
Axe2HUncoCraftT1.desc: The blacksmith's signature can be seen on the haft.

Axe2HUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Great Axe
Axe2HUncoCraftT2.desc: Thanks to its long reach, the wielder of this great axe can fight several opponents head-on.

Axe2HUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Great Axe
Axe2HUncoCraftT3.desc: Forging this axe requires strict observance of iron and rimesteel proportions.

Axe2HUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Battle Axe
Axe2HUncoCraftT4.desc: According to Akhed tradition, the engravings adorning this axe's blade should be highly respected.

Axe2HRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Great Axe
Axe2HRareCraftT5.desc: This great axe would have been utterly ordinary without the perfect balance provided by the vairmeil on its handle.

Axe2HUncoOutlaws.name: Great Pig Iron
Axe2HUncoOutlaws.desc: Favourite of bandits and marauders alike, the Great Pig Iron is synonymous with prestige among outlaws.

Axe2HUncoInquisition.name: Two-handed Axe of the Eye
Axe2HUncoInquisition.desc: Equally fearsome when beheading miscreants or building a pyre, this axe is very popular in the Inquisition.

Axe2HRareFugitive08.name: Mutiny
Axe2HRareFugitive08.desc: Mutiny is an axe that seems much more balanced than its previous owner.

Axe2HRareFugitive11.name: Judgement
Axe2HRareFugitive11.desc: Without a doubt, the ideal tool for rapid and effective justice.

Axe2HRareSkelmar.name: Haersir's Two-handed Axe
Axe2HRareSkelmar.desc: The Haersirs spread terror in Ormance County by splitting Guards' and Legionaries' armour with their fearsome two-handed axes.

Splitter.name: Splitter
Splitter.desc: Alexa was deeply affected by the war. So, when she forged Splitter, she swore to only ever use it for chopping wood. A few days later, she beheaded a lord of Alazar.

Axe2HLegendaryRuin8.name: Enlil's Great Axe
Axe2HLegendaryRuin8.desc: The most versatile weapon a sailor could ask for. Its relentlessly sharp blade can cut through enemies, rigging, and hulls with equal ease.

Axe2HLegendaryChampion19.name: Yrsa
Axe2HLegendaryChampion19.desc: The name Yrsa is engraved on one face of the axe. There's no way of knowing if it's the name of the weapon, the blacksmith who forged it, or someone Kraven cares for.

Axe2HLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Great Axe
Axe2HLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: The symbol on this great axe represents the Beast. It smashes armour and shatters skulls as effectively as the Beast itself.

SwordStart.name: Rusty Gladius
SwordStart.desc: An old gladius that once belonged to a soldier.

SwordCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Straight Sword
SwordCommonAlazar.desc: This weapon is the epitome of Alazarian sobriety.

SwordCommonLegion.name: Legionary's Gladius
SwordCommonLegion.desc: This gladius isn't much to look at, but its owner received it as a gift from the Kingdom of Edoran.

SwordRarePit1.name: Pit Straight Sword
SwordRarePit1.desc: The coat of arms of this sword's previous owner has been artfully concealed with the colours of the Black Market.

SwordRarePirates.name: Privateer's Boarding Cutlass
SwordRarePirates.desc: Pirate weaponry at its most iconic.

SwordCommonLuth.name: Lute
SwordCommonLuth.desc: A beautiful instrument that can also serve as a makeshift weapon in a brawl.

SwordUncoCompanion.name: Brotherhood Knight's Sword
SwordUncoCompanion.desc: One needs just glance at the many decorations on the hilt and blade to know this sword belongs to the Brotherhood.

SwordUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Falchion
SwordUncoCraftT1.desc: This falchion is light and very sharp, but not terribly sturdy.

SwordUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Gladius
SwordUncoCraftT2.desc: The pallidity of the spectral leather seems to have bled onto the blade.

SwordUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Straight Sword
SwordUncoCraftT3.desc: Rimesteel is so strong that swords like this can be passed down from generation to generation.

SwordUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Katzbalger
SwordUncoCraftT4.desc: This weapon is so imposing and beautiful that it could belong to the General himself.

SwordRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Straight Sword
SwordRareCraftT5.desc: No matter how many owners its had, the vairmeil on its guard will never tarnish.

SwordRareInquisition.name: Gladius of the Eye
SwordRareInquisition.desc: The Eye on the pommel of this gladius induces an irresistible urge to burn heretics.

SwordRareFugitive02.name: Fervour
SwordRareFugitive02.desc: Sylla wielded this Ulfberht to slay innocents and heretics alike in the name of the All-seeing Eye.

SwordRareFugitive19.name: Strongblade
SwordRareFugitive19.desc: Passed from one owner to the next following some barbaric rule, this gladius is shrouded in mystery.

SwordRareGuard.name: Defender's Falchion
SwordRareGuard.desc: An easy-to-use weapon that any blacksmiths in the Five Kingdoms could forge with their eyes closed.

SwordRareSkelmar.name: Ulfark's Ulfberht
SwordRareSkelmar.desc: Well-balanced and easy to handle, the ulfberht is also an expensive and complicated weapon to forge. Only the richest of the Skelmar can afford one.

SwordLegendaryRuin.name: Mehyt's Kopis
SwordLegendaryRuin.desc: Forged from an immutable metal by the Ancients, this sword has vanquished time itself.

SwordLegendaryArena1G2.name: Glory
SwordLegendaryArena1G2.desc: Intended to guarantee its wielder's victory, this weapon still failed Toro, champion of Bernna's arena.

SwordLegendaryEvoland.name: Clink's Sword
SwordLegendaryEvoland.desc: It appears this sword was forged very far from the Five Kingdoms.

SwordLegendaryChampion11.name: Maelstrom
SwordLegendaryChampion11.desc: This sword was forged for someone of noble lineage. If it found its way into Eokeld's hands, its original owner has likely returned to the Light.

SwordLegendarySealord.name: Groac'h
SwordLegendarySealord.desc: According to Ganne, this boarding cutlass was crafted by Tules.

SwordLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Falchion
SwordLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: Less versatile than an axe, this falchion is generally left to the biggest show-off in the hunting party.

Sword2HStart.name: Old Longsword
Sword2HStart.desc: A sword with a long but damaged blade.

Sword2HCommonCompanions.name: Brotherhood Knight's Greatsword
Sword2HCommonCompanions.desc: The welts on the blade indicate that this weapon has seen many battles.

Sword2HCommonInquisition.name: Inquisition Spatha
Sword2HCommonInquisition.desc: This spatha is one of the Inquisition's most iconic weapons.

Sword2HRarePit1.name: Pit Longsword
Sword2HRarePit1.desc: Taking a bit more damage with every fight, this sword will likely end up breaking at the worst possible moment.

Sword2HUncoBelerion.name: Ihrian Great Shamshir
Sword2HUncoBelerion.desc: Difficult to wield because of its curved blade, the great shamshir was long reserved to Ihraa's finest swordsmen.

Sword2HArena.name: Arena Great Falchion
Sword2HArena.desc: Its owner was a famous gladiator who likely fell as the crowd cheered on.

Sword2HUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Great Falchion
Sword2HUncoCraftT1.desc: This great falchion may not be sharp enough to behead an opponent, but it will definitely break their neck.

Sword2HUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Great Gladius
Sword2HUncoCraftT2.desc: This great gladius gives off a unique and somewhat frightening aura that often makes its owner put it away before sleeping.

Sword2HUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Flamberge
Sword2HUncoCraftT3.desc: With its bluish hues, this flamberge garners both admiration and jealousy.

Sword2HUncoLegion.name: Legionary's Spatha
Sword2HUncoLegion.desc: The hilt of this weapon was repaired several times. Its blade, however, does not have the slightest dent.

Sword2HRareAlazar.name: Brigadier's Flamberge
Sword2HRareAlazar.desc: The flamberge used by the royal army owes its appearance to the great master painter Sigurd Adr Alazar.

Sword2HUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Zweihnder
Sword2HUncoCraftT4.desc: Wielding this weapon takes as much skill as forging it.

Sword2HRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Claymore
Sword2HRareCraftT5.desc: A claymore of this quality needs no embellishments.

Sword2HRareFugitive05.name: Fredegund
Sword2HRareFugitive05.desc: No one knows how this sword got its name... Perhaps it is a tribute to someone the Old Crone deeply cherished?

Sword2HRareFugitive13.name: Claret
Sword2HRareFugitive13.desc: The weapon's handle still gives off the aroma of cheap wine.

Sword2HRareOutlaws.name: Criminal's Claymore
Sword2HRareOutlaws.desc: Bandits use this sword as a mace when it gets dull.

Sword2HLegendaryArena1G2.name: Prosperity
Sword2HLegendaryArena1G2.desc: Though his favourite weapon never produced what its name implied, Kogo refused to part with it.

Sword2HLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Fighter's Greatsword
Sword2HLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: Duller than other blades the Brotherhood wields, Lieutenant Loderans' weapon is no less deadly.

Sword2HLegendaryChampion20.name: Despair
Sword2HLegendaryChampion20.desc: As though its appearance alone weren't enough to strike fear into his enemies' hearts, High Jarl Sven named his favourite sword Despair.

Sword2HLegendaryRuinIR2.name: Urashu Great Kopis
Sword2HLegendaryRuinIR2.desc: Strange marks on the flat of this kopis suggest that someone tried to break it. Fortunately, the high quality of its metal stopped them from succeeding.

Sword2HLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Great Falchion
Sword2HLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: The pommel of this great falchion imitates the jaws of the Beast, recognisable by its flat teeth.

PolearmStart.name: Farmer's Pitchfork
PolearmStart.desc: A pitchfork used to turn soil and stir up rebellion.

PolearmCommonCivilian.name: Rancher's Pitchfork
PolearmCommonCivilian.desc: A pitchfork that seems to have been used to chase away a few yokels.

PolearmCommonGuard.name: Watcher's Spear
PolearmCommonGuard.desc: An unremarkable spear that was improved using whatever its owner had at hand.

PolearmCommonBelerion.name: Ihrian Spear
PolearmCommonBelerion.desc: The shaft of this spear features the intermingled colours of Mihr and Hessura.

PolearmRarePit1.name: Pit Pike
PolearmRarePit1.desc: In his youth, the Baron fought with a spear very similar to this one.

PolearmArena.name: Arena Spear
PolearmArena.desc: The wood has absorbed too much sweat and blood to retain its original colour.

PolearmUncoAlazar.name: Alazarian Halberd
PolearmUncoAlazar.desc: A scholar and a blacksmith worked closely together to create this weapon.

PolearmUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Spear
PolearmUncoCraftT1.desc: The blacksmith who created such a weapon must have been very cross with someone.

PolearmUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Pike
PolearmUncoCraftT2.desc: Made with spectral leather, this pike boasts both reach and sturdiness.

PolearmUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Halberd
PolearmUncoCraftT3.desc: Famous for wreaking havoc on Edoranian legionaries during the conquest of Alazar, this halberd is wielded by elite spearmen.

PolearmUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Corseque
PolearmUncoCraftT4.desc: The appearance of this corseque hasn't changed much since it was brought to the Five Kingdoms from Akhed.

PolearmRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Partisan
PolearmRareCraftT5.desc: The handle of this partisan can be carved from any variety of wood, as long as its reinforced with vairmeil.

PolearmUncoDeserters.name: Deserters' Lance
PolearmUncoDeserters.desc: This lance was once part of a foot soldier's kit, but years of outdoor use have greatly changed it.

PolearmUncoLegion.name: Legion Pilum
PolearmUncoLegion.desc: Simply touching this pilum's shaft makes you want to invade Harag.

PolearmUncoInquisition.name: Inquisition Pilum
PolearmUncoInquisition.desc: The pilum had its glory days under the Empire of Jeru, but was later replaced with other weapons considered to be more modern.

PolearmRareLegion.name: Officer's Pilum
PolearmRareLegion.desc: Legion officers' pilums can be recognised by their sturdiness and intricate details, but also because their owner's name is engraved on the shaft.

PolearmRareFugitive04.name: Corseque of Remembrance
PolearmRareFugitive04.desc: Obsessed with Edoran's glorious past, Captain Gacius had a corseque forged from an ancient model.

PolearmRareFugitive14.name: Crocsting
PolearmRareFugitive14.desc: Engraved on the tip of this halberd, the silhouette of a massive crocswine is revealed in all its fearsome beauty when dipped in blood.

PolearmRareTrackers.name: Pursuer's Pike
PolearmRareTrackers.desc: Light armour doesn't stand a chance against this pike, that was made to pierce Ghost Pack hides.

PolearmLegendaryRuinH1.name: Horoun's Partisan
PolearmLegendaryRuinH1.desc: It is impossible to identify what this partisan is made of. After a few battles, you realise it is indestructible.

PolearmLegendaryGrinmeer.name: Liberator
PolearmLegendaryGrinmeer.desc: This halberd was meant for a Grinmeer Guard, but for some reason, Fenris has removed all the leather from it.

PolearmLegendaryPathKnowledge.name: Jeru's Spear
PolearmLegendaryPathKnowledge.desc: Saint Jeru himself wielded this spear in the early days of the Five Kingdoms' history.

PolearmLegendaryBelerion.name: Belerion's Spear
PolearmLegendaryBelerion.desc: Rumour has it this spear belonged to Belerion Halios, but it looks to be much older than the legend.

PolearmLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Hunting Spear
PolearmLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: This weapon is difficult to handle: at any moment, the lancer's hands could slip on the shaft and come into contact with the bare bone of the Beast.

BowStart.name: Improvised Bow
BowStart.desc: The strange curvature of this bow betrays the fact that it was not designed by a master fletcher.

BowCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Bow
BowCommonAlazar.desc: The wood is barely visible under the rimesteel reinforcements.

BowCommonOutlaws.name: Raider's Bow
BowCommonOutlaws.desc: This bow is small enough for its wielder to run away unencumbered.

BowCommonLegion.name: Legion Bow
BowCommonLegion.desc: Easy to make and repair, this short bow is ideal for equipping the Legion's many archers.

BowRarePit.name: Pit Bow
BowRarePit.desc: Despite a coat or two of rather convincing silver paint, this bow is made of ordinary wood.

BowRarePirates.name: Pirate's Bow
BowRarePirates.desc: This short bow has limited range, but it is more than sufficient when boarding an enemy ship.

BowRareBelerion.name: Ihrian Bow
BowRareBelerion.desc: Using a bow at sea is far from easy, but the Ihrians haven't given up on this weapon.

BowArena.name: Arena Bow
BowArena.desc: This bow lacks range, as if it were made to be used indoors.

BowUncoDeserters.name: Fugitive's Bow
BowUncoDeserters.desc: Made to bring honour to a lord and glory to a soldier, this bow ended up in very unworthy hands.

BowUncoCompanions.name: Brotherhood Bow
BowUncoCompanions.desc: Each Brotherhood bow is different: the owner of this one carved their children's first names on it.

BowUncoCraftT1.name: Longbow
BowUncoCraftT1.desc: Made from yew, this devastatingly powerful bow must be wielded with care.

BowUncoCraftT2.name: Ghostly Bow
BowUncoCraftT2.desc: Something in the monster's hide makes this bow easier to handle.

BowUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Bow
BowUncoCraftT3.desc: The curvature of this bow was precisely calculated so that it wouldn't break in half when drawn.

BowUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Bow
BowUncoCraftT4.desc: Who could have guessed that reinforcing a bow in this particular spot could make it so powerful?

BowRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Bow
BowRareCraftT5.desc: The string of this bow is made of finely braided vairmeil.

BowRareGuard.name: War Bow
BowRareGuard.desc: By no means rare, this war bow is light and precise.

BowRareTrackers.name: Hunter's Bow
BowRareTrackers.desc: The Trackers are hunters above all else: this bow is their favourite weapon.

BowRareFugitive06.name: Liberator
BowRareFugitive06.desc: Unlike traditional Harag bows, no animal parts were used to craft the liberator.

BowRareFugitive12.name: Avenger
BowRareFugitive12.desc: Seething with hatred, Captain Eleora engraved the name of her enemy on her weapon.

BowRareInquisition.name: Herald of the Eye
BowRareInquisition.desc: Wielded by Inquisition messengers, these bows are laid out in bright sunlight for several days to receive the Eye's blessing.

BowLegendaryEliteWorld.name: The Indomitable One
BowLegendaryEliteWorld.desc: Kaghal engraved detailed figures into the wood of this bow. They recount the warrior's youth.

BowLegendaryRuinH1.name: Narses' Bow
BowLegendaryRuinH1.desc: It takes a lot of effort to draw this bow, but its stopping power is second to none. This is probably due to its string, carefully woven from fibres strangely reminiscent of the Beast's fur.

BowLegendaryArenaH1.name: Sleuth
BowLegendaryArenaH1.desc: Under its ornaments and brass reinforcements, Sleuth used to be an authentic Tracker bow.

BowLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Fighter's Bow
BowLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: Lieutenant Merin is a fearsome archer who made her arena weapon herself.

BowLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Bow
BowLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: It's not uncommon to find charlatans in Gosenberg claiming to offer these bows for sale. To avoid any nasty surprises in combat, the Trackers recommend that you craft them yourself.

FistStart.name: Thug's Katar
FistStart.desc: This katar was made from a belt and the tip of a sword.

FistRarePit1.name: Pit Claw
FistRarePit1.desc: There are versions of this claw without sharpened ends, but fighters and crowds find them far less exciting.

FistUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Katar
FistUncoCraftT1.desc: Broken fingers are a common occurrence for those first learning to handle a katar.

FistUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Claw
FistUncoCraftT2.desc: Fighters wielding this claw always look fearsome.

FistUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Cestus
FistUncoCraftT3.desc: The rimesteel's strength allows this cestus to punch through all sorts of materials.

FistUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Katar
FistUncoCraftT4.desc: Every fighter dreams of owning a weapon like this.

FistRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Cestus
FistRareCraftT5.desc: With its all-vairmeil padding, this cestus finally gives you a way to eviscerate your enemies without injuring yourself!

FistArena.name: Arena Katar
FistArena.desc: These weapons are very popular in Belerion, and fans are willing to pay high prices to see them in action.

FistCommonPirates.name: Pirate's Cestus
FistCommonPirates.desc: The guard on this cestus is badly damaged. Its owner must have used it to fend off his opponents' blows.

FistUncoBelerion.name: Ihrian Katar
FistUncoBelerion.desc: The blade of this katar was designed to rip through the enemy's guts.

FistUncoTrackers.name: Tracker's Claw
FistUncoTrackers.desc: The Trackers use this claw to cover their tracks and shift the blame for their actions to poor, innocent bears.

FistUncoDeserters.name: Deserter's Katar
FistUncoDeserters.desc: It's no great surprise to find such a disreputable weapon in the hands of a deserter.

FistUncoOutlaws.name: Bandit's Katar
FistUncoOutlaws.desc: This weapon is part of what makes dark alleyways such a nightmare for villagers.

FistUncoCompanions.name: Brotherhood Cestus
FistUncoCompanions.desc: The Brotherhood restricts use of the cestus to Mercenaries entrusted with discreet missions.

FistUncoSkelmar.name: Skelmar Katar
FistUncoSkelmar.desc: The Skelmar discovered katars during pillaging runs along the Edoranian coast. Though they originally looted them from the bodies of their victims, the tribes eventually learned how to make their own versions of these weapons.

FistLegendaryArenaB1.name: Ripper
FistLegendaryArenaB1.desc: Crafted from Akhedian steel, this weapon was made for arena fights but is perfectly suitable for the battlefield as well.

FistLegendaryRuinB1.name: Sippur Katar
FistLegendaryRuinB1.desc: This katar is different to other ancient weapons. It seems simpler and less ornate.

FistLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Claw
FistLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: While this weapon is unlikely to be confused with one of the Beast's actual claws, it's still perfectly capable of gutting an enemy or running them through.

CrossbowStart.name: Rusty Crossbow
CrossbowStart.desc: It's hard to guess how much longer this crossbow will hold together. Rust has started to affect the mechanism.

CrossbowUncoGuard.name: Guard Crossbow
CrossbowUncoGuard.desc: With its intentionally simple design, this crossbow can be handled by just about anyone, with no need for long and expensive training for Guard recruits.

CrossbowUncoLegion.name: Legion Crossbow
CrossbowUncoLegion.desc: The Legion is where the first crossbows started appearing just a few years back. Within its ranks, men say that with a weapon like this, the Harag war might have ended quite differently.

CrossbowUncoInquisition.name: Inquisition Crossbow
CrossbowUncoInquisition.desc: Adapted from the Legion's crossbows, the Inquisition's preferred model boasts a tougher type of wood and a more complicated mechanism.

CrossbowUncoAlazar.name: Alazar Crossbow
CrossbowUncoAlazar.desc: Crossbowmen enjoy little respect in Alazar, probably because their chosen weapon was invented by a rival kingdom.

CrossbowUncoSkelmar.name: Skelmar Crossbow
CrossbowUncoSkelmar.desc: It's quite ironic that a weapon created to fight the Skelmar is now so common in their ranks.

CrossbowUncoPirate.name: Pirate Crossbow
CrossbowUncoPirate.desc: Made from the hulls of their defeated enemies' ships, pirate crossbows also feature a unique mechanism.

CrossbowUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Crossbow
CrossbowUncoCraftT1.desc: This small, unpretentious crossbow is particularly easy to handle.

CrossbowArena.name: Arena Crossbow
CrossbowArena.desc: This small, unpretentious crossbow is particularly easy to handle.

CrossbowUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Crossbow
CrossbowUncoCraftT2.desc: When the string is released, it sounds like the scream of an unearthly monster.

CrossbowUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Crossbow
CrossbowUncoCraftT3.desc: With its rimesteel construction, this crossbow is as solid as they come. One sometimes hears of crossbowmen using it as a mace after firing their last bolt.

CrossbowUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Crossbow
CrossbowUncoCraftT4.desc: The Akhedian steel gives this crossbow such incredible power that it could probably fire a bolt right through a pony.

CrossbowRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Crossbow
CrossbowRareCraftT5.desc: This crossbow is a masterpiece of smithwork and alchemy. Once you try it, youll never go back.

CrossbowLegendaryArenaE2.name: Revenge (Doctored)
CrossbowLegendaryArenaE2.desc: By doctoring her crossbow's mechanism, Attia has achieved an unmatched rate of fire.

CrossbowLegendaryArenaE2Legal.name: Revenge
CrossbowLegendaryArenaE2Legal.desc: The doctored mechanism that made Revenge so fearsome in battle has been repaired. What it has lost in rate of fire, it has gained in durability.

CrossbowLegendaryChampion21.name: Ravager
CrossbowLegendaryChampion21.desc: By the look of it, this weapon shouldn't actually work. Its mechanism, its bow and even its stock all come from different crossbows, assembled in a way that's as haphazard as it is ridiculous. Yet few are as terrifyingly effective.

CrossbowLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Crossbow
CrossbowLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: The blacksmith who invented this crossbow never set foot in Harag, yet he was able to perfectly capture the essence of the Hunt with this weapon.

ShieldStart.name: Barrel Lid
ShieldStart.desc: A shield that gives off a faint odour of cheap wine.

ShieldCommonGeneric.name: Training Buckler
ShieldCommonGeneric.desc: This cute little shield reminds you of your childhood.

ShieldCommonGuard.name: Buckler of the Guard
ShieldCommonGuard.desc: A buckler that all bandits know very well.

ShieldCommonLegionary.name: Legion Buckler
ShieldCommonLegionary.desc: Many legionaries sleep with their buckler strapped to their back to ward off backstabbers.

ShieldCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Buckler
ShieldCommonAlazar.desc: It is said that during the Edoranian War, Alazar cut down an entire forest to equip its army with bucklers like this one.

ShieldCommonSkelmar.name: Skelmar Kite Shield
ShieldCommonSkelmar.desc: The Skelmar sometimes use the tip of their kite shields to bash in their enemies' armour.

ShieldCommonCraftT1.name: Targe
ShieldCommonCraftT1.desc: A small wooden shield, sturdy and practical.

ShieldUncoAlazar.name: Alazarian Heater Shield
ShieldUncoAlazar.desc: Stamped with Alazar's emblem and bearing the king's colours, this shield is recognisable in all of the Five Kingdoms.

ShieldArena.name: Arena Heater Shield
ShieldArena.desc: With iron reinforcements, this wooden shield is sturdier and can deflect powerful blows.

ShieldUncoGeneric.name: Reinforced Training Buckler
ShieldUncoGeneric.desc: It seems the owner, unable to afford a real shield, simply reinforced their training buckler.

ShieldUncoSmugglers.name: Smuggler's Buckler
ShieldUncoSmugglers.desc: This shield was clearly repainted: its previous owner's colours are still visible under the new coat of paint.

ShieldUncoCompanions.name: Brotherhood Buckler
ShieldUncoCompanions.desc: This buckler is standard issue in the Brotherhood, so much so that they made it their emblem.

ShieldUncoCraftT1.name: Reinforced Buckler
ShieldUncoCraftT1.desc: A reinforced buckler is a timeless classic among mercenaries.

ShieldUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Buckler
ShieldUncoCraftT2.desc: Anyone would look intimidating with such a shield.

ShieldUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Heater Shield
ShieldUncoCraftT3.desc: People usually paint this shield with their own colours.

ShieldUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Heavy Heater Shield
ShieldUncoCraftT4.desc: The character painted on this shield looks like Saint Eleor, but some in the Legion claim that it actually represents General Edor.

ShieldRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Shield
ShieldRareCraftT5.desc: This exceptionally lightweight shield is covered with a sheet of vairmeil to protect it from edged weapons.

ShieldBanner.name: Emblazoned Buckler
ShieldBanner.desc: A buckler on your troop's symbol can be painted and which you can show off all over the world.

ShieldUncoBandits.name: Bandit Heater Shield
ShieldUncoBandits.desc: This shield has been amply used as a blunt weapon.

ShieldUncoTrackers.name: Trackers' Buckler
ShieldUncoTrackers.desc: This buckler is designed to withstand the claws of the Ghost Pack monsters. You would be hard pushed to find a sturdier one.

ShieldRarePit1.name: Standard Heater Shield
ShieldRarePit1.desc: No matter where the fighters come from, this shield always bears the colours of the Black Market.

ShieldRareGeneric.name: Veteran Roundel
ShieldRareGeneric.desc: This roundel was made to age with its owner.

ShieldRareDeserter.name: Corporal's Roundel
ShieldRareDeserter.desc: Instead of doing his army proud, the corporal this roundel belonged to deserted and took the shield with him.

ShieldRareInquisition.name: Paladins Scutum
ShieldRareInquisition.desc: A staple of any self-respecting paladin's equipment, this scutum was blessed in the cathedral of Edoran.

ShieldRareLegion.name: Hothead's Scutum
ShieldRareLegion.desc: This distinctive shield played a crucial part in Edor's war.

ShieldRareGuard.name: Defender's Roundel
ShieldRareGuard.desc: Nothing gets through defenders of the Guard equipped with heavy armour and this roundel.

ShieldRarePirates.name: Privateer's Roundel
ShieldRarePirates.desc: The patterns on this roundel are not engraved, but inlaid in the Ihrian style.

ShieldRareBelerion.name: Solar Aspis
ShieldRareBelerion.desc: Shields were never especially popular in Ihraa. Even so, this one was forged with a great deal of care.

ShieldRareCompanion.name: Peacebearer's Roundel
ShieldRareCompanion.desc: Rumour has it that Brothers were seen breaking down doors using only their shield as a ram.

ShieldRareSkelmar.name: Ulfark's Kite Shield
ShieldRareSkelmar.desc: Though reinforced with iron or rimesteel, an Ulfark's kite shield still weighs the same as other Skelmar shields.

ShieldThorn.name: Bloodthirsty Heater Shield
ShieldThorn.desc: This shield becomes even more terrifying when parts of the wielder's opponents get stuck to it.

ShieldGuardian.name: Guardian's Heater Shield
ShieldGuardian.desc: This shield was a symbol of the Laheart family for centuries. Nowadays, no lord uses it in combat for fear of damaging it.

ShieldLegendaryArenaE1.name: Rampart
ShieldLegendaryArenaE1.desc: It is said that nothing can break through this shield, and if it wasn't enough, its edge was maliciously sharpened to cleave skulls.

ShieldLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Saga
ShieldLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: This shield belonged to a knight clad in gold from head to toe.

ShieldLegendaryRuinE2.name: Dumuzi's Aspis
ShieldLegendaryRuinE2.desc: This shield was forged to honour Dumuzi's protective spirit. Although it was never destined for war, it has all the qualities a soldier could hope for.

ShieldLegendaryCraftIR2.name: Beast's Targe
ShieldLegendaryCraftIR2.desc: The back of this targe is often covered with liturgical inscriptions, in case terror-stricken Trackers forget their customary prayers.

BlindingPowder.name: Blinding Powder
BlindingPowder.desc: A little pouch of fine powder.

RagePowder.name: Powdered Rage
RagePowder.desc: This controversial powder contains spices that burn the eyes and nostrils of animals to make them more aggressive.

OdorousPowder.name: Pungent Powder
OdorousPowder.desc: The mix of plants and putrid flesh makes this powder very tempting to animals.

ConfusingPowder.name: Confusion Powder
ConfusingPowder.desc: This powder burns and itches when it comes into contact with the skin.

IncendiaryFlask.name: Incendiary Flask
IncendiaryFlask.desc: An alcohol-soaked rag inserted partway into a flask.

HandHeldFrag.name: Hand Bomblet
HandHeldFrag.desc: A small iron capsule filled with highly explosive powder.

HandRecoil.name: Recoil Bomblet
HandRecoil.desc: This bomblet contains spices that make your eyes and nose burn.

BeeBomb.name: Bee Bomblet
BeeBomb.desc: There are probably better things to do with this bee-filled box, but someone decided it would be a good idea to toss it at enemies.

CorrosiveBomb.name: Corrosive Bomblet
CorrosiveBomb.desc: When this bomblet explodes, it projects a liquid that can eat away at enemies' armour.

BeastSplashBomb.name: Beast's Flask
BeastSplashBomb.desc: When the liquid in this flask comes in contact with air, it evaporates in a bluish cloud not unlike the mist that surrounds the Beast.

PoisonedFlask.name: Poison Flask
PoisonedFlask.desc: Many people poisoned themselves when trying to use this type of poison.

Torch.name: Torch
Torch.desc: A torch that can illuminate the darkest places as well as set infected flesh on fire.

TorchRuins.name: Looter's Torch
TorchRuins.desc: Not only does this torch light your path, it can also be used to smash the heads of overeager creepers.

Grapple.name: Grappling Hook
Grapple.desc: A large fish hook tied to the end of a rope.

GrapplePirates.name: Brutish Grapnel
GrapplePirates.desc: A fearsome grapnel that hooks on to pieces of armour and tears them loose.

GrappleBelerion.name: Boarding Grapnel
GrappleBelerion.desc: The element of surprise can make a world of difference when boarding, and having a grapnel like this one will catch anyone off guard.

SeaHorn.name: Foghorn
SeaHorn.desc: It doesn't matter if a foghorn is crafted from a horn or a shell, as long as it makes plenty of noise.

ThrowingAxe.name: Throwing Hatchet
ThrowingAxe.desc: This throwing hatchet is both light and deadly.

ThrowingAxeT2.name: Ghost Throwing Hatchet
ThrowingAxeT2.desc: It is said that this hatchet will come back on its own to a wielder it likes...

ThrowingAxeT3.name: Rimesteel Throwing Hatchet
ThrowingAxeT3.desc: This hatchet's edge will cleave any surface perfectly, be it wood, flesh, shoulder, stomach...

ThrowingAxeT4.name: Akhedian Steel Throwing Hatchet
ThrowingAxeT4.desc: Seldom seen on the battlefield due to its price, this efficient dagger deserves better than to be used for show.

ThrowingAxeT5.name: Vairmeil Throwing Hatchet
ThrowingAxeT5.desc: Thrown with sufficient force, this hatchet will embed itself easily in your enemies skulls.

PowerfulThrowingAxe.name: Throwing Axe
PowerfulThrowingAxe.desc: Heavier and bulkier than a hatchet, this throwing axe requires some training to be used properly.

PowerfulThrowingAxeT2.name: Ghost Throwing Axe
PowerfulThrowingAxeT2.desc: This axe makes a blood-curdling noise when flying through the air.

PowerfulThrowingAxeT3.name: Rimesteel Throwing Axe
PowerfulThrowingAxeT3.desc: Considered barbaric in Alazar, the use of this throwing axe has been abandoned over time.

PowerfulThrowingAxeT4.name: Akhedian Steel Throwing Axe
PowerfulThrowingAxeT4.desc: Countless Akhedian heroes wielded this type of axe.

PowerfulThrowingAxeT5.name: Vairmeil Throwing Axe
PowerfulThrowingAxeT5.desc: The price of this axe has given many owners pause when it comes time to throw it.

PoisonedThrowingKnife.name: Poisoned Throwing Knife
PoisonedThrowingKnife.desc: A greenish poison drips from the knife's blade.

PoisonedThrowingKnifeT2.name: Poisoned Ghost Throwing Knife
PoisonedThrowingKnifeT2.desc: A small and sturdy knife used to poison a target from a distance.

PoisonedThrowingKnifeT3.name: Poisoned Rimesteel Throwing Knife
PoisonedThrowingKnifeT3.desc: One might think that it's a waste to use rimesteel to forge a knife that is likely to get lost quickly. One would have a point.

PoisonedThrowingKnifeT4.name: Poisoned Akhedian Steel Throwing Knife
PoisonedThrowingKnifeT4.desc: Bandits like to carry such a knife on their belts as a sign of success.

PoisonedThrowingKnifeT5.name: Poisoned Vairmeil Throwing Knife
PoisonedThrowingKnifeT5.desc: Despite its deadly efficiency, assassins are often reluctant to use this knife. Few blacksmiths craft them, making it easy to track where they come from.

ThrowingKnifeIR2.name: Beast's Throwing Knife
ThrowingKnifeIR2.desc: The thrower generally feels great relief as soon as this knife leaves their hand.

ThrowingKnife.name: Throwing Knife
ThrowingKnife.desc: This knife is both light and sharp.

ThrowingKnifeT2.name: Ghost Throwing Knife
ThrowingKnifeT2.desc: Many careless warriors lost fingers because these weapons.

ThrowingKnifeT3.name: Rimesteel Throwing Knife
ThrowingKnifeT3.desc: The sound this knife makes when it flies through the air is called requiem.

ThrowingKnifeT4.name: Akhedian Steel Throwing Knife
ThrowingKnifeT4.desc: Some believe throwing weapons are dishonourable, but many would be tempted to make an exception for a knife like this.

ThrowingKnifeT5.name: Vairmeil Throwing Knife
ThrowingKnifeT5.desc: This exceptionally light knife can be thrown at astonishing speeds.

ThrowingSickle.name: Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSickle.desc: With its light-weight, curved blade, this sickle can cut off hands as easily as it cuts grass.

ThrowingSickleT2.name: Ghost Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSickleT2.desc: This flexible and sharp blade has already proven its worth.

ThrowingSickleT3.name: Rimesteel Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSickleT3.desc: Crafted from precious metal, this sickle barely resembles its farming implement forebear.

ThrowingSickleT4.name: Akhedian Steel Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSickleT4.desc: To a farmer, it would seem crazy to forge a simple sickle using such a precious metal. But this is not a simple sickle...

ThrowingSickleT5.name: Vairmeil Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSickleT5.desc: By the time you see this sickle slicing through the air, its already too late.

ThrowingSicklePetrifying.name: Petrifying Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSicklePetrifying.desc: This sickle is coated with a poison that can petrify the soul of its target.

ThrowingSicklePetrifyingT2.name: Petrifying Ghost Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSicklePetrifyingT2.desc: This sickle could be mistaken for a humble tool, if it wasn't dripping with poison.

ThrowingSicklePetrifyingT3.name: Petrifying Rimesteel Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSicklePetrifyingT3.desc: Rimesteel's colour pops out when covered in poison.

ThrowingSicklePetrifyingT4.name: Petrifying Akhedian Steel Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSicklePetrifyingT4.desc: This amazing sickle is forged from steel of outstanding quality and coated in a most devious poison.

ThrowingSicklePetrifyingT5.name: Petrifying Vairmeil Throwing Sickle
ThrowingSicklePetrifyingT5.desc: You really have to despise your opponent to add poison to a weapon already reinforced with vairmeil.

SwampFlask.name: Swamp Flask
SwampFlask.desc: A flask filled with a nauseating liquid.

HaragConcoction.name: Harag Concoction
HaragConcoction.desc: A vial containing a foul smelling liquid, designed to keep Harag swamp mosquitoes away.

ThrowingLegendaryArenaA1.name: Faithless
ThrowingLegendaryArenaA1.desc: This throwing axe was custom-made for Lisbeth. It will never fit another warrior's hand as perfectly as hers.

ThrowingAxeLegendary01.name: Solar
ThrowingAxeLegendary01.desc: This throwing axe was created after an encounter between the Trackers and the Beast. Rumour has it that the names engraved on its shaft are those of Mercenaries who came to their aid.

ThrowingAxeLegendary02.name: Progress
ThrowingAxeLegendary02.desc: Professor Winfrith and his scholars were able to create this throwing axe thanks to the artefacts found in the Ludern Tomb.

BundleThrowingLeftHandSpecialT1.name: Apprentice Alchemist Set - I
BundleThrowingLeftHandSpecialT1.desc: Learn the following <narrator>Special Throwing Weapon</narrator> blueprints:

BundleThrowingLeftHandSpecialT2.name: Experienced Alchemist Set - I
BundleThrowingLeftHandSpecialT2.desc: Learn the following <narrator>Special Throwing Weapon</narrator> blueprints:

BundleThrowingLeftHandSpecialT3.name: Journeyman Alchemist Set - I
BundleThrowingLeftHandSpecialT3.desc: Learn the following <narrator>Special Throwing Weapon</narrator> blueprints:

BundleThrowingLeftHandSpecialT4.name: Master Alchemist Set - I

BundleTwoHandedSwordAxeMaceT5.name: Second Master Blacksmith Set - Weapons II

BundleDaggerFistT5.name: Second Master Blacksmith Set - Weapons IV

BundleAccessoriesSpecialIR2.name: Beast Accessories
BundleAccessoriesSpecialIR2.desc: Learn blueprints for the following <narrator> Accessories</narrator>:

HeavyArmorCommonGeneric.name: Battleplate
HeavyArmorCommonGeneric.desc: This armour has few downsides apart from its weight.

HeavyArmorCommonLegion.name: Legion Segmenta
HeavyArmorCommonLegion.desc: This armour was originally reserved for captains, but they are now also widely used by the Legion's heavy fighters.

HeavyArmorCommonDeserters.name: Deserter's Plate Armour
HeavyArmorCommonDeserters.desc: The rattling sound this armour makes when the wearer walks can be very irksome after a while.

HeavyArmorCommonGuard.name: Guard Battleplate
HeavyArmorCommonGuard.desc: This armour is a source of pride for those who procured it lawfully.

HeavyArmorCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Battleplate
HeavyArmorCommonAlazar.desc: Alazar is famed not only for its quality ore, but also for its excellent blacksmiths: this armour is beyond compare.

HeavyArmorCommonSkelmar.name: Skelmar Breastplate
HeavyArmorCommonSkelmar.desc: This breastplate contains pieces from the armour of the many different armies that the Skelmar have faced.

HeavyArmorRareSkelmar.name: Haersir's Breastplate
HeavyArmorRareSkelmar.desc: The face of the god of death is engraved on the front plate of this armour. It looks a lot like the Beast.

HeavyArmorUncoAlazar.name: Valuable Alazarian Battleplate
HeavyArmorUncoAlazar.desc: As one would be hard-pressed to improve upon the Alazarian battleplate, the craftsman merely added nicer-looking fur and used a higher quality dye.

HeavyArmorCommonInquisition.name: Inquisition Segmenta
HeavyArmorCommonInquisition.desc: This sinister armour blends in with the night and glimmers in the sunlight, terrifying when you hear it, frightening when you see it.

HeavyArmorCommonPit1.name: Pit Segmenta
HeavyArmorCommonPit1.desc: After hijacking a shipment of Legion armour, the Black Market and its goons repainted it all in their colours.

HeavyArmorCommonPit2.name: Pit Battleplate
HeavyArmorCommonPit2.desc: This very simple battleplate is gradually losing ground to the segmenta, which more effectively captures the crowd's attention.

HeavyArmorUncoGeneric.name: Full Battleplate
HeavyArmorUncoGeneric.desc: This piece of armour is made of plates covered with rainproof coating.

HeavyArmorUncoCraftT1.name: Reinforced Plate Armour
HeavyArmorUncoCraftT1.desc: This suit of armour is designed to withstand just about anything.

HeavyArmorUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Breastplate
HeavyArmorUncoCraftT2.desc: Many have reported feeling uneasy while wearing this type of armour.

HeavyArmorUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Battleplate
HeavyArmorUncoCraftT3.desc: Its ordinary appearance makes its resilience all the more surprising.

HeavyArmorUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Battleplate
HeavyArmorUncoCraftT4.desc: This armour is a successful blend of steel from Akhed and Five Kingdoms craftsmanship.

HeavyArmorRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Plate Armour
HeavyArmorRareCraftT5.desc: A few strips of vairmeil can be seen under the plates of this armour.

HeavyArmorArena.name: Arena Breastplate
HeavyArmorArena.desc: This slightly dented cuirass has been straightened multiple times, and will be yet again.

HeavyArmorUncoCompanions.name: Brotherhood Battleplate
HeavyArmorUncoCompanions.desc: This armour does not sacrifice aesthetics, because appearance counts when you're a Mercenary.

HeavyArmorUncoOutlaws.name: Outlaw's Breastplate
HeavyArmorUncoOutlaws.desc: This breastplate has been modified to absorb the most treacherous blows.

HeavyArmorUncoSmugglers.name: Smuggler's Breastplate
HeavyArmorUncoSmugglers.desc: Smugglers are fond of this style of breastplate, not least because it's easy to repair.

HeavyArmorUncoLegion.name: Officer's Segmenta
HeavyArmorUncoLegion.desc: What kind of officer would wear the same armour as a grunt?

HeavyArmorUncoTrackers.name: Trackers' Breastplate
HeavyArmorUncoTrackers.desc: This breastplate wasn't made to protect against a human opponent, but to resist attacks from a monstrous creature.

HeavyArmorUncoBeast.name: Trackers' Breastplate
HeavyArmorUncoBeast.desc: This breastplate wasn't made to protect against a human opponent, but to resist attacks from a monstrous creature.

HeavyArmorUncoPirates.name: Pirate's Armour
HeavyArmorUncoPirates.desc: This armour is somewhat rusty and exudes a faint odour of kelp.

HeavyArmorRareGeneric.name: Master Battleplate
HeavyArmorRareGeneric.desc: The weight of this armour is so perfectly distributed, it quite deceptively seems lighter than an ordinary piece of armour.

HeavyArmorRareDeserters.name: Corporal's Plate Armour
HeavyArmorRareDeserters.desc: This armour is valued more for its resilience than for its aesthetic quality.

HeavyArmorRareInquisition.name: Paladin's Segmenta
HeavyArmorRareInquisition.desc: This armour is the whim of a senior officer in the Inquisition who desperately wanted to stand out from his underlings.

HeavyArmorRarePirates.name: Privateer's Plate Armour
HeavyArmorRarePirates.desc: Though rather poorly suited for combat at sea, plate armour still has its appeal for the truly audacious pirates.

HeavyArmorCommonBelerion.name: Ihrian Breastplate
HeavyArmorCommonBelerion.desc: This breastplate is very heavy. Falling overboard with it would be a death sentence.

HeavyArmorRareBelerion.name: Admiral's Breastplate
HeavyArmorRareBelerion.desc: Only an admiral would be confident enough in their fighting ability to risk wearing this much weight at sea.

HeavyArmorRareFugitiveGuard.name: Fugitive's Battleplate
HeavyArmorRareFugitiveGuard.desc: A piece of armour decorated in the Guard's colours.

HeavyArmorRareFugitiveCompanions.name: Fugitive's Battleplate
HeavyArmorRareFugitiveCompanions.desc: A piece of armour decorated in the Brotherhood's colours.

HeavyArmorRareLegion.name: Hothead's Segmenta
HeavyArmorRareLegion.desc: Worn by the Legion's heavy units, this segmenta is as imposing as it is bulky.

HeavyArmorRareCompanion.name: Peacebearer's Segmenta
HeavyArmorRareCompanion.desc: The main difference between this and a regular segmenta is the flask hanging from the peacebearer's belt.

HeavyArmorRareFugitiveAlazarSoldiers.name: Fugitive's Battleplate
HeavyArmorRareFugitiveAlazarSoldiers.desc: A piece of armour decorated in Alazarian colours.

HeavyArmorRareGuard.name: Defender's Battleplate
HeavyArmorRareGuard.desc: Some villagers are happy to pool their money together to buy quality armour for their best defenders.

HeavyArmorRareFiefCaptain.name: Militia Captain Armour
HeavyArmorRareFiefCaptain.desc: The colours on this armour probably have nothing to do with the fact that your Militia captain was expelled from the Legion.

HeavyArmorLegendaryChampionArenaE1.name: Kriskhed's Plate Armour
HeavyArmorLegendaryChampionArenaE1.desc: The breastplate is so polished that arena spectators can see their reflections in it.

HeavyArmorLegendaryChampionArenaIR1.name: Commander's Battleplate
HeavyArmorLegendaryChampionArenaIR1.desc: This showy battleplate is the very definition of prestige.

LightArmorLegendaryChampionE2.name: Attia's Battleplate
LightArmorLegendaryChampionE2.desc: A very thick set of armour, decorated with a certain flair.

HeavyArmorLegendaryChampion20.name: High Jarl's Breastplate
HeavyArmorLegendaryChampion20.desc: Sven's armour bears witness to his great wealth and power. While he wasn't keen to share the loot from his conquests, he certainly didn't skimp on the quality of this breastplate.

HeavyArmorLegendaryChampion22.name: Llyr's Armour
HeavyArmorLegendaryChampion22.desc: Llyr's armour is almost completely undamaged. His death wasn't caused by any ordinary wound.

MediumArmorCommonGeneric.name: Gambeson
MediumArmorCommonGeneric.desc: This gambeson is in a mediocre state, still damp from the rain and its previous owner's sweat.

MediumArmorCommonDeserters.name: Deserter's Brigandine
MediumArmorCommonDeserters.desc: Consisting of leather and fabric, this brigandine mainly protects the wearer's torso.

MediumArmorCommonCompanions.name: Brotherhood Spaulder
MediumArmorCommonCompanions.desc: Decorated in the Brotherhood's colours, this spaulder was designed to put merchants at ease.

MediumArmorUncoCompanions.name: Brotherhood Spaulder
MediumArmorUncoCompanions.desc: A Brotherhood Spaulder is traditionally given to a brother or sister on their tenth anniversary with the Brotherhood.

MediumArmorCommonGuard.name: Guard Gambeson
MediumArmorCommonGuard.desc: The quality of gambesons varies from one region to the next, subject to the local Lord Mayors' good intentions.

MediumArmorCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Gambeson
MediumArmorCommonAlazar.desc: This gambeson may look ordinary, but the techniques used for its padding make it lighter and sturdier than those crafted in neighbouring kingdoms.

MediumArmorCommonInquisition.name: Inquisition Hamata
MediumArmorCommonInquisition.desc: This amour's plates are covered in black paint that requires regular maintenance to prevent flaking.

MediumArmorCommonTrackers.name: Trackers' Spaulder
MediumArmorCommonTrackers.desc: The iron scales covering this spaulder are reminiscent of crocswine leather.

MediumArmorCommonBeast.name: Trackers' Spaulder
MediumArmorCommonBeast.desc: The iron scales covering this spaulder are reminiscent of crocswine leather.

MediumArmorUncoTrackers.name: Tule Spaulder
MediumArmorUncoTrackers.desc: The owner had this armour blessed by a druid in a special ceremony.

MediumArmorUncoBeast.name: Tule Spaulder
MediumArmorUncoBeast.desc: The owner had this armour blessed by a druid in a special ceremony.

MediumArmorCommonBelerion.name: Ihrian Chain Mail
MediumArmorCommonBelerion.desc: The front plate of this armour bears the shining face of the god Hessura.

MediumArmorCommonPirates.name: Pirate's Chestpiece
MediumArmorCommonPirates.desc: The chestpiece is the core component of this armour, which pirates assemble bit by bit as they plunder.

MediumArmorCommonPit1.name: Pit Layered Armour
MediumArmorCommonPit1.desc: Versatile and affordable, layered armour is far and away the most popular form of protection in the Black Market pits.

MediumArmorCommonPit2.name: Pit Gambeson
MediumArmorCommonPit2.desc: After disappearing for many years, the gambeson is finally making its big comeback in the pits of the Five Kingdoms. Fighters appreciate the comfort of its wolfskin lining.

MediumArmorCommonSkelmars.name: Skelmar Layered Armour
MediumArmorCommonSkelmars.desc: The Skelmar have developed a habit of tying metal plates to their chain mail. The result may not be especially elegant, but it makes the armour significantly tougher.

MediumArmorUncoSkelmars.name: World's Edge Layered Armour
MediumArmorUncoSkelmars.desc: They say that each piece of metal on this layered armour represents one enemy killed, which is, of course, complete nonsense. Although

MediumArmorRareSkelmars.name: Ulfark's Layered Armour
MediumArmorRareSkelmars.desc: The chain mail was carefully adjusted to fit its previous owner, and each link is sparkling clean. Some servant or slave must have dedicated their entire life to maintaining this armour.

MediumArmorUncoGeneric.name: Valuable Gambeson
MediumArmorUncoGeneric.desc: This gambeson is partitioned so that all its padding won't be removed by a single thrust of a sword.

MediumArmorUncoCraftT1.name: Padded Brigandine
MediumArmorUncoCraftT1.desc: This brigandine provides a good compromise between protection and freedom of movement.

MediumArmorUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Spaulder
MediumArmorUncoCraftT2.desc: This resistant yet light piece of armour is a testament to the artisan's skill.

MediumArmorUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Gambeson
MediumArmorUncoCraftT3.desc: This armour bears rimesteel parts where needed to protect vital points.

MediumArmorUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Spaulder
MediumArmorUncoCraftT4.desc: This crude-looking spaulder is actually one of the best pieces of armour that can be forged in the Five Kingdoms.

MediumArmorRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Gambeson
MediumArmorRareCraftT5.desc: Comfortably bundled up in this gambeson, youll feel like you can handle anything. Except maybe a heat wave.

MediumArmorArena.name: Arena Layered Armour
MediumArmorArena.desc: Only a master blacksmith could craft a hauberk capable of withstanding so many battles.

MediumArmorUncoGuard.name: Lieutenant's Gambeson
MediumArmorUncoGuard.desc: Crafted from quality fabric, this gambeson remains very effective.

MediumArmorUncoAlazar.name: Valuable Alazarian Gambeson
MediumArmorUncoAlazar.desc: With some effort, a soldier can turn their standard-issue gambeson into a coat fit for a parade.

MediumArmorUncoOutlaws.name: Outlaw's Layered Armour
MediumArmorUncoOutlaws.desc: Many farmers are still haunted by the memory of this armour.

MediumArmorUncoSmugglers.name: Smuggler's Layered Armour
MediumArmorUncoSmugglers.desc: The shiny parts of this armour have been painted over in dark colours.

MediumArmorUncoLegion.name: Swordsman's Hamata
MediumArmorUncoLegion.desc: This well-maintained, pristine hamata is a testament to Legion discipline.

MediumArmorUncoInquisition.name: Purifier's Hamata
MediumArmorUncoInquisition.desc: Sometimes, heretics resist arrest. Fortunately, this mail armour is made for such incidents.

MediumArmorUncoDeserters.name: Renegade's Brigandine
MediumArmorUncoDeserters.desc: This brigandine armour smells of smoke and sweat. Soap wouldn't suffice to get the stench out.

MediumArmorUncoBelerion.name: Solar Chain Mail
MediumArmorUncoBelerion.desc: Belerian officers are easily recognisable by the colours of their armour, never tarnished by sun or sea.

MediumArmorUncoPirates.name: Helmsman's Chestpiece
MediumArmorUncoPirates.desc: Losing your helmsman puts the whole crew in danger, which is why pirates traditionally give them the best pieces of armour.

MediumArmorRareGeneric.name: Reinforced Gambeson
MediumArmorRareGeneric.desc: Along with the fabric and padding, boiled leather adds extra reinforcement to this practically flawless gambeson.

MediumArmorRareAlazar.name: Colossus' Gambeson
MediumArmorRareAlazar.desc: In Alazar, it is customary to wear a layer of warm undergarments as well as chain mail under a gambeson.

MediumArmorRareLegion.name: Commander's Hamata
MediumArmorRareLegion.desc: Just below colonels in the hierarchy, commanders of the Edoranian Legion can pride themselves on wearing one of the best pieces of armour in the Five Kingdoms.

MediumArmorRareCompanions.name: Goon's Spaulder
MediumArmorRareCompanions.desc: Despite offering their services to the highest bidder, the Brotherhood proudly displays their origins on this spaulder.

MediumArmorRareFugitiveGuard.name: Fugitive's Gambeson
MediumArmorRareFugitiveGuard.desc: A gambeson decorated in the Guard's colours.

MediumArmorRareFugitiveLegion.name: Fugitive's Hamata
MediumArmorRareFugitiveLegion.desc: A hamata decorated in the Legion's colours.

MediumArmorRareFugitiveCompanions.name: Fugitive's Spaulder
MediumArmorRareFugitiveCompanions.desc: A spaulder decorated in the Brotherhood's colours.

MediumArmorRareFugitiveInquisition.name: Fugitive's Hamata
MediumArmorRareFugitiveInquisition.desc: A hamata decorated in the Inquisition's colours.

MediumArmorRareFugitiveAlazarSoldiers.name: Fugitive's Gambeson
MediumArmorRareFugitiveAlazarSoldiers.desc: A gambeson decorated in Alazarian colours.

MediumArmorRareOutlaws.name: Criminal's Layered Armour
MediumArmorRareOutlaws.desc: Good luck pretending you have honest intentions when wearing this armour.

MediumArmorRareSmugglers.name: Counterfeiter's Layered Armour
MediumArmorRareSmugglers.desc: This armour seems to have been used by many different smugglers.

MediumArmorRareTrackers.name: Pursuer's Spaulder
MediumArmorRareTrackers.desc: This armour is meant to have a single owner that it will follow to their funeral pyre.

MediumArmorRareBeast.name: Pursuer's Spaulder
MediumArmorRareBeast.desc: This armour is meant to have a single owner that it will follow to their funeral pyre.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampionHarag.name: Bionn's Spaulder
MediumArmorLegendaryChampionHarag.desc: Once the blood and guts accumulated over 20 years have been washed off, this spaulder is perfectly wearable.

MediumArmorRareFiefInstructor.name: Master-at-Arms Armour
MediumArmorRareFiefInstructor.desc: This armour's understated design illustrates the humility that befits the Five Kingdoms' best swordsmen.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampion.name: Matthias' Layered Armour
MediumArmorLegendaryChampion.desc: This metal abomination has a piece of armour for each of Matthias Lund's victims.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampion2.name: Alexa's Hamata
MediumArmorLegendaryChampion2.desc: This hamata belongs to a Legion colonel, and is probably one of the most valuable and prestigious pieces of armour ever made.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampion6.name: Fenris' Layered Armour
MediumArmorLegendaryChampion6.desc: Fenris Dredd carefully removed all the leather straps and cords from this piece of armour and replaced them with woven fabric and rush. The final item is surprisingly strong.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampion7.name: Trivetta's Gambeson
MediumArmorLegendaryChampion7.desc: This padded jacket was sewn to be recognisable from the farthest seat in the stands of Hoevendorp's Arena.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampion8.name: Kogo's Brigandine
MediumArmorLegendaryChampion8.desc: Despite its faded colours and damaged seams, this brigandine has been lovingly maintained. It must have sentimental value for Kogo.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampion9.name: Toro's Brigandine
MediumArmorLegendaryChampion9.desc: Albeit patched up and washed out, this brigandine has done its job for years, as Toro, who seems very attached to it, has maintained it well.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampionArenaA1.name: Lisbeth's Waistcoat
MediumArmorLegendaryChampionArenaA1.desc: This waistcoat was fashioned out of bear leather and adorned with white wolf fur, an unusual combination that probably contributed to Lisbeth's prestige.

MediumArmorLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Fighter's Spaulder
MediumArmorLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: The Brotherhood adapted this spaulder to meet arena standards.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampion11.name: Eokeld's Armour
MediumArmorLegendaryChampion11.desc: Eokeld seems to have converted to the cult of Mihr at the same time he took up Alazarian powder.

MediumArmorLegendaryChampion19.name: Kraven's Layered Armour
MediumArmorLegendaryChampion19.desc: Caked with dirt and smeared with blood, this armour lost much of its lustre during Kraven's flight.

LightArmorCommonGeneric.name: Jacket
LightArmorCommonGeneric.desc: Despite its thick fabric, this jacket does nothing to protect from the cold or the rain.

LightArmorUncoGeneric.name: Valuable Jacket
LightArmorUncoGeneric.desc: Made from quality leather and fabric, this doublet features a tasteful blend of colours.

LightArmorRareGeneric.name: Master's Jacket
LightArmorRareGeneric.desc: This jacket was hand-crafted by a Belerion artisan. The weaving technique resembles that used for boat sails, making this armour quite resistant to wear and inclement weather.

LightArmorCommonOutlaws.name: Outlaw's Tabard
LightArmorCommonOutlaws.desc: This tabard doesn't give much protection, but never fails to impress the common folk.

LightArmorCommonSmugglers.name: Smuggler's Tabard
LightArmorCommonSmugglers.desc: A simple, flexible tabard that's perfect for advancing undetected through enemy territory.

LightArmorCommonLegion.name: Legion Tunic
LightArmorCommonLegion.desc: Every Legion soldier has worn this tunic at least once in their life.

LightArmorUncoLegion.name: Officer's Tunic
LightArmorUncoLegion.desc: The brooch that fastens the cape on this armour is worth as much on its own as several months' wages for a low-level legionary.

LightArmorCommonTrackers.name: Tracker's Cloak
LightArmorCommonTrackers.desc: The wolf pelt is equally effective at camouflaging the wearer and keeping them warm.

LightArmorCommonBeast.name: Tracker's Cloak
LightArmorCommonBeast.desc: The wolf pelt is equally effective at camouflaging the wearer and keeping them warm.

LightArmorCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Waistcoat
LightArmorCommonAlazar.desc: Fighting and patrolling in a blizzard don't preclude elegance.

LightArmorCommonBelerion.name: Ihrian Doublet
LightArmorCommonBelerion.desc: This padded jacket protects the wearer from sea spray and sunburn, and has the added advantage of sinking less quickly than other forms of armour.

LightArmorUncoBelerion.name: Solar Doublet
LightArmorUncoBelerion.desc: With this doublet on, you'll feel ready to face all the perils of the sea.

LightArmorCommonPirates.name: Pirate's Outfit
LightArmorCommonPirates.desc: Pirates aren't particularly well-known for their sense of style. Even so, this light armour was crafted quite tastefully.

LightArmorCommonPit1.name: Pit Cloak
LightArmorCommonPit1.desc: The fur pelts adorning certain cloaks are the product of poaching, and are currently being sought by the Harag Guard.

LightArmorCommonPit2.name: Pit Waistcoat
LightArmorCommonPit2.desc: While some fighters try to hide their identities, others opt for a waistcoat in hopes of drawing a potential patron's attention.

LightArmorUncoSkelmars.name: World's Edge Tunic
LightArmorUncoSkelmars.desc: The padding in this garment serves to protect the wearer from the glacial cold of the World's Edge as much as from enemy attacks.

LightArmorUncoCraftT1.name: Padded Jacket
LightArmorUncoCraftT1.desc: A well-crafted jacket, reinforced with leather in its most vital parts.

LightArmorUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Cloak
LightArmorUncoCraftT2.desc: Ghost leather feels soft, but tends to give its wearer nightmares.

LightArmorUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Waistcoat
LightArmorUncoCraftT3.desc: This padded waistcoat never collects dust nor absorbs the wearer's scent. No blacksmith can explain this phenomenon.

LightArmorUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Waistcoat
LightArmorUncoCraftT4.desc: One could think this is just an ordinary waistcoat, were it not reinforced with the best alloy in the Five Kingdoms.

LightArmorRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Doublet
LightArmorRareCraftT5.desc: Its common to recolour a part of ones armour, whether to fool enemies or conceal oneself.

LightArmorUncoOutlaws.name: Outlaw's Ornate Tabard
LightArmorUncoOutlaws.desc: This tabard was decorated to excess by its previous owner.

LightArmorUncoGuard.name: Tactician's Doublet
LightArmorUncoGuard.desc: Although this doublet is light, it is also subtly reinforced at the seams.

LightArmorUncoAlazar.name: Alazarian Padded Waistcoat
LightArmorUncoAlazar.desc: This piece of clothing is perfect for patrolling the cold and windy cities of Alazar.

LightArmorUncoCompanions.name: Archer's Waistcoat
LightArmorUncoCompanions.desc: There's a pocket hidden inside this waistcoat for keeping one's earnings.

LightArmorUncoInquisition.name: Worshipper's Tunic
LightArmorUncoInquisition.desc: Who needs battleplate when you're blessed by the All-Seeing Eye?

LightArmorUncoTrackers.name: Hunter's Cloak
LightArmorUncoTrackers.desc: The fur on this cloak is stunning - whoever has maintained it knew what they were doing.

LightArmorUncoBeast.name: Hunter's Cloak
LightArmorUncoBeast.desc: The fur on this cloak is stunning - whoever has maintained it knew what they were doing.

LightArmorArena.name: Arena Tabard
LightArmorArena.desc: This tabard's fabric is of such quality that you can barely see it was mended several times.

LightArmorRareOutlaws.name: Ringleader's Tabard
LightArmorRareOutlaws.desc: This tabard was sewn by a tailor, which is rare for a brigand's attire.

LightArmorRareSmugglers.name: Tailored Tabard
LightArmorRareSmugglers.desc: An exceptionally gifted tailor has adjusted this tabard to fit its owner perfectly.

LightArmorRareGuard.name: Captain's Doublet
LightArmorRareGuard.desc: A doublet made of multiple layers of fabric that are surprisingly strong.

LightArmorRareAlazar.name: Alazarian Captain's Waistcoat
LightArmorRareAlazar.desc: Alazarian captains wear with pride the waistcoats they order not from their own kingdom, but from the famed tailors of Gosenberg.

LightArmorRareTrackers.name: Trapper's Cloak
LightArmorRareTrackers.desc: The fur on this cloak must come from a magnificent beast and is more than adequate for a Master Trapper.

LightArmorRareBeast.name: Trapper's Cloak
LightArmorRareBeast.desc: The fur on this cloak must come from a magnificent beast and is more than adequate for a Master Trapper.

LightArmorRareBelerion.name: Quartermaster's Doublet
LightArmorRareBelerion.desc: The quartermaster's doublet has been modified to make it easier to wield a bow.

LightArmorUncoPirates.name: Hodgepodge Outfit
LightArmorUncoPirates.desc: The saurian-tooth necklace is authentic, which adds substantial prestige to this somewhat untidy-looking outfit.

LightArmorRarePirates.name: Rover's Outfit
LightArmorRarePirates.desc: The rover's outfit is made of higher-quality garments than those worn by mere pirates.

LightArmorRareFugitiveGuard.name: Fugitive's Doublet
LightArmorRareFugitiveGuard.desc: A doublet decorated in the Guard's colours.

LightArmorRareFugitiveLegion.name: Fugitive's Tunic
LightArmorRareFugitiveLegion.desc: A tunic decorated in the Legion's colours.

LightArmorRareFugitiveCompanions.name: Fugitive's Waistcoat
LightArmorRareFugitiveCompanions.desc: A waistcoat decorated in the Brotherhood's colours.

LightArmorRareFugitiveInquisition.name: Fugitive's Tunic
LightArmorRareFugitiveInquisition.desc: A tunic decorated in the Inquisition's colours.

LightArmorRareFugitiveAlazarSoldiers.name: Fugitive's Waistcoat
LightArmorRareFugitiveAlazarSoldiers.desc: A waistcoat decorated in Alazarian colours.

LightArmorRareDeserters.name: Looter's Jacket
LightArmorRareDeserters.desc: Deftly patched up, this jacket is still as sturdy as it was in its heyday.

LightArmorLegendaryChampion1.name: Smot's Tabard
LightArmorLegendaryChampion1.desc: This tabard is covered in a greenish substance.

LightArmorLegendaryChampion2.name: Kaghal's Cloak
LightArmorLegendaryChampion2.desc: Time has erased this cloak's colours and eaten its original seams. That said, Kaghal's deftness has allowed this piece of light armour to survive until now.

LightArmorRareInquisition.name: Messenger's Tunic
LightArmorRareInquisition.desc: Despite looking quite heavy, this coat offers great mobility.

LightArmorLegendaryChampion10.name: Kristoff Kruppe's Tabard
LightArmorLegendaryChampion10.desc: Despite its mysterious and sombre look, this tabard is very comfortable when you have to sleep on a ship's deck.

LightArmorLegendaryChampionArenaH1.name: Nairolf's Cloak
LightArmorLegendaryChampionArenaH1.desc: The bear this pelt comes from is none other than Nairolf's previous companion, whom he didn't want to part with.

LightArmorLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Fighter's Waistcoat
LightArmorLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: This Waistcoat has been reinforced to meet arena standards.

LightArmorLegendaryChampion21.name: Valandi's Tunic
LightArmorLegendaryChampion21.desc: Dyed to stand out from the crowd and emphasise its wearer's status as jarl.

BaseArmorStart1.name: Farmer's Rags
BaseArmorStart1.desc: Old, practical clothing covered in mud stains.

BaseArmorStart2.name: Angler's Rags
BaseArmorStart2.desc: Often used in inclement weather, these rags smell faintly of fish.

BaseArmorCommonCraft.name: Rags
BaseArmorCommonCraft.desc: Crude clothing that offers some protection from the cold.

BaseArmorCommonBelerion1.name: Ihrian Rags
