BaseArmorCommonBelerion1.desc: Light clothing that's perfect for moving around comfortably on a ship.

BaseArmorCommonBelerion2.name: Ihrian Rags
BaseArmorCommonBelerion2.desc: Adventurers in the archipelago often favour this tough, inexpensive outfit.

BaseArmorFarmer.name: Rancher Outfit
BaseArmorFarmer.desc: A crude outfit for toiling in the fields.

PeasantTunic.name: Farmer Clothes
PeasantTunic.desc: This outfit is more practical than comfortable.

PeasantClothes.name: Peasant Breeches
PeasantClothes.desc: A garment handed down the generations until it turns to dust.

PeasantClothes2.name: Peasant's Outfit
PeasantClothes2.desc: This outfit is worn by many a peasant in the Belerion Archipelago.

PeasantClothes3.name: Peasant's Outfit
PeasantClothes3.desc: The heavy jacket provides reliable protection from insect bites.

PeasantClothes4.name: Peasant's Outfit
PeasantClothes4.desc: Only the wealthiest peasants and artisans wear this Akhedian-style outfit.

PeasantClothes5.name: Peasant's Outfit
PeasantClothes5.desc: A peasant's outfit that was kept by the Belerians.

BaseArmorMerchant.name: Merchant Outfit
BaseArmorMerchant.desc: Commoner clothes that have been mended.

ApothecaryBelerionClothes.name: Apothecary's Outfit
ApothecaryBelerionClothes.desc: The scarf worn by apothecaries symbolises the order they belong to.

BlacksmithClothes.name: Blacksmith Outfit
BlacksmithClothes.desc: The perfect outfit if you're handling molten iron.

BlacksmithBelerionClothes.name: Blacksmith Outfit
BlacksmithBelerionClothes.desc: The leather chestpiece offers protection from flying sparks.

TraderTunic.name: Merchant Attire
TraderTunic.desc: With an elegant cut and made from strong material, this outfit is perfect for wandering through the busy markets of the Five Kingdoms.

TavernKeeperClothes.name: Innkeeper Outfit
TavernKeeperClothes.desc: Nothing stylish about these alcohol- and fat-soaked clothes.

TavernKeeperBelerionClothes.name: Innkeeper Outfit
TavernKeeperBelerionClothes.desc: It is not so much the clothes that make the innkeeper, but rather the smell of grilled meat and stale beer.

NobleClothes.name: Noble's Attire
NobleClothes.desc: The sumptuous material is enough to make the wearer of this outfit feel like a high lord.

BaronClothes.name: Baron's Outfit
BaronClothes.desc: No outfit this elegant has ever looked this sinister. Or is it the other way around?

DihyaClothes1.name: Dihya's Garment
DihyaClothes1.desc: The dihyas' traditional garb varies slightly to reflect the different peoples they lead.

DihyaClothes2.name: Dihya's Garment
DihyaClothes2.desc: The dihyas' traditional garb varies slightly to reflect the different peoples they lead.

DihyaClothes3.name: Dihya's Garment
DihyaClothes3.desc: The dihyas' traditional garb varies slightly to reflect the different peoples they lead.

PriestClothes.name: Priest's Vestments
PriestClothes.desc: Cut from the humblest of materials, this dress is one of the most prestigious outfits in the Five Kingdoms.

PriestHessuraClothes.name: Priest's Vestments
PriestHessuraClothes.desc: Only the priests of the god Hessura have the honour of wearing these vestments.

PriestMihrClothes.name: Priest's Vestments
PriestMihrClothes.desc: The colours of these vestments are indubitably those of the goddess Mirh.

JudgeClothes.name: Judge's Attire
JudgeClothes.desc: Wearing a ghost monster's fur is the Harag judges privilege.

RagsClothes.name: Rags
RagsClothes.desc: These clothes are little more than rags.

TumblerClothes.name: Theatrical Costume
TumblerClothes.desc: A sight to behold, this colourful minstrel costume is worn by many an artist, from bear tamers to actors.

PuzzleManClothes.name: The Great Solveriser's Attire
PuzzleManClothes.desc: This ornate outfit is most appealing when worn by the great Solvius himself.

ScholarClothes.name: Scholar's Garb
ScholarClothes.desc: Just wearing this outfit is enough to feel smarter than whoever you're talking to.

ScholarBelerionClothes.name: Scholar's Outfit
ScholarBelerionClothes.desc: So common at the Great Library that you'd think it was a uniform, this Scholar's outfit is only for those who have dedicated their lives to the pursuit of knowledge.

NobleNegociant.name: Broker Outfit
NobleNegociant.desc: This outfit is a perfect blend of good taste and fine cloth.

Townspeople.name: Citizen Outfit
Townspeople.desc: Gosenberg tailors were keen to create an outfit so expensive that the poorest of their fellow citizens could never afford it.

TownspeopleBelerionClothes.name: Elegant Garment
TownspeopleBelerionClothes.desc: Only the most well-to-do classes of the Ihrian population wear this garment composed of expertly pleated folds and high-quality fabric.

TraderTunic2.name: Merchant Outfit
TraderTunic2.desc: A hard-wearing but elegant outfit, perfect for travelling trade routes.

Prostitute.name: Prostitute Attire
Prostitute.desc: The many strings tying this garment together make it easy to take off, but hard to put back on.

Sportswear.name: Sports Attire
Sportswear.desc: Still caked with mud and blood, and slightly damp on the inside, this outfit is nevertheless vital to any Rouste player.

SportswearGosenberg.name: Sports Attire
SportswearGosenberg.desc: Still caked with mud and blood, and slightly damp on the inside, this outfit is nevertheless vital to any Rouste player.

PurifierClothes.name: Purifier's Outfit
PurifierClothes.desc: This intricate piece of clothing is like a beacon in the night for sick people in distress.

FiefIntendantClothes.name: Steward Vothier's Outfit
FiefIntendantClothes.desc: This somewhat worn steward's outfit was clearly handed down from a father to his son.

FiefExecutionerClothes.name: Executioner's Uniform
FiefExecutionerClothes.desc: Wearing this uniform makes it easier for executioners to separate themselves from their cruel acts.

FiefProfessorClothes.name: Professor Adella's Outfit
FiefProfessorClothes.desc: This kind of outfit can only be worn by a Scholar who has sworn off field research forever.

FiefTaxCollectorClothes.name: Alderman's Outfit
FiefTaxCollectorClothes.desc: This outfit is worth an absolute fortune!

FiefBarberClothes.name: Barber's Apron
FiefBarberClothes.desc: To judge by the wide range of tools on the belt of this apron, barbers don't always limit themselves to hair-related issues.

FiefGroomClothes.name: Stable Girl's Outfit
FiefGroomClothes.desc: The citizens of Gosenberg would rather die than wear something like this.

HeavyHelmetCommonDeserters.name: Deserter's Bascinet
HeavyHelmetCommonDeserters.desc: This bascinet still offers some protection despite being slightly dented.

HeavyHelmetRareDeserters.name: Corporal's Bascinet
HeavyHelmetRareDeserters.desc: This bascinet's visor is hard to open, probably because it hasn't been maintained properly.

HeavyHelmetCommonGuard.name: Guard Helm
HeavyHelmetCommonGuard.desc: This is the Guard's favourite helmet, mostly because it's cheap.

HeavyHelmetCommonSkelmars.name: Skelmar Hjlmr
HeavyHelmetCommonSkelmars.desc: The decorations on this hjlmr evoke the horns of some fantastical creature.

HeavyHelmetRareSkelmars.name: Haersir's Hjlmr
HeavyHelmetRareSkelmars.desc: The eyepieces on this helmet can easily block the wearer's vision. It's essential to have them fitted properly.

HeavyHelmetCommonBelerion.name: Ihrian Helm
HeavyHelmetCommonBelerion.desc: Before the Ihrians left their frozen continent, this helm was lined with fur to keep the wearer's ears warm.

HeavyHelmetRareBelerion.name: Admiral's Helm
HeavyHelmetRareBelerion.desc: This helmet was recently polished and given a new plume, to thoroughly impressive results.

HeavyHelmetUncoPirates.name: Pirate's Galea
HeavyHelmetUncoPirates.desc: This galea is a highly effective method of intimidation.

HeavyHelmetRarePirates.name: Privateer's Galea
HeavyHelmetRarePirates.desc: The galeas worn by privateers are highly detailed, and have more teeth than most others.

HeavyHelmetRareGuard.name: Defender's Helm
HeavyHelmetRareGuard.desc: At first glance, it looks like any other helmet worn by the Guard, but its padding makes it much more comfortable.

HeavyHelmetUncoCompanions.name: Stylish Sallet
HeavyHelmetUncoCompanions.desc: Members of the Brotherhood love wearing this sallet, even when they're not fighting. Its magnificent plume probably has something to do with it.

HeavyHelmetRareCompanion.name: Peacebearer's Sallet
HeavyHelmetRareCompanion.desc: Peacebearers are known to regularly replace at their own expense the plumes adorning their sallets.

HeavyHelmetUncoTrackers.name: Trackers' Ursine Helm
HeavyHelmetUncoTrackers.desc: The first ursine helms date back to the Edoranian War. Intimidating and providing camouflage, they left their mark on the Trackers' reputation.

HeavyHelmetUncoBeast.name: Tracker's Helm
HeavyHelmetUncoBeast.desc: The Tracker's Helm far precedes the ursine helm, and while the latter is generally more popular, the Harag elite has remained loyal to this variant.

HeavyHelmetUncoOutlaws.name: Outlaw's Helm
HeavyHelmetUncoOutlaws.desc: Bandits stick spikes onto their helms to appear more fearsome.

HeavyHelmetUncoSmugglers.name: Smuggler's Helm
HeavyHelmetUncoSmugglers.desc: Falling into the sea with this helm on is inevitably fatal.

HeavyHelmetCommonLegion.name: Legion Galea
HeavyHelmetCommonLegion.desc: The mask of this galea is supposed to look like General Edor. Before he took the throne, this helmet was modelled after Saint Septimus, the First Emperor.

HeavyHelmetUncoLegion.name: Officer's Galea
HeavyHelmetUncoLegion.desc: Officers wear galeae that are heavier, but also more comfortable than those used by soldiers.

HeavyHelmetRareLegion.name: Hothead's Galea
HeavyHelmetRareLegion.desc: Hotheads are easily recognised by the tattered crest on their galea.

HeavyHelmetCommonInquisition.name: Inquisition Galea
HeavyHelmetCommonInquisition.desc: Originally, the Legion and the Inquisition used to wear the same galea, but they evolved differently over time.

HeavyHelmetRareInquisition.name: Paladin's Galea
HeavyHelmetRareInquisition.desc: It is customary for paladins to reinforce their galea with rimesteel.

HeavyHelmetCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Armet
HeavyHelmetCommonAlazar.desc: A standard Alazarian armet has no plume. Soldiers started adding them to emulate the Gosenberg Brotherhood.

HeavyHelmetUncoAlazar.name: Valuable Alazarian Armet
HeavyHelmetUncoAlazar.desc: The ornaments adorning this armet were crafted by a goldsmith.

HeavyHelmetCommonPit1.name: Pit Galea
HeavyHelmetCommonPit1.desc: There's no disputing it: the war paint on this galea is meant to intimidate.

HeavyHelmetCommonPit2.name: Pit Helm
HeavyHelmetCommonPit2.desc: This helm is a favourite among fighters who wish to keep their identity a secret.

HeavyHelmetUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Bascinet
HeavyHelmetUncoCraftT1.desc: Despite being restrictive and unrefined, the bascinet remains reliable in battle.

HeavyHelmetUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Ursine Helm
HeavyHelmetUncoCraftT2.desc: This ursine helm was said to give nightmares to the Legion.

HeavyHelmetUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Armet
HeavyHelmetUncoCraftT3.desc: The mechanism on this armet is a real work of art that lets the wearer lift the visor easily to avoid heatstroke.

HeavyHelmetUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Sallet
HeavyHelmetUncoCraftT4.desc: Is there anything more beautiful than a golden sallet adorned with a majestic plume?

HeavyHelmetRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Sallet
HeavyHelmetRareCraftT5.desc: Purists will recognise the model from which the Brotherhood took inspiration when designing their own heavy helmet. Much simpler in design, its perfect for warriors who favour comfort over appearances.

HeavyHelmetArena.name: Arena Helm
HeavyHelmetArena.desc: To drum up business, arena owners display the helms of their best fighters in nearby taverns.

HeavyHelmetLegendaryChampionArenaE1.name: Kriskhed's Bascinet
HeavyHelmetLegendaryChampionArenaE1.desc: This bascinet was made to catch the eye.

HeavyHelmetLegendaryPathMight.name: Helm of Legends
HeavyHelmetLegendaryPathMight.desc: Only the champions of the Arena of Legends may wear this dazzlingly beautiful helm.

HeavyHelmetLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Commander's Sallet
HeavyHelmetLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: Members of the Brotherhood know their commander's sallet better than her face.

HeavyHelmetLegendaryPit1.name: Mythical Sallet
HeavyHelmetLegendaryPit1.desc: This sallet is said to have belonged to Silbius the Wall, an infamous Bandit who stormed the Grinmeer Jail all by himself to free his accomplices.

LightHelmetLegendaryChampionE2.name: Attia's Helm
LightHelmetLegendaryChampionE2.desc: With its revolutionary system of straps, this helm forms a single piece with its wearers armour.

HeavyHelmetLegendaryChampion20.name: High Jarl's Hjlmr
HeavyHelmetLegendaryChampion20.desc: Few have ever seen High Jarl Sven without his helmet. Even his top lieutenants aren't sure what he really looks like.

HeavyHelmetLegendaryBeast.name: Hunt Helm
HeavyHelmetLegendaryBeast.desc: This helm has a reputation for standing up to any form of damage. But it's easy to forget just how much pressure the Beast's jaws can exert.

MediumHelmetCommonDeserters.name: Deserter's Barbute
MediumHelmetCommonDeserters.desc: Barbutes used by Deserters are cheap and easy to maintain.

MediumHelmetCommonSkelmars.name: Skelmar Intercisa
MediumHelmetCommonSkelmars.desc: The crest of this intercisa can do serious damage in close combat.

MediumHelmetUncoSkelmars.name: World's Edge Intercisa
MediumHelmetUncoSkelmars.desc: A bit dented but still in one piece, this intercisa was forged by a blacksmith who knew his trade well.

MediumHelmetRareSkelmars.name: Ulfark's Intercisa
MediumHelmetRareSkelmars.desc: Made from a Belerian intercisa, this helmet combines Skelmar and Ihrian expertise.

MediumHelmetUncoDeserters.name: Renegade's Barbute
MediumHelmetUncoDeserters.desc: Most barbutes are rather ill-fitting, but this one belonged to a veteran who padded it to make it more comfortable.

MediumHelmetCommonGuard.name: Guard Spangenhelm
MediumHelmetCommonGuard.desc: The shape of this helmet would give anyone a stern look.

MediumHelmetCommonBelerion.name: Ihrian Cabasset
MediumHelmetCommonBelerion.desc: This open, flared helmet is worn with a camail to protect the neck and lower face.

MediumHelmetUncoBelerion.name: Solar Cabasset
MediumHelmetUncoBelerion.desc: The Belerian Guard ask the priests of Hessura to bless their helmets.

MediumHelmetCommonPirates.name: Pirate's Intercisa
MediumHelmetCommonPirates.desc: This piece of armour is of Belerian design, and was worn by the Belerion Archipelago's first pirates.

MediumHelmetUncoPirates.name: Reinforced Intercisa
MediumHelmetUncoPirates.desc: Pirates like to personalise their helmets by adding seabird feathers.

MediumHelmetUncoGuard.name: Lieutenant's Spangenhelm
MediumHelmetUncoGuard.desc: Lieutenants wear spangenhelms forged by master craftsmen.

MediumHelmetRareFugitiveGuard.name: Fugitive's Spangenhelm
MediumHelmetRareFugitiveGuard.desc: A typical spangenhelm of the Guard.

MediumHelmetCommonCompanions.name: Brotherhood Kettle Hat
MediumHelmetCommonCompanions.desc: A kettle hat protects the wearer's eyes from the rain and the sun.

MediumHelmetUncoCompanions.name: Brotherhood Kettle Hat
MediumHelmetUncoCompanions.desc: A Brotherhood Kettle Hat is traditionally given to a member of the Brotherhood on their fifth anniversary with the group.

MediumHelmetRareCompanions.name: Goon's Kettle Hat
MediumHelmetRareCompanions.desc: This helmet's owner had to take on several missions to be able to afford it.

MediumHelmetCommonTrackers.name: Trackers' Crocswine Helm
MediumHelmetCommonTrackers.desc: A thick layer of crocswine fur covers an aventail that is just as thick.

MediumHelmetUncoTrackers.name: Prestigious Crocswine Helm
MediumHelmetUncoTrackers.desc: This helm can't be made from just any old crocswine. It has to have devoured at least two hunters before being killed in single combat.

MediumHelmetRareTrackers.name: Pursuer's Crocswine Helm
MediumHelmetRareTrackers.desc: Pursuers make their own crocswine helms using fur from an animal they killed themselves.

MediumHelmetCommonBeast.name: Tracker's Intercisa
MediumHelmetCommonBeast.desc: The little bones that decorate this helmet are intended as charms to protect the wearer's mind from the terror that comes of facing the Beast.

MediumHelmetUncoBeast.name: Prestigious Intercisa
MediumHelmetUncoBeast.desc: You can tell an experienced Tracker by the quality of their intercisa. This one highlights its wearer's skill and power.

MediumHelmetRareBeast.name: Pursuer's Intercisa
MediumHelmetRareBeast.desc: It's not this helmet's beauty that makes it so expensive, but its exceptional toughness.

MediumHelmetUncoOutlaws.name: Outlaw's Barbute
MediumHelmetUncoOutlaws.desc: The spikes on this barbute are not only for show: a good helmeted headbutt can make all the difference against the Guard.

MediumHelmetUncoSmugglers.name: Smuggler's Barbute
MediumHelmetUncoSmugglers.desc: The previous owner of this barbute repainted it in the Smugglers' colours.

MediumHelmetRareOutlaws.name: Criminal's Barbute
MediumHelmetRareOutlaws.desc: The original aventail was replaced with a new, much more elaborate one.

MediumHelmetRareSmugglers.name: Counterfeiter's Barbute
MediumHelmetRareSmugglers.desc: It gets hot fast with this barbute on.

MediumHelmetUncoLegion.name: Swordsman's Intercisa
MediumHelmetUncoLegion.desc: This golden intercisa seems made of akhedian steel, but it's only covered in paint.

MediumHelmetRareLegion.name: Commander's Intercisa
MediumHelmetRareLegion.desc: This helmet is lined with wolf fur to keep the officer's ears warm.

MediumHelmetCommonInquisition.name: Inquisition Intercisa
MediumHelmetCommonInquisition.desc: Simple and light, this helmet is perfect to hunt heathens.

MediumHelmetUncoInquisition.name: Purifier's Intercisa
MediumHelmetUncoInquisition.desc: This intercisa can strike terror into the hearts of infidels.

MediumHelmetCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Morion
MediumHelmetCommonAlazar.desc: It is a question of honour for Alazar to forge these morions as a single piece in order to make them sturdier.

MediumHelmetUncoAlazar.name: Valuable Alazarian Morion
MediumHelmetUncoAlazar.desc: This morion is decorated with very ornate embossed patterns.

MediumHelmetRareAlazar.name: Colossus' Morion
MediumHelmetRareAlazar.desc: Colossi now prefer the more refined morion to the cabasset they used to wear.

MediumHelmetUncoCraftT1.name: Iron Barbute
MediumHelmetUncoCraftT1.desc: This modest and unassuming helmet is a mercenary's perfect ally.

MediumHelmetUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Boar Helm
MediumHelmetUncoCraftT2.desc: This helmet's creator used a crocswine helm as a model, but fashioned it from a phantom boar's remains. A true masterstroke.

MediumHelmetUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Morion
MediumHelmetUncoCraftT3.desc: This stylish morion makes its wearer truly stand out.

MediumHelmetUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Kettle Hat
MediumHelmetUncoCraftT4.desc: Why settle for a plain helmet when you can have a golden one?

MediumHelmetRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Barbute
MediumHelmetRareCraftT5.desc: Dont judge a book by its cover: this barbute is as comfortable as a nightcap.

MediumHelmetArena.name: Arena Barbute
MediumHelmetArena.desc: This barbute's aventail is made to fit any wearer.

MediumHelmetCommonPit1.name: Pit Barbute
MediumHelmetCommonPit1.desc: Expensive to buy but easy to maintain and repair, a barbute is best thought of as a long-term investment.

MediumHelmetCommonPit2.name: Pit Morion
MediumHelmetCommonPit2.desc: The three claws painted on this morion are the mark of the Black Market. Most goons and fighters are unaware of their true meaning.

MediumHelmetLegendaryBeast.name: Hunt Intercisa
MediumHelmetLegendaryBeast.desc: This intercisa is worn only by the bravest of the brave. Wearing such a helmet is a genuine honour and a mark of admiration.

MediumHelmetTradePath.name: Broker's Morion
MediumHelmetTradePath.desc: Now a mere decorative object, this morion would have been worn by Brokers had they deigned to fight General Edor.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampionArenaA1.name: Lisbeth's Hat
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampionArenaA1.desc: Lisbeth decorated her beret with a customised brooch.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion9.name: Toro's Coif
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion9.desc: Toro maintained his coif with the same care he did his armour.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion8.name: Kogo's Coif
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion8.desc: This coif looks like those worn by peasants, a remnant of Kogo's past life.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion6.name: Fenris' Barbute
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion6.desc: Fenris snatched this barbute from a bandit who was threatening to capture him.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion.name: Matthias's Barbute
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion.desc: Matthias Lund was probably not this old barbute's first owner.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion2.name: Alexa's Intercisa
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion2.desc: A Legion Colonel's intercisa is instantly recognisable.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampionHarag.name: Bionn's Crocswine Helm
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampionHarag.desc: This disgusting crocswine helm is dripping with slobber and blood.

MediumHelmetLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Fighter's Kettle Hat
MediumHelmetLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: This Kettle Hat has been modified to meet arena standards.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion11.name: Eokeld's Helmet
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion11.desc: Despite his best efforts, Eokeld was unable to remove Hessura's symbol from his helmet.

MediumHelmetLegendarySealord.name: Lord of the Seas Crown
MediumHelmetLegendarySealord.desc: Only the greatest Lord of the Seas has the right to wear this crown.

MediumHelmetLegendaryPit1.name: Titan's Barbute
MediumHelmetLegendaryPit1.desc: Dungal the Titan deserted the Legion during the war between Edoran and Harag. It's said that his prodigious strength came from his barbute.

MediumHelmetLegendaryPit2.name: Traitor's Barbute
MediumHelmetLegendaryPit2.desc: This helmet takes its name from its former owner, the outlaw known as Brutille, famed for betraying nearly all of her accomplices before one of them cut her throat in her sleep.

MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion19.name: Kraven's Intercisa
MediumHelmetLegendaryChampion19.desc: Kraven may have simply grabbed the first helmet he could find when he fled. This one seems a bit small for him.

LightHelmetRareDeserters.name: Looter's Hat
LightHelmetRareDeserters.desc: A felt hat for the most stylish looters.

LightHelmetUncoGuard.name: Tactician's Bycocket
LightHelmetUncoGuard.desc: The plume's size is subject to strict regulations.

LightHelmetRareGuard.name: Captain's Bycocket
LightHelmetRareGuard.desc: This hat protects the wearer from the wind, not so much from blows.

LightHelmetUncoCompanions.name: Archer's Beret
LightHelmetUncoCompanions.desc: The plume is held in place by a wheel-shaped brooch, the symbol of Gosenberg.

LightHelmetCommonTrackers.name: Trackers' Headband
LightHelmetCommonTrackers.desc: This headband is fastened with claws and fangs.

LightHelmetCommonBelerion.name: Ihrian Cap
LightHelmetCommonBelerion.desc: Its colour is meant to stand out against the waves.

LightHelmetUncoBelerion.name: Solar Cap
LightHelmetUncoBelerion.desc: This cap has been blessed many times over in a temple to Hessura. According to Ihrian tradition, those blessings will protect the wearer from evil spirits.

LightHelmetRareBelerion1.name: Quartermaster's Cap
LightHelmetRareBelerion1.desc: The owner's name is embroidered on the inside.

LightHelmetCommonPirates.name: Pirate's Turban
LightHelmetCommonPirates.desc: There are two ways to tie a turban correctly: the Belerian way and the Ihrian way.

LightHelmetUncoPirates.name: Helmsman's Turban
LightHelmetUncoPirates.desc: Once it's been folded, knotted and wrapped with precision and skill, it's best not to try undoing this turban.

LightHelmetRarePirates.name: Rover's Turban
LightHelmetRarePirates.desc: The buckle that holds the turban in place was forged specially for its owner.

LightHelmetUncoTrackers.name: Hunter's Headband
LightHelmetUncoTrackers.desc: Hunters wear headbands to hold their hair back and to prevent sweat from dripping into their eyes.

LightHelmetRareTrackers.name: Trapper's Headband
LightHelmetRareTrackers.desc: This headband's light and dark hues help hunters camouflage themselves.

LightHelmetCommonBeast.name: Tracker's Cap
LightHelmetCommonBeast.desc: Made of wool or fur, depending on the clan it's from, this cap keeps the cold away during the long hunt for the Beast.

LightHelmetUncoBeast.name: Hunter's Cap
LightHelmetUncoBeast.desc: The owner of this cap took excellent care of it: the dye has barely faded at all.

LightHelmetRareBeast.name: Trapper's Cap
LightHelmetRareBeast.desc: There's an excellent chance that the creature that provided this fine cap was caught by its original wearer still the best way to ensure an ideal fit.

LightHelmetCommonOutlaws.name: Outlaw's Coif
LightHelmetCommonOutlaws.desc: Bandits add a layer of leather onto the fabric.

LightHelmetUncoOutlaws.name: Outlaw's Ornate Coif
LightHelmetUncoOutlaws.desc: Martial patterns were engraved into this coif's leather by an obviously inexperienced hand.

LightHelmetRareOutlaws.name: Ringleader's Coif
LightHelmetRareOutlaws.desc: This coif is covered with a layer of boiled leather, turning a simple hat into a proper helmet.

LightHelmetRareSmugglers.name: Embroidered Coif
LightHelmetRareSmugglers.desc: This coif has been embroidered with various patterns to make it look a bit better.

LightHelmetCommonLegion.name: Legion Bycocket
LightHelmetCommonLegion.desc: A bycocket dyed in bright vermilion.

LightHelmetUncoLegion.name: Officer's Bycocket
LightHelmetUncoLegion.desc: By protecting the wearer's eyes from the sun, this bycocket gives archers and crossbowmen an undeniable advantage.

LightHelmetUncoInquisition.name: Worshipper's Headdress
LightHelmetUncoInquisition.desc: Rather cumbersome in battle, this tall headdress can be very compelling when it comes to frightening heathens.

LightHelmetRareInquisition.name: Messenger's Headdress
LightHelmetRareInquisition.desc: Although they will never admit it to their superiors, most messengers take this headdress off when they are in a rush.

LightHelmetCommonAlazar.name: Alazarian Hat
LightHelmetCommonAlazar.desc: Widely used in the Alazarian mountains, this felt hat keeps its wearer warm.

LightHelmetUncoAlazar.name: Alazarian Padded Hat
LightHelmetUncoAlazar.desc: High-ranking officers can bestow this hat to deserving soldiers.

LightHelmetRareAlazar.name: Captain's Hat
LightHelmetRareAlazar.desc: Captains wear patterned hats to set themselves apart from their men.

LightHelmetUncoCraftT1.name: Hat
LightHelmetUncoCraftT1.desc: A very popular classic among Mercenaries who have a certain fondness for their first hat.

LightHelmetUncoCraftT2.name: Ghost Headband
LightHelmetUncoCraftT2.desc: Some say this headband can cause hallucinations, but they might just be due to the cheap alcohol Mercenaries drink.

LightHelmetUncoCraftT3.name: Rimesteel Hat
LightHelmetUncoCraftT3.desc: This hat is adorned with exquisite rimesteel medals that offer decent protection.

LightHelmetUncoCraftT4.name: Akhedian Steel Beret
LightHelmetUncoCraftT4.desc: This quaint beret hides a small skull cap made of akhedian steel that can withstand powerful blows.

LightHelmetRareCraftT5.name: Vairmeil Coif
LightHelmetRareCraftT5.desc: Though invented only recently, this coif has already saved its fair share of ears.

LightHelmetCommonPit1.name: Pit Headband
LightHelmetCommonPit1.desc: Pit fights don't leave much time for hunting. That's why the bones in these headbands are often just gleaned from somebody's lunch box.

LightHelmetCommonPit2.name: Pit Beret
LightHelmetCommonPit2.desc: Truly the most pretentious of headgear, n'est-ce pas?

LightHelmetUncoSkelmars.name: World's Edge Cap
LightHelmetUncoSkelmars.desc: A fur and leather cap to keep your ears warm between bloody massacres.

LightHelmetSaintSeptime.name: Saint Septimus' Mask
LightHelmetSaintSeptime.desc: This death mask was moulded directly on Saint Septimus' face. Those who dare look at it feel the weight of their sins on their shoulders.

LightHelmetArena.name: Arena Coif
LightHelmetArena.desc: While this coif is rather plain, it remains an essential piece of equipment for arena fights.

LightHelmetLegendaryChampion1.name: Smot's Coif
LightHelmetLegendaryChampion1.desc: A coif dyed in Smot's colours.

LightHelmetLegendaryChampion10.name: Kristoff Kruppe's Coif
LightHelmetLegendaryChampion10.desc: This dark coif allows Kristoff Kruppe to hide easily on land while protecting him from the wind at sea.

LightHelmetLegendaryChampion2.name: Kaghal's Headband
LightHelmetLegendaryChampion2.desc: This headband is made of the bones of long dead animals.

LightHelmetLegendaryChampionArenaH1.name: Nairolf's Headband
LightHelmetLegendaryChampionArenaH1.desc: This headband was also fashioned from the hide of his former companion.

LightHelmetLegendaryHessura.name: Hessura's Crown
LightHelmetLegendaryHessura.desc: Without this crown, the dihya of Tebessa is nothing more than a Lady Mayor.

LightHelmetLegendaryDihya.name: Dihya's Crown
LightHelmetLegendaryDihya.desc: A jewel that adorns the brows of most dihyas.

LightHelmetLegendaryArenaIR1.name: Fighter's Beret
LightHelmetLegendaryArenaIR1.desc: This Beret has been modified to meet arena standards.

LightHelmetLegendaryChefHat.name: Golden Chef's Hat
LightHelmetLegendaryChefHat.desc: Legend has it the spirit of a Tule resides in this hat, and that it guides the hand of any Cook who wears it.

LightHelmetLegendaryPit1.name: Serpent's Hat
LightHelmetLegendaryPit1.desc: The Baron's late grandfather was a great apothecary known as the Serpent, and was justly accused of being a poisoner. He founded the Black Market after being banned from Marheim.

LightHelmetLegendaryPit2.name: Flamboyant Headdress
LightHelmetLegendaryPit2.desc: After a long career in the Inquisition, One-Eyed Portia was finally able to express all her incendiary potential as an outlaw. Her headdress is considered a relic by the Vertruse Black Market.

LightHelmetLegendaryChampion21.name: Valandi's Cap
LightHelmetLegendaryChampion21.desc: Jarl Valandi tells anyone who will listen that the fur on this cap comes from a World's Edge bear that he killed with his bare hands.

LightHelmetLegendaryBeast.name: Hunt Cap
LightHelmetLegendaryBeast.desc: The fang that adorns this type of cap depends on the Tracker's favourite animal, with options ranging from mole-rats to crocswine and even saurians.

BlacksmithHat.name: Blacksmith's Scarf
BlacksmithHat.desc: This scarf is saturated with soot and sweat.

FarmerHat.name: Straw Hat
FarmerHat.desc: Any self-respecting farmer makes their own straw hat by hand.

FiefIntendantHat.name: Steward Vothier's Hat
FiefIntendantHat.desc: A quaint piece of headwear that makes the Lords' Stewards instantly identifiable.

FiefExecutionerHat.name: Executioner's Hood
FiefExecutionerHat.desc: Great for working the gallows on a rainy day.

BeltAccPoisonExtra.name: Poison Vial
BeltAccPoisonExtra.desc: Not so long ago, merely having a poison vial in your possession could send you straight to jail.

BeltAccLariat.name: Lariat of Truth
BeltAccLariat.desc: An enchanted lariat, capable of binding even the fiercest foes. Some say it once belonged to the queen of the Amazons, though few dare speak her name.

BeltAccPoisonDmgBonus.name: Toxic Balm
BeltAccPoisonDmgBonus.desc: This white paste looks like duck fat.

BeltAccPoisonResist.name: Antidote
BeltAccPoisonResist.desc: Prepared by a renowned apothecary, this lotion protects against the worst poisons.

BeltAccBleedingCrit.name: Sharp Fang
BeltAccBleedingCrit.desc: The fang of a ferocious beast - it isn't just for decoration.

BeltAccBleedingResist.name: Poultice
BeltAccBleedingResist.desc: This mixture of herbs and viscous clay can stop bleeding.

BeltAccHumanTorch.name: Fireproof Ointment
BeltAccHumanTorch.desc: Though it will protect the skin from flames, this ointment will not stop the fire from spreading.

BeltAccBurningResist.name: Anti-burn Ointment
BeltAccBurningResist.desc: Can be used to soothe skin burned by fire or by the sun.

BeltAccRangeDmg.name: Quality Projectiles
BeltAccRangeDmg.desc: These projectiles made by a master craftsman are very accurate.

BeltAccRangeBonus.name: Light Feathers
BeltAccRangeBonus.desc: One needs but glance at these feathers to feel weightless.

BeltAccRangePrecisionBonus.name: Ballast Stone
BeltAccRangePrecisionBonus.desc: Quite useful for disposing of a cumbersome corpse, this carved stone also grounds you in combat.

BeltAccBackstabCritBonus.name: Whetstone
BeltAccBackstabCritBonus.desc: Popular amongst barbers and warriors alike, this simple stoneware item is an invaluable companion.

BeltAccBackstabDmg.name: Whetstone Case
BeltAccBackstabDmg.desc: This little box contains very fine sand mixed with water, and is used to sharpened blades.

BeltAccAutoHeal.name: Quid
BeltAccAutoHeal.desc: Thoroughly chewed, a single quid of tobacco can relax the muscles and ease pain.

BeltAccGuardEngaged.name: Leather Straps
BeltAccGuardEngaged.desc: Wrapped around a fighter's knuckles, these straps cushion blows on the hands to allow for a firmer grip.

BeltAccReduceOpportunityAttack.name: Tin Lucky Charm
BeltAccReduceOpportunityAttack.desc: The flat silhouette portrays a juggler performing a stunt.

BeltAccBarbs.name: Mustard Tonic
BeltAccBarbs.desc: This tonic tastes so strong it could raise the dead.

BeltAccBaseActionOnly.name: Small Gauntlet
BeltAccBaseActionOnly.desc: The finger joints are articulated thanks to the intricate work of an artisan.

BeltAccCandy.name: Treats
BeltAccCandy.desc: As any tamer will tell you, animals (and humans) are driven by their stomachs above all else.

BeltAccSap.name: Ether
BeltAccSap.desc: A valuable ally when you need to pull a tooth.

BeltAccCritBonus.name: Stiletto
BeltAccCritBonus.desc: This weapon can be hidden in the folds of a cloak or up a sleeve to execute an attack at the very last second.

BeltAccWillpowerBonus.name: Medallion
BeltAccWillpowerBonus.desc: Who would have thought a badger-shaped pendant could make you feel so serene?

BeltAccMovementBonus.name: Adjustable Straps
BeltAccMovementBonus.desc: It took all of the sheath-maker's ingenuity to make straps that were suitable for holding any and all weapons in place.

BeltAccMovementMalusDmgBonus.name: Tule Horn
BeltAccMovementMalusDmgBonus.desc: This horn strangely resembles that of a ram, but it must be Tule magic that makes its wearer's blows more powerful.

BeltAccDmgCritBonus.name: Pocket Knife
BeltAccDmgCritBonus.desc: This blade can be used to settle disputes as well as to slice ham. A must-have item.

BeltAccMoraleBonus.name: Ancient Idol
BeltAccMoraleBonus.desc: A small ivory statuette with ruby eyes.

BeltAccGritEndTurn.name: Sewn Crest
BeltAccGritEndTurn.desc: This coat of arms is the very symbol of allegiance to a lord. But difficult to tell which one.

BeltAccGoldTeeth.name: Forceps
BeltAccGoldTeeth.desc: A small instrument for performing dental treatments on-the-go.

BeltAccTerrorMax.name: Trackers Charm
BeltAccTerrorMax.desc: A trinket made from hides and fangs, a lucky charm for Trackers.

BeltAccTerrorReduceRound.name: Fetish of the Ancients
BeltAccTerrorReduceRound.desc: This accurate representation of the Beast reminds the wearer what it's like to look fear in the eye.

BeltAccOilProcPoison.name: <item>OilProcPoison1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilProcPoison.desc: This substance must be handled with care. Be sure to wash your hands thoroughly after use.

BeltAccOilProcBurning.name: <item>OilProcBurning1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilProcBurning.desc: An apothecary thought it wise to add a disclaimer advising not to ingest this oil.

BeltAccOilProcBleeding.name: <item>OilProcBleeding1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilProcBleeding.desc: This odourless mixture will allow any inexperienced warrior to sharpen any blade.

BeltAccOilProcTrueDmg.name: <item>OilProcTrueDmg1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilProcTrueDmg.desc: Warning: This flask should be handled with care.

BeltAccOilStrengthProc.name: <item>OilStrengthProc1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilStrengthProc.desc: Developed by Alazarian scholars, the recipe for this concentrate has long remained secret.

BeltAccOilDexterityProc.name: <item>OilDexterityProc1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilDexterityProc.desc: No one can explain the colour of this concentrate.

BeltAccOilDamageTakenProc.name: <item>OilDamageTakenProc1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilDamageTakenProc.desc: This substance casts a mesmerising shine when the sun hits it just so.

BeltAccOilSlowProc.name: <item>OilSlowProc1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilSlowProc.desc: The Rooks have used this as a poison by passing it off as a type of seasoning.

BeltAccOilSelfHeal.name: <item>OilSelfheal1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilSelfHeal.desc: Its colour is reminiscent of remedies prepared by apothecaries.

BeltAccOilDotEffect.name: <item>OilDotEffect1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilDotEffect.desc: The oil smells dreadful enough as it is, so the concentrated form is... vileness itself.

BeltAccOilCleave.name: <item>OilCleave1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilCleave.desc: Even as a concentrate, this oil has an ethereal consistency.

BeltAccOilWindfury.name: <item>OilWindfury1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilWindfury.desc: This oil was devised by an apothecary famous for murdering his Lord Mayor.

BeltAccOilHemorraghe.name: <item>OilHemorraghe1</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilHemorraghe.desc: Considered an abomination by healers and apothecaries alike.

BeltAccOilProcSolid.name: <item>OilProcSolid</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilProcSolid.desc: This oil is so efficient that even its vial is strengthened.

BeltAccOilSwipping.name: <item>OilSwipping</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilSwipping.desc: There is something comforting about this oil's colour.

BeltAccOilProcFever.name: <item>OilProcFever</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilProcFever.desc: Unidentified chunks are steeping in this oil.

BeltAccOilBrave.name: <item>OilBrave</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilBrave.desc: This oil is meant for the most courageous, who carry it proudly on their belts.

BeltAccOilProcSlowReflexes.name: <item>OilProcSlowReflexes</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilProcSlowReflexes.desc: One drop of this concentrate on your fingers and your whole hand goes numb.

BeltAccOilPropulsion.name: <item>OilPropulsion</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilPropulsion.desc: Naysayers claim that it's the stench of this oil that drives enemies back.

BeltAccOilInitiative.name: <item>OilInitiative</item> Concentrate
BeltAccOilInitiative.desc: This runny oil will quickly flow from its vial.

BeltAccRadiusVision.name: Belerion Talisman
BeltAccRadiusVision.desc: This type of talisman is said to have guided the Ihrians to Belerion. If it works at sea, it must also work on land.

BeltAccBlindDay.name: Pewter Mirror
BeltAccBlindDay.desc: This small polished metal shard is commonplace in the Legion's ranks, who use it to tame their facial hair before reporting to a superior officer.

LucillaLundPendant.name: Lucilla Lund's Medallion
LucillaLundPendant.desc: Blood is splattered on the letters forming the name LUND that's engraved on the back of the pendant.

PurifierRing.name: Purifier's Ring
PurifierRing.desc: A golden ring set with a square-cut ruby, a signature item worn by Purifiers.

BionnTorque.name: Bionn's Torque
BionnTorque.desc: This neck ring dates back at least to the Edoranian War and is decorated with pony heads.

BeltAccBeastH1.name: Fur of the Beast
BeltAccBeastH1.desc: This fur looks more like rope than animal hair. A sense of unease overcomes you if you look at it too long.

BeltAccHoevendorp.name: Hoevendorp Seal
BeltAccHoevendorp.desc: The Hoevendorp family uses this precious item to add their seal at the bottom of various contracts.

BeltAccWeighted.name: Lead Belt
BeltAccWeighted.desc: Designed for Belerion sailors to practise swimming in difficult conditions, this belt is also worn on land by fighters looking to keep their balance.

BeltAccMudGuard.name: Mudguard
BeltAccMudGuard.desc: People claim wearing it makes it easier to walk through muddy terrain.

BeltAccPushDistance.name: Back Brace
BeltAccPushDistance.desc: Reinforced with wood and metal, this padded belt is easy to put on and relieves the wearer's back pain.

BeltAccProtection1.name: Chestplate
BeltAccProtection1.desc: This piece of armour can act as a belt, but unfortunately, it doesn't adjust to the wearer's waistline.

BeltAccPlague1.name: Alazarian Antidote
BeltAccPlague1.desc: This version of the Alazarian cure needs to be taken daily to ward off the Plague, hence it is more practical to carry it on a belt.

BeltAccPrisonerTrust.name: Personal Cup
BeltAccPrisonerTrust.desc: What greater show of respect within a troop than giving one of its members a personal cup?

BeltAccPrisonerPony.name: Pony Figurine
BeltAccPrisonerPony.desc: Symbolising the ponies' legendary courage and determination, this small lucky charm inspires its wearer to show the same fortitude.

BeltAccPrisonerWorkMeatDryer.name: Clean Rag
BeltAccPrisonerWorkMeatDryer.desc: This carefully washed rag keeps one's hands clean while handling jerky.

BeltAccPrisonerWorkBrewBarrel.name: Dry Yeast
BeltAccPrisonerWorkBrewBarrel.desc: The yeast in this small packet needs to be stored in a dry place.

BeltAccPrisonerWorkSkinDryingRack.name: Plant Tannin
BeltAccPrisonerWorkSkinDryingRack.desc: Powder extracted from plants and used to tan leather.

BeltAccPrisonerWorkBeeHive.name: Beekeeper Mask
BeltAccPrisonerWorkBeeHive.desc: This mask is a necessity when working with beehives.

BeltPathTradeCorrupt.name: Loose Change
BeltPathTradeCorrupt.desc: This purse dangles from its owners belt, jingling with coins that can be thrown casually at a peasant needing to be bribed.

BeltAccNoMovePenalty.name: Spare Buckles
BeltAccNoMovePenalty.desc: You won't have to worry about your heavy armours integrity with sturdy buckles holding it in place.

BeltAccLightArmorCrit.name: Needle
BeltAccLightArmorCrit.desc: As easy to hide up your sleeve as it is to stick between someones ribs.

BeltAccMagnifyingGlass.name: Collector's Magnifying Glass
BeltAccMagnifyingGlass.desc: True weapon and armour collectors can appraise items themselves before buying them, which is why they always keep a good magnifying glass close at hand.

BeltAccGoldsmithPliers.name: Goldsmith's Pliers
BeltAccGoldsmithPliers.desc: These delicate pliers are precise enough to handle the tiniest gemstones.

BeltAccLegendaryMysteriousEmblem.name: Mysterious Insignia
BeltAccLegendaryMysteriousEmblem.desc: The occult powers that dwell in this insignia have made generations of Bandits kill one another.

BeltAccRareBestiary.name: Erudite Bestiary
BeltAccRareBestiary.desc: Though incomplete, this bestiary is a collection of decades of research by Gosenberg Scholars.

BeltAccThrowingGlove.name: Rod Left-Hand's Glove
BeltAccThrowingGlove.desc: Tales say that Rod Left-Hand triumphed over the Arena of Legends using only throwing weapons.

BeltAccKrownLoot.name: Pedlar's Ring
BeltAccKrownLoot.desc: Members of the Pedlars Guild recognise one another thanks to this small ring. It can be worn on a finger or as a pendant, or even carried on a belt.

BeltAccTrample.name: Hobnailed Treads
BeltAccTrample.desc: To prevent them from rusting too quickly, it's best to remove these treads unless you need them.

BeltAccRescue.name: Portrait of Brutus the Dogged
BeltAccRescue.desc: Legend has it that Brutus the Dogged climbed back aboard his ship no less than thirty-seven times in a single battle.

BeltAccBallista.name: Gunner's Winch
BeltAccBallista.desc: This winch lets you draw a ballista's bowstring with a few flicks of the wrist.

BeltAccAntiBoarding.name: Small Spikes
BeltAccAntiBoarding.desc: This tool was invented by an obscure Belerian lord mayor to repel boarding attempts.

BeltAccCrowSkull.name: Crow Skull
BeltAccCrowSkull.desc: Crows are a symbol of intelligence and cunning for the Skelmar. Killing them is forbidden, except in a ritual setting.

BeltAccLighter.name: Lighter
BeltAccLighter.desc: This metal plate is not merely decorative. It can be used to quickly set wood ablaze and enemies as well.

BeltAccLegionOath.name: Legionary's Oath
BeltAccLegionOath.desc: The words scribbled on this scroll are from the Legionary's Oath, a solemn recitation in which the soldier swears to serve Edoran and their General.

BeltAccUnwavering.name: Pirate's Crampons
BeltAccUnwavering.desc: These removable crampons fit on the soles of your boots and leave nasty holes in the ship's deck.

BeltAccSwordmanGloves.name: Protective Glove
BeltAccSwordmanGloves.desc: There's no shame in wanting to keep all your fingers.

BeltAccMultipleHit.name: Ichtyan Amulet
BeltAccMultipleHit.desc: This amulet could represent a siren or any sort of fish, really. Hard to say.

BeltAccSupport.name: Unbreakable Heart Medallion
BeltAccSupport.desc: This medallion can be separated into two distinct pendants, then reassembled into one heart-shaped pendant.

BeltAccIgnoreGuard.name: Powdered Mother-of-Pearl
BeltAccIgnoreGuard.desc: When a weapon is covered with this powder, it reflects the sun and prevents your opponent from looking straight at it.

BeltAccBoarding.name: Sea Dog's Flask
BeltAccBoarding.desc: Nothing like a quick shot of rum to find your sea legs.

BeltAccRange.name: Spyglass
BeltAccRange.desc: This item has greatly reduced collisions at sea, but vastly increased the number of hostile boardings.

BeltAccTroubled.name: Pirate's Smoke Pouch
BeltAccTroubled.desc: The wad of dried seaweed can be smoked or steeped in water.

BeltAccDaganSong.name: Dagan's Tablature
BeltAccDaganSong.desc: Dagan's instructions are so clear that you don't need to be a musician to understand his tablature.

BeltAccAtlessHorn.name: Mehyt's Ivory Horn
BeltAccAtlessHorn.desc: Carved out of ivory from an unidentified creature, this horn produces a sound that rekindles your Companions' hope and courage.

BeltAccNarsesNet.name: Narses' Net
BeltAccNarsesNet.desc: This net is made of an alloy unlike any other. As thin and light as a spider's silk, it's still sturdy enough to withstand the fangs and claws of the wild animals Narses fought.

BeltAccHorounBox.name: Horoun's Soundbox
BeltAccHorounBox.desc: This item is so strange that it's hard to describe. It's a box carved out of bone, with a switch that can be pressed to produce a sound that attracts animals.

BeltAccEnlilKey.name: Enlil's Wrench
BeltAccEnlilKey.desc: This ingenious little device is actually a miniature version of the tool the Ancients used to tighten their ballistae's bowstrings.

BeltAccLegendaryFighterbuckle.name: Champion's Buckle
BeltAccLegendaryFighterbuckle.desc: Awarded exclusively to winners of the Arena of Legends, this belt buckle clearly showcases its wearer's prowess.

BeltAccLegendaryArenaTrophy.name: Trophy of Legends
BeltAccLegendaryArenaTrophy.desc: This trophy was made to be carried on a belt, letting its holder boast without saying a word.

BeltAccSeaSerpent.name: Sea Serpent Scale
BeltAccSeaSerpent.desc: Its best to wear gloves when handling this item, as the slightest contact could prove extremely painful.

BeltAccPit.name: Hangman's Rope
BeltAccPit.desc: Made from a rope used in an actual hanging, this charm reminds Bandits of what could happen to them if they're ever captured.

BeltAccPit1.name: Homemade Tonic
BeltAccPit1.desc: It's not easy to fight and drink at the same time. But for those who do manage, nothing beats a homemade tonic.

BeltAccPit2.name: Crocswine Musk
BeltAccPit2.desc: This ointment exudes an indescribable, vaguely nauseating odour known for awakening a powerful urge to murder someone in even the gentlest souls.

BeltAccPit3.name: Prayer to the Protector
BeltAccPit3.desc: Hand-copied from a holy text, this prayer is said to give the believer some of Saint Eleor's protective abilities.

BeltAccPit4.name: Sooty Scarf
BeltAccPit4.desc: Legend has it that One-Eyed Maxillus once stole from the Tules a scarf that made him invisible to the Guards. Could this be that very scarf?

BeltAccBlockTerror.name: Tules' Finest
BeltAccBlockTerror.desc: A sacred spirit that provides a reliable gut-full of courage. Reserved for only the bitterest fights.

BeltAccHealTerror.name: Soothing Concoction
BeltAccHealTerror.desc: It's hard to be sure that this concoction really has any effect on wounds, but its sweet, familiar aroma soothes the soul of all who inhale it.

BeltAccTrapperBook.name: The Huntsman's Handiwork
BeltAccTrapperBook.desc: This collection of songs, poems and hunting stories recounts a young huntsman's journey through the Five Kingdoms. While its literary qualities are debatable, this volume is packed with useful advice and edifying descriptions that are worth reading before setting out on a hunt.

BeltAccTrapperBookSmilodon.name: The Skelmar Huntsman's Handiwork
BeltAccTrapperBookSmilodon.desc: This appendix to the original Huntsman's Handiwork is sometimes considered to be apocryphal, in light of its preposterous adventures. Even so, the advice it offers for dealing with the wildlife of the World's Edge seems entirely valid.

BeltAccTrapperBookSaurian.name: The Pirate Huntsman's Handiwork
BeltAccTrapperBookSaurian.desc: This appendix to the original Huntsman's Handiwork dates back to before the Ihrians' arrival in Belerion. However its descriptions and advice about the archipelago's wildlife are still relevant today.

BackAccMiningGemsChance.name: Sieve
BackAccMiningGemsChance.desc: Gemstones won't escape through this fine-mesh strainer.

BackAccMiningGemsQuality.name: Master Pickaxe
BackAccMiningGemsQuality.desc: This finely crafted pick can mine gemstones without damaging them.

BackAccMiningOresBonus.name: Pan
BackAccMiningOresBonus.desc: With a little skill and some practice, you can separate mud and gravel from sought-after ores.

BackAccMiningSandstone.name: Chisel
BackAccMiningSandstone.desc: This could have been the tool of a gifted sculptor and left its mark on many a masterpiece. Instead it is used to dislodge stubborn chunks of sandstone.

BackAccMiningGreyMass.name: Miner's Pick
BackAccMiningGreyMass.desc: Favoured by Gosenberg and Alazar miners, this pick is an efficient tool that makes it easier to extract rare metals.

BackAccMiningGoldenMetal.name: Pick
BackAccMiningGoldenMetal.desc: This lightweight pick is a great tool for delicate mining as it doesn't shatter etherite.

BackAccProfessionXp.name: Labourer's Headband
BackAccProfessionXp.desc: Manual workers tie this around their forehead to keep sweat and hair from getting in their face.

BackAccProfessionXp2.name: Laurel of the Labours
BackAccProfessionXp2.desc: Once rested upon the brow of a champion whose twelve labours defied kings, beasts, and even the will of the gods.

BackAccProfessionKnowledge.name: Punch
BackAccProfessionKnowledge.desc: An artisan can use this steel punch to leave their hallmark just about anywhere.

BackAccSecondProfession.name: Saint Lenaid's Emblem
BackAccSecondProfession.desc: According to legend, Saint Lenaid founded nine crafting guilds herself. Today, no less than 24 corporations claim descent from her prestigious patronage.

BackAccThiefStealReduction.name: Bar of Soap
BackAccThiefStealReduction.desc: The scent of Spring emanating from a squeaky-clean thief washes away their victims' suspicions.

BackAccThiefLockpickDuration.name: Velvet Pouch
BackAccThiefLockpickDuration.desc: Even the crudest of bandits will take the greatest care of their precious lock-picks. Many will wrap them in velvet to keep them from rusting.

BackAccThiefLockpickEasy.name: Trumpet
BackAccThiefLockpickEasy.desc: This iron instrument is primarily intended for people with hearing difficulties. But it can also be placed between a thief's ear and the lock they are attempting to pick.

BackAccThiefStealNoPrison.name: Embroidered Handkerchief
BackAccThiefStealNoPrison.desc: Without a doubt the most intricate item in your troop's possession. The striking lacework will make the wearer seem highly respectable.

BackAccBlacksmithQuality.name: Swage
BackAccBlacksmithQuality.desc: Using a swage, a blacksmith can imprint a uniform shape onto metal.

BackAccBlacksmithResources.name: Forge Pincers
BackAccBlacksmithResources.desc: These pincers make it possible to handle burning metal without losing one's fingers.

BackAccAlchemyResources.name: Herbarium
BackAccAlchemyResources.desc: This comprehensive collection identifies almost every herb and grass from Belerion to Alazar. Readers can look up the dried specimens to easily identify various plant species.

BackAccFishingNumber.name: Fly
BackAccFishingNumber.desc: Attached to the end of a fishing line, the fly imitates the movement of insects above the water.

BackAccFishingCalamity.name: Sturdy Lure
BackAccFishingCalamity.desc: This lure is the size of a big rat and represents a moustachioed fish.

BackAccCookingNoSalt.name: Salt Scoop
BackAccCookingNoSalt.desc: This small shovel allows you to perfectly portion salt, avoiding spillage and making the user appear more professional.

BackAccCookingResources.name: Cooking Ladle
BackAccCookingResources.desc: Ladles can be used for just about anything in a field kitchen: from measuring to serving, it's every cook's travelling companion.

BackAccTinkererResources.name: Wooden Ruler
BackAccTinkererResources.desc: The measurements inscribed on this wooden rod belong to someone unknown. Its feet have been used to build houses for a very long time.

BackAccMedicNoCost.name: Brace
BackAccMedicNoCost.desc: An ingenious assemblage of wood, leather and fabric, this brace can immobilise a limb to accelerate its healing.

BackAccMedicDoubleInjury.name: Doctor's Mask
BackAccMedicDoubleInjury.desc: This plaster mask is moulded on a statue of the holy Saint Balfroy. Its mere sight is enough to convince the sick that they have been cured.

BackAccMedicPlague.name: Alazar's Treatise
BackAccMedicPlague.desc: A copy of a copy of a copy of the research completed by Sophy Adr Alazar.

BackAccScholarTime.name: Inkstand
BackAccScholarTime.desc: Jotting down a discovery one day means you won't rediscover it the next day.

BackAccScholarKnowledgeRest.name: Pocketbook
BackAccScholarKnowledgeRest.desc: The supposedly interminable Song of Jeru is a treasure trove of information about the Five Kingdoms.

BackAccFishBonuses.name: Chum
BackAccFishBonuses.desc: Quality bait so prized by fishermen that they will not hesitate to fight over it.

BackAccRousteBall.name: Rouste Trophy
BackAccRousteBall.desc: While this may look like a ball chewed up by a crocswine, it is actually the symbol of a dazzling victory.

BackAccBushHammer.name: Bush Hammer
BackAccBushHammer.desc: This small hammer is used to refine stone surfaces quickly and precisely without wasting any material.

BackAccRollingPin.name: Rolling Pin
BackAccRollingPin.desc: Highly effective for rapping would-be pie thieves on the knuckles, and for turning leftovers into halfway edible dishes.

BackAccDrinkingHorn.name: Drinking Horn
BackAccDrinkingHorn.desc: These jewels of Skelmar craftsmanship are made from wild cattle native to the World's Edge.

BackAccCraftsman.name: Master Craftsman Medal
BackAccCraftsman.desc: Traditionally awarded to a craftsman by their mentor, this medal has been losing its prestige because of trafficking.

BackAccErkeshetTool.name: Erkeshet's Chisel
BackAccErkeshetTool.desc: This tool may look rather plain, but it was admired by the Ancients decades after its owner died.

BackAccNeptiAbacus.name: Nepti's Abacus
BackAccNeptiAbacus.desc: Made of gold and ivory, this ridiculously precious abacus was made in Nepti's image.

BackAccBehediteCompass.name: Behedite's Compass
BackAccBehediteCompass.desc: According to the scriptures, it's impossible for this compass to have belonged to legendary explorer Behedite. Still, there is something unique about this tool.

BackAccDumuziNecklace.name: Dumuzi's Half-Necklace
BackAccDumuziNecklace.desc: When put together with its twin, the words "eternal friendship" are visible in an ancient language.

BackAccUrashuNecklace.name: Urashu's Bestiary
BackAccUrashuNecklace.desc: Who can believe that the creatures described in this bestiary once actually existed?

AnimAccAnimalWalkSpeed2.name: Pegasus Blessing
AnimAccAnimalWalkSpeed2.desc: Whispers say it once belonged to a fabled white stallion. Those who wear it swear the wind itself follows their stride.

AnimAccCarriage.name: Saddlebags
AnimAccCarriage.desc: Harnessed to an animal, these bags can distribute the weight of a load.

AnimAccCarriage2.name: Pocketed Saddlebags
AnimAccCarriage2.desc: Harnessed to an animal, these bags can distribute the weight of a load.

AnimAccCarriage3.name: Medium Saddlebags
AnimAccCarriage3.desc: Harnessed to an animal, these bags can distribute the weight of a load.

AnimAccCarriage4.name: Large Saddlebags
AnimAccCarriage4.desc: Harnessed to an animal, these bags can distribute the weight of a load.

AnimAccCarriage5.name: Huge Saddlebags
AnimAccCarriage5.desc: Harnessed to an animal, these bags can distribute the weight of a load.

AnimAccCarriage6.name: Magical Saddlebags
AnimAccCarriage6.desc: Harnessed to an animal, these bags can distribute the weight of a load.

AnimAccFriendship.name: Friendship Necklace
AnimAccFriendship.desc: This necklace's soothing effect comes from its weight and the essences its fabric is soaked in.

AnimAccExperience.name: Ear Net
AnimAccExperience.desc: This bonnet protects ponies against insects.

AnimAccDiscretion.name: Halter
AnimAccDiscretion.desc: Lighter and less cumbersome than bridles, halters can be used by Companions to lead ponies with a gentle hand.

AnimAccAllyMelee.name: Collar of Unity
AnimAccAllyMelee.desc: A collar imbued with the scent of its wearer's peers.

AnimAccNoAllyMelee.name: Collar of Solitude
AnimAccNoAllyMelee.desc: A leather collar favoured by solitary animals.

AnimAccCritDmg.name: Tooth Collar
AnimAccCritDmg.desc: Teeth embedded in a leather strap.

AnimAccGritIfKill.name: Collar of Loyalty
AnimAccGritIfKill.desc: A fine leather collar, symbolising the wearer's attachment to their master.

AnimAccBerserkProc.name: Spiked Collar
AnimAccBerserkProc.desc: Forcing an animal to wear this collar is extremely cruel: the vicious spikes pierce its neck so deeply that the beast becomes enraged.

AnimAccRegen.name: Infused Collar
AnimAccRegen.desc: The fibres of this elegant collar have been infused with medicinal ointments that protect the animal's health.

AnimAccSecondLife.name: Protective Collar
AnimAccSecondLife.desc: The All-seeing Eye's priests have fashioned this collar according to the precepts of Saint Lenaid, which have remained unchanged for 500 years.

AnimAccObey.name: Bacon-bound Collar
AnimAccObey.desc: While initially delicious, this collar's smell can turn into a foul stench if it is not properly looked after.

AnimAccGuard.name: Guard Collar
AnimAccGuard.desc: This collar makes it hard to sleep soundly. No wonder the animal wearing it is the first to know of a surprise attack.

AnimAccDomination.name: Training Collar
AnimAccDomination.desc: This collar is made of a running knot that makes training faster and more efficient, although it can be painful for the animal.

AnimAccSwiftness.name: Feathered Collar
AnimAccSwiftness.desc: An incredibly soft collar that gently tickles the animal's neck when it moves.

AnimAccPoison.name: Poisoned Collar
AnimAccPoison.desc: It seems that this collar was created by someone who has a strictly utilitarian vision of animals.

AnimAccFire.name: Burning Collar
AnimAccFire.desc: You really have to hate animals to make one wear this collar.

AnimAccRedoBaseAction.name: Juggler's Collar
AnimAccRedoBaseAction.desc: Though slightly discoloured by Erymanthos's gastric juices, this collar has lost none of its effectiveness. Judging by the exceptional quality of the fabric, its previous wearer must have been a famous artist. Now, as to whether it was an animal or a human being

AnimAccCorrosion.name: Corrosive Collar
AnimAccCorrosion.desc: This collar tends to burn the hair and flesh of the animal wearing it, but such beasts are easily replaced.

ArmorPlatePonyT2.name: Light Pony Plate
ArmorPlatePonyT2.desc: Although ponies do not take kindly to wearing protection, this plate has been designed for their comfort.

ArmorPlatePonyT3.name: Medium Pony Plate
ArmorPlatePonyT3.desc: No expense must be spared when protecting your favourite mount. The artisan even engraved the armour plates.

ArmorPlatePonyT35.name: Enhanced Pony Plate
ArmorPlatePonyT35.desc: Medium pony plate enhanced by a skilled blacksmith.

ArmorPlatePonyT4.name: Heavy Pony Plate
ArmorPlatePonyT4.desc: This armour covers the pony from head to tail.

ArmorPlatePonyT5.name: Rare Pony Plate
ArmorPlatePonyT5.desc: Heavy armor masterfully crafted that covers the pony from head to tail.

AnimAccBeastResist.name: Hunt Collar
AnimAccBeastResist.desc: After a complex ritual that includes immersing this collar in water from the Mirror of the Ancients for seven days and seven nights, this item protects its wearer from the Beast's influence for a bit longer than other animals.

AnimAccBeastDamage.name: Pack Collar
AnimAccBeastDamage.desc: The bones of the Beast embedded in the leather of this collar feed the rage of the animal that wears it, causing it to behave like a monster from the Ghost Pack.

AnimAccBeastRiposte.name: Herald Collar
AnimAccBeastRiposte.desc: The Beast's influence is present in this sinister collar. No Tracker would ever make their animal companion wear it.

AnimAccBeastDefense.name: Beast Collar
AnimAccBeastDefense.desc: A small fragment of the Beast's influence allows this collar's wearer to resist pain. As for what happens to their mind in the long run... they'll have to survive long enough to find out.

LayerCommonArmor.name: Defender's Reinforced Layer
LayerCommonArmor.desc: An enhancement used by Defenders from Harag to upgrade their armour.

LayerCommonGuard.name: Tracker's Reinforced Layer
LayerCommonGuard.desc: Popular with Trackers, this heavy enhancement cushions blows and deflects blades.

LayerCommonDexterity.name: Hunter's Reinforced Layer
LayerCommonDexterity.desc: This extra leather layer protects a hunter's body without impeding their movement.

LayerCommonStrength.name: Warrior's Reinforced Layer
LayerCommonStrength.desc: Grants additional momentum to the wearer's blows.

LayerCommonCritical.name: Bard's Reinforced Layer
LayerCommonCritical.desc: Stylish and refined, this layer allows the wearer to demonstrate their full potential.

LayerCommonMovement.name: Sage's Reinforced Layer
LayerCommonMovement.desc: Sages always choose mobility over power.

LayerUncoArmor.name: Reinforced Layer of the Boar
LayerUncoArmor.desc: Renders armour as durable as a boar's hide.

LayerUncoGuard.name: Reinforced Layer of the Bear
LayerUncoGuard.desc: The bear paw engraved on this layer serves as a talisman for the wearer.

LayerUncoDexterity.name: Reinforced Layer of the Eagle
LayerUncoDexterity.desc: It's not uncommon to see Harag hunters displaying this - the eagle is their emblem and this piece is ideal for an archer.

LayerUncoStrength.name: Reinforced Layer of the Wolf
LayerUncoStrength.desc: The stylised wolf maw is intended to scare away evil spirits.

LayerUncoCritical.name: Reinforced Layer of the Lynx
LayerUncoCritical.desc: Inspired by the acuity of the lynx, the wearer is said to be granted the animal's piercing gaze.

LayerUncoMovement.name: Reinforced Layer of the Fox
LayerUncoMovement.desc: Simply replace your armour's stiff joints with this leather layer to get around faster and more stealthily.

LayerUncoArmorGuard.name: Reinforced Layer of the Ox
LayerUncoArmorGuard.desc: Made entirely of plate, this layer only dates back to the war of Edor.

LayerUncoArmorStrength.name: Reinforced Layer of the Stag
LayerUncoArmorStrength.desc: The scales are arranged to form antlers.

LayerUncoGuardStrength.name: Reinforced Layer of the Horse
LayerUncoGuardStrength.desc: If you look closely, the horse engraved on this layer looks more like a pony than a stallion.

LayerUncoDexterityCritical.name: Reinforced Layer of the Falcon
LayerUncoDexterityCritical.desc: The fawn-coloured scales are reminiscent of a falcon's plumage.

LayerUncoDexterityMovement.name: Reinforced Layer of the Ermine
LayerUncoDexterityMovement.desc: Designed by a hunter for his child, this layer is smaller than other enhancements but can be adjusted to any armour.

LayerUncoDexterity2Movement.name: Scholars' Armour Layer
LayerUncoDexterity2Movement.desc: Created by Alazarian Scholars, this armour layer is incredibly similar to that of the Trackers.

LayerUncoStrengthCritical.name: Reinforced Layer of the Serpent
LayerUncoStrengthCritical.desc: Notorious in Harag, this enhancement was a favourite of the Rooks. Now the Trackers believe that it brings bad luck, and few still craft it.

LayerUncoCriticalMovement.name: Reinforced Layer of the Rat
LayerUncoCriticalMovement.desc: They say this used to have a more honourable name, but that its prevalence among renegades made it an object of scorn.

LayerRareMovement.name: Colossal Reinforced Layer of the Fox
LayerRareMovement.desc: Messengers love this reinforced layer, especially when their route leads them through a battlefield or a swamp full of crocswine.

LayerRareArmorGuard.name: Colossal Reinforced Layer of the Ox
LayerRareArmorGuard.desc: This reinforced layer is made of uncomfortable plates, but the protection they offer is such that no warrior would turn them down.

LayerRareArmorStrength.name: Colossal Reinforced Layer of the Stag
LayerRareArmorStrength.desc: According to Trackers, the colossal version of this reinforced layer is the first of its kind.

LayerRareGuardStrength.name: Colossal Reinforced Layer of the Horse
LayerRareGuardStrength.desc: The engravings on this layer still depict some kind of pony, but they give off an ominous glow.

LayerRareDexterityCritical.name: Colossal Reinforced Layer of the Falcon
LayerRareDexterityCritical.desc: This comfortable reinforced layer makes the wearer's movements smooth and precise.

LayerRareDexterityMovement.name: Colossal Reinforced Layer of the Ermine
LayerRareDexterityMovement.desc: The Layer of the Ermine was made for a child who then went on to create this colossal version.

LayerRareStrengthCritical.name: Colossal Reinforced Layer of the Serpent
LayerRareStrengthCritical.desc: Many tales are told about those who use this layer, some less glorious than others.

LayerRareCriticalMovement.name: Colossal Reinforced Layer of the Rat
LayerRareCriticalMovement.desc: Costly and hard to forge, this reinforced layer is used only by the most ambitious Bandits.

LayerRareGuardNoCritical.name: Saurian Brooch
LayerRareGuardNoCritical.desc: This brooch restricts movement but provides significant protection.

LayerRareCriticalNoMovement.name: Mihr Brooch
LayerRareCriticalNoMovement.desc: Rimesteel was used to give this brooch its pearly colour.

LayerRareDexterityNoArmor.name: Siren Brooch
LayerRareDexterityNoArmor.desc: The siren on this brooch is far less repulsive than the scavenger that haunts the shores of Belerion.

LayerRareStrengthNoArmor.name: Hessura Brooch
LayerRareStrengthNoArmor.desc: The divine Hessura's smiling face brings hope and strength.

LayerRareMoveNoArmor.name: Aeda Brooch
LayerRareMoveNoArmor.desc: The goddess Aeda looks particularly annoyed to have been depicted on this brooch.

LayerRareCritNoGuard.name: Sabretooth Brooch
LayerRareCritNoGuard.desc: The artist put most of their effort into the beast's fangs, to the detriment of the rest of its face.

LayerLegendaryStrength.name: Beast's Reinforced Layer
LayerLegendaryStrength.desc: Inspired by the power of the Beast, this reinforced layer gives its wearer superhuman strength.

LayerLegendaryDexterity.name: Tules' Reinforced Layer
LayerLegendaryDexterity.desc: One doesn't have to believe the Tules exist to enjoy the benefits of this tough reinforced layer.

LayerLegendaryGuard.name: Saint Eleor's Reinforced Layer
LayerLegendaryGuard.desc: The symbol engraved on this reinforced layer is said to be a faithful depiction of the holy Protector's shield.

LayerLegendaryCritical.name: Sea Serpent's Reinforced Layer
LayerLegendaryCritical.desc: Legend has it that Prince Belerion Halios once faced a gigantic sea monster that could break a ship in two with a single stroke of its fin.

RawMaterials.name: Raw Materials
RawMaterials.desc: A few scraps of metal and leather, handy for repairing companions' armour in a fight.

Remedy.name: Medicine
Remedy.desc: A powerful salve that heals a companion's Injury. The vial is collected after use.

EstantRemedy.name: Ihrian Remedy
EstantRemedy.desc: Crafted in the finest Ihrian tradition, this ointment can be used to treat a Companion's Injury. The flask is recovered after use.

FakeRemedy.name: Hairpusher
FakeRemedy.desc: The Hair Growth Lotion invented by Mr Quickwit a great scholar is supposed to help your Companions' hair grow back completely within one Rest.

ApprenticeRemedy.name: Flawed Remedy
ApprenticeRemedy.desc: A cure prepared with love and care, but no particular knowledge. The flask is recovered after use.

PlagueRemedy.name: Cure for the plague
PlagueRemedy.desc: A very strong remedy that can heal a plague-infected wound. The flask is recovered after use.

BeastRemedy.name: Remedy of the Ancients
BeastRemedy.desc:
Thanks to the blessing of the Ancients, the water contained in this flask can heal animals influenced by the Beast.
It has no noticeable effect on humans.

LockPick.name: Lockpick
LockPick.desc: This small lockpick can be used to open locks that separate a thief from their loot.

Piton.name: Piton
Piton.desc: When driven into a rock, this spike can be used to hang a rope and descend from steep heights.

Chains.name: Chains
Chains.desc: Tough chains made from alazarite used to shackle a prisoner after capture.

GhostPackChain.name: Alazar's Chains
GhostPackChain.desc: It took all of Alazar's ingenuity to create chains capable of catching a Ghost Pack monster.

E1TrackerMap.name: Arthesian Hunt
E1TrackerMap.desc: According to the report, someone was attacked in a field near Saint Eleor Abbey. The Ghost Pack then fled in an unknown direction. We might have to wait for nightfall.

S1TrackerMap.name: Tiltren Hunt
S1TrackerMap.desc: The report states that another body was found north of the stables. All points to the giant she-wolf Sikha we have been hunting for several weeks now.

G1TrackerMap.name: Vertruse Hunt
G1TrackerMap.desc: The report mentions a half-eaten corpse south of Brownrock cave. If it is indeed the Ghost Pack, we will have to wait until nightfall before going after it.

H1TrackerMap.name: Ludern Hunt
H1TrackerMap.desc: The report mentions a corpse lying somewhere between the Ludern Jail and Fatclaw Cave. If this is the Ghost Pack's doing, you'll have to wait until nightfall before tracking it down.

G2TrackerMap.name: Grinmeer Hunt
G2TrackerMap.desc: According to this report, a corpse was found on the beach in the south-west of the region. Rumour has it the Ghost Pack might be involved. You will have to wait for nightfall before going after it.

A1TrackerMap.name: Drombach Hunt
A1TrackerMap.desc: The report mentions a Scholar who disappeared on the way to the statue waterfall.

B1TrackerMap1.name: Belerion Hunt
B1TrackerMap1.desc:
The report describes a body torn to shreds in the north of Per-Bast.
If this is the Ghost Pack's doing, you'll have to wait until nightfall to track it down.

E2TrackerMap.name: Ormance Hunt
E2TrackerMap.desc: The report mentions a dismembered corpse in the south of the Barony of the Isle. If this is the Ghost Pack's doing, you'll have to wait until nightfall before tracking it down.

IR2TrackerMap1.name: Herald of the Beast Hunt I
IR2TrackerMap1.desc: The report says that the Scouts found the body of a Brotherhood Mercenary west of Loner's Barrow. If this is a Herald's doing, you'll have to wait until nightfall before tracking it down.

IR2TrackerMap2.name: Herald of the Beast Hunt II
IR2TrackerMap2.desc: The report describes a half-devoured body at the bottom of the Mirror of the Ancients. If this is a Herald's doing, you'll have to wait until nightfall before tracking it down.

IR2TrackerMap3.name: Herald of the Beast Hunt III
IR2TrackerMap3.desc: The report mentions a corpse abandoned near the rapids. If this is a Herald's doing, you'll have to wait until nightfall before tracking it down.

HideoutMap.name: Lair Location
HideoutMap.desc: After defeating a member of the ::name::, you obtained a map indicating the location of their lair.

E1TreasureMap.name: Mercenary's Treasure
E1TreasureMap.desc: Indicates the treasure of a mercenary.

G1BourgomasterTreasure.name: Lady Mayoress' Documents
G1BourgomasterTreasure.desc: Shows an important location for Marheim's Lady Mayoress.

G1ApothecaryMap.name: Apothecary's Meeting Place
G1ApothecaryMap.desc: Indicates where Joren Toverdrank is to meet his uncle.

E1KnowledgePath1.name: Inquisitor Rendezvous Point
E1KnowledgePath1.desc: This map is marked with a rendezvous point for the Inquisition.

H1TreasureMap.name: Colonel Deteore's Treasure
H1TreasureMap.desc: Shows the location of Colonel Deteore's treasure.

H1GhostPackMap.name: Winfrith's Map
H1GhostPackMap.desc: Shows where Winfrith needs to be escorted to.

G2BanditTreasure.name: Bandits' Map
G2BanditTreasure.desc: Shows the location of the Bandits' treasure.

A1TreasureMap.name: Drombach Bandits' Treasure
A1TreasureMap.desc: Shows the location of the Drombach Bandits' treasure.

B1SmugglersMap.name: The Albatross' Route
B1SmugglersMap.desc: This map was drawn by someone who could barely hold a pencil, but with a little guesswork, you can make out the route followed by a ship called The Albatross.

B1PiratesDihya.name: Pirate Map
B1PiratesDihya.desc: Shows the location of a small pirate camp.

B1SmallTreasureMap1.name: Treasure Map I
B1SmallTreasureMap1.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap1.name: Sinan's Map
B1SealordMap1.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap2.name: Adelwis's Map
B1SealordMap2.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap3.name: Drest's Map
B1SealordMap3.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap4.name: Hana and Meryem's Map
B1SealordMap4.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap6.name: Loderans's Map
B1SealordMap6.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap7.name: Danzir's Map
B1SealordMap7.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap8.name: Isha's Map
B1SealordMap8.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap9.name: Rodolbert's Map
B1SealordMap9.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap10.name: Ganne's Map
B1SealordMap10.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

B1SealordMap11.name: Kjerti's Map
B1SealordMap11.desc: Shows the location of a pirate treasure.

E2R6Map.name: Sigurdr's Map
E2R6Map.desc: Shows the place where Jarl Sigurdr was supposed to meet up with his men.

E2TreasureMap.name: Bandits' Map
E2TreasureMap.desc: Shows the location of the Ormance Bandits' treasure.

IR2TreasureMap.name: Fragam Clan Map
IR2TreasureMap.desc: Shows the location of the decimated Fragam Clan's supplies.

GoldenKey.name: Golden Key
GoldenKey.desc: This key is precious, but not as much as the treasure it keeps sealed.

WroughtKey.name: Ornate Key
WroughtKey.desc: Produced by an expert metalworker, this key probably opens intricate locks.

CoarseKey.name: Crude Key
CoarseKey.desc: This key probably opens locks as basic as itself.

CrimePathKey1.name: Noble's Key
CrimePathKey1.desc: The head of this key depicts two golden spears on an azure background.

CrimePathKey2.name: Broker's Key
CrimePathKey2.desc: The head of this key depicts a bunch of grapes.

CrimePathKey3.name: Smuggler's Key
CrimePathKey3.desc: The head of this key is crusted with mud.

CrimePathKey4.name: Holy Key
CrimePathKey4.desc: The head of this key was forged using rimesteel alloy.

CrimePathKey5.name: Scholar's Key
CrimePathKey5.desc: The head of this key depicts a scroll.

DaggerKey.name: Sword Key
DaggerKey.desc: Two crossed swords are engraved on the head of this key.

ShieldKey.name: Shield Key
ShieldKey.desc: The Brotherhood's shield is engraved on the head of this key.

EyeKey.name: Eye Key
EyeKey.desc: The All-Seeing Eye is engraved on the head of this key.

WheelKey.name: Wheel Key
WheelKey.desc: The Gosenberg Wheel is engraved on the head of this key.

RuinsKey0.name: Blessing of the Ancients
RuinsKey0.desc: This carved stone contains more powers and secrets than it appears.

RuinsKey1.name: Stone Seal
RuinsKey1.desc: This stone is not as heavy as it ought to be. Fine ridges can be felt on its sides.

RuinsKey2.name: Copper Seal
RuinsKey2.desc: This roughly reassembled seal has seen better days.

RuinsKey3.name: Steel Seal
RuinsKey3.desc: Your Blacksmith has done wonders with this seal to restore it to its former splendour.

RuinsKeyHalf2.name: Copper Seal Half
RuinsKeyHalf2.desc: Someone broke this seal intentionally. What could it have contained to deserve such a fate?

RuinsLever.name: Lever Shaft
RuinsLever.desc: This stone lever shaft can be used to open doors built by the Ancients.

InfectedBrain.name: Infected Brain
InfectedBrain.desc: This will surely be of interest to scientists in Alazar.

Pass.name: Border Pass
Pass.desc: Allows you to cross the border without needing to pay.

Tip.name: Information
Tip.desc: You are far too well-mannered to open this letter.

G2Mountain.name: Information
G2Mountain.desc: This note was written several days ago. It says: Meet up tonight at Hoevendorp Mine. Bring shears. And don't forget to burn this note!

G2Hoevendorp.name: Sales Contract
G2Hoevendorp.desc: This contract, dated before the Broker was killed, proves the Bernna Arena was sold to the Hovendorp family.

G2RookInstructions.name: Anonymous Letter
G2RookInstructions.desc: The Rooks' contact is pretending to be a merchant. To reveal their true identity, sell them some eel soup.

A1AstronomerLetter.name: Astronomer's Letter
A1AstronomerLetter.desc: This letter needs to be delivered to the Astronomer in Gosenberg.

FV5EdoranCode.name: Legion Letter
FV5EdoranCode.desc: This is a very old message from the Legion. The relic must be delivered to the War Council as quickly as possible. The chest code is: [REF_ICONS]

B1StartPoeme.name: Awkward Poem
B1StartPoeme.desc: Oh Lahissa, whose beauty is unsurpassed, whose voice warms my heart like the rays of the sun, whose laugh is like a seagull's cry above the waves, Lahissa, have mercy on my soul and marry me.

PathCrimeAdverting.name: Inventor's Instructions
PathCrimeAdverting.desc: The note reads: Lock your most precious belonging in the chest bearing the Gosenberg Wheel before placing it among the other chests. Then, arrange the various keys of the security system in those other chests. We would like to remind you that only chests with symbols are sturdy enough to house the bombs provided by our store. Wooden chests can only hold keys and paper. Make sure your notes on the location of the treasure are stored in a safe place.

PathMight4Paper.name: Deed
PathMight4Paper.desc: This simple piece of paper makes you the proud owner of the Brotherhood Fortress.

Fangs.name: Pristine Fang
Fangs.desc: This fang of a wild animal can be used as currency with Trackers.

Fishhook.name: Fish Hook
