Fishhook.desc: An iron hook that keeps the fish on the line.

SolidFishhook.name: Sturdy Fish Hook
SolidFishhook.desc: A sturdy hook that can catch an additional fish.

ExpertFishhook.name: Expert Fish Hook
ExpertFishhook.desc: A sturdy hook that can catch two additional fish.

GoldenTooth.name: Gold Tooth
GoldenTooth.desc: This was forcibly removed from its previous owner's mouth.

WeedKillingPotion.name: Weeding Potion
WeedKillingPotion.desc: Poured onto a plant, this potion will burn it from root to leaf.

BarberKit.name: Barber Kit
BarberKit.desc: Any mercenary who has spent a week in the wilderness has simple wants: a small blade, a shaving brush, and a little free time.

Seal.desc: This stamp can be placed on any helmet to grant it the effect of the one it was taken from.

Seasoning.name: Seasoning
Seasoning.desc:
Ingredients with rich and diverse flavours to enhance the dishes on a Tavern's menu.
Can only be used at the Tavern.

SkillMastery.name: Skill Mastery
SkillMastery.desc: Contains knowledge that will allow one of your Companions to upgrade one of their class skills.

WarChronicles.name: War Chronicles
WarChronicles.desc: A book detailing a series of military campaigns in the time of the Edoran Empire.

MilitaryReport.name: Military Report
MilitaryReport.desc: A small journal retracing the daily life of a Guard patrol.

WorkManual.name: Work Manual
WorkManual.desc: A book dealing with traditional workmanship.

PestTreatise.name: Treatise on the Plague
PestTreatise.desc: A book dealing with the Plague and how to treat it.

EdoranChronicles.name: Chronicles of Edoran
EdoranChronicles.desc: A piece of history retelling the death of Edor.

TraderManual.name: Merchant Manual
TraderManual.desc: Teaches you how to sell anything to anyone.

MedecineEncyclopedia.name: Medical Encyclopaedia
MedecineEncyclopedia.desc: Its anatomical drawings are sure to send shivers down one's spine.

GhostPackMemories.name: Tales of the Ghost Pack
GhostPackMemories.desc: Reports from Trackers in pursuit of the Ghost Pack.

FrostReport.name: Compendium of Frost
FrostReport.desc: A collection of accounts about Mihr's Curse.

SongPirates.name: Pirate Sheet Music
SongPirates.desc: This sheet music will teach you to play The Captain's Beard on the lute.

SongEdoran2.name: Skelmar Sheet Music
SongEdoran2.desc: This sheet music will teach you to play Aeda's Tears on the lute.

BoatConstructionBook.name: Builder's Blueprints
BoatConstructionBook.desc: These blueprints can be used to upgrade the design of any of your ship's components.

OilStrengthProcWeak.name: Energising Oil
OilStrengthProcWeak.desc: Apprentice apothecaries often prepare this oil to practise their skills.

OilDexterityProcWeak.name: Invigorating Oil
OilDexterityProcWeak.desc: This oil may not be perfect, but as the peddlers say: it's better than nothing.

OilDamageTakenProcWeak.name: Defensive Oil
OilDamageTakenProcWeak.desc: While it may be tempting to look down on imperfect oils, one should remember that they have allowed miraculous victories.

OilProcPoison1.name: Poisonous Oil I
OilProcPoison1.desc: This solution, made by mixing poisonous plants with thick vegetable oils, has effective toxic properties, and its smooth texture ensures good adherence to a weapon.

OilProcBurning1.name: Acidic Oil I
OilProcBurning1.desc: This highly caustic solution, stabilised in an abrasive mixture, triggers significant burning on the skin, but without causing any damage to the weapon it is applied to.

OilProcBleeding1.name: Whetting Oil I
OilProcBleeding1.desc: An abrasive mixture of mineral powders within a slightly acidic solution attacks and sharpens the most prominent parts of the weapon it is applied to.

OilProcTrueDmg1.name: Misty Oil I
OilProcTrueDmg1.desc: A gelatinous substance, which turns into a mist, dissipating in an area around the point of impact. Abrasive additives make it painful on contact with mucus membranes.

OilStrengthProc1.name: Strength Oil I
OilStrengthProc1.desc: A slightly sticky and lumpy mixture that allows for better grip on a weapon, and thus for stronger strikes. It is fairly unpleasant to touch.

OilDexterityProc1.name: Swiftness Oil I
OilDexterityProc1.desc: A light oil that very subtly lubricates the weapon it is applied to without making it slippery, which allows for quick and easy readjustment of the grip to constantly take advantage of the best possible balance.

OilDamageTakenProc1.name: Shielding Oil I
OilDamageTakenProc1.desc: Though foul smelling, this medicinal oil, to which a transdermal carrier has been added, reduces the sensation of pain, making its user more resistant.

OilIgnoreGuard1.name: Perforating Oil I
OilIgnoreGuard1.desc: An irritant liquid solution that tends to splash the target of the weapon to which it is applied, imbuing clothes and causing wounds regardless of protection.

OilSlowProc1.name: Paralysing Oil I
OilSlowProc1.desc: The sweet aroma of this gelatinous substance makes one quickly forget it is a poison, which momentarily affects the nervous system, causing the victim's movements to slow down.

OilAnimalsDmg1.name: Animal Essence Oil I
OilAnimalsDmg1.desc: The formula of this toxic oil is unique as it affects animals without presenting any danger to humans.

OilSelfheal1.name: Conversion Oil I
OilSelfheal1.desc: A medicinal oil which penetrates the skin and has properties that activate during an adrenaline surge, making it an excellent substance to use in combat.

OilPlagueDmg1.name: Plague Essence Oil I
OilPlagueDmg1.desc: This smelly concoction is the product of experiments designed to cure the Plague. Sadly, it induces intense pain in the afflicted, and its curative effects have yet to be proven.

OilDotEffect1.name: Infectious Oil I
OilDotEffect1.desc: This revolting mixture, a veritable bouillon of microbial cultures, rapidly infects the wounds caused by the weapon to which it is applied.

OilCleave1.name: Explosive Oil I
OilCleave1.desc: This unstable solution will detonate when hit, greatly increasing the damage caused by the initial impact.

OilWindfury1.name: Unstable Oil I
OilWindfury1.desc: An oil with a balanced and very subtle texture, which provides a better hold on the weapon to which it is applied, and makes it easier to surprise an opponent with an unexpected move.

OilOpportunityAttack1.name: Alertness Oil I
OilOpportunityAttack1.desc: This mysterious concoction seems to stimulate the nervous system of the person holding the weapon it is applied to, making the wielder especially effective at crucial and highly fleeting moments.

OilCrit1.name: Sharpening Oil I
OilCrit1.desc: This corrosive oil, when applied with a certain know-how, sharpens the most strategic parts of a weapon to maximise damage on the most effective strikes.

OilHemorraghe1.name: Bleeding Oil I
OilHemorraghe1.desc: Initially designed as an anticoagulant cream to stop bleeding, this greasy solution is now primarily used to accelerate blood loss in combat.

OilProcSolid.name: Hardening Oil I
OilProcSolid.desc: A weapon coated in this oil is less likely to break on impact.

OilSwipping.name: Immunity Oil I
OilSwipping.desc: Judging by its delicate scent, it's obvious that this oil has protective properties.

OilProcFever.name: Putrid Oil I
OilProcFever.desc: The effects of this oil originating from Harag are reminiscent of the diseases proliferating in this region's swamps.

OilBrave.name: The Brave's Oil I
OilBrave.desc: Who doesn't know the legendary Brave's Oil? Sold by unscrupulous apothecaries and popular with superstitious Mercenaries, this brew is rumoured to have all sorts of beneficial properties.

OilProcSlowReflexes.name: Exhausting Oil I
OilProcSlowReflexes.desc: This oil is sometimes used in Tiltren as a painkiller. Applied to the skin, it numbs limbs and alleviates pain.

OilSticky1.name: Sticky Oil I
OilSticky1.desc: This oil is hard to apply, but its texture helps deflect hits.

OilProtection1.name: Protection Oil I
OilProtection1.desc: The smell of this oil helps your allies recognise you and avoid hitting you even in the dark.

OilPlague1.name: Plague-ridden Oil I
OilPlague1.desc: Derived from the cure for the Plague, this oil was created by the famous Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory in Drombach.

OilPropulsion.name: Propulsion Oil I
OilPropulsion.desc: Whoever developed this oil must have discovered that the fastest way to get rid of a pirate was to throw him overboard.

OilInitiative.name: Initiative Oil I
OilInitiative.desc: The scent of this oil stirs the blood both yours and your opponent's.

OilAppease.name: Soothing Oil I
OilAppease.desc: This oil was supposedly invented by a pirate who became a protector of the Belerion Archipelago a century ago.

OilRegeneration.name: Regeneration Oil I
OilRegeneration.desc: Who wouldn't feel perked up by that powerful mint aroma?

RatBait.name: Rat Bait
RatBait.desc: You can pour this oil on a rats' nest to rebuild it in <narrator>::value:: hours</narrator>. But who would do such a thing?

OilBonusBurning.name: Inquisition Oil I
OilBonusBurning.desc: Developed by the hierophant Milos himself, this oil adheres to the skin permanently and bursts into flame at the slightest spark.

OilBonusBleeding.name: Briny Oil I
OilBonusBleeding.desc: The slightest touch of salt on an open wound is pure agony, as the inventor of this oil knew full well.

OilBonusPoison.name: Infected Oil I
OilBonusPoison.desc: This oil is ideally prepared by mixing pus from diseased skin with rancid vegetable oil.

OilRancour.name: Spite Oil I
OilRancour.desc: This oil has a misleading lustre. Its colours are bright, and it exudes a flowery scent.

OilSkelmar.name: Skelmar Oil I
OilSkelmar.desc: Though the Skelmar's alchemical expertise is limited at best, they have still managed to develop an oil perfectly suited to their fighting style.

OilCloudy.name: Murky Oil I
OilCloudy.desc: Bits of debris swirl about in this cloudy, rancid oil.

OilApothecary.name: Apothecary Oil I
OilApothecary.desc: This oil was developed in secret by the Arthes Apothecary that the Mercenaries saved from the Inquisition.

TailplaneProjectile.name: Fletched Projectile
TailplaneProjectile.desc: It takes a significant number of birds to make this type of fletching.

IgnitedProjectile.name: Flaming Projectile
IgnitedProjectile.desc: The wood of this projectile is saturated with grease expensive, but terribly effective against enemy ships.

Charcoal.name: Coal
Charcoal.desc: Coal can be used with iron to forge powerful weapons and armour.

Rope.name: Rope
Rope.desc: The hemp rope is used to make bows as well as gear for navigation and climbing. In a pinch, it can also be used to tie up a captured animal.

Leather.name: Leather
Leather.desc: This leather is used to craft weapons, armour, and armour layering.

Cloth.name: Cloth
Cloth.desc: This cloth fabric allows you to craft clothing that will stand the test of time.

Fat.name: Grease
Fat.desc: This grease can be used to make torches, quite handy for travelling in the dark.

Flask.name: Vial
Flask.desc: A small vial made of glass, used to craft medicines and alchemical items.

Salt.name: Salt
Salt.desc: Sold by most merchants, salt is a key ingredient in cooking.

PlaguedLeather.name: Plagued Leather
PlaguedLeather.desc: A strange aura emanates from this piece of leather. Perhaps someone knows how to refine it?

Wood.name: Wood
Wood.desc: The quintessential fuel source, wood is also useful for making boats and weapon handles.

Resin.name: Resin
Resin.desc: This thick, viscous substance isnt easy to work with, but it can be quite useful in alchemy or for treating materials.

Tanbark.name: Carmine Tanbark
Tanbark.desc: Its said that alchemists spend a fortune to procure what seems like just an ordinary dye.

Vairmeil.name: Vairmeil
Vairmeil.desc: Those who know how to craft vairmeil are careful not to share their knowledge: this extraordinary material is so highly prized that selling it is enough to ensure their familys fortune.

SnowWillow.name: Mountain Willow
SnowWillow.desc: This species of willow can grow just about anywhere, even at high altitudes, and is resistant to most tree fungi.

IronOre.name: Iron Ore
IronOre.desc: Iron ore can be used to make weapons, armour, and building components.

GreyMass.name: Grey Cluster
GreyMass.desc: This mass of metal and rock is unusable in its raw form, but a skilful alchemist can extract rimesteel from it.

Rimesteel.name: Rimesteel
Rimesteel.desc: Rimesteel is a recently discovered metal that doesn't occur naturally and is very difficult to extract. Only the best blacksmiths can make use of it.

Etherit.name: Etherite
Etherit.desc: Etherite was long valued only for its aesthetic appeal, but the arrival of Ihrians and their alchemical knowledge changed everything.

GoldMineral.name: Akhedian Steel
GoldMineral.desc: Akhedian steel is named after the city of Akhed in Ihraa. Without the help of their Scholars, the Five Kingdoms would never have discovered how to use etherite.

BeastMaterial.name: Bone of the Beast
BeastMaterial.desc: The toughness of this bone isn't the only obstacle to making weapons out of it, as it also exudes a strong sense of unease. Carving this material is a constant struggle against fear.

BeastSpawnMaterial.name: Herald's Horn
BeastSpawnMaterial.desc: A horn fragment that Trackers recover from the Heralds' corpses. They have to be reclaimed quickly before they dissolve into smoke in the sunlight.

Sandstone.name: Sandstone
Sandstone.desc: This slightly brittle rock could have many uses.

SnowIris.name: Snow Iris
SnowIris.desc: This flower mainly blooms in snowy regions.

Comfrey.name: Comfrey
Comfrey.desc: Comfrey is commonplace in prairies and fields.

Cowbane.name: Marsh Parsley
Cowbane.desc: Very common in humid places such as marshes and riverbanks, this plant induces nausea and convulsions, and can also lower the heart rate.

Starflower.name: Immortal Bloom
Starflower.desc: A flower growing in the sandy soil of the coast.

Lavender.name: Lavender
Lavender.desc: Lavender's anti-mite properties are well-known to Belerian peasants, who put sprigs of it in their chests of clothing.

StrangeRoot.name: Strange Tuber
StrangeRoot.desc: The folds in its skin are reminiscent of a human face.

FreshMint.name: Fresh Mint
FreshMint.desc: This herb is vital to Merchants, who can work wonders with their fresh breath.

Hemp.name: Hemp
Hemp.desc: This plant has many uses, from weaving fabric to cooking.

WhiteLeather.name: White Leather
WhiteLeather.desc: An odd type of leather, which is exceptionally tough despite its silky texture.

WhitePaw.name: Colossal Paw
WhitePaw.desc: It is said that these paws can suddenly take on a life of their own to crush the skulls of those who cut them off.

SharkTooth.name: Shark Tooth
SharkTooth.desc: Shark tooth jewellery was once all the rage in Belerion, but it's been disappearing recently as the use of these teeth in alchemy grows.

AlazarPowder.name: Alazarian Powder
AlazarPowder.desc: This powder gives off a strong smell of sulphur and coal.

AlchemicResidue.name: Alchemical Residue
AlchemicResidue.desc: In alchemy, nothing is wasted, not even the seemingly useless by-product of another recipe.

PestiferousGrowthSample.name: Plague-ridden Sample
PestiferousGrowthSample.desc: Extracted from plague-infected outgrowths, this substance could be of great use in alchemy.

FishOil.name: Fish Oil
FishOil.desc: A fatty oil with a pungent sea smell.

InfectedBlood.name: Infected Blood
InfectedBlood.desc: A sample that could be of interest to the Purifiers.

RedEyeball.name: Red Eyeball
RedEyeball.desc: Its vivid red colour is nauseating.

VirginEssence.name: Pristine Essence
VirginEssence.desc: This sticky translucent essence is an essential component in the brewing of alchemical oils.

MosquitoPiece.name: Mosquito Proboscis
MosquitoPiece.desc: Surprisingly flexible and resistant, proboscises can be dried and ground into a powder.

CrocoporkScale.name: Crocswine Scale
CrocoporkScale.desc: Crocswine skin is covered in reptilian scales, which can be ground into a powerful alchemical reagent.

DragonScale.name: Saurian Scale
DragonScale.desc: Saurian scales look a lot like crocswine scales.

Fin.name: Fin
Fin.desc: A very elegant fin that tends to rot quickly.

RetractableClaw.name: Retractable Claw
RetractableClaw.desc: The tendons are still attached to this claw.

SmilodonHairs.name: Tuft of Fur
SmilodonHairs.desc: No one really knows if sabretooth fur is of any real use in alchemy, but it does add a distinct flavour.

Ruby.name: Ruby
Ruby.desc: A sellable item. The ruby evokes fire and blood. It is associated with bravery and love.

Sapphire.name: Sapphire
Sapphire.desc: A sellable item. The sapphire represents peace and serenity. The superstitious wealthy wear it to ward off misfortune.

MarineBoard.name: Wooden Plank
MarineBoard.desc: A strong board, cut from a tough variety of wood.

HempSail.name: Hemp Burlap
HempSail.desc: It takes weavers many hours to make fabric of this quality.

MetalPlate.name: Metal Plate
MetalPlate.desc: Made from an alloy treated to resist rust, but bound to end up covered in it.

Hoist.name: Hoist
Hoist.desc: For anything larger than a rowboat, you'll need hoists to upgrade your ship.

ImpermeableCoating.name: Waterproof Sealant
ImpermeableCoating.desc: An essential product for sealing whatever needs to be sealed.

SmallItemFragments.name: Fragments of a Small Item
SmallItemFragments.desc: Only the scattered pieces of this small ancient object remain. A scholar could repair this.

Antiquity1.name: Piece of Pottery
Antiquity1.desc: This shard is truly exceptional - the bird adorning it is unbelievably lifelike.

Antiquity2.name: Tarnished Necklace
Antiquity2.desc: There is no way of knowing whether this piece of jewellery was worn by a man or a woman.

Antiquity3.name: Belt Buckle
Antiquity3.desc: The rest of the belt is gone, but this buckle is barely warped.

Antiquity4.name: Figurine of a Man
Antiquity4.desc: The sculpture is a bit crude and doesn't seem to represent anyone in particular. Yet a certain detail leads you to believe the figure is male.

Antiquity5.name: Coral Bracelet
Antiquity5.desc: The bracelet's bright colours glimmer in the sunlight.

Antiquity6.name: Glass Lens
Antiquity6.desc: When you look through this item, your vision is distorted. The lens was presumably meant to be inserted into something.

Antiquity7.name: Bone Rattle
Antiquity7.desc: Tiny bite marks are still visible on this toy.

Antiquity8.name: Coin
Antiquity8.desc: There is a hole in the middle of this bronze coin.

BigItemFragments.name: Fragments of a Precious Item
BigItemFragments.desc: The pieces of this object attest to its former greatness. A scholar could repair this.

Antiquity9.name: Silver Statuette
Antiquity9.desc: The creature represented resembles a snake but in a much more terrifying form.

Antiquity10.name: Hand Mirror
Antiquity10.desc: No one has ever seen the like of this object. No polished metal could ever reflect a face with such precision.

Antiquity11.name: Military Medal
Antiquity11.desc: This brooch has a very specific shape, and the spears engraved on it hint to the fact that it is actually a medal.

Antiquity12.name: Engraved Chalice
Antiquity12.desc: This cup is adorned with a variety of patterns. If they are indeed stars, the constellations they form are entirely fanciful.

Antiquity13.name: Unaltered Coat
Antiquity13.desc: The material this coat was made from is unknown, but has withstood the passage of time.

Antiquity14.name: Smooth Tablet
Antiquity14.desc: This object is strange enough to be quite valuable - its surface is entirely flat and blank.

Antiquity15.name: Guardian Figurine
Antiquity15.desc: This figurine represents someone holding some sort of shield... or perhaps a lantern?

Antiquity16.name: Valuable Box
Antiquity16.desc: Covered with battle ornaments and jewels, this box probably used to hold something important.

FakeAntiquity1.name: Corkscrew
FakeAntiquity1.desc: A corkscrew disguised as an antique. Alazarian alumni are such jokers!

RareAntiquityCristalSkull.name: Ancient Fragments
RareAntiquityCristalSkull.desc: Only a Scholar could discover the true nature of these fragments.

RareAntiquitySoulCradle.name: Ancient Fragments
RareAntiquitySoulCradle.desc: Only a Scholar could discover the true nature of these fragments.

RareAntiquityCelestialInstrument.name: Ancient Fragments
RareAntiquityCelestialInstrument.desc: Only a Scholar could discover the true nature of these fragments.

RareAntiquityAutomaton.name: Ancient Fragments
RareAntiquityAutomaton.desc: Only a Scholar could discover the true nature of these fragments.

RareAntiquitySystemSolar.name: Ancient Fragments
RareAntiquitySystemSolar.desc: Only a Scholar could discover the true nature of these fragments.

LegendaryMaceRuinAntiquity.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryMaceRuinAntiquity.desc: The owner of this broken relic must have come from noble lineage. A scholar could repair this.

LegendaryBowRuinH1.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryBowRuinH1.desc: The owner of this broken relic must be of noble lineage. A scholar could repair this.

LegendaryPolearmRuinH1.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryPolearmRuinH1.desc: The owner of this broken relic must be of noble lineage. A scholar could repair this.

LegendarySwordRuinS1.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendarySwordRuinS1.desc: The owner of this broken relic must be of noble lineage. A scholar could restore this.

LegendaryDaggerRuinG2.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryDaggerRuinG2.desc: The owner of this broken relic must be of noble lineage. A scholar could restore this.

LegendaryAxeRuinG1.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryAxeRuinG1.desc: The owner of this broken relic must be of noble lineage. A scholar could restore this.

LegendaryMace2HRuinS1.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryMace2HRuinS1.desc: The owner of this broken relic must be of noble lineage. A scholar could restore this.

LegendaryAxe2HRuinB1.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryAxe2HRuinB1.desc: The owner of this broken relic must be of noble lineage. A Scholar could restore this.

LegendaryFistRuinB1.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryFistRuinB1.desc: The owner of this broken relic must be of noble lineage. A Scholar could restore this.

LegendaryShieldRuinE2.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendaryShieldRuinE2.desc: The owner of this broken relic must have been an illustrious individual. A scholar might be able to reveal all of its secrets.

LegendarySword2HRuinIR2.name: Treasure of the Ancients
LegendarySword2HRuinIR2.desc: The owner of this broken relic must have been an illustrious individual. A Scholar might be able to reveal all of its secrets.

CommonFakeAntiquity1.name: Treasure of the Ancients
CommonFakeAntiquity1.desc: Only a Scholar could discover the true nature of this antique.

LegendaryRecipeRuinB1.name: Stone Tablet
LegendaryRecipeRuinB1.desc: This tablet features a drawing of an ancient ballista, but the inscriptions alongside it are nearly illegible.

PathKnowledge1Item.name: Puzzle Piece
PathKnowledge1Item.desc: The thick sides of this marble puzzle piece should slot in with other pieces.

DragonBones1.name: Dragon Bones - I
DragonBones1.desc: According to Professor Maurith's research, these bones belonged to a real dragon.

DragonBones2.name: Dragon Bones - II
DragonBones2.desc: According to Professor Maurith's research, these bones belonged to a real dragon.

DragonBones3.name: Dragon Bones - III
DragonBones3.desc: According to Professor Maurith's research, these bones belonged to a real dragon.

PrayerCollection.name: Prayer Book
PrayerCollection.desc: It is dedicated to the Eye and to Jeru.

EyeNecklace.name: Eye Necklace
EyeNecklace.desc: A sacred necklace with an eye-shaped pendant.

OokStatuette.name: Wooden Statuette
OokStatuette.desc: A small figure representing a soldier.

TuleStatuette.name: Tule Effigy
TuleStatuette.desc: Rare is the artist who dares try to depict the Tules, as the little gods are quite sensitive about such things.

Lyre.name: Lyre
Lyre.desc: A musical instrument that is very popular with minstrels, troubadours and jugglers.

MasterPiece.name: Masterpiece
MasterPiece.desc: No description could ever do justice to such a beautiful masterpiece.

Daub.name: Daub
Daub.desc: Simply looking at this terrible portrait will make your eyes water.

LaceRibbon.name: Lace Ribbon
LaceRibbon.desc: This ribbon is used to adorn the most beautiful attire in Gosenberg.

PoetryCollection.name: Poetry Book
PoetryCollection.desc: Whose heart would remain unmoved upon reading this book?

SilkGlove.name: Silk Glove
SilkGlove.desc: The glove's delicate material and trimmings make it ideal to slap a rival across the face with elegance.

SilverPin.name: Silver Brooch
SilverPin.desc: An elegant little piece of jewellery to suit anyone with excellent taste.

AnatomyBook.name: Anatomy Manual
AnatomyBook.desc: All these skinned corpses are nauseating.

Lancet.name: Scalpel
Lancet.desc: A surgical instrument, which has been used.

PreservationBowl.name: Preserving Jar
PreservationBowl.desc: Something is floating in this jar. It looks... human.

TeacherHourglass.name: Professor's Hourglass
TeacherHourglass.desc: Used by the greatest professors in the most prestigious universities in Alazar to avoid having to teach their students one second too long.

Lorgnon.name: Spectacles
Lorgnon.desc: When you look through these eyeglasses, your vision is distorted. How odd.

BirdCall.name: Bird Whistle
BirdCall.desc: When you blow into it, the instrument mimics the call of a duck.

HuntTrophy.name: Hunting Trophy
HuntTrophy.desc: This Harag badger has been stuffed with a great deal of care.

HuntressDoll.name: Huntress Doll
HuntressDoll.desc: A rag doll representing a huntress.

IronTorque.name: Iron Torque
IronTorque.desc: The ends of the torque represent wolf maws.

ExcellentHairbrush.name: Amazing Hairbrush
ExcellentHairbrush.desc: The boar bristle used to make this brush leaves your hair soft and silky.

LapisLazuliBracelet.name: Lapis Lazuli Bracelet
LapisLazuliBracelet.desc: This bracelet's bright colours make it an exceptional item.

BoatModel.name: Model Boat
BoatModel.desc: This toy in the shape of a Belerian boat can float on water.

BoneLuckyCharm.name: Bone Lucky Charm
BoneLuckyCharm.desc: A little grinning sun made out of bone.

Logbook.name: Ship's Log
Logbook.desc: Water and salt have eaten at the pages and words of its owner.

SmallTapestry.name: Small Tapestry
SmallTapestry.desc: This small tapestry represents Mihr as a bird.

PreciousTapestry.name: Precious Tapestry
PreciousTapestry.desc: This is a beautiful tapestry. It might not be a masterpiece, but the craftsmanship is undeniably remarkable.

PlayingCard.name: Playing Cards
PlayingCard.desc: The cards are split into four suits: the Wheel, the Crown, the Tower and the Stag.

MerchantPen.name: Merchant Quill
MerchantPen.desc: Useful for keeping the books as well as signing commercial agreements, this quill is a Merchant's best friend.

RousteBall.name: Rouste Ball
RousteBall.desc: This leather ball isn't worth much outside of the Rouste Field.

ChewedRousteBall.name: Chewed-Up Ball
ChewedRousteBall.desc: This ball spent some time in a crocswine's stomach.

ChampionStatuette.name: Champion Statuette
ChampionStatuette.desc: Arena spectators can buy this kind of figurine in the stands as a souvenir of the tournament.

LydericLetter.name: Love Letter
LydericLetter.desc: A sickly-sweet letter written by a woman named Adelise to Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp. It mentions a meeting at the Artists' Square.

SinisterIngredient.name: Puzzle
SinisterIngredient.desc: It is annoying to know that in Alazar, puzzles of this kind are meant for children.

Sulfur.name: Horn
Sulfur.desc: Alazarian shepherds use this instrument to while away the hours spent in mountain pastures.

Drum.name: Drum
Drum.desc: Performers use this instrument to drum up business... and sometimes even to play music.

Pendulum.name: Pendulum
Pendulum.desc: This Ancient Artefact was given by the Fellowship of Knowledge as a welcome gift, probably because they are hoping that newcomers will find out what it is used for.

Fan.name: Fan
Fan.desc: The Belerian climate has brought fans back into fashion, after Mihr's Curse nearly drove them out of existence.

Pomander.name: Pomander
Pomander.desc: This little silver ball is actually a perfume diffuser, prized by Ihrian nobles.

BeardComb.name: Beard Comb
BeardComb.desc: Before braiding one's beard, it's important to untangle it thoroughly.

RunsBag.name: Bag of Bones
RunsBag.desc: To ask a question of the gods, speak it clearly and intelligibly, then throw these knucklebones on the ground.

Ocarina.name: Ocarina
Ocarina.desc: A small musical instrument whose tones are little appreciated in the Five Kingdoms.

HairyStatue.name: Miniature Aurochs
HairyStatue.desc: This statuette is covered with long, woolly hair, probably from the very animal it represents.

Navigation.name: Sailing
Navigation.desc: The art and science of staying afloat.

SquareRig.name: Square Sail
SquareRig.desc: Square sails are incredibly effective for downwind sailing.

SquareRigT2.name: Improved Square Sail
SquareRigT2.desc: The ingenious weaving technique used for this sail means it won't be torn to ribbons in a storm.

LateenRig.name: Triangular Sail
LateenRig.desc: Triangular sails allow for risky manoeuvres.

LateenRigT2.name: Improved Triangular Sail
LateenRigT2.desc: A sail of Ihrian design, perfectly adapted to conditions in the Belerion Archipelago.

AuriqueRig.name: Spanker Sail
AuriqueRig.desc: Though often spurned for its lack of speed, the spanker is easier to use than its rivals.

AuriqueRigT2.name: Improved Spanker Sail
AuriqueRigT2.desc: A sprit adds stability and reliability to the spanker.

FlatHull.name: Flat-Bottomed Hull
FlatHull.desc: Especially popular for river transportation, flat-bottomed hulls are perfect for navigating the shallows without running aground.

FlatHullT2.name: Improved Flat-Bottomed Hull
FlatHullT2.desc: The secret of this hull's success lies in its smart use of space.

RoundedHull.name: Rounded Hull
RoundedHull.desc: The most popular hull type in the Five Kingdoms. Preferred for its toughness and load capacity.

RoundedHullT2.name: Improved Rounded Hull
RoundedHullT2.desc: A few simple adjustments to this hull's layout significantly improve its stability. Your crew's stomachs will thank you.

PointedHull.name: Sharp Hull
PointedHull.desc: This hull is designed to cut through breakers at high speed.

PointedHullT2.name: Improved Sharp Hull
PointedHullT2.desc: An intelligent plank layout makes this hull even lighter. It feels like it's flying over the waves.

SunGod.name: Steel Hessura Figurehead
SunGod.desc: This figurehead adorned the ships that made the Great Crossing.

SunGodT2.name: Akhedian Steel Hessura Figurehead
SunGodT2.desc: No material could be a better fit for the sun god.

Siren.name: Steel Siren
Siren.desc: Pirates love this figurehead, which symbolises drowning and distress.

SirenT2.name: Akhedian Steel Siren
SirenT2.desc: Akhedian steel adds a touch of nobility to this foreboding scavenger.

Ram.name: Steel Ram
Ram.desc: The pretentious and pedantic among us have long mocked this figurehead for its alleged vulgarity.

RamT2.name: Akhedian Steel Ram
RamT2.desc: Akhedian steel brings additional strength to this figurehead, already set to smash through everything in its path.

Ballista.name: Ballista
Ballista.desc: A weapon of Ihrian design, unknown in the Belerion Archipelago until their arrival.

BallistaBelerion.name: Ancients' Ballista
BallistaBelerion.desc: Invented by Admiral Enlil in the time of the Ancients, this ballista is specifically designed to take out sea monsters.

RopesKnowledge.name: Rigging Expertise
RopesKnowledge.desc: Your team knows how to handle the rigging to make the most of favourable winds.

SparsKnowledge.name: Spar Expertise
SparsKnowledge.desc: Your team knows how to adjust the sails' position to mitigate the impact of unfavourable winds.

StockManagement.name: Inventory Management
StockManagement.desc: Life at sea requires rigorous management of the ship's provisions. Your companions know this and have adapted their habits accordingly.

BoatRegistration.name: Registration
BoatRegistration.desc: As long as a ship is identifiable and for a nominal fee, of course you can have it towed to save time.

AlternatedRows.name: Alternating Rows
AlternatedRows.desc: With some oarsmen set lower than others, this layout allows for more rows of oars.

Stretching.name: Stretches
Stretching.desc: This Belerian routine includes a series of physical exercises to practise at the start and end of each day.

GeometryCalculation.name: Geometric Calculations
GeometryCalculation.desc: Maths had long been the privilege of the priests of Mihr, but now allow sailors to better understand the winds they sail by.

RopesMaintenance.name: Rigging Maintenance
RopesMaintenance.desc: Correct lubrication of a ship's rigging is an important skill that should never be neglected.

SecuritySystem.name: Security System
SecuritySystem.desc: A combination of complex knots and hidden bits of wood, properly arranged, can stop enemies from taking over your ballista.

KnowledgeOfTheSeas.name: Knowledge of the Seas
KnowledgeOfTheSeas.desc: For those who know it well, the sea is teeming with life and overflowing with resources.

NavalTraining.name: Naval Training
NavalTraining.desc: As the Legion and the Brotherhood have learned all too painfully, even the best ground infantry can prove entirely incompetent at sea.

DodgeManeuver.name: Well-Chosen Reinforcements
DodgeManeuver.desc: Strengthening certain sections of the hull can reduce the damage caused by enemy ballistas.

SynchronizedOarsmens.name: Synchronisation
SynchronizedOarsmens.desc: Once synchronised, the oarsmen will argue less and more easily accept a new neighbour.

Cohesion.name: Cohesion
Cohesion.desc: Living in such close quarters on board will inevitably help the crew forge tight bonds.

Artimuse.name: Hatch Battening
Artimuse.desc: Battening is a skill little used on land, but one that any good crew will need to learn when there are hatches about.

SurpriseAttack.name: Fast Boarding
SurpriseAttack.desc: This well-known pirate technique consists of rushing at the enemy ship before anyone can realise what is happening.

SmoothNavigation.name: Smooth Sailing
SmoothNavigation.desc: Sailors keep their cool even in a storm.

ExiledTenacity.name: Exile's Tenacity
ExiledTenacity.desc: Of all of the sailing techniques used during the Great Crossing, this is one of the most surprising.

CaptainConstancy.name: Captain's Constancy
CaptainConstancy.desc: The Legion aren't known for their sailing skills, probably because this technique was lost at sea with its inventor.

SeaLordExcellence.name: Supremacy of the Lord of the Seas
SeaLordExcellence.desc: Kjerti didn't become Lord of the Seas by accident he was the fastest captain in the archipelago.

BuilderCodex1.name: Builder's Codex - Chapter I
BuilderCodex1.desc: I fell asleep in Canopus and awoke in Siefrid, but the cities looked so alike that I didn't realise I had left the harbour! Tis such a shame to see all the young builders copying Erkeshet's work.

BuilderCodex2.name: Builder's Codex - Chapter II
BuilderCodex2.desc: The epicentre of this phenomenon is undoubtedly Tiltren. Nobody has dared even move a stone since Erkeshet redesigned the city. It's as if the place were frozen in time.

BuilderCodex3.name: Builder's Codex - Chapter III
BuilderCodex3.desc: The Builder's fame benefits the city, too, although not without a certain measure of cynicism. Its citizens gathering on the lake shore are quite a sight to behold as they descend, with open mouths and empty pockets, into the halls below to contemplate a simple chisel!

FightersCodex1.name: Combatant's Codex - Chapter I
FightersCodex1.desc: Know, dear reader, that I do not pit myself against the arena's vulgarity without good reason. This place, I dare say, is not an outlet for our savagery but the very source of it. Such demonstrations of violence are not suitable for those who claim to be civilised.

FightersCodex2.name: Combatant's Codex - Chapter II
FightersCodex2.desc: Because my chronicles demand it, and because I spare no effort in my quest for knowledge - whatever it may cost me personally - I visited the Arena of Horoun and Narses. What a sight! The building, planted squarely in the middle of rolling hills and vineyards, sticks out like a sore thumb...

FightersCodex3.name: Combatant's Codex - Chapter III
FightersCodex3.desc: ... As one approaches the arena, the clamour of hysterical crowds drowns out all other sounds, from the gentle song of the birds to the powerful white-water of the two rivers surrounding it. The entrance to the building mangles a small limestone cliff, which would otherwise have been quite picturesque.

ArtistCodex1.name: Artist's Codex - Chapter I
ArtistCodex1.desc: That night, I awoke to a racket that made my windows rattle. Stepping out into the garden, I saw that fireworks were being fired from the city. The beauty of it all made such a rude awakening somewhat tolerable.

ArtistCodex2.name: Artist's Codex - Chapter II
ArtistCodex2.desc: Who else but an artist could have designed something so beautiful? It is said that such displays are best enjoyed when set off above a lake, as originally intended by Dagan in his mountains.

ArtistCodex3.name: Artist's Codex - Chapter III
ArtistCodex3.desc: The artist used to set off his fireworks from the other side of the lake, opposite the town of Amessa, still nestled today in a rocky enclave. He had also set up his workshop there to avoid any incident with the explosive powder. I hope to travel there soon...

ExploratorCodex1.name: Explorer's Codex - Chapter I
ExploratorCodex1.desc: Despite several years of scouring the world and combing our cities' archives, I have found no reliable sources regarding Behedite. The little we know about our civilisation's founder is nothing more than myth and legend.

ExploratorCodex2.name: Explorer's Codex - Chapter II
ExploratorCodex2.desc: How can we know for certain that he ever existed? Even his tomb was built a thousand years after his estimated death. As for the compass the town of Lahearta protects like a relic, how can we be sure it even belonged to him?

ExploratorCodex3.name: Explorer's Codex - Chapter III
ExploratorCodex3.desc: I had to see it with my own eyes: I travelled to a sanctuary, located in the north of a river island. Joining the throngs of faithful, I went down into the crypt. But all I saw there was an ordinary compass, of the kind our grandparents would have owned. It would have been useless, given that Behedite travelled in...

GeneralCodex1.name: General's Codex - Chapter I
GeneralCodex1.desc: Despite the commoners' protests and the scholars' admonitions, the General precipitated the war between Canopus and Siefrid. According to her, the weapons at our disposal would grant us an easy victory. This would not come to pass.

GeneralCodex2.name: General's Codex - Chapter II
GeneralCodex2.desc: We have witnessed the complete and utter devastation of both our countries. Who could've imagined such a nightmare? ... What our fathers had built, what our mothers had made, the roads and the fields we had loved as children, are now but ruins and barren deserts.

GeneralCodex3.name: General's Codex - Chapter III
GeneralCodex3.desc: ... as if to punish Mehyt for her ambition, death took her far from her tomb, separated from the full honours due to her rank by an angry sea of warring battleships. May her body rot far from the living, in the wreckage of Tyssa Harbour, amid the foul stench of destruction.

MerchantCodex1.name: Merchant's Codex - Chapter I
MerchantCodex1.desc: Rich as Nepti, son of Nepti... The Merchant King is seldom mentioned nowadays, except in colloquial expressions. Our contemporaries seem to forget that before being murdered by his own son, Nepti was not only the wealthiest man in the world, but also a visionary.

MerchantCodex2.name: Merchant's Codex - Chapter II
MerchantCodex2.desc: One needs only behold Drometh Harbour to realise that. This temple of trade is first and foremost a feat of ingenuity! The creator of this harbour, which looks like no other and changed a mediocre peninsula into a thriving region, deserved greater posterity.

MerchantCodex3.name: Merchant's Codex - Chapter III
MerchantCodex3.desc: This obvious ungratefulness might be rooted in what the Merchant King denied his heirs. Chronicles recounting Nepti's last moments mention a certain [Objet] thrown into the depths of the basin north of Drometh Harbour.

AdmiralCodex1.name: Admiral's Codex - Chapter I
AdmiralCodex1.desc: My journey led me quite by chance to the icy, mountainous shores of Enophre. To pass the time, I was admiring the details of the ballista on my ship's main deck, and decided to check my cabin boy's knowledge on the subject. He couldn't even name its inventor!

AdmiralCodex2.name: Admiral's Codex - Chapter II
AdmiralCodex2.desc: This interaction robbed me of my last hope of relaxing that day, and I furiously threw myself into educating the poor ingrate. He stared at me with bulging eyes as I explained that, were it not for Enlil, Prince of the Seas, admiral and brilliant inventor, our shores would still be at the mercy of Siefrid and its monsters.

AdmiralCodex3.name: Admiral's Codex - Chapter III
AdmiralCodex3.desc: To cap off the irony, the fool told me he was born and raised in Enophre! The very place where Enlil's cenotaph is located! Is it truly that far from the harbour to the lake? It didn't take much to reveal the full depths of this child's laziness

CitizenCodex1.name: Citizen's Codex - Chapter I
CitizenCodex1.desc: When visiting the great lakes of Tyssa, you may have wondered about the astounding cenotaph by the largest lake's shores. Hardly anyone visits it nowadays, and I fear it may succumb to the ravages of time

CitizenCodex2.name: Citizen's Codex - Chapter II
CitizenCodex2.desc: Dumuzi's fame is now restricted to the small city of Lizelet. A symbol of the decay of our customs, so to speak. Who now cares for the health of his neighbour? Who now sets their work aside to lend assistance to a friend?

CitizenCodex3.name: Citizen's Codex - Chapter III
CitizenCodex3.desc: Concern for others used to be valued! We used to celebrate honest men like Dumuzi by building them temples as big and beautiful as those of merchants and craftsmen! Back then, the real heroes were good neighbours and kind citizens.

MakerCodex1.name: Maker's Codex - Chapter I
MakerCodex1.desc: We had to wait until Siefried's army was only three days' march away for the Makers to finally come to their senses. They ordered the arenas to slaughter the animals immediately, then headed off to Ber'Gerna themselves.

MakerCodex2.name: Maker's Codex - Chapter II
MakerCodex2.desc: Terrified at the thought that the enemy might get hold of their work and turn it against Canopus, they destroyed their machines one by one and burned every last scroll. They even went so far as to ransack Urashu's temple and throw the key into the depths of a lake. This frantic act of sabotage was a disgrace to us all. These creatures should never have been created in the first place.

MakerCodex3.name: Maker's Codex - Chapter III
MakerCodex3.desc: Alas, things done hastily aren't often done well. I worry that they may have been negligent. For example, no one told me of the destruction of Urashu's crypt, west of Drometh Harbour. If they missed such an obvious place, how can we be sure that we will bring down with us in death the abominations that we ourselves have created?

PathKnowledgePage1.name: Chronicler Erius' Journal - I
PathKnowledgePage1.desc: I hid the item in the region where Nepti is buried, on a small strip of land between sea and mountain. My Pendulum will show you the way.

PathKnowledgePage2.name: Chronicler Erius' Journal - II
PathKnowledgePage2.desc: ... This beauty deserves to be preserved! I thought it would be safe in Dagan's Tomb, but I was unable to travel far enough to the north.

PathKnowledgePage3.name: Chronicler Erius' Journal - III
PathKnowledgePage3.desc: A relic said to date back to Behedite's time! But time was too short for me to find a good hiding spot! So I headed north of Lahearta and buried it at the foot of the mountains.

PathKnowledgePage4.name: Chronicler Erius' Journal - IV
PathKnowledgePage4.desc: It's with this invention that I started. Tyssa's heights seemed so safe at the time! They offered a breathtaking view of the secret beaches of the region, and when the weather was clear, you could even see the peninsula.

PathKnowledgePage5.name: Chronicler Erius' Journal - V
PathKnowledgePage5.desc: If I had to choose something that I wished to pass along, it would be our knowledge of the cosmos. I hid this apparatus in a rocky basin filled with snow, not far from a mountain lake but still too close to that woman's tomb!

AllyCorpse.name: [NAME]'s Body
AllyCorpse.desc: [NAME]'s dead body. You can bury them wherever you want.

Pork.name: Pork
Pork.desc: A greasy, plump piece of pork.

Crocopork.name: Crocswine
Crocopork.desc: Although it is quite filling, crocswine meat makes for unenjoyable dishes.

Sheep.name: Mutton
Sheep.desc: Just based on the smell, this meat is instantly recognisable.

Chicken.name: Chicken
Chicken.desc: The chicken's head dangles on the end of a limp neck.

Wolf.name: Wolf
Wolf.desc: The pungent aroma of the wolf meat makes your mouth water.

Bear.name: Bear
Bear.desc: In Harag, eating bear meat is believed to heal the soul.

SmilodonMeat.name: Stringy Meat
SmilodonMeat.desc: No matter how long you cook it, this sabretooth meat always turns out dreadfully rubbery and stringy.

Rat.name: Rat
Rat.desc: Not a very appetising dish, it must be said.

DriedMeat.name: Cured Meat
DriedMeat.desc: True connoisseurs savour this delicacy in parchment-thin slices.

Perch.name: Perch
Perch.desc: Its striped back camouflages the fish among seaweed.

Pike.name: Pike
Pike.desc: Caution is required when fishing for this carnivorous fish that can bite fingers off a clumsy fisherman.

Bass.name: Bass
Bass.desc: Its delicious meat makes for fine dining.

Sardine.name: Sardine
Sardine.desc: A popular folk song tells the tale of a great warrior defeated by a sardine bone stuck in his throat.

SeaBream.name: Bream
SeaBream.desc: Belerians have a particular taste for sea bream, traditionally served at weddings and for the Festival of Light.

Shrimps.name: Prawns
Shrimps.desc: You wouldn't know from the taste that prawns are the worst sort of bottom-feeders.

Shellfish.name: Shellfish
Shellfish.desc: After enjoying the tasty flesh inside, the shells can also be made into jewellery or other trinkets.

Tuna.name: Tuna Fillet
Tuna.desc: Whether raw or cooked, tuna's texture is surprisingly close to that of red meat.

Shark.name: Shark Fillet
Shark.desc: Belerians only eat shark when nothing else is available. On those unfortunate occasions, they drown the acrid meat in Edoranian spices.

DriedFish.name: Dried Fish
DriedFish.desc: Belerian fishermen are known for their fish dried out in the open.

Cherry.name: Cherries
Cherry.desc: Red cherries with fine, sweet flesh.

Blueberries.name: Blueberries
Blueberries.desc: People of the Five Kingdoms do not care much for these berries, thinking they are only good for wild animals.

Olives.name: Olives
Olives.desc: Common to both Belerian and Ihrian cultures, olives are a key ingredient in many culinary specialities throughout the archipelago.

Apricot.name: Apricot
Apricot.desc: This tasty Ihrian fruit can really quench your thirst.

Lemon.name: Lemon
Lemon.desc: The lemon's arrival in the archipelago has saved countless local teeth from scurvy.

Tomato.name: Tomato
Tomato.desc: A small, slightly sour fruit brought in from Akhed to throw at incompetent jugglers.

Cabbage.name: Cabbage
Cabbage.desc: This head of cabbage bears appetising leaves.

Carrot.name: Carrots
Carrot.desc: Nothing better for getting a pony moving.

Beans.name: Beans
Beans.desc: Quite filling and nutritious, beans add a certain atmosphere to any campfire.

Seaweed.name: Seaweed
Seaweed.desc: No one in Belerion would eat raw seaweed.

Milk.name: Milk
Milk.desc: An inexpensive liquid, which can act as a binding agent in many a dish.

Cheese.name: Cheese
Cheese.desc: No one is indifferent to the smell of this cheese.

Wine.name: Wine
Wine.desc: A highly tannic wine with a silky mouthfeel.

Brandy.name: Brandy
Brandy.desc: A strong alcohol, which could also be used to unclog latrines.

GosenbergWine.name: Gosenberg Wine
GosenbergWine.desc: Supposedly the best wine on the continent, it is undoubtedly the most expensive.

Cider.name: Cider
Cider.desc: Traditionally consumed on rare occasions, cider has become a staple in Gosenberg taverns over the past few years.

Rhum.name: Rum
Rhum.desc: A strong liquor that goes down especially well with mint.

Genepi.name: Genepy
Genepi.desc: A mountaineer alcohol that warms you but also knocks you out.

Pastis.name: Pastis
Pastis.desc: Some Brewers replace the anise with fennel to cut costs.

Gin.name: Gin
Gin.desc: Great for cleaning wounds and warding off mosquitoes, it can also be consumed.

Hypocras.name: Hippocras
Hypocras.desc: The Brokers made it trendy to drink this very sweet wine loaded with spices.

Kirsch.name: Kirsch
Kirsch.desc: In order to prevent brawls, Lord Mayors may require Tavern Keepers to serve kirsch in small glasses only.

Absinth.name: Absinthe
Absinth.desc: They say the Tules passed down the recipe for this beverage to humans.

Whisky.name: Whisky
Whisky.desc: A dignified drink, owing to the complexity involved in crafting it.

SparklingWine.name: Sparkling Wine
SparklingWine.desc: There's nothing more deceptive; you drink it without a second thought.

Akvavit.name: Akvavit
Akvavit.desc: There are many ways to flavour Skelmar akvavit, giving this spirit a broad range of colours.

Glogg.name: Glgg
Glogg.desc: Glgg tastes even better when drunk hot after a successful raid.

Syrup.name: Syrup
Syrup.desc: A large amount of sap was boiled down to obtain one small flask of this thick substance.

Bread.name: Bread
Bread.desc: A loaf of bread with a thick crust.

BraisedChicken.name: Braised Chicken
BraisedChicken.desc: A lightly braised chicken, dripping with grease.

GrilledPork.name: Grilled Pork
GrilledPork.desc: A few pieces of fine pork, grilled to perfection.

WolfSausages.name: Wolf Sausage
WolfSausages.desc: Wolf sausage links with a bold taste.

MediumCookedSheep.name: Medium-rare Mutton
MediumCookedSheep.desc: The Edoran speciality of mutton cooked over charcoal.

GameSkewers.name: Venison Skewers
GameSkewers.desc: Skewered venison that is perfectly cooked.

GrilledCarp.name: Grilled Carp
GrilledCarp.desc: Carp grilled over a wood fire.

BoiledEel.name: Boiled Eel
BoiledEel.desc: A favourite dish of Belerian fishermen.

RostedBass.name: Roasted Bass
RostedBass.desc: This simple dish is appreciated by one and all.

SmokedSardine.name: Smoked Sardine
SmokedSardine.desc: Probably the most common snack in Gosenberg.

SoupPike.name: Pike Soup
SoupPike.desc: There are as many ways to prepare pike soup as there are families in Vertruse.

BrothPerch.name: Perch Broth
BrothPerch.desc: The broth needs to be heavily seasoned to give flavour to a fish that doesn't taste like much.

SimpleTuna.name: Potted Tuna
SimpleTuna.desc: There's nothing finer in this world than watching the sunset from the deck of your ship with a bit of potted tuna on toast.

SimpleRay.name: Steamed Ray Fin
SimpleRay.desc: There's no getting around it: this classic Belerian recipe is a little on the bland side.

SimpleShrimp.name: Sauted Prawns
SimpleShrimp.desc: Hand-peeling hot prawns fresh from the pan is a real art.

SimpleBream.name: Fried Bream
SimpleBream.desc: Every Belerian household has its own fried bream recipe.

SimpleShark.name: Salted Shark
SimpleShark.desc: If you must eat shark, don't skimp on the salt.

FakeMedecine.name: Homeopills
FakeMedecine.desc: Sold by charlatans as a cure for the Plague, these small sweet-tasting pills make for a comforting snack.

ToothPaste.name: Toothpaste
ToothPaste.desc: Apothecaries claim it's made of flowers, but its aftertaste suggests otherwise This toiletry item can be added to meals or given to prisoners.

BlueberriesTisane.name: Blueberry Tea
BlueberriesTisane.desc: Past a certain age, it is customary to start drinking blueberry tea.

MintTisane.name: Hemp Tea
MintTisane.desc: An excellent cure for hangovers, some innkeepers even serve it early in the morning.

AppleMatefaim.name: Apple Pancake
AppleMatefaim.desc: The melting apple smells of sweet caramel.

EelBrouet.name: Eel Soup
EelBrouet.desc: This crudely prepared soup looks less than appetising but is nevertheless hearty.

SheepHericoq.name: Mutton Stew
SheepHericoq.desc: A delicious stew cooked over several hours.

StuffedCabbage.name: Stuffed Cabbage
StuffedCabbage.desc: Delicious chicken stuffing wrapped in cabbage leaves.

TrapperFondue.name: Trapper's Fondue
TrapperFondue.desc: Melted cheese accompanies gamey meat in this dish originating from the Alazar Mountains.

SurfAndTurfSkewer.name: Surf and Turf on a Stick
SurfAndTurfSkewer.desc: The perfect marriage of seafood and red meat, skewered on walnut sticks.

CandiedFruits.name: Candied Fruit
CandiedFruits.desc: Fruit cooked several times in a mixture of a honey and spices.

Oatmeal.name: Porridge
Oatmeal.desc: A little milk, a drop of honey and a lot of oatmeal make for a substantial meal.

PorkStew.name: Pork Stew
PorkStew.desc: The smell of this rural Edoran speciality is enough to ward off wild animals.

BeerBastedWolfRibs.name: Beer-infused Wolf Ribs
BeerBastedWolfRibs.desc: The secret is in the marinade.

MintPork.name: Seed Sausage
MintPork.desc: Hemp seeds take this sausage to another level.

RatStew.name: Rat Stew
RatStew.desc: This unappetising dish will at least fill a starving stomach.

MeadPike.name: Mead Pike
MeadPike.desc: For years, this dish made the Armemans famous for their gourmet dinner parties.

HerbalBass.name: Sea Bass Marinated in Hemp Oil
HerbalBass.desc: The marinade gives the fish a strange green colour.

MushroomSardine.name: Mushroom Sardine
MushroomSardine.desc: This dish is proof, if any were needed, that Grinmeer people are very creative.

PerchCabbage.name: Cabbage Perch
PerchCabbage.desc: Despite its lingering smell, cabbage perch is one of Tiltren's most popular dishes.

FlamedCrocopork.name: Flambed Crocswine
FlamedCrocopork.desc: The cider almost manages to hide the muddy taste of crocswine meat.

MintCake.name: Seed Biscuits
MintCake.desc: Touted as the perfect travel snack, they usually end up crumbling in travellers' pockets.

CheeseSheep.name: Mutton au Gratin
CheeseSheep.desc: The sweetness of the cheese offsets the meat's strong flavour.

BeanBears.name: Mountaineer's Hotpot
BeanBears.desc: A hearty and copious dish that fills up and warms the body.

BlueberriesChicken.name: Roasted Chicken in Blue Sauce
BlueberriesChicken.desc: A perfectly roasted chicken, drizzled with a creamy blueberry sauce.

FlamedRay.name: Ray Fin Flamb
FlamedRay.desc: Countless dockside pubs have caught fire with a ray fin flamb gone wrong.

ShrimpCurry.name: Prawn Curry
ShrimpCurry.desc: There are as many curry recipes as there are islands in the Belerion Archipelago, but every cook will tell you that their recipe is the one true original.

BreamTajine.name: Bream Tajine
BreamTajine.desc: Ihrians on Zawlin Island were the first to import this tradition to the archipelago.

SharkMeal.name: Shark Touff
SharkMeal.desc: This dish somehow manages to make shark meat palatable through slow-cooking and skilled marination.

LavenderBiscuits.name: Lavender Syrup Biscuits
LavenderBiscuits.desc: Biscuits that stick to fingers and teeth alike.

Jam.name: Jam
Jam.desc: A delicious way to use up overripe fruit.

IhraApricots.name: Pirate-Style Apricots
IhraApricots.desc: A dessert that makes you both drunk and happy. What's not to love?

ChiefSpecialty.name: Chef's Platter
ChiefSpecialty.desc: This dish's main advantage is its low cost.

RiparianTerrine.name: Lake Fish Terrine
RiparianTerrine.desc: This slightly bland dish is a way to use up fish scraps.

MushroomGratin.name: Wolf and Mushroom Gratin
MushroomGratin.desc: Traditionally cooked in winter, when wolves are the only prey to hunt.

Clafoutis.name: Clafouti
Clafoutis.desc: Fruit dish that pairs well with any drink.

VineyardChops.name: Vineyard Cutlets
VineyardChops.desc: The grape somewhat balances out the strong taste of wolf meat.

FishTartare.name: Two-Fish Tartare
FishTartare.desc: Lavender is added to give some flavour to these fairly flavourless fish.

StuffedMushroom.name: Stuffed Mushrooms
StuffedMushroom.desc: Who doesn't love noshing on these with a fine beer?

CrustyCrocopork.name: Crocswine Pie
CrustyCrocopork.desc: This family dish is very nutritious. Some would say noxious.

FriedCherry.name: Cherry Fritters
FriedCherry.desc: The secret to getting these right is to triple-fry them.

BearStew.name: Bear Stew
BearStew.desc: After simmering for hours, the bear meat melts in your mouth.

TiltrenFeast.name: Culture Shock
TiltrenFeast.desc: A full banquet, typical of the region of Tiltren and representative of its citizens: a subtle mix of strength and sweetness.

EdoranFeast.name: Creature Comforts
EdoranFeast.desc: A selection of Edoranian produce, expertly prepared to feed both the body and the soul.

GosenbergFeast.name: Hill Delights
GosenbergFeast.desc: A food lover's dream: rich, generous and accompanied by the most refined wines. In Gosenberg, a meal without wine is like a day without sunshine.

GosenbergFeastTwo.name: The Broker's Table
GosenbergFeastTwo.desc: You must be as rich as a Broker to afford such a feast.

HaragFeast.name: The Tale of the Wolf and the Hop
HaragFeast.desc: Fresh produce prepared in the Harag traditional way, sure to enthral even the most discerning palates.

AlazarFeast.name: The King's Feast
AlazarFeast.desc: This aptly named dish is always served during celebrations at the Alazarian court.

BelerionFeast.name: Souvenirs from Akhed
BelerionFeast.desc: Nostalgia awaits any Ihrian who tastes of this feast.

BelerionFeast2.name: Captain's Booty
BelerionFeast2.desc: Good food that sticks to your ribs, copious quantities of alcohol... what better way to motivate your crew?

TavernFeast.name: Feast of Five Kingdoms
TavernFeast.desc: With Gosenberger wine, these very different dishes magically come together.

Edoran2Feast.name: Sabretooth Smorgasbord
Edoran2Feast.desc: This assortment of dishes is perfect for celebrating a tough battle or dangerous siege. It's also a great way for your four-legged companion to take part in one last meal.

CremeBrulee.name: Alchemist's Crme Brle
CremeBrulee.desc: Scullions are reminded not to leave the crme in the oven too long, lest it explode.

Ratatouille.name: North Country Ratatouille
Ratatouille.desc: One spoonful of this rich, fatty ratatouille will send any Gosenberger right back to their childhood.

Bouillabaisse.name: Lake Fish Bouillabaisse
Bouillabaisse.desc: In Edoran, this dish is often served during the Festival of Light.

Bourguignon.name: Swamp Bourguignon
Bourguignon.desc: Crocswine meat is boiled, baked, then finished with a quick turn in the pan to tenderize it.

Macaron.name: Cheesy Macaron
Macaron.desc: Macarons are an elegant and refined treat, and enjoying them at the Tavern is a most distinguished privilege.

SurveyorsSnack.name: Breaded Sausage
SurveyorsSnack.desc: This wild game sausage, rolled in oat or wheat batter and then fried in oil, is a big seller on Black Market stands.

StuffedFangs.name: Stuffed Fangs
StuffedFangs.desc: The bigger the fang, the easier this recipe is to prepare. The secret is packing the stuffing as evenly as possible.

StrangeStew.name: Gladiator's Stew
StrangeStew.desc: With a reputation for strengthening pit fighters' resolve as well as their muscles, this stew is often enjoyed or rather, choked down before fighting in the Black Market Pits.

SmilodonMeatBalls.name: Sabretooth Meatballs
SmilodonMeatBalls.desc: There are two options when eating this type of dish: swallow it whole to avoid the taste, or chew it thoroughly for some hope of digesting it properly.

SmilodonKalops.name: Sabretooth Kalops
SmilodonKalops.desc: If the mushrooms added to this stew are of high quality, they can mask the presence of sabretooth meat.

LegOfSmilodon.name: Sabretooth Haunch
LegOfSmilodon.desc: You'll need a taste for adventure to bite into this grilled leg of sabretooth.

RecipePlagueRemedy.desc: A very strong remedy that can heal a plague-infected wound.

RecipeWeedkillingPotion.desc: According to the apothecary in Vertruse, this potion can destroy specific plants in the region.

RecipeApprenticeRemedy.desc: A cure prepared with love and care, but no particular knowledge. Might heal injuries, sometimes.

AbilityExcellence.name: Lord of the Seas' Secret Manual

SnareT3.desc: [JOBASSIGN] produces ::value:: during each Rest. Has a strong chance of producing meat.

Banner.name: Banner
Banner.desc:
This banner represents your troop and your pride.
[ASSIGN] Any assigned lieutenant will proudly carry this banner everywhere.

Chest.name: Camp Chest
Chest.desc:
Place the items you wish to keep in this chest.
[JOBASSIGN] sells the stolen items during Rests little by little.

BrewBarrel.desc: [JOBASSIGN] produces brewed fruit alcohol during a Rest.

BrewBarrelT3.desc: [JOBASSIGN] produces brewed fruit alcohol during a Rest.

Beehive.desc: [ASSIGN] produces honey with plants during Rests.
