WatchStool.desc:
[ASSIGN]
- Reduces the chance of being attacked during a Rest.
- Reduces the chance prisoners will escape.

DiceGame.name: Dice
DiceGame.desc: [ASSIGN] generates <happy><good>+::value::</good></happy> during each Rest if two Companions are assigned.

Lute.name: Lute
Lute.desc:
Play songs in Taverns to earn a few Krowns and a little Influence.
[JOBASSIGN] grants each Companion ::value:: [Willpower].

Whip.name: Whip
Whip.desc: [ASSIGN] you can whip your Companions to encourage them to work.

CristalSkull.name: Crystal Skull
CristalSkull.desc: A marvel of glassware that looks both eerie and captivating. After a Rest, Companions next to the Skull will start their next fight with [AttackExaltation].

SoulCradle.name: Cradle of Souls
SoulCradle.desc: An unknown essence is trapped inside this glass egg. After a Rest, Companions next to the Cradle gain [Satiated].

CelestialInstrument.name: Astral Instrument
CelestialInstrument.desc: One can track the course of the stars through the lens of this incredibly accurate mechanism. After a Rest, Companions next to the Instrument will start their next fight with [Inspiration].

Automaton.name: Musical Automaton
Automaton.desc: A protective effigy that looks strangely like a Tule. After a Rest, Companions next to the Automaton will start their next fight with [DefenseExaltation].

SolarSystem.name: Solar System
SolarSystem.desc: Multiple spherical worlds spinning through the air. After a Rest, Companions next to the System gain [Inspired].

Haystack.name: Haystack
Haystack.desc:
This haystack could serve either as a makeshift bed for a Companion, or as a tasty snack for a pony. Decisions, decisions...
[ASSIGN]
- Generates <happy><good>+::value::</good></happy> during Rests.
- Gains <ap><good>+::value::</good></ap> during Rests.

TreeStump.name: Tree Stump
TreeStump.desc:
A thick, golden-tinged liquid oozes from a long gash across the trunk.
[JOBASSIGN]: Produces <item>Resin</item> during Rests.

EyeAltar.name: Altar of the Eye
EyeAltar.desc:
There's no guarantee that anything will happen if you pray here. But what really worries you is what might happen if you don't.
[ASSIGN]: Gives a random bonus until the next Rest.

FieldsVines.name: Vine
FieldsVines.desc:
Someone patiently planted and tended to this vine so it would someday yield fine fruit like these.
[ASSIGN]: Produces <item>Grape</item> during Rests.

Well.name: Well
Well.desc: This cool, clear water will quench your thirst better than any Gosenberg wine. [ASSIGN] - Generates +::value:: during Rests. - Reduces the Troop's daily consumption of food by ::value::.

RabbitHole.name: Burrow
RabbitHole.desc:
Animal tracks lead to the entrance to this hole, which is littered with fine hairs.
[ASSIGN]: Produces <item>GameMeat</item> during Rests.

Track.name: Trail
Track.desc:
This flattened carcass is a treasure trove of information for a Huntsman. You will also be able to find new traces left by the Beast more easily.
[JOBASSIGN]
- Generates a bit of Knowledge of the Beast at each Rest.

RuinMonolith.name: Bookshelf
RuinMonolith.desc:
You doubt youd be able to decipher any of this text. But since youre stuck here, you may as well give it a try.
[JOBASSIGN]
- Generates a little Profession experience during each Rest.
- Generates a little Knowledge during each Rest.
- Has a chance to find <item>SmallItemFragments</item> during Rests.

PlainMonolith.name: Monolith
PlainMonolith.desc:
This stone has no particular meaning for ordinary mortals, but a Scholar might learn something unexpected from it.
[JOBASSIGN]
- Generates a little Profession experience during each Rest.
- Generates a little Knowledge during each Rest.
- Has a chance to find <item>SmallItemFragments</item> during Rests.

BoatChest.name: Hold
BoatChest.desc: Store any items you wish to keep on board.

Anvil.name: Anvil
Anvil.desc: Choose a companion to forge weapons and armour using ore, leather and wood.

ApothecaryTable.name: Apothecary Table
ApothecaryTable.desc: Choose a companion to prepare medicines using herbs and various alchemical components.

Tavern_FurnaceT1.name: Oven
Tavern_FurnaceT1.desc:
Can assign up to [Tool_Capacity] Scullions.
[JOBASSIGN]
- Produces meals to order.

Tavern_FurnaceT2.name: Improved Oven
Tavern_FurnaceT2.desc:
Can assign up to [Tool_Capacity] Scullions.
[JOBASSIGN]
- Produces meals to order.

Tavern_FurnaceT3.name: Perfect Oven
Tavern_FurnaceT3.desc:
Can assign up to [Tool_Capacity] Scullions.
[JOBASSIGN]
- Produces meals to order.

Tavern_Cave.name: Cellar
Tavern_Cave.desc: Barrels and their assigned Brewers are located here. Select the types of alcohol produced, set sales prices, and manage ageing.

Tavern_BarrelT1.name: Tavern Barrel
Tavern_BarrelT1.desc:
Can hold up to [TavernBarrelCapacity] servings of alcohol. This tool goes in the Tavern's Cellar.
[JOBASSIGN]
- Produces or refines alcohol during each Shift.

Tavern_BarrelT2.name: Upgraded Tavern Barrel
Tavern_BarrelT2.desc:
Can hold up to [TavernBarrelCapacity] servings of alcohol. This tool goes in the Tavern's Cellar.
[JOBASSIGN]
- Produces or refines alcohol during each Shift.

Tavern_LuthT1.name: Tavern Lute
Tavern_LuthT1.desc:
[JOBASSIGN]
- Grants Comfort based on Profession level.
- Increases sale odds for all patrons in the area, based on Profession level.

Tavern_LuthT2.name: Improved Tavern Lute
Tavern_LuthT2.desc:
[JOBASSIGN]
- Grants Comfort based on Profession level.
- Increases sale odds for all patrons in the area, based on Profession level.

Tavern_BountyBoard.name: List of Bounties
Tavern_BountyBoard.desc: - Allows the Troop to accept ::value:: additional contracts.

Tavern_Chicken.name: Chicken
Tavern_Chicken.desc: Accompanies Bards' singing and boosts their range.

Tavern_LandscapePaintingT1.name: Landscape Painting
Tavern_LandscapePaintingT1.desc: - Attracts different factions depending on the region depicted.

Tavern_LandscapePaintingT2.name: Improved Landscape Painting
Tavern_LandscapePaintingT2.desc: - Attracts different factions depending on the region depicted.

Tavern_WeaponDisplayT1.name: Weapon Display
Tavern_WeaponDisplayT1.desc:
- Use to exhibit up to ::maxWeapons:: weapons.
- Grants <TavernPrestige>::value::</TavernPrestige> per legendary weapon during each Shift.

Tavern_WeaponDisplayT2.name: Improved Weapon Display
Tavern_WeaponDisplayT2.desc:
- Use to exhibit up to ::maxWeapons:: weapons.
- Grants <TavernPrestige>::value::</TavernPrestige> per legendary weapon during each Shift.

Tavern_PuzzleManTavern.name: Portrait of Solvius, the Great Solveriser

Tavern_Rock.name: The Great Scholar of Alazar's Stone
Tavern_Rock.desc: Despite its magical properties, this stone looks like a common pebble.

TavernBasicWall.name: Basic Wall
TavernBasicWall.desc: Same walls as when you first moved in. The main thing is that they're holding the roof up for now.

TavernBasicGround.name: Basic Floor
TavernBasicGround.desc: Not sure if you can really call this a "floor", or if it's just "the ground". There's no noticeable difference between inside and outside.

TavernRusticWall.name: Rustic Wall
TavernRusticWall.desc: The natural ruggedness of wood creates a warm, welcoming atmosphere.

TavernRusticGround.name: Rustic Floor
TavernRusticGround.desc: A few rough elements are enough to improve the look of the space without taking away from its natural simplicity.

TavernFancyWall.name: Stylish Wall
TavernFancyWall.desc: The light colour of these walls gives an impression of cleanliness that most Taverns lack.

TavernFancyGround.name: Stylish Floor
TavernFancyGround.desc: The materials are admirably refined, but not everyone will feel at home in such an opulent setting.

Gems.name: Gems
Gems.desc: These brightly coloured stones can be used as inlays in jewellery and crowns.

Silver.name: Silver
Silver.desc: A rare metal that is difficult to produce and is used primarily to measure an individual's success and power.

Pottery.name: Pottery
Pottery.desc: Somewhere between handicraft and art, pieces of pottery can be tricky items to travel with, due to their propensity to break.

Furs.name: Pelts
Furs.desc: Making fur is harder than you think, as its value depends on a large number of variables.

Parchment.name: Scrolls
Parchment.desc: Prized by scholars everywhere, these scrolls will also be of interest to Merchants and Lord Mayors who like keep track of their finances.

Spices.name: Spices
Spices.desc: Mysterious substances for the commoners who gape at their colours while the aristocrats savour their flavours.

Linen.name: Woollen Cloth
Linen.desc: Whilst the quality of the wool is important, it is the method of weaving which determines the fabric's market value.

Amber.name: Amber
Amber.desc: Amber is prized for both its aesthetic qualities and its supposed curative properties.

Perfumes.name: Perfumes
Perfumes.desc: The delicate scents of Ihrian perfumes are far superior to anything produced in the Five Kingdoms.

Incense.name: Marble
Incense.desc: The archipelago's once-flourishing marble trade has slowed somewhat due to pirate activity.

TGPlagueRemedy.name: Plague Remedies
TGPlagueRemedy.desc: Fragile and valuable goods that are most likely contraband.

Knowledge.name: Knowledge
Knowledge.desc: The Knowledge ability helps you learn new blueprints, patterns and recipes from the Compendium.

Discovery.name: Discovery
Discovery.desc: Discover new areas to fill the progress bar and earn Knowledge points.

PathMightKnowledge.name: Knowledge: Power and Justice
PathMightKnowledge.desc: You have one point available to unlock a bonus in the path of Power and Justice.

PathTradeKnowledge.name: Knowledge: Trade and Craftsmanship
PathTradeKnowledge.desc: You have one point available to unlock a bonus in the path of Trade and Craftsmanship.

PathCrimeKnowledge.name: Knowledge: Crime and Chaos
PathCrimeKnowledge.desc: You have one point available to unlock a bonus in the path of Crime and Chaos.

PathMysteryKnowledge.name: Knowledge: Mysteries and Wisdom
PathMysteryKnowledge.desc: You have one point available to unlock a bonus in the path of Mysteries and Wisdom.

RunAbility.name: Run
RunAbility.desc: You can run for short periods of time. Perfect to get away from pursuers.

EnduranceTraining.name: Endurance Training
EnduranceTraining.desc: The troop is improving its stamina, and can move faster.

CareerPlan.name: Career Plans
CareerPlan.desc: Allows you to have enhanced control over your Companions' evolution when they level up.

Restauration.name: Restoration
Restauration.desc: Your troop improves their armour maintenance skills.

Rationing.name: Rationing
Rationing.desc: Your Companions are now more sensible and ration their food.

WeightTraining.name: Weighted Training
WeightTraining.desc: The troop has trained with weights and can now carry heavy loads over long distances.

Frugality.name: Frugality
Frugality.desc: Each Companion agrees to a cut in their wages for the greater good.

ActionPointBonus1.name: Feat Makers
ActionPointBonus1.desc: Your Companions are ready to fight and shine with glory on the battlefield.

FightForGold.name: For Money!
FightForGold.desc: Companions will search bodies in the most incongruous places to find Krowns.

BidHunters.name: Offer Hunters
BidHunters.desc: Your Companions are bribing the Bounty Emissary to get more Missions.

BountiesStream.name: Bountiful Bounties
BountiesStream.desc: Your troop is improving their organisational skills and seeks to accumulate more bounties.

Orientation.name: Location Markers
Orientation.desc: Your troop can add objective markers to the map using [RMB].

Cannibalism.name: Cannibalism
Cannibalism.desc: Your troop is prepared to do anything to survive, including eating their own...

HumanTannery.name: Miscellaneous Tanning
HumanTannery.desc: Your Companions no longer have any qualms about treating a human like an animal.

Cunning.name: Artful Dodgers
Cunning.desc: Your Companions are honing their criminal skills and learning to master the art of stealth.

RecruitCostReduced.name: Smooth Talk
RecruitCostReduced.desc: Your Companions become great spokespersons who can talk anyone into joining their ranks.

SpeedupRecruit.name: Fast Training
SpeedupRecruit.desc: Your troop knows how to welcome new recruits with care and attention.

WhipToDeath.name: Make an example of them!
WhipToDeath.desc: Your troop fears being whipped by too strong a hand.

PoisonMastery.name: Poison Mastery
PoisonMastery.desc: Your Companions are learning how to use toxic plants and infectious reagents to cause the most painful death.

BleedingMastery.name: Bleeding Mastery
BleedingMastery.desc: Your Companions are learning the delicate art of butchery on the battlefield.

BurningMastery.name: Burning Mastery
BurningMastery.desc: Your troop is developing a strong taste for seared flesh.

DrinkMate.name: Drinking Buddies
DrinkMate.desc: Best friends can get drunk together to forget their woes.

MisanthropicTroop.name: Misanthropic Troop
MisanthropicTroop.desc: Companions who are on bad terms can toughen up by aggravating their quarrels even more.

HumanResources.name: Human Resources
HumanResources.desc: Your troop can publish Vacancy Notices through innkeepers.

ImprovedOrientation.name: Methodical Exploration
ImprovedOrientation.desc: The talented explorers you are can mark points of interest on your map.

MasteringBullying.name: Intimidation
MasteringBullying.desc: Bandits have reduced aggression range and give up the chase faster.

MoralStrength.name: Fortitude
MoralStrength.desc: Your Companions encourage one another and their willpower gets stronger.

InveterateTravellers.name: Seasoned Travellers
InveterateTravellers.desc: Your Companions travelled so much that they can now walk longer before getting tired.

SkilfulExtraction.name: Skilful Extraction
SkilfulExtraction.desc: You Companions are skilled enough to gather several samples on plague-infested outgrowths.

SpecialisedApprenticeships.name: Specialised Training
SpecialisedApprenticeships.desc: Your Companions are quick learners. Path challenges worth at least 2 PP grant 1 more.

AdjustedEquipment.name: Optimised Gear
AdjustedEquipment.desc: Your Companions know how to increase their armour's efficiency by wearing matching helmets.

HealthyCommunication.name: Good Communication
HealthyCommunication.desc: Your troop is organised so well that relationships grow more easily.

SkilfulGatherers.name: Experienced Gatherers
SkilfulGatherers.desc: Your Companions can recognise plant varieties and make the most of what they find along the way.

RestaurationForgeGosenberg.name: Gosenberg Restoration
RestaurationForgeGosenberg.desc: Following Gosenberg methods, your troop optimises armour maintenance.

RestaurationForgeEdoran.name: Edoranian Restoration
RestaurationForgeEdoran.desc: Following Edoranian methods, your troop optimises armour maintenance.

RestaurationForgeHarag.name: Harag Restoration
RestaurationForgeHarag.desc: Following Harag methods, your troop optimises armour maintenance.

RestaurationForgeTiltren.name: Tiltren Restoration
RestaurationForgeTiltren.desc: Following Tiltren methods, your troop optimises armour maintenance.

RestaurationForgeAlazar.name: Alazar Restoration
RestaurationForgeAlazar.desc: Your troop uses Alazarian methods to optimise armour maintenance.

RestaurationForgeBelerion.name: Belerian Restoration
RestaurationForgeBelerion.desc: Your troop uses Belerian methods to optimise armour maintenance.

FightForRenown.name: For Glory!
FightForRenown.desc: The troop tends to boast after beating an opponent.

FightForPower.name: For power!
FightForPower.desc: Your troop learns more from their fights.

ActionPointBonus2.name: Bravest of the Brave
ActionPointBonus2.desc: Your troop is highly trained and ready to do anything to win. With class.

Ruthless.name: Ruthless
Ruthless.desc: Defeating the first opponents greatly increases chances of victory.

Opportunism.name: Opportunists
Opportunism.desc: Your Companions learn to take advantage of their opponents weaknesses.

MoreLayers.name: Champion Craftsmen
MoreLayers.desc: As long as a piece of armour is properly cared for, it is possible to improve it beyond the usual limitations.

NonDestroyedLayers.name: Careful Salvagers
NonDestroyedLayers.desc: Your Companions learn to take better care of their equipment.

Forgecraft.name: Art of the Forge
Forgecraft.desc: Your troop can rely on passionate and diligent blacksmiths.

ForgeTrade.name: Trade of Forged Goods
ForgeTrade.desc: Your troop can count on substantial income from their forge.

LeftHandedSpecialist.name: Left-hand Specialists
LeftHandedSpecialist.desc: Having two hands means they should both be used efficiently.

PathRunners.name: Long Distance Running
PathRunners.desc: The troop is learning how to use roads and trails for quick travel.

Carrier.name: Transporters
Carrier.desc: The more you carry, the more you can sell. That is the key to becoming rich.

Negociator.name: Negotiators
Negociator.desc: Patrons offering missions can be more generous with their bounties. All it takes is a little explaining.

MissionGold.name: Valued Mercenaries
MissionGold.desc: A troop as renowned as yours deserves to be paid more than others.

PrestigiousMercenaries.name: Reputable Mercenaries
PrestigiousMercenaries.desc: Your troop can take on more missions thanks to their efficiency.

TradeGoodsBought.name: Suppliers
TradeGoodsBought.desc: Your troop knows how to get better prices from merchants.

TradeMissionDone.name: Skilful Merchants
TradeMissionDone.desc: Knowing how to offer buyers exactly what they need is a very lucrative art.

MasterFollower.name: Masters and Disciples
MasterFollower.desc: Self-learning is important, but sharing in the knowledge of elders can be just as beneficial.

LuxuriesSold.name: Goldsmiths
LuxuriesSold.desc: Its always profitable to sell what the rich can buy at inflated prices.

PrisonnersGiven.name: Untouchables
PrisonnersGiven.desc: Serving justice for money can also do wonders for ones reputation.

Cooperative.name: Cooperative
Cooperative.desc: Wages are negotiated downwards for the good of the troop.

TradeHorses.name: Trade Horses
TradeHorses.desc: With better harnesses, ponies can carry more.

MerchantFought.name: Highwaymen
MerchantFought.desc: Knowing where to find Krowns is key to being a successful thief.

AmbushDone.name: Unprincipled
AmbushDone.desc: A successful ambush reduces risks while maximising loot.

Backstabs.name: Backstabbing
Backstabs.desc: Attacking an enemy from behind is not cowardice, but strategy.

NonLetal.name: Non-lethal
NonLetal.desc: Your troop learns where to strike to avoid damaging future workers.

Bandits.name: Ruffians
Bandits.desc: Forests are home to plants, animals and those who want to lie low.

AssassinApprentice.name: Assassins in the Making
AssassinApprentice.desc: Your Companions have no more qualms about taking on the most dubious missions.

StolenItemsCount.name: Nimble Fingers
StolenItemsCount.desc: Your Companions are getting better at stealing stealthily.

WantedDuration.name: Innocents
WantedDuration.desc: A successful thief needs to look as innocent as possible and know how to keep a low profile.

Awareness.name: Vigilant
Awareness.desc: Anticipate. Predict. Prepare. These are the operative words to turn any situation to your advantage.

SoldStolenItemsCount.name: Regular Customers
SoldStolenItemsCount.desc: Fences are no different from other thieves. You need to speak their language to get good prices.

Parley.name: Negotiate
Parley.desc: A poignant and impassioned speech can sway anyone.

Scapegoat.name: Scapegoats
Scapegoat.desc: Throwing unanimous accusations all at once can make just about anyone seem guilty.

RunLonger.name: Endurance Run
RunLonger.desc: After all that travelling around, you can now run longer.

Ascetism.name: Asceticism
Ascetism.desc: Your Companions learn to be content with less food.

Encyclopedist.name: Archivist
Encyclopedist.desc: Your troop studies history, but mostly tries to make their own mark by sharing their story.

Archaeologist.name: Archaeologists
Archaeologist.desc: For the pursuit of knowledge, antiques are priceless. But then again, a price can always be negotiated.

LegendCollectors.name: Restorers of Legends
LegendCollectors.desc: A weapon thats more famous than its wielder deserves to be used to its full potential.

PestControl.name: Exterminators
PestControl.desc: No one wants to set foot in those disgusting nests. All the more prestige for your troop.

Cleaner.name: Cleaners
Cleaner.desc: Your troop understands that rat nests can hold great riches.

Poachers.name: Poachers
Poachers.desc: Loving nature means taking what it gives without damaging it.

TrackersLanguage.name: Trackers Language
TrackersLanguage.desc: Trackers know and recognise your troop.

MoreLights.name: Enlightened Opinions
MoreLights.desc: Its important to follow a guiding light, be it spiritual or physical.

AnimalInstinct.name: Animal Instinct
AnimalInstinct.desc: To respect nature is to understand it without destroying it.

BeastKnowledge.name: Knowledge of the Beast
BeastKnowledge.desc: This Knowledge will help your Huntsmen to find traces left by the Beast, or to prepare to fight it.

BeastKnowledgeTerrorResist.name: Unflappable
BeastKnowledgeTerrorResist.desc: Your units can resist [VALUE(BeastKnowledgeTerrorResist)] more application(s) of [Terror] before fleeing the battle.

BeastKnowledgeInfluencePower.name: Ghostly Ferocity
BeastKnowledgeInfluencePower.desc: Each application of [BeastInfluence] on an allied animal increases its damage by an additional [VALUE(BeastKnowledgeInfluencePower)]%.

BeastKnowledgeTrackerTrade.name: Negotiation
BeastKnowledgeTrackerTrade.desc: Your next ::count:: purchases at the Trackers' Guild will cost [VALUE(TrackersMerchantsPriceReduction)]% less.

ResolutionMoreTransport.name: Expected Profits
ResolutionMoreTransport.desc: Until the next Rest, your troop is willing to be encumbered in order to carry more valuable items.

ResolutionMoreXp.name: Swift Progress
ResolutionMoreXp.desc: Until the next Rest, what doesn't kill your Companions makes them stronger!

ResolutionMoreGather.name: Coordinated Gathering
ResolutionMoreGather.desc: Until the next Rest, your troop gathers more resources.

ResolutionMoreKnowledge.name: Thirst for Knowledge
ResolutionMoreKnowledge.desc: Until the next Rest, your troop pays closer attention to the details of their surroundings.

ResolutionMoreLoot.name: Respect for the Enemy
ResolutionMoreLoot.desc: Until the next Rest, your troop earns more loot after a fight.

ResolutionSellPriceCraftedItems.name: Trade Fair
ResolutionSellPriceCraftedItems.desc: Until the next Rest, you proudly announce that you are holding a great fair to sell equipment and items you crafted.

ResolutionNoWanted.name: Faking Innocence
ResolutionNoWanted.desc: Until the next Rest, your troop acts as an ordinary group, less likely to draw the attention of local authorities.

ResolutionForcedMarch.name: Overflowing Motivation
ResolutionForcedMarch.desc: Until the next Rest, your troop is motivated by greed and feels a surge of energy, which helps them travel longer.

ResolutionFreeVP.name: Vow of Valour
ResolutionFreeVP.desc: Until the next Rest, your troop swears to show courage and valour in combat.

PoneyItem.name: Pony
PoneyItem.desc: A bright-eyed pony with hair as soft as silk.

PitFoeWeaponSword.name: Pit Straight Sword
PitFoeWeaponSword.desc: The coat of arms of this sword's previous owner has been artfully concealed with the colours of the Black Market.

PitFoeWeaponShield.name: Standard Heater Shield
PitFoeWeaponShield.desc: No matter where the fighters come from, this shield always bears the colours of the Black Market.

PitFoeWeaponMace.name: Studded Pit Mace
PitFoeWeaponMace.desc: The incredible weight of this mace is balanced by its impressive efficiency.

PitFoeWeaponDagger.name: Pit Dagger
PitFoeWeaponDagger.desc: A handsome blade offered to participants from the Black Market's equally handsome profits.

PitFoeWeaponBomb.name: Frag Bomblet
PitFoeWeaponBomb.desc: This bomblet is full of nails and bit of shrapnel that explodes in an area of effect upon impact.

PitFoeWeaponFist.name: Pit Claw
PitFoeWeaponFist.desc: There are versions of this claw without sharpened ends, but fighters and crowds find them far less exciting.

PitFoeWeapon2HSword.name: Pit Longsword
PitFoeWeapon2HSword.desc: Taking a bit more damage with every fight, this sword will likely end up breaking at the worst possible moment.

PitFoeWeapon2HMace.name: Large Studded Pit Mace
PitFoeWeapon2HMace.desc: Rumour has it that this mace actually comes from one of the Pit traps. After losing his weapon, a desperate fighter supposedly tore it out of the mechanism.

PitFoeWeaponPolearm.name: Pit Pike
PitFoeWeaponPolearm.desc: In his youth, the Baron fought with a spear very similar to this one.

PitFoeWeapon2HAxe.name: Pit Great Axe
PitFoeWeapon2HAxe.desc: Black Market rules state that the blade of this great axe must be dulled. But no one has really taken the time to check.

PitFoeWeaponBow.name: Pit Bow
PitFoeWeaponBow.desc: Despite a coat or two of rather convincing silver paint, this bow is made of ordinary wood.

PitFoeWeaponAxe.name: Pit Cleaver
PitFoeWeaponAxe.desc: This weapon is very popular in the Black Market Pit, and guarantees a rousing show every time.

FiefArmor.name: Militiaman's Armour
FiefArmor.desc: Tough, yet inexpensive to produce, this armour is perfect for members of the Militia.

Dice.name: Wooden Dice
Dice.desc: Little cubes that you can throw on a table, or in your opponent's face.

Arrows.name: Arrows
Arrows.desc: Perfect for filling up the quivers of the Fief's defenders.

PlayTokens.name: Game Tokens
PlayTokens.desc: They may not be as precious as the ones used by the Brokers, but they still do the job.

SongFief.name: Musical Compositions
SongFief.desc: The Scholars explore the delicate art of music, creating pieces that are harmonious, though hardly classical.

FiefArmorRenfort.name: Militiaman's Armour Layer
FiefArmorRenfort.desc: It may not be the most effective armour layer, but it's better than nothing.

ClayTablet.name: Clay Tablet
ClayTablet.desc: Scholars can go through dozens of these a day if you let them.

line0.t: ::roaming:: is responsible for countless cattle thefts in the area. The outraged farmers have decided to raise money in order to put an end to these crimes.

line1.t: The recent increase in caravan raids is attributed to ::roaming::. A bounty is offered to anyone who will put an end to this nuisance.

line2.t: ::roaming:: must be stopped. The Guard seems unable to deal with the issue single-handedly.

line3.t: ::roaming:: must have inconvenienced the wrong person and now, someone is willing to pay to get rid of them.

line4.t: The Brotherhood wishes to see ::roaming:: dead. These Bandits have despoiled the merchant one time too many.

line0.t: ::roaming:: is a group of forsaken Trackers. They must be slaughtered.

line1.t: Eschewing the Trackers's doctrine, this group has become a danger for Harag.

line0.t: ::roaming:: is a group of Inquisitors who turned away from the Eye's precepts. They must die.

line1.t: This group of fanatics hunts down and burns innocents. They are a threat for the entire region.

line0.t: ::roaming:: embodies something the Brotherhood punishes harshly: treason.

line1.t: There is nothing worse than former Brothers who broke their oath. Hunt them down and kill them.

line0.t: ::roaming:: is spreading death and chaos in the waters of Belerion. The Guard is requesting help.

line1.t: Gosenberg Merchants are willing to pay to have ::roaming:: eliminated.

line2.t: ::roaming:: has escaped from the Belerian Prison and intends to take vengeance on the Guard. These pirates must be stopped.

line3.t: A number of pirate captains have chipped in to offer a reward to anyone who can get rid of ::roaming::.

line0.t: ::roaming:: has escaped the Guard and is continuing their reign of terror in Ormance. Someone has to stop them.

line1.t: ::roaming:: has refused to leave Ormance and continues to brutally pillage the County. The Lord Mayor of Lycia is offering a reward to whomever can take them out.

line2.t: Despite having supposedly converted to the religion of the Light, ::roaming:: was recently seen pillaging a church. The Inquisition has called for their elimination.

line3.t: Though isolated, ::roaming:: has not abandoned their quest to conquer Ormance. The Guard wants someone to disabuse them of their illusions... for good.

line0.t: ::roaming::s overzealous behaviour is not good for business, and the Smugglers want them out of the picture... for good.

line1.t: The Bandits leader seeks revenge against those who put her behind bars: ::roaming::.

line2.t: ::roaming:: is a bit too eager to monitor the roads, which is very unfortunate for the Bandits dealings in the area. This must stop now.

line3.t: The deserters want their former comrades from ::roaming:: to forget about them. Once and for all.

line0.t: ::place:: is well guarded, but you will be paid handsomely to destroy it.

line1.t: The Guard is convinced that hoodlums are hiding in ::place::. A handsome reward has been offered to those who will lay waste to the place.

line0.t: ::roaming::'s shipment is very suspicious, and the Brotherhood is demanding their arrest.

line1.t: ::roaming:: has escaped border control: find them and arrest them.

line0.t: Meet up with ::roaming:: and protect them until they reach their destination. They are ready to pay to reach safety.

line1.t: ::roaming:: is looking for mercenaries to escort them on their journey.

line0.t: Prisoner convoys seem to be headed for ::place::. Intercept them and liberate at least ::amount:: prisoners.
Find and kill $ChampionName. This individual is dangerous. Their mere existence is a threat to the population.

line1.t: Find and kill $ChampionName. This fearsome individual has already attacked many an innocent.

line0.t: Supply ::place:: with ::item:: x::amount:: and you will be rewarded handsomely.

line1.t: ::place:: is desperately looking for x::amount:: of ::item:: and is ready to pay the price.

line0.t: Bring this message to the Informant in ::place::.
The ::groupType:: have invaded ::place:: and made it their lair. The client will let you keep whatever you find there.

line1.t: ::place:: no longer safe since the ::groupType:: have taken up residence there: it is high time we kicked them out.

line0.t: A Rat Infestation is destroying our lands. At night, we can hear piercing screeches coming from teeming masses.
Rumour has it that there is an unexplored Tomb of the Ancients in the region.
Bandits stole some of the citizens' belongings and dropped their precious loot while fleeing. Collect the ::item:: lost in the area.
Foreigners were seen in Alazar. Locals are asking you to capture some of them and take them to the tavern.

[XX]Celebrate the victory of Saint Jeru's chosen one
[XX]Give thanks to the God of Light for this victory

[XX]Whoever the General puts in charge of this County, they can't be worse than Vernalis and Laheart! It's a good thing the troops refused to take sides, or I wouldn't be able to look at myself in the mirror!
[XX]Celebrate the death of the two despots
[XX]Talk with the troop about the future Count

[XX]And here I thought the Inquisition were only good for burning farmers! It's a good thing they were there!
Any longer and Alazar would have reduced their own kingdom to ashes! How could those heretics think they could control the God of Light?
[XX]Celebrate the Inquisition's victory over Alazar
[XX]Pray together to the God of Light
[XX]Once Prince Aerald is able to control the Eye's Reckoning, he'll be the most powerful man in the Five Kingdoms. Then we'll be happy we sided with him instead of his enemies!
[XX]Celebrate the victory of Knowledge over fanaticism
[XX]Take pride in having clearly chosen the winning side

[XX]I can't sleep at night! All I see when I close my eyes is the Beast's bloodthirsty grin!
I don't know what the Scholars may have learnt from those relics, but nothing justifies bringing that monster down on the residents of Ludern!
[XX]Celebrate the defeat of the Alazarian Scholars
[XX]Thank the Tules and the Ancients for granting this victory
[XX]Alazar's methods may be extreme, but fanaticism needs to be countered! If the relics of the Ancients can help to advance Knowledge, what right does Harag have to keep them locked up in a Tomb?
[XX]Celebrate the victory of Knowledge over obscurantism
[XX]Learn your lessons from this adventure and get ready for the next one

[XX]I hope I'll live long enough to tell my grandchildren about our adventures in Belerion! We learned to sail, met the descendant of the emperors of Edoran, fought pirates and defeated the Sea Serpent. Damn! If I'd known all that was coming when we delivered wood to the carpenter in Tiltren
[XX]Celebrate the end of your travels in the Archipelago
[XX]Give thanks to the Gods of Ihraa for this adventure

[XX]Did we do the right thing when we left Sigurdr in charge of Ormance? He turned out to be a more reliable ally than expected, but I still can't get Liv's words out of my head. Can a Skelmar really be content with just one County?
[XX]Set your doubts aside and celebrate the victory over the Skelmar
[XX]Head out to new adventures without looking back

[XM]Now that the Skelmar have been defeated, I won't be sad to leave Ormance behind. Montrevel may be the rightful Countess, but I wonder if it would have been better to listen to Tella and let the Skelmar cut her throat in front of the prison.

[XX]After all that the people of Ormance did to free themselves from the Skelmar, they deserved the chance to choose their own Count! I hope that Tella and the Lord Mayor will still be there to protect the farmers once we're gone.
[XX]Drink to the glory of the people of Ormance
[XX]Confess your fears to the group about the fate of Ormance
[MX]Well! Who would have thought we'd see Countess Montrevel and Sigurdr laying siege to Forecastle Rock, hand in hand! Some people didn't waste any time whilst we were liberating the baronies!

line1.text: [FX]Well! Who would have thought we'd see Countess Montrevel and Sigurdr laying siege to Forecastle Rock, hand in hand! Some people didn't waste any time whilst we were liberating the baronies!

If only its inhabitants had been a bit more charitable!
[XX]Suggest that the group share a drink to forget the sad events in Tiltren
[XX]Encourage the group to toughen up and stop moping

[XX]Push this unfortunate ending out of your mind
[XX]Remind the group of their place as Mercenaries

TroopAdventurers.introText:
Your Companions are off in search of adventure!
After a few days of quietly travelling along where their only feat was not getting lost, they have now reached their destination.
Here, surely, awaits some novel and exciting quest that will stir up the uneventful lives of bored apprentices.
Adventure awaits at the end of the road! For those who make it there alive, that is...

TroopMerchants.desc: Men escorting Merchants who lost their employer
TroopMerchants.introText:
A Mercenary's life is never easy
After a heated skirmish with Bandits, the most opportunistic of your Companions have fled, leaving behind a generous payment and a furious client.
Keen to make a few krowns, but not at the expense of their own lives, they now need to find a new job
Repairs and drinks won't pay for themselves, after all!

TroopDeserters.introText:
Enough is enough!
After bearing that horrible captain's abuse for far too long, your Companions can finally enjoy their well-deserved freedom.
Although...
Deserters are never appreciated, neither by their former colleagues nor by the locals, who regard them as traitors for some reason.
They will need to keep their heads down, while still making a living.

TroopFarmers.desc: Young farmers looking for a better life
TroopFarmers.introText:
Ah, the fresh scent of the morning breeze filled with the delicate tang of the nearby stables
A good old-fashioned Tavern brawl, where the furnishings make for perfect weapons
Born and raised in the countryside, your Companions know the value of the simpler things in life.
But to make it in this world, one must take risks and go far afield in search of fame and fortune!
Just be careful not to lose what you value most along the way That is to say, your shoes.

TroopBandits.desc: Bandits looking to escape the Guard
TroopBandits.introText:
It was all very straightforward
Petty theft, highway robberies, a purse of coins handed to a childhood friend now serving in the Guard, and your Companions always got off scot-free.
The simple honest life of a merry gang of Bandits.
But there's always that one last score The one that targets the wrong person... The victim who is out for revenge...
After running away in a very disorderly fashion, your troop has reached a new region.
Surely, here they will find many new opportunities to get rich quickly! After all, one person's loss is another one's gain...

TroopPugilist.introText:
At least your Companions are still alive!
That's more than they expected when the storm sank their ship, along with their dreams of piracy on the high seas.
Now stuck on dry land, they've got all the time in the world to discover the joys of day-long hikes, wild beast attacks, hostile villagers, and more!
But sailors are a resourceful lot. In time, they're sure to adapt and thrive!
TroopPugilist.props.unlockConditions:
Requires one of the following:
- Must have a Pugilist of level 5 or higher
- Must complete the story for a region
- Must complete a contract in a region other than Tiltren

TroopTavern.desc: Associates looking for a village where they can set up their Tavern
TroopTavern.introText:
Their Tavern will be the most famous in all the Five Kingdoms!
Your Companions are confident that with their innate talent for cooking and their love of fine drink, they've got what it takes to open the business they've always dreamed of.
Who cares that they don't know where the nearest village is and have only mastered two or three recipes? Becoming tavern keepers is their true calling!

line0.name: The Coterie of Taps and Tipples

TroopCrossbow.introText:
After years of loyal service to the Edoranian Legion, it was eventually decided that your Companions' time had come.
Forced into retirement and sent back to their homes, these hardened soldiers don't intend to fade away quietly in their old age.
They've decided to embark on a whole new adventure, filled with challenges and discoveries, and to show all those youngsters that the older the fiddler, the sweeter the tune!
TroopCrossbow.props.unlockConditions:
Requires one of the following:
- Must have a Crossbowman of level 5 or higher
- Must complete the story for a region
- Must complete a contract in a region other than Tiltren

TroopTrapper.desc: Hunters always on the lookout for new prey
TroopTrapper.introText:
For years, your Companions were the pride of their village. Their hunting skills guaranteed them a peaceful and prosperous life. However, deep down, they knew that beyond the horizon, prey far more worthy of their talents lay in wait.
So one morning, they packed their few belongings and left their families behind in search of much bigger game...
The kind that walks on two legs and has a large price on its head.
TroopTrapper.props.unlockConditions:
Requires one of the following:
- Must have a Huntsman of Experienced rank or higher
- Must complete the story for a region
- Must complete a contract in a region other than Tiltren

TroopFief.desc: Nobles driven from their own lands
TroopFief.introText:
Whether they were petty nobles ruined by war or heirs disinherited by their parents, fate has deprived your Companions of their birthright.
Now doomed to spend their lives wandering, they still cherish memories of their past lives, and are determined to acquire by force the lands and riches they know they deserve.

Bonus6.desc: ... have a gift for petty theft

Bonus8.desc: ... enjoy being at one with nature

Malus3.desc: ... an uncommon bout of bad luck

Malus4.desc: ... a very hard time getting up

Malus6.desc: ... a greediness far more developed than others

Malus7.desc: ... a very relative sense of loyalty

Technocracy.inf.desc: The most educated and prestigious Scholars decide in everyone else's best interest.

Kleptocracy.inf.desc: Those who cannot protect their possessions deserve to be robbed.

Tyranny.inf.name: The Tyrant's Yoke
Tyranny.inf.desc: Terror is an effective way to preserve public order. Even the slightest opposition will be crushed.

Pacifism.inf.name: Safe Haven
Pacifism.inf.desc: The Fief is a refuge for those who have suffered the horrors of war for too long.

Aristocracy.inf.name: Blood Lines
Aristocracy.inf.desc: The family that a citizen is born into defines their place within the Fief. Nobles are destined to rule, and others to obey them.

PeasantGov.inf.name: Sovereign Workers
PeasantGov.inf.desc: Those who feed and enrich the Fief should also decide its future.

Fief_Event01.desc: There's been an accident: a child who was playing by the lake has drowned.

Fief_Event02.desc: Your residents are unhappy some have even stopped working in protest.

Fief_Event03.desc: Your residents are unhappy: there have been a number of desertions from the Militia.

Fief_Event04.desc: Your residents are unhappy: your Craftsmen's workshops have been vandalised.

Fief_Event05.desc: Your residents are unhappy: the Scholars are too busy protesting to study.

Fief_Event06.desc: The Farmers are happy to be working for you, and put more heart into their daily efforts.

Fief_Event07.desc: Proud to be wearing your colours, the Militia are enthusiastic and efficient in their work.

Fief_Event08.desc: The Craftsmen are so happy to be working for you that they don't bother keeping track of their hours.

Fief_Event09.desc: Happy with their conditions, the Scholars are more ambitious than ever in their quest for Knowledge.

Fief_Event10.desc: Some residents have chosen to abandon their children in the forest rather than watch them starve to death.

Fief_Event11.desc: Wracked with hunger, some of your residents have left the Fief to try their luck elsewhere.

Fief_Event12.desc: Since no one needs to steal in order to eat, crime is down in all districts.

Fief_Event13.desc: Your residents have organised a Rouste tournament.

Fief_Event14.desc: Your residents lack all the essentials. Today a brawl broke out over a shoe.

Fief_Event15.desc: With nothing to buy, Merchants are losing interest in your Fief.

Fief_Event16.desc: Your craftsmen's excellent work has led Gosenberg Merchants to offer them contracts.

Fief_Event17.desc: Your residents blindly have spent a fortune on completely useless Hair Growth Lotions.

Fief_Event18.desc: A resident died because he couldn't tell which mushrooms were poisonous.

Fief_Event19.desc: A Scholar has discovered a highly effective remedy for frostbite.

Fief_Event20.desc: A prisoner managed to escape when his jailers' vigilance flagged.

Fief_Event21.desc: The populace is up in arms over a number of mysterious disappearances.

Fief_Event22.desc: Your Militia repelled a Bandit attack.

Fief_Event24.desc: Your Jugglers put on an exceptional performance of The Green Night of the Tules.

Fief_Event25.desc: Your Militia was able to extinguish a fire.

Fief_Event26.desc: An eminent Alazarian professor has joined your Scholars' ranks.

Fief_Event27.desc: The poet Meretha from Ormance gave a lute recital in your inn.

Fief_Event28.desc: The Jailers performed a public execution, which was a rousing success.

Fief_Event29.desc: A famous Gosenberg Merchant has declared the Caravan Travel Post to be an essential trading hub.

Fief_Event30.desc: Your Apothecary prevented an epidemic from spreading.

Fief_Event31.desc: Your residents have got in the habit of going to look at the animals in the stables for entertainment.

Fief_Event32.desc: Your Farmers organised a sheep fair.

Fief_Event33.desc: Your residents organised a banquet in honour of young newlyweds.

Fief_Event34.desc: Thanks to the gambling den, the Outlaws have come to an agreement, and murders between rival gangs have stopped.

Fief_Event35.desc: The Black Market is said to have robbed the honest merchants blind.

Fief_Event36.desc: A brawl broke out over a game and the gambling den was set ablaze.

Fief_Event37.desc: A famous stone sculptor has decided to join your workshop.

Fief_Event38.desc: Now that an embassy has been built in your Fief, the neighbouring kingdoms have more respect for you.

Fief_Event39.desc: An altercation broke out between the Alazarian and Gosenberg delegations on their way out of the Embassy. Your residents were highly entertained.

Fief_Event40.desc: A fire broke out in your new district, damaging houses and businesses.

Fief_Event41.desc: A foul odour is spreading within the Fief.

Fief_Audience06Event01.desc: Someone set fire to the Fief's granaries. Could it be the shadowy figure that the Militia had spotted?

Fief_Audience06Event02.desc: The mysterious shadowy figure that was prowling around near the granary seems to have disappeared.

Fief_Audience09Event01.desc: The man who poisoned the well was unmasked and promptly hanged.

Fief_Audience09Event02.desc: The man who poisoned the well was never found...

Fief_Audience09Event03.desc: Your wells have been poisoned again. Multiple residents have died in terrible agony.

Fief_Audience10Event01.desc: Your mercenaries found the bandits and rescued your residents.

Fief_Audience10Event02.desc: The Bandits sent the missing residents' heads back to your Fief.

Fief_Audience19Event01.desc: You kept your promise and made your Fief a democracy.

Fief_Audience19Event02.desc: You failed to keep your promise, and your people are losing trust in you.

Fief_Audience20Event01.desc: You've managed to stabilise the Fief's finances. The Merchants are satisfied with your efforts.

Fief_Audience20Event02.desc: You failed to improve your finances, leading multiple Merchants to leave your Fief.

Fief_Audience21Event01.desc: Your Militia successfully countered an attack by a gang of Bandits who wanted to take over your Fief.

Fief_Audience21Event02.desc: A gang of Bandits attacked your kingdom. Although your Militia were able to repel them, they inflicted serious damage.

Fief_Audience22Event01.desc: Sewer construction work revealed a treasure buried under your Fief.

Fief_Audience22Event02.desc: Thanks to your stock of remedies, the pestilence emanating from your streets didn't make anyone sick.

Fief_Audience22Event03.desc: The pestilence emanating from your streets made a number of residents sick, leaving them unable to work.

Fief_Audience23Event01.desc: The Festival of Light went off without a hitch.

Fief_Audience23Event02.desc: The Eye's Reckoning struck your Fief.

Fief_Audience24Event01.desc: Your Mercenaries eliminated the Ghost Pack that was threatening your subjects.

Fief_Audience24Event02.desc: The Ghost Pack attacked and killed a farmer.

Fief_Audience24Event03.desc: The Trackers were ultimately able to defeat the Ghost Pack without your help.

Fief_Audience25Event01.desc: Your Mercenaries destroyed the Rats' Nest that was threatening their Fief.

Fief_Audience25Event02.desc: The first cases of the Plague have been recorded in your Fief.

Fief_Audience25BisEvent01.desc: The measures taken to contain the Plague worked: no one else has fallen ill.

Fief_Audience25BisEvent02.desc: The measures taken to contain the Plague worked: the sick residents have recovered.

Fief_Audience25BisEvent03.desc: The Plague spread in your Fief and killed a number of residents before disappearing on its own.

Fief_Audience25BisEvent03_2.desc: The Plague spread in your Fief and killed a number of residents before disappearing on its own.

Fief_Audience26Event01.desc: Your Mercenaries found the culprits behind the caravan's disappearance and recovered its cargo.

Fief_Audience26Event02.desc: The caravan disappeared too long ago and there's no longer any chance of finding its cargo.

Fief_Audience27Event01.desc: Several of your residents are suffering from a terrible stomach bug. The Militia's report shows that they all ate at the same Tavern the night before.

Fief_Audience29Event01.desc: Your Mercenaries won the fishing contest, drawing admiration from the fishermen.

Fief_Audience29Event02.desc: You broke your promise, and the fishermen are bitterly disappointed.

Fief_Audience30Event01.desc: Several of your residents were summarily hung. Terrorised, the populace no longer dares to complain.

Fief_Audience30Event02.desc: Several of your residents were summarily hung. Mad with rage, the populace attacked the militia.

Fief_Audience30Event03.desc: After a lengthy investigation, your Militia has unmasked and hung the leaders of the revolt. Calm has been restored for the moment.

Fief_Audience30Event04.desc: Despite a lengthy investigation, the leaders of the revolt have slipped through your Militia's fingers.

Fief_Audience31Event01.desc: Thanks to your generous donations, the sheep festival was a success.

Fief_Audience31Event02.desc: You broke your promise, and the sheep festival was ruined.

Fief_Audience34Event01.desc: Two Farmers who had cut down a tree the day before woke up with their hands covered in pustules.

Fief_Audience34Event01_2.desc: Two Farmers who had cut down a tree the day before woke up with their hands covered in pustules.

Fief_Audience34Event02.desc: The Tules have given no sign of their presence, so your workers can cut wood without fear.

Fief_Audience34Event03.desc: Now that the rituals to appease the Tules have been completed, work can continue.

Fief_Audience36Event01.desc: The faithful are thrilled that a church has been built in your Fief.

Fief_Audience37Event01.desc: After construction was halted, your Scholars discovered a number of artefacts that they sent to your Troop.

Fief_Audience37Event02.desc: What was supposed to be an Ancient city turned out to be a smugglers' cache. Even so, it did contain one interesting artefact.

Fief_Audience37Event03.desc: Besides preventing a proper dig, resuming construction was seen by your Scholars as a rank betrayal.

Fief_Audience40Event01.desc: The Edoranian General greatly appreciated his gift.

Fief_Audience40Event02.desc: In appearing before the General without a gift, your ambassador made herself the laughingstock of Edoran.

Fief_Audience41Event01.desc: The clans of Harag are deeply grateful for the help you provided to their sick brethren.

Fief_Audience41Event02.desc: The clans of Harag are not surprised that you broke your promise, but they're disappointed nonetheless.

Fief_Audience42Event01.desc: The King of Alazar was greatly impressed with the breadth of your Scholars' Knowledge.

Fief_Audience42Event02.desc: The King of Alazar was highly amused by your ridiculous attempt to impress him.

Fief_Audience43Event01.desc: Thanks to your help, the Arena Clash was the most festive in years. The Broker Council is most grateful.

Fief_Audience43Event02.desc: Grinmeer's latest Arena Clash was unbelievably dull. The Broker Council holds you personally responsible.

Fief_Audience44Event01.desc: After your Mercenaries' intervention, the Smugglers won't be causing trouble any time soon.

Fief_Audience44Event02.desc: You lost all trace of the Smugglers.

Fief_Audience59Event01.desc: Your militia were able to track down the thieves. The Gosenberg Merchant is already singing your praises.

Fief_Audience59Event02.desc: With no witnesses, your Militia were unable to find the thieves who robbed the Gosenberg Merchant.

Mandate_Monarch.desc: The selected Companion acquires the [FiefMonarch] trait.

Fief_Mandate_LocateSepulcre.desc: The Sepulchre's location will be shown on your map.

Fief_Mandate_Rehabilitation.desc: ::unit[0]:: will be released and can be recruited in the [FiefPlace_Auberge].

Action_TrainAnimal.desc: ::unit[0]:: will be trained up to level ::value(levelUpUnit)::.

Action_Kidnap.desc: A new prisoner will be captured.

Action_KidnapSpecific.desc: A unit from the selected faction will be taken prisoner.

Action_MakeRecruit.desc:
A new recruit will join the [FiefPlace_Auberge].
The following elements will be similar to ::unit[0]:::
- Class
- Level
- Attributes
- Skills

Mission_AddRelation_Hard.text.title: Protect an important individual from [::kingdomKind::]
Mission_AddRelation_Hard.text.desc: An important person from [::kingdomKind::] has already been the target of a failed assassination attempt. Their entourage is offering a handsome reward to whoever can protect them from their would-be killers.

Mission_RemoveRelation_Hard.text.title: Plunder a village in [::kingdomKind::]
Mission_RemoveRelation_Hard.text.desc: The harvest season is at its peak in [::kingdomKind::]. It's the perfect time to plunder their villages!

Mission_RemoveRelation_Medium.text.title: Attack a [::kingdomKind::] Border Crossing
Mission_RemoveRelation_Medium.text.desc: The [::kingdomKind::] Guard is being a bit overzealous about inspecting goods that cross over its borders. The local Bandits would like to see things loosen up a bit.

Mission_AddRelation_Medium.text.title: Destroy a Bandit Camp in [::kingdomKind::]
Mission_AddRelation_Medium.text.desc: A Bandit Camp is disrupting residents' lives in [::kingdomKind::]. Local authorities are offering a bounty for destroying it.

Mission_AddRelation_Easy.text.title: Escort a Caravan from [::kingdomKind::]
Mission_AddRelation_Easy.text.desc: A Caravan from [::kingdomKind::] is looking for Mercenaries to protect it during its perilous voyage.

Mission_RemoveRelation_Easy.text.title: Attack a Caravan from [::kingdomKind::]
Mission_RemoveRelation_Easy.text.desc: A Caravan from [::kingdomKind::] has the audacity to travel without an escort. Robbing it should be a breeze.

MissionAudience_10.text.title: Rescue
MissionAudience_10.text.desc: Some residents of the Fief have disappeared! Find them and punish their captors.

MissionAudience_24.text.title: Kill
MissionAudience_24.text.desc: A Ghost Pack is haunting Mount Altis and threatening your residents.

MissionAudience_25.text.title: Exterminate
MissionAudience_25.text.desc: It's only a question of time before the Mount Altis Rat Infestation spreads the Plague to your Fief.

MissionAudience_26.text.title: Recover
MissionAudience_26.text.desc: Send your Mercenaries to inspect the place where a caravan disappeared and recover its cargo.

MissionAudience_29.text.title: Participate
MissionAudience_29.text.desc: You promised that you would take part in the fishing competition, and your residents are counting on you to be there.

MissionAudience_44.text.title: Vanquish
MissionAudience_44.text.desc: Some Smugglers are shamelessly enriching themselves on your backs. They need to be taught a lesson.

Tax.title: Tax the People
Tax.desc:
<comment>Start:</comment> Generates [Fief_Currency_Money].
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Applies a [Fief_Val_Happy] penalty.

EducatePop.title: Educate a Population
EducatePop.desc: <comment>At each Rest:</comment> A selected population type produces [Fief_Needs_Education].

Prospection.title: Prospect a Population
Prospection.desc: <comment>Start:</comment> Increases a selected population type's numbers.

RemovePopulation.title: Expel a population group
RemovePopulation.desc: <comment>Start:</comment> Reduces a selected population type's numbers.

Blackmarket.title: Export Contraband
Blackmarket.desc:
<comment>Start:</comment> Damages the relationship with a selected kingdom.
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Increases production of items from that kingdom.

Stable.title: Stable Visits
Stable.desc: <comment>At each Rest:</comment> Increases production of [Fief_Needs_Hobbies] for each animal in [FiefPlace_Stable].

BanditHideout.title: Rob
BanditHideout.desc: <comment>Start:</comment> Increases the [Bandit] population and generates [Fief_Currency_Money] for each dwelling in the Fief.

Embassy.title: Diplomatic Visit
Embassy.desc: <comment>Start:</comment> Improves the relationship with the selected kingdom.

Blacksmith.title: Arm the Militia
Blacksmith.desc:
<comment>Start:</comment> Increases the [Mercenary] population.
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Reduces the Militia District's production of [Fief_Needs_Defense] and each [Mercenary] produces [Fief_Needs_Defense].

Farm.title: Seasonal Hire
Farm.desc: <comment>At each Rest:</comment> A selected [Cook] Companion produces [Fief_Needs_Food].

GamblingDen.title: Tax on Gambling
GamblingDen.desc: <comment>At each Rest:</comment> Generates as much [Fief_Currency_Money] as your [Fief_Needs_Hobbies] production.

Execution.title: Public Execution
Execution.desc:
<comment>Start:</comment> Executes a selected prisoner, which greatly reduces [Fief_Val_Happy].
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Grants a production bonus on [Fief_Needs_Defense] and [Fief_Needs_Hobbies].

PrisonWork.title: Forced Labour
PrisonWork.desc: <comment>At each Rest:</comment> Prisoners produce a small amount of each need.

Celebration.title: Organise a festival
Celebration.desc: All needs are satisfied during the Assignment.

CelebrationLight.title: Festival of Light
CelebrationLight.desc:
All needs are satisfied during the Assignment.
<comment>Start:</comment> Each [Cleric] in your population produces [Fief_Currency_Power].

CheapServices.title: Rule of Law
CheapServices.desc: The cost of the Fief's services is reduced during the Assignment.

Fines.title: Heavy Fines
Fines.desc:
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Generates [Fief_Currency_Money] for each [Bandit] in your population.
<comment>End:</comment>Reduces the [Bandit] population.

Proselyte.title: Conversion
Proselyte.desc:
<comment>Start:</comment> Increases the [Cleric] population.
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Each [Cleric] produces [Fief_Needs_Hobbies].

ReinforceMilitiaMultiple.title: Support the Militia
ReinforceMilitiaMultiple.desc: <comment>At each Rest:</comment> The selected Companions in the garrison produce [Fief_Needs_Defense].

ReinforceMilitiaSingle.title: Support the Militia
ReinforceMilitiaSingle.desc: <comment>At each Rest:</comment> The selected Companion in the garrison produces [Fief_Needs_Defense].

Disarm.title: Disarm the Fief
Disarm.desc: <comment>Start:</comment> Improves relations with all kingdoms. Reduces the [Bandit] and [Mercenary] population. Generates [Fief_Currency_Power] for each resident.

ShareRiches.title: Redistribution of Wealth
ShareRiches.desc: <comment>At each Rest:</comment> The Fiefs total production is distributed equally among all needs.

RepressOpposition.title: Suppress Opposition
RepressOpposition.desc:
<comment>Start:</comment> Slightly reduces [Fief_Val_Pop].
All needs are reduced during the Assignment.

Corruption.title: Collect Bribes
Corruption.desc:
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Generates [Fief_Currency_Money] for each [Bandit] in your population.
Reduces [Fief_Needs_Defense] during the Assignment.

Conference.title: Organise a Conference
Conference.desc:
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Each production of [Fief_Needs_Education] generates [Fief_Currency_Money].
The [Fief_Needs_Education] need is satisfied during the Assignment.

ProselyteForce.title: Forced Conversion
ProselyteForce.desc:
<comment>Start:</comment> Increases the [Cleric] population immediately
<comment>At each Rest:</comment> Increases production of [Fief_Needs_Defense].

Raid.title: Launch a Raid
Raid.desc: <comment>Start:</comment> Damages the relationship with the selected kingdom. Reduces the [Mercenary] population. Generates [Fief_Currency_Power] and [Fief_Currency_Money].

ChooseMonarch.title: Appoint a Monarch
ChooseMonarch.desc:
The selected Mercenary becomes a monarch.
When the monarch is in the Fief, needs are reduced. When they are in the Troop, generates [Fief_Currency_Power] at each Rest.

TeachTrait.title: Teach a Trait
TeachTrait.desc: Gives a positive trait to a Companion.

LocateSepulcre.title: Locate a sepulchre
LocateSepulcre.desc: Shows the location of the Sepulchre associated with the selected codices.

TrainUnit.title: Train a Companion
TrainUnit.desc: Increases a Companion's level to match the Troop's level.

TrainAnimal.title: Train an Animal
TrainAnimal.desc: Increases an animal's level to match the Troop's level.

MakeRecruit.title: Train a Recruit
MakeRecruit.desc: Trains a new recruit to have similar attributes to the selected Companion, and sends them to the [FiefPlace_Auberge].

RepentanceLight.title: Repent
RepentanceLight.desc: Removes a negative trait from a Companion.

RepentanceTules.title: Repent
RepentanceTules.desc: Removes a negative trait from a Companion.

Rehabilitate.title: Rehabilitate
Rehabilitate.desc: Releases the selected prisoner and sends them to the [FiefPlace_Auberge]. They can then be recruited.

KidnapSpecific.title: Kidnap
KidnapSpecific.desc: Add someone from a selected faction to the Fief's prisoners.

BuyAnimal.title: Buy an Animal
BuyAnimal.desc: Adds an animal of a species you already own to the [FiefPlace_Stable].
